comment.text:
Seeing that this vendor finished up with their renovations, I figured to try them out for lunch.

I order The Truffle Burger ($12) because who doesn't love the taste of truffle? Not too shabby. Also got a side of Thin Fries ($4) with a side of Truffle Ketchup dipping sauce. I have to say that the Truffle Ketchup was somewhat interesting, but didn't work for me.

Service in particular stood out to me. Shoutout to Chastity (according to my receipt). They even go out of their way to provide you with a cup of water because we all gotta stay hydrated, am I right?
Waited 45 minutes for a burger, manager said no one wants to work. The had 2 people running the entire place.
Founder should be ashamed of himself and should be cancelled immediately.  I will never step foot in one of these restaurants.  Supporting his business support him.
I will never step foot in this place again! The food sucks! I had to go buy mouthwash to get the nasty taste out of my mouth! Do yourself a favor and skip this place.
With so many vastly better places steps away from this place.  I can't imagine a reason to dine here

Ooooh, mami! I could say this for their Truffle Fries, Mango Shake, and Matcha Banana Shake which were all very good, but their Umami Burger lacked flavor and reminded me of a Wendy's burger. Yet, since their truffle fries were so good, I plan to try their Truffle Burger next time. Super friendly staff stayed mindful of spice levels for my kids' mac and cheese and provided major deals, but the kitchen took a long while to produce our order.

NOTES/TIPS:
**Combo deals available.
**For free water, ask for a cup with or without ice. There's a water fountain around the corner.

Was invited back by Umami to try more of their new menu items after my last visit.
Was definitely a pleasure interacting with the customer service team and the manager of the Brookfield location. It says a lot that they are so invested in Umami's success and making things right with their customers. On this next visit, I tried:

-onion rings: a large portion for $~4. Batter was crispy and onions were fresh.
-truffle fries: The new fries have a new spice mix on them. It is very tasty and I imagine it is great on plain fries, but I think the flavor clashed a bit with the truffle flavors added. Think the dish would be improved with unflavored fries with truffle toppings
-matcha banana shake: Absolutely DELICIOUS! This is a must-try. I haven't had this flavor combination in ice cream before but it is so flavorful and refreshing on a hot summer day and there are puréed bananas at the bottom of the cup!

Cant wait to return again to try more menu items.

I was expecting to like this place, but I was VERY pleasantly surprised by the Nashville chicken sandwich. I'm really big on texture, and they nailed it all around. Love the way the chicken was fried (sooooo so crispy, but not overwhelmingly greasy or rock hard) and sauced up. Breast meat was HUGE, but somehow juicy all around. I'm willing to bet that they brine their chicken, which usually leads to the meat being way too salty at most other places, but that wasn't the case here.

Bun was generously buttered (but not dripping in grease) and toasted till it was golden and crispy (most places never get it this crispy without burning it a little). I usually rip off 90% of the buns at burger places because I'm really picky about them, but these were right up my alley - chewy and soft with the slightest hint of sweetness.

Lastly, fries were good, not mind-blowing, but I really liked the house made ketchup - wasn't anticipating the light sweetness and truffle flavor! It probably tasted even better to me because I thought it'd just be a generic ketchup flavor; so as long as you don't come here with astronomical expectations for it, you'll likely enjoy it :)

Inhaled everything, easily. Will be grabbing another chicken sandwich here next opportunity I get.

Came here 2 days in a row due to a promo they held. I was able to try sams original crispy chicken sandwich and truffle fries.

The sandwich was quite bland. It essentially felt like it was 2 microwaved pieces of Tyson tenders made into a sandwich. I will say the sauce was pretty good but I don't think if I was picking somewhere lunch, I'd be picking this. It's underwhelming and $9  a pop with no extra add ons. Not exactly my idea of worth it when there's so much other options nearby.

The truffle fries were good though, and worth it at $4.50.

It's a good place with good food. I cannot give them higher as I had much higher expectations for the umami burger which they are named for.  If you get to go to Los Angeles then try umami burger. They are why I rated umami the best burger in the world. It's one thing to take the name. It's another to be represent the name.

Manly burger and chicken tenders.

Par for the course.  Food comes out quickly and everything is reasonably tasty. As a mall and office lunch spot, it's doing pretty well.

If you want a simple burger, Shake Shack would be a better bet if the location nearby could actually pack the food and give it to you in a reasonable amount of time.  Since it can't, it elevates Umami Burger relative quickness into a plus.  

The chicken's coating is aggressively crispy and the Buffalo sauce is both tart and spicy.  The manly burger is fine, though drenched with cheese and sauce so it's harder to judge the patty.  Overall, good food.
The location was difficult to find. Then when I finally found it this place was closed despite coming during their posted hours
Truffle burger was amazing!!! Loved the crispy fries! The place is nice and clean and the service was great! I'll definitely will be back!

We've tried Umami Burger a few times over the years, and while the burgers have been fine, never really got the hype. We decided to give them another try the last time we were at Brookfield Place and in the mood for burgers.

On our last visit, we tried the original Impossible Burger, which was two Impossible patties, grilled onions, American cheese, miso mustard, house spread, dill pickles, lettuce, and tomato. My husband and I split the burger and a side, so it wasn't quite as heavy as it would have been on its own, but it was definitely huge and filling and probably would have been too much for me solo. I liked their flavor combination, and it was better than the other burgers we've had at Umami, but there's still a lot of other burgers I like more.

On the side, we got the manly fries, which covered their fries in beer-cheddar, bacon, onion strings, mustard spread, and chives. These were pretty tasty, although also on the heavy side. I would consider getting them again if I were getting another burger here, but their problem is that they're only steps away from Mighty Quinn's in the food court, and I like those dirty frites more. Generally, like our previous visits, everything was fine, and we'd return if we were at Brookfield Place wanting burgers, but probably wouldn't make a special trip just to go there.

Tried the Truffle Burger today.  First of all, the scent of truffles is so inviting from the bag.  I added shiitake mushrooms and pickles to the burger, and asked for ketchup and hot sauce.  The ketchup added more truffle flavor to the already very truffle-tasting burger.  It was still warm and juicy when I got it back to my desk. The hot sauce is very hot, so be careful!

As for the beet salad, I think it is awesome and the beers are perfectly roasted and fresh.  This is how beets should taste (not the raw beets that sweetgreen tries to pass off as belonging in a salad).  Beets need to be roasted, and Umami got it right.  Also, the pickled onions are very refreshing and add to the flavor of the salad, as well as balancing out the burger.

I've tried four burgers here. I used to like the truffle burger the most but it's flavor is not consistent. My last attempt of it was not that memorable.

I like the Sunnyside burger which has sunnyside eggs and bacon. It's moist, flavorful and juicy. However the yolk can easily be burst while the staff was assembling the burger cause I saw it first hand.

The Cali burger is a good choice as well as not only it is flavorful, it has 2 patties and it's cheaper!

Wagyumami was a disappointment to me. It was dry and not juicy at all. Kimchi mayo was a little unexpected and interesting. There's no 'wagyu' in this burger.

This is based off a MealPal order.

So it's sort of a pita to get a hold of people to check in for meal pal. Just go to where the food pick up is and say you're there for meal pal. They will provide you the QR code after that point and the burger was immediately ready to take. You just had to fight the crowd to talk to them.

The truffle burger normally goes for $14 or so. It had a nice truffle flavor and was overall a decent burger for the mealpal price of $6 or so. I don't think it stacks up with equivalently priced competitors at the normal price. Stars based on value subsidized by that decent truffle taste.

Got delivery from GrubHub. Half my order was missing. They refuses to help and wanted me to walk to them to pick up a replacement item for a delivery. Tone deaf and need retraining. Avoid this poorly run restaurant.

Note: My food was missing because the restaurant didn't put it in the bag. They made no effort to fix it and the comment below shows no ownership of their error. Grubhub doesn't pack their bags.

Kind of pricey, but delicious. Maybe they can scale back on the superfluous packaging to bring prices down? But hey, what do I know?‍

That withstanding, the food is actually tasty. I've only had the loaded truffle fries, the original impossible burger and the impossible double truffle - all of which are scrumptious. I couldn't see myself paying $6.50 for a medium shake (an extra $2 to make it a vegan shake), so I just had a fountain lemonade - which was $4 and kinda bland. They had West Village location (and I believe a Williamsburg location also), but it has been closed for some years now. The only options are Battery Park City and the Hudson Hotel on W. 58th.

I decided to try the impossible burger today after hearing about it, this was the only place nearby that had it.

I have to say, this was probably one of the dryest burgers i've ever had in my life. I'm not sure if it's due to the patty or due to Umami's cooking of it. But this burger was not juicy and the cheese was barely melted.

At $13 a burger, Not gonna bother again.

I've been wanting to try the signature Umami burgers with the U on their top buns for a long time now. The TravelZoo voucher I found online was my calling, and I'm so glad I was able to try it. I got to the location around 3:50pm and started ordering. Umami burger, cali burger, and truffle fries. It was a few minutes before happy hour starts at 4pm and the lady there was so nice, she asked if we wanted to wait a few minutes so we can get happy hour price on the fries. Of course we said yes! Then we ordered a full-sized thin fries to make up for the cheaper price of the truffle fries.

The thin-cut fries were so good and perfectly crisp. However, the truffle fries were a little on the saltier side because of the cheese. The truffle flavor was strong, but not overpowering. I ordered the cali burger and it was actually pretty good. The patties were nice and juicy and the ingredients were fresh. However, the umami burger was just okay. I definitely think the cali burger should cost more than the umami burger.

Also, when they ask you what house sauces you want, go for the jalapeno ranch! It's SO delicious. I also tried the roasted garlic aioli which was just okay, also a little salty for my taste. I have yet to try the other two sauces. I would've asked for one of each had I known that they were going to give me four sauces anyways. Oh well, it gives me a reason to come back!

Update: I was contacted by Jayson Portman in guest services and offered an apology due to a bad experience at this location.

I was assured that the lack of training at this location would be corrected and I was given a gift card and asked to give them another chance after the staff was retrained.

We did and I must say Jayson, You hit a home run like the other locations I have been to.

Thank you again for being a great company and actually caring and taking the time to respond to your loyal customers and hearing their issues and resolving them with the utmost care and love that never goes unappreciated and that all restaurants should strive to be like.

I look forward to coming back again and again.

Thank you!

Oh my God! Did I really just spend that much on a fast food burger?!

Don't get me wrong, it was a fantastic hamburger but it was on the small side and honestly the difference between 80/20 and Wagyu Is damn near unrecognizable when you throw lettuce tomato cheese and a thick bun on it.

Overall it was a good experience and the service was quick and friendly. I might go back and try it again but this time I don't think I'll order the Wagyu.

The Impossible burger is insanely good. I've tried the brand before at Bareburger, so I was happy to see it here at Umami. I ordered it without the cheese or thousand island (house spread). Just added some umami ketchup (hint of truffle) and it was phenomenal.  Only wish I'd ordered some fries to go with it, but at $17 for a modest sized burger, I wasn't quite ready to drop 20 plus bucks on another meal for the day.

Previous visits to Umami had solely been for beer--a Duvel mainly while taking in Brookfield's unmatched view. Today an Asahi Super Dry.

But with a vegan option now, I'll be back sooner than later and order the fries with my Impossible burger next time.

I don't think I've ever had an Umami burger. On this visit, I ordered a salad. Before you ridicule me, this is why: Ritual was having their $1 week, so I was able to order their taco salad for $1. It was surprisingly good. This comes with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, pickled onions, avocado, tortilla strips, seasoned taco meat (extra $2 for protein), and jalapeño dressing on the side. It sounds like it would be a heavy salad, but it actually wasn't. It was the perfect portion. Not sure I'd order it at its full price, but maybe I'll finally try the burger next time!

Food is good and comes quickly but is too expensive. Located in the Brookfield mall food court, Umami Burger is convenient for office workers in the connected buildings. Even more alluring to me was the fact that there was really no line during peak lunch rush, when everywhere else was packed - but it is expensive for the glorified fast food that you get.

I got the Impossible Burger, an all plant based patty that looks and bleeds like meat. I wish you could just substitute the Impossible Burger patty into one of the other burgers - but I got the spiel from the cashier that they are contractually prohibited from doing any substitutions with Impossible Burgers (that sounds ridiculous, but that's more on Impossible Burger I guess).

The patty was grilled up nicely. The sauces - I had some kind of aioli and a hot sauce - were great. The bun was a bit dry and I didn't eat half of it but other than that it was an okay quick meal, but too expensive. You even have to order fries separately. I'd get the Impossible Burger again here, because I like it so much, but only if I'm in a hurry and the company is paying. Otherwise, the price is not really justified.

This place makes a killer burger alright.  3rd time visiting and Umami burger, and taste is A+ every time.

The one in Brookfield was good because it's setup fast-casual instead of sit down.

I got the simple burger, with American cheese, pickle and sunny side up egg, which goes so well with it.

This, fries, plus beer was about $23.  Wish it was a few bucks less, but at the same time love the ambiance with the view.

This place is way over hyped. With each burger being priced between $12-$15, I would expect a lot more for the burger. It was a decent burger but I wouldn't say it was anything special, especially since it didn't even include fries. Truffle fries were pricey as well ($7) but really really good, but aren't they always? Thank god I had a Groupon so I was able to only spend $20 for two burgers and fries. Otherwise, I don't think I would've come here tbh.

I'll start by saying I visited this location during traditional lunch hours. There was a long line of people waiting for orders and this may have contributed to my experience. Although the long wait was a bummer, it didn't contribute the score of 2 stars. The score is for the umami burger and thin fries. Both were cold when I arrived to my office a few steps away. And the fries were undercooked. It's a shame because the flavor was there. However, the meal was tossed because I couldn't eat a cold meal.

Serves me right for getting a salad at a burger place. There are so many salad places nearby, why did I pick this one? The description sounded so promising: Asian pulled chicken on baby romaine, edamame, avocado, with yuzu dressing ($14).  
When I got my order, I thought the salad bowl looked rather small but hey, if it was delicious, then it would be worth it, right?
Wrong.
The chicken had a strong fishy taste.  I couldn't taste any dressing. Everything was dry and bland. The avocado was the only good thing. I ate the 2 slices of avocado and dumped the rest.

ive been wanting to try or for a while but it just didnt live up to the hype. i had the earth burger with umami fries.... the burger was not good & the bread was hard. the fries with the umami sauce was really good... id go back for the fries

3.5 stars

I have always wanted to try Umami Burger, and finally had the chance to do so at Brookfield Place.  On a weekend morning (11:30 am or so), the place was fairly empty and lines were short or nonexistent at each food outlet.  

While the prices are a bit high, the quality of the ingredients does shine through.  I ordered the Ahi tuna burger and some onion rings.  The tuna was fresh and the combination of ingredients made for a delicious sandwich.  One minor quibble - I wish the sandwich had a touch of acid, either a squirt of lemon juice or a dash of hot sauce to brighten the flavors up.  The wasabi wasn't prominent, or maybe not prominent enough for me.  The bun was toasted and the sandwich held up well while I was eating it.

The onion rings were another matter.  When I picked them up,they were contained in a take out box, with the lid closed.  I thought that was odd for something fried as it can render the contents soggy.  When I opened the box, most of the onions either didn't have an tempura batter or had very little. (yelp.com/biz_photos/umam…)  They looked nothing like the other pictures posted by others on this site so likely this was an isolated event.  Most of the batter had fallen off.  The onions themselves were good, quite sweet and some of the largest rings I have ever seen.  While the batter itself didn't taste greasy, there was a good amount of oil at the bottom of the container.   The jalapeno ranch dipping sauce was watery without any hint of jalapeno.  

Service was great!  The staff were friendly and helpful.  I waited approximately 5 minutes for my meal.

The restaurant is part of the awesome food hall at Brookfield Plaza Mall.  You have incredible views of the water if you pick your table well. I think all of the restaurants are counter service exclusively up on the second level, so you're going to make your trek back and forth to order, collect your food, and bus your table, but it is definitely the high end of the fast casual realm. Even the food trays are above-average quality and design.

The bacon burger is no joke. Delicious, perfectly cooked bacon that's a perfect complement to the burger that it's dressing up. Cheesy tater tots on the side complete the immensely satisfying and completely filling meal.  They'll happily give you a couple of aioli sauce packages to tease the tastebuds some more.

My wife had the impossible burger and couldn't believe a vegetarian burger could taste so much like a regular burger. Actually, she said it tasted like a McDonald's burger without evoking the fears of what you're truly eating. I think that's a compliment of sorts.

Anyway, it's pricy for what it is. Two burgers, one side, one drink is $42 and you're serving and cleaning up after yourself, but the quality is evident.  I think this place is now the backup plan to Shake Shack which firmly holds the number one spot on my list of fast-casual burger places.

Use to love coming to this place but they have gone down hill. Their chicken sandwich is dry and cold. Their manly fries is just terrible, saggy cold fries over sauced with cold bacon. They also seem to take forever to prepare your order despite not having a line or any orders in sight. The only thing they are still able to put out properly is their truffle burger. So if you don't mind waiting, come here for their truffle burger and skip everything else. If you want proper chicken sandwich go next door to Fuku!

I am a huge fan of Umami, and I usually came out to eat here twice a month. I order my usual which is the Umami burger with a sunny side egg, side of maple bacon fries and aioli sauce. You cannot forget the sauce! Medium rare is how i eat mine but at brookfield they over cook so it's good to ask to under cook it. It could be better quality, as I've had umami in sit-down locations which of course are better since there's no rush, but being that this is in a mall, it's as good as it gets.

I recommend.

If you have limited time I will not recommend you coming on a rush hour (12pm-2pm), the line is quite long and the service a little slow, and the food is a little expensive, although it is very delicious.

I had the opportunity to eat in the other location with a group of friends and sit down, but in this location that is on Brookfield is kind of hard to find a table or chair.

My order took a while to come out but It was worth the wait.

In this occasion, I order the K-BBQ Burger with fries and the side. The K-BBQ is a nice burger with gochujang glaze, caramelized kimchi, sesame aioli, Korean ketchup and nice good scallion-cilantro salad.  The burger was very good with a nice, mildly flavorful, definitely is different from others typical burger, but I recommend to taste the manly burger that is the true M.V.P. The fries were a lot with a nice very fresh, good and crispy flavor.

Service is super slow.  Be prepared to wait for your food.

Ordered truffle fries for $6. You get a buzzer.  Fries were covered with truffle flavored cheese.  I guess it is just truffle oil, but it tasted pretty good.  Choose four sauces to dip them in, chipotle mayo, house ketchup, garlic mayo, jalapeno ranch.

One person working the registers was nice.

Person getting food is always distracted, either restocking the drink fridge in front or taking call orders.

When kitchen is done cooking, the completed food orders stack in the service window.  

A bunch of customers were just waiting staring at the completed food orders at the window...wondering when someone would pick the stuff up and feed paying customers.

Burgers are okay, sometimes greasy, but pretty packed with flavor.  Buns can get soggy fast, buns should be toasted more before the burger grease takes over the territory.
I would love to know why we were literally shooed away at 7:58 when they're supposedly open until 9? No explanation, just rudely "no more orders" from around the corner

I am ordering right now through Uber Eats, and it's been over two hours since I first placed my order. The kitchen will not respond to delivery times. I find this very unorganized and unprofessional considering I only ordered two things. Two things should not take two hours to complete.

Full disclosure: this review is biased as this is the first time I've ever gone and it's during the COVID-19 PAUSE. I had a disappointing burger delivery a couple weeks ago from a different restaurant so thinking that perhaps burgers & fries don't travel well.  Well, Umami Burger changed my mind! I ordered a single version of the Cali burger (was totally fine paying the same price) and the thin fries. The burger was very flavorful and the carmelized onion tasted great. Yah, maybe it's the quarantine talking but I do think it was a good burger. The fries have a crunchy coating. Next time I'll travel the truffle topping on it.

I got the impossible truffle burger. Overall it was good - good portion for a good price, and the impossible patty def tastes like real patty! Truffle flavor was a bit light. Very very cheesy. Lettuce was a tiny piece, so was the Tomato. Buns were really good though.

It used to be one of my favorite burger joints in the city - but last time I had Umami burger and side of salad with water-all together it was 25$ and this is what they served- picture below! It's half of the slice of the tiny mushroom and tiny tiny tomato?
I thought it was a chefs joke and asked the counter person if this is ok- she said yeas, this is how we serve it, if I don't like it they willing to give me full refund which I took!
Sorry guys- you have to pick your game up, it's not a McDonald's- you charge over 20$ for a burger and side of salad - it should be some normal portions served for that price...it's god damn TOMATO!!

A far cry from the Umami Burger that was once located on West 8th street and still very saddened that, that one closed. Umami Burger at Brookfield Place located by Battery Park, okay for lunch if you work in the area or are a tourists looking for a burger spot. Nice for a view but the overall experience and burger itself....ehhh, it doesn't live up to what I am used to at Umami at all!

Now mind you I did go there about 45 mins before they were set to close but still there was only one server and the burger I got which was the Manly burger came in a container instead of served on a plate, I had to ask for sauces instead of being offered the usual 4 sauces that would come with a burger at the actual restaurant version of Umami Burger and the burger itself just didn't have the same flavor and feel of regular Umami Burger. This one almost feels on the level of Shake Shack which I consider over hyped and overrated. I was really disappointed. May give them one more shot being that I have considered Umami Burger the best burgers in NYC but if I am not uplifted by next burger my next go around...idk.

Hopefully one of these days the actual Umami Burger restaurants can be bought back cause these little version ones, it doesn't have the same feel at all and as of right now just isn't cutting it for me.

Located in Hudsons eat at brookfield place. I recommend coming here around 11:30am or else there is a huge line that starts forming around noon.

Burgers cost around 11-15 with the Ahi Burger being the most expensive at 15. I got the truffle burger which costs around 13-14. Sides aren't included so if you want fries it's extra. The burger itself is pretty filling- there was a lot of cheese and truffle oil on my burger- I asked for medium rare. It was cooked pretty decently. I also got a lemonade ($3).

They give u a buzzer that shakes when your food is ready. I asked for a side of the garlic sauce (they have 4 to choose from). Super rich sauce.

Decent gourmet burger but pricey- expect to spend around $20 for just a burger and drink. Getting the fries would have put me over the top and I didn't want to fall asleep in the afternoon at work.

If you have a burger craving then this place is good. I feel like I need to run this fat off though...

I am impressed, Umami Burger - Brookfield Place was truly impressive. Despite the location, the rates weren't outrageous. Truffle Burger was wonderful, I really liked all of their food. All of the staff are extremely welcoming - you certainly feel welcome and taken care of. Umami Burger - Brookfield Place is awesome.

I love this umami burger location. Inside hudson eats. You can enjoy eating this burger inside the foodcourt or in the summer time you can bring it in the nice park outside (battery park city).

So my favorite burger in here is the truffle burger. It has truffle aioli, house truffle cheese & truffle glaze! Whenever I'm in the mood for some burger inside hudson eats I always get this. It has this garlicy taste. The beef patty is very tasty. Its perfect! I always ask for their catsup because it blends in well with the taste of this burger but the crew will advice you not to put anything since the sauce that they use is full of flavor by itself. I always go for some truffle fries. Its the same thing. Garlicy fries. Its thin & full of flavors.

I love umami burgers but Its kinda pricey.

Umamiliscious!

My rating is perfect, it is just fitting since I have never enjoyed a burger as I have enjoyed my Umami burger. My patty was grilled to perfection. The contents of my burger are ridiculously good. Perfect combination . The bread bun has its signature stamp (U ) and toasted for you. The serving size is big but I was able to finish it in no time . It was very satisfying and I had this  heavenly after taste . The fries were thinly sliced which has no chance of getting choke into it. The sauces selection are incredibly awesome. They serve beer which perfectly match the burger. My new favorite burger joint .

It's service was quick. Even though the cashier said roughly 10 minutes wait , my guest pager lighted up shorter than that. Dining location is in a food court style. I find the price a little bit higher comparably to other burger joints that has its own place though.

I've been following this Umami Burger on Instagram for awhile. Finally went there! Please note: many places in Brookfield's food court are cash-free. Umami is one of the few who accept cash. I got the truffle burger with fries. It was very tasty! Husbo got the Caesar salad which had an Asian flair. He'd definitely get it again. While I'd probably try something else, they have a tasty burger that I'm definitely a fan of.

I'm on keto so ordered the ultimate vaccinator burger without the bun.  Came out pretty good and flavorful but lots of grease but it's expected.  My friend ordered the truffle burger and fries.  She cut me a piece of the burger with truffle and it tasted so good.  Would probably come back again as it's in Brookfield place.  It is in the food court on the second floor.

Burgers with lots of umami flavor!
***
Locals
They have many locations even if one location closed. This is right in Westfield mall!
***
Travelers
Great place to eat after exploring Westfield Mall, World Trade Center and Financial District! Seating can be tough during peak hours, but great options!
***
My Recommendation
Right in a food court with lots of options, but umami burgers are different than other burgers. They pack a lot of flavor and umami sauce. Truffle fries are also a great supplement as well!

IG: @foodisseur

Fun place mixed with other smaller restaurants in the Gansevoort Liberty market.

Fast friendly delicious sushi rolls. Not bad for being hungry and walking all over.

For sure will come back.

I am giving one star because I cannot give 0 star. This place is a garbage. I paid $19 for a spicy tuna and salmon bowl. It looked like a full-filled bowl at first glance, but it was just filled with all the cheap side toppings such as onion, cucumber, and seaweed salad, and there were only total of 5-6 tiny fish cubes that are not even fresh. Seriously? Why am I paying this much for the crap? You can get more decent poke bowls from ANY other poke restaurants if you pay $19.  This is absolutely the worst poke bowl I've ever had. I suggest not to purchase food from them.

After completing a lap in the Gansevoort Liberty Market tucked into the Oculus, I went with Umai Fish since I was in a poke mood. I paid at the register and was given a buzzer. It ended up that my buzzer never buzzed, and I was wondering why my grub was taking such a long time. It's not like anything had to be cooked. Thankfully the cashier noticed my lengthy loitering and checked on my order. She was really apologetic. My tropical salmon poke bowl wasn't too bad and was filling, though I think it was somewhat overpriced at close to $20 including tax. And the mango maybe was a little past its prime. But overall, not bad. Though I'd try their prepared rolls next time!

I have been back many times for the Hawaiian poke bowl....the tuna is so fresh as are all of the vegetables. Absolutely amazing food. I have tried similar meals at other places and nothing comes close. So worth every penny. Can't wait to go back again.
Miranda was extremely sweet and welcoming, the food is mega fresh and the flavors were very well balanced. Service was really quick and we'd definitely come back!

This is my first visit here at the Gansevoort Liberty Market in the Westfield Mall at the Freedom Tower.  This was a tasty snack that was surprisingly inexpensive for sushi. - under $10.  It's located in a very clean and open food court. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. I look forward to coming back.

Just ordered the Volcano Lobster roll, edamame with black salt, and miso soup here. It looked and tasted wonderful. I would post a picture but I devoured it before I even thought to. Miranda was very kind and personable. Her smile was contagious and lit up the kitchen. Thank you Umami Fish for a great meal and thank you Miranda for the superior customer service!

I always go to this spot during my break from work. They always make the food fresh, and are very quick to make what you ordered. The employees are also very nice, especially Miranda, she is the sweetest person.

The sushi and miso soup were both wonderful! The staff are so kind and accommodating, especially when compared to the typical food court restaurants. I ordered the butterfly roll and after bringing it out, Miranda decided I needed some miso soup; both were delicious!!

Not that great, must be my timing (2pm) but my rice was stale and some pieces weren't even cooked, the fish itself was okay, definitely not coming here again, for the locals (job oriented near WTC) try sushi co, that place has good sushi, a bit expensive but it's defo worth

Umai Fish you are totally exceptional, I had an incredible experience here yesterday. This place is fabulous. Every item that we ordered was really fresh and tasty. Every one was extremely pleasant. Umai Fish... Thanks and keep up the good work.
I often stop by to get lunch there. They charged me today $1 for two extra SMALL BAGS of soy sauce. Why did it happen? Nobody explained and didn't apologize.

We just got back home (to Portland OR) from NYC. We couldn't wait to get our hands on some real New York pizza, and boy did we find it!! We visited Underground Pizza 3 times on our visit. The owner was right behind the counter, working and talking with his crew and with us-very friendly and patient while we made our choices. The pizza was simple and SO delicious and SOOO HOT!!! Now we know why ya gotta fold that slice!! Warm and welcoming spot with some slightly faded '80's decor. We appreciated the garlic salt at the table with the usual parm, herbs, and chili flakes-a little bit of garlic salt took that pizza to another level! We will most certainly visit NYC again, and when we do we'll DEFINITELY come to Underground Pizza again.

Great pizza here.
Went around noon. They are very efficient so don't worry about the line. Ordered pepperoni and calabrese with person at counter. He put it in the over for a minute or so. Paid at counter. Super fast.
Pizza has great flavor. Crust is awesome.
Plenty of room in back for seating. Very clean.
There is a restroom there also in back.

Ordered a Grandma Pizza with Pepperoni for takeout via Seamless.  Even though it was a busy Friday evening, my pizza was ready when I got there at the time that had been estimated.

Overall a solid pizza - great sauce and good size.
Perfect NY slice!!!   Couldn't ask for a nicer place   Great service and atmosphere  highly recommend!!!

Disorganized set up at the ordering counter especially with a narrow walkway. There is a small dining area upstairs.

If you pay with cash, you get a slightly reduced price.

Tried the basil and mozzarella slice and it was too sweet and light on flavor. Crust tasted bland. I think a different topping pizza might have showcased this pizza parlor better.

Nice spot conveniently located near the hotel I'm at. Similar to other pizza places I've been to in the city (full disclosure: which isn't that many). Order the slice you want at the counter, they slide it in the oven, pay, and you can eat it there or take it on your way.

I enjoyed a slice with sausage and pepperoni and fresh mozzarella. A buddy got a slice of what they called Grandma's pizza, three cheeses and sauce with extra garlic. Also a win.
Great food and service. My boyfriend and I love this place and the owner! Best pizza around here !
I love this place! Great friendly and fast service! Love me some Underground 'Za. Good food ambiance too.
Great pizza. Friendly personnel. Relatively pleasant seating for about 20. here are more characters
Nice little pizza shop to eat at once you get off the ferry. Amazing NY Style pizza. Cooked inside pizza ovens and served fresh.

Had the two slice and drink combo- slice of pepperoni and Pomodoro. Both great definitely filled my New York pizza craving!
As good as anything I've had at any of the best food pizza joints in NYC.

We visited New York and wanted authentic pizza, but also needed gluten free. Underground Pizza checked all the boxes! Excellent service and attention to gluten free needs, and very delicious pizza! The owner was very kind and accommodating, which really made our meal top notch. The Grandma pizza was our favorite! We will definitely be back the next time we visit NYC!
The best we had in town, family owned and very friendly and hands on owner treated us great and good is terrific
Great true Italian pizzeria _ does not disappoint. Third attempt on finding the best pizza in Manhattan and a home run. Roy and Ben were great.  Underground Pizzeria was perfecto!
A great choice for a slice. Especially enjoy the white pizza and the grandma's pizza. Good value as well.
Easy to walk right past, but worth it to stop in. Delicious "grandma pie" in picture.

My go to pizza spot at work! The artichoke spinach in my favorite slice, the grandma comes second. The slices are sized just right and crispy, doesn't flop! Although it's pricey, $5 a slice, it is FiDi. Overall i've been here 10+ times and will keep coming!

My wife and I stumbled upon this place in 2016 on our way to Dead Rabbit. Ever since then we can't help but to stop here every time we're in the city and we also bring our friends with us. Delicious and consistent!
Excellent Pizza. I love local places that are owned and worked by the owner. I watched this owner make pizzas wait on customers and his pizza is top notch. Small place but a hidden Gem! Try it!

Solid pizza and lots of different slices to choose from.

For as long as I have worked nearby, the Underground Pizza has been in the shadow of the line for Leo's Bagels right next door. Undoubtedly, Leo's has been the king of the small block for years, but by no means overlook Underground Pizza. I had probably walked by Underground Pizza hundreds of times, but neglected it each time in search of something "better" to eat for lunch. After an unsuccessful trip to one of the food carts at Hanover Square, I FINALLY decided to give them a shot.

I knew they had a great variety of pizzas, so it was of no shock to me when I walked in and saw all of the different pies laid out. You name it and they have it - regular, pepperoni, buffalo chicken, spinach, white cheese, mushroom, grandma regular, grandma pepperoni, etc. In my first trip, I decided to go simple and went with a regular and pepperoni heated up.

To summarize, the slices were good. Unfortunately, they weren't hot anymore by the time I had reached my cubicle or my lunch time "dining room". However, I am glad to report that the slices were perfect and really exactly the way I love my New York pizza slices. The slices were thin, but not extremely thin. With each bite and crunch, you knew there was crust there. There was ample cheese on each slice and just enough oil to wet your beak. I disdain when pizza slices have so much oil they can run an automobile and the amount of oil on the pizza here was just enough to keep the cheese moist. For the pepperoni slice, there was a fair number of pepperonis on it and, like many pizzerias these days, they decided to use the roni cups, which I absolutely love. Those little roni cups are always full of flavor and truly one of the great inventions for pizza.

The pricing of the slices are also on par with the standards for today and in fact slightly less expensive than even some pizzerias in the outer boroughs, which is shocking. With the reasonable prices and solid slices, it's definitely one of the best pizzerias to get a normal New York slice in the FiDi.
Tried the white keto pizza with mushrooms today... if you love ricotta and are trying to cut down on carbs this is perfect.

First time here!  Nice and friendly staff.  Didn't feel overwhelmed ordering.  I tried their Grandma's pizza and a slice of traditional pepperoni & sausage.  The Grandma was really good, taste like pasta on dough as the topping tasted like meat sauce.  Pretty simple but good.  The pepperoni and sausage slice was nothing to write home about.  if I re-ordered I would have gotten two Grandma slices (which come in squares) as I got the two slices and one drink combo.

My coworkers and I passed by here while we were in the area and looking for a pizza place!

The employees were really nice, and we ordered several pizza slices (three of the regular cheese for $3 and a mozzarella for also about $3). They were heated up really quickly, so we only had to wait maybe a maximum of 3 minutes! Because I had mentioned I love pizzas with a lot of marinara sauce, one of the guys behind the counter also gave me a container full of marinara to go with my pizza slice. The cheese pizza itself was so, so crispy and the cheese melted off of it in little stringlets - it was a pretty fantastic pizza. There was a surprisingly great amount of seating despite the store being small, so it was nice to relax there after work!

The service and food were awesome since the pizzas are still cheap relative to other foods nearby, but it didn't particularly amaze me enough to warrant five stars, especially at the price point. There were several pizzas at Underground selling for about $3-5 a slice, and I felt that it would be much more worth it selling at $1-2. Otherwise, I'd still probably visit occasionally if I'm in the area.

Overall if I could I would give this place a 4.5. The Pizza is absolutely delicious, it was my first time having a margarita pizza and that is what made me give them the 4.5. We also got pasta (I didn't take a picture), but it was also pretty good! Definitely above average pasta with good tasting sauce. Lastly the only complaint I had is that we got some of their garlic bread balls and they were a little stale so unfortunately we didn't get a fresh batch but overall the taste was good. FYI, the owner is really cool and chill very cool person to talk to and friendly, so if you're in the area I would definitely recommend a spot for a delicious quick slice.
The staff is SUPER nice. The food was amazing. It's some of the best  genuine Italian food i've ever had. We wanted to stop by a pizza shop touring NYC. I'm glad we made this choice.
Very good pizza, and people. Employees were very kind, and the overall vibe was nice and calm, great place.

Good bacon jalapeno pizza. This square had a light crispy airy crunch while the bacon and jalapeno added a great amount of flavor.

Margherita was good, but nothing special.
The keto pizzas are amazing! They are so good that I don't even miss regular pizza. The keto pizzas are also gluten free. Underground is the best!
I've had a lottttt of NYC pizza and this ones definitely in my top 5!!! I got the grandma slice and Buffalo chicken slice and both were unreal. Highly recommend trying this place out!!
Owner was very kind and welcoming. Tried several different pizza spots during my stay and this was my favorite. The pizza was perfectly crisp at every bite.

I had Underground Pizza around 11:00am for breakfast and I must say it was a fine piece of pizza. As usual I had the corner Sicilian and this one was very cooked well.
The crust was crispy and and not doughy or undercooked, the sauce had a nice balance of herbs and tomato and the cheese was melted on point. It's not the best pizza I've had, but it's very good.

The location was tricky to find as it's on a small section of Hanover Square up West from the small sitting park (which is actually a nice place to sit and eat)

If I were in the area again I'd go back for sure... though I'm not often in the financial district of NYC!
Oh, and at $3.00 it was the best price I've paid for a square in the city....

A tale of 2 slices.  I stopped here for a couple of slices after some business at MTA Headquarters.  The guy at the counter was very friendly, telling me that Coca-Cola was on strike after I asked for a small soda.  He showed me a sign saying one of the unions walked out.  He had soda cans but no fountain soda.  I found that very interesting, as I have heard nothing about this.

So I get my slices and soda can and go upstairs to eat.  The first slice left much to be desired.  It was mostly sauce.  Not nearly enough cheese.  I was thinking to myself, "This is sure a waste of $8.25."  Then I had the second slice.  The difference was day and night.  This slice was quite good, with a decent amount of cheese and a proper amount of sauce.  Far superior.  

I would try this place again and hope the bad slice was just one of those things that happen sometimes.

Pizza is spot on and the service is great.  We were welcomed in and helped with the different choices of slices or whole pies available.  If visiting or staying, this is a place to quench your appetite and thirst.

Great pizza. Get the grandma with pepperoni.
Ben, the owner, is terrific and makes a delicious pie. The taller bald guy he leaves in charge sometimes ... not so much. Prices can vary depending on from where you order.

Although that doesn't have many options that would be different from your typical pizza place, what they did have was incredible! the store has a friendly staff and environment that was welcoming. the pizza tasted great
First time here, got take out. Staff was really nice and accommodating! Pizza was good, sauce didn't have much flavor but still good. Will definitely go back.

Short Review: underground pizza is an average pizza place around the FiDi area. As the overwhelming majority of quality pizza shops around here charge an arm and a leg (e.g. Harry's Italian or Adrienne's) this is a nice alternative when you're not interested in spending over $30 bucks for a plain pizza.

The staff is nice and the delivery is wordy. Years back, my  previous firm had issues when placing an order for a large delivery order. However, I would surely would recommend this place.

I love underground pizza, the staff is always friendly but I didn't really appreciate it until I started having the cauliflower pizza- my gosh is this the best pizza !!! I am not gluten free or health conscious and the pizza just tastes AMAZING and fresh mozzarella and basil is used. They always honor my extra toppings like extra cheese lol! Great pizza spot you won't be disappointed!

My first pizza experience in NYC!
The flavor was great and the slices gigantic (I literally had NO idea that this was a well-known characteristic of NY pizza...oops.) I had one slice of BBQ, one slice of traditional pepperoni, and a calzone. So filling even with the thiiiiiiiiin crust -so crunchy!

Had dinner at Underground Pizza on Thursday evening. An average pizza spot, but one of the better pizza options in the Financial District.

Quality: I ordered a Regular Slice and a Regular Sicilian Slice. Both were perfectly fine, but nothing that would have me rushing back. The Sicilian Slice was thick and heavy, but it could have used much more cheese. The Regular Slice did not have that same problem, as it was loaded with cheese. However, it came out a bit greasy and the crust was not my favorite.
Quantity: Average size pizza slices, but the Sicilian Slice was hearty.
Value: $2.75 for a Regular Slice. $3.00 for a Sicilian Slice.
Ambiance: Underground Pizza is located in the FiDi of Manhattan. The shop has the kitchen in the front, then a raised seating area in the back. It is not the prettiest of dining spaces, but it works to quickly eat a slice. They have a television in the far corner showing sports highlights with audio in the background.
Crowd: I came at an odd time, but there were a few people waiting for a slice or two.
Service: Quick and easy to grab a slice, and the staff moves fast.
Parking: Difficult to find nearby parking.

This place is awesome. They have a keto pizza with cauliflower crust that is fabulous. I usually get a Meatlovers Keto pizza with sugar free tomato sauce instead of white sauce. Fantastic! The flavors are great and the crust is crispy. It's a neighborhood gem and I visit frequently! Highly recommend.

My office has been ordering from Underground for years, but we never tried the Cauliflower pizza.   It was actually recommended to me by my accountant and his son.   Well, we tried 3 diff ones today and absolutely LOVED them.  The crust was actually CRUNCHY! wow    Thank you Joe and Bradley!

great quick pizza stop! the staff was so kind and welcoming. they have an awesome selection of pizzas and had them ready so quickly. there's seating inside and their location is prime to the tourist spots in the area. check them out for a classic new york slice!

Great pizza a few blocks from Wall street. It's a small place with some limited seating up top but it's mainly people grabbing and going. My slices were very good. The crust was near perfection. I will return for sure. The owner/manger guy was extremely nice and friendly. Give them a shot!!!
Delicious spot to grab a quick slice of pizza, although they have much more than just pizza. I stop in here often and they are always so nice and so fast and the pizza never disappoints!

Fun fact. This place is not underground! Anyways, this Pizza is so good and so cheap. BUT THE CRUST, the crust, just tastes so Italian and perfect. The staff is friendly, attentive and hard working. They have a great variety of topics and Italian dishes, but the best thing I like there is the pizza by the slice. Definitely worth it if you're saying in FiDi and looking for a quick, relaxed and inexpensive bite

I'm always craving New York Pizza and it HAS to be from NY! Had an opportunity to bring some home from my last minute trip to NY yesterday.  Stumbled upon Underground Pizza and am so pleased I did so. Got 3 18 inch pies, a cheese, pepperoni and my favorite, a margarita pizza. The cheese on the margarita was so creamy and delicious with the perfect amount of fresh basil. The pepperoni was the perfect amount, just enough...and the cheese is always a must have and it was just the way I like it, cheesy but not oily. The crust was thin and light and crispy!

A special shout out to Ben, he knew we were rushing to get back to MA so he brings the Pizza out to us and puts it in the trunk for us! Now that's what I call amazing customer service! Can't wait to go back on my next trip to NY!

Breakfast pizza!! You read that correctly!! The western omelette with bacon and sausage is AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!! I treated my staff to breakfast and they were shock on how great this breakfast pizza tasted. I highly recommend this breakfast pizza, you will not be disappointed

You're in NY. You know that at the top of the foodie to-do list is to eat pizza. You know. Standing on a street corner with a thin crust folded up, you're hunched over so not to spill grease on your Boss suit, hailing a taxi at the same time. Maybe even leg sweeping a would-be pickpocket.

Well, I almost accomplished that. I aimed too high and kicked the pickpocket in the knee tearing his MCL..... KIDDING!

Yes we got an amazing NYC pizza experience! Thin crisp crust. Not greasy! No we didn't have to stand on the corner to do so. Why? Because we found Underground Pizza!

Located in the Financial District this place made our NY pizza dreams come true! You are immediately cheerfully greeted by employees as you stand in front of the case making your selections. The nice gentleman was patient with us as we perused even though a line was forming. He described each pizza we asked about with a smile on his face. They had many to choose from so this took some time. Each slice is ample sized.

Both My Love and a daughter got a Margherita. Fresh mozzarella. Basil. Tomato slice. Perfect according to my daughter.

My other darling got a sausage slice. She is developing her Yelpiness so she knew immediately to judge the meaty pizza on greasiness of which she said there was none! Pizza-Domino-Papa-Costco this place was not.

I wanted veggies on mine but couldn't decide between a square spinach & artichoke slice or a baked eggplant & spinach slice. FUC it, I got both. Yes, the shadow of my a$$ weighs 15 pounds. Again an amazing crust. I would have thought all the moisture from the veggies would have softened it but nope! There was plenty of spinach/artichoke in each bite. And the eggplant brought tears of joy to my cherubic cheeks.

Dear Pagan Pizza Deity in the Oven in the Sky, thanks for such a wondrous find!

Cool little pizzeria at the beginning of the Financial District, probably the first open pizza place you'll encounter after you debark from the Staten Island Ferry. I got there a few minutes after the owner started making slices, so there wasn't much on offer, but did manage to get a tasty slice before I returned home.

Had a great experience here! We went in late on a sunday night and got great service at the bar. I got the espresso martini and it was delicious! We also got an order of loaded fries, which I wasn't sure about at first but then after my first bite I couldn't stop. did not seem to offer much more than any normal bar, but still had a great selection of liquors and good service.

Came here for HH on a Wed around 4:40pm, it started to get crowded around 5:15pm. There are some seats outside, we sat at one of the picnic tables. I got the spring fling ($10), it was on the sweet side. They also had Prosecco, a white wine, a beer, and aperol spritz on the HH menu. This review is just for the drinks, I didn't try the food.

Service can be sort of slow but I think it's because there wasn't enough staff vs the amount of tables. Not really a fan of any HH on stone street as it gets pretty crowded and loud.
I used to come here and loved it but now the Menu has changed and service was meh. I'll pass on coming back here again

One's a stop. Two's a layover. Three's officially a bar crawl. Where better than Stone Street for a proper bar crawl where you can literally crawl from bar to bar! Underdog had some of the best whiskeys I came across on Stone Street. I was drinking beer earlier, so I decided to avoid a hangover and opt for an excellent glass of Fiddlehead IPA. One of the busier bars yet a very short wait for a pour.

I really enjoyed the vibes of Underdog. We shared wings and had an enjoyable time. Nice outdoor area too. Got a good view of Statue of Liberty nearby as well. There are better bars out there but a nice option if you are around Stone Street

Can be a bit hit or miss - I liked the espresso martini (albeit it was pretty sweet) but my partner wasn't a huge fan of his PB old fashioned. Haven't had the food since pre-pandemic but I do remember really liking the Mac and cheese balls when I got them a few years ago.

You know how there are places in big cities that seem so incongruous? This is one of them. Right on Stone Street, swarming with bros, this bar is a gem. Inside was not too loud and not too busy even though outside was swamped. The bartenders were friendly, funny, and a little bitchy in the best possible way. I feel like I was hanging out with new friends.

The food was good, cocktails delicious, but the service is incredible. I want to move in.

NO SPEAKEASY.

Man was rude as we walked in and said does it look like we are open. Well fyi for a speakeasy it's meant to not look like what it's supposed to be.

But apparently been closed for private events since Covid

Me and friend went here on a rainy Friday and the place wasn't that busy in the afternoon. We ordered a few lagers and got their Impossible burger sliders which were really filling and excellent to share between 2 people.

Service was excellent and the team is very friendly and welcoming!

This place is pretty good to stop by with friends for a quick drink and a snack! The service is OK, they're a little slow, didn't give off a really friendly vibe. They have clean bathrooms and have really nice outdoor seating, it's covered. But there are no fans or anything so on a hot and humid day, it can get pretty hot. It's basically back to pre-covid days for this joint.

We ordered the mac & cheese bites and they were so good that we had to order them 2 more times!!! They come out super warm and hot! They were not as cheesy as one would like, but I think that's part of what made them addicting and not too heavy. These bites honestly taste so fresh and the marinara dipping sauce they give with it really completes the appetizer.

I had the spicy paloma drink! It was spicy, they garnish it with a little jalapeno and it's super yummy, I ended up having two. The jalapeno itself wasn't spicy, however. I enjoy the drink and the app. I'd probably stop by again for a quick drink.

The prices are pretty standard NYC drink prices ($15ish) and apps (also $15ish). The location is on Stone street which has a really cute and aesthetic vibe, I loved it. The restaurant itself doesn't really have like music playing or anything -- I think the vibe could've been more fun if they did.

This is a cool place to chill and get a drink. The service was great, the bartender was very friendly and helpful. The drinks were strong and tasty, it's a nice ambiance definitely recommend it. However, the buffalo wings were not what I expected. They were very thin, the thinnest wings i've seen. They tasted ok but just small.
We had a great time. Food was good and so were the drinks . Found this gem after doing a cocktail class at the cauldron next door and so pleased we did.

Did a quick stop by with my co workers on my first day of work! It was a bit empty but I'll say it was due to it being a Monday and the rain. The food was good and everyone enjoyed what they got. Apparently the grilled cheese was great.

Close enough to most subway stops and probably a good place to go to after work to get a few drinks and relax.
Drinks are really good. Got some grilled cheese and tomato soup afterward, which was all I could actually remember from the night though. It was amazing.

Vegetarians, rejoice! Came here for a quick visit the other day and was pleasantly surprised by the number of veg/vegan option on the menu. We ordered the Korean flavored cauliflower wings with vegan ranch and it was very tasty! Good place for a quick drink and bite. Will definitely be back to try some of the other options on the menu.

A group of friends and I went here on 10/29/22 and let me just say Sam the bartender makes the best espresso martini I have ever tasted ! He was really kind and patient ! I 1000000 percent would recommend this place to anyone !

How is this place even on Stone St? It's literally the worst place that you can drink or eat. The service is absolutely terrible. And the food tastes like it was fried in 3 day old grease. It's just yucky!

This is my first Yelp review. I am not the type to post, but I feel the need to let the general public know about the stinky Korean chicken wings because it may be a health concern. The wings were quite literally fried bones, some with no meat at all. The width of a sharpie. Simply horrific. That being said, if you can look past the chicken quality, the Korean sauce is legitimately unedible. It tasted like a mix of nail polish remover and bleach. I am worried I am going to be in the bathroom all night.

If you want to take a year off of your life span, please go get the wings at Underdog

Why 2 stars? Customer service alone is pretty horrible. My friend and I ended up getting the winter Tippler 2020 book and stoped by the underdog to redeem our cocktail. The first bartender literally said 'fuckkkkk' when we showed her the books. 5 minutes later another bartender came, took our book and stamped them. We told him what cocktails we wanted and this guy had literally just ignored us.
Ten minutes later he finally looks at us and says 'oh there you guys are' dude have been sitting here staring at you for the last 10 minutes

The drinks are strong, but good. I ended up getting the strawberry margarita and my friend for the winter cosmo. They kind of taste alike ....
Wouldn't go out of my way to visit this place again. Really disappointed with the service.

Woooie, service is not their strong suit at Underdog.

We stopped in last night to redeem one of our Winter Tippler cocktails. It was moderately busy, but the barstools were turning over at a decent rate. The bartender came over to us and asked what we needed to which we showed her our Tippler books. At that point, she walked away, and by reading her lips I could see she said "f..k! F..king tipplers!" She then sent over another bartender to help us. It was the strangest interaction ever and very uncalled for. The guy who came over to help us was just a smidge nicer. I can totally understand that promos like this might bring in a little more traffic than desired, and maybe some patrons feel no need to tip because of it, but you can't assume that all of us are the same. Other establishments have been extremely nice to us regardless of our reason for coming in (promo or not). The experience left a bad taste in our mouths.

Besides that little fiasco, we ordered a Winter Cosmo and a Strawberry Margarita, which were actually very delicious! There was nothing wintry about my cosmo but it was still nevertheless good.

If the bartenders were nicer, I would make my way out here again in the future.

Stopped in at this fabulous little bar in the financial District of New York on our last night in town. Hanging out with my friend who is a local doing a pub crawl up and down the street this was our second stop. Can't say much about the food because we were more in a drinking mood than an eating mood but really did like the vibe of this little pub and quick service. The beer selection was pretty good as well. Considering it was after midnight when we got here the bar was full but not jammed but definitely doing a great business. Would start back in my next time in town to visit my buddy

Came here for drinks with a friend after work and had a good time! They have a great drink menu plus some good food options. One thing that would have been nice that should have stated in the beginning was you need to get at least one food item to close out the bill. It was like 10pm and we wanted to close out the bill, and our waiter was like oh you have to order food before doing that.. so we ended up getting fries and staying a little longer which was fine but should've been stated beforehand. Others would have gotten mad.

Otherwise, this is a chill place to come and hang with friends.

Legit just had the bartender come out and yell at me for not using tomato juice at the do it yourself bloody Mary bar.

It's called DIY. But yeah let's belittle people about how bloody Mary bars work

Thanks for a super fun Sunday underdog

___________
P.S. The change for 75$ when someone gives you a 100$ is 25$, not 20$. We saw what you did, but were so pissed we just wanted to get out of this place. Thanks again!

I came here with my friend on on Wednesday after work and oh god the service is so bad. This tall curly haired woman should be fired. She completely neglected my friend and I to chat it up with these guys and then when we tried to get her attention to order she rolled her guys and says "ya what do you want" as if we were inconveniencing her. This continued throughout the night. She needs to be fired.

This place was just ok. Pretty good drinks, food was not so great. I think its an ok spot to come hangout bc the ambiance was very much eclectic bar vibes. One bitter sweet thing we experienced was ordering another round of drinks, which were forgotten about. The host noticed this and brought them out on the house which was a kind gesture.

Overall, this place could be enjoyable with good company but with the combination of alright drinks, mediocre food, and slow service, I don't know if I will be coming back anytime soon...

Came for a couple hours with friends while bar hopping the block. Good food, good drinks, friendly bartender...what more do you need?

I ordered the arancini burger, a unique option on the menu. The buns are crispy arancini patties. Overall a tasty burger. Good fries too. Got 2 other burgers to go which I fed to by husband. My friends got the grilled cheese and tomato soup, also excellent. My other friends seemed to like their veggie burgers.

The male bartender we had was great. Felt like he never left our side (in a good way). I heard he even gave us a round of shots.

On a particularly busy night, with great weather and sitting outside on Stone St, we got impressively attentive service which was greatly appreciated by our hungry group. The food was good, portion size a little weak on the grilled chicken sandwich, but everything hit the spot and we had no complaints there.

Only issue was with the check (to no fault of the staff) the gratuity was already included for our party of 7, which is totally fine. But that wasn't clearly stated/mentioned and then posted in big font on the bottom of the check was suggested tip amounts, which to an unsuspecting tourist, would indicate the tip needed to be added. Just not a fan of these kind of tactics to get a double tip.
We were first drawn in to the Underdog from their cute signage with two Airedales. We loved everything about it. Great service and atmosphere.

Amazing drinks? Check! Friendly staff? Check! Reasonable prices? Check! I couldn't have picked a better place to drop by after brunch. I didn't order any food, but I'll absolutely be back to grab a bite!

The food and drink was delicious. They have very good draft beer as well. The staff was professional and quick with the food and drinks.
They also have impossible sliders that were really good.

Just a typical bar in Manhattan. The cocktails are creative and reasonably priced at $14. Theres a decent happy hour on select cocktails, wine on tap and crappy beers (bud, budlight, highlife). I went there on a Wednesday afternoon and it was pretty empty so I was glad to have found a spot right away at the bar. Staff seems friendly to those they know or are loud but leave you alone if your by yourself or not talkative which I don't mind.

3.5, rounded down.

Visited the Growler on the weekend, maybe at around 12:30.

Made a mistake in coming here in that I thought they would have the dip sandwich. I didn't realize that they have different menus for lunch as they did for dinner, and it seemed like a reasonable assumption to make before hand. I guess not, since they didn't have the dip sandwich for lunch.

Instead, I ordered the Po boy sandwich, which was kind of underwhelming. It was also rather lacking in actual shrimp. They gave me chips with this order, instead of french fries, which was like... not the best. My friend on the other hand got the biscuits with gravy, which was actually better than my sandwich.

I will probably be back to try the dip sandwich again, but I will have to figure out when the dinner menu starts, as I do not want to repeat the same mistake twice.

--------------------

My second visit, which was in July, was for dinner. I remembered that I had to try the french dip, since they didn't have it when I visited the first time for lunch. The sandwich came out to be about $14, and I got a sandwich (beef? lamb? probably beef, but I couldn't tell for sure) with dipping sauce, and some potato chips.

I thought the dip sandwich was fantastic, but wish they had given me more juice to go with it, since I was running out towards the end. Also, would have been nicer to serve fries instead of potato chips with this dish. Perhaps they don't own a deep fryer?

Would like to round my 3.5 up based on the dip sandwich alone, but the po boy I had during lunch here was a little sad, so I'll stick with 3.

I've been to Underdog a few times but most recently it was when a friend from out of town was visiting.

It was the first nice day of spring in NYC so Stone Street was alive and loud. The outdoor tables were packed but inside was on the quiet side, especially in the back. When we first walked in we saw a girl straddling what I hope was her SO on a bar stool, shoving her tongue down his throat, but that's besides the point.

Our waiter was nice and quickly got us situated at a hightop table in the back. Dimly-lit aided by candles at each table. The bar is long and can accommodate many people. Their beer list is disappointing. All craft beers, which is great, but only 5 or so to choose from regularly and then a rotating list. I ended up trying a red ale that was very good so at least it all worked out. For food we each had the Underdog which is their standard burger that is served with fries. I asked for medium rare and it was perfectly cooked. It was also very large and I barely finished it. The fries were just okay but the burger filled me up enough.

Restrooms are downstairs in an area that looks like it's employees only but really isn't. Clean but on the small side. No paper towels.

Overall, a pretty solid place for a burger and a beer.

What a wonderful brunch experience! During nice weather, Stone Street is a great place for eating outside as the whole street is covered with tables and seats to eat and drink outside. My friends and I started our day with brunch at Growler and it was absolutely delicious. Service was quite attentive and the atmosphere is perfect for socializing.

We started off with the Unlimited Bloody Marys with as much fix-ins as one may want. For $15, it was an amazing deal. I absolutely loved it. Not only because it was very affordable, but the variations you can have is awesome. The Bloody Mary do-it-yourself bar is located at the middle bar in the restaurant. The bartender will pour a good shot of vodka and the rest is in your hands. They offer 4 different types of tomato juice, including a habanero chipotle tomato juice which I highly enjoyed. From there, you can essentially add anything you want, from pickle juice, seasonings, horseradish, siracha, olives, parmesan cheese, bacon bits, picked tomatoes, celery and banana peppers!...just to name a few. It was great to be able to experiment and make the drink to your liking. There were also complimentary chips on the side of the bar to munch on while making. So worth it.

I also got the brunch burger which came with a large pile of fries, 6oz kobe patty, a fried egg with runny yolk, crisp bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, pickles and cheese, all in a pretzel bun. Fantastic. The meat was super juicy. The egg and yolk was a great complement to the meat. The bun was strong to hold everything in the burger. The fries were nice ,crispy and plentiful. Everything worked perfectly well with each other. A great pick!

Overall, it was a great brunch experience. I would recommend this place for sure, especially if you are a Bloody Mary addict.

I've been here a couple of times over the years. My number one complaint is the happy hour only lasts until 6pm and its generally on things I don't particularly want to drink. They have one of the best craft beer selections in the financial district which is a huge lure but then they charge $9-12 on most of the beers I would want to drink. It's been that place I've come in for 1 drink - to sip slowly and enjoy and then leave and head elsewhere to better and happier happy hours. But the bright side is that it wasn't as packed as Ulysses or Whitehorse gets any time I've been inside. I recently came in for the Bakery: Banana Bread Stout and it's two thumbs up. Their porter and stout - dark beer selection has always been really superior to most bars. Again, it's frustrating that it's not on the happy hour with even like a dollar off drafts would be enough to get me to come back more frequently. I'm pretty sure this also used to be called 'The Growler' or might still be and they have pictures of wiener dogs on their walls.

This place is POPPIN' - I think we came in on a Thursday night and the whole street was lined with people. All bankers and people dressed in suits and business attire, mind you - So we kinda of stood out because we were in casual duds. Mostly men - Which I guess makes sense because a lot of men work in finance? The hubs wanted to find "Growler" but was told this was the new joint - They had re-branded to become "Underdog."

I really enjoyed the music - It's an alternative mix. They also have a pretty dang good list of beers on tap as well - Hopefully, you're well versed in beer - Or have an app that can tell you about the beer. Our waiter pretty much didn't know anything about beer, but it's all good. We had a good laugh about it. It was here that I discovers LIC Beer Project. I had several of their beers and liked all of them. Yay for local brews!

We ordered 2 things here on account we were eating our way through NYC - The fried pickles and the arancinis - The frickles were hella good. The arancinis were ok.

Good spot to people watch too - It's interesting the people that come in and out that you can tell are finance folks. It's a really diverse mix of people!

My friend and myself decided after a long week of eating healthy, we deserved a good burger. When we walked it appeared a bit empty, walking towards the back is where the crowd was. To eat I ordered the underdog burger and it was very good. I'm usually surprised when bar food actually tastes good. I would certainly go back for a burger during the week. To drink, I wanted one of the hot cocktails, this is where the disappointment came, they didn't have the ingredients to make the drink, I tried for another drink, yet the same result. All in all I was able to get monserrat to drink along with other drinks. The bartender crafted the drinks very well and I absolutely loved them despite not getting my first choice. I would certainly go back.

The first time I came to this bar it was super crowded on a weeknight, so I went downstairs to Underdog for a more quiet setting. This time around on a Sunday night, the place was much more empty, and we were able to get a couple seats at the bar.

Wasn't hungry, so we settled on drinks instead. Got one of the drafts off the board ($8) and the Bourbon hot chocolate ($10). The hot chocolate wasn't very big, and topped with a bunch of mini marshmallows, but it packs a wallop with the bourbon. The beer selection here is great and at a decent price.

A chill spot on the weekend. I wouldn't come back here on the weekdays due to the after work crowd. Food looks good, so will be back for that.

Sat outside in freezing temperatures for brunch. Our group of 4 was seated almost elbow to elbow next to another group of people so the whole social distancing thing doesn't fly at this place. Chicken wings were mediocre. My chicken sandwich was dry and the bread was stale. Everyone else I was with said they wouldn't return.

Avoid this bar/restaurant or whatever this garbage-hole is. Terrible service!The short haired female bartender is a ZERO. She deserves zero stars. Even better negative stars. It's like she didn't want to work!! We would ask her for drinks it would take - no joke - 15 minutes+ ... AND not to mention the bar and outside were only at 40-50% capacity. So it really wasn't busy. She had plenty of time to stand around and talk with her co-workers. Most of the time she just stood and talked to her manager, which btw this dude what a total a**hole. I tried to communicate him about how horrible the service was and he just said "well, now you have a drink. Can we just be happy about that...". I work in the service industry and I would never EVER answer a customer that way. I was appalled by that response. Now, I'm not saying the customer is always right. What I'm saying is to have empathy and listen to the feedback the customer gives you. Terrible management. I hope the owner sees this. I know he's be greatly disappointed. I'm a regular on stone street and I will be making sure the people don't go to this place.

Get your sh*t together. Provide proper service and do your job! It's that simple. Treat people with respect. Hire better staff, cause the ones you currently have working front-facing SUCK.
I've been coming here for years. Great atmosphere and the drinks and food are on point. Always a friendly face and the staff are so nice.
Staff lazy and very entitled. Underdog doesn't provide good service people who work there spend more time socializing rather then working. This place can make you wait 20 minutes for a drink.

Bretta weisse from firestone walker on tap! Perfect summer slightly sour beer.

Cheese board with 3 cheeses, toasted bread, apples and amazing bacon marmalade.

French dip was rare. Bread was soft and crunchy, could have used more horseradish.

Bartender was great. Offered us tastes of a few beers we wanted to try. They have 24 beers on tap.

A small sparrow somehow flew in. Staff were "bird friendly" and gently cajoled it outside with the help of a cloth napkin. It flew happily away.

Dark, candlelit, friendly.  Would definitely return.

Don't bet on the underdog in this situation. The people who work here are insanely rude. A group of us showed up to celebrate my birthday - we are all late 20s to early 30s and well behaved. My friend accidentally used the employee bathroom as it was behind an unmarked door on the first floor. The waitress followed her back to our table and proceeded to berate her in front of our entire table asking, "do you know what a bathroom is?"

After she finally stopped embarrassing our friend, we all said quietly to each other, "that felt like an overreaction." She proceeded to yell from behind the bar "I'm not talking to you and I'm not sure why you're running your mouth," while another bartender pointed out across the bar and said "YOU are an overreaction." It was not a creative enough comeback to justify further rudeness.

Ulysses, on the other hand, has delightful staff.

We had the Sazerac and Sherry Cobbler, both the re-released version, cocktails here are good but I'd say it's pretty pricy for the area- $15 each

My favorite will be the jalapeño hush puppies! Only wish there were more jalapeños mixed in so it's hotter~

Underdog is underrated. Kai was excellent (hope i spelled it right lol). Quick service and great food.

The bartenders were nice and gave reliable recommendations for drinks.

Great music and personable staff made our visit enjoyable.

Is it possible to give more than 5 stars? Please let me know ASAP
