Not quite the Little Italy experience I was hoping for! We walked in around mid afternoon on a Friday, and it was empty inside (although most restaurants on the street were empty at that hour). Our table of 10 was immediately seated. The service was good, no complaints there. I probably would have preferred to sit outside because the AC was blasting inside.

I wasn't impressed with my Pesto Gnocchi dish. The gnocchi was too thick and dry, and the pesto didn't quite do it for me. On the other hand, my husband raved about the Chicken Parmesan the entire rest of our trip! Our table also got Bruschetta, which was just ok.

Overall, great service. The food was hit and miss with our table.
Okay y'all so I said I wasn't coming back here after the bad service but they redeemed themselves. Sangria is still good. Service was way better. Had the penne ala vodka with shrimp which was good.

Party of 13 ordered linguini with clams, chicken parm, pasta primavera, pepperoni pizza, fettuccini alfredo, calamari and sangria. All were very good but lets be honest, you're going to find excellent pizza all over NYC, so if you really want pizza , hit another spot. Ingredients were fresh and service was great.

I was on my way to Little Italy to get some canoli's and decided to stop by someplace for dinner. This place piqued my interest because of its mafia history. We stopped by here and were the only ones in the restaurant, which was kind of good since we could enjoy some quiet time.

The servers were attentive, and our food arrived quickly. We ordered oysters, stuffed mushrooms, and fettuccine with garlic and oil. The fettuccine was great; the rest was mediocre.

Don't understand the bad reviews...we had a great experience and the food was delicious!

We got the sangria pitcher to drink and it was so refreshing. The calamari appetizer was crispy and flavorful. I got the squid ink linguine which was DELICIOUS and came as a huge serving size, I got to take half of it home to eat for lunch the next day.

The service was on point as well, the manager came by our table a few times to make sure we were well taken care of and happy with our experience (which we definitely were!)

Definitely recommend umberto's to anyone who loves Italian food, seafood, and an authentic experience! LOTS of history behind this place too (look it up) which made it even more interesting dining in

Friendly service & good food. We had a group of four during a Monday afternoon so it wasn't busy inside - we chose inside instead of outside seating since it was a little chilly. Our server was helpful & friendly. Everyone enjoyed their food, we ordered Chicken Marsala, Linguine with Clam Sauce (no shells), and Spaghetti with meatballs, with an appetizer of bruschetta. It all tasted good and it was a nice break from the outside with a clean restroom.

Came on a Friday around 6pm during San Gennaro. They had a stall outside that had a line, but the restaurant still had plenty of seats. I tried the blue point oysters on half shell and clams on the half shell.

The shucking could've been cleaner as there was shell debris in both the oysters and clams. The sizes of the clams and oysters were inconsistent. They weren't bad, but I've had sweeter clams and oysters. The cocktail sauce paired well with them though.

Did it again! Used to go there a lot many years ago, tried again last night and didn't disappoint! Seafood was fresh, pasta cooked to perfection' Tried the squid ink pasta with shrimp and calamari- it was incredible!!! Baked clams have always been my go-to appetizer
Great service, nice menu. Kinda basic menu but good food. Went there as a default because every Chinese restaurant was booked because Roy was Lunar New Year.

Absolutely amazing service!! We got here an hour before closing with a large party and the service still was unmatched. Food was delicious but the attentive, consistent, friendly and thoughtful service was truly the highlight. If you're in Little Italy and in the mood for italian, EAT HERE!

In the city dropping off my daughter and her bridal party for a night out so I headed to little Italy for some pasta when done. Old school Umbertos is the choice. The bread was delivered with a small dish of dipping sauce and all I will say is it was the best I have ever had. Omg. Had the burrata over greens that was to me just ok. They could have put a little more effort into this dish. The black linguine with giant shrimp and calamari was fantastic. It might have been the best I have ever had. Overall a great time by myself. Enjoy

On a Sunday you will most likely bump into the owner standing outside and hustling to get customers to walk inside. I believe he offered free wine/sangria. The ambiance isn't much but the food and service make up for that. Even the tap water was good. We used a $55 pulsd deal that offered 1 antipasti, 2 entrees, 1 dessert and 1 pitcher of sangria. Everything was so good we stopped by a few weeks later for both food and sangria. Def recommend if you're in the mood for Italian!

We wanted a nostalgic restaurant in Little Italy and we thought we'd found it. Upon arrival for our 6pm reservation we noticed we were the only two in the place. And now we know why. The food was not great. The Marsala had mushrooms from a can, the garlic was burnt and bitter, and the gnocchi were gummy. I do not recommend!

- Beware of the SCAM the servers do with the bread. My friend & I ordered apps & the waitress asked us if we would like some bread with our apps ( we thought it was complimentary since she was the one who brought it up & asked.)  When we got the check we saw that we were charged $6.95 for bread . The way she spoke to us was  VERY MISLEADING ,giving  us the impression that the bread came with the meal free of charge , but that was not the case.

- At the end of our dinner  I asked the server if  we could split the apps down the middle  & pay for our dish  but she cut me off & said " NO I AM NOT GOING TO DO THAT."  I understand sometimes splitting the check can be annoying especially if it's busy, but there was only  3 other tables in the restaurant , it was NOT BUSY at all.  I guess she just wanted to continue to chat with the other server at the host stand

- We ended up just splitting the bill down the middle & noticed that they ADDED 20% gratuity on the check. Nowhere on the menu or anything suggest that there even would remotely be auto gratuity added to the check, especially for a 2 top. I work in a restaurant & it is a common practice to  add auto gratuity to large groups of people & even then I let the group know that auto gratuity is included in the bill. In conclusion, spending $127 here was absolutely not worth it . The clams were good & they were very good with refilling our water

Wife and I stopped in for the first time. We have a few other favorite places in little Italy. I have never been to Umberto's before. I think this is our new favorite place. We shared the calamari as an appetizer, I enjoyed the Lobster Fra Diavolo for my entree and the wife had the veal parm. My dish was amazing, they have excellent sauce here. The wife's veal was some of the most tender I have tasted. Service was friendly and attentive. We will definitely be back!

The best thing about the place was the greeter who is there to talk you into going there and usually is annoying and wont leave you alone.

Had to ask for water 2 times and it was during the heat wave
(Mind the fact NO ONE else was outside)

They sat us along the street (should be fine) but it was garbage day and the neighboring restaurant left 10+bags of smelly garbage next to us while we were eating!!!!
Like i said NO ONE else was there so WHY put us there OR WHY NOT offer to move us when we clearly were holding our nose and vocally complaining how horrific it was.  They said "Oh yea its terrible.... but its not our garbage"!!!!!!!!!!!!

The bread was stale and NOT warmed up (the greeter said yea you don't serve good bread at ital restaurants bc you don't want to have the guests fill up on it!) for real!  thats why!?!?!  gross

The "free wine with dinner" that was promised to us - we were charged $30 and when I quested the server he ripped it from my mothers hand (her class) poured it back into the carafe and said "Fine! You don't want to pay you cannot have anymore"
RUDE!!!!

The tomato for the caprese salad was not ripe... it was barely orange...

This was the most horrific dinner experience I have EVER had and the food was barely eatable!

In my option - Please save yourself and just pick another restaurant!
The manager was not helpful at all - he watched as the server was rude
Yelled at the greater for saying free wine with dinner
And started to slam chairs together and pile them up as we paid the bill!

Little place in little Italy famous for the mafia, my boyfriend wanted to go here we got some clams and tried the alfredo. The clams were not my personal favorite but it was a texture thing. The Alfredo was good.
Excellent food! The baked clams are Amazing and the service is great ! Baked ClamsChicken Parm

If you are thinking about purchasing a Pulsd offer for this place don't bother. Try a different restaurant.  The website does not say anything about black out dates or times you cannot use it. I purchased it seeing that they had open reservations on a Saturday night and only after purchasing it was told to call for reservations where they said they will not accept it on any weekend nights. The manager was extremely rude and hung up on me.

Pulsd took care of this issue immediately. They are a great company. However, I will keep this review up to ensure that no one makes the same mistake.

Umbertos Clam House is an Italian seafood restaurant located at 132 Mulberry Street in Little Italy in Manhattan, New York, Umbertos became known for its "tasty dishes of calamari, scungilli, and mussels", but initially became prominent, weeks after opening, for being the site of the murder of gangster Joe Gallo. The restaurant was founded and is owned by members of the Ianniello family...how can you pass up a spot where a mobster was killed!

Food was subpar... baked clams were dried pucks. The lobster ravioli was primarily a large piece of pasta with almost no lobster. Covered in a watered down sauce which seem to be similar to a storebrand jar sauce.  I was really looking forward to this and I'm quite disappointed in the quality of food.
Amazing food!  Always stop by when we are in the city. Sit outside and have a wonderful view of the Empire State Building - so beautiful at night!!

I can see why some restaurants might be struggling in a 'Little Italy' that seems to be waning as other communities take hold. I say this with the understanding that the pandemic didn't help. Business ought to be back with seasonal adjustments. This was mid-November.  

My first pick next door was packed so I decided to circle back to Umberto's for dinner. Umberto's was practically empty with only one other group for Friday evening. I decided to sit at the bar. The bartender was very polite and attentive. Service was efficient. Good conversation and choice of drinks.

The menu options seemed extensive specializing in seafood. I decided to order the tortellini with grilled chicken and a Caesar salad. Simple enough. What showed up might have been an off night. The salad was average with barely any dressing and processed 'Parmesan' cheese. Next, the tortellini must have suffered under the microwave with barely any 'grilled' chicken. The entire dish looked like it came from a ready meal mixed with a can of chicken soup. Everything tasted bland. It all seemed lazy or uninspired.

The entire dinner was a disappointment. I let it go and decided to pay my bill. I doubt the 'karaoke night' was enough of a crutch. Empty restaurants are empty for a reason...customers go where the food is good.
Amazing Loved the calamari and the lobster ravioli Bartender makes a great lemon drop
We had excellent service and a very good meal for a fair price. This isn't going to change your life, but it was a solid experience.
Delicious oysters and wine! More of a relaxed space. If you have the chance to have Dulce as your waitress, definitely ask for her!! Super sweet.

First time going to this restaurant and everything was amazing. The most authentic Italian food I've had in a long time. From the delicious bread to the pasta primavera and also to the waiter who was professional and friendly. I can't wait to go back again!
Best place in little Italy for clams. Has been a family favorite for years. I think my aunt still holds the record here for eating four dozen raw cherrystones.

Such a welcoming experience, seated right away no wait! one of the best restaurants in little italy that offers linguine with clam sauce. so fresh and so delicious. loved the bruschetta and the calamari felt so incredibly fresh. offered us free refills and free wine/sangria with our meal! 100% recommend for the seafood
I love this spot. The clams are always great and the staff is so nice! I'll definitely be back!
I've had better minestrone from diners and Campbell's cans. The broth only aspired to edibility. The linguine with clams was o.k., featuring a decent hit of garlic.

I got lured here by some guy yelling free wine in a shabby fur coat one day.... So I sat down ordered some sangria, raw  oyster & clams. I was glad I did because it started  raining and hailing shortly after. Cute spot for a quick bite

Stopped by for lunch with some buddies. Clean location with friendly, fast service.  Of course, the clams and linguini was the best I've ever had! No joking!!  Our waitress took the time to explain everything to us and was very inviting.  Wash it all down with a bottle of their fine Chianti and you will enjoy the best Italian seafood meal you can ever get in New York...period.
Excellent food and good service will be back. Order the clams pasta and appetizers all great and reasonably priced.

For tourists only, which we were/are  
, so fair enough. Zero ambience , but friendly waitstaff and decent prices for typical Italian American dishes. You have had just as good at wherever you are visiting from.

My entire motivation for coming here was the restaurant's fleeing appearance in Ghostbusters (1984). While I didn't grow up in NYC, I moved here for college & then after graduate school & made a habit of visiting not only famous eateries, but those that had a place in popular or niche culture.  Sometimes those two categories intersected quite well.

Though as I'm also no fan of seafood, I skipped that & went with their lasagna. It was excellent, as was the service & general atmosphere.
The homemade pasta was great! My wife had the classic lasagna and I had the chicken and cheese tortellini! The hype man Tommy the Nose was awesome! They gave us a free glass of wine and a sangria!

Owner is outside trying to get you to come in haha. They have outlets at some tables which is what brought us in. Got a bottle of Prosecco and calamari which were both good. Lasagna, fettuccine Alfredo, vodka penne, and spaghetti cabanera were all really good. We did see a server eat a fry off of a plate which became a now joke within our family. The decor was not one of an Italian restaurant but ok. We were going to go again for a second day in a row if that says anything. The place was empty at 5:30 but when we were leaving around 6:30 some people were coming in. Do have a bar. Food was between 20-35$ but all the pastas that we got were 20$.

Never, disappointed!!!! Food is amazing and sangria never fails!!! Staff is super welcoming. Love the waiters and the manager and Dulce is the doll of the place. Tommy, well Tommy is the spokes man for umbertos he goes with the furniture lol.

This place is horrible. Both food and service. Free glass of shitty wine (Just go buy yourself a bottle of two buck chuck at this point). The food was even worse. Cesar salad was drenched in dressing  and the clams were mediocre. We asked for tap water and they gave us a bottle of still and then charged us. After serving us our meal, the waiter asked if we wanted plain and garlic bread (we thought is was complimentary since he asked)  and then charged us for the bread as well. TL;DR:
NY is full of great Italian restaurants and this place isn't one of them. Save yourself the money and time and dine anywhere but mulberry st. especially, this place!
The best Lobster Bisque anywhere. The Maitre'd sings Sinatra. Life is good at Umberto's.

Had the whole restaurant to ourselves. Ordered a salmon fettuccine. Good portion sizes. Somewhat heavy. Not too pricey. It didn't taste too fresh or particularly amazing. But this not the place you go to purely for the taste. History factors into ambiance too. RIP Joe Gallo.

0 SD Taste
+0.5 SD Value
+2 SD Ambiance
+1 SD Memorability

Read any other negative review...exactly what they said.

Bill was $68, after running my card I was charged $123. Some excuses about a new waiter adding items from the wrong table to our bill? I guess this happened in the minutes between our initial bill and when they charged my card? Why wouldn't a table be closed out when they print your check?

What we thought would be a nice lunch on an otherwise quiet Labor Day in nyc was really just an uncomfortable meal with the "owner" literally chasing after people to come in and then cursing them off when they didn't show interest.

Clams were drowning in oil, caprese of 3x tomato slices and 3x small mozzarella slices, calamari was decent only because of the spicy sauce.

4 Years later. Still shitty. Only reason I can think of that this place is still around is probably links to some TV show that used to be popular way back when. Definitely go spend your money somewhere else.

Not a bad spot in little Italy. Owner lures you in with a free glass of wine. He also busted out in show during lunch and started singing frank sinatra so that was pretty entertaining lol. Had the mozzarella caprese which was nice and fresh, and we shared the chicken Parmesan which was a great portion size and pretty tasty. No complaints about the food, minus the bread which was stale and crunchy. I would come back.
Great classic Italian matched with great service right in the heart of Little Italy. You can't go wrong. The staff is attentive and have great memories for returning customers.

The lasagna was easily the best lasagna I have ever had. The over all experience of the restaurant was wonderful. Umberto the owner is such a gem and lovely person. You feel welcomed immediately walking in! Kind staff & waiters. Such a lovely dinner and delicious food.

Couldn't have had a better meal in little Italy.
Linguine and clams done perfect. Gnocchi, some of the best we've had.
Will return.

Amazing!!!!!!!
We live in Miami and we came to eat here, the BEST CLAMS EVER!!
There are so many restaurants around here but this one is soooooo good and also they gave a FREE sangria.
Can't get anything better around here !!!
Gracias Manny!!

I have eaten at Umberto's many times. It is a steady Italian red sauce place. I loved the zuppa di claims and the bread was nicely crunchy as it should be. You will not go wrong here. Let's not forget about the characters who work here and are perfectly wonderful as are the people you will see outfrint and walking past the window. Don't miss this place or you will be sorely disappointed.

**Urban Dessert Lab Review: A Sweet Symphony on a Plate**

Nestled in the bustling streets near the Tenement Museum lies a paradise for sweet tooths - the Urban Dessert Lab. It's not just a confectionary restaurant; it's a wonderland where strawberries find their true calling and ice cream dreams come true.

**First Glimpse: The Sweet Sanctuary**
Upon stepping into Urban Dessert Lab, you're greeted by an aroma that's part bakery, part Willy Wonka's factory. The decor? Imagine if modern art and a dessert buffet had a baby - that's Urban Dessert Lab for you.

**The Dessert Odyssey Begins:**
The menu is a veritable atlas of vegetarian delights, guiding you through a world where sugar and creativity intertwine like lovers in a dance.

**Strawberry Shortcake: The Berry Heartthrob**
The strawberry shortcake here isn't just a dessert; it's a starlet in a world of sweets. Each layer is a testament to the love affair between strawberries and cream, making you question every strawberry shortcake you've had before.

**Strawberry Ice Cream: A Creamy Dream**
Then there's the strawberry ice cream - a creamy, dreamy scoop of heaven. It's like the chefs whispered sweet nothings to every strawberry, coaxing out their richest flavors.

**Brezeln & Biscuits: The Unsung Heroes**
Don't overlook the Brezeln and biscuits. These are not mere sides; they're the trusty sidekicks in this dessert saga, ready to swoop in and steal the show with their buttery, flaky goodness.

**Liquid Indulgence: Wine and Frappes**
To quench your thirst, the wine is as divine as Dionysus' personal stash. And the chocolate frappe? It's like sipping on a cloud made of cocoa - frothy, rich, and utterly indulgent.

**Iced Coffee: The Cool Concoction**
And if you're a coffee aficionado, the iced coffee is a cool, caffeinated embrace. It's the perfect partner-in-crime to any dessert, adding that buzz to your sugar high.

**The Sweet Symphony: Staff and Prices**
The staff at Urban Dessert Lab are not mere employees; they are the conductors of this sweet symphony, orchestrating an experience that's as delightful as the desserts they serve. Their smiles are as genuine as the flavors.

And the prices? It's like they decided to give your wallet a break. Fair and friendly - just like the desserts.

**The Verdict: A Dessert Lover's Dream**
In the end, Urban Dessert Lab is more than just a dessert spot; it's a culinary adventure, a sweet retreat in the heart of the city. Whether you're a dessert connoisseur or just in the mood for a tasty treat, this place is sure to satisfy your sweet cravings with a side of joy.

---

Prepare for a delightful journey at Urban Dessert Lab, where every bite is a chapter in a deliciously sweet story!

One of favorite dessert spots in the city, and no I don't think it's overhyped.

I have been here twice, and the first time (a weekend night) I probably waited 45 minutes to order. At the time, they had a seasonal matcha soft serve flavor which I jumped on. Because I love strawberry matcha lattes, I got it with the strawberry crumble, and it was magical.

Tonight I ordered my usual, chocolate, and added on a waffle cone crumble. That was delicious as well.

The texture of the soft serve is amazing. It's very airy but not too light, and it has a bit of a firmness to it that really hits the spot. The crumbles are also such a good idea and so good! Love coming here with my vegan friend because I know it's something we'll both be able to enjoy.

What a great option when one is craving a texture different from regular old ice cream/gelato!

If long lines outside are any indication, Whipped Dessert Lab has made quite a name for itself with its plant (oat milk)-based ice cream creations, which are not only vegan-friendly, but instafriendly too.

The "artisanal" cones, for example, pile several toppings onto a "signature sweet crème" soft serve. My chocolate butter peanut pretzel cone, for example, featured a nice, crunchy coating of pretzels, chocolate sauce, and peanut butter sauce. Slightly spending at $8, but not egregiously so, and a reasonably sized treat for one.

Besides sweet crème as the base, there was also chocolate to choose from when I stopped by, not to mention plenty of other toppings and sauces if you wanted to customize your treats. All in all, an excellent option for those who don't take well to dairy products or want to stick to a vegan diet. Also, a successful, minority-owned business!

Pro tip: you don't need to shove your ice cream into the photo - or massage, fondle, or molest it - with your bare, moist, wrinkly hands and dirty fingernails. You also don't need to call attention away from the food with pointless "action" shots. Keep all body parts, plaque-laced bite marks, and distracting backgrounds out of the photo. Focus solely on the food and drink itself. #stayclassy #stayuseful #noyouarenotanarteeste

Cannot recommend enough!!! It's a little pricey (~$9 for a cup or cone), but how often do you see oat milk ice cream (that tastes amazing!!)?

I ordered the salted pecan in a cone and absolutely loved it! Our group also tried the peanut butter, mint and cookie crumble -- everyone was pleased! The perfect afternoon treat.

This is a great dessert option if you're out on a walk. For everything to be plant based you really can't tell. The cinnamon is very powerful but not over powering, the apple flavor filling was a hit. The crunch bits on the outside were nice but I probably wouldn't get it again.

The inside is small but you file in line so it goes pretty quickly. The staff also explains how everything works and keeps order for a smooth experience.

I will say the portion sizes are generous enough 2 people could share 1 order.

Hyped to the max until I finally try it and it does disappoint. The tiniest cup of this vegan soft serve ends up costing as much as a whole deli sandwich and it half melts before you can actually appreciate it. I had high hopes for this trendy spot but now I see why there are no longer lines. It's really not affordable to eat this often and it's not quite satisfying. I feel like all them influencers scammed me on this place.

Overall as a product yes it's good with a texture reminiscent of whipped marshmallow cream but quite overshadowed by sticker shock.
The ice cream was delicious, definitely a 10/10. But the service could definitely be better

I've been wanting to try this spot forever and finally had the chance!!

I loved the various toppings and drizzles my ice cream artist made for me. Not only was it a visual piece of art, it was just as tasty and satisfying in the plethora of simultaneous textures!! Crispy pretzels, crunchy cone, smooth silky soft serve, and the thick ribbons of peanut butter.

My only complaint is the ice cream melts way too fast and there's too much going on. My cone fell and I ended up asking for a new one which I felt bad about, as if the ice cream makers don't got enough going on. They were filming videos while I was there, so Whipped definitely has got it going on!! There were no lines on Sunday, which I was thrilled about. Go get your vegan sweet tooth fix now!! Oh, warning, you might have a nice bathroom trip in the morning. But I expected that as with anything oat milk.
It's fun watching they make the creations. The "ice cream" is light and flavorful and tasty. Everything is plant based as well. Wish they had more flavor options for the base.

06/09/23 : This has been on my list and finally able to check it out. Black and woman owned can't go wrong.

Note, it's small line is long so be prepared to wait. However, once inside organized process.  

Place your order at the kiosk and wait for preparation. I like before they start your order they ask any allergies. New pair of gloves is used for every order.

I ordered the strawberry shortcake with strawberry sprinkles and syrup. Please not dairy free gluten free egg free. The ice cream made from oat milk was ok all the toppings is what made it for me.  

If in the neighborhood definitely check them out and support!

Ice cream easy on the stomach. (Don't steal that tagline unless you pay me). I'm sooooo late posting this! I forget sometimes posting on Instagram tagging businesses. I went here last year lol AND I need to return asap! After being let down by oat ice cream at the grocery store I couldn't not support a black business that sells ice cream so I gave them a try. I looove pecans and the taste of the light ice cream covered in pecans and the light taste of the waffle cone each bite was literal perfection. Service was fine. They were very busy late night near closing time but they seem to sell until sold out.
The chandelier was a nice, cute touch along with the walls. It's very small inside but they do have 2 tables out front where you can sit, as we did.
Go, enjoy!!!

I often reflect on how lucky I am to be one of the rare citizens of the world with high lactose tolerance-- that is, cheese, ice cream, and all other dairy products make up a significant portion of my diet with no consequences. When I see non-dairy milk or ice cream alternatives I'm mostly thinking about all the xanthan gum and binding agents required to imitate the real thing, and why subject myself to all that when I can just have the good stuff? Whipped has opened my eyes to a delicious and xanthan gum-free alternative.

The base of these desserts is oat milk, which is definitely the creamiest alt-milk I've tried, so I understand why their treats taste so good. They use all natural ingredients to produce a frozen treat that is nut-free, soy-free and gluten-free. I'm really impressed with their product, and after one bite of this dessert I didn't mind the 40 mins or so I spent waiting in line.

Get there before the crazy summer lines start.

I heard so much about this place. I even passed it a few times and saw the incredibly long line outside. The other night after seeing a play I took a chance and stopped in around 9 pm and the line was short (no line out the door and only a few people inside waiting). I walked right inside and because there were just a few people ahead of me I had just enough time to scan the menu and decide what I wanted. You can choose from one of their hand-crafted creations or you can customize your own. Everything is also plant-based, including their toppings, sauces and cones. Their natural, artisan soft-serve begins with a premium oat milk base and is coated with carefully selected top shelf ingredients. You have to order at the kiosk and only cards are accepted (no cash). The staff is super friendly and works hard to move the line along.

I selected their strawberry shortcake handcrafted creation (signature sweet crème base coated with strawberry crumble and strawberry sauce). I opted for the waffle cone. The ice cream was light and super creamy, sort of like whipped cream but thicker. It's as delicious as it looks and presented beautifully. Eventhough it's oat milk ice cream it tastes just as creamy as regular ice cream. It wasn't too sweet and literally melts in your mouth. Although it is a bit on the pricey side (around $8) the quality and taste definitely make up for it. The shop is small inside with only a few seats. Fortunately I was able to grab a seat by the window and devour my absolutely amazing vegan ice cream.

I can't wait to come back to try other creations.

Whipped Urban Dessert Lab is a sweet oasis. Their service is great, providing a warm and welcoming atmosphere. But it's their oat-milk ice cream that steals the show - each scoop is a creamy, flavorful delight. It's a must-visit for dessert lovers looking for a delectable frozen treat that fits their lifestyle in the city.

Today I stopped by here and got Cinnamon Apple crisp. I saw someone else get a smores which looked really good and will try it again next time.

Cinnamon apple crisp-tastes just like apple pie, really good! The ice cream is made out of oatmilk, but hard to tell the difference between that and regular soft ice cream.

It's super soft, super creamy, outside had a dusting of cinnamon and other seasonings which made it taste like apple pie. The cone was good.

Overall: Will definitely be back again to try a different dish

Social media hyped this up WAYY too much (plz don't come @ me).

Cool concept, taste was okay and the staff were nice. But I didn't get that "cool" factor as  I've seen on social media. The line was a block out the door so maybe the wait influenced my review but I thought it was average.

The ice cream was very creamy and the ingredients tasted nice. Great option if you're vegan!

My photo says it all.
We were excited to find a place that could accommodate our vegan, dairy-free,,gluten-free family members. And it's quite tasty!

I've seen so many videos about oat-milk based ice cream spot Urban Dessert Lab in Manhattan, NYC and finally had the chance to go myself. It did NOT disappoint!

My go-to milk is oat milk, so it automatically checked that box for me. Definitely a go-to for anyone with any dietary restrictions, as they're very accommodating (they even double checked that I didn't have any additional food allergies)!

The space is small but the flavors are mighty. There's a kiosk inside where you can choose between ordering a hand-selected fusion for $8, with the following choices:

-Salted Pecan
Their signature sweet creme base coated with crushed salted pecans

-Mint Chocolate Cookie
Their signature sweet creme base coated with chocolate cookies & mint chocolate sauce

-Coffee Waffle Crunch
Their signature sweet creme base coated with waffle cone pieces & coffee sauce
​
-Strawberry Shortcake
Their signature sweet creme base coated with strawberry crumble & strawberry sauce

-Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel
Their signature sweet creme base coated with pretzels, chocolate & peanut butter sauce

-Cinnamon Apple Crisp
Their signature sweet creme base coated with a delicately-spiced crumble and topped with cinnamon and an apple drizzle

OR you can build your own, with a base starting at $5.75

-Signature Bases:
Sweet Creme with a touch of vanilla
Chocolate
The Whipped Twist  (Chocolate & Sweet Creme)

*Base is dairy free, egg free, nut free, soy free and gluten free

-Natural Sauces:
Chocolate
Peanut Butter
Coffee
Strawberry
Mint Chocolate 
Apple

*All sauces are dairy free, egg free and gluten free

Natural Crumb Coats:
Pretzels - DF, EF, NF, SF
Waffle Cone Pieces - DF, EF, NF
Chocolate Cookie Crumble - DF, EF, NF
Strawberry Crumble - DF, EF, NF
Cinnamon Spice Crumble - DF, EF, NF
Salted Pecan - DF, EF, SF, GF
Rainbow Sprinkles - DF, EF, NF, SF, GF
Sugar Cone Pieces - DF, EF, NF, SF, GF

*Dairy Free - DF ,  Egg Free - EF,  Nut Free - NF,  Soy Free - SF,  Gluten Free - GF *

I ordered a custom sweet creme base in a cup, with strawberry sauce and strawberry crumble. It was essentially the Strawberry Shortcake flavor but I couldn't eat a cone that comes with the fusions, so ordering this way saved me $0.75 (in a cup is free). I love how creative it was, with layers of crumbs, sauce, and ice cream, and how delicious it was too! I got a taste of the sauce and crumbs in every bite which made it extra flavorful.

I will most definitely be back here to try more flavors!

This place was unfortunately...just ok. I love the idea of a plant based ice cream shop, especially one that serves soft serve because that's really rare...but the ice cream itself was mediocre. It was really light and airy and didn't have the creaminess you'd hope for. Flavor wise, I mean hey, it's ice cream, it was tasty, but not mind blowing. It's a small shop and it's painted all black which is an interesting vibe too, a bit emo. I would not come back probably.

We customized our own order with

* Swirl (mix of chocolate and sweet creme softserve)
* Pretzel
* Chocolate + Peanut butter drizzle

This was really delicious! I tried my first oat milk ice cream some time back (a pint of oatly ice cream) and had such a bad experience so I was hesitant to try this but it was really different and didn't taste much like oat milk. It was very creamy too.

Dairy free soft serve?! YES PLEASE! This ice cream was insanely good! I just got the plain swirl but there are also lots of toppings and sauces to choose from.

They're super conscious about allergies, have the common allergens listed next to each menu item, and also ask you about any food allergies before they start making your ice cream. There weren't many gluten free toppings but I wasn't in the mood for extras so that was ok with me.

The one thing they could improve is the ordering system. When I entered the store there was a long line because everyone uses one iPad to order. The interface of the iPad is fairly straight forward but it seems like it would be more efficient for the people working behind the counter to take your order and make your dessert as they go.

Despite the wait, I'm so happy I found this just in time for summer! Five stars!

This spot was definitely one of the BEST vegan ice cream places I've ever visited.
The shop is really tiny and cute. You walk in, and place an order on iPads. The menu was a little confusing on how to make your own flavor, so I just went with an item on the menu. The employees were SUPER sweet & helpful with any questions I had.
I ordered the Strawberry Cheesecake and it was amazing. The ice cream is super fluffy and I couldn't believe it was dairy-free. The strawberry flavor is fresh and not overly sweet. 10/10
I will definitely be visiting in the future!

My boyfriend and I were looking for dessert after spending the day in Brooklyn, and we ended up coming back into Manhattan to a tiny little ice cream place on the Lower East Side. Orchard Street is crowded with shops and restaurants, and we're always up for vegan ice cream on a summer evening. You order at a kiosk and can get a pre-set cone or make your own, deciding between chocolate soft serve, sweet creme (a vanilla type flavor), or a swirl. We got the S'more's cone (made with a Dandies vegan marshmallow) and the  Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel, which I liked more than the S'more's (I think it could have used some chocolate sauce). So we switched. But they were both really tasty.

There's not much room inside the UDL; they also limit the number of guests inside, I guess to keep it from getting too warm. There is, however, seating outside so you can sit and enjoy your cone. Oh, and did I mention they use waffle cones? It's the first time I've seen vegan waffle cones, so I couldn't be more thrilled.

I'll definitely have to come back the next time I'm in New York.

This place was definitely not for me but I seem to be an outlier here. Firstly it is unorganized in the store itself with where to order vs pick up after ordering. Everything is covered in black containers so you can't see what topping are available without searching the menu or the tablet. When we first came in the tablet said it was offline so people were just ordering with the workers instead. Halfway through the line the tablet suddenly started to work again and we were able to place our order.

I soft serve itself was no where near as creamy or rich as non vegan but you can only do so much about that. The toppings were okay and they did put some on the bottom of the cup so each bite had toppings which is probably the only thing I liked here. It was $8 for a cup which is a bit steep for soft serve but at least they don't charge you for a waffle cone if want one. There is a lack of a trash can outside in the seating area so you have to go back inside and wade through the people to throw anything out.

I'm beyond disappointed, after seeing this place on social media. I ordered the chocolate peanut butter one but all I got was the twist in a waffle cone. I thought there might be some peanut butter or chocolate somewhere in the bottom since I saw they made others with some sauce drizzled on the bottom but mine has nothing in there. And I already walked away so didn't want to go back to complain. They took a while to make each every one of them. Expect a little wait. And also one is still in training kept messing up the order. My partner had mint chocolate there's also no flavor. Definitely not the mint chip you think it would be.

They are very welcoming that greet you upon arrival and introduce their products and how everything works. And for people with lactose intolerance or looking for vegan this is the place to be. But there's nothing special about it. Just expensive oat based soft serve. I had better oat soft serve elsewhere at a lower price.

It's rare to come across an ice-cream shop for vegans/non-dairy people only (because there are limited options in regular ice-cream shops).

My friend recommended me to try this out and I absolutely love it!  Whipped makes their ice-cream differently than most vegan ice-cream shops like Van Leeuwen (I love VL too), but I like the way that you can customize the ice-cream flavors with the toppings that you want, and how they make it compact and tasty!

This store was crowded on a Wednesday evening when we walked in (cold and wet). It's gotten super popular and crowded.  I hope they get a bigger place soon because they only had two staff making and operating the whole place.

Overall, don't expect an in and out experience, but so for some really good vegan ice-cream!!!

Wow soft serve oat milk ice cream. It's BLACK OWNED, WOMEN OWENED. And VEGAN. Beyond that; the ice cream is absolutely delicious! I got the s'mores flavor that they even toast the marshmallow! Can't wait to go back

Delicious ice cream shop a short walk away from Chinatown and Little Italy. Service was quick and also very communicative.
We got the strawberry shortcake with a party hat, which was a fun little dessert. We liked the strawberry crumble coating which gave a very slight crunch around their perfectly smooth ice cream.

I love this place so much. Vegan soft serve is incredibly difficult to find and this place has an amazing one, which also works for folks with but allergies because it's oat milk based. They had a special S'mores cone with cinnamon graham cracker crumbles, chocolate sauce, and a toasted marshmallow on top. The chocolate peanut butter pretzel is amazing as always - my favorite flavor by far.

The soft serve is amazing on its own, but the cones are a special creation in themselves. Absolutely fantastic - I'll always come back.

Worth it!

Like most of the places I've been to lately, Whipped Urban lured me in through their many Instagram posts. I felt like I could taste the dessert in my head based solely on the photos and it did not disappoint.

My boyfriend and I opted to go custom (he ordered the chocolate base and I went with sweet crème). The texture and taste were divine and there was a lot to eat in the deceptively small cups.

The staff were friendly and sweet, food pun intended.

Highly recommend!

The I cream is a little overpriced and overhyped. That being said they were very considerate of people with food allergies. I liked the I cream, but wouldn't wait in that long line again. Overall if you're going to go, do it at an off time.

This a trendy oat-milk ice cream shop. It was very busy on a Saturday around 9pm. For any of the ice cream flavors, you can choose a cup or a waffle cone. They pack the ice cream with crushed toppings and load it with drizzles.

We tried the cinnamon apple crisp. The ice cream was smooth and not too sweet. The flavoring came through, but wasn't overpowering. Definitely a perfect treat for autumn.

They have two seats inside the shop and a bit more outdoor seating but to avoid the crowd, it's best to grab and go.

Not sure I feel the need to come again but it's a nice option for dessert lovers.

too long didn't read: solid ice cream, clean, small shop, expensive.

I am a bit conflicted reviewing whipped, but before I get to that, the logistics:

Service was as quick as it could be given that they were understaffed and I appreciated the attention they gave me. You order at a kiosk and then can watch your ice cream being prepped. They also have signs explaining how to order and the process for creating your own, as well as several crowd favorites that I ended up choosing from. I tried the popular strawberry shortcake to go, which came in a cute pint container. Is the ice cream good enough to eat in the cold? Yes. Maybe it was because I was really hungry or because it is standing room only I couldn't savor it the way I wanted to, and only concluded to my friend that it was okay, and maybe didn't need to go out of my way to try it.

On the one hand I am so happy to be able to get vegan soft serve that approximates the Mister Softie ice cream of my youth (hooray for unlocking core childhood memories), and so for the nostalgia alone, earned three stars.

But honestly, if I had just gotten the soft serve with a cone with no accompaniments it would have been four stars, because sometimes there is such thing as too much of a good thing. I would have probably liked it better as a soft serve in a hard candy shell on a cone a la mister softie. It is pricey so it wouldn't be an every day treat but just like the truck, the magic is in the chase.

FINALLYYYYY! I was able to visit Whipped!

On my first attempt, my friends and I visited around 12pm on the weekend without checking their hours and they were closed so ever since then I made it my mission to visit when I was back in the area.

It's a small dessert lab with two stool seats by the window and a table outside. You can order at the kiosk which is quick and easy. I HAD to try their strawberry shortcake ice cream and i'm so glad I did. The nostalgia of having the strawberry shortcake ice cream bars as a kid, haha!

A small cup was around $8 which I didn't mind paying since it's plant based. Of course I took some photos of it across the street too. My bf and I shared a small which was such a tease. I will be back to try other menu items ASAP!

I ordered a mint oreo ice cream and couldn't even taste it. To this day I am not sure whether it was for a lack of flavor or sinus infection, but based on my spouse's reaction, the flavor was lacking. Not a place I want to come back and try, but that's not to say other people won't like it. It was brand new when we visited so there was a bit of delay to get our serving as the manager was training staff. Free ice cream offered to patrons though when there were screw ups.

Simple soft serve place with basic flavors and good topping combinations. Saturday afternoon, only a small group of people inside who've already ordered at the kiosk in the back.

Decided on the Chocolate Peanut Butter Pretzel on a cone ($8ish). Pretty expensive for an ice cream, but had to get that flavor combination. Full scoop of  chocolate ice.cream.woth peanut butter, nuts, and chocolate syrup on top. Nice covering and soft interior - incredibly messy to eat (take several napkins and a spoon). Also like the chocolate core at the bottom of the cone so the soft serve doesn't melt through the bottom.

Website has no prices, which is odd since it's not a large changing menu. Like the service and quick turnaround; good to try at least once.

This was my first time trying oat milk soft serve. I thought it tasted good, but will not go out of my way to come back as it is a little pricey. We had to wait in line for about 30min on a Sunday evening to order, and another 20min to get our order. The line did move quickly though. Only a few people can enter the shop at a time since it is pretty small. The staff was nice and asked all customers about dietary restrictions and allergies prior to making their order.

Okay so this place has been all over social media & I am nothing if not an over enthusiastic consumer of media. I hardly ever eat dairy ice cream anymore so I was excited to try the oat milk soft serve.

We got to the small east village establishment & the line was down the block. We honestly had nothing better to do & we wanted this ice cream so badly so we waited. Did we wait an hour? Yes. Was it worth it? Honestly yeah.

The service was impeccable. I cannot say enough about how kind the workers are. They were essentially breaking their backs to get these orders out & still made sure to ask each customer if they have food allergies. I have a severe nut allergy & I was nervous about eating here. They took the time to sanitizer all the surfaces & took many more precautions than other ice cream places. I was really appreciative.

I got the s'mores special & it was so so good. It had the vanilla & chocolate swirl with chocolate syrup inside, cinnamon coating, a toasted marshmallow & a waffle cone on the side. It was decadent & truly unique.

I know people will complain & say this place isn't worth it- but they are doing something new & the ice cream is great. Yes it's expensive, but so is everything in NYC & at least this is something different. I loved the fluffy texture of the oat milk & wish Chicago had one of these!

The oat milk ice cream is okay, but it's all about the toppings! I got the sweet creme base with the strawberry crumble on top. The strawberry crumble was delicious! At $7.35 for a scoop of ice cream with some toppings it's a little pricey, but you won't be disappointed.

Finally got a chance to try whipped ice cream since I've been seeing it all over my Instagram! Love that they serve oat milk based ice cream since I'm lactose intolerant! I found the ice cream to be really good and was more than enough to share with my partner.

I was one of the first people in line so i didn't have to wait very long for service and the people who worked there are really nice!

It's cute but very small in there, they have a small bench outside that you can eat your ice cream at.

Yummy! I came here from a recommendation that my sister gave me and it was worth it. I ordered the Cinnamon Apple Crisp ($8) which was well worth as it includes everything for one price. The fact that it is oat milk based is an immediate plus. I would come back again for more. Not sure if their hours changed, but when I went they were only open weekends and usually night? and were looking to scale and broaden their hours.

Was craving ice cream after dinner and passed by this cute, little shop. When I say little, it's literally very little.
You order on the screen and pick up at the counter. Very easy and simple. Ice cream is plant based; even the toppings were too. It's my first time trying plant based ice cream and it was very good! I loved how soft and airy it was. Will come back next time I visit nyc!

Talk about a vegan ice cream. This was delicious through and through. I loved the texture of the crumb coat and the strawberry purée was so yummy. They work fast too and the staff are so nice. The place is small so it's really more of a to go spot.

This place has been on my list for a while, and today I was finally able to check it out . The line wasn't that bad, we waited about 20 mins. The line does move slow, however there are only 2 people working the front.

I ended up getting the sweet crème ice cream with pecans in a cup and my husband ended up getting the mint chip in a waffle cone.

The ice cream texture was light and airy. However, it's bland, has no flavor. I ended up taking a few bites before I gave up on it. The mint chip was good, but the mint flavor was strong.

If you walk too fast you'll miss this cute little dessert shop in LES.

I found this place on Tik Tok and it was vegan, so naturally, I had to try it out!

Now I am a big ice cream fiend. It was good. Its not blowing my mind but I did enjoy trying a different take on a dessert I love so much.

I got the graham cracker scoop in a cone. For me, I feel like the graham cracker was doing all the heavy lifting and without it, the base would be somewhat bland. On the other hand, I really liked the fact that it was whipped. It didn't feel heavy at all because of it.

If I was back in the area and had a sweet tooth I would go back, but that would be a long journey for me that I otherwise probably wouldn't take just because.

This place has been on my radar forever, but I never wanted to wait in line on the weekends. I finally tried it and I was underwhelmed. To be fair, if you are vegan, nut free, egg free, lactose intolerant, etc., this place would be perfect.

The ice cream is surprisingly creamy in texture, but lacked flavor. We got the sweet cream + chocolate twist; the chocolate was better, but the sweet cream just tasted like sugary water. We chose the chocolate cookie crumb, which overpowered the ice cream even more. Lastly, our coffee drizzle was gross -- WAY too bitter for me and had a strange aftertaste.

A lot of reviews said there was bad service, but that's not necessarily true. It's a small store that's quite popular so they literally cannot have more people working there. Ordering is through a self kiosk, but the menu is pretty self explanatory.

This was a spot that I have been waiting to try out for a while. One -  cause it's around the area I work and two - it's interesting seeing oat milk ice cream and three - I love ice cream! Even better...soft served ice cream!!  So, like I said  I love ice cream so honestly, it doesn't have to be oat milk but wanted to give this place a try.
I later discovered it's only opened 3 days a week!!! Not sure if this started during the pandemic but 3 days isn't much and they open starting Fridays .... at 4pm...(Open Fridays 4pm-11pm, Saturdays and Sundays 1-11pm, could be wrong there...)  so yeah I can't even grab a dessert or cone during my lunch break. (Who eats lunch ...at work that late anyways...).
Luckily, I grabbed dinner with a friend around the area recently and pushed that we give this place a try after our meal. Thankfully - she agreed!!!

So, the place is quite small so there will be a line plus...it's only open for 3 days so it makes sense. The line wasn't too horrible. It moved fairly quickly so no biggie. There's also very limited seating; 4 seats outside and a small bench as well as two seats inside the shop, that are located in front of the window. If you arent is able to get a seat, you can always walk to the nearby park to enjoy your ice cream.

Once, we were able to get into the shop, you'll see the menu posted pretty close by and you can choose your flavor. You'll also see only 3 staff are there, preparing the ice cream orders. Additionally, you'll see that staff won't be taking your order and payment but you'll be ordering through a kiosk so that's easy if you're nervous talking to someone but this also is the made reason (I believe) that people aren't quick. So it's not the staff but the customers that are slow... you got to be prepared and look at the menu online or before even going to the place... come on! (again, that's me I want to see what they got and choose something - be ready!) On the kiosk you get to pick what base ice cream (sweet creme, chocolate, or twist), cup or cone, and toppings.

My friend wanted the strawberry shortcake one (I wanted that one!! T_T) and I decided to get the coffee crunch. I suggested we get different flavors and share a little bit.  My friend choose her base of creme (even thought I suggested twist cause best of both worlds, you know? ) and I got mine with the twist base and everything else for the flavor (coffee crunch) was kept and no adjustment was made.

It came out fairly quickly.
The ice cream was soft and light (hence whipped) and was super delish. My friend thought the creme has no hint of vanilla but I can taste it. The chocolate you'll taste more of the chocolate taste. The toppings really gives the ice cream the crunch favor and flavor - so yeah my coffee crunch you'll know it's coffee. The strawberry one , reminded me of the good humor strawberry toppings.

I actually really enjoyed my experience and will come again. Am thinking of going again next week. :D

I loved this! I got the strawberry shortcake and it was such a treat. It tasted like light and fluffy whipped cream, which was perfect because sometimes I'm not in the mood for super heavy icecream. The strawberry crumble was spectacular.

Con is that this is very expensive for icecream, even in the city. But this is perfect if you have any dietary restrictions or just in the mood for something not too heavy!

Had one of the signatures this time - the strawberry shortcake which looked great in social media. The actual ice cream was smaller and looked less aesthetic than I thought, but definitely felt that their ice cream had a distinct taste and texture. My favorite was probably the strawberry crumble part! I wish there were more ingredients mixed in to their signatures, because it's really just the ice cream, crumble, and drizzle in the middle, nothing crazy

You know when you see a place on Instagram and it lives up to its hype? Whipped is for sure one of those places! I was so excited to try it during my vacation in New York! I had the coffee waffle crunch and it was creamy and dripping with a generous amount of coffee sauce, and delicious. I enjoyed the outer waffle cone coating. My friend really liked the mint chocolate cookie. Like many non-dairy ice creams, I could not tell it was made from oat milk. I love a good soft-serve ice cream!! I wish I was from the area so I could take a pint home. Staff was friendly and open to answering any questions, providing recommendations, and helping customers order on their system. I do wish there was more indoor seating and in a more spacious area.

Went in for a quick slice, came out finding happiness can be found at Pizza Parlors.

I wish I remembered the name of the slice I got, but this was the best mushroom cheese slice I've had in a very long time as a pizza fan.
The taste reminded me of Crème fraîche(fresh cream) mushrooms over beautifully baked dough.
How can something be so thin, yet so full of flavor.
What makes New York great are places like Upside Pizza.
Whether you're a college student, executive, parent, dog, your grandma's goldfish, or having a bad day, for a couple bucks, an amazing slice can lift up your day!

Till next time Upside Pizza!

Good pizza by the slice. Sourdough based crust. I ordered a cheese pie the night before I went home back to Cali and brought to my daughter.

Traveled well and was just as delicious after being warmed up! NYC Pizza

I wish I had 2 stomachs to try all
The flavors of
Pizza they had but I stuck with the tried and true pepperoni which was DEER-LISH-SHHHUUSSS!!  It's a thin yet thick Slice With zesty Marina and
Plenty of cheese but  thin pepperonis
That are small but manageable.  A slice
Is about $5.50.  Next time I will try the sausage, mushroom and broccoli rabe!! Tables inside have have ample breeze but there are also spacious tables outside.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was cuz the crusts were super dry and hard, and the slice was really oily.  Still would come back!!
I got the quality the pizza was very good crispy and yummy. Line went by really fast as well.
I dream about this pizza and unfortunately am not in New York as often as I'd like to be (pretty much just to eat this pizza). The crust was perfection.
I know it makes me less of a New Yorker to enjoy Sicilian pizza but it's just too damn good! Pizza was delicious and I was thankful it was open late for me to get food at 11 after a flight.

I feel good. Today I experienced a life changing event, so I am perhaps a bit bouncy, and it will reflect in this review.

Upside Pizza is a pizza joint I have been meaning to try. It has been on my list, my radar, for several months, and each time I seem to never find the time to try the slices out. I finally got the chance today.

The slices come out hot, and incredibly crispy. It is a great crust, a rather thin one, but I liked the taste. There was little burn on the undercarriage, it had a nice blonde color, not raw at all. The cheese is undoubtedly the star here. It is super fresh and full of flavor. The grease just pours out the slices, like pools of grease (it is really excess cheese), just ooze out. Unfortunately, the sauce is kinda bland and the power of the cheese is simply too much.

I would also suggest trying their Spicy Vodka slice. It is not too overwhelming in spice, but has good flavor and complements most of the slices in the pizzeria.

It is also super close to the Spring St subway station on the 6 train.

Normally, I would restrain on this pie and say it is a 3.8/5, but I'll be nicer and say 3.9. I have gone back and forth on giving it the 4 point rating but unfortunately I have to keep it where it is at 3.9.

Now therefore go.

Came here for a lighter bite in the middle of the day. I got a tomato slice. The tomato sauce was too acidic for me. However the crust and bread were so good. A good amount of heft yet still so crispy. The aromatics of the garlic and basil were fragrant. There's ample amount of seating. However, I can see it getting busy. Definitely would want to come back to try a normal slice sometime.

I thought the price of a slice is supposed to be roughly the cost of an MTA fare (as of today, $2.90). I guess times have changed and ya know, inflation. Here you get a pretty standard cheese slice for $4 bucks. I like that they have seating indoors, cafe seating on the sidewalk, and benches on appropriated side street parking. Take your pick! Quick and easy to grab a slice, and genuinely friendly guys who work here! This place probably gets a ton of foot traffic for its proximity to the divey bar across the street, the playground and the subway station. If I had one minor thing to mention, it was about their crust. Texture of the crust was nice, had a good crisp and chew but the flavor was a bit lackluster. Neither sweet nor salty nor yeasty. Just okay for what it was.

I have to say this is my new favorite pizza place!

The workers are all nice and the food comes out fast and a good temp. Not too hot and not cold.

The mushroom white pizza is delish! It has like a lemony flavor to it which adds such freshness and elevates it so much. It's good dough too. Not too thin and not too thick. Good sauce and good amount of cheese.

The slice with broccoli on it was delicious! Don't knock it until you try it!

The pepperoni was a solid slice as well.

Their upside down square pizza is delicious!
The dough is so good and kinda taste like sourdough and the sauce and cheese ratio is good!

For garlic knots were just avg to me

Standard slice. Not the best but serviceable.

This place gets popular especially since it's by a touristy area and soho.

Popped into Upside Pizza while doing some shopping in Soho. This spot is definitely a more upscale pizzeria with it's nice design touches. On a Sunday afternoon this place was packed with all seating on the inside and outside in use. Luckily I planned to just grab and go so I was happy that the service was fairly quick. I ordered 2 cheese slices which came out to $8... a bit pricey for my taste but for a good slice I'll do it. When I bit into the pizza it was way too crispy, you could barely fold the crust and the sauce lacked flavor. I'm not sure I'll be back here but it did get the job done.

...Back to my journey of finding the perfect slice
Great pizza! Great service! Very fast! I want to go back tomorrow, very excellent thin sliced pizza!!

This pizza combines the simplicity of NY style pizza with amazing toppings with robust flavors. The result is an amazing pie, worthy of a 5 star review. I waited the lines at Joes, and it isn't even in the same ballpark as Upside.

Very good slice. If you like it extra crispy, it has a good amount of crunch.

What really reeled ne in was that they were playing some mellow Bob Marley tunes.

Very solid pizza spot in NYC!! More of a takeout spot but it does have a few tables for that late night bite before traveling home from its hopping location! Lots of different pizza varieties so something for everyone! The service was fast and the outside is trendy

A slice on the hoof, I saw it at the counter, they popped it in the oven for two minutes and then it was on a plate. Ready to go and I walked and at my way to the next stop.

The pizza was a little thin, but well topped. Tasty with a spicy pepperoni on it and just a little bit of grease that dripped onto the streets of Manhattan.

[Review 18381 overall - 379 in New York - 1903 of 2022.]

Fast and easy. Perfect for my quick lunch during my shopping spree in SoHo.

If you're in the area for a quick bite, this is it.

We were waiting for a table to be called on at Ruby's next door and we were in NYC and who can't resist pizza when you're in NYC? The place looked poppin' so we decided to grab a slice. I'm used to those $1 slices, so I was pretty shocked when I saw the pizza was $5, but maybe it's inflation.

I grabbed a slice of pepperoni and we were able to get our pizza heated up pretty quickly. It may be due to the ambiance, but NYC pizza absolutely slaps wherever you are. The thin crust, the perfect amount of cheese, and the perfectly seasoned pepperoni make a great combo. Their crushed pepper was more like a powder, and it definitely added the spice to it!

They have indoor and outdoor seating so it's great place to grab a quick bite. It was my first time in SoHo and my first time at this pizza spot -- I will say the $5 price point threw me off, but I definitely enjoyed my pizza slice here!
genuinely the worst pizza i've ever had in my life. and the atmosphere was like a dirty mcdonald's with a loud DJ. do not waste your money

Upscale, renovated pizza spot that's popular with the late night crowd. Pizzas are solid but not that special. Then again, when you've had a few drinks you just want a hot slice in your mouth quickly and this place delivers.

Their pepperoni squares are decent but generally inferior to Prince Street Pizza around the corner. Some of the pizzas get left in the oven for too long when they're being reheated and tasted burnt. For around $5 a slice, there are better spots nearby but overall this is a convenient, casual spot that does the basics.

The pizza was delicious. Exactly what I want from a New York slice - thin, crispy, and flavorful. Their vodka slice is the best one I've ever had. It was SO good. Too good. Highly recommend. Also tons of places to eat your slice -- both seated spots and standing spots with tables. Do yourself a favorite and go!

Pretty good pizza. We just came because the line for prince Street was super long. I tried their thin slice pepperoni and was not disappointed. It was thin and crispy but not burn. The square pizza looks thicker than prince Street though. Will come back to try it

Great casual spot to grab a quick slice on this busy intersection in Nolita. No lines, no fuss, service was quick, prices are not too crazy. I tried the Falcowitz (mushroom) slice ($4.50) and the Sunny Goldstein ($6) - both were delicious though I wish I went for the classic cheese instead of the latter.

Lots of outdoor seating and bar tables if you want to stand and eat like a true New Yorker, on the go. Upside is a newish business with a more modern interior, but still encapsulates the NY culture and vibe.

Their pizza is fine. It's not notably delicious. I love pizza and when I've had pizza cravings since going to Upside I've never once craved Upside. Staff was nice and it's not ridiculously priced despite the hype. I'd be fine eating it again (like if I was nearby?) but can't imagine seeking it out.

quick, casual grab & go slice
pizza was good.
Boyf ordered a Sicilian Cheese slice & a classic sausage & peppers slice ..
Around $5 a slice .. tasted like a $3 a slice
service was whatever .. not very accommodating
was ight.. not bad but wouldn't necessarily come back unless it was the only option ..

SHEEEESSHHHHH when I came to New York and they said I have to try pizza at any spot I see I didn't think it would be this good!

I tried about 4 different places for a slice and THIS was the best slice I had in my time here. Given, I was starving and had a friend recommend it to me but what really set this apart was the crunchy crispy edges on the crust. As someone who PREFERS that and almost likes it when its a little overcooked (cheese is like a darker orange) that grandma's pepperoni slice really did it for me.

Quicker to get as well compared to other places. Light and fluffy - better than Prince's imo.

Upside was open after 10:00 pm on a weeknight, which I appreciate. Slices were heated quickly yet thoroughly in the oven. Thin crust with plenty of cheese and toppings makes for enjoyable pizza. There is a decent mount of seating, both inside and out, and a good soft drink selection too. Definitely a good stop for a slice.

New yorker living in LA, havent been back to the city in a whole year, staying nearby at a hotel for work/memories, this hit the spot! Had a pepperoni (4.5/5) slice and mushroom slice (5/5). (Pepperoni is my go to/fav, so cant give a 5)
Recommend over all the other choices in the area with stupid lines.

This location used to be a crappy pizza joint that's been around for ages. I'm so so so thankful they replaced the old place because they have the best Vodka Slice in NYC!!!! (don't @ me)

My boyfriend and I come here when we're craving a slice. The crust is perfectly thin and crispy. Don't get anything else. Every time I felt adventurous and tried a different slice, I regretted my decision. I've had the Grandma slice, the mushroom and the regular cheese but the Vodka always wins!!!! We've ordered whole Vodka pies multiple times for birthdays, sports events, get togethers... etc. I have to admit the pies taste better as they're fresher but either way it's amazing and worth a try!

Tasty slices that almost seem like a clone of Prince Street Pizza down the block would be how I would describe it. While I am not a fan of pizza places trying to get all hipster artisanal and using it as an excuse to charge over $5 for a slice even when factoring inflation, this place is a decent alternative to Prince Street Pizza if the line at Prince Street is a bit too long with tourists in the neighborhood. I would give this place a try if you're in the area and would probably put it on a list of the many pizza joints in NYC to try.

Only had one slice (white pizza with mushroom), but the crust and taste convinces me that this would be your typical great by the slice pizza place. Quick service. Lots of options. You won't go wrong here.
Delicious tiny pizzeria in Nolita. Had a Sicilian slice and it didn't disappoint. They take cards too. Ample outdoor seating. it's so good you can't eat just one slice.
Thin, crispy, cheesy and the perfect amount of  pepperoni which equals the perfect pizza. Just got a slice of pepperoni and it was pipping hot, packed with flavor and so delicious!
Great pizza - the sauce was delicious and the crust was thin and crispy. Would recommend stopping by if you are in the area.

Great location for a pizza shop, close to the park, the train, and a bunch of other restaurants. I stopped by for a quick bite and I ordered the pepperoni grandma slice and the pepperoni cups were really tasty and the dough was thick and fluffy. The decor is beautiful and the service was quick and attentive.
Amazing pizza in NYC. Great service and energy from the staff there. Be ready to wait in line because the hype is real. The crust was really good and the pizza was fantastic.

Nice location and an open space vibe. Can be very crowded and busy. At the time I went they didn't have some slices available so I settled with the cheese and Sicilian slice. They were crispy and saucy. Overall solid but nothing too special. If you are in the area, I would give them a try.

Delicious New York pizza! Probably overpriced ($5 a slice) for New York pizza, but so glad I tried it. The slice is very big, so I do not feel as bad about the price. The workers are very friendly and make sure your pizza is warmed up before receiving it. The pizza itself was crunchy, which I prefer, but something else about the dough or cheese that was used that makes it superior to the typical California pizza that I'm used to.

Stopped in randomly for a slice, was not even planning on it. Just walking by and saw something that looked good....and I'm glad we did. We got the Don square slice and it was delicious; crispy bottom, soft and airy middle and delicious toppings! And the staff was also quite pleasant, thanks guys for an unexpectedly good surprise slice on my afternoon outing the other day

Coming in i expected the service to be slow due to the mass amount of people around, but it was actually very quick and the workers were really nice.

For food I personally got 2 plain slices, i'm not a very big thin crust pizza guy but i thought for thin crust it was very good.

The only problem with this place is that there isn't much seating around especially when it gets crowded. i had to sit on the ground and eat my pizza while i waited for a bench to open. The plates also weren't the greatest so it was hard to eat while holding.

Solid slice! Simple, satisfying, and well done.
We got a plain slice. We enjoyed the crust a lot, nice and thin and crispy (with good structural integrity). They're not redefining pizza, but definitely doing a good job.

Pizza was just okay. The crust was weak and wasn't cheesy enough for me. The sausage pepper one was too sweet and I wasn't a fan of it. But the soft serves they serve right next door though?? Holy. Moly. Bomb dot com. Super soft and better than your nostalgic mister softee. I tried the vanilla and the pistachio flavor and both were soo good. Definitely will keep coming back for that ice cream. They also have sundaes too which I will be getting. Lines are always forming for the soft serve side! Definitely give it a try!!
Best pizza in New York. Maybe in the United States. At least out of everything I've ever eaten. Don't miss this place.
Some of best pizza slices I've ever had in my life. The mushroom with lemon is insane. Also vodka The crust of the pepperoni was perfect

After a stellar first experience at their 8th Avenue location during their infancy, I finally paid this location a visit.

Same friendly staff and same no-frills delicious pizza.

I had a pepperoni slice and a tomato square. The total came out to $9 exactly.

Gone are the days of thinly-sliced pepperonis. It's all about the slightly smaller charred, thicker, grease-filled pepperoni cups now.

I especially enjoyed their tomato square since the sauce was tangy and herbaceous. The dough was soft and airy, while the sides were charred and gave a nice slightly bitter aftertaste.

There was plenty of seating inside and out. 2-3 round tables on the Mulberry Street side of the store and 3-4 large picnic tables on Spring.

I enjoyed my first visit to this location and I'll definitely be back to try out their other offerings. A must-stop-by whenever in Nolita.

Stopped into Upside Pizza during their collab with popular skincare brand Summer Fridays. I picked this white sauce pizza with sausage and broccoli and it was delicious! For about $5 a slice it filled me up and was quick to grab on the go! Will definitely come back

Quite possibly my favorite pepperoni slice in NYC! There's almost never a wait and service is fast with indoor and outdoor seating. The crust is fluffy and has a sourdough taste to it and the tomato sauce tastes so fresh and different from other pizzerias.

Was walking around in the swealtering heat and I honestly don't remember why we were in the area, but we were jonsing for some pizza and walked by this. Had solid reviews and no line, so win win. We got a mushroom slice and a grandma and at at the tables on the street. Solid NYC pizza, reminded me of the pizza I had in NYC when I was a kid. No line probably cause they are really fast and attentive.
great spot! Open late night, but our pizza was not great  it was incredibly salty and overall. I love a good thick crust!

Great pizza with one of the best doughs we had in New York, airy, fluffy, and the right amount of char.
Made a reservation for 5 and arrived at 5:02 pm. There was a long line waiting outside for walk-ins, which made me realize that setting an alarm 2 weeks ago at 8:59 am to check Resy was the right move.

Food quality is high for sure, but I can't see myself waiting in a long line on Saturday, probably before 4:45pm, just to get in.

Checkout Sottocasa! They have great pizzas too!

I'm wondering if Una Pizza Napoletana acquired its "World's Best Pizza" designation like one of the 27 hot dog carts in Midtown boasting that they have "World Famous Hot Dogs".

Don't get me wrong. It's still delicious. The quality of the dough is top-tier and you can tell; it's chewy and airy, with a whisper of a crisp on the outer edge. The crust is MASSIVE. And I love pizza crust; in fact, I will give a bombastic side eye to anyone who abandons Neapolitan pizza crust on their plate. However, the ratio of crust to middle was a bit ridiculous. I suggest one goes in expecting pizza crust with a side of sauce and cheese.

In summary ... pretty disappointed with the quality of food, given the fact that it was known as "the best pizza in the world" at some point.

Una pizza napoleona, given its massive demand, runs on a pretty "hard to get" resy reservations cycle, and I'm certainly glad I wasn't waiting hours for a walk-in spot. When entering, what's unique is that even among other well known pizza restaurants, UPN does capture that "date-night" vibe the best :fully equipped with a bar, low lights, and a modern ambiance.

I ordered a margarita pizza, which given that it's a classic pizza style, was a pretty huge letdown. The tomato sauce felt watery, and for $25 , seemed overpriced for the quality that was received. Would be at a 2 but the service from the waiter was superb :)

I made reservations here 3 weeks in advance and reservations tend to instantly sell out on Resy. When it came time, we arrived at the place and the entrance is fairly hard to see if you do not pay attention to the subtle door handle. We checked in early and they were only able to seat us closer to the reservation time, which makes sense. We got the margherita pizza to share, and it was a decent amount of food for a satisfying meal. The reservation does indicate that they save 1 pie per person, so if you choose that route, you may end up with leftovers which I see a lot of people do, or have a very very filling meal. The pizza itself is very okay. I don't understand how this place made it to the #1 top pizza in the US list. Sure, the crust and dough are very chewy and kind of like a mochi texture, which is amazing, but the tomato sauce is fairly scarce yet the dough is very soggy. There is a good amount of cheese and basil which is good, however. The pizza is also fairly burnt which some amount of burnt is tolerable due to the high heat Neapolitan style pizza needs to cook.

Otherwise, service is good as they check up on you fairly regularly and don't mind if a party of two only orders one pizza and that's it. Price wise, it is on the very pricey side for the quality as it was $25 for the margherita, plus tax and tip will come to well over $30 for just one pizza that is not even that delicious.

Una serves a neopolitan style pizza with specially made dough without yeast! The dough was tasty and the taste was similar to the pizza I've had in Italy. The chef himself is making all your pizzas to order in the restaurant! Our server explained everything well and were attentive without interrupting your meal too many times. It's a cute place that's not too big. Reservations are easier to get with a party of 2 but they do accept walk ins and sound highly recommend going a few minutes before opening.

This is the best pizza I've had in New York. NY pizza purists might disagree because it's a completely different style, but I'd take a pizza here any day. It's really difficult to get a reservation due to limited seating and the fact they're only open a few days a week, but keep trying because it's so worth it.
