I highly recommend watching the Eater video before coming here to really appreciate the effort that Chef Anthony Mangieri went through to perfect this pie. We were lucky and were seated right near the kitchen, so we could see all the pizzas being made by the Chef himself through the window!

I'm a huge crust person and the crust on this pizza is the best i've had. It has a sourdough note to it due to the starter they use, and it's cooked to absolute perfection. I was debating getting a red sauce pizza or the special pizza, but ended up getting the special since it was so unique. I'm so glad that I did because everything came together so well and I truly have never had a bite like it. The mortadella gave the pizza just the right amount of saltiness and the pistachios brought everything together. I can't even describe the flavor you just have to go try it for yourself!

Do yourself a favor and try to get a reservation because this pizza is so good.

My friend and I are always on the hunt for the best pizza in NYC, and after trying a singular bite she claimed this was even better than Lucali's. It definetly has the most unique texture -- I don't think I've had a thinner, softer, fluffier dough base. The margherita in the pizza was impeccable, the tomatoes were so fresh. The waiters were very knowledgable in the menu and even recommended a "pizza wine" to go with our meal. They were extremely attentive and even let us try the wine before ordering. Finally, the ambiance is quite nice for a pizza restaurant -- it's not noisy at all and great for an intimate meal.

Wow is the best word I have to describe the pizza at Una Pizza! Here is a breakdown of the two pizzas we had the pleasure of tasting:

-Margherita with Pepperoni: the star of the show for both of these pizzas was the crust. It was incredibly fluffy and had great definition. I can honestly say it was the best crust I've ever tried. Each ingredient used by this restaurant is of the highest quality.

- Cossaca: this pizza really highlights the sauce as there is not really any toppings to overshadow it. This pie is very simply with sauce, basil, and a sprinkling of pecorino. The pizza was delightful because you really tasty the complexity and richness of the sauce.

Overall this place is amazing! There are a few things to note: First, it is extremely hard to get in. I had to make a reservation right when it was released and they sold out  within one minute! Two, some people might not be used to this, but they do not slice their pizza, you have to cut it yourself. I highly recommend this pizza spot, it's no wonder why they were ranked #1 pizza in the world (tied with another Italy spot). Well done!

Getting a reservation at Una can be slightly challenging but I can definitely see why everyone wants to come here for pizza. The crust on the pizza is AMAZING. I usually don't eat pizza crust but I couldn't stop myself from just carb loading. It was soft and chewy and with every bite, you can taste the quality ingredients. Una pizza definitely is more on the simplistic clean side of pizza where they don't put hoards of toppings on their pizza so it can let it's base ingredients shine. I got the margherita and the filetti. The filetti (white based) was surprisingly one of my favorite as the tomato was the star of it. The tomato was juicy, sweet, and tasted so fresh. The margherita was simple and to me, the sauce did lack a bit of flavor, but we added anchovies and it just brought the pizza to a whole nother level. The anchovies are reallly gooood.

While I did wait 20 mins or so after my reservation, I understood it was not their fault as they were waiting on people to leave. Service was also friendly. I would definitely recommend people to give it a try and I personally would come back again.

As many before me have probably said, there's a lot of hype around this place especially with all the videos about the pizza here. The man is certainly dedicated to his craft but in my opinion to a fault. The menu is definitely not trying to appeal to the masses but whatever they want to serve. I understand the need to serve a neapolitan pizza but at least offer me a few reasonable toppings not just pepperoni and some other one that i forgot. I just want some solid sausage or a mushroom or something to get on board with. In any case, the dough here is definitely special and the cheese and sauce are both  solid but didn't make a case for the best pizza in nyc in my opinion not to mention the price to value ratio. This guy is definitely just going to serve whatever he wants and to his credit people are still clamoring on resy to get in here. I probably won't be back due to the menu, lack of toppings and overall experience but good on him for working at his craft.

Pizza lived up to the hype. Looking forward to going back again and trying a different special next time. Staff was well versed with the menu and gave us a great suggestion for a wine to complement our pizza.

Being that they are open only couple days out the week, it books up really quick. When you do get a reservation you won't be disappointed. I seen them turn walk ins away because they were booked for the evening. The ambience is cute, dark and intimate. You enter and the bar area is kind of loud but then you get seated and it's quiet lol. You are only able to order 1 pie per person.

I got the margarita pie and experienced the pizza experts build it from scratch. All ingredients used to make pizza are imported. I smashed the whole pie, it was super fresh. The bread was so airy and had a nice undercarriage. I had 2 cups of red house wine and gave me a light buzz.

One of my favorite Neapolitan pizza in NY. Would certainly come again. I paid with tip $75 for margarita pie and 2 cups of red wine, normal NYC prices lol. Going back to try their Bianca pie.

The pizza is excellent and certainly as good as some of the best pizza I've had in Italy. Nothing about the flavors was disappointing to me. If you make a reservation though just know that you can only order as many pizzas as the # of people are in your party unless you give them advanced notice that you'll want to order additional. I emailed ahead that two of us would want three and it was seamless.

The menu is limited, even from an appetizer standpoint, could have been nice to have maybe one or two more options but I respected that they want to keep you focused on the main attraction.

It's also quite expensive for the size of the pizza as some others have said but I went in sort of expecting that. Each of our three pizzas was between $25-28 for what was essentially a personal pizza.

All in all, amazing pizza but for the price and the the challenge of getting a reservation it wouldn't be the first place I think to go next time I'm craving pizza but definitely worth going to at least once.

I am not a pizza expert so I won't talk about the undercarriage or the cornicione just a regular person who likes pizza ( and learned a new word - cornicione!) .   The pizza itself gets 5 stars for a Neapolitan-style pizza.  I do agree with previous reviews that this place is all about the dough.  I thought the crust was fantastic - light and flavorful.  I liked the sauce , toppings and cheese and thought this is great.  
The choice of app and dessert is so limited and not that great.   I would skip those for sure.  
So go in with the expectation that I am going to have a great neapolitan style pizza for ~$28 per person and you will be happy.

Make the reservation. Be excited and try not to read reviews. Arrive a few mins early. Notice the simple menu and order practically everything food related on it. Lament that you came down with a bug and can't really smell very well. Lament that it's one pie per customer. Admire the rule that reminds you of the soup nazi episode on Seinfeld. Admire the oven. Admire the nonchalant attitude as the pizzas are made; surely it is the mark of years of dedication and expertise and honing a craft.

Munch on mediocre appetizers and sip  very good Italian sodas.

Wait.

Wait.

Wait.

Finally! It's...

No... nope. Wait.

...1 hr later...

Pizzas.

The dough is indeed fluffy and chewy and airy. The toppings are balanced and not overpowering. And yet... rejoice in the waiter limiting you to one pie per person.

It's good but 1 hr wait worthy it is not.

Still my favorite Neapolitan pizza anywhere. Most recent visit, we got both apps (olives and beans) followed by three pies: margherita with pepperoni, filetti with long hots, and cosacca. The margherita is usually my favorite but the filetti with long hots was kind of perfect (or I should say, even more perfect than usual) -- the long hots are just so amazing here, I wouldn't want to do dinner here and not get at least one pie with them.

On the apps -- I'd get the olives again but would probably skip the beans.

We wanted to do dessert too but neither sorbet or gelato flavor really called out to us.

Although I wasn't particularly impressed with Una Pizza Napoletana when I visited years ago, its because nobody else was charging these prices for "pies" this size, and I just could not personally justify the expense. But now everyone charges the same price or higher, and it all makes perfect sense.
The flavors here are all extremely intense. I think about these pizzas for days afterward. Bread, sauce, garlic, anchovies. Yes I had to take Zyrtec beforehand and Benadryl afterward, because I am allergic to raw garlic (AND THEY USE IT VERY AGGRESSIVELY), but I was awed by the perfection. This isn't understatement or minimalism, it's definitely maximalism, but they're achieving gigantic results with the fewest possible ingredients. Bread, sauce, mozzarella, calabrian chiles. A blissful assault on the senses.
That's the reason I make follow-up reservations here while I'm still eating!

This is the best pizza I've had in New York so far. It's a different style from typical American pizza, which is obvious from the restaurant's name, and with a very restrictive menu. They clearly know what they're doing. The crust is amazing and the ingredients are carefully selected. The best one was the margherita with pepperoni added. Really incredible. The local beers are also not left behind and also give a special touch. I would definitely go back.

Price: $45 per person (tip included).

Came here 2 years ago so had to come back for the reopening! The difference is the dough here... an amazing chewy fermented perfection. Yes the topping to crust ratio is not for everyone. Definitely a spot to impress your foodie friends. Worth the hype

The bean appetizer really fell flat for us :( undercooked.

Great pizza. Service was friendly, quick, efficient and very helpful as it was our first time there. Great atmosphere but not a very large restaurant and extremely popular so reservations are recommended as we saw parties turned away that tried to walk-in. Open visibility of chefs preparing the pizza is a nice design. The crust is amazing, sauce and cheese are light but very fresh and high quality. Felt good physically after eating this pizza versus other pizza places. If you like lighter high quality pizza I'd recommend trying Una Pizza. Oh and it's voted the best pizza in the world so can't really go wrong. Well done, nice to go to a restaurant that exceeds already high expectations.

Def. The most airy pizza dough. Very friendly service as well.

Is it worth the hype? I'd say there's too much hype, but worth trying once for sure

Overall, Una is wonderful. The staff are all incredibly friendly, and service is excellent. The atmosphere is really nice, but still casual. The wine list is also phenomenal! Oh, and the food is obviously delicious.

Now, for the pizza. Yes, it's great. Is it worthy of being the best pizza in the country at the moment? Maybe, maybe not...at least for us. There are incredible elements, like the cornicione, which is so airy, has good char and chew. The texture, in short, is unreal. The sauce on the Margherita is incredible. There's a slight sweetness that would make you think he's added a sugar element, but I highly doubt it. There's just something excellent and standout about the sauce that I'm not sure I've had in a traditional San Marzano sauce. We've tried many without getting THAT flavor! I also love the mozzarella he's using. I prefer a mozz on my Neapolitan pie that holds this texture and isn't too melty or runny. All high points.

Now, as super picky pizza folks, there were some things we didn't necessarily think matched our expectations for THE top spot in the country. For a naturally-leavened dough, we tasted almost zero of the sourdough flavor we expected to find. Any subtle sourness I worry was from me searching so hard that I've made it up. We eat a ton of Neapolitan pizza (and make a ton of naturally-leavened Neapolitan) and I'm not sure there was much difference in flavor from some 2 or 3-day fermentation commercial yeast doughs. It's flavorful, just not as flavorful as we expected. Picky, I know. While the cornicione is texturally amazing, there's the issue of too much not always being better. The larger crust makes it photo-worthy, sure, but we are rarely so full from two pies. This dough absolutely crushed us like it's 300g of dough or something. Another downside of such a showcasing of the dough means the toppings on the special pie I had were overwhelmed. The sauce on the Margherita kept the ratio feeling better, but the dryer special just couldn't stand up to the dough. So, while the pizza IS amazing, being #1 means we have to examine things at a different level. The cornicione texture is probably unmatched, but in the flavor of the dough, and dough-to-toppings ratio areas, it's definitely debatable for us.

Another downside is the cost. Coming from Philly, we expect to feel a NYC cost adjustment, but at $25 for a Margherita, we're talking nearly between 66-92% increase compared to our typical Neapolitan spots. Una is DEFINITELY worth checking out, but even for freewheeling food spenders like us, there's a slight price barrier to wanting to rush back. I certainly will return, though.

So ultimately, we were happy we went, and it was a truly enjoyable experience. The fact that we left feeling a little underwhelmed stems mostly from us taking pizza far too seriously, and from grading Una on a #1-pizza-in-the-country curve. It's legit. It's great. It's beautiful. It's a lot of things. I just can't decide if it's #1 for us. Perhaps we'll return to reevaluate sooner rather than later, but you should definitely check it out and decide for yourself!

Enjoy!

Ok, I LOVE NYC/NJ pizza, and even CT style better than Naples pizza. I like the bold flavors of the cheese, the sauce, firmer undercarriage, and a more abundant layer of toppings on the NYC/NJ/CT styles. I never eat the crust though, I know some people will think that's blasphemy, but I don't like plain dough, it's a filler and the middle of the pizza is where the party's at. But... @unapizzanapoletana is number one in the world, numero uno al mondo! I wasn't hyped because it's not my favorite style of pizza, but I enjoyed the flavors, and yes, I even ate the whole crust. It was satisfying, light, fluffy, chewy, and had the perfect amount of char. The Margherita was good, but I could've used more saltiness or more garlic in the sauce, maybe more cheese, but still enjoyed it. The special pizza of the night, which rotates, was buffalo mozz DOP, spring onion, garlic, basil, Sicilian sea salt, Italian pine nuts, Provolone Del Monaco, Altamura breadcrumbs and Calabrian crushed pepper, topped with EVOO. Yes , I had to list every ingredient because it was so worth it! This pizza gave me the flavors I wanted! Garlicky, salty, cheesy and a chewy bite. I wish I could've had some EVOO on the side to dip the crust, but they don't give it out even if you ask. My guess is that @anthony_w_mangieri wants you to eat the pizza as he intended, or the only EVOO they use is too expensive to give out by request. In the beginning, I asked but wasn't allowed to order a third pie, but I was glad because I was so full by the end (they limit each customer to one pie and are limited on their dough and sell out every night). I think we chose the right pizzas, go with the classic and go with their special of the night. Although still not my preferred kind of pizza, I'd definitely come back here to try their other pies. Oh, and finish with their gelato or sorbet, the flavors also rotate, but last night's almond gelato and blood orange sorbet were out of this world. Kept going back and forth trying to decide which was better... I only took off one star because I don't love how they limit you to one pizza or do not allow you extra olive oil, but I understand...to keep their quality and their style uniquely theirs, they gotta limit, but a customer wants what a customer wants! Especially when it's good stuff...

Hey Anthony,

On occasion I've been going to watch Anthony make pizza since the east village. He was  a guy on mission. I've gone to see him in Sanfran the place wasn't busy at all. When he cam back to the LES I was one of the first people through the doors.
   
It appears now that you pretty much need a reservation as they only make so many doughs. I was turned away at 630 pm because all the dough was all sold!

I told him this is pretentious pizza and I wasn't a fan of all of the quirkiness. He responded that maybe I shouldn't go there if I was offended. Its far from the best pizza in NYC never mind the world. His dough is light an airy however it often is underwhelming some say sublime however they are wrong. What he and many like him is to have made made pizza is a sin. Pizza was to feed the poor it is every mans food. At 27 dollars for a personal pie Anthony has made pizza for the few.

If you have a minute please go and support Patsy's uptown, Difara now that Dom has passed his family needs support. Scarr's, Scar Pimental is a rock star. Roberta's they will never run out of dough. Totonno's brooklyn, any of the hundreds of fine pizzerias around Manhattan and the boroughs'. Anthony Mangieri and Una Pizza no longer need our help!!

 He has struggled to make a cohesive business since day 1.  I can never go back here. you shouldn't either. Its a joke. Anthony Mangieri / Una Pizza  che liberazione

Bomb pizza. Kinda b.s. that they're only open 3 nights a week and impossible to get a rez, but once inside the pizza is insane.

If you don't want to wait, just buy their frozen pizzas near the bar. Pretty close to the real thing

It's sad to see Yelp letting couple of ass***es letting
Their private issues being written here (with their "reviews")  and get the deserved 5 stars place go to 3.5 stars .
This place worth waiting for hours and waking up early to get the coveted reservation .
Those pizzas are pure ART!
The dough , the ingredients, the preparation.
All are top notch .
Fantastic service make the pizza even tastier.
If you are (lucky...) local or visiting ,it's a must !

Definitely A Destination!!!!

This dough was amazing!  You can tell the Pizzaiolo really put his time into it, even when it came to shaping the dough, he did it all... Unfortunately, when it came to cooking it, some other guy cooked it and we ordered a couple pizzas and you could see the inconsistency in the cooking.  Some of the bottom of the pizza were over cooked, leaving a burnt taste in my mouth. This might sound like a normal thing, but this is supposedly the number one Neapolitan style pizza in the country.  Overall good pizza and great service.

This was okay...

Great dough but that's about it. Definitely a great puffy crust. However the sauce was weak and a bit flavorless and the mozz didn't taste super fresh (as if they got some commercially made mozz balls)

I remind you that this was $25 for one pizza. Which is pretty crazy. The service was great and the staff were all very friendly (which was pleasantly surprising given all the other reviews here)

The 2 star penalty is solely for the eye popping price for one pizza

When considering the pizza, Una Pizza Napoletana has some of the best pizza in New York. However, certain attributes of the restaurant detract from the experience surrounding the best Neapolitan style pizza I've ever had.

The Neapolitan style pizza you can eat here is second to none. The crust is chewy and airy; the outer crust has a height I have never seen before. The pizzas are very simple and feature combinations of the highest quality tomato sauce, tomatoes, and buffalo mozzarella you can eat in New York. Eating pizza like this is a delight. Though make sure to eat the pizza while it's hot as the flavors and textures dull as the pizza cools.

I was fortunate enough to be introduced to Una Pizza Napoletana before the pandemic by a good friend and was devastated when the restaurant closed with no plans to reopen. However, I was delighted to learn a few weeks ago on Instagram that the restaurant was reopening. I contacted the same friend and we planned a time to revisit.

The restaurant is not without its faults. They seem to be struggling with problems associated with being closed for so long and reopening that lead to exorbitant prices, unnecessarily difficult reservations due to limited days that they are open, and limited dough/ingredients that had our waitress frantic when she thought we wanted to order 3 pizzas for the two of us. Unfortunately, our waitress messed up the toppings on my pizza, which was uncomfortable given her warning. While I left the restaurant with a smile on my face, ecstatic that I got to eat the pizza again, I was still hungry and slightly dissatisfied.

The negative reviews seem to prioritize the price over the food; I think these concerns are misplaced. I plan to return but will likely dine solo as a walk-in at the bar, eat the pizza while it's hot, and make a quick exit.

HUGE HEADS UP... Walk-ins are only allowed if reservations haven't been filled. There's no way to know if there are any openings without having to stand on line outside the establishment for a half hour. Sure, their site states that walk-ins are welcome but people have reserved their spot weeks in advance. So expect to be turned away after waiting a half hour. Hopefully you're lucky enough to score a reservation.

Overall, Una was a disappointing experience. Notwithstanding the level of hype surrounding the place, my party found the pizzas to be underwhelming -- especially after a pleasantly good experience at Lucali's the week prior (I know, very different types of pizzas, but we'll compare experience rather than the pizza vis-a-vis).

We got three pizzas -- the margarita, the marinara with parm and long hots, and the white pizza with anchovies. I won't qualm too much about the small sizes or the uncut pizza which some reviews have touched on. What was more concerning was the quality relative to the price. The pizzas lacked any depth of flavor, which places like Lucali's prove simplicity can still burst with flavor. The margarita was watery and nearing tasteless. The white pizza was sopping with oil and the anchovy was low quality (aka extremely fishy tasting rather than umami), and was an overload of pure salt.

The only pizza we somewhat enjoyed was the marinara with the parm and long hots. However, without the spice of the long hot peppers, I think the pizza would have been underwhelming as well.

Overall, it wasn't the minimalism that bothered me, but rather the lack of flavor at all -- a simple pie like this should be bright, subtly rich and comforting, which I got none of. It just felt low quality in preparation and ingredients, especially with the prices it trying to command.

This restaurant's pizza just tied with a place in Italy for the best pizza in the world. In the world! Look it up. The pizza is certainly not conventional NY pizzeria pizza. The dough is softer and sweeter. It also happens to be delicious, but what really makes this pizza outstanding is the toppings. Simple. Elegant. Ultra high quality. The mozzarella is soft and deep. The Sicilian sea salt adds so much to the flavor that I'm literally salvating as I write this.

I read in other reviews that the appetizers are limited. That is true as there are only two. We had both. They were flawless. I don't like olives and yet I ate at least fifteen of the marinated olives. The lupini bean salad was, as my wife just put it, so ####ing good. You don't need other appetizers.

Believe it or not, the best thing at this restaurant is dessert. Again, there were only two. Again, we had both. Gavones. The gelato would put any place in Little Italy to shame, but the star, the really big star, is the sorbetto. The house made lemon sorbetto that we were served may be the best thing I've ever put in my mouth. It was to die for.

All in all, if you can get in to this restaurant, Go!

I really enjoy coming here as the service is great and the decor is more of a change of pace of what a "normal" pizza joint would look like.  The Neapolitan pizzas pack a variety of flavor but there are other hidden gems on the menu so be sure to get more than just a few pies.  A fair amount of seating and some bar style seating too but place gets packed.  This place is among my favorites in the City and I would highly recommend.

We've had great pizza throughout New York, the U.S. and Italy.  This was definitely the best pizza or at least one of the best pizzas ever.

The pizzas are made Neapolitan or Naples style.  We had the Bianca pizza and the Margherita Pizza with Pepperoni.  The later of the two is a popular pizza that most people order.  There's also a daily speciality pizza that changes each day or so.  I'd suggest ordering one pizza per person.  The dough and crust are amazing.  The staff said that the dough is made first thing in the morning and only a certain amount is made each day.  

We met Anthony, the owner and chef, who also appears in the Showtime  series "Billions".  If you watch "Billions", then you know that the show runners pick great restaurants including Una Pizza to showcase.  For fans of the show, then you must try Una Pizza.

If you're in New York and the LES, then I'd highly recommend you try Una Pizza. It may be the best pizza you've ever eaten.

The pizza is good but our server completely forgot to ring in our appetizer. I asked about it 3/4 through our pizzas. We were done eating and the server drops our cold, pre made appetizer in front of us.... Lmao... what????

Neapolitan spots don't get much better than this! This place has been my go-to for years and I can't say enough how much it rules. They clearly know what they're doing, the dough is softer and sweeter. It also happens to be delicious, but what really makes this pizza outstanding is the toppings. Simple. Check out the other spot on the jersey shore too. Top notch.

No diet soda
No salt available for guests
**** I like things saltier than most people. I'm not asking the restaurant to serve the food differently, just please make salt (and other standard pizza fixings) available.

Will only serve a single espresso.  I ordered 2 and dumped one in the other cup.

They told us they wanted the table back after we had dessert.  We got up and stood off to the side/out of the way.
Then, they told us to stand by the hostess when we were waiting for someone to pee.

The pizza is absolutely delicious.
The dessert (gelato) was also delicious.
I found the service to be unacceptable.

I have literally never been more disappointed by a restaurant... This is supposed to be the world's best pizza but it had basically no taste! I was shocked at how bad it was. It isn't that I don't like this style of pizza - I was in Naples last month and had amazing Neapolitan pizza. Don't bother going here and it definitely isn't worth spending anytime to get a reservation. The burrata and bean appetizers and the sorbet and gelato were very good but not good enough to warrant a trip on their own.

I'm not sure how many star to give them, because the place is beautiful, the staff are so nice, I loved that they have this Italian sodas, you can tell they take care of all the details, we order the Margarita and the special, both pizzas where delicious, the sauce for both where great the sauce on the special was amazing, great ingredientes, my problem is the crust vs topping ratio was huge, I only have like 5 bites in total with toppings, and the rest was amazing crust but just crust, it was a lot of just crust, you get amazing ingredientes but to much crust, I'm not sure if I will like to come back, because delicious ingredients but to much crust. I understand that the crust of the napolitana most be big and like a pillow but it was to much, like 80% crust, 20% toppings, I need it a little more, maybe 30% toppings will be ok but a little bit more of the amazing toppings they have. Maybe you can ask for extra sauce and cheese and pay more? Because it is so good.

Unmatched Napoletana style pizza. Incredible service and great atmosphere. The hype is well-deserved. The best dough & crust I've ever had...and I've been to most of the top pizza spots in the US & beyond.

Think I must have come on an off night. Service was really slow, and it took more than 20 minutes after our reservation time for us to be seated. Pizza took over an hour, the crust came out floppy/soggy, and the taste/texture wasn't great. A very mediocre experience. Given the prices and effort to get a reservation, I would recommend looking elsewhere.
The best of the best as they say in NYC!great Father's Day dinner with my daughter!!  I want to go back.

This place is definitely overhyped. Pizza is a very subjective, and sometimes religious experience, so I get that some people love it. The dough is good. But for me, the dough is a platform to bring everything else together. Here, the dough is the star, and everything else is sparse or non-existent. And my personal preference is a crust that is slightly thinner and less chewy. It may be the best pizza in LES, but in NYC it's a far stretch.

I try not to post bad reviews especially if I haven't eaten at a restaurant, but I want to make sure no one else wastes their time like I did. Don't bother coming here unless you made a reservation.  Their Resy page says walk-ins are always welcome.  I arrived around 540 to put my name down for a table assuming there would be a wait. I was told while they technically had tables available, they only had enough dough for their reservations.

This review is for the pizza only.

As far as pizza, Una Pizza Napoletana gets everything right:
The pie is thin and chewy with a beautiful spotted pattern.
The tomato sauce is one of the best I've ever had, with a wonderful balance of sweetness and acidity, and the perfect consistency.
The buffalo mozzarella is absolutely delicious.

Why just 3 stars, then?

Well, for starters there are only 5 pies available[1] on weekdays. Of them, none have any meat topping, and the other ones are just combinations of buffalo mozzarella, smoked mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, and arugula. I found that a bit disappointing, to be honest, and a bit of a waste of a truly wonderful pizza oven.
I guess one could always order a plate of cold cuts[2] and add them to a pie, but still...
They have the Concetta pie[3] on Fridays, and the Apollonia[4] on Saturday; no special pies.

Then, at $22 a pie, this may well be the most expensive Margherita pie I've ever had. Was it delicious? Yes, absolutely; one of the best I've ever had. Was it worth $22? Well, that's debatable.

The other pie I had was the Filetti, a white pie with cherry tomatoes. Another great pie... at $23, though.

The drinks menus (yes, plural) are interesting, with a separate menu for just Spritzes, one for beers, and one for wine. The wine menu is very extensive, with lots of orange wine varieties.

Overall I really liked the pizza here, and the ambiance is modern, simple, and welcoming.

Still, $44 for a pizza and a can of beer...?!
--------------------------
[1] 4 if we exclude the marinara, which is just a Margherita without mozzarella and with oregano.

[2] They have soppressata on the menu, and they cut it fresh.

[3] It features 4 different varieties of tomatoes prepared four different ways.

[4] With parmigiano, egg, and salame.

Oh how I've missed having Una Pizza in SF! Of course, within 3 hours of landing in NYC, I had to come here. I just wish I had known they have two additional pizzas that are only served on Friday or Saturday!

RESERVATIONS: Made online about four weeks in advance for a Wednesday night at 8pm for four.

SERVICE: Our server was a natural, really friendly and easy going, with a loud booming voice that was handy in a noisy restaurant. He told us at the start that he was training a server who would basically be handling the meal from then on, but most of our interaction ended up being with the main server.

They came back several times as we were trying to decide what to get, then it turns out we had a surprise 4th guest (my father-in-law invited a family friend in secret to surprise us!), so on our servers' third trip to our table when we thought we actually were going to order, the whole thing got up ended again! They were very nice and patient though.

MUST-HAVES: Marinated White Anchovy, any pizza, ice cream.
See my photos for additional details.

The woman who said it's pretentious is insane. It's the best pizza I've eaten. It's like Keens steakhouse. Amazing ingredients and I'll be back many times. The deserts are amazing too. Cheers Anthony and my friend Shane! Simply the best.

I know I know, you're paying $20+ for a small pizza but you have to admit, is there a better Neapolitan style pizza around?

WAIT: Came on a Saturday night around 7pm and there were no tables for a group of 2 (I recommend making reservations in advance) so we had to sit at the bar.  It's not bad except for the fact that you're near the door on a cold night.

ATMOSPHERE: Definitely digging the atmosphere. Very clean, minimalist with lots of white and steel.  I would definitely suggest taking friends here or going here on a date because of the low lighting and romantic feels.  There is also a huge pizza oven with glass surrounding the person making the pizza so you can watch them.

FOOD: Being cheapos we only got 1 pizza to share between the 2 of us.  It's definitely enough for 1 person and for 2 it's stretching it a bit but we made do.

MARGHERITA PIZZA - the classic, at around $22 for a pizza that probably has about 4 large slices or 6 small slices. It actually does not come sliced so you have to cut it yourself.  The dough is amazing, it's the perfect neopolitan dough with bubbles, soft, chewy and pillowy.  It is a bit "soggy" in the middle because it comes out piping hot and the ingredients did fall off when trying to take a slice but that's expected.  The sauce is very tangy, I think the types of tomatoes they use have more of a tang to them, which was nice.  The cheese seems a bit scarce but it was fine.  One thing I wish was that there was more basil, it seemed too skimpy!  Overall though, I enjoyed my pizza.

Overall, if you are a fan of Neapolitan pizza and are looking for a nice night out and are willing to spend a bit, then this is definitely worth trying..at least once.

GET THE GELATO. Tough deciding between 3-4 stars but gave it the benefit of the doubt because the gelato/cannolis were that good. Wait times between pizzas were long (30 minutes between each, ordered 2 pizzas), prices are expensive, and took 20-30 minutes to be seated for a reservation. Pizzas are definitely good, crust is doughy and delicious and ingredients are fresh but there's definitely equally as good places with less of a wait
with better prices. But damn, gelato was really good.

This was our first time at Una. Very nice staff and interior is modern and clean, with most tables able to view the pizza being prepped and baked in the impressively sized oven. We ordered the margarita and that night's special Bianca pizza. Got the long hots added to mine. Pizzas arrived in about 20 min directly out of the oven. Like other reviews, wonderfully bready crust and flavorful topping. I loved the delicate tomato sauce on mine. The hots were indeed spicy hot but tasty. Like others mention, center of pizza soggy so I would just fold it over the more rigid crust and enjoy. My suggestion to chef is to perhaps have a few small thin rounds of baked crust to place in middle of uncooked dough onto which place toppings. Anyone who goes and does their homework must know the pizzas are pricey for their size so no surprise to us.

This pepperoni square pizza and garlic knots (sadly not pictured) are the best I've ever had!

The thick pepperoni slice and even spread of cheese and tomato sauce make the perfect bite - in my books, this trumps Prince St Pizza, which often has its bad days with cold, limpy pizza with the cheese separating from the sauce.

But the true winner is the garlic knots - truly a bomb of flavor with the amount of garlic used (which I love!) and not too doughy but perfectly moist and chewy and springy in texture.

Solid drunk pizza spot. Good for late night. Large variety of slices.

The pepperoni is spicy & delicious. Pepperonis are perfectly crisped.

Pro tip: they have ranch!!!

Decent pizza, but would not brag home about it like they do throughout the store. The pizza is loaded w pepperonis, but the general taste of the dough and rest of the pizza just wasn't that great.  

It did take a long time for the person there to come take our order which was disappointing considering we were the only people in the restaurant.

The guys at the liquor store, next door, told us to check out Uncle Sam's pizza stating they had the best square pepperoni pizza. We grabbed a slice at 10pm and were not disappointed. The staff is fun. They sing in the back while warming up the pizza. It's a great small shop to pick up a slice.
I had a slice of their spicy pepperoni and did not see the appeal for $6. While it was loaded with pepperoni, overall the pizza was greasy and bland.

I had a great time at Uncle Sam's pizza today. I came by on a lunch break from a work training I was attending around the corner. The door was ajar so I went in. It didn't seem to be open yet based on the fact that there was no food behind the display glass. However, the owner warmly greeted me and asked how was I doing and what I wanted to eat. I told him I wanted a plain slice and he informed me that there were Sicilian slices fresh out of the oven but if I wanted a plain slice, there'd be a wait. I decided to go with the Sicilian slice and it was a good choice! The pizza was fresh, hot, and crispy around the edges--just how I like it!!!

We even chatted for a bit seeing as how I was the only customer there at the time. We spoke about our nationalities, and I shared the tiny bit of Arabic I knew with him, since he told me that he's from Egypt and speaks that language. It was a pleasant experience at Uncle Sam's. It's a quaint, unassuming pizzeria in a super bougie neighborhood (Lower East Side) but he made me feel right at home!

Thanks for having me, Uncle Sam! Look forward to being back soon.
Delicious slices, some of my favorites in NYC.
Service was quick, the vodka slices were super filling and generous. I came here late night with my beautiful partner and we both had some good pizza. The garlic nots are very salty.

It's just ok.  

Place is not much to look at inside but they do have outside seating.  

I got a plain and a grandma to go.  Man working there wasn't friendly but it's a to go order so whatever.  Pizza came out not piping hot. Ehh.  

Regular slice :

Crust 4/5
Cheese 3/5
Sauce 3/5.

Crust was pretty good.  Crispy and had an airy crust.  But tasteless.

Cheese.  Had no pull.  Wasn't a fan.

Sauce : bland but not bad.

Grandma slice :

If it was hotter I'd love it.  

Sauce was good.  Not too spicy or salty nor too sweet

Cheese. It's mozzarella. Nuf said.

Crust was decent but also not flavorful.

I'd come here again if it's the only place opened bc they do open until late.  

Prices are standard LES slice price.
Got a grandma's slice. Very taste.  Hope they stick around, I've seen too many come and go.

Just ordered 2 eggplant slices and 2 reg slices. The guy working the counter was rude to every female I watched enter the place myself included. Meanwhile all the men that entered were calmly and patiently spoken to.This woman came in after me and my gf, went to order, he rudely asked what she wanted and she walked out and told her guy friend to order for her.
Always eat pizza here, never seen or been approached this way here. Ambiance and service needs improvement. Took the slices 3 blocks and reheated

So I was walking by and saw all these articles and notes about this being the "best pizza" and I gave it a try. Honestly the guy that greeted me what nice but I wasn't impressed with the food. The pizza was bland to me I might give it another try.
$5.50 for a spicy pepperoni pizza. Perfect ratio of crust, sauce and cheese. The pepperoni bowls are delicious and not too salty. A satisfying slice that meets NYC pizza standards.

Uncle Sam's pizza has been one of my highlights of the time I've spent in the East Village. Phillip is always so kind and cheery! Not to mention each slice is delicious - Especially late at night after a fun time out !!!
You know that late night slice you're always craving?  Their square pepperoni will always answer that call.

Excellent pizza and GREAT garlic knots!

No where to sit inside or outside though

Not many options as far as slices, but every slice looks fresh and delicious!!!
The Pepperoni Square is absolutely amazing, do not miss this treasure. Staff were tremendously friendly and went above and beyond
Great pizza and very nice staff! And a very funny robot that the kid I nanny loves! !
I come here for lunch almost everyday. you have to try their slices! they are delicious!
Everything is amazing! The food is amazing and the service was even better. 10/10 (especially the Buffalo chicken :)) must try

Perfect for a late night snack after drinking in LES. Just around the corner from Subject and down the block from Garfunkel's.

I loved the Sicilian deep dish pepperoni. They are incredibly generous with the meat, so it's a great value (around $5). Plenty of cheese and pepper topping options.

Limited seating and ambience is meh, so it's really best for delivery, take-out, or a quick bite.

Honestly you walk by and don't think much about it, but if you should choose to walk in, swear you'll be quite pleased.

Pepperoni is fire, vodka pizza is noice, and the staff is cool.

Come through
Amazing pizza, isn't that enough said? Honestly you in the area have a slice.small shop but delicious.

New York has the best pizza, right? Not necessarily. This was okay but really the kind of slice one could step at a highway-stop pizza shop, not the kind one would anticipate in one of the pizza capitals of the world.

Classic thin crust with those quality pepperoni's that curl at the edges into little bowls! Their sausage is also delicious (crumbled, not sliced). Their vodka slice is also strong. I'd come back any time.
It is an excellent and underappreciated pizzeria. If you go there, make sure to try the spicy pepperoni!

Another 5 stars because we went one last time as promised in my last review and again, Uncle Sam's did not disappoint. DELICIOUS pizza!!!!! The round pies are large enough for a good group so it is well worth the money. I ordered the regular cheese, the vodka sauce again, spinach, and pepperoni-- all DELICIOUS!
So happy I came across this place after a comedy show at Caveat, it's a great selection of classic and non-traditional slices and the staff is friendly. Garlic knots were packed with flavor, too.
This spot has some great pizza options both square and round pies! Highly recommend the vodka slice and the pepperoni! The bbq chicken is also fantastic! Must try spot for sure!
Got to post in LES, if I'm nearby I have to stop here. Workers are super chill as well, always love a good chat. Ting
This is the BEST pizza in Manhattan. Hands down. Not only is the pizza amazing, but the service.... Wow. Blown away. Love this place so much. Also the pizza is AMAZING.
One of the best pizzas in New York! Would recommend to anyone who lives in the East Village.
amazing experience, the spicy pepperoni is maybe the best pizza i've had in the lower east side - definitely a must visit !!
There's a lot of disagreements over where to find the best pizza in NYC. For me, it's here. Give it a go, they're so worth it.
Customer service was amazing and the pizza was flavorful! The place stays open till late so that's a plus too!
Passed by cause I wanted a quick slice before I go to work & WOW! the greatest vodka slice I ever had, no joke! They have different slices that I also want to try so I'll definitely be going back!!
It was a really good just easy greasy pizza. Nothing crazy just good pizza. If you're on the go and want a good slice just stop by.

The worst new york slice i've had so far. bottom was warm and crunchy but the top is ice cold toppings, cheese, and water between the cheese and bread. Only has good ratings since they have a sign for a free cheese slice for a five star rating. Aint no way i come back

I was having a late night drink with a beautiful lady next door to this location and decided to walk in.  I speak a little bit of Egyptian dialect Arabic and was delightfully surprised to hear some of it spoken inside. The guys working were very jovial and made some great recommendations on what sliced to get. It was a wonderful experience and Donato will be back again! 5 stars!
Some of the best pizza in New York. I love this place so much it's the best. My favorite food. Yeah
Uncle sams is the best pizza in New York City no argument. My fave pizza. I get this pizza almost every night with my roommate.  We live for it.

I have ordered delivery from here several times, ordering different pizzas each time.

The pizza always arrives quickly and still hot; the prices are reasonable and the quality is amazing. I have had a lot of pizzas in the city, and Uncle Sam's is up there on my list of top pizzerias. There is always ample cheese and sauce on their pizzas (but never too much either) -- and I am surprisingly in love with the dough / crust! It's not super thin, but it's thin enough and it also means that the pizza is well supported and doesn't just fall apart.

Finally, I'd be remiss if I did not mention the amazing service and kindness of the staff here. They are responsive, accommodating, and clearly interested in serving their customers -- something I unfortunately can't say about a lot of joints in the City.

TLDR: It's amazingly good pizza at a reasonable price coming from a staff with customer service in mind. So happy this small business opened up!
Love this place! Gave it a shot when walking by. Pizza was delish and everyone who worked there was extremely friendly. Would recommend!
Obsessed with the pizza here. It is incredibly good. My favorites are the vodka and grandma square slices. Truly some of the best pizza I've had in NYC. Highly recommend it.

Without a doubt some of the very best pizza in NYC. both Detroit style and New York style slices are one of a kind - extremely flavorful sauces and toppings, with crunchy yet satisfying doughs. I'm a regular here and they never disappoint. Highly recommend!

I love Uncle Sam's Pizza! The pepperoni is my favorite. Don't be afraid to ask for extra barbecue sauce on your bbq chicken pizza -- they are nice and generous with the sauce if you want more. Super flavors and delicious crust.

With all the great ratings we were so excited for this pizza. We ordered delivery to a bar 2 blocks away while watching the game. We got slices- 2 slices of the spicy pepperoni, 1 slice of grandma and 1 slice of bbq chicken. We also ordered wings in hot sauce. The wings came dry, not coated in any sauce at all. The spicy pepperoni pizza was terrible. The crust was ridiculously hard it was clearly over cooked. The bbq chicken and grandma were also not great at all. Very very disappointed in this place. Would not recommend.
Stopped here after a wedding. Amazing pizza, amazing people, and amazing service. Their pizza is delicious, greasy in a good way, authentic NYC pizza.
Amazing pizza, and an amazing owner! Got way more garlic knots than asked for and we loved it!

I don't love the pizza here - the crust is not doughy enough and the sauce is too sweet. I like the garlic knots but I never feel like it comes with enough marinara sauce. I know this place is new so hopefully it improves over time as the service here is great and it has the makings of a great late night LES pizza spot.

I finally had the chance to stop by Upstate and it was well worth the wait! Initially, my plan was to have oysters and go home. I took a seat at the bar just after they opened. Their $12 special for a half dozen oysters and a beer (or wine for +$4) is a good deal. The oysters available for HH are bolded on a list of their other whole oyster selection. I went with 2 of each of the 3 on special and a glass of vinho verde. The oysters were fresh and briny.

As I sat at the bar listening to their great Pandora selections, I looked at the rest of the menu and decided to stay a little longer. Many things caught my eye, ensuring a future return, but the scallops of the day captured my heart. They were served atop a bed of sauteed spinach and a carrot puree, with prosciutto butter sauce. When I say amazing...I mean it. I could eat the puree in a bowl by itself. The scallops were cooked to perfection. Nicely seasoned and a perfect sear. Spinach is not my favorite vegetable but it was prepared very well here, where it wasn't mushy as spinach can be. The whole dish was just so good. And very reasonably priced, as my entree was $21. I'm looking forward to going back to try more of the menu!

Oysters and beer were really really good! The happy hour is great and the service was fantastic - super friendly and efficient.

The escargot was also good - not the best I've ever had, but definitely really tasty and enjoyable.

Excited to try more on the menu as their seafood is super fresh

Always outstanding! We frequent this little gem and it never disappoints. Oysters are the best, definitely try their happy hour, 6 oysters and a draft beer for $12.

The food is all cooked to perfection, try the tuna, it's to die for, charred to perfection every time!  And their tartare is amazing.

Was having a girls night Saturday night and was craving some oysters. I've had my eye on this spot for the longest and finally got to come here. Honestly would say one of the best oyster spots in Manhattan!

I ordered the escargot (snails) and oysters. Never had snails before and it tasted amazing. It was dipped in an olive oil/basil base which gave it great flavor. The type of oysters I had were recommended to me by the server and they were very delicious.

Service and staff was very sweet to us and even offered free bread and dessert for us to snack on.

The place can get lively and booked so PLEASE get a reservation to be safe. I would definitely come back here very soon and try many other things here. Amazing!  :)

Coming in for happy hour on a weekday provides the perfect amount of ambiance but nothing too loud or crazy. There's a nice dimly lit little bar area, high-top tables, 2-4 person tables, and space outside if the weather's nice (and those food sheds are your thing).

Happy hour goes past six, which is much appreciated. The option is for six oysters and then either beer for $12 or wine for $16. The oysters available as part of the special are from MD (Chesapeake Bay) and VA. My friend and I split the oysters and got individual beers, from which they have a large selection ranging from chocolatey to fruity hints. This was definitely worth the price for me. Also, our waitress was great and gave us a few beers to sample to help us decide.

I got lucky as this first time ever trying oysters. My friend walked me through the tutorial due to me not being able to properly eat it in one go. While I'm still debating whether I liked the taste or not, I think the restaurant did everything right. The three dipping sauces were great, I especially liked the garlic butter one.  

I wish they had more things on the menu that weren't seafood based as I didn't want to have two seafood-based things at once. Also, I was still hungry post oysters, because while it's fun to play with your food it's not too filling. It is a great place for an app and some drinks. Complimentary whiskey bread at the end is also a fun surprise

Great oyster and beer happy hour deal!!

The happy hour was $12 - 6 oysters and a beer (or wine they said). The meat on the oyster was on the smaller side, but they order fresh from the market each day. There is no freezer at the restaurant!!

The surf and turf was very solid. The steak was juicy. I had asked for medium, but some pieces were a little rare. There were also some potatoes that were perfectly crispy, but was not consistent throughout.

My friend said the bone marrow was too oily for her and definitely need more bread to go with it. I told her bone marrow is naturally rich and fatty, but she said it was even more so than usual.

The service was good. Our waiter was attentive with water, but hard to catch him sometimes, though all the tables were filled.

This definitely is a great place to eat casually. Being outside was fantastic as it was a perfectly sunny day!
The happy hour deals are great. $12 beer and 6 oysters. They also have good specials prices. Cute vibe

Solid 3.5 stars - I came for their oysters and ordered 2 of each off the menu

CONS
- A majority of my oysters were small. I only had maybe 10 large ones out of 24
- Service was poor, waiter was not attentive and did not provide recommendations for the menu
- Because I ordered two of each. It was not very clear on where the oysters started in correlation to the menu, which defeated the purpose of the tasting, because my partner and I were not sure if we were trying the same oysters at the same time

Came here for the happy hour which was $12 for 6 oysters and a beer. They had a selection of 3 different oysters that we could choose from so we tried all three. The three oysters we could choose from were nandua creeks from virginia, orient pearls from north fork, and malpeque from prince edward island. The service was pretty good and our waitress came to get our table as soon as we finished. The oysters were not bad and the beer selection was also solid. It was an extra $4 if you wanted wine instead of beer. At the end, they gave us some complementary whiskey infused cake, which I also enjoyed.

We came here for Happy Hour, so my review doesn't have an expansive view of the whole menu.

On the oyster menu, the choices that were in bold indicated what was available for Happy Hour.  Any 6 oysters in bold and a draft beer runs you $12.  

Oysters were fresh and delicious; all the oysters on the menu reign from somewhere in the north east.  The draft beer list had good varying selection of different types of beers.

Other reviews were picking at the service, but I thought the service was fine when we went.

I'll come back here.
We've been back twice since our initial review - both times on a weeknight. The food and service were incredible! Some of the best oysters I've ever had and the Marlin and Scallops were also Devine!

Arrived around 4:40pm on a saturday for the happy hour deal, by 5pm there were a lot of people waiting. $15 for 6 oysters and a wine is a very good deal. We also ordered the escargot. It didnt have much flavor to it. The oysters did take a while to come out as well. Not sure what the inside looked like but the outdoor seating is great on a nice day.

I always saw people post upstate oyster bar and I would crave oysters, so I decided to invite my friends and go for happy hour. It was a disappointing experience.

1) There was no option of having 1 dozen oysters, the waitress gave us a list of oysters and it had random names on it, I asked her what each name meant and she said "I have no idea." Great. I decided to order 1 of each on the list so that was about 14 oysters, when she brought out the oysters, I clearly counted only 12, so I asked her which one she was missing, once again, she had no clue. The oysters themselves were decent but again, I had no clue what I was eating!

2) The bone marrow scallop dish was good, but the portions were really small for that price. However, if you had to get something here, I would suggest the bone marrow dish. The scallops could be salted a bit more.

3) The squid ink pasta with sea urchin - absolute disappointment. It was flavorless, the sea urchin wasn't fresh and the portion was extremely small.

Overall food is about 4/10 and service was 2/10. Would not recommend visiting this place!

Always outstanding! We frequent this little gem and it never disappoints. Oysters are the best, definitely try their happy hour, 6 oysters and a draft beer for $12.
The food is all cooked to perfection, try the tuna, it's to die for, charred to perfection every time!

And their tartare is amazing.

Big fan of this place! This was my second time coming here. We got a dozen oysters, which were all super fresh. I also got the rainbow trout / gnocchi and I was really pleasantly surprised by how good it was! We sat at the bar, and the service was great, our waiter was super friendly and attentive.

Upstate never fails to disappoint. They have a fun happy hour deal of $12 for beer + half dozen oysters. Their seafood is fresh and prepared super well. My family and I enjoyed their fish of the day, which was cod served with roasted zucchini, their scallops of the day, which was served over greens and carrot purée, the squid ink pasta with uni, and their roasted trout with gnocchi. We thought each dish was unique and delicious. Can't wait to return!

We've eaten at Upstate twice on two different trips to NYC in 2019 and 2022.  We're planning to return to NY this year, and Upstate is on our short must-return-to list.  It feels like a casual neighborhood restaurant, but the quality of the seafood and inventiveness of the dishes sets it apart.  We generally order a few items then add as we see things pass by the table that look good, and they're fine with that.  Service is outstanding, including wine and beer suggestions.  My only ding is that it's kind of dark and kind of loud, but you stop noticing that once you start eating.  Love this place!

Came with a reservation for 2 on a Saturday evening and was sat outdoors.

Clam fettuccine- the pasta was quite dry and lacking flavor, but the clams were meaty/juicy and carried the flavor in this dish

Shark & shrimp mash- a new item on the menu. Never had shark before so was curious to try it. The shark was flaky but didn't have much taste, I'd recommend squeezing the half lemon to give that extra zing/acidity. The shrimp mash was so good & buttery accompanied by baby shrimp with each bite. Pretty balanced dish with the asparagus included.

They gave us a complimentary slice of whiskey cake at the end which was nice. The cake tasted more like pound cake with a whiskey brush, but nonetheless still good.

Waiters were attentive and came to check on us periodically. Only thing with outdoor seating is that it's quite noisy with the cars going by.

I went to this place for happy hour and arrived at 5:05 hoping to sit at the bar. However, the hostess informed me that I needed my husband, who was running about 15 minutes late, to be present before I could be seated and asked me to wait outside. Additionally, I was told that I must leave by 6:15pm.

Sensing the situation, I immediately booked a 5:15pm slot, considering the restaurant was completely empty and slots were readily available every 15 minutes. When I returned and mentioned my reservation, the hostess inquired if I would like to order before my husband arrived, which was my intention for happy hour anyway. Eventually, she ALLOWED me to enter.

Interestingly, ten minutes later, two white gentlemen walked in without any hindrance or questions. While I adore this place for its food and happy hour offerings, the actions of one person completely marred my experience. What a shame..
Went in for the happy hour ( one of the BEST in E-Village ..... ) have dinner here EVERY week ... great service ..... grrreeeat menu..!
One of my favorite restaurants in NYC. Everything I've tried here is good, but I especially love their fettuccine and clams. Highly recommend for affordable, high-quality seafood!

They overbooked people and we ended up waiting over half an hour despite arriving earlier than our reservation time. Our reservation was at 6:15pm, and they sat us down at 6:40. Service is also very slow, its been another 30 mins since we placed the order, we're still waiting for our food as I'm writing this review.

Update:
The server for our table was very disrespectful. He told my friend to "put your hand down" as if she's a child and then walked away to get water when we were merely hoping to get his attention to order food. Not sure if it's because we're three small Asian ladies because he didn't treat the two tables next to us with the same level of disrespect.

Although the food was okay (the escargot was flavorless but the oysters, squid ink pasta, and the scallop w/ carrot purée were decent), we would never return to this place again and would advise others to avoid it because there's just so many other restaurants with much better service and food in this neighborhood.

Came here for happy hour and it was such a fun time. $12 for 6 oysters+beer?! You can't beat that. The service was great and the oysters were tasty. I recommend making a reservation since they are a small place and do fill up quickly

Although the portions are small for the price, the food is extraordinarily good. The service is great, and I regret not getting the oysters. The ravioli was cold on the outside (bleaugh), but the crab was very fresh inside.
The other dish was very exceptional.
Will definitely be back for the happy hour!

This spot has a great deal for happy hour - $12 for 6 oysters and a beer, and they have happy hour every day!!

The ambiance is great here; super lively and you can people watch if you sit facing outside. The service was great. I would def like to try their other dishes next time I come back; everything sounds amazing.

Although the portions are small for the price the food is extraordinarily good. The service is great, and I regret not getting the oysters. The ravioli was cold on the outside (bleaugh), but the crab was very fresh inside. The other dish was very exceptional. Will definitely be back for the happy hour!

Consistently great service and food is always fresh. You can't beat their $12 oysters and beer happy hour -- truly a gem. Make a reservation or come right at open time (5pm).

We also tried the escargot... tasty but wouldn't order again. The crab cakes, however, were fantastic. The salad bed has a nice sweet chili dressing that complements the dish nicely.

I came here tonight bc of the fantastic reviews and was surprised when they didn't have any reservations so I snagged one on Yelp. Should have known why there is so little demand. It's terrible. Oyster selection is ok.  I had a selection of 4 and the clams. Briny but their accompanying sauces lacked the finnese I usually look for (eg the horseradish is flavorless and packs none of the heat it should). Then I had the burrata with crab ravioli and the squid ink pasta with uni. First, the Burrata with crab ravioli came out within a few min of ordering. The pasta on the crab ravioli was cold, hard... it was gross, like eating uncooked ravioli straight out of the freezer.

Then the squid ink uni. The uni was brown, slimy, and not fresh, none of the sweet delicate taste I was looking for. This place touts itself on not having a freezer but maybe they should have one to keep their seafood fresher and sell better food over a gimmick. The pasta sauce was too sour, which was unpleasant. All around inedible.

Additionally, the service was dismissive and inattentive. I sat for a while before anyone came to fill my water or take my order. Waitress never came to check in on me and hardly spoke 10 words to me. After telling me he'd get me a fresh plate after the oysters and Burrata appetizer, the busser never came so I just used my small plate the whole time, with the uneaten frozen ravioli still there.

Also, like caught Mahi mahi from Hawaii? Y'all are crazy if you think that's unfrozen. It's frozen previously then thawed.

The last straw for me was that the bathroom was unkempt and dirty. The garbage can was overflowing and there was urine on the floor and the seat.

I will never come back here.

The ambiance is fantastic. We had the pleasure of sitting outside on the sidewalk cafe on a beautiful evening. It did however start raining on the plastic roof, which subsequently started raining. Luckily there was a vacant table across the aisle and we were able to relocate and the server was pretty accommodating.

The food was pretty good. This coming from a person who travels to many different cities and eats at many different restaurants. If you're looking for something quick and tasty, this place won't disappoint.

In order of what we got:
Oysters:
they were good sized , fresh and tasty. We had 3 different types one sweet, one briny and one as a combination. Naked cowboy, blue whale and I can't remember the 3rd.
Tuna tartar:
I felt like there was not enough tuna and too much bell peppers. The portion was good but the ratio was all off, especially when at the end you're cust getting mouthfuls of peppers and not tuna. Flavor was good otherwise and prep and presentation was good.
Escargot:
this one I was meh about. It was fine. Not too much flavor, nice prep and presentation.
Marlin crudo with caviar:
this was by far my favorite dish. It def left me wanting more. The texture/flavors were fresh and rich.
Fettuccini with clams:
This was ok. I really felt like this was a missed opportunity though. The presentation was a fail. Too much pasta and the clams came on too so I had to manually separate the clams from the shells and by the time you get a bite together of some pasta, a piece of clam and some sauce, you've already made a mess of the plate and the foods cooled off. The flavors were good tho.

The one thing however I am disappointed is this:
The cocktail menu was too light. It lacked substance. So I  asked for a "bartenders choice". The server hemmed and hawed and said they didn't have a full bar etc. I asked about watermelon and he said they didn't have that but watermelon is one of the ingredients for a drink on the menu. So yea not very helpful.

THE hangout spot for oyster-lovers! Great happy hour deals, $12 for 6 oysters (3-types to choose from) + beer; $19 for wine. I came with a party of 4 and tried the rose and vesper martini -- solid options. Drinks paired well with the food we ordered. I got the bone marrow with baby scallops and the flavors were excellent. Squid ink pasta was also really good. A lot of other guests ordered it, assuming its a fan favorite. Portion-size is decent but definitely the type where you can use a bit more food/snack after a solid hour or two of chatting.

I usually have a hard time finding good crab crakes but its pretty well-made here. Moist but won't fall apart if you break it into smaller bite-size pieces (they come in twos). Not a fan of the tuna tartare. There was a minty aftertaste and the overall bite had a very fishy (not fresh) taste that kind of just sat on my tongue and was hard to get rid of. Not sure if its suppose to taste like that or I'm just not a fan of the combination. Overall atmosphere of the place was great!! 8/10 recommend!

A little east village gem. A great spot during the summer months for a crisp glass of wine or a cold beer with some seafood. Very unique and interesting menu. The burrata with cold crab ravioli was very good, I haven't had anything like that. The uni pasta was good too but the steak i would skip next time. Great vibes!

UCBOB is simply reliable. The menu is short and simple but it does not miss. The beer selection rotates frequently and the food is consistently excellent. Plus, it's cozy, cool, the service is great, and reservations online are a breeze.

It has earned my trust so much, l recently brought my very-allergic-to-shellfish friend here for dinner. (Relax, his wife is a doctor; we had an epipen; no one's life was endangered).

Though he seemed skeptical at first, two bites into his Surf and Turf (he substituted a portion of the salmon for the prawns), he was won over. His wife told us that the Fettucine with Clams was the best she's had in New York. By the end of the meal, we all full stomachs and pictures of three different beers on our phones to look up later. I'd call that a smashing success.

In case you're undecided, I'll also recommend the Bone Marrow with Baby Bay Scallops. The bone marrow is phenomenal, just absolutely packed with flavor. But like I said, you can't go wrong.

I would not take a friend with a seafood allergy to many seafood restaurants. But this place is exceptional.

This was one of the best meal experiences I've had since I've lived here for 2 years! We had oysters and the scallop ceviche for an app and they were both amazing! For dinner we had the squid ink pasta and lobster risotto. The service was amazing here, they brought our complementary bites while we waited for our food and they gave us a free dessert!! I will definitely be coming back

Cute, cozy, and good service. But the food and drink just didn't hit the mark. The one saving grace was the bone marrow which was likely one of the best I ever had but the scallops that came with it weren't salted appropriately nor cooked perfectly. The fettuccine with the clams.... Great mix of ingredients with simplicity but also under salted and the clams were way over cooked, hence feeling like rubber. Bar isn't a totally full bar so there's no top or bottom shelf just A shelf. The house cured salmon was super disappointing, didn't seem much cured at all and maybe on a good day it may taste smoked. Also, not sure why the server wasn't attentive enough to ask about the fact we hardly touched that plate.

So this is a hard skip.

If you love oysters and I mean really love oysters this is the place for you! They have every oyster from anywhere you could imagine and they are all SO good and fresh! We had about 40 oysters total between 2 people and I wish we could have had more but we had to control ourselves. Our oyster selection varied from east coast to west coast and the states to British Columbia. It's a great spot in LES with a good drink selection as well. Super casual and cozy and great to just hang out have some oysters and beers. I also had the pasta with clams which was good but nothing can compare to how amazing the oyster experience was here! Definitely a must try if you are a local or just visiting NYC!
Great food!! Message to the restaurant tho - I think remove the shrimp heads. It takes away the elegance of the surf n turf and I just can't handle eyeballs on the plate
Oysters and scallops were excelled. Plenty of good beer and wine options. Staff was efficient, helpful and friendly. Highly recommend.

First time here. Amazingly delicious food. SERVER WAS A DOUCHEBAG. Went for the oysters (make sure to ask which ate briney and which are sweet, and try a mix)  and would up having appetizers and entrees. The pistachio encrusted grouper was cooked perfectly and my partner loved the bone marrow entree. Hard pass on the creole shrimp, which lacked flavor and had zero spice.

Fettuccine and clams.

Fresh amazing oysters.

Friendly service.

Low Key Atmosphere.

Can't not love this place.

A cozy leaky tub place, those were my first thoughts coming in here.  Maybe it was the massive rain this day that settled my thoughts on that.  It's never too rainy for a day of oysters and hearty dining.  Came here on a reunion with my bestie and the East Village was her comfort neighborhood.  Oysters to order, there were so many to sample from different parts of the East Coast.  Had placed my highest bets on the Cape Cod oysters but the most popular ones for me were the Rhode Island Breachway and the Moonrise from East Dennis, MA.  Oysters are as reasonably priced as they can be compared to most parts of Manhattan but it wasn't happy hour so we wanted to get as much of a sampler experience as possible.  The inside of the restaurant - looks like a basic bar restaurant, very dim, and casual.  Both my bestie and I sat at a high-top table and were fine with it because this place was brimming with popularity and we were hungry.  We were about to find out why this place was popular, and it wasn't just the oysters.  The cocktails here are very refreshing and well made.  My mint mojito was very alluring and well balanced - right natural sweetness, minty kick, and the alcohol base was the good amount of buzz any overworked New Yorker needs.  That built up my appetite to the winning dish of the night - my squid ink uni pasta.  Granted I'm not a girl who is afraid to stain her teeth for a scrumptious bowl of noodles.  This pasta was so homemade, you can taste the quality of the noodles of how soft and made-from-scratch it was.  Basic pasta tapestry work put into it.  And the icing on top of the pasta cake was the uni dabbed on it.  This uni was so fresh and similar to most Hokkaido imported uni I've tasted - not to mention the price of this dish was so reasonable, it was unbelievable.  And trust me, any good sushi restaurant would try to price gouge you for uni pieces because of the ingredient itself. Good food always makes my heart and stomach happy.  And my bestie and I have kept up that tradition well where we stumble on a non-fancy hole-in-the-wall but the food surpasses our expectations.  That was the impression left on me at this place. Well done.

Dining solo, a Friday night, I had a reservation (recommended) and arrived a few minutes early. Not a problem. The friendly hostess said I had a choice of tables so I took a seat in front. I could look out the window to people watch but there was also garbage out there so I switched seats to look at all the couples and throuples and pals having a great time. It's a narrow, small, and perfectly-dimly lit place with seats at the bar, high top tables, and  regular tables for 2 or 4. I didn't check out the outdoor seating but there was a lot of service going outside. I got down to business to select my oysters (1/2 dozen) and a craft brew. Not an IPA guy, So I got a lager that was good but I should've gotten the Pilsner--which I did get on round two.
My wait person was friendly and helpful when I asked a few questions about the menu. There was a special that sounded good, but I already knew what I wanted. Along with the oysters, I ordered their in-house cured salmon I had read about in other reviews and crab cakes.
The crab cakes: 2, served on greens with some vinaigrette. I don't get crab cakes too often so I can't compare. The balance of crab to cake ratio (I know, I mean breadcrumbs?) and seasoning was great. I didn't see/don't remember if there was an aioli but it really didn't need it.
The salmon portion was very generous- mounds of large but not thick slices, with red onion and capers and nicely toasted bread all plated on a slate with what I think was XVOO. I have a good appetite but the idea of having an entree after that was too much.
I enjoy smoked salmon a few times a year, but usually on a bagel, or out of a package at home. This is not your ordinary grocery store or IKEA salmon. It's insulting to even mention the big box salmon in the same review as this but that's my go to for salmon at home.
Delicious, delicate, tender but very salty. It's salt cured so that makes sense. Needed extra bread that seemed to be like asking for ketchup with a steak. I'm not ketoing, but I don't usually raid the bread basket when I go out to eat. But in this case, I needed the extra carbs as a vehicle to finish up the salmon. It was too good to not finish but it was way too much for one person.
So far so great. The exception came when I found out no dessert menu and no coffee. In hindsight, I realize coffee makes people linger and such a small place needs to turn the tables.
My wait person suggested pound cake with a drizzle of whiskey and I think I asked about brown liquor to drink. I want to say he said they have an in-house whiskey, but not sure exactly how he phrased it. Whatever it was, I ordered a short one finger pour. I don't remember how it happened but when I got the pound cake (with a drizzle of whiskey) and the glass of whiskey, tried both, I didn't even think about having a coffee.
Whatever that whiskey is/was was smooth, slightly sweet. Nice.
I decided I would come back just for that.
I felt alittle guilty about not ordering an entree but when I added up the three plates and two beers I think it was comparable. I didn't want to stay too long so I asked for the check.
It looked like I had been comped a couple of things. Which was a surprise and very nice.
Left a 30% tip on what I was charged.
Why not 5 stars? Well, it's not their fault, exactly, but one of the nearby tables (all the tables are very close to each other) had 4 young women who got louder and louder to the point of shrieking /screaming laughter. I don't know if it was because they were imbibing, but it disturbed me. I was going to say something but it was a temporary inconvenience so I just decided it's a busy night, they were young and having fun. When I dine solo I don't talk, obviously, so I notice when the din starts to get louder. There's a point where people tend to shout to be heard. That's when I'm done.
So, beer selection is great, especially if you like IPAs. Oyster selection was ample but not overwhelming. All the food was very good, fresh, flavorful and lots of it. The pound cake and whiskey were great. Staff was friendly, helpful, quick, but I never felt rushed. Overall vibe: lively
I'll be back.

We love going here. The room isn't large, you should make a reservation but the happy hour oysters and drinks are so well worth it and yummy. The shrimp with head on is also one of those dishes you just can't wait to have.
Totally like this place.
The owner is the worst. Hes all nice and shit. Tries to make me feel welcome. Pfft. No thanks!

This place is amazing. They have happy hour with 6 oysters (there's about 3 different types you can choose from) and one draft beer for $12. The service is fun and attentive. The oysters vary in size, but for the price it's pretty decent. Would definitely come back.

Bottom line: stopped quickly for a drink. Service quick and efficient, beer and oysters hit the spot.
Gluten line: oysters and wine are thankfully gluten free. They otherwise seem aware.
Bottom line: this was just a quick stop but they had happy hour that included half a dozen oysters and a beer. We enjoyed everything and will definitely be returning again soon!
Happy hour deal is dope. Half a dozen oysters and a beer for like $12. Truly a hidden gem
The oysters were pretty good for it being happy hour oysters. And the pound cake that came with the check was an amazing touch.

This place is so GOOD!!!!! Been here a bunch of times both sober and drunk and EVERY times has been AMAZING.
