They used to have scallop with risotto and their risotto was my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE, so i'm super sad it's not there anymore. They still have the scallops but I think it's on a bed of asparagus.

Honestly, everything here is soooo good. They start you off with an oyster list, usually around 2-3$ an oyster and they've always been pretty juicy regardless of what i order. I think they have a happy hour, but i've never been around that time.

The crab cakes are a bit spicy, but if you're into crab cakes like me, you'll enjoy them.

The fettuccine with clam is also DELICIOUS. It's a bit of a guilty pleasure because the noodles are OOOOZING with garlic and butter (in the best way).

Bone Marrow also A++++. I liked the way they laid this dish out. You essentially use the bone marrow with crackers and this beautiful Greek(?) yogurt-like sauce. It's so tasty! I like that they made it into finger food so the bone marrow isn't too overwhelming.

I think we've had all the octupus dishes and they are pretty solid too. The only thing I'd say i didn't enjoy was the ceviche here, i think it didn't taste super fresh to me for some reason.

OTHERWISE, the menu here is PERFECT. They serve drinks and beer and I find the drinks here to be pretty strong. The line/wait here can get quite long, especially on weekends for dinner. I'd HIGHLY recommend putting your name on the yelp waitlist ~30-40mins before coming. We had a subway delay issue and we're late to our waitlist spot, but I called them and they were super nice about it. We were seated immediately after getting to the restaurant.

I LOVEEEEEEEEEE upstate! it's such a nice date spot and just has so many solid dishes!

Another case of "came for the happy hour special and stayed for the meal'!  They have a great happy special or 6 oysters and a beer for $12 which is a great deal.  The entrees were reasonably priced and super delicious.  We had linguine with clams and trout over gnocchi.  We'll be back as often as we visit NYC.

5/26

I'be been to this establishment over 20 times and have never been treated like how I was treated today. There was fly in my oyster, and, rather than apologizing, our server's response was "This is a hazard of outdoor dining."

After thanking him for bringing our dishes, he ignored both my guest and me and had a very annoyed look. I'm addition, the fettuccine clam dish usually comes with 8+ clams; however, when he brought the dish, there were only six, so we ordered again with a different waiter who brought the normal 8.

Moreover, we ordered four of our regular oyster happy hours which come each include a glass of beer or wine. When trying to get his attention for the second time, our server shook his head with annoyance and continued to ignore us. My guest and I were genuinely confused as we're regulars at this establishment. I really hope management can look into this, as there were hints of racial motivation, and all other staff were helpful as usual.

Last thing, as he just brought our check when the waiter came backs for the last him, he asked in a very sarcastic tone, "Would that be 'sufficient' for you guys?," and I responded that we already asked for the check. Again, he shook his head and walked away. Eventually, he brings our check, throwing the fork and check, without saying anything.

We are very, very confused and disappointed.
Popped in for a slice. Super friendly staff and great place to take a breather from the Midtown chaos. And above all, yummy pizza

I hesitated to post this review because I was afraid everyone would start swarming (read: Joe's) one of my new favorite pizza spots in Manhattan, but in the end it's in the best interest of everyone involved.  I stumbled upon this hidden gem and it has quickly become one of my go-tos in the city.  My favorite slice is the pepperoni, featuring a perfect balance of flavor on a perfectly baked, crispy crust.  Service is quick and the ambiance is trendy, creating a perfect spot to get my pizza fix on!

I was in the neighborhood today and stopped if here at the end of the day, I remembered hearing this place was supposed to be similar to Prince St. Pizza.

I got one regular slice for myself to eat there, one pepperoni slice to go for my dad. In total, $10.

The regular slice:  It was good, I could tell it would have been much better if it was super fresh. But either way was still very tasty, it didn't really taste like Prince St. Pizza but it was still very good on it's own merit.

Service: The guys inside of the pizza place were friendly.

Overall: Will probably stop by here again sometime if I'm in the neighborhood and want pizza.
The garlic rolls and pizza were really good. Great flavor, not greasy or soggy. The garlic rolls had a lot of garlic and were warm and soft.

Upside Pizza: looking for a quick slice between meetings at work. I love pizza and will never turn down a slice. Aside from the price, this is a real pizza that locals eat. It's farther away from some of the main tourist areas, and even though it's a tad pricey, it's just a solid, slice.

You'll probably do well enough with one or two slices, as they are large. I like that you can sit at the barstool and listen to a podcast and watch the people.

Food: 4/5
Value: 3/5
Experience: 4/5
Service: 5/5
Ambience: 5/5

Good for: A quick lunch.

Authenticity: 5/5

Notes: Don't get fancy with a New York slice. You're looking for a solid, pep, cheese, or one Ingredient.
I tried a slice pretty late in the day and perhaps that's why the pizza was dried out and chewy.

A pizza spot that just hits the spot. Vodka and cheese slices were both well made. Reasonably priced. Adequate seating inside for folks - bar and table options.

Order at the counter and sit and enjoy or take to go - whatever floats your boat!

On Fri night, I ordered from Upside via their site (toast ordering service). 2x during checkout, my delivery order reverted to pickup, and I switched it back. Upon checking out, with delivery clearly indicated, and a $7 DELIVERY tip too, I received both an on-screen and email confirmation for pickup.

I was not able to pickup the order, so I immediately called the number in their email confirmation (no answer), e-mailed their info email address on their website, and contacted them via DM on social media. I called a total of 10x, trying to correct the error before giving up.

More than an hour later, I receive a call from the restaurant to let me know my pizza is sitting there for pick-up. I told the caller I had been continuously trying to contact them to no avail, and he offered to deliver the hour+ old pizza, however I had already placed an order with another restaurant after not hearing back, which I explained to him.

At that time, I asked for a refund, and the employee proceeded to tell me I was calling the wrong number (I called the number on the confirmation email, not to mention a also contacted via email and DM!). Then, to end the call, he PRETENDED SUDDENLY TO NOT SPEAK ENGLISH!!!!

I've tried several times since Friday to contact the restaurant for a refund with no response, so now I'm out $50 and alerting others to not do business with this incredibly dishonest restaurant.

This pizza was phenomenal! I tried the vodka pizza. It was a little spicy and crust was super thin. I could have eaten like five slices. The service was amazing. The guys behind the counter were nice and very welcoming. It was very fast-paced, everyone was rushing to get their food. We'll return if we're ever in NYC.

When in New York, you must eat the pizza.  It's like a rule or something.  This place was around the corner of my hotel and after seeing the reviews, I gave it a try.  Small venue but felt very "New York".  I ordered a sausage and pepper as well as the pepperoni. I was giddy with excitement when a fresh pie was pulled out of the oven so I could get it while it was piping hot!  The folks working the store were nice!  Make sure you add the garlic powder for an added touch!

Upside Pizza is amazing. I describe it to people as "hipster pizza", as it is in the new New York style like Williamsburg Pizza, Scarr's, and Zazzy's. It's thin like your average New York pizzeria, but they use better quality ingredients and charge a little more per slice as a result.

I've tried a plain slice, pepperoni slice, and thick pepperoni slice. All are great in their own way. The pepperoni curls are not the (now overused) same variety as Prince St. Pizza, and they're crispy and satisfying. The cheese slice has blister marks you get from using a properly hot oven. And the thick pepperoni slice has cheese laced up the side of the crust, to add another layer of umami. The crust almost reminds me of Parisian baguette, with its subtle saltiness and fluffy airy quality.

I work nearby, and am already daydreaming of my next visit.

Horrible with a capital H. Worst pizza I've ever eaten in New York. The moment I walked in I should I have known it was going to be terrible. It was not Italian-owned. At least the guys working there were not.

Ordered four square slices (two pepperoni and two cheese) and when I asked for Parmesan, the guy taking orders looked at me with an annoying expression and said NO. What? How can you not have Parmesan at a pizza place? Like I said, they're a disgrace to New York pizza.

When I bit into the pizza, the dough had a nice texture but it tasted off like it was made with bad, old water. The pizza sauce was unimpressive and tasteless and the pepperoni tasted like Walmart great value pepperoni. A metallic, bad-quality, meaty taste. If you know what I mean, you know. The cheese pizza was no good either and we found a tiny fly in the sauce on one of them. Sad to say that we only took one or two bites and tossed everything in the garbage. What a waste of $22 for 4 slices of pizza. Take your money and run!
No frills kind of place. $5 for a slice, not greasy, and reheated to a delectable crunch. Good place for a quick stop.

Wanted a square slice without having to venture further south to grab it so here we are!

Small seating area but very spacious. Open window which really helps gives this place a pleasant eating space (also off the main street to get away from the chaos of NY!).

Tried a pepperoni slice and a pepperoni square and cheese square.

Overall thoughts?  It's perfectly fine!  If I was craving a square and was in the area I'd definitely stop by.  Really enjoyed the crunch of their pepperoni.  The bread and sauce was good but didn't blow me away.  I would get the square over the slices next time but that's just me!
Really, really good pizza. The crust was crispy and the sauce tasted good, but didn't overpower the rest of the flavors. At $5 a slice it's a little pricy but it definitely hits the spot.

A definite contender for best quick slice in Midtown East. They've got both New York Style and sicilian, both of which are great. Great sauce, crust is consistently thin and crispy but not hard or overcooked, and a good variety of toppings. Both slices are on the bigger side. Personally, I love the pepperoni and the mushroom slices. It's a small place but they have a handful of tables and things move fast.

Based on the reviews, I thought Upside Pizza only had Sicilian-style pizza, but they also have "regular"/triangle slices of pizza. That being said, I love Sicilian-style/square pizza, so I got a slice.

One thing to note is that these slices are HUGE. I have a decent appetite, and one slice was very filling. I was surprised by how thick the slices were as most Sicilian slices I've had have been a bit thinner. The pizza is good but super filling since there's so much dough. A Sicilian slice of pepperoni set me back $5.50.

Service was very nice. There are a few tables and counter seats available for dining inside.
My wife got the Falcowitz slice and I went with the classic cheese pizza. Both were great, but the cheese was better.

I enjoyed my plain slice and my pepperoni . However, I prefer the pepperoni not overwhelm the taste of my slices.  The pizza was fairly priced and the atmosphere clean & sleek! Service was friendly but prefer that prices are displayed up front instead of having to ask.

The final stop of my running pizza tour, I ran up to Upside and had some trouble finding it with the scaffolding blocking it on a dark block & on a rainy night. They kept the menu relatively simple here, so I walked right up the counter with no line & ordered a classic slice of cheese. This wasn't crazy thin, which could be a good thing with a quality crust. I found this crust to be thicker than the other two classic New York style slices I had just eaten, but it was quite dry. They also go heavy on the cheese, so my slice tasted almost entirely of cheese. The tip was easy enough to chew through because there was so much cheese & it was so oily, but by the time I got to the back half of the slice, the dry breadiness of the crust was too much to handle and it sapped all the moisture out of my mouth. If you like your pizza to be like a very cheesy saltine, you'll really like this place! Personally, I thought the crust was difficult to get through & the composition was not very balanced as the sauce was completely overwhelmed by the massive amount of thick greasy cheese & dry crust. The dry crust could have been a symptom of it being late & close to closing, but I think that for my personal preferences, I'd like to see a little less cheese & a little more sauce.

So far, so good. One of the doctors at my city gig recommended this spot to a patient and I overheard him exclaiming how amazing the 'za is. I had to ask him to give me the deets. He said they have a really good mushroom slice and that's when I knew I had to try them out. I ran downstairs in between patients and grabbed a slice of mushroom for myself. The crust is on the thin side, which is what I prefer. The end piece is very crusty and there are definitely enough toppings to satisfy.

I was able to grab my slice, have it heated up and pay, in under ten minutes. The staff is efficient, fast and pleasant. They greet you when you first walk in and take your order immediately. The place is kept very clean. They have multiple dining options. You can sit inside, either at tables or at a window bar. That window is garage-style and opens completely, for indoor/outdoor dining. They also have a few sidewalk tables, which have now become the norm for many dining establishments.

All of their pies look really good. As I said, I like the thin crusts but they do have thicker crust pizzas for purchase, including a really sexy sicilian that made me want to order a second. Thank goodness I'm only working in the area for the rest of this week!

Another one! About 4 avenues over from the OG location, Upside just opened their 3rd location, another nice and breezy one with wide open space and the same amazing pizza.

Get all the slices - cheese, vodka, mushroom, sausage & peppers, pepperoni, they're all excellent.

This is far enough away from the original that it should be your new top choice for a slice joint in this area.
Great pizza, super friendly guys at the shop, best of everything. The slice selection they had was great and I loved the mushroom. The pepperoni were the curl up style.

This is a very simple review.

They serve pizza here.
There are 3 or 4 tables and a bar/counter by the window to sit and eat. There are some tables outside in the front.

You order at the counter, they warm your pizza in the oven, you get called when your pizza is done, you pay.

The pizza is so yummy. It's simple but the ingredients they use are so great, making a simple slice taste great. The slices are nicely thin, crisp and tasty. They have sicilian slices but I didn't try them. They look great too.

Love this pizza.
Got the upside down Sicilian pie. Look, I don't know much about the toppings, but this is just garlic bread on crack. Big fan. Would get again.
Great pizza place near time square. Flavorful full, good portions , tomato sauce sauce on point.

Picked up a pepperoni slice from here today. The owner seems like a very serious guy. Efficient at what he does but very brief. No friendly chit chat. He put the pepperoni slice in the oven and served it up on a paper plate for me. Lots of thin small pepperoni pieces on the slice that are crispy. Nothing unique tasting, but it did taste pretty good. Good crust.

Hole in the wall pizza joint...excellent slices!  Pepperoni was my favorite, the perfectly balanced slice!  Tried the french bread slices too, they were good but I prefer New York style pizza.  Recommend for grabbing a quick, delicious slice of pizza!

Cooked perfect. Bottom crust well done - not burnt. The edge crust was chewy - not dry. Toppings weren't sloppy. My fav NYC slice so far. (Pics don't really do any justice) Also I burnt the roof of my mouth bc I was too impatient to let it cool of. 10/10 worth

Place isn't really a pizza spot. Asked for Parmesan cheese to add to my slice and was told "it's already on there". Ummm, no. They don't have a Parmesan shaker, apparently.

Tried to eat the slice like a "normal" slice and it "broke". They don't have plastic utensils, either.

Was a greasy, sloppy mess. Definitely not worth the price.

Won't be coming back.
Came back for some more awesome pizza! The white slice with mushrooms was great too! And a awesome looking box! Can't wait to try the other slices when they arrive!

Pretty good pizza! I had the pepperoni slice and I thought the sauce was pretty good, it was tangy. The pepperonis were great as well. The crust was a bit bigger than I'm used to with typical New York thin slices. It's a bit on the pricier side for a slice as well
Very good place. The white pie with mushrooms was out of this world. Had so much flavor and the opposite of bland. The square was ok but white amazing.

She's a thing of beauty  For a long time, our go to spot for pizza has been Joe's, but we tried slices from Upside a few weeks ago and were really impressed! Just ordered a whole pie for delivery now, and YUM. 10/10!

Totally delicious. I picked up and  it was so fresh I had to make sure I didn't tilt it because the toppings would have slid around. Got a 50/50, half cheese, half pepperoni, and it was so good.  I'm originally from NJ but have lived in SF for more than 20 years. This NY sourdough pizza satiated my bicoastal pizza cravings and then some.

Had a pepperoni slice. Amazing. Cashier just cashed out customer in front of me when he dumped his slice on the credit card reader. He cleaned the mess and asked the guy if he wanted a replacement slice. Very cool.
Was not impressed with this pizzeria at all. The pizza was over cooked and dry. There are definitely many other better pizzeria's in the area.
This is really excellent pizza. I love the sauce and the crust so much. The owner said the crust is sourdough. I will be going back and definitely would recommend the place!
Classic New York pizza, with a hot crispy crust and great flavor. Pleasant style and friendly staff, clean restrooms. Great stuff!

Great thin juicy slices. Just a block from the New York Public Library and Bryant Park ice skating.  Looking for a quick cheap slice, I stumbled upon a place I will go out of my way to return to.  Also appear to have cane sugar bottled Coca Cola from Mexico, another big plus.

Excellent pizza. It's cooked well done and is very tasty - not your typical NY football pizza joint.  The vodka slice has a kick, gotta be a must-try.  The classic cheese is delicious too.  Also picked up a Sicilian that looks like a Detroit-style slice.

Great local stop for pizza. Upside is near my office and still open when I work late. I spoil myself with a Neapolitan cheese and a slice of Sicilian too. Nothing better than washing it down with an ice cold coke. The owner is friendly and there is seating for a few hungry pizza lovers. The perfect stop on my way home!
Their Sicilian slice is pretty impressive.... And they have fountain soda, which makes me happy! :) :)
We love the pizza we love the environment we love the staff. We will be back. They have been New York pizza but they also have the pizza which I enjoy. Great spot five stars for sure
BEST PIZZA IN NYC!!! Truly can't find a better slice shop and have lived in NYC all my life.
Delicious pizza. Super friendly staff which seems rare in NY. Food and service were great!
Delicious! The best crust in the city! Crispy, delicious and wonderful! Great store and friendly workers! Let's put Rays out of business!
Good pizza at a good price. Eat in or carry out. Nice workers too. Didn't have a huge drink selection but pizza was great.

The pizza came thirty minutes early. When I opened it, I saw why. I have had their pizza previously. This time it was very different.  This time it was clearly a reheated older pie. It tasted like cardboard. I will never order from here again.

Pizza is not consistent.  I've had good and bad here.  Today I got a pepperoni slice that turn out to be an epic grease bomb!  It was literally dripping off the slice.  I regret eating it but didn't want to waste my money.  Get your act together guys!  I don't think this is what Anthony Falco had in mind.  I'm taking a break from this joint and going back to Joe's on Broadway.

Perfect spot for a lunch break.
Tried two slices and both were delicious.
Had some wine as well.
They also had a great playlist playing.
Definetly will come again

I dnno, everything's good I guess... maybe... kinda... i think they got so popular so quick n just rested on that, but nothings amazing.  It's heavy, makes ya run to the bathroom, and the mushroom slice I got was foul.

There was a fly or two on the pizzas towards the end of the night and I don't think I have a reason to ever go back.  I don't like their factory flavored sauce, and I can't say I'm in love.  
The vodka chucked parm from my too good to go order was real good but also real dry and not real great.

So - so   imo

Pizza paradise Roman style like corner slice. The sheer variety is astounding. It's smallish store with mega flavors. I appreciated the vegan options and the choices overall.
Ate:
Mushroom $6.00 with a dollop
The price point here is high! They are known for the burrata addiction to some slices. Not regular but certainly a solid slice.

This is a square slice pizza place. The second location seems quite new, and even the other people in the shop seemed to confuse it with the original more downtown location of this shop. The slice spread looked impressive, and I ended up with a robust veggie slice that did not skimp on peppers and mushrooms, as well as (somewhat by accident) a vegan margherita. The vegan slice was quite credible for those in need, and I was happy with the vegetables I got as well. It was too much salt, which is not surprising but brings them down a notch in my eyes as it was otherwise a quality pizza.
Pizza was great! Would definitely go back again. We had pepperoni and Cacio e Pepe slices. Cute little shop.

Same as in union square.
All around of deliciousness!
If you take the square slice with burrata or
The fried pasta or the excellent chicken parm sandwich....
All are fresh and flavorable.
This place also has seats so it's convenient.

Highly recommended!!!!

Definitely A Destination!!!!

Average pizza place with average tasting food. The fried spaghetti was still cold on the inside, they offered to reheat it for me but after waiting for over 30 mins I just ate it cold. This place isn't special the pepperoni slice was pretty good and so was the grandma slice.

I never was brave enough to barter my talent for a slice of their pizza, so when they finally opened a brick and mortar, I could finally barter with credit card on hand.  I could afford a Burrapizza and i prefer to gauze a pizzeria based on a simple slice of tomato and cheese pizza. Now this isn't NY style pizza, as it's a baked square, Roman style. There's a chew to the crust and i also go for the corner for additional cornicione.  Service is attentive, but not a place to linger long. Next time, I will try the vegan version, so thank you for expanding to other dietary options.
Great pizza! Clean place! Vegan Options! Avoid the chains and come here!! This isn't a traditional NY pizza place, and that makes it great.

Experience Newly introduced  Bengali menu at Utsav
It has been curated to accommodate both vegetarian and non-vegetarian palate and has a host of dishes that represent the Bengali cuisine.
Recently visited them ..

We have tried
Nimbu paani
Fish fry
Jhal Muri
Daab Chingri
Bhetki Maccher Paturi
Kosha Mangsho
Cholar dal
Aloor Dum
Luchi
Bhaat
Mishti doi

Bengali food is a combination of subtle and fiery flavours. There are certain European influences also like the snack food tradition and foods like chops , fish fry and cutlets that are British in origin but are prepared and served in most Bengali households.

They have focused on presenting classic dishes of Kolkata in their menu. Try the Jhal Muri ,Fish fry, Bhetki Macher Paturi (fish fillet in a spicy mustard paste steamed in a banana leaf), Daab Chingri (large prawns cooked with mustard in a tender green coconut )and Kosha Mangsho (slow-cooked spicy mutton curry) with some Bengali Alur dum , Cholar dal, Luchi. Don't forget Mishti doi which is a thick and creamy sweet yogurt dessert that's one of my favourite too.
If you're in New York City do check out this restaurant. Their Bengali menu aims to give you a taste of indulgence like the jolly Bengalis.

They also offer Indo Chinese and regional Indian cuisine.

Been to New York recently and we were looking for some Indian comfort food, we found Utsav Restaurant, the restaurant is specializes in traditional Indian cuisine. The portions were generous and food was delicious.

Starters: We ordered Manchow soup, samosas and puchkas. I would say puchkas was little cold and little bland. Other starters were pretty decent.

Main course: We took Aloo parathas, Butter Naan, Fried Rice and Malai Kofta.
Highly recommend and must try their Malai Kofta with Butter Naan and Aloo Paratha, it's a 10/10. Loved that bust of flavors.

The restaurant has a great ambiance and a perfect place for business meetings or pre show dining. It is  near Times Square so win win for everyone.

Overall highly recommend Utsav restaurant to anyone looking for great Indian food in the heart of Manhattan.

Way to spoil birthday dinner!

We visited this place for dinner on Aug 12. It was just two of us. Ordered a curry and a few breads with some starter. Curry had a burnt taste and breads were hard. Upon request, they redid the curry but took enormous amount of time and by then bread went cold like a toast! Naan turned into Nachos!

Overall, a terrible dining experience and hugely overpriced the so called "Bengali Cuisine". We don't recommend this! Much better places to eat in the area.

Thanks!
Great experience at Utsav! Was impressed by the authenticity of the butter chicken, dal Makhni and seekh kebabs! Was the right spot to celebrate an intimate family Diwali evening

I really enjoyed the comfort of this place! Nice spacious dining room and air conditioned. I ordered the butter chicken kulcha as an appetizer which was honestly the perfect appetizer, great chutney as well. For dinner I ordered the tikki masala and the bengali dish bengali alur dum. SO SPICY!! I almost always opt for a mild option to still get some spice but still be able to enjoy the food. This place didn't offer an option and everything was so spicy I was suffering lol. The flavors and everything was so good and cooked perfectly but was hard to eat because of the spice. Overall was a great experience I would just bring some milk next time lol.

We went for Diwali. The service was impeccable and the food is amazing! Given we were 9 women, we got to try a lot of food. The broccoli appetizer was amazing as was the chicken  appetizer. I had the prawn tikka from the grilled menu. Half the table was vegetarian so we had a lot of vegetarian dishes as well. The service was impeccable! I would definitely go back!

Had a quick lunch here and the food was super good. The lamb and chaat was flavorful and the naan bread was fluffy and warm. There was also some type of bean curry which I've never had before which was also nutty and delicious. The only thing that was lackluster was the rice - it just tasted kind of dry / stale. Service was good, waiter took time to explain the spice levels and different options for lunch.

I took off a star because the interior is in desperate need of an upgrade and the restrooms needed a good cleaning - I was just washing my hands quickly but it smelled like urine in there :(

We had a decent experience here on a Friday night. The dishes were tasty, and the garlic naan bread was to die for (super buttery and flaky). The cocktails were slightly disappointing - we had the vodka passion, which was way too strong. The turmeric margarita was also just ok. Service was a bit slow on Friday night - but be aware that a 20% gratuity is included.

We had the hot garlic sauce fish from the Indo-Chinese menu and saag lamb from the Indian menu. Portions were generous, and you only need one serving of basmati rice for two.

I had the chance to visit Utsav New York when I first arrived in the USA. As an Indian restaurant that has garnered a lot of attention, I was excited to try it out. The ambiance and decorations were impressive, and the staff was welcoming and friendly. To start, we ordered the bhel, and for our main course, we had palak paneer, butter roti, and pulav. The food was decent, and we enjoyed our meal overall.

However, what disappointed me was the fact that we were charged extra ($5) for cut onions and lemon that we requested with our meal. We were not informed of the extra cost, and it was only added to our bill when it arrived. The menu did not mention the additional charge for the side accompaniments, and it felt like the restaurant was trying to make a quick buck without being transparent. It left a sour taste in my mouth.

Despite that, the restaurant is spacious and can be a good choice if you and your friends or family enjoy Indian food. However, I would suggest being careful with any requests you make and asking about any potential hidden charges to avoid any unpleasant surprises.

It was dark in there (it was nighttime)! The service was lousy (there's an older gentleman who seems to be the host (and a waiter) and seems like he's mad at the world. That was the sweetest Tikka Masala I've ever tasted. And the garlic naan had no flavor. And that's the first time EVER at an Indian restaurant that I've had to pay for the rice separately. It's usually included, after all, the Tikka Masala was something like $29!!! The restaurant was close to my hotel so I took a chance. I lose.

I was really intrigued by the idea of the Chinese food like they serve in India. The hot & sour soup was really hot; that's a good thing. Szechuan fried rice, Indian style? Sure, I'll try that. I want to come back for the Hakka style noodles. Everything was delicious.
One not-so-nice thing I'll be aware of next time: when you receive your check for the meal, it includes a gratuity, but when it's time to sign, there's a line for "tip." I don't begrudge tipping extra for good service, and this WAS good service, but it seems a little underhanded, like they are counting on the customer not noticing s/he has already paid a gratuity. Moral of the story: always look at the bill.
Great Food. Lovely ambience. Excellent service. Great hospitality. I would love to recommend to all my friends

An amazing Indian restaurant in NYC! I was going here for the classic Indian food, but in an amazing surprise I found Indo-Chinese. It was incredible!

I got the egg fried rice, manchow soup, chicken Manchurian, chili garlic noodles, and their kebabs. Don't miss out on the soup!

My friend and I visited here for dinner after work. We were both not really feeling that hungry so we decided to just get a bunch of appetizers and naan instead of any entrees. We definitely got judged but the server seemed to find it a little funny. We got there at around 6ish and it seemed very empty, but by the time we left at around 8/7:30 the place was really filling up! A little expensive and I definitely had better Indian food, but not too bad. 4 stars for their patience with us :)

Ustav - Authentic Indo-Chinese here in Midtown offers a captivating culinary journey led by Nandita Khanna. Nestled between 6th and 7th Ave on 46th street, the restaurant creates an intimate and ethereal atmosphere, making diners feel like cherished guests. The attention to detail, warm hospitality, and prime location contribute to the overall inviting ambiance, creating a memorable dining experience.

The menu at Ustav boasts a range of delectable dishes that showcase the authentic flavors of Indo-Chinese cuisine. From the flavorful Chelo Kabab with its tender and well-spiced lamb, to the appetizers like Cauliflower Manchurian and Crispy Chilli Babycorn that expertly blend Indian and Chinese influences, each bite is a delightful fusion of tastes. The creativity of the chef shines through in the unique Gulab Jamun Creme Brûlée, a perfect combination of classic French flavors and the indulgent texture of Gulab Jamun.

Ustav delivers on its promise of offering some of NYC's most authentic Indo-Chinese food. With its inviting atmosphere, impeccable hospitality, and a menu that tantalizes the taste buds, Ustav is a must-visit for anyone seeking an unforgettable culinary experience in Midtown.

We ordered a bottle of Robert Mondavi cab, truffle oil cheese naan, butter chicken naan, chicken Chetinad, kadai paneer, roomali roti and a bread basket. We were a group of 4 friends meeting up after 15 years. The place is super busy, and overall I'd say the food was up to standard and felt like food from back home. So why only 3 stars? Id rate them a strong 3.5 but I can't do a half star.
1. I docked 1 star for the Kadai paneer. During the 1st iteration it had a strong pickled lemon sour taste. The server promptly took it back. The 2nd iteration was better but still had that pickled sourness. Disappointed because this was supposed to be a flagship item.
2. Docked another half star because they added an 18% gratuity by default. We weren't thrilled with the paneer and even the service wasn't up to snuff. I probably would have eventually kept a 15 or 18% gratuity but wasn't given that chance. I don't appreciate them sliding this in (no mention of that anywhere on the menu or at the premise)

Service was fine and food was tasty, but the lunch special features a tiny portion of protein (3-4 chunks), a small spoonful of rice, and then 1000 calories worth of naan. Probably a good restaurant, but the lunch special left a lot to be desired.

Had a large group here for a corporate function and could not have been more wonderful to work.  Accommodations were in a private room which we started outgrowing and they graciously provided more space for us

Food was family style and at their suggestion, all guest thoroughly enjoyed the food.

Great authentic food in the middle of great area in manhattan, would highly suggest if you have large groups!

I placed a catering order for my company form Utsav SPECIFICALLY because they are 2 blocks away. I called at 12:05pm to confirm my 12:30pm delivery. My enetire company is waitinf for lunch...12:45 comes, still no delivery. I call the (212) 575-2525 number for TWENTY MINUTES....NOBODY WOULD ASNWER....I then leave and start walking to Utsav.....Who do I see....delivery guy....its now 1:07pm. How the hell are you late and you are literally TWO BLOCKS AWAY???? I WILL NEVER EVER EVER ORDER FROM HERE AGAIN....HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND DELIVERY!

High hopes for Christmas dinner 2022. Deflatingly, the CTM was bland. On the bright side, the general holiday vibes in the open dining room were merry. The wait to pay was 25-30 mins. Eventually waiting this long will erode any Christmas cheer... Overall, I wouldn't return (based on the food), but I acknowledge Utsav offers a convenient and tempting Indian food option close to Times Square.

Ambiance is very nice.
Service is very good. Happy hour by the far, drinks are reasonably priced!
Food can be spicy so do request otherwise. Food is most definitely delicious!

Came for the first time not expecting much but just beat the dinner rush on a weekday. Really great food, a bit pricey but the portions were good. The restaurant was pretty packed too. Made a reservation and would recommend doing so if you want to eat here. When we left the waiting area was full.

We went here for dinner on a Wednesday after work and were seated immediately. We ordered the butter chicken kulcha and the kali mirch kabab to start and the goat biryani as our main. Perfect for 2.

The kali mirch kabab was delicious 10/10 - perfectly cooked! it was peppery and moist - just perfect.

The butter chicken Kulcha was cute and nice 7/10. It was good but as the husband of a Delhi girl i've come to expect nothing short of perfection when it comes to butter chicken.

The biryani was really good - 8/10. One of the better available in NY. it's not perfect but it's really good and better than most others. would love to hear if anyone has recommendations.

Naseem our server was the best. He recommended the biryani and he was right! Super kind, friendly and prompt! Exceptional service!

I used to order from Utsav all the time when I worked on 51st and 6th! Went back recently and tried out their new Indochine menu and it was delicious. Love the Indian Chinese fusion and lots of chili dishes and noodles. Please try the gulab jamun crème brûlée for dessert! Please support your local restaurants!

As someone who has similar food restrictions as Jain cuisine, it's really nice to eat at a restaurant which has Jain restaurants!

I got the chickpea tikka masala, and thought it was really good :) I really enjoyed the fenugreek that they included it as well. Portions were very fair, it wasn't super busy when we went (Wednesday Night) so we were able to get a table for 3 right away. Prices aren't bad either! They also have indochinese options, which is always fun to combine with the other Indian dishes they offer. Would definitely come back again, and would also love if they added more Jain options to their menu :)

Nice food great service I had chicken curry and eggplant it really amazing Ashok make very good food .
I really want to go back see you soon guys.
Thanks for everything my family r really happy.

Visited @utsavnyc to sample their Indo-Chinese food and it was phenomenal. Indo-Chinese food is amongst the top five cuisine I enjoy but to get the Kolkata Street Style Noodles , Manchurian or Fried Rice which balances flavors perfectly has always been a challenge. @utsavnyc I literally felt I was eating at a place in India which specializes in Indo-Chinese Food. Nandita the owner told us that the Chef is trained in Indo-Chinese cuisine and the taste spoke loudly about it.
I am a vegetarian but my friend was a Non-vegetarian so we sampled both.
.
We enjoyed the following :
Drinks - Spiced Jalapeño Collins
Appetizers - Cream Cheese & Truffle Oil Mini Naan, Butter Chicken Naan, Tandoori Broccoli, Paneer Chutney Tikka , Crispy Chilly Baby Corn
Main Course - Veg Haka Noodles , Coriander Burnt Garlic Fried Rice, Vegetable Manchurian and Chilly Chicken
Dessert - Mishti Dhoi and Gulab Jamun Creme Brûlée

I would rate the restaurant as :

Cuisine - Indian & Indo-Chinese
Food & Drinks - 4/5
Ambience & Location - 4.5/5
Service - 4/5
Price - $$
Overall Rating - 4

I stopped by here for lunch with a friend and we placed our order, Chicken Tikka Masala ($24) and Tandoori Lamb Chops ($44), including a to-go order of the Chicken Tikka Masala. The to-go order came out within 10 minutes while we continued to wait for our order. It took almost 40 minutes for our order to come out even though they managed to get the to-go Chicken Tikka Masala ready within 10 minutes. Given that we both could only do lunch for an hour, we ended up having to pack our dishes and didn't eat anything at the restaurant. Truly horrible service, especially given how overpriced the dishes are. The cherry on top was that rice was $5 extra even though Chicken Tikka Masala is a curry dish. I wouldn't eat here again nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Came here quite awhile back last spring and forgot to write a review. Went here with a group of folks for a lunch. We tried a large variety of things both vegetarian and for meat lovers. Things to know about this spot: It's kind of off the beaten path and hidden with large office buildings and in the lounge of a large building. It's hard to notice it which is a shame because they offer a unique menu of food that I'm not too familiar with and never have had and what I want to call super spicy Indian/Indonesian food. The food was delicious and the service was fantastic.

Favorite stand out items: I remember the mustardy fish being creamy and having great flavor for those without a heat tolerance. The fried drumsticks were also fantastic. I'm not sure if everything is the same on their menus. Thin spicy noodles were burn your mouth off but delicious. A giant egg dish that had rice stuffed inside. Don't sleep on desert. Their ice cream with these fried caramel like crisps on top was so good. The only thing I would really say was lacking were cocktails. While being fairly strong, they were choke worthy strong and lacked a nice balance of flavors. The place is also pretty enormous with being two levels. I believe they have a $20 lunch special every day as well.
So close to Indo Chinese food! My go to when I am craving Indian Chinese, absolute loveeeee!!

As a born and raised New Yorker who is always on the hunt for exciting food experiences, Utsav exceeded my expectations. While I went in expecting to try the Indian classics I was pleasantly surprised when the owner, Nandita, convinced me and my guest to let her take the reins and let her order an array of items off the Indochinese menu. Nandita is from the Kolkata region of India, which is known for its Indochinese food - a cuisine I had never had the opportunity to taste...until now!

From start to finish the dishes I tried were packed with flavor, texture, and spice combinations I had never tasted before. Some of my favorite dishes were the Lemon and Coriander Chicken Soup, Konjee Crispy Veggies  (battered cauliflower, baby corn, potatoes) in a chili sauce,  Szechuan Chicken (boneless!), Konjee Crispy Lamb (which reminded me or fried pork rinds in the best way possible!!), Salt and Pepper Shrimp, and the Traditional Indochinese Hakka Noodles with veggies and chicken. For dessert I tried the  "Mishti Doi" which is traditional sweet yogurt with a custard like consistency.

Everything was amazing!

Along with this meal I ordered the draft "Taj Mahal" beer - an Indian lager that was awesome and my guest had the homemade lemonade with ginger.

If you're looking for something exciting and innovative that is based in centuries of tradition, then Indochinese food at Utsav is definitely for you. Be prepared to leave Utsav feeling stuffed and content.

I can't wait to bring more people here so I can order more next time!

Visited Utsav after a friend recommended but was highly disappointed, food was very pricey and overall portions size was good for 2 person, chicken lollipops was so dry and had no sauce whatsoever, service was slow and food came after 1 hour after we ordered, ambiance was good, I  will not visit again!!

The food is awesome. Their Indo-Chinese cuisine is the best in the city. Recently they introduced some amazing Bengali dishes as well. A must try. Brings back memories of home!

The service as always is nothing short of spectacular. The staff are so helpful, kind and knowledgeable.  

Fantastic ambience.

Definitely going back soon!

Great Indian food with various excellent choices.
Service is prompt, servers are patient and knowledgeable.
Place has old vibes but what it loses in look makes up in the quality and taste of delicacies they serve

I came here for dinner with my bestie and we had the greatest time ever. The interior is gorgeous. Lots of open space and floor to ceiling windows, it feels so relaxing and luxurious. We tried so many dishes so I will let you know my absolute faves incase you're looking for inspo! I am obsessed with the Indo-Chinese menu options, must try the chili lamb dry appetizer (super savory and spicy) as well as the Salt and pepper prawns (sauce is absolutely amazing)  we ordered the burnt garlic coriander fried rice and it was fragrant - flavorful and a great accompaniment to other meaty dishes. We tried the crisp lamb as well for our entree and it was so good. Will be returning soon to try the extensive Indian menu!

My family and I visited the restaurant for dinner. We were immediately impressed how nice the ambience was. We were given a nice seat by the window.  Romson (our waiter) recommended the turmeric ginger mango margarita! It was amazing! I also ordered a Jaljeera drink (one of my favorite drinks when I travel back to India). They also made a special food request for my son.  Highly recommend to anyone! Great ambience, great food and great service! Thank you Romson for giving us a great experience!

Came here with friends and it started off with really low hopes. The restaurant is big and they were taking seating upstairs. We ordered the Lunch special some beers garlic and jalapeño naans and a mango lassi. Unfortunately didn't get a chance to get dessert :( Not sure if it was just an off day for the service, although they were nice, it was very very slow. We were all getting a bit impatient.

Once the food finally came out it was actually really good! Don't expect it to be the best you've ever had but it's definitely really authentic and tasty! We all really enjoyed it.

Jalapeño naans were popping! Mango lassi was not too sour and delicious! Everyone's lunch specials were yummy. And the beers were crisp and cold

Only things were the service was slow and it is a bit pricey.

We came for dinner on a Thursday night. The place was maybe 60% full. The service was terrible and barely there. The waiter had an attitude while taking our order and had some (unwelcome) criticisms for the order. The portions were ridiculously small and yet the prices were higher than average. Rice was a separate cost, which is also highly unusual for an Indian restaurant. The food had minimal flavor so even that wasn't a saving grace. I'm genuinely confused by the amount of positive reviews this place received. Oh and they add the tip automatically to the bill without prior notice.

At Utsav, the customer service is unmatched! Butter ChickenChristopher went above and above to set up a table for us when we dropped by on a weekend without a reservation so that we could eat in rather than order takeout. Then our dinners were served, and while they were tasty, they weren't spicy enough for us. Without us asking, our waiter Robin sent our plates to the kitchen to add more spice, and the food was delicious. He also provided us more rice for free when he packaged our leftovers. Wonderful experience! The food was fantastic, as was the service.

Had dinner tonight at Utsav. What a terrific experience. Having grown up in India, I found the food authentic, flavorful and so very diverse. you had Bengali, Indo-Chinese and North Indian all in one evening. Thanks Utsav.

Im Indian and loved the food! Indo Chinese was nice to try because I haven't gone to many restaurants of the type. Favorite was the Butter Chicken which was filling and very flavourful. Spicy Garlic Chicken was pretty spicy for my family but they liked it! Service was nice and helpful. Also very beautiful restaurant with nice ambiance. Glad we came! :)

Utsav is a good Indian restaurant- go along with co workers once in a while mainly to sit and dine but after Covid just went there recently
They have a small outdoor dining area which was good
Food was good nothing great for the prices  - got the vegetarian lunch special with malai kofta/ mixed vegetables and salad
My colleagues got the chicken lunch special with chicken tikka and chana dal
It has gotten expensive since the last time we went there
They used to have lunch specials for pickup around 15 .
Their dine in lunch specials are around 20
Good taste overall for lunch specials
We had indochinese dishes- all if which were excellent!!! This review is from a person who's hard to please

I have been craving for the indo-Chinese food for so long. Tried in California, Florida and some other states but they were so bad. But oh my goodness Utsav finally served me what I wanted for soooooooo long. The Indo-Chinese food was amazing. Before I fly back I will try to visit this place again. The aroma, presentation, taste everything was so good. We also got tandoori and  chicken angara which I did not like it too as it was too masaledar (lot of spices) but oh well my husband really liked it. It is 8 AM in the morning as I write this review but all I am thinking of is the chicken lollipop lol .

Truly one of the best restaurants I have ever been to. I came here with my kids and my wife, and they all had an amazing time. The food was delicious and the service was outstanding. From the moment we stepped into the restaurant we felt welcomed. The recommendations from our server, Naseem, were on point! We cannot wait to be back. definitely a five out of five!!

Called 10/14 for 10/16 Reservation at noon. Confirmed, left my name.
Arrived, private party only. No one bothered to call! We were very much looking forward to it.

The food was yummy, however they didn't have the lunch specials they promote on their website or signage and I was not alerted until I ordered with my server. While my food was good, it was expensive for the portion and the lunch special was a decent value. My server was nice and the dining room looks pretty, but I had to knock off two stars for value and for not offering what they promote.

There are countless Indian restaurants in NYC with delicious food, so picking one is kind of tough. We came across Utsav because it had a good amount of Jain and Swaminarayan offerings for members of our party who follow these diets. We had high hopes going in, but no one in our party was overly impressed. The appetizers we ordered were the best part of our meal. The Jain tandoori broccoli and chili paneer were great! We also really liked the crispy quinoa aloo tikki. I would give this place 3 stars based on just the food, but the extra star is for the variety of food options, decor, and location. The service was just ok, and they added a 18% gratuity for a party of 5 without informing us or having it listed on the check. I normally don't mind and usually tip extra on top of that when I'm pre informed of added gratuity, but I find it unprofessional when you aren't told that it has been added. Additionally, the music they played was very random; they didn't pay for premium Spotify, so you would hear the ads and the genres were very varied.

Excellent Indian and indo Chinese food
Costly
Good service
Ambiance very good
Very good location near time square

Edit: lowering the rating as the business manager is stating that I'm lying. She was not there when the waitress told us about the indo Chinese menu being unavailable so it's hilarious that she thinks otherwise. We certainly did not opt for the Indian menu as we had no choice. I don't know how you dare to tell a customer this. And you wonder why I wrote about disrespect.

AVOID THIS PLACE

Not sure what happened since last time I was here in February but the quality and experience has dipped heavily

Their indo Chinese menu was not available at all, which was the reason we came. Didn't bother to mention on the website or notify us ahead of time which is disrespectful.

Secondly, I hate lazy restaurants that don't season their meat. At least add some salt. I got the lamb saag, the saag was delicious but the lamb was completely bland and unseasoned. Starting to suspect the chef is not Indian.

Their turmeric ginger mango margarita used to be incredible - now it's just mango juice and tequila! They didn't add any turmeric or ginger, and used table salt instead of rock salt like they used to. It's pathetic honestly

Sad to see another promising restaurant go down the drain due to either lazy staff or cost cutting measures or both. As an Indian, I do not recommend
Best pizza we had during our visit! We'll definitely be going back next time we're in town. They have more than just pizza as well.
Kept walking past this place, and today I finally found the time to stop! Excellent overall. Well seasoned, great flavor, need to try their Caesar salad.
Definitely one of the best pizzas we had while visiting NYC. The pepperoni and cheese pizza was so delicious. Perfect on the sauce, the crust was soft and the pizza was so cheesy.

My wife and I came here with two of our friends and my wife and I agreed it was the best pizza outside of Chicago.  We decided ahead of time to come here since we spent the day nearby at MoMA and my belated Great Uncle that lived nearby in New Jersey's name is Paul and it is also the name of our brother in law from New York.  There is plenty of seating and the decor is very cool.  The prices were very affordable and the service was fast and friendly.   We would love to come back but would also love to try some of the other New York pizza places as it is a staple food there.

Very solid pizza option.   Some flop, but very crispy.   Is a little thinner than I've seen, but good flavor.   Better than several of the other options I've found in NY.   Place was filled up at 3:30.  They're obviously doing something right!

Excellent pizza slices from this local shop. Located right off Vanderbilt. Slices are mostly what they got--and there's a big selection to pick from as therr is usually a long lunch line. Good sign! Crust was light, crispy yet foldable. Great sauce and cheese balance. This is a strong recommendation here.

This is by far the BEST pizza in Midtown! And I gotta say, I'm a Foodie and I LOVE pizza more than any other food group! The crust is thin.... and crispy on the bottom. The sauce is ON POINT. WHAT ELSE IS THERE???
Oh! The staff is super friendly and fun! This is a great NYC experience! Anyone who's around the area Must Must MUST stop in here to enjoy a slice.
All the other options they have - like the chicken ranch pizza? INSANE.
Why? Because the crust is thin and crispy on the bottom....everything else on top is a tastebud bonanza
Hey - You know if you know.... Pleeease Make this a destination my pizza loving people!!
I didn't think the pizza was amazing but they did give us this entire box for free as we left because they were closing for the night so that was awesome

One of the beauties about New York is its local pizza. I took my sister here on her first trip to New York and we enjoyed the pizza. There was a long line when we walked in but the staff was quick and efficient with getting everyone's orders out. The Pizza had the right amount of cheese and sauce where the sauce wasn't dripping out of the pizza and the cheese had a perfect cheese pull when it came out of the oven. Another thing to note was that there wasn't much excess oil from the cheese which prevents messes too. Overall, if you're looking for the taste of New York, definitely check out Uncle Paul's!

The pizza was some of the best pizza I had in the nyc area in a minute. This is my go to spot for good pizza when I got to Grand Central Station, highly recommend it. The service is always great nice people always welcoming. And the ambiance is like an authentic Italian pizza place.
Everything I'm looking for in a classic New York slice.  Thin and crispy (yet still soft and chewy) crust, perfect proportion of sauce and cheese.  Everything melding together into one.

The pizza I had was a Sicilian corner. Just too good.

They were polite and the pizza made me greedy for another one. Here I go order one again ......

Only real pizza place in the neighborhood so great to have them.

Unfortunately the pizza quality and taste over the years has gone extremely downhill. We all talk about how good it used to be.

Perhaps they changed ownership or ingredients.

Either way the pizza is tasteless and all taste the same. Would not want to waste my calories on this.

Only good if you really need to get something in your stomach quick. Otherwise skip.

Just look at the pic.  One of the best slices I had anywhere ever.

Just flawless execution.  Place might be overlooked if you're not paying attention but it's right by Urbanspace Grand Central.  No wait.

Delicious NYC pizza. Tucked away near grand central and a great little spot to pop out of the hustle and bustle for a bit.

Usual toppings as well as some unique options. I grabbed the lasagna pizza and was sure glad I did!  This tourist highly recommends it!

I was a bit surprised that this pizza shop had such high ratings. The customer service is wonderful and they have a huge variety of pizzas. The prices are also very fair. The pizza itself was just so so. Maybe it's rated so highly since it's close to pen station and the train station and perhaps a lot of tourist pass through. I was a little disappointed with the taste of the pizza. However, it is a good place for a quick stop once you get off the transport and you are hangry lol.
I remember about 10 years ago I got a really good pizza here! Ever since that, the food has been hit or miss with mostly air-balls, so place your bets.
Just got takeout and the large cheese pizza was delicious! I love that they didn't skimp on sauce. Saucy, cheesy, and big slices too! Definitely have leftovers. The pizza was great hot or cold.

Continuing my running pizza tour, I jogged over to Uncle Paul's with a couple of slices already in my belly. This place had a number of people in the place decently late on a Monday night, so I'm inferring that it's a pretty popular local Midtown spot. I walked up to the counter & asked what a certain pizza was, when he told me it was chipotle chicken, I was immediately intrigued. I ordered a slice & it came out pretty quickly. It was a very beautiful slice, with excellent crust bubbles, a lightly browned crust & cheese, bright red cherry tomatoes, splotches of orange chipotle mayo sauce, and little pieces of chicken scattered throughout the cheese. The crust here was quite crispy & airy, the right texture of a classic New York slice & as I said, it was clear the bread was given a good proper rise with how bubbly this slice was. The flavor combos on the slice were fantastic, with the cherry tomatoes offering a burst of sweet juicy flavor to balance the creamy & smoky chipotle sauce. The chicken tasted good, but it was quite dry which was a little disappointing & was tough to chew through in that regard. Considering how good everything else was with the slice, I'll chalk it up to it being late & near the end of of a slow Monday. I would definitely recommend the Chipotle Chicken Pizza, especially if you were getting a fresher slice or ordering a whole pizza. I've heard people say Midtown doesn't have good pizza, but Uncle Paul would have to disagree!

Good slice!  Not as sloppy soft as NYC slices can be. Bit of a crisp. I got buffalo chicken. Happy about no onion. Not spicy if you prefer mild which I do. Very fair price. Good beer and wine selection. Indoor and outdoor seating. Wife had veggie which she enjoyed.

Came to NYC for my granddaughter's 16th birthday.  The first thing she wanted was a slice of pizza.  The pizza was fantastic, but Zelka was our server and she made the entire experience even more amazing.  The restaurant is simple, but with a very cozy feel.  It's clean and inviting.  The experience was so good, my granddaughter wanted to come back again the next day before heading home.  Thank you all so much for such a wonderful time.

Being deprived from great east coast pizza living in the West Coast, Uncle Paul delivers. From the simplest cheese to meat lovers to margarita, crust is thin and firm a flavor galore! Well done . Staff is awesome!

Grabbed a quick slice of Margherita ($5 cash). Absolutely hot the spot! The right amount of crispiness and softness. Delicious blend of flavors. The crust was so tasty. The only thing I'd ask is a tiny bit more of tomato sauce. If nothing changed, I'd totally get the same thing.

The pizza is good. Entrees, not so much.

I've been to Uncle Paul's many times for pizza, which has always been great. But, I recently deviated from that order and got penne alla vodka with grilled chicken.

The entree came with a hefty price tag of $27, which surprised me for such a classic, simple dish with relatively inexpensive ingredients. While I expected a generous serving of chicken and pasta to justify the cost, I was sorely disappointed. The dish only took up about two-thirds of the average-sized to-go container, and while I was expecting to see a chicken cutlet with the dish, it was served with a paper-thin half of a cutlet.

While I appreciate the importance of using high-quality ingredients and charging accordingly, the lack of portion size for a dish consisting of a classic sauce, cheap pasta, and chicken left me feeling ripped off and unsatisfied.

Uncle Paul's is a nice spot for a slice, in a convenient location, but I cannot recommend the pasta entrees until either the price tag lowers or the portion size drastically changes.
This place was really good and like others have stated the ingredients have changed and left the pizza very mediocre.

Good deeper dish pizza. Loved the crust. We also enjoyed the pasta dishes. The person taking our 'to-go' order was very busy with his phone call (air pods in both ears, obviously talking to them, not us) and only got 1/2 of our order. This employee could kill Uncle Paul's revenue stream through this location, but then a hero stepped in and took over. The second employee went above and beyond making it right. the other guy walked out to get a smoke.
Great spot for authentic pizza by the slice. Crispy crust that is still doughy inside and lots of toppings. Sauce was savory with a hint of sweet. Pizza perfection.

Order:
- Spaghetti & Meatballs (4/5)

Pros:
- Very large portions ~ I was so full from eating half of my meal
- Tasty ~ one of the better spaghetti and meatballs I've had from a pizza place
- Large menu ~ pizzas, pasta, heros, platters
- They have gluten free pizza!

Cons:
- Delivery came weirdly inside multiple pizza boxes instead of bags

Overall:
Can't speak for the pizza, but their pasta is good and they have a lot of options to choose from
Worse pizza ever and even worse environment.  I get that the city has slipped a little but your pizza has fallen off the table onto the floor and even the dog does not want it.

Favorite pizza in New York.

Had 6 slices and chicken wings between a group of 4.

Very nice people.

Mediocre pizza for NYC. The price is comparable for the location.  I find it annoying that two Sicilians cost $8.17 NYC pizzerias have always rounded up or down by 50 cents, who wants to carry around 83 cents all day. I grew up on NYC pizza and will say that this is not bad pizza, yet nothing special. There is a 99 cent pizza place around the block.  Definitely of lesser quality, but for the price it is worth it. That is where I will continue to go for my pizza fix while at work.

I've never had pizza like this before!!! I'm a californian and have always wanted REAL New York Pizza - I'm glad I found this place - I got the lasagna pizza, spinach and cannolis. What an experience!!!

Seating: low top and high top tables

Service: walk up to the counter to pay and order

Vibe: the perfect quaint nyc pizza joint. Italian music playing and pizzas made fresh. I'm from the Midwest,  but it seemed like an authentic nyc pizza joint to me! ‍

Food: soooo good! Pizza was warm, cheesy, and the bottom was crisp and didn't flop over limp when you hold it. Very good! They also serve alcohol, beer and wine, I believe.

I stopped here this past weekend for a slice before heading home on the train. I got a basic margherita and it was actually one of the best slices of pizza I can recall. Bonus that I was able to enjoy it with a glass of wine at the last available table outside. Would definitely go back. Staff was very friendly and it seemed like a family business.
Don't miss it, it is not flashy, the flash is all in the food. Nice NY pizza crust, flavorful sauce and fresh toppings. It has a nice outside seating area with table service.

A few tables and a walk up counter and some of the finest slices you'll find in the city. Hot and fresh with great flavors. They also have calzones. Lots to choose from. I had a slice of mushroom and one with pepperoni. Awesome! Service is friendly and fast. Great place for a quick lunch.

I'm so happy to have discovered Uncle Paul's!  NY pizza at it's best and such a convenient location next to Grand Central!  Nice staff, and a cozy interior on a wintery day.  Uncle Paul's is now on my favorites list!

Uncle Paul's, thank you for a great experience at the Big Apple for my family and I. My parents first time in NYC and of course they had to eat a slice of pizza and I am so glad we stumbled at Uncle Paul's Pizza! We chose the location because they had seating available outside and we were astounded when they had dining inside too!
Opon entering we were greeted by a gentleman, and I think he is the son or a relative of the owner, and he was very patient with my parents and I as we were deciding what to order. He was helpful and answered all of our questions. I loved that you can tell her had passion for the pizza!
The food was delicious and authentic! I had a calzone (not my first time in NYC so I didn't order pizza lol) and man, it was packed with chicken! I wanted something with protein as I haven't been eating much protein for a week (vacation makes you eat unhealthy) and I chose just that because of it. The calzone wasnt heavy on the dough like some joints do, this one was proportioned and balanced between dough, sauce, cheese and chicken! Ok, maybe too much chicken but who complains on extra meat?! Lmao no one!! The pizza was ravedby my parents the whole time and my brother even said NY has the best pizza ever! Of course, every pizza is unique but you know what he meant, it was delicious and worth it!
Given the interior and dining room and how up kept the bathroom and outdoor dining is, the pizza is worth the money and amazingly not expensive. The price is so worth the quality and quantity!! Attention to detail is here and I would definitely come back to enjoy this local eatery. The sounds of the city and locals coming makes New York, well, New York!

Best pizza I tried in NY! The service was fast and they had high tops and regular tables inside, as well as some tables set up outside, so lots of room! The slices were huge and filling, although my boyfriend went back up and ordered another slice after he finished his first, haha. We were going to stop again before we left for another quick bite but ran out of time. Would definitely go again if I were back in the city!
Classic cheese slice.  We'll balanced sauce to cheese ratio.  Not aggressively seasoned with oregano, which I don't personally care for. Thin, crispy crust with a satisfying chewiness.

I tried the pepperoni slice and the buffalo chicken slice from here - service was very friendly and my order was ready for pick up once I arrived. There are a number of tables in both the indoor and outdoor dining area, with several groups sitting down and enjoying their slices. The pizza was really good here! The buffalo chicken slice had a good amount of not-too-spicy buffalo sauce, and the chicken was not breaded, which I really liked. The pepperoni slice was not bad either.
This was a great surprise to find as we wandered the streets of NY!  Great pizza! Great atmosphere! Great people running it!!!

The pizza pies are huge and classic. It's a hole in the wall with few tables. I think they must do a brisk takeout business. I was in town on a field trip with a few students. We had the pepperoni pizza, the lasagna pizza, a plain one, and a mushroom sausage pie. We had dinner there on a Tuesday and returned for lunch on Wednesday. I'm knocking off a star because out of five pizza pies I thought two had underdone crusts and the bathroom looked good but wasn't very clean. Also it would have been great to have the option of a pitcher of water for our large group rather than only individual bottled drinks. Table service was not available but we ordered at the counter and they did deliver the pizzas to our table. They seemed very busy. Three of the pizzas were very good. I would return.
It's over priced and just ok. Better pizza within a 4 block walk.  Only plus is the outside seating

The best family restaurant. Best service, wonderful eats and a variety on the menu. Their wings, pear salad, and white pizza were amazing! Nora was our server and gave us the history of the restaurant. Lovely dinner.
Stopped for a quick slice wasn't disappointed. Decent NY slice right by grand central terminal.
Ordered pizza for a lunch meeting with delivery at noon, they showed up at 10:45 with cold greasy pizza.  Would not recommend!

I had a pizza delivered from Uncle Paul's Pizza. The pizza was pretty tasty and I liked that the pizza was very thin. I wish there was a bit more sauce, but overall it was a solid pizza and I would go back again.

Came here on a visit to the Big NYC. Starved all day and made it a point to come here for a meal. Got Grandma's pizza and Pepperoni. Phenomenal. Sauce so fresh you can taste the air the tomatoes were just pulled from. The pepperoni was not like any sliced meat I have ever had. It was tantalizing. Environment was warm and clean. Staff was helpful and made sure everyone followed the rules for covid. Excellent representation of what a NYC pizzeria should be.

They completely messed up my order. I ordered margarita and mushroom/ onion and they sent me cheese and a veggie slice. I called and they refused to fix my order because I "live too far." Atrocious customer service. Also the cheese was only half hanging on the cheese slice and it arrived in very poor condition.

Amazing variety of food and very chill and cheerful vibe. I had some Korean pancake rolls and japamese takoyaki. Both were amazing.

You get the food pretty fast. There are many seats too. The prices aren't too crazy depending on which stall you go to of course.

Would recommend going here for a quick bite or even for a proper meal.

Came here for lunch to pass the time before an appointment after getting off Amtrak. I came at prime lunch hour ~ 12:40-1:00ish. And wow was it packed but I still managed to find a seat; though, it did feel cramped-was sitting elbow to elbow with my neighbors...but what isn't cramped in NYC...

I ended up getting a very generous amount of salad at extravert. The thai chicken and peanut salad was delicious--and had a bit of a kick from the jalapeños. Could not finish it all; even though i started as famished.

The tables were being cleaned promptly by the staff, and it definitely kept the table sitting moving!

I did not see a water fountain, but know that a lot of vendors had bottled water for sale.

Would definitely love to come back and try some of the other vendors.

Pretty cool food hall for a quick bite to eat or chill with friends. Many styles/choices of food to choose from. We went for a poke bowl spicy salmon $15.99 and a lamb pita wrap $12.95.
Poke bowl was ok, but the pita wrap was legit - juicy flavorful meat, sprinkle of fries, and a decent size pita. Tummies we're satisfied.
Lots of table seating inside.

This is a great place to meet up after work with a large group. Since it's a hall, everyone can eat something different for dinner and no one has an excuse to not find something. There's a bar for drinks, mako matcha for coffee tea and desserts, Brett's deli for sandwiches, Briggs also for sandwiches, international chicken house which has great tenders and sandwiches, and a Japanese place I didn't try yet that I think is by ippudo. I definitely recommend!

What should I eat today? Roberta's pizza? Carnita Tacos? Lobster Roll? Perhaps a smoothie and then a glazed doughnut from Dough? Urbanspace Vanderbilt is my favorite and is the first food hall created by the Urbanspace company. One can eat very nicely on a different cuisine every day of the week and feel satisfied. I know that I do. Whenever I am in this part of town I drop in to see what catches my eye. This time I ate two baos: Peking Duck and Pork Belly. Both were luscious and I almost wanted to get seconds. Since the pandemic all the prices here have risen which makes second helpings a tad pricey. I always like to end with a Cortado and a slice of the lemon pound cake from Partners Coffee. I sat there to savor these two tasty treats.

Service at both food kiosks is excellent and friendly. Restrooms are located to the side of this cafe which is essential at a food hall.

I love places like this. Sometimes people just want to eat different things and I feel like Urbanspace gives you a great variety of delicious food. Loved the pizza from Roberta's (coal fire, neopolitan style pizza - my favorite) and the desserts from Lady Wong's.

LOVE the concept behind Urbanspace and the entire experience of dining here!!! If you are not sure what you'd like to have for lunch or if you're with a mixed group of people that would all like to eat something different, this is the perfect place. So many vendors and cuisines to choose from here! Ramen, poke, Mexican, Indian, seafood, Korean, Italian, vegan... there is even beer sold at a few of the vendors! The market is cozy and has a decent amount of available seating. Great location right next to Grand Central as well.

I had an espresso from the cafe and then moved over to Red Hook for a beer, some fresh oysters, and a tuna melt. I had an amazing experience sitting at the bar at Red Hook. My friend had ordered tacos from the Mexican option and they still happily allowed us both to sit at the bar. Sal, Alex and David were working and were all SO friendly and accommodating. My tuna melt was one of the best I have ever had. It was perfectly cooked and incredibly tasty. I had such a great experience chatting with the Red Hook crew and enjoying my food and beer, I would absolutely come back to not only try more Urbanspace vendors but also more dishes from Red Hook! My friend loved her tacos as well, so I have a feeling you really can't go wrong with the many delicious options at Urbanspace.

This place gets VERY packed during prime lunch time during the weekday (b/c all the working people come by!!) but there are so many good options here.

I got my food from Pita Yeero, which is Greek food, and I absolutely loved it!! It is a little messy to eat so make sure to grab lots of napkins on the way (: Also eat it when it is fresh and hot!! I made the rookie mistake of waiting for everyone to get their food and my fries were a little cold and I felt that they would've tasted better if they were still hot ):

Will definitely come back to try other restaurants!!

I really enjoy going to Urbanspace. Although I am quite indecisive, I like the idea of having unique options to choose from. I've been a few times and always enjoy what they have. Playa bowls, doughnuts, coffee, lobster rolls, Mexican cuisine, Mediterranean cuisine and more. I recently tried Mian Kitchen and it was delicious. The dumplings were really good and the boa buns were tasty. I got shrimp and pork belly. My husband got duck and unfortunately he did not care for it because it was cold. He did ask them why and they told him it's served that way. Besides that it's a great place for a quick bite to eat. Be forewarned though, it is pricey.

The space is quite interesting with a number of eateries and spaces to sit and eat.  I chose La Palapa Taco.  I'll probably go back and try the lobster spot.  The space has good space to move about and investigate the restaurants.  The entrance is very tight.  You have to do a bit of a shuffle entering as other patrons are exiting.  I'll definitely come back.

All of the restaurants here charge a 3% credit card fee that is a surcharge beyond the menu prices. This is actually a violation of New York law. I pointed this out to the Plant Junkie store, and the cashier called me "cheap".

This is the law: www3.erie.gov/consumerpr….

It clearly says that Businesses are not allowed to advertise a price and add a surcharge at the point of sale when a consumer elects to pay with a credit card.

We had some delicious Korean fried chicken Sandwiches!!! You can find them at @bullchicken which is located in midtown At @urbanspace52 on west 52nd street!
The Korean BBQ sandwich with fried chicken tossed in k-bbq sauce comes with coleslaw, pickle chips, kimchi mayo in brioche bun was my favorite!! But the Guilty Pleasure sandwich with fried chicken, bacon, cheese, onion rings, coleslaw, pickle chips and the bull sauce was a close second!  The chicken was soooo good and flavorful!! And they also got cheese fries and fried chicken bites!! Yummy!!  go check it out!!!

Urbanspace has swept across my Yelp feed multiple times since I started using the app. It never attracted me enough to check it out on my own, but it stuck in the back of my mind. I was in the area for work and when one of my colleagues suggested we head there for lunch. As someone who is always looking to find new places to eat, I was excited to check this place out.

In a nutshell, Urbanspace is a food hall - home to multiple vendors of varying food genres. There are multiple Urbanspaces, with this one being on Park and colloquially called Urbanspace Vanderbilt. Upon walking in, I found that the aesthetics lived up to the name; it almost had an industrial theme with concrete floors and exposed fixtures. When I arrived around 1:30 it was quite crowded, though not overwhelming enough that I couldn't navigate the space. I recognized some of the vendors, such as Red Hook Lobster Pound, while others were new to me.

I ended up picking up some lunch at Mikey Pomodoro, which exceeded my expectations. They have a few tables to sit and eat, though it might be tricky to find a spot during peak hours. Overall, while I only scratched the surface of Urbanspace, I was impressed with what I saw (and ate). Due to its versatility, it's an ideal spot for many to check out for some food - I definitely want to return to explore more.

I'd passed by this place several times, just assuming it wasn't for me but who knew this central spot was so good for vegans?? There's two fully plant based spots: plant junkie and neat burger and many other spots have something for you on the menu as well. Not a whole lot of seating- I came after hours for a dinner but I can imagine this place being packed during lunch. The food I tried was from plant junkie- the Bangkok curry bowl. The tofu was the ideal soft inside/crispy outside combo and the fried lotus roots were a unique crunchy plus! Loved the peanut noodles as well. Ran me about $16 which seems about right for midtown. Came out so quick as well- I barely had to wait!

Ordered from both Jian bing and red book lobster.
Jian bing: way too oily and the service is totally lacking. $19 for a peking duck jian bing - just not worth it. The jian bing making was slow too. I waited 15 mins when there was only one person before me.
Redhook: yum and great service.
