This is a solid spot!  There are tons of different stands, so it's an easy place to go with a group where everyone can get something different.  There's a lot of seating, but it can get really packed during lunch break on a weekday.
All the food heat was just okay. I sampled food from the Greek, Italian, Indian, and Taiwanese booths. My favorite were the gyros and baos. The price was okay.

Decent selection- if you time it around late or early lunch its a little bit easier to navigate. My favorites are the salad and Greek section as well as the traditional deli section. Since I work in the same building on Park Ave I hit this place up a lot but don't expect to get out for less than $20 for lunch. Sweetgreen on Vanderbilt is right next door and my preference.

The food here is all really solid and it's just so convenient! Happy hour is until 6 or 7 I think and is great and the vibe in there at that time is busy but great.

I've had the indian place, seafood place, Mexican place, and the pasta donuts.

Sorry I couldn't find all the pictures.

Indian:

The samosas and pastries were delicious and the mango lassi and also the lychee drink omg!
Haven't tried anything else yet. Also the lady who works there was so nice.

Mexican:

Quesidalla
Tacos
Sodas

All these were great! Not the best ever but really solid!

Seafood place:

Oysters not bad ( I have low standards)
Lobster grilled cheese $14 I thought it was delicious!
Alcohol is great during happy hour :)

The pasta donuts:

Really sweet Italian grandma was selling them and I couldn't resist. I feel like it had potential I would get one that is extra cheesy (maybe Mac and cheese). This one I got was a bit too dry for me but it was kind of addicting lol and I could see if it was more cheesy me liking it.

This place was exactly what my family of 4 needed to find during a trip to NYC! Casual grab & go, but SO many options for our diverse food preferences. My husband is vegetarian, and there were many options to choose from. We got Indian, Mexican, American and Mediterranean dinners and everyone left full & happy. Also not crazy overpriced like so many places in NYC.
Only challenge is finding a spot to sit, as the food hall was pretty bustling when we were there.
Lots of choices for lunch from lobster rolls to ramen and different price ranges.  Seating and clean bathrooms too.

We came here on a Friday night before catching the train at Grand Central. This is a great location with a ton of food options! Plenty of seating indoors and outdoors.

Some of the vendors close around 7pm so I would try to get here for an earlier dinner. We came around 7:30 and ordered the Famous Pep (really good)!

The assistant GM Paul was very helpful when we had questions about the vendors!

COVID had really depleted the wide array of vendor options at Urban Space, but there are a few good spots.  Everything is super overpriced because the vendors are probably paying crazy high Park Ave prices.

Favorite places:
Plant Based Vegan Spot
Gyro Spot
Rotisserie Chicken Spot

Gotta be careful with UrbanSpace as not all the counters are good. Nice walk from my office, but the food is not spectacular.  

Some are overpriced.  The Bahn Mi counter is an example. The counter example is the Bao Mao.

Salads are uneven.  The poke stand is generally fine.

The Greek place is fine.  The pizza is ok, but huge.  

Gets very busy after 1145.

Came here today for a quick lunch with a larger group who couldn't decide what we wanted. Loved all of the options here- it was hard to choose where to eat! I settled on the rotisserie chicken spot to get a platter with chicken and two sides (Brussels and sweet potatoes). The staff was friendly and efficient, and the portion sizes were good. Lots of sides to choose from too if you don't want chicken! I ate this food so quickly I forgot to take a picture but it was all super flavorful and the chicken was juicy and seasoned perfectly. Will be back here soon!

This review is specific to one of the food vendors called Extravert. First off, love the play on words for this veggie forward spot. I had the harvest bowl. It was the single best bowl I've had in my entire life. It had a unique combination of flavors (chimmichurri, lemon, maple, apple, goat cheese, kale, sweet potato...). They all coincided perfectly. It was topped with a delicious piece of salmon. I couldn't get enough of it. On top of that, the service was quick, a well oiled machine even during the midweek lunch rush. I especially appreciated the person at the register - super friendly and made me smile! If I worked in the area, I'd be grabbing lunch here every day.
Got this combo of four yums at Yum Yubu inside Urbanspace. So tasty! On Monday's, there's a 25% discount when using Apple Pay
Great ice cream cake! Went here for my baby's birthday. Had a lot of fun. Try the chocolate express cake if you have the chance!

Mysttik Masala. Very very average tikka masala. Chicken was dry and tasted like nothing even with all the spices they tried to put in. Extra naan for $4. While eating, I found a piece of plastic in the masala.

$27 for masala bowl, naan, and mango lassi.
Basically, you are not getting any decent food and paying for their rent.
The lady that served me at Mian has an attitude problem. Otherwise the food was delicious!

I like the Urbanspaces around NYC, it's basically a food court, not the ones I grew up on with an Orange Julius, but I could go for one right now.
This location is on 45th & Vanderbilt, not far from Grand Central.  

So many hipster like food vendors, as long as it tastes good, I'm down!
About 18 vendors were open, it was tough to decide but we did our reconnaissance work and did a few laps around the area, divided up and then made a rally point to meet up when we were done with our mission.

Takumi Tacos:  1 chicken taco and 1 pork. It's Japanese & Mexican fusion, beautiful combo, the flavors were definitely of both cultures, tasty tacos, meat was flavorful, stuffed pretty generously, well made and flavorful, comes with some tortilla chips on the bottom of your box.  

Mr Bing: Tasty meat stuffed crepes but Beijing style (jianbing). It was good, pretty big sized crepe you get, nicely made, very flavorful and I went to town on this.

Black Iron Burgers: We just got the loaded fries here, it was pretty darn good, good portions of shoestring type fries, plenty of cheese for that ooey gooey, handful of real bacon bits and some green onions sprinkled on top. Good item to share and pick at, people at other tables will have some envy.

All the food we tried was delicious, this Urbanspace is good place to stop by and check out all the vendors. Decent amount of seating, community table sharing style (move your stuff so I can sit down), prices aren't too cray, good amount of variety, glad we came by this food hall.

Urbanspace is a fancy food court. They have 3 locations in the city. There are some good food options and lots of seating. Very clean. It's very close to Grand Central. The Chinese crepes seemed very popular.

I'm suddenly craving the quesadillas from La Palapa Taco Bar so I thought I'd write a review instead. First, the industrial decor of Urbanspace gives off a very cozy and chill vibe, and there's two floors with sufficient seating. The amount of eateries in here is just enough to give you options but not too many that it'll leave you overwhelmed. I remember feeling torn when I had to choose between the baos from an Asian stall and the quesadilla from La Palapa Taco Bar, but I ultimately chose the latter. It was probably the best choice that I made that day. I've never eaten a quesadilla like theirs before because the dough was so incredibly crispy and flaky - almost like an Indian pancake. I can honestly say that it's probably the best quesadilla I've ever eaten.
Moynihan Train Hall puts this to shame. Overpriced and subpar food.  Donuts were like lead balloons.  Very little seating, very few healthy options.  Too noisy to meet people.

Lots of good things about this place except no WIFI. I found a seat and an electric plug. I'm resting. They have plenty of name places to eat. Plenty of seating. I'm going to need a bathroom after walking all the way down here!

The space is clean, they open early and no one is harassing me! Every employee is hard at work preparing for opening and the lunch crowds. I've been here at lunchtime and believe me, it gets crazy!

If you're nearby and want lots of food options come in. It's hard not to find something you would enjoy. PLUS the bathroom is clean and well stocked with TP! The floor employees are kind enough to show you where the bathrooms are located also!

We met up with friends here because I really didn't want to decide what kind of food we all ate that night so this place was AWESOME for the indecisive! Think mall food court but high class and hipster. It was such a fun atmosphere, we loved it!

Yes  We need to come here and support the businesses in here. We had pizza from Robertas!
Everything really looks delicious so I'll be checking in again when I'm in the area

Just realized I've never rated this wonderful food hall since the past couple of years with almost 10 check in's. This is my go-to food hall when it comes to a great variety of food choices on the days I just want to try everything. Although at many times, I find myself ordering a bowl of ramen from Kuro-Obi. Kuro-Obi is derived from the famous ramen chain, Ippudo, but it is all about their chicken broth. Even though the portion is small, it's one hearty bowl of noodle soup.

At this food hall, it's inevitable that you would have to fight for seats especially during lunch rush hour. The weekend and happy hour times are not so bad. For happy hour from 4-6pm at Red Hook, you can find yourself a good deal for some fresh oysters ($1.5 standard/ $2 premium). At other places, you will find good deals on drinks, mainly beer, from 4-7pm. Happy hunting!

Nice food hall. Lots of different options and cuisines, some more creative than others. Variety of Asian, seafood, chicken, donuts, pizza, coffee and pastries.

I came here 3 times during my 4 day work trip for either breakfast or lunch. The soup place (Good Stock) in the middle and coffee (Toby's Estate) down on the end were my favorites. I never did get around to trying the Japanese inspired Mexican place, which may have been interesting, or just gimmicky, I'm not sure. Perhaps next time.

Biggest downside is that seating is limited and really cramped during the lunch hour if you are dining in, so I'd recommend taking your meal to go if you don't like loud, overly packed spaces, fending for elbow space while trying to enjoy your meal.

Urbanspace is cool -- another food hall sitch.

Good for lunch, as it has something for everyone.

My issue is that more often than not, something seems to be lacking from some of the food. It's as if the vendors are giving a "budgeted" version of their real restaurants... And for the price (usually $15+ for  lunch), I expect it to be on point. Examples: 1) The Lobster spot -- the mac & cheese was insanely underwhelming -- hardly any flavor and had a weird chared taste from being flash broiled. The lobster grilled cheese was also very underwhelming and super greasy. 2) Ippudo's Kuro Obi -- they hardly include any toppings in the ramen and the flavor just doesn't compare to a bowl of ramen at Ippudo. For $15 a bowl (a small bowl) I expect more. 3) Mr. Bing's beef dumplings were horrible -- I've had better frozen, store bought dumplings.

Places that haven't disappointed: Ovenly, Dough, Roberta's, KBBQ by Korilla, Mimi's Hummus, Liquiteria.

It's nice to have returned to Urbanspace Vanderbilt. Great place for happy hour and to take advantage of HH pricing on beer and wine.

There are quite a few Asian food stalls. Plus, there's seafood, Bob White's friend chicken, Dough donuts, Toby's coffee & pastries, Ovenly cookies & pastries.

It was 5ish. I noticed most ppl were enjoying a drink and talking. Looked like a young working crowd.

The men's and women's bathroom are located in one of the corners of the venue. I didn't see a sign at that corner.

After eating and drinking here, my clothes smelled like I've been cooking at the stove. Guess it's not a well-ventilated venue.

When you don't want to venture into Brooklyn for Dekalb Food Hall but still want a unique lunch experience, this is a great spot. My favorite thing: Bangkok Bar's young coconut water, straight from a young coconut. WOW! Best coconut I've had outside of Hawaii.

Followed the other Yelp reviews and loved the buttery Red Hook lobster roll, Connecticut style (dunked in butter and lemon). So delicious with the potato roll. Pure Americana!

Also enjoyed Roberta's famous Bee Sting Pizza. The crust isn't as good as the new Simo pizza by the Whitney Museum, but the toppings are delicious - sweet and savory and grilled.

Would come back here again to try more!

There are SO MANY food halls being built in NYC with in the recent years, and this isn't necessarily a bad thing.  It allows people to pop into one location and be able to purchase food that satisfies a variety of cravings.  What I enjoyed about Urbanspace Vanderbilt is the wide variety of eateries that are available - from the big name vendors like Dough Donuts and Ippudo's fast food style Kuro Obi to smaller vendors not as well known selling lobster rolls, Asian/Mexican fusion, as well as quinoa bowls and juices, there is definitely something to satisfy what you're looking to eat.  

Unfortunately, the space is small (surprise surprise) and while there are many food stalls, there is very little eating space.  If you're lucky to grab a table or a spot at their standing table, stay there.  Otherwise, you're out of luck and going to need to head back home or back to the office to eat your meal.

I'm not sure why anyone doesn't like food halls.* It's a large place full of delicious things for you to eat.

Urbanspace Vanderbilt is no exception.

With Roberta's, Red Hook Lobster Pound, Delaney Chicken, Mayhem & Stout, Ovenly, 17 different types of tacos, and much more, it's a veritable smorgasbord of tasty treats.

If I had one piece of advice for you, it'd be to get there early for happy hour. Much like anything good in this city, you need to go at off hours if you want to get a seat, or if you don't want to wait in line. Also, booze is cheaper during happy hour.

If I had two pieces of advice for you, it'd be to avoid the mac and cheese at Red Hook Lobster Pound. The seafood was on point as usual, but the mac and cheese was bland and awful.

If I had three pieces of advice for you, it'd be not to forget about Seamore's, hidden upstairs.

If I could stop with this different pieces of advice shtick, I'd also want to tell you that Roberta's pizza is always a winner, Liquiteria's healthy drinks are pricey but worth it if you're a smoothie guy, and that you should floss more.
____________

*Unless they are in the restaurant business. I've heard a few complaints from proprietors/staff that seem legitimate. But on the consumer side, it's all gravy.

I've been here a few times so far. If I worked nearby I'd probably be here a lot more but its again another one of "those" food halls. But its a great selection of restaurant pop ups in a really nicely spread out space. Not to be confused, this isn't inside of Grand Central or that food court in the basement. It's literally across the street in the building next door.

Vendors worth checking out - Bobwhite's chicken sandwiches and biscuits are pretty glorious. I've still never been to the actual restaurant downtown but I'm glad they make appearances in these kinds of places so I could finally check them out! Their chicken is so tender and juicy.

Burgers Hard Times Sundaes - I mean, you can design up to a triple roadside cheeseburger with various toppings.

Korilla bbq - I've actually always enjoyed their location that used to exist near st. marks. But for the first time recently I tried their mac and cheese egg rolls with kimchi and it is glorious. Especially with the side of spicy mayo.

Roberta's Pizza because duh. I haven't had it here but at another food hall and they are always always worth checking out. Plenty of other food options including Red Hook Lobster, Dough, La Palapa tacos, Amali Greek food, and Ovenly cookies.

Lastly, don't forget, there are a couple of bars here. I didn't check out the beer bar downstairs near Farmstand and fully regret because on my way out the door I saw they had a Tiramisu beer from GunHill on tap. Whaaaa- but upstairs there's a really nice cocktail bar done by Seamore's along with some tasty seafood bites on their menu.

We need a food hall in Southern CT! Stopped by here for lunch before heading to a matinee broadway show. There were so many choices! I really had a hard time deciding which stall to get food from. Since we don't have a lot of Korean restaurants from where we live, I decided to get food from the Korilla stall. I had the bibimbap bowl and it was soooo good. Hubby also got some of their wings and he devoured them! We also tried a chicken sandwich from bob white but he said that it was just okay. He wasn't wowed by it. He wished he ordered from a different stall instead.
This place is definitely good if you have a group with you... so you can get different food from different stalls and share! The only downside is not enough tables and the bathroom is quite small.

What a food galore! Sandwiches, poke bowls, noodles, Thai food, coffee, smoothie, Beijing Street food, and more...I love coming here with a big group of people because there's something to satisfy everyone's tastebuds.

Here's the food I got:
From Takumo Taco - lychee tea ($4)
From Mr. Bing - Peiking duck Bing ($15)
From Hai Street Kitchen - make your own poke bowl ($15)

Lychee tea was very refreshing. It was sweet but not too sweet.

Peiking duck Bing is very flavorful with a great cruncy shell. Highly recommend!

Make your own poke bowl - I chose salmon, brown quinoia rice, mixed greens, shrimp tempura crunch, cucumber, tomatoes, with miso ginger dressing.

The food is delicious! I'm happy with all my food choices above.

There is plenty of seating. We came with twenty people and there are tables big enough to seat our entire party. We came on a Sunday afternoon and it was bustling with people.

Note: to find the bathroom, walk past Hai Kitchen and the coffee place, take a left, and you'll be at the bathroom!
Love the eateries inside this cafeteria, especially Jian Bing, which reminds me of summers spent in Beijing, getting 1rmb egg crepes on the back burner of some street-side pushcart vendor!

A solid food hall with at least a dozen vendors running the gamut from Asian to pizza to seafood.

It's a bit hidden in plain sight at the moment as there's scaffolding all around, but once you venture inside you'll remark at how open, airy, and spacious it is. There's a good amount of communal seating at benches and along the walls, and most of the options here are reasonably priced given that this is a busy, prime area atop the Grand Central train tracks and amidst tons of office buildings.

In particular, it's a good place to bring a modestly sized group as you can mix and match among different options or have pickier people find their own choices. Thanks Yelpers for a great find!

One has to love Urbanspace as it gives you a bit of everything that NYC has to offer under a single roof.  If you are hungry, you will definitely find something to satisfy your craving here!  

The possibilities are endless - so don't hesitate to stop in and check it out for yourself.

Outstanding food, outstanding service. Had one of the best dinners of my life here this week. Steak for two, appetizers and a desert assortment along with amazingly kind and attentive service. If you get a chance to eat here don't miss it!

This was my second time attending this private club for Founders Day West Point. Been going for 2 years.
The service is very good. The building is beautiful, but the food is not very good at all
But the staff is very friendly.
They chicken was nice, but i hated the dessert

I'll be back next year....

This is a private social club. You either must be a member or be accompanied as a guest. Unless you are attending a social function that at this very historical and remarkable venue.  I'm not a member but aspire to be. A tour of the club-house one might notice that there are many portraits of US presidents. All but one president have something in common...

Now for the food. Exceptional. The best fois gras in the city. I'm especially partial to the fish. Particularly the spots a la Mitch (spots in a lemon butter sauce but instead of the capers, a heaping helping of shaved almonds).

The staff is exceptional. Everything is first rate.

Visited for a corporate business function The Union League Club - located just off Park Avenue - provided a convenient relaxing five hour stay.

Spacious tables and comfortable chairs the upstairs meeting room allowed one to focus on the meeting agenda with no distractions. Afterwards the downstairs hall was equally comfortable for cocktails. Easy access to food (average at best) and beverage - one could enjoy catching up with business associates.

Friendly and courteous service - no issues whatsoever.

I came here for a Boston College alumni event (Always an Eagle: From the Mods to Manhattan) that welcomed my class into the alumni group, and it was a beautiful venue. We were on the 2nd floor, in, I think, the library area, and it was a space that was decorated in just the way that you might picture a high-end social club--ornate carpeting, floor-to-ceiling bookshelves, a grand piano by the elevators, giant portrait of Abraham Lincoln, and lots of space for activities.

The architecture was remarkable, and gave it more of that traditional feel, as if we'd been transported back to old New York, despite the relatively rowdy crowd (we were loudly reuniting with old friends, making new friends, talking to alumni from 1999 and eariler, etc). The staff was quick and professional, collecting used cutlery and napkins with such expertise that you barely knew they had been there before they were on to the next guest.

The dress code is business casual, but people take it very seriously, and maybe even to the next level. Officially, it's "jackets preferred" for men, though our post-grad crowd was a mix of full-on suits to button down and khakis, with girls mostly in dresses (while it's still warm enough outside, I'm sure).

Came here for a corporate retreat. A long day of guest speakers and speeches. The club is very historical in culture and appearance. Doesn't seem I have a reason to return but while I was there the staff was very helpful and all of our meals were very nicely prepared. I did not bother getting to know the history of the place as its not up my alley at this point in my life but the older men at the firm seemed to appreciate it.

I was brought here by a member, for that which I am fortunate, and thoroughly enjoyed my time here.

A refreshing oasis from the city's hustle and bustle, the ULC and its building (originally owned by the J.P. Morgan family) are a wonderful part of New York City - of today and yesteryear. I aspire to be a member at this private social club. The gentlemen here are polite, driven and have purpose. The staff is incredibly professional and truly care about your experience while here. The ULC leaves a lasting impression long after you've left.

The history of this place is remarkable. Similar in kind to the Dallas Petroleum Clubs of the South, the Union League Club has made its own mark on American History and World History with its members ranging from Heads of Industries, to Senators, to U.S. Presidents.

As a member, you have access to a plethora of services ranging from event spaces to wonderful networking opportunities as well as a world class speaker events. The bar has an awesome flag from the 13 original colonies that has its own story, that hangs above-and-center to the bar.

Dress code is strict, but simple: formal business attire during weekdays (business casual is allowed, but business attire is encouraged) until 4pm on Friday (no jackets needed then, but are encouraged. Ties not required, but highly encouraged, and mandatory "only during dinner hours in the Mary Murray Room and Lounge, and at evening committee events, except where the event announcement states otherwise. Jackets may be removed when playing billiards."

The members here are truly great. A walk though the President's Room is mandatory if you wish to understand the full significance of The ULC, and as others have posted, all 15 Presidents have something in common.

Attended a function there, and it continues to be one of the best clubs in the city.  I have been going there for many years, and I am always amazed at the beauty every time I visit.  

Steeped in tradition, the club is private, but if you are there as a guest it is recommended that you spend some time to admire the architecture and grandeur of NY past.  

For a large gathering, the food and presentation were excellent. The steak was even cooked to my order! Where do you get that when attending a function?

Nice place all around.

Getting past the dark wood, austere portraits and exceedingly stuffy clientele at the Union League Club is difficult. The place strikes me as old-school and uptight even by New York club standards. Founded during the middle of the Civil War - as a refuge from the draft riots that were plaguing the city at the time? - with its last major renovation seemingly held just a few years later, the club offers very little to the casual guest.

I've been here a few times for banquets, and while it projects grandeur, each time I've found it falling short when it comes to presentation. At these prices and with this much attitude, things should run smoothly. Instead I've been treated to mics plagued by feedback, ancient projection systems and bars stocked with cut rate hard alcohol and beer selections. While I'm sure some of the deficits were the particular choices of the events I've attended, I don't think at any price point overcooked duck should be tolerated, or dry chocolate desserts.

I suppose there's a time and place for this sort of black-tie, best-behavior affair. I only wish the Union League Club would ensure that the experience is in line with the effort it takes to get in here.

A private social club where social graces are the rule, not the exception, including,

-- Dressing the way people should be dressed to a club like the Union League (you may be refused admission if your shoes are wrong, nevermind just your shirt)
-- Signing in to the book
-- No cellphones permitted except in designated areas (thank you, thank you, thank you)
-- Smoking room
-- Overall old-school gentility and attention to service
-- Dining that exemplifies the best of classic New York, as in, a most excellent Lobster Roll.

Other notes:

The presidential portrait room indeed does celebrate presidents with "something in common" as noted by another Yelper.

If you are lucky enough to get in as a guest, membership or reciprocal membership, you have a unique social sanctuary in New York steeped in American history.

Finer dining experience.  I invited as a club mbers guest. We sat at a beautiful table over looking the city. The menu was smaller but everything was cooked and served with great attention. The sea bass & risotto were the most tasty I've ever had. It was served with a sauce on the side that I never tried because the meal stood alone as perfection! The history of the building around you made want to read and experience all of the portraits and documents. I wish I had more time experience the location.  I hope I have another opportunity to visit. I
Every step you take feels like you're making history. All and all, an instant classic

This place is wonderful, I was lucky enough to be a guest here on a Friday lunch time, it was spectacular!

That was the most cooked lobsters I've ever seen, and I lived in Maine!

If you can get in here, do! That all I can say, it was Seafood heaven!

Private club, but great for conferences, special event dinners and award ceremonies. I've attened several functions here and have always been impressed with their professionalism and quality of food.

A must see if you're planning a special event.

We asked for a "superior room" and are paying a fortune for it...turns out the tiny room we got is considered superior because the "corner rooms which are larger" are being used --even though we reserved months ago!

Also, the door staff doesn't always answer the phone...called about 3 times and didn't get an answer!  Hello...anyone home?

I was here recently for a company celebration and it was a good experience.

Didn't get a chance to explore the whole building but our event was held on the second floor.  There are two rooms, the library which we used for drinks and hors d'oeuvres and the dining room for dinner and dancing.  Some people might not have liked the venue but I thought it was interesting.  The walls are lined with American Civil War books (the most comprehensive collection) and the dining room had paintings of historical figures -- the place just reeks of history.  

Service was great, we had enough wait staff to take care of our large group (200+ people).  Venue has a spacious layout too so you are able to setup according to your needs.  I was happy with the hors d'oeuvres, they tasted better than the main dinner entrees.  We hired our own band and florist, so everything turned out well and everyone had a great time.

I have only been here once, for a wedding reception, but it was amazing. Such a good time. I love the old historical feel of the place and the artifacts displayed. Makes you think you are back at a party 100 years ago. The levels and complexity of the place is intriguing and the appetizer spread and passed appetizers were SO yummy. I recommend having any party here, though not sure how accessible it is to the general public.

A gorgeous space for functions. Surprisingly bad passed food. Pigs in a blanket? please.
Probably depends on the budget of the event, but some choices would never be appropriate in my opinion served in a space like this.
One day I will be successful & wealthy and I will join this club to drink fine aged alcohol with the elites.

mostly super WASPy gents drinking G&T and playing billiards while wearing their khakis and gold button blazers. However these clubs are struggling to stay open so they are allowing members to entertain in rooms that Abraham Lincoln once stood in.. the kind of folks who would have been working the land during the time of Lincoln are now walking through the front doors and enjoying the laid back and very civilized settings
A balance between establishment and progress - they even have quesadilla on the bar menu! it is still mostly WASP men over 60 here though which I really don't mind.  They would hardly crank up hip hop music and wear cut offs.

As can be expected the drinks are stiff and the food bland as you may expect

This is one of the most Elite Clubs in NYC.  The building is beautiful and rich in history.  The Union League Club was founded in 1863 by a group of concerned citizens to help preserve the Union.  The Club also played an essential role in the founding of the American Red Cross. It helped erect the Statue of Liberty in New York Harbor and the Lincoln Monument in Union Square. Its members were instrumental in bringing down the "Boss" Tweed ring and in raising funds to outfit American soldiers in several conflicts.  
The restaurant on the fourth floor, the Mary Murray Room, reflects a subdued elegance with a chef and wine cellar that compare favorably with any in the city.  The grill room on the first floor is great for an early dinner or a quick lunch.  
I've had my sister and her friends stay in the newly renovated overnight rooms.  They're stay was extremely comfortable and pleasant.  Also, a gym in the basement for members and over night guests, complete with gorgeous squash courts.  
If you are accompanied with a fellow member, check out the golf simulator on the fourth floor. It's like Wii Nintendo for adults.  
So many great qualities to an elite NYC club.  The club regularly has entertaining events, special guest speakers, organized offsite events (theatre, golf, shooting, wine tasting), and library evenings featuring guest authors.  
Great for corporate events as well.

If you're looking for a venue to host a meeting or event, this is not a bad place to try. The building is impressive and the food is good, and although the service is a bit lacking, the location, accessibility and atmosphere makes up for it.
Private club, but great for conferences and lunch. I was very impressed with their professionalism and quality of food.

What a beautiful club that emanates grandeur, class, and history! I was here for a lecture and found the library and hall on the second floor absolutely charming. The waitstaff and service were professional and it was really a great venue for this type of speaker event.  I love visiting clubs in the city - such a nice change from the bar scene and usual venue space.  I hope to revisit for another lecture.

A lot of history but don't expect luxury accommodations; I was here on business June 2014; very old rooms; however the library is stunning; the staff are very friendly and the wine selection from the bar is amazingly good; the location is also great within walking distance to a lot.
The experience of enjoying good food and good drinks in this beautiful historic building is a great memory maker for those who want one.

What a historic, beautiful club!  I've been once before for a wedding reception but got to go this week with my boyfriend and his family for a scotch tasting, dinner and a round of virtual golf!  Sorry no pictures with this review - I learned at the coat check there are no phones allowed.  One star deducted because we had to wait almost an hour for our appetizers to arrive, but they kept the bread and wine coming while we waited.  My pheasant main course was by far the juiciest I've ever had before.   The staff was beyond professional and the library, ballroom and dining room are such beautiful classic spaces!

Was lucky enough to join a friend of mine for lunch here. I'm a young guy and hadn't thought I'd ever get access to an establishment like this. He gave me a tour of the building and its history. Terrific decor, wonderful art and a beautiful library. They have, among their collection, a multi-part encyclopedia of every telegram written and sent during the Civil War - apparently one of two such collections in existence. How cool is that?!?! . Large billiard tables, kind staff that know the members well. What a treat!

This December was the 3rd year my company held our Christmas party at this club. Every year we have been treated to great food in an elegant, historic setting with excellent service. Doesn't get much better than this in my opinion.

Nice and bright modern setting with fun EDM playing in the background.

Service is excellent and very friendly.

All the food was delicious with really nice gluten free and vegetarian/vegan options. Wonderful variety of flavors that sing along with some tasty small desserts too.

This place closes at 2PM for lunch but we showed up a little later and they were very gracious and let us come in and order anyway. Service was great and so were the sandwiches!!

My aunt is vegetarian and lover her avocado sandwich!

I got the croissant with bacon (cooked perfectly), egg, cheese, arugula (dressed well) and I added an avocado.

Both sandwiches were great. Place is super cute. Also came with a mini brownie which was fantastic.

So happy we stopped by!

I'd say 3.5-4. Food was excellent. Atmosphere is just ok. Service was ok. Everyone was SO nice, but ordering was tough. Wanted just a side of scrambled eggs for example and the server didn't know how to do that outside of ordering a sandwich with eggs on it and then taking the eggs off. Just little things.

The avocado toast was great. The lattes were great.
Lovely experience. The place is small but have both indoor and outdoor. Option of breakfast is really good and portions r reasonable size. Staff r friendly and coffee is very good.

Pretty good spot with vegan options. I like the vegan sandwiches and they've all been tasty. Don't get the dumplings. It's clearly just frozen dumplings you could buy yourself. The beverages are cute as well.

This is a really cute brunch spot!!! Love the aesthetics here and the service here is super friendly. My friend got here 30-40 minutes after I did, and the waiter was patient and ok with her coming later.

I sat in the courtyard area with my friend which is really great on a nice day out. I got the turkey bacon bagel and it came with a complimentary brownie and tangerine. It was really good and very filling overall.

I also got myself an iced vanilla latte which was really delicious and it is semi-sweet, the way I like it. It was cute how it came in a can!

I would come back here again, particularly for the ambience and relatively good brunch food. They have a lot of other vegetarian and vegan options which makes it a lot more inclusive! They serve other Asian-fusion dishes that I would like to try as well.

Having a healthy, wholesome, and delicious breakfast here was delightful. The unique ceiling design let the soothing sound of rain filter through. I particularly enjoyed the kosher sandwich layered with avocado and eggs. The kimchi dumplings stood out with their freshness and uniqueness. Pairing their matcha latte with ginger not only added flavor but also offered a health boost.

Came here in a group of 3 on a weekday at 11:30 and got seated right away. I liked how the hot drinks were in these aluminum cans and they used these wooden baskets instead of plates for the food.  

We picked this place because my two friends were vegan. This place had many vegan and non vegan options! For the food itself, they were all great. My friends enjoyed their vegan dishes and I really enjoyed the sous vide chicken breast panini. The dip, orange, and brownie were nice touches to the panini.

I can see myself returning in the future!

Such a yummy meal here! As a solo vegan traveler visiting NYC, I wanted something that would be delicious and filling - this definitely did the trick! The staff were very nice, the restaurant was well decorated and clean, and overall I had a wonderful experience. I would recommend!

If you like Ube lattes, then look no further. They can make them with oat milk too which is my jam. The breakfast sandwiches were excellent too. It's a bit pricey, but isn't everything near Time's Square? We ended up visiting back to back days because it was that good. The second day I tried my ube latte iced. It was just as good as hot. Definitely recommend it. Pro tip: There are 2 doors. Left side is to go orders and right side is dine in. Go to the left side to order your drinks, they give you a larger size, than when you sit down.
This brunch spot was amaizing.  Asian fusion, or avacado toast...it's all at UT47.  Try the dumplings.

I'm giving 3 stars b/c the service was very friendly, but the food here is the definition of mediocre. We came as a group of 3 on a Sunday afternoon around 1pm and was seated immediately. I ordered the sweet baked bacon grilled cheese panini. There was really nothing creative, unique, or technique in this sandwich. It's like they literally took regular ingredients from Trader Joe's, stacked it, and threw it in a panini press. The green sauce it came with was more like a dressing. Since the sandwich was glued shut with melted cheese anyways it's not like I wanted to forcefully open the sandwich to spread the sauce (so it became a dip?). I thought $17 expensive for this. The brownie that came on the side was pretty good though.

We were looking for a brunch spot this past weekend and stumbled upon UT47. I really liked the atmosphere inside, and the sandwiches were both delicious. We ordered the sweet baked chicken grilled cheese and the sous vide chicken breast panini. While it was REALLY good, the only critique is that it was a little overpriced considering it only came with the sandwiches that were $16-$17 each, and to add tomato soup was an additional $7. We were impressed that they did add in a strawberry and small brownie bite in there as well. The service was good!Definitely worth checking out!

What a hidden gem! We had been wanting to visit this cute spot for a while and finally got to doing it yesterday. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. We were taken to the outdoor patio area for our table, which was beautifully decorated like a garden with flowers, plants, and lots of wooden elements.
We ordered the Avocado toast and vegan BLT sandwich. They both arrived in cute wooden boxes with a complimentary vegan blueberry muffin and strawberry. It felt like we were given a Tiffin box, each with fruits, food, and dessert. This was such a pleasant surprise and really made our day! Their drinks selection is massive and very unique, with amazing flavors that they have experimented with and perfected. Our drinks arrived in cute can like containers which we were allowed to take with us.
The service was very friendly and attentive. It was apparent in how the owner herself brought in our order to the table and explained each item. She's a sweetheart who chatted with us for a while and even offered to take our picture, which we had been struggling to take.
Fun fact: the restaurant is named after her initials UT! The waiters were also super friendly and paid close attention to our needs by getting us napkins before we even asked for them.
Overall, 5/5 restaurants, which I would 100% visit again and again!

UT47 came highly recommended as a brunch place in the city by one of my friends. After trying it, I would definitely put it in one of the top 3 brunch locations I've tried in the city. The exterior looks very unassuming but the back patio-ish resembling place is very cute. The front was completely filled, but thankfully there were a couple empty tables in the back. We scanned QR codes on the table for the menu, after which we ordered the avocado toast with soft egg and a matcha latte and an avocado roasted beet hummus toast with taro latte.

My favorite part of the meal was the complimentary clementine and muffin that were brought out with our orders. Our food was brought out in containers seen in dim sum and our avocado toasts were delicious. The avocado was fresh, the arrangement of seeds on top made it seem extra healthy, and it was overall a great experience.

I would definitely come back to try something else on their extensive menu!

Tucked away at the heart of Hell's Kitchen sits a hip Korean fusion take on a brunch cafe called UT47. If there are three words that could best describe the cuisine, it would be 1) Avocado, 2) Latte and 3) Breakfast.

Taste: 4/5
Ambience: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Value for Money: 3.5/5

There is indoor and semi outdoor dining in the back where we sat, we had:

1) Avocado Tuna Melt Panini - ($16) Rich in flavour, for those who like Tuna fish sandwiches, this is a godsend, for those that aren't the biggest on them, it would be worth splitting this one given the richness (first few bites are great, the later few get tough)
2) Open face bacon egg cheese and avocado on a bagel - An elevated bacon egg and cheese bagel
3) Mermaid Latte - Oatty
4) Taro Latte - like a tarp bubble tea but latte style!

All in all, the place elevates a lot of brunch staples using a good amount of avocado and presentation. Instead of tap, they provide bottled water and a already packed togo cup for their lattes, not only does this give a nice touch but it's definitely easier for them to clean dishes!

The first thing that needs to be mentioned is the kind and gracious and knowledgeable greeting and service received by our server Jasmine who is also the general manager.  As my fiancé said, my day was going great but it got even better (because Jasmine was so sweet to us).  
They have a dedicated vegan menu and I got the vegan chicken Panini and Chandler got the vegan BLT on gluten-free bread. We both got lattes with oat milk, but I found that they had macadamia milk which I will get next time we go.
The sandwiches were nothing short of amazing. And they come with a little extra vegan muffin which was such a nice touch. Presentation and food and service was excellent and we will be back.

I've always had trouble finding good, quick, and yummy food before a Broadway show, and @ut47manhattan is definitely it! Love that it's vegan and has quite a few options for a healthy and filling meal. They come with a piece of fruit and a small muffin as well!
The best meal we had all weekend! So good! Drinks were great. A lot of food for the price and we all enjoyed every item we received! Very cute place with kind servers.

This place is cute little cafe with amazing food and the most delicious taro latte. I ordered the breakfast bagel and it came with a free homemade brownie which was a nice surprise. The service was friendly too.

Aaaaamazing spot for breakfast. Service was awesome and the place was super cute. The food was delicious - everything I needed  to recover from a night out. The orange juice picked me up and cured me!! Each plate also came with a mandarins and a homemade brownie that was gifted by the kitchen (delicious).  This place was more on the pricey side for sure, so expect to drop a bit of $$$ but worth it. Excited to come back and try out more items in the menu!

Wow. Excellent service, fantastic food. As soon as I took the first bite my immediate thought was when is the earliest I can come back to this place. It was that good. The only drawback is that it is tiny. It's not someplace to bring a big group but for yourself or two people, it's perfect!

I only just discovered this little place when it looks like it's been here for several years now - I wish I'd found it sooner!

They have a great menu with many vegan and gluten-free options, but plenty of options for omnivores as well. Great bubble tea, lattes, and coffee drinks, too, with multiple plant-based non-dairy milk options. Also a nice selection of baked goods, a few of which are vegan and/or gluten-free.

I came with two omnivore friends - one who went for a vegan sandwich, as did I. All three of us were amazed at the beautiful presentation of our plates - our sandwiches were served in dim sum steaming trays and came with a small muffin and a few pieces of fruit for dessert.  All three of us LOVED our food and drinks.

I am most definitely coming back to try more of their vegan items!

I was a little apprehensive about the prices, but now that I see that just about each order comes with fruit and small muffin, it seems much more worth it.

There are maybe four small tables inside that are squished together (and all were taken while we were there), and they have two small tables outside as well. So, not a lot of seating if you're eating there.

Loved this place! Cute vibes and I enjoyed their cold brew black (though there are a lot of other unique drinks as well). I got the salmon avocado toast and the dressing was really unique and flavorful. The service was great, the staff are really kind and seem to care about the customers.

Fantastic, small, local, healthy, friendly. All in one place.

This is a very small place with a great experience. Come off hours so you can get a table and enjoy your food.

Service was very attentive. You walk right through cashier to order. Check their menu online and be ready with your order so they can be fast.

Avocado toast with salmon was delicious. The bread was perfect texture and super tasty. Generous portions of avocado sliced very well and the egg was cooked the way I like it. All this on a bed of arugula and a super tasty home made sauce that was so y delicious. They included a strawberry and brownie on the side.

They have so many options for coffee too!

We will come again to try their sandwiches for lunch!

Where do I begin, this place is an Ode to the Irritable Bowl Syndrome (IBS) diet.  I traveled to New York for a college alumni holiday party with some concern about where I could eat w/o a stomach episode. Of course I whipped out my Yelp app (I mean bible) to stay on the right course within proximity of where I stood. This restaurant sat nestled between 8th and 9th ave within a residential neighborhood (lucky them!).

Whether you are Vegan/Vegetarian, Gluten-Free, or just looking for delicious comfort food, this is your place.  The kicker is that you don't have to choose. Everything on the menu can be made either regular, gluten-free, or vegan. EVERYTHING!  I ordered the #22 (Open-faced bacon, egg, and cheese bagel). As someone with both a dairy and gluten intolerance. I started to order everything I could with intention to pack for later (this was real food lol).  I even added tomatoe soup, and lavender tea.  They transformed the entire meal into a vegan and gluten free dream..right down to spreading homemade matcha sauce on the bagel for the essence of butter and coconut cream in the soup. They even caramelized a banana and added a mini vegan/gluten free brownie for a touch of dessert without my ordering it.

It was the dedication to ingredient details for me without even a slight loss to taste or presentation. This place was truly a dream for this DC girl.  Go and Thank me later!

Very cute but small spot! I had ordered a couple of macaroons and coffee while walking by and noticing this place. The coffee was very unique, it was in a can, and it was delicious! They have a number of specialty coffees and everything tasted great. Would definitely stop by again!

This place is one of my absolute favs!!! The beef bulgolgi tacos, the vegan grilled cheese, the creamy tomato soup, the specialty hot drinks, the attention to detail and the love I taste in the food! Annnd the owners!!! I love this place!!!!

I still love this place. We come from out of state and make it a point to come here. It's nothing fancy but the food and service are amazing. Jasmine, the GM, helped us today and she was so kind and helpful. The presentation of the meal for it to be a sandwich is fantastic. I genuinely love this place. Especially good for people who have dietary restrictions and/or who are Kosher or vegan. They have fabulous options and they take care to be mindful of these issues.

This is a new favorite! My coworkers are always grabbing lunch from here and the presentation for takeout always made me curious: sandwich comes with some fruit and a little dessert/brownie. So cute like momma packed it up. I finally popped in last weekend for myself and this place did not disappoint.  The vegan tacos were divine and I love the cans they serve hot drinks in.  My chai latte with oat was delicious and stayed nice and hot. Lots of vegan options!

It was so hard to find a good place with tasty vegan/dairy-free food in the theatre district/Times Square area & this place blew us away. The ambiance is gorgeous & the servers were all so friendly!

There's two entrances - one for take-out & one for dine-in, but they have it labelled on the stairs which is which. HIGHLY Recommend

So good! This is a great little spot with a bunch of vegan options and attentive service. It is a small space that adds to the intimate ambiance. I'm very happy to have had a chance to enjoy a vegan breakfast while in NYC.

Very small restaurant on 48th that is easily overlooked but unforgettable once you've been. They have a very cool way of serving your fresh drink: inside a sealed 12 oz aluminum can. Our waiter said that was a traditional Korean method, and the owners are korean. Made sense once he explained that. Too fun!
We had breakfast and loved it. Definitely going back!

Normally, this is our go to spot for coffee in this neighborhood.

Completely unacceptable behavior from a restaurant with such high ratings. I have been here many times and will not be returning. EVER. My girlfriend was picking up breakfast and coffee while walking her dog from my apartment. Not only did the restaurant take exceedingly long to make the food, the owner YELLED in front of the whole restaurant at my girlfriend when she was grabbing the food because she had her dog with her. This was extremely embarrassing for her. Before this, she was waiting respectfully outside. If the restaurant does not allow dogs, they should let us know BEFORE we pay for the food.

Honestly, this is unacceptable. This made us feel extremely uncomfortable and disrespected. Restaurants should have a need to make their long time customers feel at home. We will never be returning and suggest other customers stop as well until management understands the concept of respect.

0/5 stars.

The food was AMAZING I had the vegan BLT, it is probably the best vegan sandwich I've ever had. 10/10 absolutely recommend. My friend also loved their smoked turkey bacon thingy on a croissant. And the drinks were amazing too! I got the ginger honey one, and they come in the cutest cup! (See pic). They also give you a little fruit and baked good with your food, it's the cutest place. And the staff was so nice! I don't remember our waiter's name but they were so kind. So glad I found this place, I will definitely be back.

Was looking for breakfast nearby and this popped up. What a wonderful hidden gem... I say that because it's so small but once you find it and walk in, you know that you are in for a treat. Everything looks good and the attention to detail as well as kind service made the experience fantastic. Highly recommend, especially if you enjoy vegan and you loved ones don't  you can all be happy here.

Laptop-free cafe.

I come here for their superfood latte, so I got a taro latte (5/5). I love it!! It tastes like some Thai dessert but I can not figure out what it is. I ordered with the regular whole milk. A little bit sweet and smell lovely. I feel regret that it doesn't come with beautiful latte art, but is okay.

Sous vide chicken breast panini with sundried tomato pes (4/5)
I didn't expect that it will come with a little desert and a fruit. The bread grilled perfectly. When it come right away, it was crispy on the outside and have a chewy texture that I like. For the dipping sauce, I am not sure what is exactly called but it tastes like mayo with wasabi. Good pairing with the bread.

A brownie and plum were perfect to finish the meal. Recommend this place
AMAZING! Food! Delicious and tons of gluten free options, definitely worth the trip if in NY and GF!!! Thank you!

I had the vegan BLT and it was one of the best sandwhiches I've ever had. It also came with a little vegan blueberry muffin, some fruit, and matcha sauce. The tofu marinade was amazing. My mom had a turkey bacon bagel sandwhich and really liked it!
At 9:30 AM, on a Saturday, there was about a 10 min wait, but once we ordered, our food came quick! The owner chef brought our plates to the table and told us about everything. She was so nice and sweet.
Lovely small spot with a personal touch in presentation and food quality. Jasmine, the general manager- thank you for your kind service. Good choice of vegan options.

A small shop offering a range of drinks, both alcoholic and non alcoholic, canned and uncanned.

UT47 place is a great spot to go for a morning coffee and small treats run. They even offer soju-margaritas if you're in the mood for it. My favorite thing about here is that they offer their drinks canned, so you can keep it sealed tight and fresh to open at your convenience. The staff and owner is also super nice and was very welcoming for us.

My only negative would be that because they are a smaller coffee shop, expect a bit of a wait for your order.

Pros:
- canned drinks
- sojuritas
- friendly staff

Cons:
- wait is longer than expected

For someone who is plant-based, this small restaurant is incredible. You can order in or to-go, my friends and I ate in. I love trying plant-based food that isn't typically on the menu at a majority of places, so I was excited to explore their diverse options in their vegan section. Our waiter was very kind and the food came out very quickly. I also got the Taro Latte with Oatmilk, which I recommend anyone to try one of their lattes! When I find myself back in Manhattan, I will be visiting this place again.

Really yummy!! I ordered the vegan breakfast sandwich with tofu bacon and it was soooo good. The taste of the tofu bacon was better than any I've had. Would definitely recommend. I also got a latte with dark chocolate and caramel (all their syrups are dairy free) and oat milk and it was really good!

I saved this spot for so long because I want to try their pretty Mermaid Latte. Once I arrived there, I didn't even look for the menu and I ordered the Mermaid Latte right away. I ordered hot latte (despite it was on the hottest day) just because I wanted the cute latte art with the rose petals. Unfortunately, the latte I got looked nothing alike the photo on their menu (It arrived with the lid on and without latte art or rose petals). I asked if they could put the rose petals, the staff just said they ran out of the petals. I would be totally fine if they told me before ordering so that I would order cold one instead of hot one. I ended up braving the heat for nothing. The drink tastes good tho (3.5/5 for the drink)
I will try again. See if I will adjust the ratings.

I've only ordered delivery, SEVERAL times, but the quality of the food and presentation of the orders are more than enough to say this place rocks. Excellent vegan menu, delicious food, LOVE that each order comes with a fruit and a muffin, how thoughtful!
Favorites of the vegan dishes are the vegan blt and the bagel with "egg" and "bacon" and tomato and avocado. So yummy!
Whenever I'm in the area, this is my go-to for lunch, hands down!

I love this little hole in the wall spot in Hells Kitchen! Tons of clearly labeled vegan options for both beverages & food. They have so many choices of non dairy milk it is amazing. Oat, soy, almond, hemp, macadamia, coconut! They have a wide range of drinks, such as espresso drinks, flavored lattes, cold brew and many teas.

It is also such a great spot to pick up a quick vegan snack or meal. They have a few vegan sandwiches such as a soy "chicken" panini and a vegan breakfast bagel. I will say that I hope they will switched to Just Egg or something- the vegan egg they use is not that great and I've had better egg substitutes. The vegan panini is definitely on the decadent side as it has vegan cheese, oil, mayo. So not so healthy per se, but delicious flavor wise! I preferred the vegan BLT over the vegan soy chicken. When you get their sandwiches, they give some free sides-- a tangerine & a mini muffin! So cute.

I recently tried their vegan veggie mandu- SO yummy! One of my favorite veggie dumplings I've tried.

I have not tried it yet but they carry mochidoki mochi ice cream here including the non dairy flavors! No need to go all the way to the mochidoki store downtown.

Currently- indoor seating is closed during COVID-19. There are small side tables outdoors but not that great as it is a busy street. I suggest to just get take out and go!

I will be supporting this place frequently :)

The vegan soy chicken pamini and vegan blt were super tasty. We ordered both and halfed them to be able to try both. Great decision! They also gave me a little vegan blueberry muffin to try out that want overly sweet or too much blueberry flavor. Also, the vegan tomato soup was a nice touch to dip the last little bit of the panini in.  great place in hells kitchen
Delicious vegan fare, creative recipes, excellent service. Highly recommend checking this place out.

Nice little cafe nestled into a compact space in Hell's Kitchen.

The menu offers fast casual, almost Bodega style meals.

They have a great range of vegan and gluten free options so it's great for those with specific dietary requirements.

Fun fact, they actually serve hot drinks in a can.

Food here is amazing and there are plenty of options for everyone. I came with two friends - one who is vegetarian and one who is gluten-free - and both loved their food. Two of us ordered the avocado toast and one ordered chickpea + avocado sandwich. All entrees came with a side of fruit and small pastry. The portion size is good and the flavor is wonderful. There are also many options for lattes and teas and they come in a can so you can buy a few to-go :). Staff members are also extremely friendly.

Hunger comes to cease here.  With all their sandwiches at about $7 and  packed, overpaying for deli sandwiches comes to R.I.P here as well.  

United is completely unassuming standing quietly on the outer skirts of Hell's Kitchen, with most of its patrons drawing from the residents in the area.  Though I don't live here, I do go to church in the area and need to get my grub on after service and before basketball (yes, at church) without paying much and using as little time as possible.  The selection is strong and you really won't grow wrong with anything here.  I love the salami, turkey, and pastrami heroes.  Descriptive, I know, but just go check out their menu.

Their MASH soda is $1.75 here.

I also bought a pair of socks here as well for $2.  I won't do it again.
Usual Deli with cheap sandwiches. I would recommend this place if you are looking to grab a sandwich. They have both hot and cold sandwiches.
Ordered a ham and Swiss toasted on a croissant, got a cold ham and Swiss and they charged me $8. Insane... will never go back.

Deli sandwiches are very good. I normally order the roast beef however my friend had the tuna sandwich and the hot pastrami and he said they both we very delicious. I literally wanted to buy another one last night right after I ate it. They have there own numerical list of heros to kind of give you a basic guideline of the choices available, which I'm guessing makes it easier so your not just standing there holding up the line looking at the menu not sure what you want on you hero.
Overall I have been there every Tuesday for the past month and I will continue. Dudes that work behind the counter are cool. Would be better if it came with drink but for under $7 can't really complain.

Walking past this establishment and found two employees cleaning the food grill on the dirty public sidewalk. They did not rinse or clean on the grill. They proceeded to bring it back into the restaurant.

Best local sandwich spot in the city. Affordable, large selection, amazing bread, and made fresh. I've lived in Hell's Kitchen for a year and only recently discovered this deli inside an unassuming grocer. I was floored and have been back almost daily since.

I'm not really sure that in NYC, you are going to find a place that has a better price to size to taste ratio. Their menu with prices are available on their website and you'll be able to see what I am talking about there at least in terms of price. What the menu doesn't tell you is if the food tastes good or how large the sandwiches are.

Well I can tell you the sandwiches are huge and the sandwiches are delicious.

In short, this place has portions and taste consistent with what you would expect in NYC but has prices consistent with what you would expect in a rural town.

I haven't had EVERYTHING on the menu so I don't want to vouch for everything. For example, their garlic chicken sandwich as well as their chicken parm (which uses the garlic chicken) is WAY too garlicky. But their regular chicken (grilled and fried) is superb. Their regular deli meat (turkey / roast beef etc) is superb. Their bread is superb. And obviously you can order things to order / make substitutions and don't need to stick to the menu as is standard with any deli.

Don't get me wrong... this isn't the BEST deli in NYC in terms of taste. But the chances of you being disappointed with your order in terms of taste are very low. It's very very good. But this may be the best deli in NYC when it comes to taste combined with value. Incredible.

They do get crowded during the lunch rush and usually only have two guys making sandwiches but it still goes by pretty quickly. You won't have to wait around too long.

This location has no tables so all orders are to go. There is a small "market" in there where you can purchase drinks, chips, cookies etc. They also have baked goods like muffins, croissants etc. Not a huge selection of baked goods... but a selection nonetheless. They also sometimes feature a soup. But I don't think there are multiple soups you can get every day. There is just one soup of the day and that's it.
The sandwiches here are on point - my go-to is the Cuban Sandwich. They have everything else you need - Takis, Little Debbies and Soda. What more could you ask for?

My fiancé brought me home a hero and it was delicious. Turkey, provolone, lettuce, tomato, avocado and mayo. Although he brought it home to me hours later the bread didn't taste soggy. The sandwich was a huge for $7. Afterwards I was full and my NY hero craving was complete!
This place has some CHEAP sandwiches but let me warn you that this place is a dive! Tastes great but its DIRTY! Fly's in the deli case and people still eat here! I guess that says it all.

Reasonable prices for the sandwiches, especially within the area If you get a hero sandwich, honestly might as well eat it with a fork and knife, because the size of the sandwiches they make...make subways look like chumps. Yes ladies & gentleman, large portion. I've bought a honey turkey, swiss w/lettuce, tomato on a roll once during an Odesza concert and my jaw was hurting because thats how much chewing I had to do because of the large portions going into that roll. Matter of fact...I just had another roll yesterday before class =D
Grilled chicken gave me food poisoning, never again. Cooks are rude and the cashiers are nice.

Great sandwiches made fresh and correctly.  Reading the one star reviews for this place dismays me. If you expect Nordstrom's customer service at a place that charges $6 for a huge sandwich then disappointment is probably a big part of your life.  Singling out a small, inexpensive deli seems strangely petty.

Here in New York, your local bodega, deli, corner store, whatever you want to call it, is, much like your laundromat or dry cleaners, most often chosen based on proximity and not much else.  There is literally one every two to three blocks, and most of them are pretty much identical.  It's open 24 hours, there's a sandwich bar, there's lots of sundries and snacks, cigarettes and things like laundry detergent and toilet paper for those late night emergencies. This is my bodega.

But the United We Stand Deli deserves a review for two reasons.  One, it's called The United We Stand Deli, which is just awesome for so many reasons (although the true brilliance of this title is really only appreciated by my former roommate, myself, and anyone who worked at Galveston Outdoor Musicals in the summer of 2002).  

The second is for the #38 sandwich, which, in the absence of any good pizza within a two block radius of my apartment, has become my late-night go-to snack.  Go get one, it's amazing, and it only costs $5.50.  God Bless America.
Def my fave deli in the area!! This place gets poppin' during lunch. Awesome wraps and hot sandwiches!

I used to walk home from "The Rambles" (a party at The Park, on 10th Avenue) on Sunday Nights / Monday mornings, and would stop in here fairly frequently for a pack of cheap cookies or an egg sandwich... Between 17th street and 94th street (and West End Avenue), this was my deli of choice time and time again.

Recently, I've been exploring the bodegas of 10th avenue before bedtime, it's a little bit of adventure not too far away... And, once again, a few years later, somehow, this place still stands out.

The service is extremely friendly, like really super-duper friendly... There's a decent selection of fresh produce and breads and beverages and canned food and toiletries -- all at decent prices, and the store is really clean and well-lit... The only shortcoming I can find: they don't sell alcohol, so that means I can't brown-bag it on my walk home with my late night sandwiches -- which, by the way, they do very well here.

Of all the delis in Hell's Kitchen this one is my fave. A sandwich on hero (about $7-8) makes two meals for me. They definitely don't scrimp on the filling. Pastries are fresh too. They make such brisk business that the foods are always fresh.

Another bodega/deli in Hell's Kitchen.  This place offers a better range of household supplies and staples than their competition across the street, but I don't like their sandwiches as much.  All in all, a decent bodega that has what you need, 24/7.  

NOTE:  NO BEER!!

Ok so I'm going to insert a picture so you can decide if that is chicken .. I ordered the chicken breast wrap from United on seamlesss , So I assumed that the chicken would be cooked . When the wrap arrived it looked like turkey and was super cold to the touch, being pregnate I can't have cold cuts so I called and informed the man who answered that there was a mistake wit my order, I ordered a chicken breast wrap . He insisted that the cold cut mystery meat was what I ordered and that he will not replace the sandwhich. He was super rude and unempathedic to my situation . I am from the midtown neighborhood and order samdwhichs from Delis all the time . I never came across a cold cut chicken sandwhich. When you order a chicken breast wrap I'm sure the picture below isn't what comes to mind . I will definitely never order from United again !!!!
The guy was rude when trying to order delivery he wanted to charge me more for then what they are priced at on there menu. Then waited 30 minutes to tell me.

Fast and convenient. For a deli, it's pretty good prices and quality...again, for a deli! Although, the delivery guy that hit on me was a little awkward...and I'm gay! Lol. But that happened a while bank and I've never seen that guy again.
A 24hr deli that won't make a bacon, egg, and cheese on a roll at 5am because it is too early, is hardly a  New York deli.

One of the friendlier delis in the area. You can take as much time as you like, and they won't give you an odd look. Spot on for its selection of beverages, including the elusive coconut milk in the can.
Get the French BLT - heaping portions of Brie cheese and bacon on toasted rye. Delicious for only $5.50.

As far as I stand, this has got to be the best deli in the neighborhood. The coffee has more flavor than others, and the sandwiches are nice and messy. Usually teeming with teamsters and other union workers; its not Italian or Jewish or Irish, but it is a true NY deli.

A $5 BLT that can feed 2 people may seem like an urban myth to many people in this city. Not when you step into this deli. Cheap yet amazing sandwiches are quickly prepared here, perfectly for a lunch break or picking up a dinner after work.

Friendly staff also. Not too chatty, very straight to the point while you are paying, but they do not treat you like crap unlike other nearby deli's.
i love this place. there's a million delis around here and i always go here. great sandwiches and wraps. clean and friendly.

I do not understand how this place exists, except maybe that people get home late after the bars and clubs and are hungry enough to tolerate the nonsense.  I ordered a few things just now (it's not even 8 p.m. on a Thursday now) and, after a half hour, called to find out where the delivery was.  The guy assured me that the delivery was "a half second away," and I asked him how he knew that.  He told me he could see the delivery guy in the lobby of my building (across the street from the "Deli" with big windows).  Five minutes later, I got dressed and went down to buy what I needed.  After getting home, i called to complain and got attitude.  Don't order from here; instead, order from 10th Avenue Gourmet, (212) 541-7880.  And, no, I have nothing to do with 10th Avenue Gourmet.  I'm just tired of this "United We Stand," place, which sounds like an H. Ross Perot institution.
Great spot, only had the fries but they were amazing.  Nice outdoor seating area.  Will be back again for sure.

Found this spot on Google and drove for over an hour for lunch.

Service was quick , owners very friendly and informative about the neighborhood.

They have two more locations at the cruise shop terminal at Brooklyn and Manhattan pier  

Food was fresh . Mahi Mahi Tacos needed a bit more acid and flavor it was good but not great !

Rosemary Fries had great rosemary flavor , but was quite soggy,  except for the smaller  pieces which had a bit of crispiness. Ketchup on the side was bomb  !

Sturdy recyclable packaging used .   .

Ambience was perfect... breezy outdoor seating

Limited  parking options except the key lime pie spot.

If you live around Brooklyn or are near the cruise terminal you can stop and  try it once .

So glad that I stopped by United Sandwiches of America because the food was amazing. If you love a good lox sandwich then do your taste buds a favor and order the NY Loc on Rye. The salmon was fresh, delicious, and so was the tomato. The onion was crunchy and very tasty. The bread was toasted and crunchy but still light. The sandwich costs $12 and the sandwich artist was very kind and personable. I definitely recommend this business.

Absolutely amazing food and the menu changes occasionally as well which always makes it fun and rewarding to try the latest menu items. Well worth going out of the way for, and the owner is very friendly.
Wow yesterday's Oklahoma smash burger made my day - perfectly balanced, great meaty texture. Pickles, caramelized onions, cheeeese - can you say umami? Add it to the pantheon!

Had the New York (smoked salmon, cream cheese, fresh dill) and it was outstanding! The rye was perfectly crisp, just lightly toasted and it wasn't too dense. The cream cheese was light and creamy. Will definitely be back.  Service was friendly and quick. Love the location too.

"Godamn" is what I said after ingesting one of their amazing sandwiches. It was an extremely pleasant experience overall. The look of it is very welcoming and it's in a very nice location. We had the Mississippi and the New York. Both amazing. And the fries. To die for. Go there. You won't regret it.
The Alaskan Sandwich with macaroni salad is what your life has been missing!! Great smiles, great people, great food!

This place is awesome! We got the jersey (pork roll, egg, and cheese), end the New York (lox w/ cream cheese, dill, and onion) and both were super delicious. We also really enjoyed the macaroni salad and the drinks. This place is an awesome addition to the neighborhood!
A great corner of red hook for food. Had a sandwich here, a beer at strong rope and finished it off with a Steve's key lime pie. All great!

I just had the most amazing Detroit-style pizza in NYC and it was truly extraordinary! The crust was cooked to perfection, and the corner piece was absolutely to die for. The cheese was hot and bubbly, and the pepperoni was the perfect thickness - it even cupped when it was baked. There was just the right amount of pepperoni grease for a classic flavor.

Tomorrow, I'm heading back to try the NYC style and will fold a slice.

This place is a classic NYC setting. On the corner with two friendly and helpful guys running the place.

Keep NYC awesome - eat here!

Really great late night pizza. On our last night in NY we did the taste test, Upside Pizza vs Berlina Cafe since they were across the street from each other on the way back to our hotel. Upside Pizza was the clear winner. The service was really fast, but more importantly, the pizza was hot, crispy and tasty. Pretty standard set up with a counter and an oven behind it, really efficient. The crust was crispy and tasty, the pepperoni were those small ones that end up with a nice meaty grease, but in a good way. Highly recommend for late night eats.
Also gotta give love to the mushroom pizza, it was pretty bomb too.

Upside Pizza delivers a NYC pizza experience in midtown. Order by the slice and staff throw it in the oven and soon you have your slice of heaven (almost). The cheese slice was fine, but the thicker style pepperoni could have used some more oven time. There is limited seating and the ambiance is basic but then again so is the pizza. And that may just hit the spot.

What's not to like about this pizza!?!?

The square pepperoni is crisp and delicious. I'm going back and if you haven't tried it you should.

Grabbed 2 slices for lunch last week as I needed something quick and easy. I opted for a pepperoni and a chicken marsala. The pepperoni was a little underwhelming but by no means was it bad. I definitely enjoyed the chicken marsala especially since the local pizza spots in this area rarely if ever have it. Would certainly come back for that specific slice. Overall, it's pricey but that's the nature of the area it's located in. service was quick and easy - no qualms there.

First I am going to say I am not a fan of NY style pizza. I am more of a Detroit style pizza. That being said, we ordered delivery from this shop. Easy app to order and delivered quick.

Hubby wanted to try NY style pizza so I indulged him. He really liked the thinnest of the crust, not too much sauce, and lots of cheese. He was a happy camper with this pizza.

I wanted to take off one star off for the greasiness of the pizza. My friend from NY enlightened me to the fact that is the way NYC pizza is supposed to be greasy. So giving it 5 stars. Hubby did not complain at all.

Delivery was quick and ordering was extremely easy. Would I go back? No, but it was an experience for hubby.

On the way back to our hotel after the Knicks win, we saw the Sicilian style pizza and decided to give it a try along with. $2 bottle of water.

For $4, we got the simple slice of pizza.  The dough is quite fluffy and the edges are crispy however, overall it's lacking flavor for us.  Having had other slices around town, one can't help but compare right?

The guys were friendly enough claiming they had the best pizza in town when we came in.  Good luck in a town that has a pizza place in every block.
Decided to stop by and grab a slice because I saw the reviews were pretty good. I got the mushroom slice and it was great really enjoyed it! Price not horrible for an NYC slice $5

So my last review was right before the pandemic hit.  Maybe it was the evening. Who knows.

But after a visit to MSG to see Harry Styles, we had a long drive back and needed some energy. So we stopped by and ordered a few slices. We both agreed that the slices were delish. I had a pepperoni while my dining companion had a cheese.

This time, we skipped any sicilian or Detroit style and just went for the classic NY slice. A little greasy which is what you want here.   Good crust and good sauce.

A very good slice place.

They have a nice upside-down Sicilian.
The cheese is a little more complex that a typical NY slice
Sometimes I get the no-cheese Sicilian that has slices of fresh garlic on it.
It's always burned on the bottom as people have noted in other reviews.
That is not my thing.
