He always has a big smile and is eager to make something you'll enjoy. New York City can be a tough place, but Urban Juicery is an oasis of good food and friendly people.

The owner was very friendly. He welcomed each customer with a big warm smile. I ordered the Island Breeze Smoothie and Yellow Mellow Smoothie Bowl. Both very yummy. Will definitely stop by again to try the sandwiches and wraps.

Absolutely love this place! It's pretty hard to find a good acai bowl as I'm from Florida but this place is exactly what I had been looking for! The staff are extremely kind and friendly and always remember me. Yummy smoothies & soups too. It smells so fresh when you walk in and is such a hidden gem with cute decor. So thankful Urban Juicery is right around the corner from my apartment-- what a great spot.
Very Friendly service. The yellow mellow is so tasty! I will definitely be back! Thank you so much!
Super fresh açaí, nice owner, will be back if in the area. (The person after me got the yellow mellow, and that looked amazing.)
rly good smoothie! albeit a bit pricy -- but i'm shocked to say i would prob pay this price again bc it is a very good smoothie. also the customer service is amazing, really friendly employees :)

I can not rave enough about how amazing the service is here!! The smoothies are excellent and the  owner is the nicest person. Always welcomes us with a smile. Vibrant and cozy juicery with sandwiches, salads, wraps, juices, smoothies, and smoothie bowls! Highly recommend the pure protein smoothie with vegan protein, it's delicious!! It's a must try if you are in the mood for a good smoothie in the east village!

I'm loving this spot! The sandwiches are special because the ingredients are always tasty. Every note I'd like to hit in a wrap or roll is right there - sweet, tangy, spicy. If you like vegetables, there are fully vegetarian options. But if you're a meat eater, you got it right here. Today I ordered the Union Square wrap which has roast beef, avocados jalapeño rajas, and more. I don't remember all the ingredients because as usual, there are so many - all making delicious combos. This is my awesome spot for lunch, hands-down !!!!

This place is a must eat - healthy food at a fair price! I came in one night and got the Mango Tango, the chipotle chicken and the açaí bowl. They were so delicious that I came back the two days later  - and everything was great again. Will be coming here regularly.

Also, the chef is kind and really cares about his place.

Fresh, generous portions, delicious! How a bowl should be made.

I try to only go to places where the food is made with "good intentions". So you can imagine my surprise, and delight, when the staff person asked me if I liked my Pitaya Bowl (yes!) and if I knew the secret ingredient. When I asked what it was, he said that all their food is "made with love and passion." My kind of place! I'll be back!

Ordered a Vegetarian Muffaletta Sandwich and a Tropical Smash Juice! Both were realllly good and filling. They did not skip out on the high quality vegetables and the owner was so kind. Super conversational and he helped me pick out a sandwich! Will definitely be back - especially for an affordable, midday meal

This place is a hidden gem. I came for a juice, but I can't believe how good the sandwiches are. And very reasonable prices. The jerk chicken sandwich was the best I've had. Juicy and very spicy. I would go out of my way to grab food here. I met the owner, who radiates love. You'll see.
I love this place and the guy that runs it. The food is fresh and the ambiance is bright, which is wonderful to find in a small space.
Friendliest owner ever! Prices are fair and affordable compared to most juicery places around. Delicious and fresh.

tiny Mexican food cart parked on Park Avenue South, near the corner of 17th Street. the cart is there most days from lunchtime to early nighttime. cart looks pretty clean. there are variety of comfort eats served up from tacos and burritos to cemitas, huarache, and chalupas. it's a one-person cart so there might be a little wait if there's a line.

stopped by here for a burrito and it was pretty satisfying. went with the spicy pork with everything. the burritos are made from scratch. the pork is cooked on the grill (it is not precooked) so the flavors really come through as fresh. there's veggies, cheese, and cream which had to the texture and flavor. the burrito were superstuffed and overflowing. a bit too much rice in the burrito which is why it is a bit overstuffed. but the rice tastes fine...the overflow of rice just sorta detracts from the spicy pork. overall, this is a well-made burrito that has that home -cooking charm.  spicy pork burrito, $9 + tip

the grill lady was really nice and courteous. you can order for pickup. cash only.

drops mic cuz these burritos are no joke
I out
zzz

Wow. Coming from California, we still come here about once a year. Tonight's visit was the best yet.

Food. My lemon pasta was simple, and simply perfect. A savvy balance between creaminess and tartness.

The rack of lamb was divine, with squash and whipped ricotta. I definitely picked them up and gnawed them to the bone.

Ajit was the perfect server. I went with a non-drinker, so relied on our server for a glass of white and red as I was drinking solo. He delivered!

All of the service was top-notch, warm and welcoming.

It was just one of those nights! Thank you!

I stopped into Union Square Cafe with some friends for Brunch. We were one of their earlier reservations, so were seated right away on the top tier. After looking over the menu, I decided to go with the Duché de Loungueville Sparkling Cider as my drink (I was in a fall, cider mood). We ordered the Parker House Rolls for the table. I went with the Chili Poached Eggs dish for my main. I overall wasn't overall impressed with the food. The rolls were tasty, but not memorable. My Chili Poached eggs had some bright spots and some downfalls. While i liked the flavors, my eggs were cooked closer to over medium/hard and the english muffin was so tough it was very difficult to cut into or even chew.

The ambiance here is very nice. I like the old school feel with the tiered setting. While it got crowded, it never felt too noisy. Service was decent. Our waitress was friendly, but we felt a bit neglected at times. It took a very long time for her to come take our order after delivering our drinks and we had to flag her down each time we needed something.

Overall, I'm glad I tried Union Square Cafe. Though i wasn't "wowed" by the food or service, I'd definitely like to stop in again to try dinner and some other food options!

This review is for dinner. Had a reservation for 4 people on a Saturday night. I had never heard of this restaurant so came with zero expectations. The food is a bit more classic, so nothing blew my mind from a creative standpoint. However, everything was very good.

Service / Ambiance: we were on time for our res, but had to wait 15-20 minutes at the bar to get seated. Overall service was good. The restaurant is huge (at least for NYC standards.) Good for larger groups. The vibe is casual, but refined. Great for a date night, bring visitors, or if you're just looking for a good meal.

Food: ordered an egregious amount of food, but somehow ate all of it. I don't think it's meant to be family style, but we shared everything amongst 4 people.

-Broccoli: surprisingly delicious. The candied pecans are amazing with it.

-Tuna Crudo: perfect for sharing - comes with 6 pieces. Not terribly flavorful, but very fresh and light.

-Chicory Caesar Salad: doesn't necessarily taste like a traditional caesar salad, but refreshing and tasty nonetheless. Dressing is much lighter than a caesar dressing.

Potato Stacks & Caviar: this was a special. Honestly, probably not worth the money because there really wasn't much flavor but it's a fun dish. Comes with 4 little hashbrown stacks topped with a dollop of caviar.

For the pastas, we opted for the entree portions which is $10 extra per pasta. Highly recommend if you're doing family style.

-Fettuccine Al Limone: the lemon flavoring has a nice subtle hint. I don't think I'd want this as just my sole entree, but good to share.

-Mafaldine All'Anatra: this was my favorite. I'm not really a duck fan, but this pasta was delicious. Flavorful, rich, but not too rich, and the green olives are the perfect addition.

I think the menu changed since I went. We also got Amatriciana, which was actually my least favorite. It was not nearly saucy enough and wasn't red sauce. Also got an agnolotti + truffle dish - this was so good. They should bring it back, it's perfect for fall!

-Country Pork Chop: I NEVER order pork chops - I feel like they're also dry and underwhelming. This was delicious. So juicy and flavorful.

-Lamb: again, juicy and flavorful!

-Tiramisu: nothing crazy, but tastes just like tiramisu should.

-Apple Cake: the best dessert we got. Dense, cinnamon-y, caramel-y, perfect for fall/winter.

Ice Cream + Caramel Corn: I think this was a dessert special. Not everyone's favorite, but it was fun!
Love Union Square but this time on a Friday night found it to be a bit noisy. The food is excellent and when too busy the service is good but the noise level sometimes overshadows the find food

Finally had a reason to dine here and the food / service lived up to expectations. By the completely filled house on a weekday night, apparently I'm not alone in that assessment. Great upscale bistro atmosphere, and a fancy pants bar that just invites you to come early for the delicious libations before moving to your table. I would like to commend them for their impressive list of whiskies.

Once our party arrived we were quickly seated and given a run down of the daily specials from our friendly waitress. Most impressive is that they use different glasses to distinguish between Sparkling or Still water, so there was never a mixup. I have never seen this in a restaurant before and frankly most places should take note.

Food was outstanding. We tried a bit of everything from tuna carpaccio to various pasta dishes, oysters, razor clams, shrimps, and of course desserts. The Desserts - wow! We ordered a chocolate cake, tiramisu, and a deconstructed strawberry panzanella which came with basil sponge cake and whipped mascarpone. OMG these were each mouthwatering, and despite being full of food and alcohol we were determined to finish every bite.

Highly recommend coming here at least once.

Went for Restaurant Week Brunch.  
Gazpacho Verde was delicious - smooth, not too chilled so can savor the flavors and not too liquidy nor too thick.
Chicken Milanese was disappointing. Meat was too flat...started drying up about mid way. the side green sauce did not do much...unless to make the plate look good. Breading texture was too fine...which not my preference...which is comparable to almost a frozen chicken breaded cutlet from a grocery store.  Vegetables were fresh...which was good.
Am very picky with chicken breast meat...especially breaded.  Was recommended from a friend to try...and sadly did not pass muster
For $45 for 2 course meal...definitely not worth it.

Outside dining ambience : very nice! Comfortable and spacious.
Service: Very friendly and professional.
Food: Meh overall.
Remembered in the late 1990s, USC food used to be excellent when they were located on E16 st.  Lobster bisque was the first I ever had and was awed.

My priority standout in dining in any restaurant / eatery is The Food.  Though service and ambience was great...these take a back seat after food...however expensive or cheap.

We ordered the duck liver mousse, citrus salad, rigatoni al cacciatore, red velvet cake, and a apple cake.

The duck liver mousse was well executed. Creamy, and having an irony finish, i don't think liver is my favorite flavor sadly. The citrus salad had such a unique flavor profile. The nuts incorporated with the brown butter made the salad one of the best of the meal. The rigatoni was pretty good, perfectly al dente pasta, pretty depthful flavor. The deserts were amazing.

I have to note that i would like the restaurant to definitely use less butter. The service was excellent and the wait staff was more than amiable/amicable!

Cheers!

I have eaten at almost every Union Square Hospitality Group restaurant except the original so finally did brunch.

Honestly, brunch was just fine; the onion rolls that looked so amazing were good but nothing special and I would not recommend it. The liver mousse was good and would definitely have that for a happy hour. I enjoyed the burger but I like gramercy tavern one better.

But dinner was a totally different experience and was so glad I decided to give it another chance. I love every other single restaurant and have learned dinner is why you go to Union Square Cafe. I got the pre-fixe menu and the scallop dish was one of the best things I have eaten. You need to order this! The carrot butter with it was just amazing and the scallop was quite large!

I ordered rabbit pasta for my main dish and it was delicious. It was a large portion too so I feel the regular size of the pasta is plenty big. For dessert I got the orange mille fuille; delicious!

I don't think I need to do the pre-fixe again since it was a lot of food but glad I did it the first time to get a good sampling of the menu! Will return again for dinner.

37 years in, Union Square Cafe still carries (and deserves) its reputation as one of the finest restaurants in the neighborhood.

I came in for lunch on a Monday afternoon craving a great burger. Being the flagship restaurant of the man behind Shake Shack: the food didn't disappoint.

Service here is friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable. I ordered their 19th Street Burger and a pint of craft porter. On ordering, a dish of fresh bread, butter, and marinated olives. The bread was hearty and just chewy enough, paired well with the rich butter. The olives were just briny enough, with bits of fennel adding an extra layer of flavour.

The burger was among the best I've ever had: while the bacon and the cheese were on point, the beef was more like a fine minced steak, perfectly balancing meat, fat, and char. And the fries (thin and crisp, with fried rosemary) were a fantastic side.
To much hype not enough flavor. Place is nice, wait staff is high end, but the food is so so. But I'm not the end all and be all for taste. It's just not mine.

It's time for sleazoid hypocrite Danny Meyer to close this overhyped, overpriced joke of a tourist trap. Its best days are LONG behind it. Food is nowhere near as good as it once was. Decor is dated beyond belief and service is out the window.

Have become a regular here at Union Square Cafe. Always a good meal, always good service. For the gluten free - ask for their gluten free bread, it's very good and homemade. Some of my favorites are the eggplant harissa - so flavorful, squash appetizer, and the fish option, which is rotated regularly and always cooked perfectly.

The cocktails rotate regularly as well and are always inventive and delicious without being overly sweet. If you're a wine drinker, ask the sommelier for a recommendation, you won't be disappointed.

The pork chop is outstanding (medium rare was the call).  Pasta with goat was also incredible.  Skip the desserts.  All dishes can be shared easily.  With prices this high you have to.  Wine list is great.  To get a deal, get the InKind app and buy some points.

Food is simply delicious. The servers kindly split one appetizer and one main into separate plates for my friend and I. The MAFALDINE ALL' ANATRA duck ragu was incredible, well salted and just the right amount of butter and oil. The gelato trio dessert also had my favorite flavors: Amarena Cherry Chip, Fior di Latte, Coffee Crunch. Loud space with lots of corporate folks spread over two floors.

Our experience was fantastic.Our reservation notes were read, and we were surprised when the manager came by, referred to our notes of what we were celebrating, and presented us with T-Shirts and took a picture. Our server was enthusiastic and answered all our questions. She was attentive and so pleasant. She made the experience awesome and made us feel special. The food was outstanding. We enjoyed SEARED STEELHEAD TROUT,BUTTER-POACHED LOBSTER and TRIANGOLI D'AUTUNNO. The apple cake was the favorite dessert at the table although the baklava sundae and chocolate cake and fig were yummy too. Hospitality shone at Union Square Cafe!  Thank you.

This is still one of my favorite restaurants.  The manager is one of the kindest people, we took the restaurant that it was our anniversary, and they made sure to give us a toast even remembering I wasn't drinking for the evening, with a lovely Apple Cider. The service, thank you David for the great attitude and laughs, :) and of course AMAZING burger.  I can't wait to come back again very soon to experience such a delicious, delightful meal and experience.

I'm impressed! And I am not easy to impress.
Excellent food, wine and dessert. Photos
Don't do justice to the ambiance. The art work on the walls is lovely And adds to the charm of the dining space. The wait staff was very attentive to our requests and timed the food service perfectly. We tried the Tuna Crudo for appetizers. Sausage pasta ( I have forgotten the fancy pants names from the menu) was next. IMO,
It is the most perfectly balanced pasta of all time. Blackened steelhead surpassed my expectations of how delicious and flavorful roasted fish can be.

Amazing - from the ambience to the food to the drinks - I would definitely come here!

Food: everything is amazing here! We ordered apps, pastas and some mains! My must haves were the broccoli and the MAFALDINE ALL'ANATRA! The broccoli was so well seasoned and the pomegranate they added was perfect! I am still thinking about the mafaldine! The pasta captures the sauce so well and the duck ragu was decadent! I wish I just ordered a plate of that in an entree size for myself! The fish dishes were good as well - we got the Arctic char and the crudo!

Drinks: I got the Chianti and they were extremely generous with there pours! The cocktails were also good!

Price: pretty pricy but worth the quality

Ambience: I loved the space! It's so much bigger than you would expect!

Service: great service - they are very attentive
The food was fabulous & the Emidio Pepe wines were other worldly. Michael & his crew were utterly impressive with their stellar service. It was a joy to meet Chiara Pepe. Just an amazing night.

Food 3/5
Service 1/5
Ambiance 4/5
Servers would ignore you. Asked for help and pretended not to see but decided to still check me with side eye. There are better food with better service in the are.

If someone recommends broccoli it must be really good. Brocoli is typically boring, here it's exciting. Like an accountant drunk at an office holiday party.

My friend and I also got the hamachi crudo (which was only ok) as a starter. For my entre I got  the duck breast (which was good). Love breast.

They offer 7oz beer glasses. That is such a small amount of beer. Not sure why that exists.

Perfectly cooked medium rare burger for $29. Fries were thin and crunchy. Coffee was great.

My friend's loved their meals also - their meat was done perfectly medium rare, which is tough for lamb since it's risky.

Staff was very professional. Venue is clean. Top notch lunch spot for me.

Very busy place but great staff service the big salad was good the duck Ragu was good the trout was excellent the Black bass for two was excellent scallop even though it's one scallop appetizer was delicious good wine selection espresso martinis or very good but small. The steak tartare was excellent. I knew Danny when he started the first Union Square, Café on 16th St. this place is just as good.

Well, I'm hardly the first person to review this spot, but there have been some changes afoot recently-ish (or so I'm told), so perhaps this may have more add-on value than the 100,000th Katz review.  I met up with some college friends for a party of five (tbt lol...but it was Saturday) for dinner. We decided to just kinda order a bunch of different stuff off the menu and just share everything...too many things on the menu that we all wanted a taste of lol.

The service/servers were very attentive at first and through most of the meal (especially when trying to figure out how many total dishes would be a good amount for our group to share, which was a little tricky with dish sizes [apps, pastas, entrees, etc.]), though a bit of a wait to get a hold of somebody when we were trying to close on out - but overall pretty good. And onto the food:

Roasted Squash appetizer (I don't 100% recall the proper name of the dish and looks to have just dropped from the [online] menu) with tahini, pine nuts, and other goodness - I'm normally a 'must have a protein' dish orderer-kinda guy, but this was divine!

Duck Liver Mousse with Rhubarb, Green Apple, Pickled Mustard Seed - creamy, decadent, and indulgent; love the idea of the pickled mustard seed and green apple to contrast with the richness of the mousse. Delightful.

Spicy Manilla Clams with Soppressata, Shallot, Chili - these were perfectly fine, and tasty, but perhaps 100% necessary / maybe should have been more adventurous with a more unique dish.

Mafaldine All'anatra (with Duck Ragu, Pistachio, Amaro) - You had me at duck ragu and pistachios. Loooved this dish (and was pulling hard for it during the deliberation process lol). The flavors of the ragu meets pistachios worked so well, perfectly cooked pasta - yum!

Ricotta Cavatelli (with Kale Pesto, Market Broccoli, Ricotta Salata Vecchio) - very nice, the kale pesto really shined; we really enjoyed this one.

Fettuccine al Limone (Preserved Lemon, Breadcrumb) - this dish was surprisingly delicious; I'm always a bit hesitant to order dishes that feature lemon as it seems to be frequently over-done/overpowering, but this was just spot on!

Arctic Char - really superb!

Half Chicken Scarpariello with Pork Sausage, Pickled Peppers, Charred Lemon - I'm not one to order chicken when dining out, but this...this was good. Crispy skin, really hearty dish (and we were dining in mid February, so very timely).

Roasted Duck Breast with Moroccan Carrots, Purple Barley, Charred Almonds - overall the dish was delightful, from the duck itself (whiiiich...I could always wish for more) to the complimenting sides/garnish, really tasty.

Side of Roasted Brussel Spouts - if brussels are on the menu, I'm asking for 'em. And the table thanked me lol.

In the spirit of gluttony, we also opted for 2 desserts, which they actually added candles to as it happened to be close to two of our birthdays. I settled on the:

Burnt Honey Cheesecake with Whipped Chevre, Bruleed Figs, Red Wine Sauce - a really cool brulee twist to a cheesecake, glad we land on this one!

Chocolate Panna Cotta with Cocoa Tuile, Malted Whipped Cream - a chocolate lover's dream.

All in all, very pleased with our outing at this NYC institution!

Went for brunch. Service is outstanding. Food is mediocre. I had the chili eggs--was bland and not spicy. Husband had the unseasoned breaded chicken--he makes a better version. 3 stars for service. Food is clearly an afterthought.

Oh my god, AMAZING food. We came during NYC Restaurant Week and the did not disappoint. We were able to order an appetizer, main, and dessert for only $35 a person. The food was excellent and presentation spectacular. Will definitely come back even when it's not restaurant week!
Great spot. Love the high ceilings and great menu. Feels very homey for a spot in the middle of manhattan. Not sure why the hostess needed my phone number to sit at the bar...

This review is long overdue. Carole and I had lunch here early this year during Winter Restaurant Week. Here one could choose two courses of an appetizer and a main course from the regular menu. Such riches! As it was chilly a bowl of warming Ribollita Tuscan Bean and Bread soup was Carole's selection. Duck Liver Mousse with pomegranates, kumquats and pistachio with toast points was my choice as it would be filling. Indeed it was with each mouthful being smooth and tasty. We both had the Beef Tenderloin with Brussels Sprouts, pickled chili and salsa verde. The star of this entree were the sprouts. Mouthwateringly tasty and when I asked for the recipe was told that several guests had done the same. The sprouts could also be ordered as a side. Carole did not have wine with her lunch. Sancerre was my original choice and I did get a glass but when I told the server that  I really wanted the Chablis the glasses were exchanged. How kind. We split the Apple Cake for dessert. Fior di Latte gelato topped this warming dessert surrounded by a brandy caramel sauce. Service at Union Square Cafe is always top notch and why wouldn't it be? After all this is one of Danny Meyer's restaurants and worth but not one but several visits.

I had the pleasure of dining at Union Square Cafe with a friend/colleague who I haven't seen in years.  The evening was perfect from the outside dining area  (beautifully designed and spacious) to delicious food and outstanding service.

We started with a cocktail (if you like Gin/Rum you must try the Last Straw) as we listened to the specials.  Whoa their take on tater tots with caviar on top - a must have.

Next up pasta  (I loved the option of a pasta before the entree) - AGNOLOTTI DI MAIS (Corn, Truffle, Asiago) - mouth watering!

Finished up with ROASTED DUCK BREAST and the BROCCOLI
(Pomegranate, Candied Pecans, Mint) accompanied by a bottle of French Chardonnay - served with the perfect chill.

I couldn't stop thinking about my meal today so I had to write a review!
Don't miss this place
Impeccable service, delicious food, great ambience. Wonderful neighborhood spot for a special occasion.

We went for restaurant week and it was unbelievable! The whole staff was very kind, especially our waitress Olivia.
We were so torn by so many different menu items because they all sounded so good and she was so so wonderful in helping guide us. We ordered a bottle of wine as well and it was delicious. The highlights were the burger and the citrus salad. Both were absolutely to die for!

"Our waiter Bob was probably the best waiter we have ever had. Knowledgeable, pleasant and extremely helpful. People who come to Union Square Cafe would be lucky to have him as a server!!!"
Food was also fabulous.

Wonderful food;
Wonderful service;
Wonderful ambiance.

it never fails us.  We've been coming a long time!

Upscale spot worth the steep price! The interior is extravagant with top notch service to match. I started with an espresso martini which at $19, was quite overpriced and was barely filled to an acceptable level. The drink itself was good, and that was the only subpar part of the whole experience. The complimentary starter bread was welcoming and decadent. I ordered the duck pasta and it was oozing with rich flavors and cooked to perfection. The portion was big enough to be full, but not big enough for leftovers, not that I expected those sizes from a place like this. Yes, it's expensive here but once you accept that and don't order a $12 side of veggies, it can be well worth it.
I'm updating my review after having lunch at the bar today. The food was great as always but the hospitality really shined today.

I think most aspects of my meal here were fantastic. The heirloom tomato salad was well seasoned and fresh. The straciatella special was delicious and served with some delightfully crisp and seasoned crostini. A bite of pasta I took from a friend was well cooked with a creamy sauce balanced with the bite of amaro. My disappointment came from the meat preparations. We ordered some duck wings as an appetizer and although they were juicy and tender, they were coated in a a sauce that I just found far too sweet. My main dish was a thick, bone-in pork that was both excessively charred and bland. There wasn't really anything resembling porky flavor in any bite that I took, the only thing that I could really taste were the burnt bits that were in contact with the grill and any pieces that I covered in their salsa verde. What felt bizarre though was that it felt like the meat was cooked in a technically correct manner for the most part, there was just something that went wrong in terms of actual flavor which was a shame as I was having a fantastic meal until I got to my main dish.
In other regards, the restaurant remains in line with what I expect from the Union Square Hospitality Group. Service was excellent, drinks were great, and most everything surrounding the meal was extremely pleasant. I am certainly tempted to come by again given all of these other qualities; however, the most important part of a meal is the meal and this is what disappointed most.

One of the best restaurant experiences I've had, ever. First of all, it's really pretty inside- not at all what comes to mind when you hear "cafe"; it's more upscale but still comfortable and inviting. There were some beautiful spring flower displays with cherry blossoms when we visited for dinner on Easter weekend. Service was excellent. The servers were very attentive and were constantly refilling our waters, looking over at our table- basically anticipating what we might need. We were a party of 4 eating dinner. The other members of my party had all eaten here before but this was my first time visiting. We decided to start with a few appetizers for the table. My family had all raved about the broccoli, which seems like such an odd thing to be impressed with.... But, let me say this. Just order it! I don't know what they do to it but it was honestly addictive and crave-able. We'd also ordered a Bibb salad, which was tasty as well but ended up ordering a second order of the broccoli after we devoured the first one. I honestly need to know the recipe. They were able to accommodate my nut allergy by serving the pecans on the side. For my entree, I ordered the half chicken. It was served with a light gravy type sauce with some pieces of sausage and some peppers underneath. The bits of sausage gave it a thanksgiving turkey and stuffing vibe, but more elevated. Two other members of my group also got the chicken because they'd had it before. We ordered some fingerling potatoes as a side. That was the only item that I didn't really feel was above and beyond. They weren't bad, just nothing special. They did go nicely with the chicken, if you want some carbs. My mom got fettuccine al limone and the pasta was cooked perfectly with a zesty creamy lemon sauce. It comes as a small portion or for $10 more, you can have the pastas as an entree portion, which they said is double the size. She got the entree size and it wasn't huge. It was just right for the main dish of her meal. The other two member of my party also got the chicken. Everyone's was cooked perfectly and it was such a large portion. We also got some desserts for the table and coffee. The coffees came with a little biscotti. We chose the tiramisu, the chocolate cake, and the strawberry "panzanella". I'm not a fan of tiramisu but this one was delicious. Very well balanced and so creamy and chocolatey. The cake was rich and had a great deep flavor. My favorite turned out to be the strawberry dessert! I'm a huge chocolate fan so that surprised me. It had a basil cake with strawberry gelato and whipped mascarpone. There were some crisps on top as well. So many textures! Our server stopped back by the table just to let me know none of our desserts had nuts. Since another member of my party had been before, they had his food allergies on file. This dinner really stands out in all aspects. I can't recommend this enough and am already trying to plan another trip to NYC that involves eating here again!

Food: 4/5 (except for the chicken which was cooked to perfection)
Service: 6/5 our waitress was super attentive to us and kind. She always came by to fill our water glasses, asked if we had any feedback on the food so she could possibly let the chef know before the next meal. She changed our plates and utensils often and was all around a great waitress!

We came here at 8pm after we saw Spiderman nearby and wanted something to eat. For 8pm on a Monday it was still pretty busy.

The tartare was on the under seasoned side, it needed a bit more acidity. The skate wing was fried well and the meat was still juicy but needed a sauce. The duck breast felt very heavy and was under salted. Our waitress ended up bringing maldon salt over to let us season it to our liking. The pasta was cooked perfectly but I would have liked a larger portion size for that price. The chicken was the winner  of the night with a super crispy crunchy skin and perfectly cooked dark meat underneath. The sauce was a great pair with preserved lemon.

If you're in the area, definitely check out this restaurant or make a reservation online!

This is the second time I've been here in a month. The first time was with clients on a Monday night sitting inside downstairs. The second time was with family for my mom's birthday sitting upstairs. I came back because of how stellar the food and service was, and this time was even better. My mother was wished happy birthday multiple times by different people. They made her and us feel special. My sister and mother raved about everything we ate and rightly so. Service was again impeccable--upscale but friendly and not stuffy at all. It's the place to go where you want to be casual but also enjoy being at a sophisticated
establishment. I can't wait to come back.
Combination of casual and classy. Limited menu but the food is great and the staff is attentive and makes sure you've got everything you need. Highly recommended.

Ordered the steak tartare and there was a piece of ice in it. Some of the worst steak tartare I've ever had honestly. Clearly had just been sitting in the fridge. The Cesar salad was so bitter and the after taste was bizarre. I can't imagine the chef would taste that dish and think it was good. Mediocre service as well. Wouldn't recommend!
Union Square Cafe is one of our most favorite restaurants. our meals are always delicious, the welcome warm and the service impeccable.

Returned here for the first time in a while, and have to downgrade my review. The food still is good, but I think the value is quite poor compared to similar places in the city. For starters they got rid of including the tip in the bill, but I don't think they adjusted the menu prices accordingly, so this works out to be a fairly substantial price increase.

We ordered a squash appetizer, and shared a fish dish as well as ragu entrees.
-The squash appetizer was tasty, and fairly unique. They added some pine nuts and sauces which really went well. And the serving size was quite generous
-In general I think Union Square does fish well, and today was no exception. It was cooked perfectly, and flavorful
-The short rib ragu was a disappointment. For starters we added shaved truffles (almost $20 surcharge), which made this a $50 pasta lunch dish. The taste didn't warrant that... the truffles did make it a bit better but not significantly imo. And there was nothing really special about the dish... really just seemed to be a standard pasta that I could get anywhere for under $20

The cafe has a small menu with carefully selected meal options for a lunch meal. Went with a small group. Service was slow but friendly, appetizers arrived quick and entrees much slower which was annoying. However food itself was delicious. Their salads are great, loved the burrata and the brussel sprouts. The burger was the best entree, along with the thin fries. For a healthier option the trout is the way to go, full of greens on top. Overall a nice place.

The food was good - I had lamb chops and my daughter had fettucine al fredo.  She found the pasta very tasty but a bit heavy.  Our server was very knowledgeable and helpful and the ambiance was good.  Would recommend

Too  expensive for mediocre food and service .  Danny Meyer living on his laurels ,
NY is full of better choices

Union Square Cafe is a staple in NYC and for good reason.  Not only is the location perfect for anyone in NY to visit, but their food is always great.  Their duck might be my favorite in the city and I always look forward to dinner at the restaurant.  There is a strong argument for Union Square Cafe being Danny Meyer's best restaurant!

I visited Union Square Cafe for the first time with my husband just days before we got married. We had a lovely dinner and appreciated the attentiveness from our server. I didn't catch the spelling of her name - I think it was Elisa. I remember we had the amazing pork chop, scallops, an amazing pasta and a hearty soup. Our server even extended our compliments to the line cook on the pork chop which was so kind. We didn't have the opportunity to try the duck wings and look forward to! The GM Max stopped by our table a couple times and made us feel warmly welcomed. The decor is also beautiful and creates an intimate environment. We can't wait to go back!

To start, I had the TUNA CRUDO CALABRESE. I've never had this dish, so didn't know what to expect, but it was good.
I had the SEARED ARCTIC CHAR - it was amazingly tender and very well seasoned, but not overly so. The accompaniments only added to the experience, specifically the Panzanella. I also had a cappuccino, which was perfectly served, even down to the heart that was crafted into the drink. I finished off with the Apple Cake. It was served warm with a scoop of ice cream on top, with a sliced apple atop of the ice cream. OMG - moist is an understatement, but the base of the cake was a cooked to a crisp (it was a amazing, trust me).

Really enjoyed my lunch here!  From the minute I arrived in (on a rainy day) the team could not have been nicer.  German and Rebecca were so welcoming and greatly appreciate it.

Sat at the bar and my bartender/server Gersom was fantastic.  Really enjoyed the market lunch - I had the tuna tartare and the artic char and both were so delicious.

Will definitely go back for the great food and hospitality and highly recommend!
We had a spectacular meal last nice.  Service was perfect.  The Upland team was full of smiles.  Our server, Luis, was extremely attentive and cordial.  I cannot recommend Upland enough.

Came with a group of four for a Friday night dinner around 7pm.  

Service was excellent very prompt and professional.  Ordered Burrata and Crispy Duck Wings to share, the Duck Wings were delicious!  Highly recommend.  Had the Pork Chop for the main dish and cooked to perfection.  

I'd like to go back to try other menu items and sadly, didn't take any photos this time around.

We came here for an early brunch right when they opened at 10a. We made a reservation, and I'm glad we did because there was a huge brunch rush.

The menu is eclectic with a range of breakfast and lunch items. For sharing with the table, we ordered the breakfast pizza (with bacon, broccoli and egg), margherita pizza and donuts. Both of the pizzas were great, particularly the breakfast pizza. I ordered the Eggs Benedict which were delicious.

Service was lovely and very attentive.

Looked forward to dining here at the recommendation of someone who's had her eye on this place (She'd never tried before, but she wanted to). Met an old buddy of mine whom I hadn't seen in a long time, and we were promptly seated at the back of the restaurant between two semi-large tables. The noise/crowd was boisterous but not terrible. Waiter quickly came to take our water/drink order. Then another wait person quickly checked in  to see if we were ready to order. We hadn't even looked at our menus but promised we would. Minutes later, first waiter returned with our drinks and pressed us to take our order again but we had literally just told the other wait person we needed a few minutes. He apologized and left. Literally as he disappeared, the 2nd wait person returned, full-court-press, for our order which we figured out and gave to her just to get them off our backs so we could proceed with our catch up. My friend wondered nervously if they were hoping to flip our table. It wasn't the best introduction to a restaurant I've ever had. To say the least...

Minutes later, the crispy artichoke we ordered as appetizer arrived and it was good. And then.... crickets. Crickets for almost 45 minutes before I finally stopped a passing bus person and asked to send our waiter over. The lunch rush had subsided by then, and the restaurant was emptying out. The 2nd wait person (who took our order) returned and I asked where our food was. She said something about hold-ups in the kitchen... but for real? I asked what the hurry-up to order was all about if the kitchen was ill-prepared to turn around our food.

Needless to say (and in this age of living and dying on Yelp and social media reviews) the manager (I assumed the never-before-seen guy) suddenly appeared at our table pouring water and asking if we needed anything when our salads were finally delivered to our table. I did request fresh ground pepper, and moments later a small ramekin containing what appeared to be store-bought pre-ground pepper was presented to our table. I asked if they had an actual pepper grinder, but the manager said they "Vitamix grind" their pepper. Ok... Interesting.

When we finished eating, said wait person suddenly appeared again and thumped a couple of clean dessert plates on our table and asked if we wanted anything sweet, to which we declined. Yet, the restaurant wasn't having any of that. Suddenly two desserts (cheesecake and ice cream) were  foisted onto our table as they were "on the house", but we vociferously declined and thanked them anyway for the gesture. We did end up ordering coffee though, and the restaurant nobly withdrew charges for our two drinks and the coffees as a silent apology.

UPLAND is a lively, charming place and the patrons seemed to enjoy the food. Maybe today was just a bump in the road.

This is a great place for brunch. I haven't tried it out for dinner but it has the perfect vibe for a nice weekend brunch. I tried out their famous Upland Cheeseburger and I'm glad I made that choice. First of all, the burger is not greasy or sloppy but nice and clean. When you bite into the burger meat, it has the right amount of juiciness and tenderness, again without the sloppiness. In a way, it makes you feel like you're eating a healthy burger. There are also avocados included in the burger, so it adds a richer flavor to the overall bite. The fries that come as a side of the burger are also delicious. They have the right amount of crisp and crunchiness to them, making them the perfect complementary piece to the burger.

Came here for a brunch date on a Sunday and it's a pretty busy establishment. Luckily we had a reservation so we didn't have to wait. The ambience and decoration is phenomenal. Love the warm lighting that is dispersed everywhere in the restaurant. The service was also decent.
The food on the other hand could have been better. We ordered a Salmon Benedict and breakfast pizza. The Salmon Benedict was good, but it was lacking some flavor. It tasted like something at a diner and I guess my expectation was a little higher for this place.
The breakfast pizza was definitely more unique and we enjoyed the saltiness from the meat with the egg that was cooked on top.
We also ordered a mimosa and espresso martini, both of which were delicious.
Come here for the vibes but don't expect too much from the food, it is your regular brunch food.

I'm a fan of Upland for both dinner and brunch.  They space is bright, warm and inviting with a talented staff both front and back of house. I've taken work colleagues, friends, and ever dates to this location and have always gotten rave reviews.

I highly recommend the bucatini cacio e pep, little gem salad, beef tartare, pappardelle, branzino, the duck...whom I kidding.  It's all good.  The wine selection is also top notch.  

Definitely a place to hit if you're near the Flatiron district.

Food was not very good at all, the spaghetti was so dry and bland that it felt like perhaps maybe they forgot to salt? The pizza was good, ice cream was good but nothing was spectacular.

A somewhat forgetful place.

Good service, good ambience though!

I came for brunch on a Saturday afternoon around 2:30 PM. They close at 3 PM and were still busy and yet kindly sat me and one other person. The service was good, very attentive, water glasses were always filled. The donut appetizers were delicious. The donuts were thick and filling. I had the salmon Benedict as my entrée and it was delicious, nothing crazy or fancy, but just a delicious salmon Benedict. And the limoncello spritz went well with it! I have been meaning to go to this restaurant for quite a while now and I'm glad I was finally able to make the stop, and I suggest you do the same!

Great food and great company - what can go wrong!

We ordered a variety of food to share with the group, very delicious. My fave was the chicken which was brined for 2 days. Also the coconut cake was for dessert was really yummy.

Our waiter Angel was very attentive and knowledgeable. Service was top notch.

Good fun place with modern settings if you are trying to look for something in the area.

Bonus: the chicken is halal

Wow brunch and dinner, they just nailed every single dish.
I am very fortunate to try both brunch and dinner at upland. I just have to hands-down on their dishes. All of them are impressive,flavorful and delicious!

We had pizza, lobster pasta, buratta and they also gave potato bread at the beginning. We love every bite of everything.
Pizza is just amazing. Dough n red source are something you cannot forget.
I had lobster pasta. You can taste the freshness of the lobster n the chewiness of pasta. Love it.

Service is wonderful. If you didn't reserve a spot, they typically will let you wait 10 mins to give you a table.
This place is wonderful for date night or family gathering.
Amazing food. Delicious, creative pizza. Perfectly cooked pasta. Wonderful service. The best place in Nomad

My friends and I came here for brunch ! I got the breakfast pizza to split with my friend and a coffee. It is very beautiful inside was the service was great!

The breakfast pizza was pretty good. It had bacon, eggs and cheese with green onions. The coffee was strong and delicious. A pretty solid breakfast place! My other friends ordered a variety of bowls and eggs Benedicts they enjoyed their meals as well :)

We adore this place! The food, ambiance, and service were outstanding! Their Caesar salad is delicious and original. Their slow-cooked fish was to die for! The mixed greens Caesar salad was good. Wish I had tried the short ribs.

The cheesecake is sooo delicious eat bite needs to be savored.
The staff are friendly and attentive.
The atmosphere is pleasantly contemporary.

We ate dinner on Saturday night at Upland.  We had 6 pm reservations and arrived around 6:18 pm.  Traffic is a beast in NY.  We attempted to walk it from our hotel, but either my navigation or me screwed up. Lol Uber to the rescue.

We were promptly greeted and seated.  It's a beautiful spot very well decorated and designed.  Our server was Natalie and I must say she was exceptional.  She answered all of my questions, and offered some great tips.

There was fresh baked bread served at the table that was very good.  We started with the Little Gem salad.  It is enough for two to share and it is awesomely tasty.  Then we ordered the Lobster Cavatelli  I thought it was good but really lacked the depth of flavor I was expecting.  

Our main dish was the Grilled Branzino.  Folks my wife and I agreed this was one of the best things we ate since our east coast adventure started a couple of days ago.  The depth of flavor of the fish was better than expected.  Plan on a whole piece of fish fashionably presented to you.  It was the perfect size for the two of us.

We finished our meal dessert:

Machiotto
Vanilla Ice cream with decaf espresso
Carrot Cake

The desserts were exceptional.

I highly recommend Upland for anyone in the NY area
Loved the lobster cavatelli with English peas and black mushroom and the gem salad with ricotta salata on top.

First of all, the space; absolutely gorgeous. Golden and spacious and full of floral arrangements, perfect for bigger groups or parents who want a classy Manhattan vibe.
Everything we ate, from the Crispy Artichokes to the margherita pizza with nudja, tasted fresh and creative. The fritto misto had fried lemon peels which I loved.
Finally, the service was wonderfully orchestrated. As soon as we would order any dish, another server would immediately bring us new small plates, and all the food was brought to the table with a smile.
We are looking forward to going back for brunch to try the famous burger.
Solid. Great atmosphere and service. Mixed fried seafood starter was great. Pork porterhouse was good, not great... little dry. Dessert was excellent. Solid

My friends and I came here without a reservation. We were able to be seated in one of their outdoor tables that had a heat lamp.

I got the Eggs in Hell ($19), which was essentially a shashouka. It was actually pretty spicy! It's not the best shashouka I've had, as it could have been more flavorful. I also got a latte ($7), which they made with simple syrup.

For the table, we shared a Margherita pizza ($22) and fries ($11). The pizza was really good and I loved the Asiago crust. The fries were thin and crispy.

For some reason, they gave us a complimentary side salad and egg/bacon breakfast sandwich, which came on a biscuit. The sandwich was super yummy!

Service was great! Our waiters constantly filled our water and I felt like they still gave us attention even though we were seated outside.

I wish we sat inside because it is very pretty and vibey!

Beautiful modern venue. Always packed!
Great spot for a business lunch.
Staff was very friendly and attentive. Food comes out quickly.
Good selection of cocktails.
The little gem salad and burrata were both very good, shareable app portions.
For lunch I had the grilled chicken sandwich, the bread which it was served on was very soft and tasty but it was too much bread, more bread than chicken. The chicken was a little undercooked.
My friend had the burger, expected more after reading all the reviews about their popular burger. It was just ok, nothing special.
Both dishes were served with fries which were very good, thin and crispy.

A good brunch spot in the Chelsea area, fairly quiet location.

Really nice decor and ambience with art deco style fixtures.

Service is welcoming and attentive.

We got the two eggs your way and the Salmon Benedict. Food was good and the cocktail list is just what they usually have. Doesn't really play up brunch too much.

First Impressions: spacious and good ambiance for a group dinner. I picked this spot for dinner after spending the day surprising one of our girl friends with a baby shower (her husband was in on the surprise and it was super successful!). The service was attentive and prompt without being overly hovering

The food was delicious. Decent serving size and apps were shareable (we were a part of 6). I really enjoyed my Pappardelle and had it with a glass of chardonnay. Not sure if that was the correct pairing, but since I'm not a huge fan of red wine, it was what I wanted even though I ordered a meaty red sauce item. I was mostly finished with my wine prior to dinner anyway, so it worked out. I would definitely come back for dinner, it looks like it would be a good spot for an intimate dinner date as well.

Very nice restaurant. We sat at the roadside seats on a cool summer afternoon so it was very agréable. The burrata was very fresh and creamy and it's super yummy - I especially liked the grilled tomatoes in it. The pizza was very tasty too, the dough was unique and chewy. Both our pastas were delicious, the Parpadelle was quite large portion and I could not finish it (which was good), but it was also pretty salty too that I had to drink a lot of water during and after the meal.

Overall a very pleasant dinner and I would come back again!

Came for a belated birthday brunch and felt very welcomed by staff. We ordered a cocktail each and shared the breakfast pizza and upland burger. The former a brunch specialty and the latter one of their classic, popular items offered throughout the day. I would say definitely order the breakfast pizza - it is cream based with broccoli, egg, bacon and sausage. Good on its own but better with hot sauce! The burger was ordered medium but came out a bit rare (not a huge problem). It was good and came split, making it easy to share. However, I would like to note that flavor and consistency was pretty one note - quite mushy. Cocktails were well mixed and the taste/flavor of alcohol was masked. At the end of the meal, two servers came out with a sweet birthday surprise - thank you!

Food - 4
Service - 5
Ambiance - 5
A great spot on park ave south! The menu is California modern but the pizzas salads and pastas are my fave. The ambiance inside is amazing, one of the most beautiful bars on park ave south. Reservations can be slightly tricky to get but it's pretty easy to walk in and sit outside or at the bar.

Good experience. Loved the ambiance and also how big the space is. We went for a work lunch, and I ordered a salad. One bummer was that I asked for dressing on the side but they mixed it into the salad and was very dressing heavy. Also it was just a lot of cheese, walnuts avocado and cucumber slices. Thank goodness I ordered the chicken or there wouldn't have been much substance.
The waiter was good about refilling our drinks, and the food was quick.

I've been here a few (4-5) times. Always a nice spot for drinks. Dinner is usually solid, but it has been lacking the last couple times I've been there.

Service is great, but the quality of the food and drinks is dwindling. I suppose that's what happens to a lot of long-standing restaurants in NYC (recall Upland is almost 10 years old, which is much longer than other eating establishments last).

Last night we ordered the following:

Grilled Octopus
Burrata
Lemon/Shrimp Mafaldine
Skirt steak

Octopus is great. Everything else needed work. Pasta came out cold and the lemon/butter/Parm sauce had congealed. The Burrata was fresh but the 2 half pieces of bread had massive holes in it, rendering them useless as a vehicle. Honestly the roasted tomatoes on the side were far better than the Burrata and prosciutto. The skirt steak was tough and the peanut or cashew romesco on the side was too chunky to be useful.

I will inevitably be back, but I wish they would step the game back up to the first few times I went.

Brunch
: the pancakes!
: the service was a bit slow
Servicio: slow
Deco: big, american style
Tip: come for a nice brunch!

Brunch
:  la creatividad en el menu
: el servicio fue un poco lento
Service: lento
Deco: enorme, estilo americano
Tip: vengan por un rico brunch!

This place was buzzing. Took them a few minutes to seat us for our reservation but that was okay. The acoustics were bad which made it hard to hear when talking. We split the cauliflower side which was delicious!  We also had a gem salad. The salad salad itself was good but then dressing tasted store bought. We split the sausage ragu pasta dish. The pasta was cooked perfectly. They had a Happy Birthday card on the table for me when we sat down.
One of the best meals and service I've experienced in a long time. I highly recommend upland even to the pickiest NYC foodies. Second to none.

Really fun happy hour and dinner spot on Park Ave.

While visiting New York for work, we decided to have a happy hour at upland, which turned into dinner. Inside the restaurant is amazing, but if the weather is right I would suggest sitting out on the front patio. They built a nice sectioned off area so that you can eat on the street, but not feel like you are sitting right next to another dinner party. It also has a tiny roof just in case it did drizzle, which we were lucky to avoid. Service was top notch and they were happy to give us some great suggestions on the food.

In terms of food, there wasn't anything that we didn't enjoy. I would say if I was ranking the food, the skirt steak was at the top. It was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. The sausage pizza was also great. Not traditional New York style, but felt elevated. We had a pasta dish which was very yummy. Cacio E Pepe, One of the highest rated items on the menu, and it didn't disappoint. The corn side dish was amazing. Felt like an elevated street corn. We had the little gem salad, which was not pictured because we ate it so fast, and it was nice to have something green on the list. And finally the bread was amazing. I don't know if they cook it in house, but I would definitely recommend having a little bit of bread, but not spoil your appetite.

5 out of 5 experience and will definitely come back to try the other dishes!

On a recent trip to NYC we chose Upland as our first dining spot upon entering town for a 4 night stay. The dining room was crowded & buzzing with energy but as we dined through the evening the crowds & sounds began to thin out which was nice. The tables were arranged around a serpentining banquette but far enough apart to allow for private conversation. The service was professional but lacked warmth & personality. The food was mostly delicious but several dishes were a bit underwhelming like the under seasoned Crudo. The wonderfully moist Bronzino & spicy crabby cioppino seafood entrees though were the the stars of the evening for sure! Overall a good restaurant but not an essential destination.

The food and atmosphere are lovely. It's got a nice vibe, and we went at lunchtime, so thinking it must be really fun to go to at night.

We had a 2pm reservation-fully aware that lunch is only served until 3 (this will come into play in next paragraph) but the reservationist assured us this wouldn't be an issue. We had a male server (forgot his name) but very friendly, and personable. We ordered the little gem salad, the Bucatini Cacio e Pepe, the cookie basket, coffee and a Bloody Mary.

Bloodies were very good, as was everything else.  Cookies were average though. Cacio and salad were large portions so brought some home and had it the next day.

It seems as though our server was done for the day and we had a female bring us the check right after we had ordered dessert but hadn't  received it yet. I posted a pic of the receipt, the time stamp was 3:06. At 3:10, Cheri came over and asked us if we were ready to pay. Really? 4 minutes later and we were waiting for dessert...The restaurant stops serving lunch at 3-you think they lock the doors and are closed from 3-5pm (dinner begins at 5) by the way she was acting. Was she getting off work too? What was the hurry? I thought it was rude. A bad look. And if you see on the bottom of the check- they use a contactless payment system so.....anyway, food good, rush job, bad.

I walked in for a late Saturday brunch with a friend without a reservation and we were able to get seats at the bar, where they still serve the full lunch menu. Decor is stylish, upscale, and chic, as you would expect from Starr restaurants (owner of Buddakan, Electric Lemon, Pastis, etc.) Even at the bar, service was friendly and attentive. The salmon benedict was well-executed with a generous portion of smoked salmon, nothing remarkable though. The party next to us ordered the smoked salmon pizza which looked amazing and huge -- I will probably order that next time! Overall, a consistent and pleasant New York brunch experience.

Great service, beautiful interior, and wonderful food are all part of the experience we had at Upland. We made reservations for 3 at 5:30 on a Sunday. It was fairly busy, but not packed. We were seated right away.

What we ordered: we started off with a little gem salad which was the perfect amount for us to split. (The bread they bring out to start the meal is absolutely heavenly, but we wanted some greens as well.) For our main we ordered the mushroom pizza with the cauliflower side. The cauliflower was good, but forgettable. The pizza had a delicious pesto-based sauce.

The crowd here is very upper east side esque. You don't necessarily need to dress up to go here, but I wouldn't dress down.

The service was so attentive and nice. Our experience at Upland was excellent and I highly recommend having a meal here.

I had a delicious meal at Upland.

The Pizza's were so amazing that me and my friends were so full afterwards.

1. Bianca - roasted Garlic, mozzarella and scamorza
2. Lobster Cavatelli - Mushrooms, peas, carrots and Mushroom -
3. Hazelnut Pesto, faves and mint

Big picture this was a no for me.

Some of the food was great, some was not. The service was friendly but inconsistent.

We had:

- Little Gem salad with avocado on the side - first salad had avocado even though we were clear about it being on the side. The second salad was delicious.

- Burrata with country bread - delicious, we ask for more country bread, which we got after they took the burrata away.

- Cacio Pepe - way too much pepper

- Bianca Pizza - very good

- Lemon Spaghattini - mascarpone cheese with shrimp doesn't work

- Puttanesca - very good

- Brussel Sprouts - delicious

- Cookie Basket - very good

- Carrot Cake - delicious

- Chocolate Budino - very good

For the price and the inconsistent service, this is a pass.

Came here on Father's Day (I'm not a dad, but once or twice I did get called daddy). I've been here a handful of times before and I always sit in the same corner. Initially I was concerned that this is an ugly or undesirable corner but I looked around the rest of the restaurant and everyone looked about the same. Phew.

The food is great. I had the breakfast sandwich and the pizza. We didn't finish the pizza but had it later and it was still delicious. My girlfriend had the steak. We both loved everything we had. I'd come back, definitely a good spot

Lovely, spacious, clean, with high ceilings. Good for a small group meal, work/team meal, birthday, or date.
Food was great! Enjoyed both the Pappardelle $27 and Margherita Pizza $22.
Wait staff was attentive but didn't over hover.
My friend and I were able to walk-in on a Sunday around 2pm.
Would definitely come back for a dinner with some friends!

Excellent chicken dish ($32). A ton of protein, moist, and delicious mushroom.

Ambiance is amazing here. The lighting is spectacular, it's clean, and the service is top notch.

Perfect spot for drinks, a casual meal, or business/date.

Espresso shot is $7.

The cacio e pepe is divine. The noodles are perfectly al dente and are coated in a ton of fresh parm cheese. I love cacio e pepe and this might be one of the best that I've had. I'm only knocking off a star because I wish it was bigger (well yes, I always wish I had more pasta) but for the price the portion was skimpy. There were also too many whole peppercorns that should have been ground a bit better.

The vibes at Upland are also top notch. It's impossible to snag a table without a reservation, but we were able to post up at the bar which was a win. The bartender was super friendly and pleasant.

My husband ordered the jalapeno biscuit egg sammie and really enjoyed it. I definitely have a feeling that you can't go wrong with anything here. I know the pizzas and burgers are super popular.

If you are looking for a special occasion spot that isn't too fancy but still feels *special* than I highly suggest Upland.

One of my all time favorite restaurants in NYC, this place does not miss. The ambiance is fire, the staff and service is impeccable, and every food and drink item is super! Great spot for any meal or any occasion. A must try

This is my absolute favorite brunch spot in the area! The restaurant is well decorated with a nice upscale vibe. Although reservations can be difficult to get last minute, especially for dinner, if you go around brunch time you can usually get a seat at the bar where they serve their full menu.

I've been here for a nice Sunday brunch a couple of times and I absolutely love it. To start, the Bloody Mary is phenomenal. And then the food, I've had their smoked salmon pizza, the California BEC, eggs Benedict, and pancakes. I'd say the smoked salmon pizza was one of my favorites--they absolutely nailed the crust and the toppings worked perfectly.

The California BEC was another favorite, the flavors were delicious and melded together well. In regards to the eggs Benedict and pancakes, those were not my favorite and tasted like I could get them from most other standard brunch spots. This place is so worth coming to for the Bloody Mary and the pizza/BEC alone. Will definitely frequent this spot for brunch regularly!

We visited Upland for dinner and had a very mixed experience--great food, a pretty setting, but glacial service.

I'll start with the food.  We started with (what I believe was) the little gem salad, and it was solid overall.  The cheese was papery and had an odd flavor, but the salad worked as a whole.  The remaining dishes were stronger.  The cacio e pepe was very nice, with a perfect balance of pepper--enough for pepper lovers, but not so much that you won't enjoy it if you're not a fan.  The chicken also had a great flavor, though it could use a bit more sauce.  (The chicken comes with the whole foot, as an fyi, for the squeamish eaters among us.)

On to the more disappointing aspect: The service was exceptionally slow.  We spent much of the evening waiting for courses and asking each other when they might come, which always detracts from the experience.  And it took so long that we decided to forego dessert and just got ice cream on the way home.  Our waiter rarely checked in as well, and although we understand kitchen delays aren't on wait staff, an indication that the food is taking a while or an occasional refill of water can't hurt!

Overall, if Upland gets its service back on track, we'd happily go back for the food.

My friend and I had a very enjoyable brunch here a few weeks ago. There were no reservations available but it wasn't an issue walking in and getting a table for 2 at 1 on a Saturday. The food wasn't necessarily the best part. We really liked the restaurant and appreciated how the staff didn't rush us. We started with the donuts. The glaze and the raspberry jelly donut were our favorites out of the 3. Unfortunately I couldn't enjoy my coffee with the donuts. It took me asking for a coffee the times before I finally got one. Our waitress acknowledged there was an issue with the barista and comped the coffee. I had the breakfast pizza as my main. It was okay. I liked how there were multiple eggs.
Really enjoyed brunch at upland. Ambiance, service and food all outstanding. Breakfast pizza was incredible, nicer / more upscale vibe and beautiful restaurant interior

Pleasant place to grab a dinner. Our reservation was for 830 but they seated us at 8, With the caveat that we had to empty our table by 10 PM as it had another reservation by then. I asked our waiter what's so special about 10 pm? That's when the pre- party crowd shows up- so they do dinner before heading out to clubs. Ohhhh....

Food: great pizza margherita
We ordered one to share as a starter.
Silky smooth cheesecake
Everything else was unremarkable

Back to Upland, this time for Brunch. Had an amazing experience all around from the time we walked in to our servers to the food. We enjoyed some brunch items and some pasta/lunch items. The breakfast pizza was amazing and a huge portion.  Basically all the fixings on soft pizza dough. The Hell egg breakfast item has a kick but really tasty. Salmon Benedict was a very healthy portion and perfectly executed. We also had two pasta dishes that were tasty. A great visit and experience.

Love Upland! A must try in the city. First off, as someone from California who went to college 10 minutes away from the restaurant's namesake, it is sooo weird to have an upscale restaurant named after such a quiet, mundane town.

The ambience here is very chic. I think this place would be a good date spot. Not too loud, dim lighting, intimate feel. I prefer sitting in the booths, they are cozier to me. I have sat in both a booth and in chairs here.

I've tried a lot of the menu items - njuda pizza, margherita pizza, beef tartare, crispy duck wings, lobster cavatelli, cacio e pepe, roasted chicken, and the angus skirt steak to name a few. My faves are the crispy duck wings, skirt steak, and the roasted chicken! For veggies the Brussels sprouts are my go to! Can't really go wrong with most everything on the menu here.

If you thought next door prices were outrageous come here. You almost have to sell your new born child for anything here.

I know there has to be some mark up but come on. I ran out of water so got two bottles of seltzer water from here and it was $6. I guess it is my own darn fault. I could have walked 4 blocks down to Duane Read and save $3 but that's what I pay for laziness.

Next time I'll just tell myself the walk is good for you.

This is like any of the hundreds of nameless NYC delis. They have sandwiches, terrible bagels, mediocre coffee, etc.

This one just happens to be near my office, and since one day I refused to buy a shitty $11 smoothie for lunch like my health-conscious co-workers, I stopped in for a sandwich.

They have a substantial list of "signature" combinations, and I went with the Smokey: smoked turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, honey mustard. It was nothing special, but it was $7 (because they put it on a hero without asking, it's $6 on a roll), and it came with a free water because it was lunchtime.

I would rather just have a cheaper sandwich, but such is life.

The receptionist at my hair salon said she grans lunch from this place around the block, so I stopped by here for a sandwich. It was about 1pm and the place was not busy at all, just one person ordering a salad.
Red flag: the walls were old and beaten up, the menu signage was old and faded with price stickers peeling off. The pan inis are listed as $6.95 but the guy behind the computer told me "$1 extra for paninis" (but not indicated on the sign!). Then he says he's out of jalapeños, and the sliced avocado on the counter has browning on it.
So I walked out real quick. Eating here would likely make me ill.

I've never paid the same price for anything. Literally, I've been charged anywhere from $2.17 to $2.25 for the same order of 2 egg whites and a slice of toast over the past three months. I always chuckled to myself over this. However, today it was $3.25. When I questioned why, the lady at the register answered, "We've been charging you the wrong price." I pointed to the sign where the price was listed and it said $2. She still wouldn't budge. And the "free" water with purchase of a salad or sandwich is only free if you remind her not to charge you. I've had to do this every single time.

The only reason why I have been continue to patronize them is based on their proximity to my office. I'm not a cheap person by nature. I understand you pay for convenience in NY, but based on principal, I find these practices offensive.

Buyer beware.

I bought a cup of cereal. I wanted to put some milk in so I poured some from the coffee creaming section. The lady at the register runs up to me and starts complaining that I need to pay for the milk??? Since when do you PAY to use the milk OFFERED for coffee. What a dumb excuse for profit. And if thats actually their new policy, then they must have lost their minds. Smh.

I stop here to get my morning bagel and an emergen-c packet if I'm feeling a little blah. They have decent bagels, cheap coffee, really yummy smoothies, and a variety of snacks and drinks to choose from. Great, quick morning stop.

Also, there's a bodega kitty that lives there which would probably be totes gross if she weren't so darned cute and friendly.

A good lunch special - order a sandwich for $5.75 and up and get a free bottle of water. So, the lunch prices are pretty cheap and the sandwiches are satisfactory, if not better.

It's a good place to grab a sandwich and head out to Union Square to eat and people-watch if the weather is nice!
Sandwiches are good and reasonably priced.  I work right around the corner and this is a convenient stop.  If I ever need a little comfort lunch like a club sandwich or something I go there

Bad customer service, employees working with a cold (sick), and the food isn't all the great. This morning I walked in to order a breakfast sandwhich, and right after I placed my order I noticed that the cook was sneezing, his eyes were watery and his face was red: he was coming down with a cold, no doubt. I squirmed, but felt bad not paying for the wrap I had just ordered, so I bought it anyway. When I was about to pay, I took out a $20 and the cashier, whom I think is also the manager/owner, gave me an attitude because I didn't have exact change--she ALWAYS gives me an attitude about something. She then gave me my change very rudely, and didn't even say thank you. I've worked in customer service before, theirs suck! Never ever going back to this place!

This place closed, completely renovated, and reopened (I think under new management).  It's much cleaner and better organized, and the staff much friendlier.  They still make a good egg and cheese, and it's still under $3.
Overpriced, mean owners, But and a Big But,  you can chill and drink your beer there otherwize known as bodega bar.  So for that you get four stars.

M.K. is right - NEVER GO HERE..... they rip you off and charge a new cost every time your there...  Plus they charge a "CREDIT CARD FEE" of up to $2 for minor purchases.  Nothing like buying  a $1.75 item and having to  pay $1 just for using a card.    Plus they water down their coffee big time - place is a MAJOR RIP OFF
I bought a muffin, took a bite and it was not a blueberry like I ordered. So, I brought it back, got my money back and they placed back in the shelf. Gross!

I ordered a simple sandwhich- turkey breast, cheese, pesto, tomato. Nothing out of the ordinary. I took a bite and wanted to throw up. I smelled a peice of the turkey and it smelled almost fishy- like the meat was bad. I am not a person to return something, but paying $7 for such a small, simple sandwhich with bad meat was too much. I went back in, asked to speak to someone in private, and they brought me to the middle of the store and started yelling at me for lying. I tried to calmly explain to them that i was not comfortable eating the meat, as it smelled and tasted off and said "it almost tasted like fish." I had had the same sandwhich before, and it did not taste like that. The cashier whose speaks Enlgish as a second language told me that I shouldnt have ordered Turkey if I wanted fish. She would not listen to me, put her hand in my face, gave me the $7 and left. I am an incredibly timid person and tried my hardest to be descrete, but that was the rudest woman I have ever encountered.

Hidden gem off Broadway in Nomad. We left feeling that this place should be so much more popular than it is.

Highly recommend the margherita pizza. Up there with the best in the city.

Both pasta dishes were incredible. The ravioli special was buttery, and the truffle was just enough not to overpower the dish. The bottarga pasta dish was so garlicky and delicious - I didn't want it to end.

The service was top-notch as well. We walked in on a Tuesday evening.

Will definitely be back to try more. Cute, date night vibe

Great experience and dining time for my team while visiting NYC! Since we were a party of 8, the restaurant policy requires a card on file for parties of 6+ to ensure a cancellation fee of $15 per guest. Our reservation was set at 7:30 pm Tuesday night, and we were sat immediately when our party was fully assembled. The vibes were lively, fun, and great. The only issue was that our waitress disappeared for 10-15 minutes and another waiter took our menus to "restart the service" though we ordered appetizers and but no orders to kitchen for pasta nor drinks. We decided to go family style and we were quite full after the appetizers of fried eggplant, bread, pizzas and more. We ended up sharing 1 pasta between 4 people. The food was tasty, good portions, and traditional Italian with class.

Nice little Italian restaurant in Nomad! Servers were all very nice, my water was constantly refilled. I tried the Busiate con Pesto alla Trapanese ($25) - I have never had an almond pesto before, so I was very interested in trying this-don't expect your typical basil pesto! This is slightly more tomato based with crushed almonds. The pasta shape itself was also unique, I have never had pasta like this. My friend got the pork chop special ($50). Good Italian spot, I would be back if I were in the area!

I came here randomly while I was here for polo classic. I came here without any reservation on a Saturday night in like may. It was off the late night like after 9 and I was able to be seated right away. I picked this place because it's close to my hotel and I wanted good pasta and this had good reviews. Well I was very happy with my visit! I loved the bread, service was great, food was fresh and I was very happy. The service was good with us being in aid attention to. The ambiance was grown, dim lighting and just a grown feel. I would come back again.

Delicious Italian food, perfectly al dente noodles, very kind, attentive staff. We were walk ins for an early dinner tuesday just before 6pm and got seated right away. Overall amazing experience and would definitely return.

Amazing Italian dishes! I am usually a person who is not a fan of Italian food because I've always thought the palette is limited but Ulivo changed that for me. This is one of my go-to restaurants and I find it amazing especially the service. It is usually difficult to find good service while you're dining alone but June the floor manager has always led her team by example.

I ordered the fried Zucchini & Fried shrimp, and quite frankly this is my favorite vegetable because the taste and texture resembles potato chips lol. The shrimp was interesting almost looked like popcorn, this dish was an appetizer but I'd recommend it for small bites. I paired this with a dry white which was perfect.

To finish off my stay, I went with the Salame di Ciccolato & Cannoli, hats off to Chef Emmanuel. I've never make it to dessert but I'm glad I did today.

You all know I love a great interior design. I've always been a bar seater here but decided to change that up. I love the combination of family style leather seats & textured cement ceilings meshed with a modern wooden approach. There's a corner booth/seat that I wish I sat in but now that I know that'll be my next request.

Super classy very Italian place. The restaurant is very big and the food was excellent!  Ulivo makes you feel fancy while paying very decent prices. The waitress was super nice and helpful. The perfect place to go for lunch. My friend and I spent a few hours here catching up and it was just amazing. Definitely going again.

This was a date night planned by my husband so to say I was impressed is an understatement! The atmosphere is super relaxing & inviting.
