We ordered the arugula salad, cheese ravioli, truffle ravioli (summer special), and enjoyed the house bread (yes, free). The salad was simple yet refreshing, which is exactly what I'm going for before I have pasta (especially when I'm also eating it with the aforementioned free bread). It was a pretty good size, perfect for us to split. The cheese ravioli was good & I would enjoy it at any restaurant but the truffle ravioli....*chef's kiss*. If this item is still available when you visit, I couldn't recommend it more. I would also like to call attention to how attentive their staff was. My husband & I are those people that drink a TON of water so when I say that our cups were never empty, I was incredibly impressed. Super great experience!

They have indoor & outdoor seating available. We did not make a reservation & easily walked in at 6:30pm on a Friday night. They did ask if we had one though so they're available if you want to plan ahead!

We were a group of 11. The ambience was ambient. Creating a warm vibe and cozy atmosphere. Their breads were a little dry but their balaamic vinegrette with lentils was amazing. We also ordered Margerita Pizza, the sauce was really good but the crust was a little thick and doughy. Their pesto pasta was one of the best i have ever had. Right amount of pesto, with right amount of nut and pasta were al dante. The raviolli was great but the sauce was ok. It looked like it was not cooked andstraight out of the can. We also ordered tiramisu which was as expected

This restaurant had what I needed: open late, close to my hotel, and excellent Italian food. The pappardelle pasta was made perfectly. They told me their pasta is homemade. Delicious. I sat by the bar which was cozy with an attentive bartender. He made two different bourbon-based drinks for me which were excellent. I would come back when in the area again.

Not much on the menu at Ulivo will surprise you-- they serve a really standard menu of Italian classics, like salad, pizza, pasta, and antipasti. Sometimes, that's exactly what you want, like a nice bowl of comforting pasta, a glass of aperol spritz, and some good conversation, which is why I found myself at Ulivo one recent evening.

Reservations were not needed as the dining room sat mostly empty on the night I visited. The space was beautifully decorated, and in the empty space in this prime location already had me suspecting the food was probably pretty lackluster, which turned out to be true.

I was dining with someone who is Italian and likes to judge a restaurant by their most basic dishes, so we ordered a margherita pizza and pappardelle fresche con brasato di coda alla vaccinara (oxtail ragu), and a basic, arugula, parmesan salad. Sometimes basic dishes will taste amazing if the kitchen knows what they're doing, but everything we had lacked any punchy flavor, so much so that we left food on the table-- a rarity for me.

I did enjoy the wine selection and my aperol spritz was pretty solid. I'd come here for a drink and maybe an appetizer but would save a full meal for elsewhere.

This place is great. Pastas were amazing. Specially the truffled ravioli special and the pappardelle. The ambiance is great and romantic--perfect date night spot. Service was attentive and quick. Would highly recommend!

3.5 stars for a chill but classy vibe, decent food, and pleasant service at this Italian spot between Flatiron and Koreatown. We arrived around 9m on a Friday, which in the new New York is apparently now a late dinner rather than a normal weekend dinner time. The dining room emptied out over the next hour with only three other tables then occupied.

A decent wine list brought a too sweet sparkling rosé. For an appetizer, we tried one of the specials: burrata wrapped in pizza dough and then fried up and served with a pomodoro sauce. Thankfully, it was not over fried like a state fair food monstrosity. It tasted just fine, but a bit more bland than I had expected. That same blandness was also the taste of my ricotta ravioli entree with pomodoro sauce. Almost all of the pasta is made in house and this was good pasta, but not great. However, the tomato sauce was oddly watery and not as flavor forward as I prefer. The rigatoni with veal ragu across the table got a thumbs up from my better half.

The service was pleasant but a bit too chill at times, where we still hadn't been asked what entrees we wanted even though the appetizer was on the table, as were the menus, and we had begun to eat. All in all, a pleasant spot but no real sublime moments to make it memorable.

Any overly quiet restaurant in NY is a sign...I should have known. I booked Ulivo for my fam to celebrate my son's bday-he wanted Italian- but was pretty unimpressed. Ambiance has potential, but food and atmosphere was really lacking. Not ideal for vegetarians. We got the almond pesto which was interesting, pizza was fine, nothing special, and the pomodoro really left something to be desired. They would not accommodate any of the other dishes to be made vegetarian, and overall service was meh. Many restaurants offer complimentary dessert for a bday but there was no acknowledgment of it here. Overall made for a really mediocre dinner celebration.
Very impressed with the menu specials and the prosciutto pizza was quite good. Pasta was nothing exceptional but overall great Italian spot

We came here and were immediately seated without a reservation on Saturday evening.  Our server was good and attentive.

The ravioli special was excellent and it was the best of our three entrees.  The margherita pizza was very good as well.  The branzino was tasty but overcooked.

Thumbs up for the side of potatoes.  

Enjoyed the cannoli, we wouldn't order the Italian cake again.

Great place! Nice !
Small bar Great service
And delicious food !
I'll come back next time for main course!

Ulivo was delightful. The interior was cozy and elegant; our hostess and server was welcoming and hospitable and; the food itself was exquisite. We were so so so satisfied. Plating was beautiful and the drinks were well done. Tutto perfetto!

The fried burrata over romesco sauce was superb and the rest was bad from the experience, and staff. The hostess was sassy , a bit unprofessional, and unfriendly and judge people base on what they are wearing tonight, we order for second regular martini and surprisingly the hostess present us with a different drink, which expresso martini, and didn't say a word, and when they are taking order and server/waiter telling us about or menu's choices staff are laughing at him - we are not sure if its him or us they are making fun of. Very disrespectful, disgustingly unprofessional. We will never eat on this disgusting establishment....

I've been coming to this place since 4 months ago and is amazing.
The food is fabulous home made pasta, super fresh.
It just feel like a taste of Italy in Manhattan.

The cocktails are also AMAZING we set at the Bar and the Bartender (Juan) gave as almost a mixologist lesson.
We are going to come back, for sure!

If you're looking for a lovely Italian spot for a one on one dinner, this is the perfect place. The lights are dimmed just enough for it to be romantic and still see your date. The service was great, with multiple servers refilling your water at a moments notice, while giving you time to settle in and pick what you like from the menu (ask about their specials for the night). The servers were also very professional. The food was amazing, I'd recommend their octopus as a starter any day. Being that I had a special, I won't necessarily recommend any particular foods off of their menu, but the meal was well prepared and delicious.

The host, Enza was very rude to us when we walked in. Dismissed us and made us feel very unwelcome. We ended up sitting at the bar and then watched Enza be very mean and rude to her staff. It was hard to watch. The food was fine - but a horrible experience watching this one staff member (Enza) who seemed like the manager be so horrible to customers and the staff.

Love the service, food and drink. We sat at the bar; because my boyfriend likes to be able to hear me. He feels that it gets a bit noisy when sitting at at table. The restaurant is nice. My salmon over the spinach and creamy cauliflower was delicious.

Ulivo has a wonderful selection of pastas to eat, ranging from malloreddus to busiate

I ordered the malloreddus a dish that comes with a sweet and spicy sausage ragu. This dish is from Sardinia in Italy that is typically served with a assuage ragu although most sauces work well with it. The ragu was great, seasoned well and overall a great dish. I've had malloreddus from different places before and this holds up. Definitely recommend
I went with coworkers for lunch. It was not crowded. Nice open space. Pizza regina margherita was good. But mostly, the bread dipping oil with capers was exceptional. ;)

Cute little Italian joint in Manhattan. Nice service, and good food-albeit, a bit on the expensive side, e.g. I saw a steak on the menu that cost $75. I stuck to traditional Italian fare and enjoyed it.

Had a pleasant family dinner during an NYC trip. The homemade pastas were great, and there were a lot of tasty and unusual options like spreadable 'nduja in the salami and cheese board, and a special homemade ravioli with truffles and something else I can't remember because it was so good I ate it in about 45 seconds.
Nice selection of regional draft beers at the bar, which is unusual for an Italian restaurant, and a wine list with interesting items I hadn't had before. (The one I got was good enough that I found a store online from my phone that had it in stock and mail ordered a case.)
Service was attentive and pleasant without being cloying. We'll be back.
Wonderful service. Never too busy and a nice delicious and concise menu of great pasta and sauce. Very comfortable and intimate. Bartender is top notch professional.

The service was great. Drinks were great. Food was okay. It wasn't bad but it wasn't outstanding either. Their Perciatelli Amatriciana was a little too salty for my taste. I didn't get to finish the dish because it was a bit too salty. I'm a big pasta lover- so it was a bit disappointing there. I would definitely try another dish if I get to go back there in the future.

Full disclosure- we had limited time before the set at The Jazz Gallery (nearby) and tried three other restaurants, which all had lengthy waitlists, so we were thrilled to stumble upon this authentic Italian restaurant. We were easily accommodated at the bar, weexplained that we didn't have much time and both the bartender and manager were friendly, informative and fast. We started with martinis and red wine. Fresh bread and a flavorful lentil olive oil spread came out quickly. We started with buffalo mozzarella basil salad, followed by the braised tuna belly with olives and capers- which were both delicious. We also tried a medley of small fried plates that were quite tasty. Would definitely return.

Great food, service and ambience!
We had a bit of everything and great cocktails also!

Cozy and comfortable Italian spot. The inside is beautiful and perfect for a date night. The service was really good, our hostess made really good recommendations. The menu has many different options suiting any type of dietary restrictions.
We started the night with:
funghetti
fried mixed mushrooms, fresh herbs, truffle oil - this was delicious and simple with each bite packed with flavor!

pomodoro, bufala e basilico
buffalo mozzarella, tomatoes, basil - I am a sucker for a good caprese and this did not disappoint

For our pasta course we ordered the following :
busiate con pesto alla trapanese
pesto made with almonds, fresh tomato, basil and garlic - the pasta was flavorful and al dente

ravioli ai formaggi freschi con fonduta di pomodori:
stuffed with fresh cheese, topped with tomato sauce - this was delicious and not too heavy

spaghettoni chitarra al pomodorino e basilico
fresh cherry tomato sauce, garlic and basil

We finished off our meal with the Tiramisu. Everything was delicious and freshly made.

Very quaint local spot in the neighborhood!

Overall, pretty disappointing experience. We found ourselves at Ulivo on a Saturday night. There was a reservation no-show, so my party of 4 was seated pretty quickly. The hostess was lovely, but that alone does not garner a good review. The waiter completely forgot about us -never introduced himself, never came over, nada... the hostess wound up answering our questions and taking our orders. We consistently had to ask for water. The table of 2 next to us was seated ~20 minutes after us with the same waiter and the waiter was much more attentive. It was as though the kitchen lost our order. The table next to use ordered a while after us but got their food much faster. We actually saw the hostess pull the waiter aside to remind him that we were his table. From a food perspective, the menu is limited for GF options, which is not surprising for an Italian restaurant. Despite no indication on the menu, they do have GF pasta. The pork shank was OK. All the pasta was over salted. Overall, I'd say Ulivo is not worth going out of your way for. It was a lackluster experience, and with copious Italian restaurants in Manhattan you're probably better off somewhere else. Despite this less than stellar review, I do have to give props to the hostess who stepped in when the waiter was MIA despite having to do her regular job.

Ulivo Ratings: 4.6/5

Food: 4.75/5 - Treat yourself and go to Ulivo. We decided to be adventurous and got the special pasta of the night, which is the rigatoni with braised short ribs and one off of their menu, the malloreddus alla campidanese. Both pasta were amazing and tried both pasta. We liked the malloreddus more at first, but later we agreed that the rigatoni was the winner. The rigatoni pasta tasted like no other pasta I had before. It has a subtle buttery taste to it, but did not overpowered the meat. The more you eat it, the more it will grow on you, like you don't want it to end. Meat sauce was delicious, well-seasoned and pasta is made in-house, so amazingly firm, thick, and chewy. The malloreddus pasta isn't made in-house, but still pretty al dente. It comes with a sweet and spicy sausage ragu. The meat sauce once again was phenomenal, hearty and meaty just how I like it. Only downside is I wished both pasta dishes were more saucier, then it would be perfect. I always like to dip my bread into the meat sauce at the end of my meal. By the way, their complimentary bread was not impressive at all, pretty hard and stale.

Ambiance: 4.75/5 - Amazing ambiance for a date night or catching up with friends, both romantic and inviting feel with soft lightings and pretty decor. Definitely have one of the better date night vibes compared to other Italian restaurants. We sat in the corner booth, so the atmosphere was super cute and relaxing, able to see the whole restaurant in action and the cocktail bar too near the entrance. We came in on a weekday for dinner, inside was pretty empty and quiet, so no need to worry about distancing, and able to have a good conversation with your group.  

Price: 4.5/5 - We got two glasses of red wine at $14 per glass and two pasta as entrees, the total came up to be around $80 before tips and tax. For the price and portion, I think Ulivo really stands out, especially for a Michelin Guide restaurant, a good value and steal for all the pasta lover out there.

Service: 4.5/5 - Our waitress was great. She recommended us some red wine selection and pasta, and then explained to us where its from in Italy thoroughly, super informative. I would say the service matches with the food, perfect and outstanding. Also, the Italian charm and authenticity were not missed on us. We really enjoyed the experience.

BLUF: 100% would recommend this place. Shockingly good pasta, great and extensive selection of wine menu, awesome customer service. Side note: in the menu, pasta dish with an asterisk means it is not in-house/homemade pasta. Definitely try their pasta made in-house.
Food's great, the pici alla bottarga is a thing of the gods. Atmosphere's really quiet. Good cocktail and wine selection!

We went here for a date night, no rez on a Fri night. While we had to sit at the bar, it was so worth it. Food and drinks were good, good ambience, bartender was nice. Food came very quickly. A bit pricey but overall great

This is my absolute favorite restaurant in Manhattan. The food is always fantastic and no matter what I order I am always delighted with my meal! Servers are also great and always efficient, happy and polite. The manager she is very friendly and nice ! Can't wait to return!!! Their cocktail is so good!!! Must try!!
Food was a 4/5. Quite good! Peroni is a large glass and good atmosphere. Definitely get the tiramisu! It took absurdly long for us to get our check but overall a good dining experience
The food here was actually so bad. Place was empty, service was ok, but the craziest thing here was the pesto which basically resembled vomit.

The food and customer service was amazing. The decor was rustic and authentic to the Italian culture. I ordered the ravioli with cheese and it was light but filling. I left this place satisfied, not bloated or heavy like some pasta dishes can make you feel. I didn't have the time to enjoy an appetizer or dessert but it gave me another reason to come back. Great place for out of towners, catching up with old friends or happy hour

Really great ambiance for date night or catch up with friends, quick service to begin with but then service got slow after eating which was unfortunate. Got the malloreddus alla campidanese (AKA sweet and spicy sausage ragú) and thought the noodles were a little overcooked/too soft, but I really liked the meat and sauce! We got the tiramisu and it was really delicious.

What a treat! I know there is a lot of goof Italian food in NYC, but for the price, Ulivo really stands out! We got the pasta Perciatelli Amatriciana and pizza Regina Margherita. The pasta was very good, oily in the right ways, rich and gamey from the guanciale, and well seasoned. The pizza is one of my favorites to date. This comes entirely down to personal preference, but it's like this pizza was made just for me: I love a pizza with a little crunch, a little flop, and just the right amount of salty acidic tomato sauce. Ulivo. Delivered. To ME this is the best pizza around, with delicious strands of buffalo mozz on top (again, my fave). I highly recommend giving it a try, and again, for the price it's good value too! Staff and atmosphere we're also very lovely and warm :)

***Friendly service, Delicious food, Concerns with COVID safety***

I came here with a friend for outdoor dining. It's a narrow street so there really isn't a "six feet distance" from one table to the next. However, aside from that, the food was delicious and the bread dipping sauce was absolutely spectacular. Our waitress was great and very accommodating.

[restaurant week takeout]

Both the bolognese and pesto pastas were delicious, the pesto was very homemade and nutty. If I had to pick, I preferred the bolognese. The fried meatballs looked underwhelming, but were quite delicious. They reminded of falafel. Generous portions.

Came early on a weekday and the indoor dining was quiet and didn't have to worry about spacing. The meal was memorable one. The Ravioli was delicious stiffed with eppplant and finished off with a butter cream sauce. The Oxtail Ragu was next level with freshly made pasta. Finish off with Tiramisu. A house specialty. Light fluffy and full of flavor

Great customer service and food was amazing.
squid ink pasta 10/10
oxtail ragu 8/10
octopus 9/10

Ulivo has the best date night vibes- nothing is better than authentic pasta + bread over dramatic mood lighting. We went for an early dinner on a Saturday evening and  practically had the place to ourselves. Comfy booths wrap around the restaurant creating a warm atmosphere perfect for fIrst encounters or another date night to add to the books.

The food was great and portions were a perfect size- definitely enough to feel full, but not the over indulge size portions you'd get at the Olive Garden. Highly reccomend the fried meatballs- the perfect appetizer to start off the meal!

This place was a pleasant surprise as it was within walking distance to our hotel on 8th and 28th. We came for lunch on a Sunday and there was no one inside. I loved it!

Food was very good:

*Pasta: pappardelle fresche con brasato di coda alla vaccinara ($22, 4 stars) - BRAISED OXTAIL RAGU!! Can you tell I'm excited?! I'm a huge fan of hearty and meaty pasta, and this is it! The pasta is al dente, and the meat sauce very flavorful. This will be even more perfect for a cold or rainy day.

*Antipasti:
+ Highly recommend: Polipetto alla purea di nduja e fave fresche ($20, 5 stars) - DA BEST fried baby octopus I've ever had! I'm pretty sure the octopus was cooked first cuz it was very tender inside but crispy outside.
+salsiccia e fagioli all'uccelletto $16 - 3.5 stars - fatty sausage on top of braised cannellini beans.

Service was decent, the waiters were both Italians.

I was impressed with the linguine vongole.  Ample clams in delicious sauce with house made pasta.  Start with the arugula salad and finish with the tiramisu .  Don't forget the prosecco.   Attentive staff.

This restaurant has elegant decorations indoor, and they do check vaccination cards prior to entry.

Food was decent, small portion but ok taste. However, our waitress was really rude to us. She never came back after serving us food, and asked how things are going to the table right next to us, then just ignored our table!

I'm not sure why or what we did, maybe is because we only ordered ~$50 worth of food? If we pay the premium money to have a good experience, I expect the service would be at least decent! Very disappointed.

This place is awesome all your local food in one spot.
Seats are plenty they even have inside/outdoors seating
The food are always made fresh
Their vegan options are awesome I'm not a vegan but I tried them all cause it's so good.
I took my niece there after we came from the movie theater which is just around the corner.
Services are always nice no mean cashier with a attitude unlike some of them but this has all the employees love to interact with you while feeding some good food.
I'm glad my nieces enjoyed themselves!

On my way from my appointment with DR.G., at essence acupuncture for a follow-up, I passed by urban space. What do we have here? And I was hungry and haven't eaten since my lunch break at 12 pm. So, I went in to see what food urban space caters to, and it's a variety. However, this is what I chose and it was very good.
Good guy at the front of masttik because I added a vegan option, which was the chickpeas and spinach.
It thew hm off at first because I added the chickpeas and spinach to the rice and chicken. He kindly obliged while letting me know it's extra, and we laughed. Flavors were their and chicken so soft, and as you can see, he hooked me up.
I will definitely be back to Misttik and try the other food vendors in urban space.

Urban Space Union Square is our most convenient location.

We've been to Urban Space Union Square three times for lunch. I especially like the crispy lemon chicken from Lou Yau Kee and the spicy chicken sandwich from Bobwhite. And the 3-dollar beers from Kid Brother Pizza are a great deal!

The backyard is perfect for dining al fresco in nice weather. There are long communal tables for large groups, as well as a few tables for couples. We found it less crowded on a Sunday afternoon, and we'll definitely be back to try other dishes.

A food hall on 14th Street between Trader Joe's and a NYU dorm. I've tried Bao by Kaya's combo with spring rolls, choosing the Buddha Bao (tofu with a tasty sweet chili sauce). I ate at the Top Hops bar which was casual and cool when the bartender is around (sometimes they're not during off hours). Try not to sit there when it's windy or rainy with wind: The back doors just fly open and shut on their own though staff come down to deal with them.

I want to support more new places, especially when they give space to businesses run by BIPOC folk. Unfortunately, all of the food comes in plastic to-go, even when you're staying, so it's like this at all the other Urban Space locations, which isn't great. It makes me long for a Mercado Little Spain on the West side which is a food hall that serves with real dishes.

I will drink at Top Hops though, keeping in mind that non-beers are less expensive nearby.

Urban Space has opened yet another food hall on East 14th Street between Third Avenue and 4th Avenue specifically between the late lamented Trader Joe Wine Store and Wells Fargo. Open 24 hours every day with gender neutral restrooms this is already attracting the lunch crowd and neighborhood customers. Inside is a large spacious bright area with plenty of seats both bar style and some regular tables.

Today I went to eat at Summer Salt, a tacqueria. I chose the Carne Asada taco and guacamole and chips. The two cost $11.11 which seems reasonable. The food tasted alright and the chips were quite good although I prefer the ones at the Olly Olly Food Hall in Chelsea.

I plan to return because I want to sample the other cuisines. The Taiwanese Bao by Kaya is here and I first ate it at the Holiday Markets at both Bryant Park and Union Square. Their baos are tasty and nicely priced especially the Peking Duck one. Even the Belgian Wafels & Dinges is here and is such a tasty treat!

Recommended.

New food court concept at Zero Irving Place on 14th Street with a bunch of interesting options. We started with a couple of bao from Bao by Kaya , the shrimp one and the Buddha Bao which is tofu with a tasty sweet chili sauce. They aren't too big but a nice thing to try out if you want a small bite . Then we went to Pita Yeero and got their "build your own bowl " . I got the meatless Greek meatballs with rice and grape leaves and hummus and tomato and cucumber salad. The meatless Greek meatballs were actually really good, a little bit spicy, and actually tasted like meat . Comes with some pita bread too . Next time I think I'd get the French Fries as one of the sides instead of the tomato and cucumber salad. But this was very filling and a good choice if you're actually hungry. My friend got the Chicken Yeero bowl with rice and french fries and really liked it. There was so much he took some home for dinner leftovers for the next day. We actually ate our food at the Top Hops bar. They let you order food somewhere else and eat at the bar if you order a drink. Pretty cool and the bartender is nice . The hall was playing kind of 70s rock music soundtrack when we were there. Not too loud. We got happy hour beer and wine. The beer I think was $4 and the Pinot noir was like $8 for a small glass. Pretty good to try out this place. Many options.

I happened to stumble upon Unregular pizza on my way home and I'm so happy I did. I tried the
truffle mushrooms  with mixed mushrooms, truffle oil, whole burrata, mozzarella. The
Cafonata with tomato sauce, premium pepperoni, spicy hot honey, and whole burrata. Also, the  Bufalona with cherry tomato confit, buffalo mozzarella, basil pesto, tomato sauce and the BurraPizza with cherry tomato confit, prosciutto, artichokes, and whole burrata

Their pizza boxes are super cute and stylish and the pizza was absolutely delicious.. and the staff was so friendly and welcoming.

Fun fact: They have a bartering system where you can swipe clothes, experiences, food and more as a form of currency for any menu item on offer. You can sign up on their website to learn more.

Also, check out their newly opened bakery Unregular bakery for some delicious pastries

Ig:@Thefunfluencer

＊Burrapizza Cafonata w/ Garlic Parm Squares
Tbh I was very underwhelmed by their burrapizza... I swear I ate my pizza 5 minutes after I collected my take-out, but both the pizza and the garlic squares were lukewarm, or even cold... The pizza was obviously not fresh and has been out of oven for some time. The dough was tough and hard to chew. I ended up only scraping the pepperoni on top.

Well I can imagine how heavenly it could be if it was served fresh. They popped a big ball of burrata and didn't skimp on the amount of pepperoni which I really appreciated. The garlic squares were actually very finger-licking despite its temperature, and very strong in garlic aroma. If you catch them holding a tray of pizza and garlic squares fresh out of oven, you can def give them a try.

*this is a review for their gluten free pizza*

i was not "wow'd" by their gf pizza. it was very different than the square pizza they are known for, which was disappointing. it was good, because it's pizza, but i wasn't left wanting more.

Unregular Pizza is a really cool, retro pizza place!  I visited this restaurant after seeing posts on Tik Tok.  When you walk in, all of their items are on display on the counter and ready to be heated, packaged and sent with you, to go!

I knew that I had to try the Fried Cacio e Pepe.  It was creamy Cacio e Pepe, breaded and deep fried.  It was surprisingly light and delicious and this was probably my favorite thing that I ordered!  I also tried the Burrata Pizza.  It was flavorful and refreshing with the burrata which is on each piece.  Sadly, mine was missing the hot honey, but regardless it was amazing.  Lastly I ordered the Chicken Out which had chicken, pesto, cherry tomatoes and mozzarella.  I really enjoyed this fun, different pizza.

The entire place has a retro, 80's theme.  The staff was super friendly, fun and eager to assist.  

I would definitely go back to Unregular Pizza during my next trip to NYC and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a fun, different, pizza!

This place was packed on a Saturday. Awesome variety of pizzas. Tried the Grandma Peppina and it was good,  small space with no seating but customer service is great. Would visit again and recommend. Pizza slices start at $5 but some of the speciality slices are $11.

Bonus appreciation for playing Smash Mouth - Walk-in On The Sun when I arrived. What a throwback!

Overpriced. $20 for two slices!  Pizza wasn't even good. Crust way too hard.

The person working at the counter was nice so that's one star. Next star for originality in pizza toppings.

I ordered one mushroom and one burrata pepperoni. Despite being "heated up," pizza was cold.

I wouldn't recommend and I won't be back.

Got the pepperoni burrata and grandma slice.

Service was fast and friendly!

Got my slices and ate it outside of the restaurant while the slices were hot. The slices were constructed well, great undercarriage.

The grandma slice set a great baseline - sauce was sweet and the slice was crunchy.

The pepperoni burrata slice was great too but the burrata was still cold in the middle.

At the time of this review the grandma slice was $5, and the pepperoni burrata was $11.

Definitely a must try! Will be back again.

Inside Essex Market food hall. Prepared slices to go or to stay at the food hall counters.  Friendly service.  Options for Vegans and Gluten-Free.  Loved the crispy but airy focaccia crust.  Sauce was chunky tomato and toppings tasted fresh.  Each large square for $5 is as filling as two regular NY style slices- and they'll cut it into half so you can get that two slice share game on if you can only handle half.  Apparently their fried arancini style pasta log takes 3 days to make!!

Overall rating: 4.8

I was pretty shocked that I liked this so much! I thought it would be overhyped and taste meh. But oh, my, god. This is so good! And I actually think it's relatively priced at $11.

I'm very happy I don't live near Union Square because I would be coming here every day!

Also the staff was so friendly. You never know with to-go pizza spots but I was pleasantly surprised by the niceness.

I knocked a few points because you can tell the place is popular, dare I say IG-popular  I wish it had better/ more outdoor seating spots available than a bench.

Best of definitely coming back . Can't say that for all places but definitely am for this place .

Flavors were eye popping , the variety is wow , the Italian sodas als i best I ever had .

Small space so be prepared to take out and eat at the bench in the park near by. But great place nice staff

The pizza is truly is unregular and I mean that in the best way possible lol. They have all sorts of different pizza and ALL of it looks and tastes delicious. Me and a couple friends all ordered different pizza and tried a bit of each. (If you go with a group DO THAT).

The people are nice and if you order 1 slice you will get it within about 5 minutes. The service is great and each slice is just under $7. I definitely want to come back here and try the sandwiches because they look yummy too.

The interior is small and it's not much of a sit down place so just order take out, go to the park, and enjoy life :)

Cool tiny little spot with a great 80's vibe to it!  It's all Roman style pizza squares which are quite large and priced decently for the city.  

Service is good, fast and quick, they take your order, pop the pizza in the over and you are outta there in a few minutes.  There are no seats to eat at in the small place but there is a small stand up counter you can eat your pizza on along with 2 small benches outside to sit on.

I ordered 2 slices of pizza....Bufalona (cherry tomato confit, bufala mozzarella, basil pesto, & tomato sauce) and the Grandma Peppina (tomato sauce, mozzarella, parmigiano, garlic and olive oil) plus one of the fried pasta square things which I was not a fan of.  It was too heavy for me.  Maybe I ordered the wrong one, I had the vodka spaghetti one.  The pizza on the other hand was perfectly crispy and had a nice tomato sauce.  Another plus, they give you a free drink....not sure if you have to spend a certain limit to receive it.  

Small cute spot worth trying out!

I would come back again if I was in the area.

Small storefront.  The pizza: amazing crusty,  the right amount of crunchy,  the right amount of chewy,  and the right amount.   I got the pepperoni and burata pizza.   The sauce is divine,  the pepperoni is delicious and plentiful, the honey and hot sauce add a great layer of flavor. The burata, however,  didn't add anything to the taste.   The thing is, when it got put on a hot pizza,  the inside liquefied,  and lost all flavor. Next time,  because that's how good the pizza is,  I'm just gonna get it without the burata. It's also an expensive slice,  but I think it's totally worth it,  without the burata $.
I also got the mushroom truffle burata slice... they are generous with the truffle oil!  It was blissful,  but I wouldn't really call it pizza. It was more like an incredibly delicious flat bread.  I loved it,  but it's not pizza,  in my book.  It was even great cos,  and then you could appreciate the burata...
I tried both fried pastas, they were meh...
Be warned,  this is not sexy eating unless you're into the hog eating look...
It's probably my new favorite pizza.
Ironically, my hubby,  who doesn't like to get dirty,  thought it had too much pepperoni and stuff! As if that's even possible!

Unregular Pizza, 4th Ave, New York, NY, known for Roman-style pizza, with slices not pies. Tried pizza here Tuesday, the 23rd of February.

Seem'd to be doing pretty good till mid-afternoon, same day, when it took a turn for the worse.

Though I had many slices to eat, I chewed and swallowed all. It was one of those picturesque slices you could see yourself eating in Rome, or any part of Italy for that matter. There are two mischievous pigeons, one on each side of me, waiting for crumbs or anything to fall. "This is not yours" - I told the birds as I slammed my lunch shut.

The pigeons gradually dissipate as I continue eating. One of the slices is painfully messy. I go through napkin after napkin to ensure a more cleaner lunch. I go for another napkin repeatedly, half-strenuous all this time. Life ebbs, runs now with the speed of a mill race; my splendid slices are all open, working slightly; my eyes turn back to the food.

A tourist coming in offers some help, in subdued tones, bent at the foot of a park bench, and in the space of the sidewalk, a crowd, including two or three residents, several students, and many others has silently gather'd. The slices are very still and warm, as my struggle with these slices goes on, and dwindles, a little more, and a little more - and then welcome conclusion, nothingness, mere crumbs.

A pause, and then the pizza box gets thrown away.

Stumbled in somewhat by accident (literally just looked up 'Pizza in the area' on maps), and I am SO glad I did. I know a lot of NYers have pizza places that they stand by in the city-- I personally don't have strong feelings about it. BUT, what I look for in a pizza is a crispy crust and banger toppings. That's all. Unregular Pizza had both.

I got the Chicken Out slice and an order of the garlic squares. This slice, especially if you eat it right after they give it to you, felt like the perfect crunchy bite. It was hot, savory, and did I mention that it was crispy. I need you to know that it was crispy. The garlic squares were equally as crispy-- they were more bite sized, which made them different from the garlic knots that you might be used to getting. Super good, but definitely less doughy and more chip-like.

Note that the squares come with marinara sauce, but the sauce comes COLD, which is insane to me. I don't know about you all, but I need that sauce to be warm to enjoy with my warm garlic squares. I don't like the thought of getting served refrigerated marinara sauce from the day before.

Another downside is that the place itself is so skinny. there's barely enough room to have two people side by side because while there's pizza/ordering happening on one side, there's a small standing room only counter that's on the other side. And then people are cramming through the middle to try to exit. It was chaotic when I went in to get a lunch slice on a Saturday, and I decided to buckle down and eat at the counter, which made me subject to a ton of shoving. It wasn't the best environment to relax and eat a slice, but it's effective. The line moves fast, and I'd recommend grabbing and going.

Now you got to try this FANTASTIC fried pasta that they added .
Ridiculously excellent and not that greasy !
Ask for red sauce cause it is needed and complete the flavor .
Those guys are not just Unregular pizza but great
Unregular fabulous Italian food !

Highly recommended!

Definitely A Destination!!!

Solid square pizza joint. I give this a solid 4/5.

The grandma peppina, tomato buffalo, and pepperoni burrata slice was pretty good.

The crust was thin and well done in that it was perfectly crunchy and crispy without it being too heavy or oil.

Also a drink was included!

Definitely will return.

This is for their LES location by Essex Crossing that I went to..Had the mushroom slice, I thought it was a little chewy maybe that was the style of the pizza. Overall it's not the best I have had but it's solid and tasty.

All of their slices look absolutely stunning. I was tempted to get their burrata pepperoni slice but it just looks quite rich for one individual to consume, and it's a whopping $11 for one slice so I opted for the meat lovers one (~$7). The toppings on this slice were spot on - I believe it was a bolognese type of meat sauce with pepperoni and sausage. However the crust itself was lacking in flavor and it was way too light and airy in dough to carry all the amazing flavors together. Overall it was a decent slice but probably wouldn't come out of my way for it.

Pretty cool spot for Sicilian slices.
They didn't have any really weird ones like the Doritos slice but the ones they did have looked really appetizing. I opted for the burra pizza and cacio e pepe slice.

Loved the burra pizza. The burrata and pepperoni were delicious. Plus you almost never see burrata on a slice. Unfortunately the cacio e pepe was a miss for me. The flavor n cheese just wasn't really there. I saved it by adding lemon pepper but it was just ok.

Overall pretty cool spot to check out. Might stop by again if I was in the area but prob wouldn't detour

Saw this place on tik tok and had to give it a try since it's close to work. The pizza was delicious but the fried cacio e pepe square was the star. Definitely a spot to visit if you're looking for a slice and are in the area.

Cacio E Pepe Pizza. HORRIBLE. Basically a Slice that tastes like Cheese and Bread. This Slice is a take on a ROMAN Pasta Dish which just consists of Pecorino Romano Cheese  & Black Pepper. Never heard of it. I really didn't like the flavor of the Cheese at all. Didn't see a Cheese and Tomato Sauce Slice and settled for this. Only after walking out did I realize my mistake 'cause there was a Grandma Peppina Slice. I'm just judging UNREGULAR PIZZA on this Slice which might not be fair. Can't really advise anyone to AVOID this place because of this. WALK DON'T RUN.

This may just be my new favorite pizza place in NYC. It may not be a traditional NY slice, but it's delicious and that's what matters to me.

I got a slice of Burrapizza Cafonata. I've never had burrata on pizza before and I loved it. I also loved how much pepperoni they put on it.

My husband and I were eating at several other places the day we came here, so we only tried one slice, but I definitely want to go back sometime and try some of their other slices.

What a great slice!! After being let down by PDA slice shop I was a little afraid of another square slice place. This place absolutely lives up to the hype! I'd say second just behind Prince St when it comes to a pepperoni square. Burrata is super creamy and balances out the spice from the pepperoni and the sauce. Cool walk up place and friendly service. Would definitely come back for another slice. The fried pasta square was just ok, but this is a pizza place after all so no loss of stars. Still to the pizza and you will be happy!

This place was so cute. I loved the vibes of the inside it was very retro. They had a ton of options both pizza and sandwiches. We got the mushroom slice with burrata and it was soooo good. It wasn't too truffly which is what I was worried about. It wasn't too heavy which was nice. I'm excited to try more. There's only a long bar table inside with no seating so it can feel a little crowded, but the service was nice and fast.

Honestly, I was excited to try the pizza here, but felt a little disappointed. I do understand that the burrata pizza is the most popular menu item, so it might have been my fault for not ordering the right thing. For a more honest review, I would have to try more slices and maybe even the fried pasta. I have to say, the selection here is excellent! There are plenty of vegetarian options and some vegan ones as well, but those can be a little on the pricey side. I ordered the veggie fiesta (mozzarella, tomato sauce, cherry tomato confit, roasted peppers, mixed mushrooms) because I do love myself a good veggie pizza. The pizza stays out in the glass case,  so they had to warm it up for us before serving. Rather than tasting fresh, it was a little soggy and just barely warm.

Pretty solid pizza overall, lots of vegan options!

The story of the place is quite interesting. Skip this paragraph if you don't care, but they started off during COVID working out of an apartment, bartering with their neighbors for interesting items. The pizza was so good they have their own storefront now! I believe they still  barter once a month and you have to request on their website to be the lucky winner. We love a COVID survival story!

Getting a few by the slice, the flavors were all great

UNMARGHERITA
What you would want from a margherita pizza, pools of white cheese interspersed in a thin background of sweet marinara, with kisses of basil decorating the slice. Margherita is a go to flavor for me and they make a good one!

PESTO CHICKEN - forgot the full name of this one
This was good with big chunks of chicken and pesto decorating the slice (good portions!) with cherry tomatoes topping it off for a nice touch of acidity and juiciness. Like the flavors; I think this one could have been warmed a bit more since there's a lot of toppings it didn't capture all of the heat. This is a common potential area of improvement I've noticed with pizza shops.

BURRAPIZZA
Creamy burrata spread over toasty pepperoni cups. Sweet, thick texture and enough burrata to cover the whole slice. It wasn't the easiest to spread, but I'm no burrata expert so can't say if that's good or bad but regardless the slice was yummy. Crust with a good crunch on the square slices I've had here.

I decided to visit Unregular Pizza on my latest trip to NYC. I'd heard about the Burrapizza and immediately knew I had to my hands (and mouth) on a slice. After walking about a mile up 4th Ave, I finally saw a white and black sign that simply said "PIZZA". I walked in and instantly noticed the glass case with all different types of pizza and other mouthwatering treats. There were about a dozen or so people eating and standing around inside the small establishment, which made it feel very crowded. That said, there was no wait to order. I saw the Burrapizza Cafonata staring back at me from the center of the case. The huge dollop of burrata looking at me like a giant eyeball. It looked amazing, but would it taste as good as it looked? The person who took my order popped it in the oven, and it came out piping hot. I found an inch or two at the chest-high counter and began to eat my slice of heaven. The flavor was exceptional. I'm a sucker for sweet and spicy. The pepperoni cups were delicious.  The slice had the right amount of heat. It's a tough slice to eat by hand, so I used a combination of my fingers and the plastic knife and fork provided by the staff. Wonderful pizza, friendly staff, and a cool retro vibe. What more could you ask for?

I also tried the cacio e Pepe slice for a little variety, but the Cafonata is where it's at.
Deliciousness in these packages. I tried the museum n the fried cacio e pepe. Very good

This is by far my favorite pizza in NY yet! I had to try the burrapizza as I love burrata and it does not disappoint!! The sauce has a touch of sweetness and saltiness from the cheese which blend well on a yummy, perfectly crisp crust. Pepperoni are crispy and cooked to perfection. I also tried the fried pasta in both cacio e pepe and vodka...delicious! My only regret was not getting another slice to bring home! Can't wait for this place to blow up so they can get a bigger spot so I can sit and eat in the restaraunt! There is a small bar table against the wall that you can stand and eat at and also a couple of benches outside...maybe for when I come back when it's warmer!

Unregular pizza is a cool small pizza joint very close to union square. They have a lot of nontraditional unique options for a quick slice of pizza.

Looking for a slice not too messy, I ordered the Parmigiana plus - which came with fried eggplant, mozzarella, parmigiano, and ricotta.  Service was quick, and I was rapidly served my freshly warmed slice after a few minutes.

If you are looking for a more unique pizza slice, check our unregular pizza! It will cost more than your dollar slice NYC pizza, but in my opinion, Unregular Pizza serves a darn good square slice of pizza.

I found this place online while visiting NYC and I brought my partners family to try it with me since we were all in the mood for pizza. It isn't easy finding a place that satisfies all of our tastes but this place has something for each of us! I tried the burrata pizza that has the burrata right on each slice and it's seriously one of the best pizzas I've had in NY. I also tried their fried pasta (Cació e Pepe) which was okay it lacked a bit of flavor so the taste was a bit flat. I probably don't need to try that one again, but I'd be willing to give a different fried pasta a chance next time.
The staff was so helpful and so quick even when the place got so busy immediately after we placed our order. Everyone was able to get their orders pretty fast which helped since the space is on the smaller side. Although a small space, it's worth coming in to try this pizza. The burrata pizza was sold through twice in the hour we were there. That should say enough!!

Simply only good things to say about this spot. One, the staff are my favorite people on this earth, such kind human beings. Second, the pizza, wow! I usually think pizza tastes pretty much the same anywhere but they really blew my mind here. Also plenty of vegetarian options! I got the mushroom burrata pizza, Cacio e pepe pizza, artichoke Stromboli and vegan chicken parm sandwich. The only one I'd tell you to skip out on is the vegan chicken parm. Everything else was 10/10 worth it. Only standing counter space so plan accordingly.

I totally forgot this place was so close to my PT appointment. There was so many choices to choose from.

They had fried pasta, rice balls,  garlicky knots, pepperoni, mushrooms pizza and i love anything MUSHROOMS. That's when i saw their truffle mushroom - mixed mushrooms,  whole Burrata and truffle oil. It was AMAZINGLY delicious. I can't wait to try their other pizza or their garlicky knots.

My mouth is drooling already just thinking about it. They're pricey but definitely unique
By far the best pizza slice I've had in a minute. Customer service was great, the employees at the front were super nice and funny. I'll be dreaming about this place until I can have it again.

Disappointed. Went out of my way to come here. Our chicken parm sandwhich was cold and the guy cut it in half through the foil leaving tons of foil pieces in our sandwich which we had to pick out. The fried pasta was good though.

Great service and great pizza! I tried both the triangle cheese pizza and their square margherita pizza and both were so good. Great crusts, a very satisfying crunch! Hit the spot for my pizza craving.

Loved all the pizza we ate last night. Ingredients were so fresh and the staff is so friendly and gave such great recommendations. Loved the veggie festa the most but everything else were great. Bufalona was amazing with fresh basil pesto,i mushrooms was also good. Also, will keep going back to this place. Don't forget to try their Nutella pizza, it was delicious.

Saw a blogger's review and since I was nearby, i decided to try.  Really cute, bright, old school vibe pizzeria, where there's only an aisle and then the other side the glass case of choices.  Had a 80s vibe.  Took the pizza to go and was recommended to warm at home using the handy heating instructions at the side of the box.  Slices were big, but I think I left it 5mins longer than suggested in the oven.  Bottom and crust was hard but ate the top section minus the crust. It was tasty though. I think I'll try it again but this time, more immediate as opposed to taking it home.

Came here on a weekday evening to grab a few slices to go, got a mushroom slice with burrata, meat lovers, and a arancini. Flavor for the pizza was good and the crust was tasty, but the arancini was lukewarm and not that flavorful nor tasty, would skip that one. Conveniently located, lots of options to choose from.

We ordered delivery from here because I was excited for burrata pizza. Overall, not bad, but a few things to note:

1. Burrata pizza arrives soggy because of the amount of cheese. Flavor was great, but the entire bottom of the pizza was just wet dough. You can tell if you got it from the store, it would have been an entire different experience. It would be great if they separated the Burrata and you can add it once you receive the pizza, especially in this cold weather where you may have to reheat the pizza upon arrival.

2. Other pizzas are fine, non-burrata pizza crust is crispy, flavors are good. We got a few things to try and so far, we're not upset, but 2 out of 6 slices were the $10.50 burrata slices so it's disappointing that it's soggy.

I want to try this in store, so this review is strictly delivery based. Maybe we'll get an update soon.

Update: on November 27th there was a young man with a broken foot serving and so happy. We started to have conversations as I wait for the food, but man I don't know what it is but if the owner is making his employees happy then that is good reason to come back. He was a nice employee just like the other young man with the pink cap. He is also a nice person, but amazing how you recognize me all the time and know what I'd like. Wish I can give you a 6 start but google doesn't allow it, haha

(FR)

Mise à jour : le 27 novembre il y avait un jeune homme avec un pied cassé qui servait et tellement content.  Nous avons commencé à avoir des conversations pendant que j'attendais la nourriture, mais je ne sais pas ce que c'est, mais si le propriétaire rend ses employés heureux, c'est une bonne raison de revenir.  C'était un gentil employé tout comme l'autre jeune homme à la casquette rose.  C'est aussi une personne gentille, mais incroyable comme vous me reconnaissez tout le temps et savez ce que j'aimerais.  J'aimerais pouvoir vous donner un 6 départ mais google ne le permet pas, haha

A howling wind hit fast with a barrage of nickel sized snow and a chilling cold was mercilessly pounding the Lower East Side streets and sidewalks. I just parked on 13th and 4th, to my right I saw what appeared to be icy green spikes hanging down upon the scaffolding, ready to drop as the wind continued it's onslaught.

We quickly huddled inside, pressing the glass door closed behind us as winters last grasp pushed hard upon the opposite side. I spun around - first noticing the 80s themed tiles, neon lighting and pastel colors. My partner didn't see it because she thinks I see the 80s everywhere - I don't know wether that's true or not, I suppose it's possible. It's not like I'm actively seeking out Tetris shaped tater tots or anything but it'd really cool eating the backwards L after connecting it to the upside down inverted L.

Behind the glass sat a wide array of gourmet pizzas - piping with garden fresh color and all perched up upon thick wooden cutting boards - Those beat up aluminum disks are appearing in my mind now to look so cheap and antiquated.

The owner was from Rome, a young handsome gentlemanly fellow with honest eyes and a warm handshake. Learning my family is from Milan, he became more noticable interested - I was decked out in Real Tree Elite camouflage, clad top to bottom with long-haired NYC Grizzly Adams - I quickly recalled some Italian and began the difficult choosing process.

Anchovies, meatball, black olive could have been there - I don't know, I can't say - toppings here are beautifully unusual, cut in interesting shapes and set upon a cheese that had creamy cow Taleggio  brilliancy.
I said out loud "sexy mushrooms"  because they are - take a porchini and learn it's capabilities - they are sexy. Some truffle oil? I couldn't ask as I was diving into my cheese, pomodoro and basil slice with a half of a pepper and a half of a meat slice to finish.
My partner likes to see me do a Man vs Food episode for her private entertainment -- this is the place to over eat as your facing one way to choose, turn and take a step to the counter to stand and eat (a good position for the big eatin hungry people out there) then turn back around, do the pizza hokey pokey and order yourself up another.

Delicious pizza.

I had their burrapizza cafonata and their cheesy garlic squares.

The sauce was tangy and there was even a hint of sweetness. I really enjoyed the slightly charred pepperoni cups.

This is a grab-and-go place, so there isn't seating, but there is a small bench outside of the store.

The staff were very friendly and I look forward to returning in the future to try out their other offerings.

Worst Pizzeria in NYC!
Overpriced!
Terrible service!
Dry + Soggy - low-quality pizzas.
STAY AWAY FROM UNREGULAR PIZZA!

100/10 pizza and fried spaghetti! I found this place through TikTok and I'm so glad I finally got to visit. I got the truffle mushroom burrapizza and WOW- it was the most flavorful pizza I've ever had in my life!!
I also got two different kinds of the fried spaghetti, and my husband and I are obsessed!!! I was also pleasantly surprised by the prices! I definitely will be back!

They have so many different topping combos, they definitely have something that appeals to everyone who visits. I wish the crust was a little crispier but the flavors were there. The arancini would benefit from a side of marinara imo

Please support and contribute as they just encountered a violent attack. ;(

instagram.com/unregularp….

Pizza is pizza is pizza -NOT!!  Unregular Pizza is far from regular.  The choices are aplenty and the taste is delicious.  I ordered the fried pasta cacio e pepe which was out of this world - crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside.  The plant based chicken parm - amazing.  The unmushrooms pizza - if you're a fan of mushrooms you MUST order this.

Overall, everything arrived on time and was ready to eat.  We loved it all and we can't wait to order again.

Thank you Unregular Pizza for being different & delicious.  Continued success!!

The name of this pizza place is quite fitting. I've never had Roman style pizza before today. The staff matched the chill vibes of restaurant. I bought the Cafonata Burrapizza (pizza with Burrata on top) slice, the fried Cacio E Pepe, and imported Italian soda as my beverage. I took my food to go, and I voraciously devoured it all when I got home. If it's your 1st time here, then you must buy any Burrapizza slice and any fried pasta.

Gisell was my sever this was my first time here and last time. the service was disappointing and super nasty. I asked for a cheese cake strawberry banana crepe and she put two pieces of strawberries like if they coming out her check. then she tell she can't add more cheesecake or Nutella but it come with it. they was a hair. why are they not wearing hair net? like she took my whole order wrong I will never visit this place again.

Portions are really small and strawberry tasted really old. The worker was rude speaking of us with the other worker, the place was a dirty environment and trash everywhere and spoke to us like if we didn't know English.

Definitely my Go-To! Food is clean and sizeable, not super greasy or pricey--Id say best in the area.
My allergic self, is able to get a decent and affordable comfort dish here.

Singaporean Mei Fun! Posting cause I am grateful these guys can nourish me.

One word. Disgusting! I ordered the lunch chicken chow mein. The noodles were over cooked. Absolutely no flavor at all. They use dark meat only for the chicken. Vegetables? There were none. Do not eat here!

We ordered puffer rice with sesame chicken, light on sauce and no vegetables we received an order completely different with the sesame chicken sauce and huge vegetables onto it. we were very firm when explaining our order and still got the complete opposite. I am upset.

Good quick meal. They have gotten pricier but thats everywhere! My fave dish is the BBQ spare ribs! which no longer comes with pork fried rice but with vegetable fried rice. I guess everyone is cutting things to be more cost effective to them. Understandable...still great food!
Excellent local choice for a tasty Asian food experience.  Love almost everything on their menu! Try it our, you won't regret it one bit.

Me and Lisa were starving after many romantic hours of reminiscing about the old days. Silly Denny popped his head in and asked if we wanted to order food through a car service. I loved my chicken cheep cheep. Even Lisa loved it and she is a woman of standards. Now I have to go find Lisa a new red dress bye.

I use to like to Oder from this place until today  I asked for honey chicken wings an these ppl gave me honey in a bowl to put on my chicken wings... like if I wanted to do it myself I would of cooked it myself!!!! This is bad business

We dont eat meat and they failed to tell us that their combo comes with pork fried rice and they made us walk to go exchange it after we ordered delivery and then when we got the new plates with white rice there was a giant piece of hair in my food. Totally disgusting and I would give half a star if I could . I would have took pictures but it wasn't even worth a picture thats how disgusting it was I'd rather throw in the garbage never again
Food is prompt and happily served or delivered. Always generously served; always with a smile.
My go to place for lunch and dinner . Always consistent with food taste and authenticity; and fast also .

We have tried many Chinese restaurants in the area, we always return to U Like . The food is always good and in generous amounts. Delivery is quick and they have their own delivery men. I refuse to use delivery services that take from the profits of local businesses.

I ordered  steamed vegetable dumplings. The dough for the dumpling was too thick ,undercooked and the filling  appeared to b nothing more than chopped up ,tasteless frozen spinach and/or broccoli stems. I think that they didn't have any prepared at the time that I ordered and the chef tried to make them on the fly. See photos. Tasteless!!

Rude rude rude online order is all that matters. Don't be black and try to order, don't be Spanish and try to order, don't be white and try to order. Rude man, rude service, very too rude for da order. He too rude to the Vietnamese, philosophical men are abused, people are rude in this place. Mean, busy busy online order most best for them! Online order for them, too much money! Too rude too mean too bad for them they are bad people who don't like the Chinese people.

I placed a order for delivery, the man that picks up the phone ALWAYS HAS A NASTY ATTITUDE, he's always rushing to take a order. To end up messing the order up. When I got the order, my broccoli wasn't even cooked into the garlic sauce correctly. My chicken wings wasn't cooked all the way, and my fries was soggy.
I call back & that man tells me he's to busy to help me. So I go in person & HE HAS NO CUSTOMERS, why lie ? I ask for my money back he rips open the bag some other man started talking very fast in their language I'm American I DO not understand you please have some type of respect and speak English. The man gives me my money and says to me to "never fucking come back" again the disrespect is disgusting. How you treat a customer like this ? Your manners are poorly . Good luck to anyone.
Omnomnom.  Yum yum yum. I like Chinese takeout.

The employees are extremely rude. They rush you while taking your order. They have sent me the wrong order multiple times. When i called to get the right order, they were rude and clammed they didnt hear me and said they were not going to send me my right order. They told me to go pick it up or to deal with it. The delivery drivers also expect good paying tips, if its not enough they will complain to you about it. They hung up on me several times and they said that if i wanted it delivered i would have to wait another hour. The food has been spoiled before as well.

Great service! They're always super nice, very understanding and the service is quick! The food is yummy and very affordable. When I order, usually it is less than a 5 minute wait. I really recommend U Like. Especially if you're in the area!

Best Chinese restaurant in my area. I'm not too fan of Chinese restaurants but when u come out the 1 train that smells is like been in heaven when your walking up the stairs.

I usually get 2 shrimp rolls or whiye rice with chicken broccoli totally my favorite.

So far so good haven't had a pro let with this spot these guys are awesome.

I love this place. Perfect for a full & cheap meal!

If you're not familiar with Chinese takeout chicken wings, I'm here to enlighten you. They bring about the crisp, the juice, and the delicious meat. I always drop some soy sauce on top of it (and on top of my pork fried rice) and sprinkle it with some sriracha.

Take the tip. Cop the wings. And some pork fried rice.

Hadn't tried this place in many years. Was fooled by positive grubhub numbers.

Not good. Dumplings and wontons doughy.

Wouldn't have mattered. Wouldn't have posted.

But...

Butter in the Kung Pao Chicken sauce.
Butter.
Never had butter in Chinese food before. Not in storefront dumps. Not in fancy fusion restaurants. Never.

If you'd like to try buttered Chinese food try this place.

Not for me.

There is nothing else to say but the first and last time I ate here, I got a simple sesame chicken and pork fried rice. I was violently ill for a full 24 hours after, with food poisoning like I've never experienced before. The food even came feeling like it wasn't being kept at proper temperature, but I assumed it cooled down considerably due to the excessive time the delivery took. Highly regret trying, especially since there are so many other cheap Asian restaurants that deliver nearby.

I order Tostones with boneless chicharron de pollo and this is what I got !!! Tostones bathe in oil and soggy!!! This spot was amazing before but now it's getting sloppy never ordering from them again ! I'm taking my self to lotus express !! Horrible experience ! And the guy on the phone was rude as well .
Had to repeat the card number about 3 times, my order was general tso chicken and chicken chop suey, I got sesame chicken and according to them, chicken chop suet (and it was very unappealing.

This place failed to fulfill my order and then when I called to complain about my order in a civil manner in order to receive some sort of compensation and they still failed to fulfill my order, yelled at me over the phone and hung up in my face TWICE ! Completely Ridiculous and Extremely Rude I will never in my life deal with these people again. Horrible Customer Service

I got BBQ Spare ribs from this place which I had not patronize in a long while, I noticed original owner, wife, staff were no longer there, so I guess they sold it.  I was very disappointed when I got home with a simple order of BBQ Spare Ribs and French Frys.  Spare Ribs seemed to be the least expensive piece of meat they could find, mostly grisel, even kind of strange looking.  French Fries were ok.
I will be returning to my usual spot Amey's.

I can be pretty apprehensive about chinese food, especially if I'm not that familiar about it, but I got the recommendation that this place was pretty good. I mean come on, with the name "U" Like, I'm sure it has to be good.

And the verdict, "I" Like!

I had the chicken and broccoli, the sauce was awesome, broccoli perfectly steamed and all white meat chicken, and the house special fried rice, very very yummy, great flavors.

The order was prompt and fresh. I would def order again!

**Deal Seeking Diva tip** Check out the lunch special if you live in the area, looks like a good and cheap menu with good portions.

I've been on a bit of a Chinese-kick lately, so I thought I'd include a review of U Like, which I've been going to and ordering from for a few years. My girlfriend lives just a block away so this is our 'go-to' place for good cheap fast food. Like most New Yorkers, we've had our share of Chinese take-out. So, what's there to like about U Like? First off, they're fast. We've never had to wait long for a delivery. However, on a few different occasions, our orders have been wrong, and I've had to go back to them with my order to get it corrected. It's a serious PITA, but they've always changed my order with apologies and given me a few free extra sodas.

Their food isn't outstanding, but, then again, hardly any Chinese take-out ever is. Everything I've tried has been good, with the exception of their hot n'sour and egg drop soups. YUCK! Their prices and portions are the reverse of most restaurants in NYC, meaning you get lots of food for dirt cheap without the dirt. I don't know the name of the tall Asian guy who works there, but he's always been friendly and nice to us.  Given the lack of diverse choices for dining in Inwood, unless you want Spanish food every night (not knocking Spanish food at all for it's Damn Good!), I'll be continuing to order my late night take-out fro U Like, but making my own soup...

My fave chinese spot in the area. I've ordered from this place plenty of times and each time they've delivered pretty quickly. The food portion is worth the price and the food is so good! Love their lo mein and fried rice! I've ordered by calling in and also through grubhub

I will NEVER order from this place again because they're extremely rude! Over the phone I ask for the total and they give me a complete different price when in person. Also, the delivery guy stands on my door expecting for me to give him more than $2 tips when my order takes like one hour to get here!

Average Chinese with cuisine, nothing special.  I tried to like U like but I don't like U like.  There are better places in the area.  Checkout Lotus, this is my absolute last resort.  The general tso's chicken isn't good at all here, very mushy and not spicy at all.  

Its not terrible thats why only 3 starts, just ok.  there is definitely room to improve.
delivery is decent between 30-60 minutes and food arrives hot and well packaged.

No. Me no like. Me hate. They cold and they slow. U go somewhere else.

Sorry...but guys, you're asking for it with a name like "U Like".
It's just not good food. It's just like any other walk up or order online/on the phone Chinese place. Except they are slow with delivery and they food arrived cold.

For GOOD Chinese delivery in Inwood, check out Lotus Express. Great prices, friendly service, good food and relatively speedy delivery.
I stand here in the throes of hunger. My sesame chicken seemingly lost to the tides of history. The management indifferent to my pain.  Avoid my fate and choose more wisely than I!

Food poisoning! If you want to vomit for 8 hours straight, feel like your body is being turned inside out, and ache with pain and agony, this is your place.

I'm pretty sure it was the egg roll that did me in, only a couple of hours after eating this food, I was laying on the floor of the bathroom questioning all my life choices.

Please stay away if you value your vomit free life.

I will never order from this place again. The deliver guy doesn't even give you 30 seconds to either open the door before he is already leaving. They people that work here are extremely unprofessional and rude. They will charge you incremental charges without your consent for sauces that you would get for free when you order at the restaurant. If you order is incorrect or incomplete, they will not send the delivery person back. My order was missing the white rice..so all I had was the chicken. They just offered to discount and I had to call seamless to ensure I received credit for the full item as it was not my fault the order was incomplete. The food is not even all that great but it is one of the few options available in seamless within my area.
I've eaten here before and 7/10 they're good but when their delivery system is off forget about getting your food.

Ordered from here because of a coworker that use to live around me & the reviews on yelp. I love this place!!!! I have lived in Inwood for years and been ordering from these other nasty places.... anything u order is fresh and clean the service is really nice too
The food is always really good, the service is quick, and the price is right. I order from here probably once a week. It's my favorite Chinese food in Inwood.

They're right..I Do like..

In my continued search for good Chinese cheap cuisine I finally succeeded. Better than Ten-Tan (read my previous review about it) but still nothing beats Lotus..close 2nd due to the cheaper prices.

Ordered Peppersteak and pork fried rice, pork roll and fried wonton (dont judge me I was hungry) Definitely tasty, not too greasy and beyond gracious portions.

Problem here is that my meal comes with a can of soda..instead I found a bowl of sweet and sour chicken sauce..so the mix up shows me they can get sloppy..

If I'm on a budget I'll stick to this spot..when it's payday I'll hit up Lotus instead.

This place is hit or miss. Ordered from here last monday. Food was great (chicken with broccoli, vegetable fried rice, 1/2 chicken)
Today I walked in and ordered to go, The chicken was good but rice was inedible, seriously undercooked. I only have white rice or vegetable fried rice because the pork, chicken fried rice is not very good. INCONSISTENT

U Like, I would eat here just bc I like your name.

U Like, I like that u have small and large sizes for your entrees.

U Like, I like that your prices are right in line for your portion size.

U Like, I really, really, really, like your pan fried dumplings.

U Like, I like that you are open late and that if I decide I am too lazy to walk up and down 5 flights of stairs you will deliver to me.

U Like, I like that when I spend $10 I get a free beverage.

U Like, I like u.

The food is fabulous over here. They usually put the dishes in plastic containers -- perfect to prevent those spills in the usual Chinese box container! Of course they deliver -- they have a computerized setup, so they'll remember your address/phone number. Sure beats repeating yourself a thousand times.

Pick up a homemade iced tea too. Never overbrewed and not too sweet. :) I stop here usually once a week. I will continue to order from here even after I move.

This review is based on my order tonight.  It kind of hurts, actually.  And I certainly hope that my experience isn't what I can expect for the future.

I placed a simple enough order this evening: won ton soup (which I love; I think theirs is the best in Inwood), steamed chicken and broccoli (with brown rice), two beverages, and I asked for chopsticks and hot sauce.

Forty five minutes after I placed my order, I call to inquire as to its whereabouts.  I'm assured that it is "on it's way."  Um...yeah, not so much.  I call again after an hour and am told the same thing.  The man who answered the phone was rude, kept making excuses, and never even offered an "I'm sorry" until I prompted him.

The food finally arrives an hour and five minutes after I placed my order.  The soup is lukewarm.  The chicken and broccoli was in desperate need of more chicken.  The brown rice I had requested was white.  And there was not a packet of hot sauce, chopsticks, or those nasty prepackaged fried wontons (which should come with the soup, though I never eat them) in sight.

I called back to mention that I had indeed asked for several things (especially brown rice) that I didn't get.  The man on the phone was again, rude and unapologetic.

I'm worried about this.  Normally I really find U Like to be trustworthy and would give if four stars for the cheap Chinese that it is.  But today was definitely a one star day.  I'll give them another chance though and am crossing my fingers for better food and service.

I recently moved into the neighborood, and knew immediately that I had to try U Like. That HAS to be the awesome-est name for a Chinese fast food restaurant EVER.

The staff was very friendly. I ordered the sesame chicken. It was a little sweeter than I would have liked, and barely any broccoli, but it was good. The atmosphere wasn't great -- it's clean, but you can tell more people do pick-up or take-out. A great place for rainy day around the house.
Possibly the worst Chinese food I've ever tasted! Absolutely greasy and just wrong on so many levels starting with the name... I DO NOT LIKE!
Sometimes good, usually bad. I've given this place way too many chances. The sesame chicken is almost always gooey and the rice is bland. Ten-Tan and Lotus Express are much better options.

I Love "U" Like....

With a name that catchy who wouldn't go in there. The food is great and the guy that works there if very friendly. When I come in with my boyfriend he already knows we want 2 egg rolls.

This place is great!

I was craving for Chinese and so I placed a take out on my way home. order was ready to pick up less than 20 mins and still fresh. I got home and eat the meal, it was so good, the dumpling was the best and I loved their beef with string beans too!

recommendation: small beef lo mein with no veg add a egg and a little spicy, it is one of my favorites among so many others things at U Like.

So I have tried their General Tso's Chicken, Egg roll and their Spicy beef neither of them was something I liked.

The General Tso's Chicken was too watery and the chicken quality was just embarrassing. The flavor of the sauce was just not right and I tried it twice so it was not because they had a bad day. Their pork fried rice which came with the General Tso's chicken was okay but nothing spectacular.

The egg roll that I tried was soft and gui (if there is such a word - it felt like chewing rubber) and there was not much flavor to it.

When I then decided to try another dish because there had to be something they were good at I tried the spicy beef and since I like spicy food ( I order spicy, because I want spicy) I asked if it could be extra extra spicy and the lady handling my order said okay turn around and yelled something Chinese, so I am assuming she requested it to be extra spicy. Let me just say there was no spiciness AT ALL. What a BIG disappointment and I have stopped waisting my money at this place. It is not worth it.

Honestly, this place can be very hit or miss. I stick with General Tso's chicken and sometimes the chicken is perfectly cooked with the right amount of crunch and tenderness. Other times the skin is falling off and the chicken is just overall mushy. I'd have to say more often than not they nail it. This could have something to do with delivery time, also. They're just a couple blocks away, so it shouldn't take long, but when they get busy, I imagine the food sits for a bit. Fried wontons as an appetizer are amazing, as well.

The best part is the ordering process. They take credit cards, which is worth an entire star on its own. And it's completely computerized, so no dealing with addresses.

Ordered the lunch special. It comes with a Coke   I also ordered some soups for later. They have a digital coupon at $10 to get a free eggroll.  When they delivered, the Coke was missing.  I called the store and explained how it was left out and they said I got the free eggroll so I didn't get Coke.  I told them Coke was part of lunch - the coupon was extra for spending over $10.  Said it didn't matter.  So the point is I will never order from there again over a can of soda and not treating the customer with respect and value.

We went into this restaurant while looking around for Thai food. We came across this place in our search and decided to try it. Immediately we were greeted by our waitress who was very friendly and helpful with explaining the menu. We ordered the Thai iced tea and the Lychee Thai iced tea. Both were masterfully made and tasted amazing. The Thai iced tea was a little different than what we've had at other places, but we both agreed it was the best one we've tried yet. It had lots of flavor and wasn't too sweet. The Lychee Thai iced tea was very refreshing and slightly sweet but perfectly balanced.
