For appetizers we got the Mango Salad, Pork Dumplings, and Steak Empanada. The Mango Salad was absolutely delicious. A little spicy, but the mix of flavors and textures really made it stand out. The Pork Dumplings were super flavorful and cooked to perfection. Lastly, the Steak Empanada is what really threw us off; it was phenomenal. I can't explain the flavor used in it, but it was something neither of us ever had before. It's almost like a licorice flavor that's present, mixed with everything else. Normally I'm put off by anything of the sort, but it worked so well. It was also equally cooked to perfection; crispy and flakey where it counts. You only get one, but the size of it is more than enough for an appetizer.

For entrees we got the Tiger Cry (medium rare) and the Spicy Eggplant Basil with Tofu (we added chicken). These dishes were incredible. The Tiger Cry was cooked perfectly to medium rare, and was full of so much flavor. The portion was also very generous especially considering the cost. The rice and vegetables were a bit plain, but I prefer that so that I can blend them with the steak.

The Spicy Eggplant Basil with Tofu and Chicken was also packed of flavor, although not as spicy as we expected. Still delicious overall, and it was also a generous portion. We barely finished all of our food.

Service was also exceptional. Our waitress Khob Khun Kha was perfect. She answered all of our questions clearly, concisely, and was just pleasant to interact with overall. She was also quick and accommodating.

Overall, this place is an absolute must for anyone looking to try asian inspired dishes in the neighborhood. Cost wise it was way cheaper than we expected but the food and service surpassed our expectations by a longshot. We're planning to return very soon!

A friend found this odd restaurant. You'd usually expect a restaurant named Unique Fusion in the middle of nowhere to not be that good but the ratings were super high so we decided to make the schlep there. They have some fun options (Thai empanada anyone) and the service was friendly. It's a casual spot and overall the food was excellent though the appetizers were better than the entrees. I had a lychee iced tea which wasn't overly sweetened and it was pretty tasty.

We first got the Mango Salad with sliced mango, red onions, tomato, Thai chili, roasted cashew, cilantro, garlic, fresh lime juice, and fish sauce. Excellent version with a good amount of heat especially towards the bottom. I'd like it maybe slightly hotter with more spots but then again it's not an Isan spot so it's this style and it's definitely a good version.

We also got as an appetizer two of the dishes from the empanada section. My preference of the two was the Flank Steak Empanda consisting of grilled marinated flank steak with onions, garlic, and basil and with a Thai-style pickled salad and aioli. The mead inside was tender and very well flavored and as noted by others there was a unique spice. I presume there was star anise judging by the slight licorice flavor but there was definitely curry powder and some other stuff in there. Very tasty.

The Half Moon Turnover consisted of curried chicken, onion, potato, and oyster sauce wrapped in an oversized paratha and just like the other one it was served with a Thai-style pickled salad. This was essentially a giant version of a curry puff with a thicker crust and a lot more filling of course as it was so big. Also very tasty though less unique.

We got a bunch of dishes from the entree sections. Most of the main dishes are served with jasmine rice with some exceptions and I would say that they all had some faults.

The Slow Cooked Pork Shoulder with onions, garlic, and pineapple was likely my favorite. The pork was super tender with a rich flavor and the pineapple added some good tartness. There was also a bit of sweetness in the dish with my only potential complaint being that I found it a bit wet/ I wouldn't have minded the au jus being thicker but that's really only minor.

My other favorite was the Salmon Green Curry consisting of a reasonably sized piece of grilled salmon served in green curry with bell pepper (which we substituted for string beans,) eggplant, and basil. Usually I have a bit of trepidation with Thai curries served with bell peppers as this isn't traditional and usually a sign of an American Thai spot but the curry here was very solid. Well flavored with some spice and not too sweet.

The Pad See Ew with chicken Thai rice noodles, egg, and Chinese (or regular) broccoli in a sweet soy sauce was pretty good. Solid noodle texture and pretty tender chicken. This was the third best of the mains and it was fine.

OK was the Thai Beef Stew with celery, carrots, onions, mushroom and Thai basil. Just like the pork shoulder, the beef was very tender what's a good texture but there was way too much of some spice in it almost overpoweringly so. I'm pretty positive it was cloves but I'm not sure. Otherwise tasty especially if they were to reduce the amount of whatever that spice was (or I don't know let's say that as a Thai Clove Beef Stew.)

The Crispy Chicken Over Rice consisting of breaded chicken tenders with sweet chili sauce served with sliced cucumber and ginger rice most likely the weakest of the dishes. The chicken was a little bit bland and the breading was too heavy. The sweet chili sauce helped but not too much.

For desserts we got the Mango With Sticky Rice and Lemon Tart. The former was the standard with good quality mango and not super sweet rice. The lemon tart had a good sourness though I would say the crust was a bit thick. Still both were tasty and I would get both again and they were both reasonably priced.

Overall the food was good. If this was in a different neighborhood, I would probably give them a mid 3 saying that there were a bit too many faults especially with the entrees but the appetizers are very good but because it's this neighborhood and because of the more unique offerings which all happened to work, a low 4 is accurate for me. Would go back.

For me the best Thai in the neighborhood and beyond. Never disappoint for years. Always super nice crew and delicious flavors ... my personal preference goes to the beef stew just because the herb flavors stay in the mouth making you feel the smell of the old times - when people were cooking for ever in front of a fireplace. Ambiance at the restaurant is just not fancy. It s casual and clean. Not over made - just what s needed.

A hidden gem in Inwood. I've seen delivery lines out the door but dining in is my favorite way to eat here. Table space is limited but worth it. Service was quick, food was hot and delicious. Lots of great Thai staples on the menu as well as some variety options. Beer and wine are now on the menu and their Thai teas are made to order. Try their lychee iced tea. I recommend the chicken skewers for an appetizer and the Tiger Cry steak for your entree!

The best thing I've had is the Chocolate Mousse cake.  Other highlights are the lamb chops (though a bit too sweet) and the fried chicken wings (though a bit dry).  I'll definitely continue ordering take out from them because they hit the spot in a pinch.

A surprise treasure in Inwood. We recently moved up north from Manhattan and lost our favorite Thai in the last few weeks. However, we feel so lucky to have found Qwan & her sister.

The whole menu is exciting but for our first order we had Massaman Curry with chicken. The sauce was rich with coconut milk, potatoes, onions, & peanuts. We had an appetizer of pork dumplings, which were also great.

We will DEFINITELY visit again & again.
Meh. Order took an hour to move three blocks. Food might have been good had it been hot. Called the restaurant and they were no help. Skip ordering takeout.

What I love about Yelp is that it helps me find unassuming gems like this place that I'd otherwise probably overlook.

I stoped in for dinner recently and had the pork dumplings, the chicken skewers, and a beer. I'm a sucker for peanut sauce, so when I saw the chicken skewers on the menu I knew I would be ordering them even though I'd planned to go in for Pad Thai or drunken noodles. I guess that peanut sauce is maybe expensive to make because a lot of places only give you a pretty small serving, but here they give you a huge serving - the skewers were basically swimming in the sauce which I loved :D

It's not somewhere you go for the ~aesthetics~ but the food is great, and the staff (owner?) takes great care of you.

Will definitely be returning to explore more of the menu.

I had gotten food from here before but it wasn't very tasty. But my partner wanted to try it so I agreed. An hour and a half later the food still hadn't arrived. When I called to complain, the owner told me that they use a third party (grub hub) for delivery and that they are dishonest and that this happens quite often. My question is then why are they using that service? To add insult to injury, grub hub called me and said that the delivery person tried to delivery it and no one answered. I told him that 2 people were in the apartment and that no one rang the bell. Then they tried to tell me that they didn't have my apartment number which I told them that I included in the order. I was incredibly frustrated by this experience and will never order from here again.

One of the few good restaurants in the area.
L usually orders the same thing, spicy Thai fried rice and their spicy mango salad. I suggested the cashew chicken the other day. Generous portion. Very tasty.. if you order this with coconut rice, you will need a nap afterwards. It is so incredibly rich..delicious, just really heavy.
The spicy mango salad is pretty light, the mango strips are ripe and sweet. Just a hint of spice. Lil cherry tomatoes, red onions and pistachios add a nice flavor and texture. We ate it with some white rice as a side dish and it was delicious. Still a bit pricey at $11 since it's just mango basically but it's enough for 2 as a side.
Delivers pretty quick too which is a plus..

My favorite Thai place in the city!
Everything I've tried here tasted delicious, grilled chicken thigh skewers and spicy Thai salmon are to die for.
I always end up ordering too many appetizers because it's so hard to make a choice.
My favorite entres are pineapple fried rice with shrimp and garlic shrimp over rice.
You can't leave the place without trying mango sticky rice dessert!!!
It's truly amazing and simply delicious :)

The service and menu are great. So many options. Their spring rolls are fantastic. The main dishes were a little underwhelming. Was expecting more
flavor. But you should try it. It is the best Asian Fusion food in Inwood. I'll be back.

Applause!!! Unique is super cute and the drunken noodle is wow! I think the best I've had in Inwood/Washington Heights hands down. Mild was still a little spicy for me, so beware if you are sensitive. Ingredients tasted fresh and the dish was cooked to perfection.  I love me a good portion size and the container definitely had some weight to it.

Pick up order was ready way before 45 min estimate (during late lunch hours), which I appreciated because I was concerned with the long window. I did not spot a lunch specials menu, but I thought the dish was well worth the "regular"  price. Looks like they are trying to secure their wine license.

All I have to say is don't be me and wait two years before trying this place. Looking forward to going back several times to try the rest of the menu.

Best Asian restaurant in Inwood. In fact one of the best in the city. Unique Fusion Restaurant is just that. Authentic more than most other places that claim to be. There's a good amount of variety.

A few weeks ago I came with my boo. I picked something and she copied me. We both got the Stir Fried Tofu. It's $13 for the entree. The price seems kind of high but it's a big portion. It comes with a lot of vegetables with the tofu, and it's seasoned without just being spicy hot. There's bean sprouts, mushrooms, and peppers.

I like the relaxed atmosphere. It had a bar area with a limited drink selection. The food alone is worth coming for though.

Being a vegetarian, have always had a lack of choices in most restaurants but not here!
I started with Corn Cakes as an appetizer which combined with the hot sauce was quite tasty and complemented the flavours and filling as well, followed it up with the vegetarian Empanada which was extremely well prepared and had the spinach filling uniformly sauted/absorbed into it. Last but definitely not the least was the Lychee Iced Tea which had great taste and refreshing. The presentation of the food, taste and a great value for money with a wonderful staff! Definitely a worth visit.

I agree with each and all five stars reviews which emphasize how truly special and outstanding this wonderful restaurant is, especially for the Inwood community. The food is consistently outstanding: delicious, fresh, tasty, generous portions, beautifully presented and so reasonably priced! What else can you add! The ambience.... From the moment you enter you are transported to an oasis of calmness and serenity which is not easy to accomplish in the middle of the very busy surroundings. All of this should be enough but, what truly sets them apart is the service. Both sisters will always make sure to greet you with warmth, kindness and will never fail to make you feel like you are eating in an a cozy and welcoming environment. I truly hope that they are here to stay! Don't wait! Try them out! You will not be disappointed!
Great food! Fresh reasonably priced and delicious Asian fusion. So glad we live close by!

This is my all time favorite Thai restaurant. Bu and Kwan (sisters and owners) are the sweetest and are amazing. I'm torn between writing a very good review for them, because I do want them to be successful, but I also don't want it to become super popular because I like getting ti talk with Bu and Kwan when it's not super busy.

Half moon turnover-- get it
Drunken noodles with crispy tofu--gitit
Roasted pork shoulder--giddit

So many things to try here that are amazing, but those are my go to.

It's easy to miss this hidden gem, but if you are lucky enough to try it once you will be back again. Look at this creamy, dreamy coconut milk based soup. A popular menu item of Thai restaurants but trust me, nobody makes it like this. The crispy tofu dish was very good but I've also had the salmon which is cooked perfectly. I highly recommend.

Wow, just wow! I came here on a Saturday evening with my mom and partner, and we all thoroughly enjoyed everything we ordered. My bf says it's the best Thai food he's ever had and I agree!

Food 5/5:
We ordered 3 apps, 3 entrees, and 2 desserts to share (pics attached). The chef and owner, Quan, is wonderful at her craft; every dish was well balanced with both flavor and texture, cooked to perfection - from the crispy shrimp rolls to the tender pork shoulder - and beautifully presented. We enjoyed everything we ordered! We will be returning and look forward to making our way through the menu.

Service 5/5:
Our server, Bu, was an all-star! Bu was attentive, kind, informative, and has perfect timing with bringing out the food/refilling our waters. It was a pleasure to chat with her and learn that this is a family-owned restaurant! Her sister, Quan, is the chef/owner and Quan's boyfriend is a partner in the business.
The restaurant wasn't busy, which we found surprising considering how great the food, service, atmosphere, and prices were, but we enjoyed that. They did have several delivery people stop in for pick-ups, so delivery is poppin'

Atmosphere 5/5:
The interior design is beautiful with art representing Thailand, and the space is open. There's dim lighting inside complemented by the natural light pouring in from the glass windows and calming background music that creates a pleasant and peaceful ambiance. This is a great spot for dates with yourself, a partner, family, and friends ... shoot even a business meeting would be great here.

Cleanliness/Covid Safety 5/5:
The space is very clean, the staff wears masks, and there's hand sanitizer at each table. I felt safe dining in here as the tables are  spaced out well and it's well ventilated.

All-in-all, we had a great experience here and will definitely return. They do take-out and delivery too so if you don't want to/can't dine-in, do your tastebuds a favor and order from them! This is a wonderful local and family-owned small business and you should 100% support them :)

P.S. They do have additional Thai drinks & a few dessert options off menu. Just ask!

The place outside looks old but once you come in on the outside its pretty nice. The table set up is pretty. Came here for lunch with the family. The server is really helpful. Their thai food is good like the usual. The highlight for me is their steak. Its super tasty and the meat just melts in your mouth. Would love to come back to this place but its too far from home hehe
Food is excellent and staff is so accommodating and helpful I have enjoyed all different unique dishes but you need to like spicy food

Visited The Cloisters nearby and got hungry. This place came up on a search but I was a bit incredulous about the reviews. Look no further, this place is an absolute gem. It's as good a Thai place as I've ever been to, at great prices. If you live near here, I envy you. If I lived here I'd eat here every week. All the dishes were great but I'll call out the mango salad which is divine, and the drunken noodles, which were incredibly favorful with just the right amount of chew.

No stars here... I recently went to this restaurant and got a night full of throw up followed by diarrhea instead of my favorite Pineapple Fried rice dish. I am very disappointed that the chef did not use fresh eggs and ingredients.

It has been a while since I've reviewed a restaurant uptown. This restaurant impressed me on so many levels so It is only right that I respond with a review.

The foodie in me wanted the Thai styled Chicken wings so I asked for it. Decorative, juicy and delicious. The sweet and sour sauce drizzled on the chicken makes the  flavors burst like nothing you've ever tasted on chicken wings. You won't need a sauce to dip.

My date ordered Spring rolls which were fresh and hot. Just from the appetizers I could tell the dishes were freshly made so I planned to asked some questions about the Chef's background.

Since I'm a fan of authentic Thai food I decided I needed to try a few more plates. Green curry salmon was perfect. No one in the area makes it better. Portion was appropriate for the price and the touch of coconut rice was amazing. I don't eat rice much but the unique flavor got me to eat half.

My date got Crispy Chicken with ginger rice and OMG I could taste the ginger. My date remarked that it was so good it cleared her sinuses. The aroma of the spice just floated off the plate.

Since I had no self control I also got the lamb chops. Let me tell you something, it's a must have. Perfectly prepared and juicy with no pink which is exactly what I'd asked for. Needless to say I was only willing to share 1 lollipop with my date.

Dessert? Hell yea I was not leaving without it. Can you say home made lemon "untart" pie? I have never had a lemon dessert so balanced they I took the rest to go. Lemon flavor was rich but it didn't snack the hell out of my Mouth like a cheap dessert. My date also ordered the coconut flan and she said it was Amazing as well. I definitely ate more than I planned to.

Soon the Chef walked out to greet me and I was blown away by her humility. She is a certified Thai food chef who is now living her dream of owning her own restaurant and this is the reason for my support. From one business owner to another I say Congratulations. Running a restaurant uptown is no easy feat but I am extra grateful you are here to provide us more options and you deserve all the recognition for the passion you put into every dish. Thank you.

Please get your liquor license soon.

Just returned to this pleasant restaurant. Service still impeccably welcoming. Atmosphere still peaceful. Food still excellent.

We got the mango salad again (still great), chicken wings (just perfectly crispy, juicy and flavorful, but not overpowering), lamb chops again (still yummy) and the stir-fried noodles (simple and well executed, maybe needed a little more salt). Their coconut rice is outstanding, so make sure to get some. For dessert we got the mango with sticky rice, and it was spot on.

What to say? This place keeps delivering great food in a friendly and relaxing atmosphere. I can't wait to return and try more dishes.

Highly recommended.

Amazing experience. They're quite busy with take out orders but the food is worth the wait. Had the skewered chicken which was a very warming dish with full bodied flavors and the mango salad which was bright and refreshing with a nice kick to it. Would honestly go back! We went on a Sunday and the restaurant was not crowded but there were clearly a lot of orders going out based on the delivery drivers which kept popping up. Still, the server was really really nice and still attentive despite the rush!

Since this resturant opened a couple of months before the pandemic run by 2 talented young woman I have been singing the praises of this resturant.

I recently had my birthday party there with 10 family and friends and the ambiance,  care,  fabulous food were beyond fantastic.

The lamb chops,  mango salad,  steak salad etc were the best my guests and I every had.  Please my friends experience this gem in Inwood and bring lots of friends
Best Food in the city

Doesn't look much when you walk passed. When you walk in , it's beautiful. I ordered the pork dumplings and lamb chops with Ginger rice. THE FOOD WAS AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!! I plan on coming back over and over again. The service was awesome, the people are super friendly. 10/10 would recommend 100 times over.
delivery was quick, food hot and delicious, good spot! got the beef pad thai and shrimp spring rolls, both very tasty.

This place is amazing & the owners are so sweet. I crave this food. The crispy chicken with coconut rice is a superb sweet/salty combo if you're into that. Lychee Thai iced tea is like a delicious dessert. Tom kha is unreal, I dream of those flavors in my mouth. Whatever restaurant you were *thinking* about ordering from tonight--don't. Order from here, it's better than the other place.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant. I love the food. Whether you dine in or get your food delivered the kitchen is very consistent. Excellent service from the wait staff too. I highly recommend you give Unique Fusion a try.

This restaurant is amazing! I rarely leave reviews but thought Unique Fusion was worth writing about. The wait staff were so warm, genuine, and attentive from the start to finish of our dining experience. I ordered the crispy chicken on ginger rice and it was so beautifully presented that it drew the audible attention of everyone in the restaurant as they brought it out. I was not expecting the dish to be that stunning visually (literally people were gasping and pointing lol). And the flavors were on point! Perfect crispness to the chicken, flavorful ginger rice, and a delightful accent with the dipping sauce. My friend got the steak salad and Thai iced tea, which he really liked. The restaurant was busier than usual, and the staff gave us two complementary desserts to go because they felt that they weren't as attentive to us as they would have liked, although I thought they did great. They really went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied. 5 out of 5! They earned it.

We tried various items across the fusion menu. The beef stew was delicious, very tender and complex seasoning. The shrimp rolls were crispy and topped with unique sweet chili sauce. The chicken curry empanada was flavorful and delectable. Great spot, highly recommend!

This is definitely the best Thai food that I have had in NYC. Unlike many places, it is actually run by real Thai people, and they know what they are doing. Half my family lives in Thailand, so I'm very familiar with what's real and what's an imitation. Sorry to pull the "authenticity card" -- I'm normally against it for reasons outlined in Adolph Reed's "Three Tremes" (nonsite.org/editorial/th…) -- but you just have to trust me here.

I recommend the pork shoulder and chicken skewers highly. People are super nice and should be charging double for the quality of the stuff! Give them some love! #MERLINFIVE

Came here on a recommendation from a former coworker and it definitely did not disappoint.

Inside was very cozy and the staff was super nice and very friendly. Even the chef was very hospitable and made sure we were enjoying the food.

The food has a lot of Thai inspiration, but the menu goes beyond just Thai food. We started off with the mango salad and side sampler. As we worked our way through the sampler, every piece of food got better and better. It had a good variety and gave us a chance to sample more of the menu. Will definitely be ordering a full order of the shrimp rolls next time around.

For our mains we went with the beef massaman Curry and the lamb chops. Both dishes were amazing, but the unexpected wildcard was the coconut rice.

Accompanying our food was some Thai iced tea, one with milk and one with lime. Both were amazing.

Overall great food at a great price. Will definitely be coming back.

My bf and I like to eat at our neighborhood restaurants and luckily Inwood boasts quite a few. Unique now rises up to our top three.

Located on the busier 207th St. In Inwood, just within a block of the 207 A stop, Unique is an Asian fusion restaurant that just opened. This was our time dining there and we know we ate coming back soon.

On food:
- shredded mango salad with fresh greens, onion, cherry tomato and pistachio: an innovative take on the traditional green papaya salad. The fresh mango really stands out in this refreshing salad.

- vegetable spring roll with cabbage, shiitake mushrooms and carrots drilled with Thai chili: this is easily the best spring roll I've had for a long time. Light and crisp-crackly skin with a tender-crisp vegetables in the filling. I'm not into deep fried food but I had three of them!

- I'm a vegetarian so I asked the chef if she can adapt the beef massaman curry into a veg dish and she brought this amazing plate of curry with potato, eggplant, red pepper, carrot and fried tofu. The crisp garlic topping adds flavor and texture. I had it with the ginger rice (They serve different flavors of rice: Jasmine, coconut, ginger). It's a delightful surprise if you like ginger!

- BF has the slow cooked pork shoulder (featured in photo) and it looks amazing.

- Lemon curd pie: the lemon curd has the nice balance of sweet and citric. You can taste the fresh lemon zests in it.

On ambience:
The restaurant is elegantly designed with care and warmth. The decorations are sleek with just a touch of Thai: the photographs on the wall, the embroidered curtains, the pattern around the bar.

On the staff:
The owners are sisters and this is their third week since opening. Our waitress is one of the sisters and the chef (the other sister) came out to speak with guests at each table.

Hung out with 5 foodies on a friday night and we landed on a hidden gem amidst the exciting culinary scene in upper Manhattan Inwood area.

The most memorable appetizer for me was actually the shrimp roll. It's tasty and the sauce is not overly sweet like you'll find elsewhere. The half moon turnover was good too (very juicy inside with curry beef) and it was gone before I could snap a picture. The mango salad with a spicy kick to it was also quite arousing.

I had a Lychee Thai ice tea (the default is with no milk!). I agree that it did not need the milk here and it tastes just as smooth.

I enjoyed my choice of Salmon Green Curry, especially the skin. I would take it with a separate order of Coconut rice (you might still want to keep the plain rice for the curry), which has a very rich coconut flavor that can almost become its own dish.

The dishes definitely have their own characters (as suggested by the name of the restaurant) and pride, although you will find that the chef is extremly humble and nice, who came to apologize for the wait time due to the friday night crowds, but we didn't feel like it was that long a wait at all.

Great to have a high quality Asian restaurant in Inwood now! The food was innovative and very good, and reasonably priced for both the quality and the neighborhood.

The ambiance was pleasant, if still a bit awkward given the newness of the restaurant.

Very friendly wait staff and we met the chef/owner, who was lovely.

The food is superb, really! Go here!

This place is unique alright. Uniquely bland. I had to buy alternative food because the food I got was so underwhelming. I was craving, CRAVING some Pad Thai, get the chicken Pad Thai to go and I had a That's So Raven moment. Predicted the food would be lacking when I picked it up- no enticing smell coming from the bag, so as I was walking to the bus stop I went into a Spanish spot near them and got different food to go.

And what do you know, the food made me sad. You know that type of deep sad disappointment when you're craving a type of food and you want to DIVE into it (after spending $16) and having it taste like bland nothing with tough chicken. So, I fear I'll never be back because you know what first impressions DO matter.

Everything is good. From the cute interior to the food- our server and the chef. The food is hands down. Our server is very polite,
prompt, great service. The chef personally checked in on us to make sure that we were satisfied with our food. We are so glad that we found this hidden gem. We will definitely come back for
more.
Still our number one go-to restaurant in the neighborhood! ALWAYS get a dessert, is our recommendation.

We figured we would give Unique a go since it is relatively new, and we are so glad we did!

The restaurant owners were very kind and are currently working on their permanent menu, so they were very receptive of comments and compliments about their food.

We had tried the dumplings and the lamb chops. Both dishes had a very sweet sauce that did not overpower the food, but were very complimentary to them.

I really recommend the dumplings and lamb chops! The lamb chops were cooked to perfection and were super delicious. Unique also offers a variety of different kinds of rice, which we thought was awesome.

I hope to visit again in the future!

This restaurant has amazing food - I've sampled just about every dish on the menu. The menu is limited compared to other Thai restaurants but they make up for it with exceptional quality in every dish. This place is clean & tidy. The chef and her sister are also very welcoming.

My favorites are the following.
Mango Salad - fresh with a nice kick.
Green curry - I've ordered it with Shrimp instead of salmon which is not on the menu. This is hands down some of the best green curry I've ever had.
Chicken satay - delicious and tasty
Crispy chicken - crispy drizzled in sweet chili sauce. This is indulgent but tasty.
Garlic shrimp dish - also delicious.
Lamb chops - yummy marinade & cooked to perfection.

I've enjoyed just about everything here. All of the rice options are delicious as well.

I've had the fried rice, lamb chops, grilled salmon,
Soup, chicken wings- each of those multiple times!
I love a lot of the food, I wasn't as fond of the curry and shrimp toast. I would give it 4.5 stars.
I have only ordered delivery. Always prompt and have only had one mistake which they realized and called to apologize profusely and credited my card.

AMAZING food and service. Definitely 5+ Stars!!
The quality of food is over the top. Perfectly balanced taste with FRESH ingredients only. 2 of my favorites are Slow Cooked Pork Shoulder and Salmon Green Curry. I can eat those all day long. Highly recommend!
"Unique" became my favorite restaurant for everyday lunch and dinner especially during this Pandemic situations when we need good quality healthy food more than ever. Thank you Chef "Quan" and hostess "Bu" for your service.

I'm not one to review places typically, but this restaurant has a special place in my heart. After going for almost two years, both host Bu and chef Kwan work tirelessly to make some of the best Thai food I've ever had. From their tiger cry steak (I'm not a big steak eater but this place makes me crave theirs all the time) beef massaman curry, stir fried tofu, and everything in between, this place is a foodies' paradise and definitely worth a visit if you're in inwood. They're so nice and so is the food :)

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Inwood, currently. We went in person a while back. With the lockdown, they are still doing delivery, and the food was just as good as I remember it. Will try to keep ordering regularly to get them through this.

Just delicious takes on Thai cuisine. The pork shoulder - Fantastic. The stir fried noodles - Fantastic. The Pork Dumplings and Corn Cakes - Fantastic.

Hang in there Unique!

Amazing food and even better service. Every single plate is 10/10 from the salmon to the lamb chops to the cashew chicken to the drunken noodles . Don't forget to try their ginger rice it's so flavorful, you will like it even if you don't like ginger.

I ordered delivery from here because I've been wanting to try their food.  The delivery was delayed and the food wasn't very hot so I had to reheat it. I wanted something on the lighter side so I ordered the chicken skewers, coconut rice, steamed pork dumplings and steamed vegetables. The food was very fresh. The dumplings and coconut rice were great. The chicken wasn't flavorful at all so I was disappointed with that. You can't really mess up steamed vegetables, but I'm sure there are some places that do so i'll point out that theirs was very fresh and good (potatoes, carrots, broccoli). I'd possibly give the restaurant another try one day and try something different next time.

So if you're into hookah, loud music and just a sit down, drink and hang atmosphere -this is the place for you! Especially if you more in your 20s!!

Pretty with cute photo ops, only Dominican music perfect for Spanish Harlem!

We went for brunch and although the sangrias and mimosas were super weak, the food was delicious!!
We tried tres golpes, steak and eggs, chicken, pasta and all were super abundant, beautifully presented and delicious!!!

I'm a foodie so I'd go back for the food but not the extremely loud music and ambience. Would have preferred a variety of music not just Dominican music. (I'm half Dominican by the way and enjoy it but some hip hop would have been cool.)

Again this is a party scene. We went to celebrate a 21st year old bday and it was perfect for our group-just not my scene personally but great for the perfect crowd.

Didn't expect it but, U.S Kennedy Fried Chicken & Pizza was certainly terrific. Love the atmosphere of this place. They got a lovely menu too. Their service is always really friendly and attentive regardless how busy they are. I totally recommend U.S Kennedy Fried Chicken & Pizza.

Visiting from Los Angeles I always make a stop here to get my Turkey hero sandwich, I recommend this place to everyone visiting Bronx, New York. This time I came with my children since my son wanted a chop cheese & as always Morocco was at his best making our sandwiches, thank you Morroco.

I had their lamb and rice with white sauce. It was pretty decent; down the middle. They have a good drink selection and the employees are nice enough. Next to Essen healthcare and just before the entry onto the bridge.

Hero's and Deli

(I know it's rare for me to write just a sentence on a review but it's a local deli, you know what a bodega is like. I never seem to feel one was more outstanding then the next one a few blocks down)

Whenever I need a quick meal, this is my stop. They have a buffet with a mix of hot food and salad items on weekdays. Their items really run the gamut-everything from sushi and dumplings to fries and chicken wings. There's something for everyone. It's available for lunch and dinner but by dinner time, the food gets pretty stale.

You take as much as you want, get it weighed, and pay per pound. It's an efficient system with brisk service so I never wait more than a few minutes even at peak lunch hours. It's a reasonable price- usually around or under $10 for a filling lunch.

Food quality is mediocre but it's cheap, fast, and filling. Hard to complain!

We rented an AirBnb right next door to this deli and went there almost every day for 5 weeks.  Their buffet is so reasonably priced and has such a great selection of hot foods and salads.  The hot foods feature a variety of cuisines, and being from Hawaii, we really appreciated the selection of both Asian and Western food.  I loved the healthy choices such as baked fish, small fried fish (so tasty!), tofu, etc....as well as the "less healthy" comfort food such as pasta, casseroles, and pork dishes.  The fried chicken was consistently good.  The veggies and fruits were of excellent quality: kale salad and asparagus were my favorites.

As for the personnel, they were very pleasant and accommodating.  We needed to keep receipts and multiple times I forgot to ask for one.  When I went back to ask, they would be nice about giving one to me.  Soon they'd remember me and say "You need your receipt!"  

After over a month there, we went there for the last time and I admit I got teary saying good-bye and thank you to them.  I wish we had a place like this deli on our island!

Breakfast On Weekends | Tried their Uptown Omelette to try their breakfast options during the weekend. Originally I was craving waffles however when I had ordered it, they informed it that it was only available on Fridays (of course I'll be back on Friday to try it). It would have been nice if they mentioned on their menu it was not available on Fridays.
I ordered the Uptown Omelette platter instead of the sandwich which comes with a side of potatoes (hash or home fries) and toast. Omelette was delicious with the bell peppers, tomatoes and my favorite little sausage bits in every bite! But I was so upset there was no toast or home fries; hope they won't forget next time!

Very brief review of morning rush:

I am in Washington Heights once every 6 weeks or so, and I always stop at this deli for a Bacon egg and cheese.  very quick, very cheap and good coffee.  This review is brief, because i have been here a half dozen times, order the same thing (bacon egg & Cheese on a roll, with coffee), and they've not failed me yet.  

No comments on other offerings, nor their relatively large selection of food for lunch. But for breakfast, this place is great.

I frequent this place at least once or twice a week to get my tea/coffee which is slightly more expensive than what you would get at one of those carts on the streets, but the employees are nice and polite and try to remember my order when I walk in. Their paninis are pretty good as I usually get their Cajun Panini. I had a few of their different varieties of options for the "hot buffet" they have during the week and they are not bad, but not great either.  Last year they also added a japanese noodle soup bar (past the panini station) which I found very lacking in taste and ingredients. Never ordered the noodle soup again after that.

They are also open 24/7 which is a plus since nothing else is open past 11-12 at night near the hospital.

This place was such a life saver staying at CHONY with my newborn.  Dealing with a new found dairy allergy is not an easy thing to do while living on food you can't cook yourself.  They had great choices for people with dietary restrictions on the menu and as snack options.  THANK YOU!!!

Food is fresh. The bar is chaotic during lunch. Cashier ladies are nice and spunky. There's always someone outside, and sometimes inside, asking for change. Try to avoid during lunch rush. Don't go if you're super hungry or you will end up buying everything. Food is consistent and they have Fresca! That's pretty much everything.

I'm only giving this place 1 star because there's no way to give 0 stars.
I will never spend another cent in this establishment. Today I went to buy water and a breakfast sandwich. I see everyone getting HANDED their food. Apparently, I don't deserve to get my food handed to me. Mine has to be thrown to the side and I'm instructed to go to the front.
Not sure why I was the only one to have that but I'm surely not spending money at a place that thinks that throwing my food is acceptable.

I overlooked previous infractions because I was more focused on getting my items but never again.
Also, don't stand around thinking about what juice item you want. You may inherit a lurker who stands next to you acting like he or she is fixing or stocking shelves. It's happened at least twice. So enjoy university deli. I won't ever step foot in that place again.

They great salad and smoothie options (up to 4 fruit options with no extra charge). However the line during lunch hours is insane! As the ready-to-eat station selling sandwiches is adjacent to the salad bar, you will never figure where the line start nor how it lines up to the cashier. But they accept cards, which is great.

I work around the area and have searched for a decent cup of coffee that also won't break the bank. University Deli meets those expectations. Coffee is good and pretty consistent in taste everyday. I usually come here super early (6 am or so) and the staff are not the friendliest but who can be so cheery at the crack of dawn. They have some good lunch specials so I'll definitely try and stop by to check out their lunch.
I have got a cockroach in my deli box today. The most unfortunate part is, I found this when I almost finish it.... It's really really disgusting..... I do hope I can vomit all what I have had

Prices are fair and reasonable and they offer a good salad bar with a lot of variety. While their hot food was never something to brag about, I've noticed a decline from bad to worse. Especially with their chicken. Old meat that's either super dry,
chewy or over fried. See the picture as to what they call the chicken ranch (minus the bacon)

-flat bread
-thin piece of chicken that's over fried
-no ranch so they used mayo
-brown mushy avocado

I go here for lunch sometimes when I don't want anything too filling. I'll go to the buffet and get a few things. Some type of lo Mein or pasta, some fish and some vegetables in a small container. I get lunch for about $5 and it gets me through my day! It's usually pretty crowded at lunch but I still manage to get in and out really quickly. They also have a salad bar, paninis, sandwiches, grilled sandwiches, etc. Don't expect too much but it does the job!
Horrible customer service. Sandwich attendant was literally annoyed about having to make my sandwich.  The entire time had a sour look on his face. First time in this place and definitely the last!

This place gets the job done. When I'm hungry, strapped for time, and in Washington Heights, University Deli is the first place I visit. The cashiers are so efficient during the lunch rush hour (well, maybe sometimes a little too efficient because they tend to jam my change back into my hand and wave the next customer down...) and it's much appreciated. This place only takes cash, so make sure you have some cash money on hand. There's an ATM inside and several ATMs for major banks in the neighborhood. You won't need too much cash because this place is reasonably priced! That is, unless you haven't eaten for days and have turned into a ravenous monster.

While the buffet bar is always surrounded by people and has very little space surrounding it, it is by far the quickest way to choose what you want. Ravenous monsters, this is your best bet. There are fruits, salad items, pastas, (Americanized) Chinese food, and lots of fried and grilled meats. Since I look out for you, reader, I will have to say that the buffet bar isn't necessarily all too sanitary. On occasion, I've seen people drop the tongs into the dishes allowing all of the germs from the handle to seep into the food, but that's almost with any buffet bar. On rare occasions, I've seen people take food from the buffet bar wearing scrubs and...gloves. FYI.

When I come here, it's often to order their udon. They're a little salty, but for about $5, a giant Styrofoam bowl's worth of noodles, broth, and vegetable toppings will help me get through the rest of my day. University Deli also offers a number of hot and cold sandwich options, but don't order them if you don't have much time as they take a while to prepare. And if you're not hungry at all, you can still find bottled and canned drinks, chips, rice crackers, cookies, first aid items, and toiletries here. It's like a mini convenience store!

Likelihood of another visit:
I'll be back when hunger hits.

UD is awesome that it is always open. On the way back from a late night at 4am and you're thirsty? No problem, pop in to grab a Vitamin Water. Need a quick lunch? Get some of the hot buffet. Still, having spent time and money at UD over the months, I've come to realize its gustatory limitations. The hot buffet at nearby Shang-ri-la is a bit tastier, especially the fruit. However, go back to the first sentence in this review--UD is always open--and you'll realize its amazing utility in this stinkhole called Washington Heights.

This place gets at least 4 stars for the shear fact that I come here every. single. day.  The staff even recognizes me now (le sigh).  It basically provides the staples of my diet: soy crisps, pirates booty, clif bars, fruit, greek yogurt, drinks, candy and several asian snacks (yan yan, hi-chews, panda snacks).

Also, good salad bar (chicken is dry though), cheapest place to get a full salad.  

I've had a panini here once - chicken was very dry.

On wednesdays, they have pajeon (korean pancake).

open 24/7, cash only.

This place is CRAMPED, always packed, causing me fits of panicky claustrophobia.

Yet, I keep coming back.

1.) EPIC hot and cold buffet bar at a decent price per pound.

1a.) REAAAAAALLLLLLLLLY good Ranch dressing at the salad bar. Like, I'll shamelessly down the entire vat of it.

2.) G.T. Kombucha with chia seeds!

3.) Those little vanilla ice cream sundae cups caked with frozen strawberry syrup that I used to love for dessert after lunch in elementary school.

4.) Hot and cold sandwiches at prices comparable or cheaper to Jou Jou (...well, who am I kidding. ANYTHING is cheaper than Jou Jou) or Shrangi-La.

5.) Plenty of toiletries, et al, behind the counter; quicker to pick up there sometimes than running up to Rite Aid.

6.) It's a 24 / 7 operation, much to the joy of some of my fellow NYP workers banging out the night shifts.

Just straight forward. Get your stuff. Go. Eat. Be happy.

Yes, it's cash only, but shut up. There are dozens of ATMs in the area. (I have no sympathy for you. Haaa.)

I can't speak to the hot/cold bar (I'm way too afraid to touch that), but let me tell you my experience with University Deli: on one occasion, the fruit I purchased (in a cup packaged by them, to the right as you enter the store) tasted like chemicals. Someone clearly sprayed some 409 on that one. I was a little happy when they got shut down by the health department for a few days -- maybe it has been cleaned up since.

Of course, there are times when I'm in the hospital and need a Clif bar or Pop Chips... so it's convenient. And their frozen yogurt is fine. But based on my chemical-y experience, I can't recommend it to anyone. Shangri-La one block over should suffice.

YES BUFFET!! weighted, yes. I love their chicken. pork. fatty substances. the salad bar is beautiful to look at but I usually have unusual cravings for meat when I'm here. I told myself not to go there everyday, to try new places around the area, but I always found myself crawling back. Well, maybe not literally but... enough to make a scene.

Pretty good deli for the area.  I'm sure the Columbia people and hospital workers keep it going strong.  They have good sandwiches and nice nice looking spread, but overall nothing exceptional.

The big plus is that it is 24/7.

Almost always a daily stop for me.
This deli is right by work and it's food is consistent.  The salad bar has a mixture of Asian, Italian, American, and some Hispanic cuisine.  They do a decent job of creating a salad bar that, I think, serves the community's needs.  There's a nice sit in area, although it is very cramped.  The price is average for a salad bar (about $5 per lb.).

The deli also offers an assortment of sandwiches.  What is good about these sandwiches is that some are already pre-made, there is a menu you can also order from, or you can tell them what you want.

They recently opened up a small Udon Noodle section where you can have tempura shrimp or chicken udon.  It's decently priced for the size and it tastes good.  The broth is good during these winter months here in NY.

The service is quick and oderly.

First time here and they are very overpriced. I was not paying attention and didnt look at the scale. I think he though he could mark my salad up due to that. I am positive he over charged me. I wont be going back here.

Why do it.  It's a rip off for your basic bodega when you can go 2 blocks on Audubon and get decent equal at bodega prices.  Yeah they do have a salad bar.... Aka petry dish. I do congratulate them on finally achieving an A-food rating after being the only C rating I've ever seen in NYC. Oh and before being awarded the C rating, the DoH shut them down. Take a look on DoH website and see the rating system. You're afforded quite a few violations with an A rating, a C rating achievement is remarkable infractions.

As I was scarfing down my food, the chilled white bean sprouts with sesame seeds specifically (Korean style), I thought to myself.. holy cow this is four stars! I then proceeded to fork my tofu with scallions, red chili peppers, and vinegar soy sauce, barely lifting my head to come up for air, when a second thought surfaced.. how have I survived this long without Korean food?!

That was me a few days ago. Upon retrospect, I have come to the conclusion that the buffet at U. Deli is four stars upon the time of consumption and three stars in the aftermath. The food is tasty, no doubt, with offerings similar to that of ShangriLa just a few blocks away (minus the boatloads of sodium - I feel hypertensive just thinking about it - and with better offerings of "Asian" food. U. Deli that is. Better than ShangriLa.)

At U. Deli you will find (not inclusive of all buffet items):

salad bar (peas, carrots, tomatoes, eggs, pine nuts, olives, cucumbers, and the like)
stir-fry snap peas
chilled broccoli, chicken, and pepper mix
black bean salad
pasta salad
rice
chow mein
baked chicken in sauce
white bean sprouts with sesame seeds
tofu with scallions, red chili peppers, vinegar soy sauce
udon (you choose what to add to your soup)

If in the area, drop in to U. Deli. Otherwise? Stick to Korea town because honestly, how Korean is their selection if I can only name 2 Korean items?

Cash only.

HAHAHA I HAVE to review this place. I don't know how many times a week I go here anymore. My boyfriend and I are in here usually after 1 am buying sandwiches and tons of candy. Or I'm in here 6 am on a Saturday after a party. Im pretty sure the guys that work there think were such stoners or something. But anyways...I LOVE this deli!! Get the spyce wrap or the chicken parmagana panini. Or any sandwich, actually. I've had them all. The food is surprisingly good and the buffet they have out during the day is good too, but I rarely get to it. So when you need snacks, vitamin waters, and a panini at 4 in the morning. Go to University deli!!

I say, YES. They got good boar's head sandwiches. They got those crazy crispy potato chips. Not gonna change your life, but it's good for me & Spout. Hot food at bar during lunch, including a giant fish of some kind where you can see it's skeleton (we enjoy skeletons). Black & white cookies & do yourself a favor, get a cup of coffee next door and you can sit at their outside tables and watch the ambulances and other assorted nonsense.

This is a great lunch place near the hospital. Their salad/hot food/fruit bar is great. They have tons of choices and are really fairly priced. I went in to get a salad the other day from the salad bar and paid under $5. Sometimes the sanitary conditions of the food bar leave a little to be desired, but overall it's a great value and they have a huge selection. Also, the check people out really quickly so even though there's a lot of people, you can get in and out pretty quickly.

They recently opened up an udon station! You could probably get better tasting (but more expensive) udon at Tamaya, but University Deli's definitely holds its own. You can add different meats (I chose the shrimp tempura) and veggies. Definitely a filling and satisfying meal during the colder months.

Being a Columbia Grad student, I've had my fair share of food from "U Del" and for the most part its not bad. It is firstly WAY more economical than its wannabe gourmet neighbor next door. Since I got at lunch everything is pretty hot but I've definitely gone at night and there is some funky stuff congealing toward the back of that salad bar. The items I have picked have been consistently good, and the lines go quick. Only drawbacks is that the salad bar is weighted, and thus a bit overpriced. I love carbs, and rice and potatoes and such, so I tend to shy away b/c spending like 5 bucks for a half plate of rice in addition to whatever else I get, it adds up in the lunch dept... I've resigned to sticking to salads, with lots of chicken and croutons, though I do really wish they labeled those dressings...

I've been getting my morning coffee here for the last few months.  I gotta walk up the stairs to get into the deli, and there's a JooJoo's cafe right below them, but I still walk up the stairs every morning.  I like to make my coffee at the coffee bar.  They have choices of chocholate raspberry, hazelnut, french vanilla, toasted almond and pumkin spice.  My favorite is toasted almond.  I add two packets of sugar and some half & half, and I put in the straw in the cup (it's my ritual) and sip on the way into the job.  I see the same cashier lady everyday.  She doesn't talk so much, but she's efficient and always greets pleasantly.  I don't think they'll make a lot of money from me buying only coffee from them, but I'll go there everyday when I have to go to work.

Even when its crowded it doesn't take long to get a sandwich, bagel or a cup of coffee. They are also open 24/7 which I like because I work different shifts and don't have to worry if the deli is open or closed.

I'm not to thrilled with the salad bar. It really does seem to be hit or miss. I don't know maybe I need to grab the food when they first bring it out.

It's a good place to get a quick bite to eat.

I've got much love for the U Deli. As a nightowl grad student at Columbia, this place is responsible for keeping alive through my 5 years living in the Heights. It is what is is. Thoroughly mediocre but their hot sandwiches are good, deli bar OK during lunch, and they are open 24/7.

I only get the coffee here, which is very good. Buffet food is gone by the afternoon. Don't bother in the evening--your only food option are sad-looking wraps and paninis, that have sat at least a week. The grill is shut down at night, even though it is a 24-hr place. I asked for a hamburger. "Sorry mam." I asked for a sandwich with avocado. "No avocadoes." I asked for cheese--they forgot to put in the sandwich and charged for it. Do they deserve that B rating from the food inspection? No.

I was recently out doing some catching up and exploring our city with good friends and when it came time to sit and get a bite to eat one of our number suggested the reasonably new Urbanspace location on 14th Street, just off of Union Square.  I am always game to try something interesting.  

So inside this space are about a dozen counters of all different varieties.  There is a gyro counter, a sushi counter, an Italian food counter and many more.  I apologize for not taking more copious notes but the mission here was to eat and catch up after all.  There is also a Top Hops beer counter and a small beer garden where one can sit and enjoy a cold brew if they do those kinds of things.  I don't at the moment but still love the idea of such a thing.  Our dining experience consisted of the Bob White Counter who was serving up some tasty chicken.  Overall everything seemed to be priced reasonably but remember inflation and our being in NYC so things will only be so cheap.    

There are gender neutral bathrooms which did seem to need a little more upkeep in terms of no towels on the floor and water but its nice to have them here.  There is also free Wifi and several tables where you can sit.   I hope for this places success as its the kind of business I'd like to visit again when in the vicinity whether it be a concert at Irving Plaza or just some shopping time nearby.  Best of luck Urbanspace.

Was looking for a Bobwhite Counter location and was surprised that it was in this food hall. The place is spacious, with high ceilings; a few high tables for at least 8people, some counter seating by the large open window facing 14th St and some outdoors in the back. Friendly staff.
Bobwhite chicken is good although spicy chicken sandwich was a bit too spicy for me. Fresh lemonade around $4.50. Tenders combo around $12.
Min Sushi's tuna tartare bento box was a great choice for $14. But they changed the sides; preferred the first time.
Will not order Pork katsu don again $12. Katsu didn't seem freshly-fried (didn't notice a fryer), and was on the chewy and dry side.
Got sodas at the Yeero place $2. Will try their food next time.
Some places offer student discounts.

Didn't know they opened up a new food hall near this area that I used to frequent so I had to come in and check it out. Overall, I gotta say that this is one of the nicer food halls I've been to. The open seating area that can see out into the street, the high ceilings, layout, and outdoor patio are all good additions, and there's a good variety to the food hall. I tried two places here and they were
1. Summer Salt- 3/5. The tacos were fine and the flavor was pretty good but most of the food was warm at best, and the fish is fried in mass batches and sits in front of a heat lamp. Not only that, but it sits on top of each other, meaning that it just all becomes soggy. I don't think they need to fry that many all at once.
2. Lou Yau Kee -4.5/5. Got the mixed chicken rice and I gotta say, I really enjoy it. The food was hot, and the sauces were on point ( though I wish we could get more sauce, I love the hot chili one) and I enjoyed the two different methods of chicken preparation. I do prefer the oil basted cooked one ( the darker skin one) than the traditional method but both are good nonetheless.

It's also really cool that they do student discounts for the myriads of students that probably are nearby.

The hainanese chicken combo  (half order of roasted & half order of poached) is so good and the service is very fast.

The Peking duck bing was also great. So much crunch from the lettuce and crispy duck skin. The duck was delicious.

We also got a warmed almond croissant from G.O.A.T. Cafe. It was delicious and the owner/ counter person was very nice and had a great personality.

Mr bao's Taiwanese Lu rao bowl was incredible. Definite must and will reorder. Such deep yummy flavor in a generous satisfying bowl.

However Bobwhite wasn't. Very very skimpy 5 skinny tenders. Bobwhite sauce was weird and their cookies truly generic. I think we may like chips ahoy more. Sad really. For the same cost as the above which is miles... miles better.

Some food halls are curated really well, such that you are faced with the paradox of choice and can't settle on just one stall. I find the chain of Urbanspace food halls less inspired, with lesser known brands putting out run of the mill bowls. There are 11 stalls at this location, which include: Bao by Kaya, Casa Toscana, GoFish, Pita Yeero, Plant Junkie, twentyonegrains (yet to be set up), Playa Bowls, Top Hops Beer, G.O.A.T Cafe, Summer Salt, and Wafels & Dinges.

I wasn't really called to any particular bowl on any menu so I went with a healthy choice-- the power bowl from Casa Toscana. It had chicken that was very dry, almonds, a ton of kale, and what they called wild rice but looked to me like basmati rice. There wasn't a lot of flavor in the bowl but at least I was getting my macros. I got a side of chicken dumplings from Bao by Kaya because I wanted some flavor but was disappointed to find they tasted like prepackaged stuff and came with a much too sweet sauce that was supposed to be hot sauce.

The only stand I'm excited about here is Summer Salt, whose 23rd st location I regularly visit and love. I could also see myself grabbing a beer at the bar located right at the center and maybe grabbing a quick bite before a show in the area. Otherwise, I wouldn't stop here again.

Yet another Urbanspace, this time in another prime location right off Union Square, with the typical lineup of not particularly interesting vendors, but a few great standouts.

Today I tried Kid Brother Pizza Bar, which turned out to be exceptionally good pizza, especially for a food hall. It's a pretty small round pie cut into 8 really little slices, that are very easy to eat quickly before you realize the pie is gone.

We also tried Bobwhite, which continues to be a shell of its former self.

Urbanspace  Union Square is a newish addition--adding a small food hall to Union Square.  open from morning to night. the interior is clean, plenty of seating, and well-maintained. there are ~ a dozen eateries...many familiar ones like Bob White Counter, Pita Yeero, and Summer Salt to name a few. most of the spots offer abridged menus versus their complete menus at stand-alone locations. if you need variety of choices, this Urbanspace location  will serve your needs well. i have stopped by here a few times and have been pretty satisfied with the choices and service.

I feel like an old fart-- I've officially been in NYC long enough to see an area of town change so drastically!
What used to be TJs wine is now another modern food hall with all kinds of options! I honestly haven't tried anything but the coffee, but the ambience is fresh, hip and clean, and they make it open-air during good weather with window seats, which is an added touch.
Great venue. The various vendors have amazing food and the beer selection at Top Hops is great. With so many choices of food to choose from it's a hard decision.

Yet another food hall opens up. The space has high ceilings and is airy with a multitude of vendors.

Good space for vendors to open up shop without the higher rents I suppose.

I like how you can find a little bit of everything under one roof.  I kinda wish they had different vendors than the usual ones you see at other urban spaces, but I'm glad to have the option.  It's better than another bank, amirite?  

I wish they had more seating since it's hard to find a spot when it's crowded.

I really like this space but unfortunately none of the food at any of the options is really that good - everything is pretty much just okay. I came here with a group of people so we pretty much had someone try something from each of the vendors (I specifically have tried the sushi and the bao place) and everyone had the same report: "it's okay". This is a nice, convenient spot to meet up with people that doesn't get too busy and where you can easily get a table, but don't expect anything special when it comes to the food.

This is a conveniently located food hall near Union Square. It has a good variety of cuisines including sushi, vegan comfort food, and healthy bowls. It's a great place to go with a group as there will be something for everyone. They have a seating area with tables as well as high top seating along the front window.

Cool Place with lots of food choices and a bar, really clean space and looked like they had outdoor seating in the back. It was a bit to cold to sit outside but a nice option. Great service and friendly people from my experience visiting the first time.

This is a really fun spot. There are 13 different restaurants so something for everyone. From pizza, pasta, sushi, coffee, sandwiches, tacos, falafel, playa bowls, salad bowls, vegan, and gluten free! So many options in this spacious food hall. I'd recommend going at a less busy hour so you can really enjoy the full experience. Great place to grab a few things with friends to share!!

This does not pertain to Urbanspace.

It is strictly for Mysttik Masaala 14.

Wandered in to Urban Space because of the variety of food available.

We settled on this Indian location. Had the Tikka Masala and it was TERRIBLE.

The chicken tasted like it was precooked in a pressure cooker. Had no texture and no taste.

The sauce was an odd red color; a color off from other Tikka Masala in other Indian restaurants.

It only made the chicken taste worse than without the sauce.

In addition, at $17.00, it is too expensive for this dish, in this setting.

Went here to check out the options.  They have alot of stalls but nothing special that you can't find in the area.  We settled on Bob White and got the chicken sandwich and fries.  Tbh the fries were very tasty as for the sandwich it was nothing special. The space itself has potential, I think rhey should've rented to vendors that aren't readily available in the area.  It will be a challenge at first but maybe a Hawaiian, Caribbean, or Philippine option would be a start.

I  expected to have a delicious cup of coffee by the look of the shop display. But my expectation wasn't fulfilled. The coffee tastes too light like the street vender's. I hope they will improve the taste and the quality.

Great options perfect for lunch with your coworkers and the outdoor seating will be nice as the weather gets better

There are some quicker places to grab a bite in the neighborhood but this was a nice change. I've tried the Greek spot and the fish tacos. Both were great. Service wasn't slow, the portions were good and the food was fresh.

Seating is a little limited but we were able to find a spot. Might be difficult if it's a larger group to find a table to eat it but shouldn't be impossible because there is quick turnover.

Walked by after the gym and noticed how open it was with all the windows, so I decided to turn around. Walked around all the places looked pretty good, but I went for the Greek place. I got a bowl, came with fries, dolma, protein and a grain. The guy who checked me out reminded me of the student discount, so remember to bring your id. Pretty nice, I plan to come back this week.

This is the second Urbanspace I've been to, the other being the one at Grand Central, and I'd have to say I prefer this one. They've got a really nice amount of selections, and my friend and I surprisingly didn't have a hard time finding a place to sit on a Friday night. Super convenient place to grab a quick bite before heading to a concert at Irving Plaza which is what we did. We both got sandwiches from Cafe Toscana and they were simple but really tasty, and reasonably priced in my opinion. I definitely plan to go back both to get the same sandwich and to branch out.
Overpriced but good atmosphere. Would love for this to be my go-to lunch place, but it's too expensive. I was charged $2.18 for a regular Poland spring water bottle with no option for free tap water.

I was so upset when the original location closed a few years ago, so needless to say, I prioritized coming to their new spot as soon as possible.

My friend and I were immediately seated (not super busy Tuesday at 730) and our order was taken fairly quickly. We chose to split some spring rolls and each chose to build our own dish. I selected chicken, onion, broccoli, mushrooms and eggplant with a spicy garlic sauce, and it also comes with rice!

Serving sizes are generous, I was able to take half my meal home for dinner the next night - great value and quality!

My partner wanted a "hollywood" like NYC Chinese restaurant experience.  Little place run by a family, with the standard American Chinese fare (nothing too different).  We found it here and what was even better - the food was fantastic.  I had the wonton soup, we shared pork soup dumplings and we shared chicken loh mein and shrimp and broccoli

This is for the salt and pepper pork chops I just ordered from UberEats.
It is ALL FRIED BONES AND FAT/GRISTLE. NO MEAT!!!
I thought- surely this must be a mistake and immediately phoned Uncle Ted's to rectify this situation. I texted them photos of the fried bones, and also a photo of what they show the dish to look like on the UberEats website. The lady I spoke to said that there is nothing wrong and that is how they serve their pork chops. Didn't think the photo on Ubereats was deceiving either.
I couldn't believe it. It's literally all bone and no pork. And nothing like salt and pepper pork chops you order at any other Chinese restaurant...ever!!
Terrible customer service. And bones.
Will not be back.
Solid food, fast delivery.  They closed during COVID and we are sad but we rediscovered them recently - very happy

When i tell you that this is the best chinese food in Manhattan, believe me!!! I ordered the general tos chicken and my partner had chicken and broccoli. Delivery was fast and everything was hot and fresh! Def not cheap but worth every dollar!

I found this spot while browsing Uber Eats. I expected just plain mediocre Chinese takeout but this place blew me away. I highly recommend this place for anyone who's looking for quick but super tasty takeout. It's located a bit away from my home but it was packaged with care and delivered as if it came straight out the kitchen! One critique I have is the dough of the pork bun was a bit on the more doughey undercooked side and the sesame chicken was not as crispy but neither are a deal breaker! I will definitely be ordering from here again.
Yummy food and Tina who took care of my take out order has excellent customer service skills. I'll be back because of how friendly and welcoming she is.

Just had a delicious dinner this evening.  We thoroughly enjoyed the cold sesame noodles, chicken and garlic sauce and lamb chops.  The food was flavorful and well presented.  The service was attentive and the restaurant nicely appointed.  All in all a great choice for dinner.  We look forward to coming back.
We stumbled upon this place and we found such a great experience. The food was amazing, service was perfect and my husband loved his crispy duck more than life itself.
Beautiful restaurant with very strange service and ok very bland, sweet, Americanized food. Seems very tourist-heavy. Was excited to finally stop here, but now I know.

My friend and I came here late at night just before closing because we were craving some good comfort Chinese food. We've been curious about Uncle Ted's new location ever since the original closed down. We got the cold sesame noodles, soup dumplings, and garlic bok choy. The sesame noodles were tasty and on the sweeter side which we actually didn't mind. The soup dumplings were quite large, had lots of soup inside, and really good. The bok choy surprisingly stole the show for us as they were super garlicky and flavorful. Service was quick and the interior was nice and clean. Def will come back and check out their lunch specials!
Solid Chinese food with very organized take out operation. If you pick up be sure to call them directly to save them paying the app. Like that you can order just 1 egg roll!

Disappointing food and service.   We enjoyed the dumplings and create your own dish, but the orange "filet mignon" was fatty, thinly sliced and tasted nothing like filet mignon.  Service was fairly non-existent and after we finished our meal, the dishes sat in front of us for at least 1/2 hour until we left - we noticed that was true with the couple next to us too.  When I mentioned it to the manager, he said "we didn't want to interrupt your talking".

Met my niece and nephew here during the first week of their soft re-opening. I was a regular at the original Ted's on Bleecker, so had been eagerly awaiting it's return. The new space is a bit smaller but it's nice and on a less hectic street, so that's an improvement. It still felt fairly similar to the original Ted's in terms of ambience and the professionalism of the staff and we were told that the same chef is still there, but something is definitely different. The menu isn't quite the same as before (there's unfortunately a few notable omissions such as the vegetarian General Tso's dish) but we were able to place an order that was pretty similar to what we'd usually get in the old place and nothing tasted or was presented close to how we remember it. Not that anything was bad in any way, but if I didn't know any better, I'd never have said that I was eating food from Ted's.

Maybe it's just the hiccups of reopening. I'm sure we'll be back again soon enough, but I hope that they'll consider reverting back to the original Ted's menu and dishes that we enjoyed for so many years. As of now, this seems to be "Uncle Ted's" in name only.

I dined at Uncle Ted's modern Chinese Cuisine for lunch today with my girlfriend. The atmosphere and customer service was superb. The food was very delicious and plentiful. We had the fried pork dumplings, general tsos and sweet and sour pineapple chicken. I would highly recommend this  restaurant to anyone seeking a delicious, high-quality meal in a beautiful and artistic setting.

Actually not bad Americanized Chinese food! When seeing general Tao's chicken you know this is very non genuine Chinese. But surprisingly the crispy chicken with magic chilies was great! Especially you can eat chilies since they are blended with floured sesame and fried. I recommend it if you just want a meal.

This is limited to the Chongqing Spicy Chicken and the Mapo Tofu, since that's all I had, but it was incredible. Perfect flavor, spiciness, everything. Even the rice at this place is just... better.

Genuinely an incredible meal that left me feeling happier afterwards.

I'm so happy my favorite spot is back!!! New and improved!! The Resturant gives fine dining vibes and the quality of food is even more  delicious!! We had the chicken w broccoli x veggie lo mein. It really hit the spot. This was king overdue so happy they're back!! The service was great super friendly per usually. Already planning my next visit.

This Chinese restaurant is located right in the middle of New York's Greenwich Village historic district. Uncle Ted's Modern Chinese Cuisine serves a variety of dishes. There will be something for everyone!
Terrible and dirty restaurant. Awful and unhelpful staff. Ordered chicken and it was undercooked. Dont recommend this restaurant
Takeout order- egg drop soup, wonton soup, and veggie dumplings- all delicious esp the dumplings!! Takeout service quick and friendly, inexpensive and a great option in the area. I will be back!

We had been ordering delivery or pick-up  from Uncle Ted's for a bit and were quite happy to find our new favorite Chinese take-out, especially as so many neighborhood places have closed.

But a few weeks ago decided to go to dine in, and did so again this week.  All I can say is wow!! The service, food, and ambiance are terrific.  All made to order!!

Highly recommend the seasonal specials.  The wait staff helped with selections -- I initially asked for the wok cumin lamb without cilantro (which tastes like soap to me), they explained why that wad a bad idea, and guided me to a terrific entree.

Drinks are good too.

Just go!!

Extremely pricey but some items are pretty good. I had a basic General Tso and it was $18-$19 which is extremely expensive. To be fair, it is in the city, next to NYU and the location is a big restaurant. Giving the benefit of the doubt that they still need to break even with rent! The portions are definitely small for the price, but one thing i noticed was the meat is for sure a higher quality chicken than standard "chinese food" spots. I would give this place a second visit to try the other foods!

Happy to have Ted's on the block! Definitely a cut above anything else in the neighborhood and rates up there with some of the best in the city. Have tried many different menu items and so far they are all great. Don't let their slightly higher prices worry you, you definitely get what you pay for here!

Now back open albeit at a different location after an unfortunate fire. Their cuisine is a mixture of authentic Chinese and American cuisine, so while you could choose Sichuan Fish w. Pickled Mustard Greens, a milder palate could still be satiated with their 'health-conscious' menu and other Asian influences with their honey miso salmon or pad Thai. They've alcohol license, so be feee to pair with mai tai or even fruity tea. Good to see a local business resurrected, blessing the empty store street block of East 8th street.

Chinesse / American food.

My General Tso's Chicken was good in as much as the chunks of chicken were big moist white meat. Could have done with half the chicken and more than three pieces of broccoli. It was a lot of chicken, not a complaint.

Second meal on the order was chicken with cashews with lettuce wrap, garlic sauce on the side. Problem - what it ended up being was chicken with cashews cooked in something that looked like sugar and/or msg with onions(??) and bits of yellow, red and green peppers, lettuce on the side, no sauce on the side. Wish I had taken a picture of the chicken with cashews. If you want plain chicken with anything, you need to specify *special order* at Uncle Ted's on 8th street. Expressed disappointment and left this dish behind, no credit received.

Of note, the night before I stopped in for Sesame Noodles and asked more than once for hot oil with chili red peppers on the side, get home, no hot oil with chili red peppers.

FYI, PF Changs in the neighborhood, found in malls in the U.S.A., might actually list ingredients on their website that might be helpful to some people.

So happy uncle Ted's is back. Food is amazing & service was great too.

My faves are the fish w hot chili oil, flank steak w jalapeño, pork soup dumplings & wonton soup! Yum!!
Food is alright. But i wont be going back unless the female waiter is fired. She made us feel very unwelcome. And like we are bothering her. Service is bad. My friend went and said the same thing.

We used to go to Uncle Ted's at their old location on Bleecker Street. I'm happy to report that it's just as good as ever!
The Double-Cooked Pork was one of my dad's favorite dishes. We had it in his memory, and it's still excellent! Fitting tribute.
Also great: the Spicy Cauliflower appetizer - it's delicious and very special. The Szechuan Chicken was delicious. Very spicy, with a great amount of Szechuan peppers. And really good Hot & Sour Soup, as well!
Thanks, for being a fantastic neighborhood standby, Uncle Ted's!
