Food is great. Lots of choices (including a healthy option menu) and everything I've had so far from the menu is tasty. The servers could use some training though - from going to the restaurant many times I will say they come across as being a tad haphazard, probably due to lack of experience and not any bad intentions on their part.

Ordered from them 845, order never delivered, never got an email, a text or a call indicating a problem. Whoever they use for their deliveries is clueless.
Next day they refused to acknowledge a problem at  their end, and while they wouldn't issue a refund for $20 plus tax and tip they said they would send us the same order later. When we called they changed their mind. At Uncle Ted's the customer is always wrong.

Back and better than ever. I'm going to say it, best Chinese food in the city to me, and I lived there for 8 years and was constantly on the hunt. Perfectly executed dishes that balance the classic, comforting Chinese food many of us love with a more modern, fresh take. I traveled back from NJ to try it out after they reopened, I think it's even better than before, absolutely worth the trip.

I've enjoyed everything I've tried, but my personal favorites: sweet and sour chicken, chicken with string beans, vegetable fried rice, steamed pork dumplings (dipping sauce is incredible).

DO NOT order the egg rolls!  Unlike the marvelous "worth a trip for" creations served at the Ted's on Bleecker Street, The current version is a dollar more, and lacking a sufficient quantity of pork that the previous version had in wonderful abundance.  Hopefully they will correct this (the pork quantity) in the NEAR future.  Until then DO NOT order the egg rolls!
Otherwise the food was quite good.  We ordered the lunch specials and were pleased.

Delicious food!  Wonderful wait staff!  My husband and I were so happy when they reopened from the fire on Bleecker Street.  Sesame Cold noodles and hot and sour soup Great!  My husband liked Twice cooked pork!

To start, our waitress may never had waited tables before. When dishes came to the table they were randomly place wherever on a table for us to figure out who order what and without even knowing what it was. I was more than halfway through with my meal before someone even got theirs. First I order dumplings and what I got were dumplings in chilie oil and warm water broth they called it Hot and Sour Soup and charged accordingly, the communication was terrible ! Baffled by this random 1st time here and I have a great sense of humor so I didn't make a fuss hoping that the service would get better it did not. Maybe they were overwhelmed it was a party of 8 but nothing unusual and while were paying the bill,  dishes out of the kitchen were being brought to the table with a the waiter asking is this yours. Dazed and Confused for my dinner. The Singapore Rice noodles were acceptable but overall I know what to aspect and how to order in this epic fail at $31.95 for Dumplings and noodles

This is a small, cute neighborhood sushi restaurant.  There are only a few tables, but the service is fast and the tables turn over quickly.  They also take reservations.  The sushi is fresh and flavorful.

I have tried several of their signature rolls and liked all of them:
* Sunfire Roll (snow crab, cucumber, mango, and avocado)
* Dynamai Roll (baked scallops, shiitake, and torched masago mayo)
* Salmon Special Roll (spicy salmon tempura, raw salmon, and salmon roe)
* Niji Roll (California Roll with different types of raw fish)

I kept on eyeing what others ordered, as there were some other really fun rolls.  I guess I will just have to come back.

Craving sushi at 9:45. Nothing was open anymore and we stumbled across this on yelp. Sushi was ok. Nothing to write home about. Cuts were in the smaller side. Definitely pricier. Each sushi was based per price so it adds up real quick.

If you are up late and looking for a bite, I would say go for it. Not very many other places that you can order Al carte instead of omokase.

A casual place for some great sushi!

Definitely a missable hole in wall but once you walk in it's very cutely decorated with attentive servers throughout. I ordered a glass of plum wine with a regular sashimi plate and for $31 it was not bad pricing at all! The fish is fresh, the rice is well cooked and the plum wine is delightful. My favorite piece though was the tuna though, normally I am not a ginger fan but, they added just enough ginger and scallion to add a little something something to the fish without overwhelming it.

Overall, would definitely recommend for takeout or a solo sushi date on your own!
Had a return visit with my nephew and sushi was better than the last time!! Love this place!!!!

Cute spot for great sushi. It might not look like much but umami sushi has great sashimi and rolls. The fish all tasted high quality and the plating was great. Service was very quick and kind. I didn't seen the spicy tuna roll on the menu except in the combination section, but they were able to accommodate my order but letting me order it off the combo without making it an actual combo.

The eel was soooo good I'm already thinking about when I'll be going back again to have it.

Next time I have to try the crispy rice topped with spicy tuna!

West Village sushi spot only half filled with what looked like NYU coeds on the evening we visited. Easy seating on a busy Saturday night made us a little concerned. Tiny tables with dusty ledges and window sills, very 1970's NY vibe. Ordered the sushi sashimi for 3 since we were hungry. Didn't come with miso soup or salad :( but the selection of sashimi and sushi was fresh and "umami" :) No premium items like uni, ebi botan, scallops or toro, just the standard tuna, yellowtail, salmon, avocado and imitation crab.
With so many very good sushi sashimi restaurants in NYC, though not notable, this place was passable for no-frills sushi. Below average value at about $150 for the sushi sashimi platter for 3 (perfectly portioned for 2 people) and a beer. One hit wonder.

This place was the best find!! Looks like a hole in the wall but the sushi was fantastic! Everything was super fresh and tasted delicious. They have 3 different crispy rice options, I had the spicy tuna and loved it! Will definitely come back to try the rest. We had 3 different special rolls and all were amazing but I think my favorite was the Zuku chu toro roll. They also had a lot of great, affordable sake options. Absolutely coming back

waited over 1hr for take out. when we finally ate, the sushi rice was warm, not to mention there was an abundance of rice in the sushi pieces. overpriced and mediocre at best, would rather get supermarket sushi.
Amazing, fresh sushi, crispy fish & dumplings with an affordable lunch menu. Can't wait to go back.

After moving to east village a few weeks ago, I think I found my go to sit down sushi spot. Sushi set for $22 can't be beat. Seven pieces of extremely fresh and immaculately prepared pieces of sushi, along with a very solid California roll. Also a rarity - their tuna is fantastic. The inside is small but well appointed, and the service is quick and friendly.

I only did takeout for the first time but the Uni was from Tokyo and absolutely delicious. The fluke was so fresh all I needed was some wasabi and lemon same goes for the red snapper. The hand rolls were small but tasty. Very reasonable for the high quality of fish. We'll definitely try again hopefully in person.
1 star is for their delivery service. It never arrives. They shouldn't claim that they have delivery capabilities when they can't handle it.

Umami Sushi is a great place to catchup with friends. Casual vibes and very tiny space.

I got the Summeri Roll (spicy scallops and mango inside. Salmon and avocado on top with rice crackers) $17.95. This was not bad (8/10)!
Fish to rice ratio was good - generous with the fish! Fish was also pretty good quality for the price!

We got the lunch special for $13 which was an insane price for 2 rolls and a soup or a salad. The house salad was good but I wish the dressing had more of a ginger flavor, but it was still really good. I loved the salmon mango roll, it was easily my favorite roll there. The restaurant was super small inside with minimal seating but that made it even better in my opinion! Would definitely go back the next time I go to NYC!

I highly recommend this sushi place! it has multiple choice of fishes and has really nice ambiance! Has many Japanese alcohol beverages to just chill and and grab something quick to eat! The staffs are nice and friendly. Great service! For rolls I personally liked their Greenwich Roll (it is cooked btw)

Dined here for dinner and it was unfortunately an underwhelming experience.

My spicy tuna roll didn't taste fresh, I didn't even finish the roll; and my shrimp tempura roll had parts of brown avocado in it and each sushi in the roll fell apart when I picked up with my chopsticks. The interior is so small and I felt so crammed against the wall. Service was very slow but understandable for a Saturday night.

good food, terrible service, waitress rushed me while placing my order and although I was going to tip. i was looking through my purse to find something i thought i misplaced the waitress stared me down and stood next to me until i put the tip down. on top of being a terrible server and putting my food on the other side of the table when i was dining alone and being pretty rude the entire dining experience.
I always try to eat here when I am in West Village. Food is always very good. Service is excellent.

I finally went to this place in person after ordering delivery a few times. I loved it. The sushi is excellent, and you can tell it will be as soon as you walk in and smell it. The place is very small, which gives it a cute and intimate vibe. It just gets a bit overwhelming if any other patrons are loud.

I'm definitely impressed with this spot.  Honestly, it's always a little scary ordering from a new sushi spot.  My go to is usually Bondi or Zen Ramen and Sushi because I know their quality, but Umami was the only spot open late recently...and I saw on Grubhub they were under a list titled, "most loved on Yelp."  I gave them a shot and not only are they incredibly priced compared to other sushi spots, but the sushi is excellent.  Haven't been in person, but they are a new, cheap, quality delivery spot for sure.
Unbelievable, such a good price and high-quality food, they have a professional chef team, can meet all kinds of requirements, my friends and I had a great meal together!

Stopped by for a quick dinner and there was a short wait on a Saturday night. Seating is quite cramped. We did some gyoza and other apps for starters which were great. The rolls we ordered were not good at all and poorly wrapped/rolled so they were falling apart.
This place has really great quality sushi for a great price. Went with a few friends and we all loved everything. I seriously dream about the crispy rice. I would go back just for that.

This is the type of place you don't want to share with other people because its just too good! The inside is quite compact and small, but the food here is just so delicious. They have one of the best and fresh fish I have tasted, and the selection is amazing. It gets quite busy on a weekend especially at night so i recommend calling for a reservation.

I've both dined in and ordered pickup here and it doesn't disappoint! Honestly such a fantastic quality of fish, especially for the price! The only reason I didn't go five stars is sometimes the service is a little distracted, but at the same time they've never screwed up and order, and  for this price it's well worth it!

I first came here on a date a few weeks ago. We found it on a Google search and just went with it. Tiny hole in a wall with a couple of tables outdoors. We opted to sit outside. We both ordered a few sushi rolls each. I got the California roll with real crabmeat, spicy scallop, and crunch spicy tuna. I loved all my choices. Everything was fresh and delish. Love that they offer something slightly uncommon and for very reasonable prices. My date was happy with his rolls as well. We also shared a small bottle of sake. Their booze is priced well for sure. Service was very friendly and efficient. What more can you ask for?

I came back for lunch the other day, and will be coming whenever I'm in the area.

Ummm, wow!!! Can I eat here every day?!? #Dreams This place knocked the chopsticks right out of my hands.

Is it a tiny little sardine can of a space? Yes.
Does that even matter when your being served the most delectable bites of  fish that practically wiggle onto your plate off the boat because it's so fresh?
No.
It's amazing. All of it. Everything on the menu. Even their selection of sake is wonderful. I never knew sake could be vast in flavor profiles and  so so so delicious and complimentary to sushi. I'm a changed woman. Goodbye Sauvignon Blanc. Move over Chardonnay. Pinot who? Sake is my new friend and I'm never letting go.

So if you go and there's a wait-wait for it. It's absolutely worth it. Trust me.

Came here to had a Birthday lunch for a good friend and we both love the place. A petite and charming place for a casual yet elegance meal~ fresh ingredients, nicely crafted rolls with nice fluffy rice!

I came here on a weekday after work with a couple of friends looking for a quick bite to eat. I actually had a really good experience here and the staff was pretty friendly. There was only 1 waitress and maybe 2 chefs, but they really put in the effort to make a good experience.

The Sushi Deluxe Combo ($25) was decently priced, not too expensive for 10 pieces of nigiri and a small tuna roll. The amount of sushi in this will leave you satisfied, not too full or hungry afterwards. The fish was surprisingly fresher than I expected, but I thought that some of the nigiri pieces had too much wasabi in them. Overall I'd recommend this dish.

I'd honestly come back here with other friends if I was looking for a well-priced meal.

Tiny hole in the wall spot with incredible sushi. They have creative rolls and I got their crispy rice with spicy salmon and it was to die for.

Even though it was super busy the service was so warm and attentive, go here!
Omg  this location I find traveling with a Rasta friend of mine. I was so hungry  in so was he I purchased the Phoenix dragon rolls. They were very delicious.

They say a picture is worth a thousand words. This was the sauce to my dumplings. They should be ashamed.

Now I've eaten the food. Save yourself and your money. The sauce was the least of my concerns. Shumai was small and overly salty and tamago had zero taste, much like the rice. Anyone giving this place a good rating hasn't had good sushi.

We were in the area for Fashion Week and thanks to the ever trusted Yelp app, we found this little hole in the wall restaurant. What I loved about this place was the coziness and the attentive staff. The sushi was absolutely delicious. It was prepared fast and the fish was tender and fresh. I'm looking forward to coming back because there were things on the menu I need to try.

Great sushi in a casual atmosphere. They're open until 10:30 on saturdays do you can enjoy some quality seafood while all enjoying the antics of the West Village. While I was dining there was a guy doing laps around the block pushing a hand truck with speakers on it.

I had some cold sake. They've got a bunch of options with a fair variety. The bottle sizes are smaller making them easier for one or two people to enjoy with food.

For food, I had the omasake which included 10 pieces of sushi plus a hand roll. Some of the highlights of the omasake were the uni, the scallop, and the fatty tuna. I decided to have a few more pieces of sushi after the omasake. Again, the uni was a stand out along side raw king salmon.

I appreciate the small business atmosphere. The staff wa last attentive and the service was quick.

Hands down my new favorite sushi place.
Like the spicy tuna on crispy rice better than how other restaurants do it. Their maki rolls are good too.
I like their salads and veggies as well, cheap and nice.

This is a small no frills sushi spot. The highlight of the meal was "Spicy Tuna Crispy Rice."
The price is reasonable and the service good.
I found the entire experience to be overall adequate.

Cute little hole in the wall place that serves some bomb sushi and affordable sake. At around $10 a bottle that can be split between two people, this is probably the most affordable drink I've found at any Japanese restaurant. We started off with the chicken karaage, which was delicious and crispy and really got our appetites going.

Now onto the main dish, we got the sushi regular/deluxe, which came with a huge portion of rolls and nigiri of a variety of seafood, fully satisfying our craving for sushi. The fish was super fresh, though it took a while to be prepared, but with the low number of workers that day (only one waitress who was super efficient and attentive), I'm pretty impressed by the service and overall experience!

Small, unassuming place, with truly the best sushi. We live in SF and there are many wonderful sushi places. But the best we'd ever had prior to Umami Sushi was at a place in a strip mall (can't remember the name!!) in Honolulu. Just delicious. And the roasted shishito peppers - yum.

Cute little place close to NYU. Very good sushi - done right, one bite, correct shape, good selection.

Best to order by the piece as they always have good specialties.

Dine in: YES! Order in: No! The sushi here Taste pretty good and the service is great while dining in, but the times I ordered to have sushi delivered to me hasn't been so great. One time they took over an hour and 1/2 despite me living just a few blocks away and they didn't add the soy sauce! That's a big deal when eating sushi - I had to go buy soy sauce around the corner at Sam's Deli. The other time they pretty much forgot about my order. I ordered at 8:30 and didn't get my order until 10:15! I had called twice and they said it was almost ready, but I was annoyed to eat so late at 10:15pm. Also, the soup was scorching hot and it melted the plastic of the to go container, so I didn't want to eat "plastic seafood soup" - I bought it for nothing pretty much.

Tiny hole in the wall sushi spot. The type of spot you'd usually think twice about before eating because the sushi may not be too fresh. But that's not the case here. As they say, you can't always judge a book by its cover.

The fish here was super fresh and handled with care. The pieces were the quality that you'd find at a higher end sushi place and the rolls were great too. We had a range of rolls and pieces and everything was great.

We sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chef was super friendly and talked to us throughout the meal.

We'd definitely eat here again

Came here for the first time while visiting the area. We ordered the lunch special with three rolls and some gyoza. The food was very good and also the service  The place is very small though. Nobody was there at about 3:30 so it was good. Also the tax is included in the bill for the tip. We did enjoy the lunch but adjusted the tip.

A small hole-in-the-wall sushi spot in west village with quality sushi at reasonable prices. The basic rolls we tried were great and I'd come back to try more of the menu including their tuna crispy rice!

Unrelated to this place, I got Steven A's order and I'm Steven S so I had to get refunded and then reorder. Glad I did. Fast service and pretty yummy food. Let's dive in ...

Salmon Mango Roll (3/5): This roll is exactly what it said it would be -- salmon and mango. The salmon while bright in color, wasn't bursting with flavor and the mango I guess just isn't in season because it sadly was not sweet.

Phoenix Roll (5/5): This roll doesn't have rice and is wrapped in cucumber instead of seaweed so know what you're getting into. What carries this roll is the meaty mushroom and the delicious light brown sauce it's topped with. Mouth melting in flavor.

Spicy Tuna Roll (4/5): I like the little cucumber added to this for an added crunch. The mixture of spicy and tuna is okay -- not really spicy at all. If I order this again I'd ask for extra spicy for a little more bite.

Sakana San Shu Roll (4/5): For this price it was an steal to get 3 fish in here. The flavor was good but not the freshest best sushi fish -- but still tasty.

Cucumber Avocado Roll (5/5): This is my girlfriend's review here -- what you would expect from this roll and really fresh avo. They threw in mango upon request and didn't upcharge so automatic 5 for 5!

Avocado Tempura (5/5): Best part of this meal. The sauce is an UMAMI combination of sweet, spicy, and salty. The breading is light and perfectly coated.

Miso Soup (4/5): Standard miso soup. Good simple flavor but darker than other miso soup and I actually like this one more. I think with scallion green onion this would be a 5/5.

Wasabi (1/5): If you're going to call out the wasabi it was either really good or really bad. Unfortunately, this was not at all spicy plus was dry and flaky.

TL;DR: The fish sushi were alright here, but the non-fish pieces were my favorite parts. Automatic +1 in quarantine points so thus the 5 stars. Would order here again in the end.
We came in here for a small dinner and it was SO good. Small storefront you almost miss it, we actually did. I can't wait to go back. Pretty reasonably priced as well.

Great choice for sushi in the West Village. I came in for dinner with my girlfriend and her brother last night around 6:15. There were several tables available, but the place filled up over the next hour. If possible, I'd try to get here on the early side.

I used the Yelp check-in offer for the free sushi appetizer, and the chefs treated us well: three pieces each of two cuts of fish (salmon belly and... another one). The salmon belly was outstanding! I knew we were in for a treat.

Next, blistered shishito peppers, served in a delicious sauce. Good group appetizer choice. We followed that with the madai usuzukuri (red snapper in ponzu sauce), which was zesty and oh so fresh. The spicy tuna crispy rice is also as good as they say: give it a try!

One of the specials was a three tuna sushi sampler, which we split; I got the bluefin, and it was very tasty. Three pieces of unagi sushi followed: yum. Seeking yet more eel, we shared the Greenwich Roll. Lovely concept and execution, if a bit smaller than expected.

I could have kept eating, but we decided not to overindulge. I'll definitely come back again; sushi like this is a treasure. Thank you!

An absolutely amazing hole-in-the-wall spot that I still dream about! I was walking past with a friend one day and decided to stop in. The place itself is pretty tiny but not at all restricting. I was pleasantly surprised by the presentation and quality of the sushi, as well as the attentive service. Everything was gorgeous, fresh, and super affordable! Will definitely be back for more!

My favorite place for a casual sushi night in the WV! They have some tables for dine in but they are also great for takeout. Their fish is super fresh, I was very impressed considering the price. Their maki rolls are great but my favorite has to be their Zuke Toro roll.

This place was such a good find and I feel like it's actually a hidden gem that everyone should know about! My dad is in town and I was craving sushi (per usual when it's hot out), so I started researching good sushi restaurants in the village. The first two had four $$$$ and reservations that need to be made a month in advance. We got right in here and it was some of the best sushi I've had in quite some time! Very fresh. Friendly staff. Sake menu if that's your jam.

HOT TIP- if you check in while you're there (dinner only) you'll get a free chef special appetizer! We got four pieces of baby yellowtail.

My dad and I shared the sashimi platter, teriyaki salmon (comes with bok choy), and edamame. You also have your choice of white or brown rice. They also have the large glass bottles of San Pellegrino which is always a plus.

I'm excited to go back and try some of their rolls!
Sushi is pretty good, about 3/5 stars. Their portions of nigiri are pretty small. I dined in for lunch on an uncrowded day, and the service was just ok. Server doesn't seem to like her job very much.

Do not delay! Come visit Urban Vegan Kitchen when you want perfect vibes and unctuous comfort food.
Lots of NYC restaurants struggled through the first years of the pandemic, and the Vegans of NY (VONY) have miserably watched many of our favorites close.
So Partner and I were delighted to sit next to the open doors of fresh air on what was one of the last few warm late October nights. The DJ mix had us moving in our seats. The service was fast and warm, despite the busy Friday evening crowd. The non-alcoholic drinks were well worth the time of the friendly bartender- frosty and not too sweet!
My mac and cheese with southern seitan and broccoli satiated my cranky - hungry appetite and warmed me over with creamy comfort.
And in that moment- watching early Halloween costumed Villagers amble for the next pint, letting the breeze drift over our warmed tahini chocolate chip cookie and cold oat milk, moving our hips in our seats, I realized that this is why we love this town, and why we keep coming back to Urban Vegan Kitchen for more.

Urban Vegan Kitchen is an establishment on Carmine St. It is near West 4th Street, which is close to various hang-out spots, shops, and Washington Square Park. Urban Vegan Kitchen has both indoor and outdoor seating.  

Colorful, vibrant decor is all around w/ in their  2-Floor space in the form of cool artwork, wall pictures, in their seating arrangements, etc. They also have wooden flooring and some wooden tables.

Urban Vegan Kitchen has pictures of icons displayed on the walls. Prince, Elvis, James Brown, Miles Davis, Nina Simone, Aretha Franklin, Malcolm X, Stevie Wonder, Grace Jones, A Tribe Called Quest and so many more legends pictures are all dislayed.  Slogans like " Music is the Answer," "Love is Love" & "Akways Be Compassionate Never Be A Sucka" are also painted on the walls of this place. "Oldies But Goodies" are played at Urban Vegan Kitchen, and we were singing and dancing in our seats as we enjoyed our brunch.

The three of us had a nice brunch experience. Two of us ordered a  Belgian Waffle w/ Chick-Un in the form of Fried Seitan. This was my first time having Fried Seitan, and it definitely tasted like fried chicken. The Belgian Waffle was amazing. My other friend had a vegan burger w french fries. Two of us had cocktails that were good and well-prepared.

Website - urbanvegankitchen.com
Instagram - @urbanvegankitchen

Hours of Operation -
Mon. - Thurs. - Noon - 11pm
Fri. - Noon - Midnight
Sat. - 11am - Midnight
Sun. - 10am - 11pm.

One can go on the website to do things like make reservations via Resy, to purchase t-shirts w/ "vegan" slogans and to make donations to "Support & Feed" an organization that feeds people in need.

Speechless... The chili cheese fries were amazing, the rich boy and blt were scrumptious. I can't wait to go back!
AND CAN'T FORGET THE GINGER BEER CMONNNN

One of my favorite vegan spots in the city. The Mac and cheese and the Dirty Green Quesadilla are my go tos! The wings are an honorable mention as well! Staff is always friendly and upbeat. To top it off the entire place is decorated beautifully, always something to look at. Would definitely recommend stopping in for a meal.

First of all this place has limited seating upstairs but down stairs there is more tables.  The people who own and run the placecare super friendly  and helpful. Now the food. I would give this place 6vstars. The burger I consumed that had added bacon and another topping was super delicious. And I mean like a real arteriy clogging  burger. The BLT was tasty but the burger FORGET ABOUT IT. The food is super, not good, I said super. This whole food plant based food is worth the trip.  Also  the prices are decent.

So I'll give this place like a 3.8, I'd like to try more from their menu but I did like the restaurant. There's art all over the walls. I went on a Sunday at around 4:30pm. It wasn't packed at all but I get the idea that it's a really good time on like a Friday or Saturday evening. They played great music and the service was really good. The manager and server were attentive and helpful. I really enjoyed the buffalo switch wings, those were really good. I also got the chili cheese fries which were good and the oyster mushroom wings. Those were ok I feel like the batter and how it was fried could've been better. I've had better oyster mushroom wings. My cousin got the chili burger no chili lol but fair warning, if you don't eat Vegan food or have tried beyond burgers, this is not that. It's more of a mushroom bean burger with a mushier consistency and falls apart. The flavor itself wasn't bad, it was more so the consistency for her, if you're not used to that. I had the French toast and thoroughly enjoyed it, I recommend it and would absolutely get it again. The fruit was so fresh.

favorite vegan spot in NYC- their mac and cheese is SO good, the basement is so cool and love the decor. They have so many options, and all my meat eater friends loved it (even more than meat!)
Can't wait to go back

Eclectic interior design and ample indoor seating. Service was slower than typical.

Order your dishes through mobile and the hostess comes over to confirm. Choose between paying at the beginning or opening a tab and paying at the end.

I ordered the breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was quite small. I finished it in less than 10 bites. While parts were tasty, the tofu in the sandwich was SO SALTY that I was not able to drink enough water to satiate my thirst afterwards and that was the overwhelming taste. The fries were also really salty.
The drinks were amazing. I love the great selection of mocktails. We tried the libra, it was excellent.

Each time I come here, I like it better than the last. Currently my favorite dishes are the coconut shrimp and the po' boy with fries, but I have a lot of fun exploring the menu as well. They're nice here and the atmosphere is good too. Worth a visit for sure, and I guarantee that if you get the po' boy you won't be disappointed.

The actual chicken and waffles were good. But I didn't like the sauce on the side and the syrup was watery and  had a weird after taste. I just added ketchup. I wasn't super hungry. So I  took half of the meal home and used my Mrs. Butter worth's and it was  perfect! The food took a very long time to come out. But our server was amazing. And the vibes were good, ambiance was very, very nice.

This place was pretty cool . I love the interior design . I also loved the fact that you can do your order online pay and everything and you can keep your tap open too if you want more items that was pretty dope . I got the Korean  bbq wings they were really nice I got them extra crispy . The sauce was really nice . I also had the impossible burger and got onions rings instead of fries . It was a extra 2 bucks but it was only 4 big onion rings and I felt the batter could have been better seasoned . But it was good and the crunch was on point . The burger was a impossible burger but there was a nice sauce on it that I really enjoyed . I want to come back and try something else because what I got wasn't nothing special . Also make reservations , it's just easier to be seated that way

Tried this vegan place and went for outdoor seating. There is a heater on top and you can adjust the heat settings as desired. Ordered the Chick-Un and Waffles, Buffalo Cauliflower Bites, Classic BLT. First time trying southern fried seitan as a non vegetarian/vegan and the texture was similar to real chicken. Cauliflower bites was coated with buffalo sauce and still crispy after awhile. Regarding the service, not sure if it was because my friend and I sat outdoors but no one really came to check on us or refilled our water. That was the reason I would give this place a lower rating. Other than that, food was great.

In a nutshell: Satisfying Vegan comfort food with very amiable service and colorful drinks!

THE GOOD
You always can find a seat, I've come at different times and even large group's always can find room. You can place the order yourself by scanning the menu, adding your credit/debit card, and picking from the menu. I've grown accustomed to that in some restaurants but, unless you have questions, the interaction with your server will be minimal which might or not be a plus for you. I will say my waiter tonight has always come with a smile and enthusiasm and even if we haven't chatted as much, I appreciate it even more. On my way in and back to the bathroom, the staff is always very courteous and always with a smile, a real one, not like in other places.

THE BEST
Try the mac and cheese, I had the salmon last time and the flavor and texture were on point. In a blind taste, I would challenge anyone to try this "cheese" dish and find out it's actually plant-based. The drinks... Perhaps was tonight's bartender but the drinks (The first, I ordered with Patron, and the second one with Don Julio) were kind of the weaker side, if I were you skip the cocktails and order wine or beer (Haven't had those myself but I reckon its a safer bet since bypasses the bartender) but by no means bad, just average you know? The ambiance is quite relaxed, very mixed crowd, it is a place not so much to immerse yourself but to socialize with friends or on a date, the music playlist is a take-it-or-leave-it situation. If you want Vegan comfort food that actually tastes like your good home-cooked well-seasoned ones, come here and treat yourself. LEAVE YOUR BELT AT HOME

First time coming here and biggest reason was because they were vegan. One of my good friends is vegan, and we try to find places that can accommodate her diet.  Also big surprise was that this was right by the water. Even on a terrible day (huge windstorm and rain), we made it and were seated soon (with reservation).

We ordered a number of pizzas, nachos, and other plates to share.

PROS:
- pizzas were great size
- nice even amount of cheese, including vegan cheese
- nachos were generously topped (nothing worse than stingy tacos).
CONS:
- the lighting sucked. It was SO dark, I wasn't sure what I was eating.
- a little bit too loud, this was for my birthday dinner and I lost my voice because i had to shout for my friends to hear.

Would I come here again? Probably in the summer on a good day so we can do it outside in nice weather by the water. Definitely not indoors though :)

Amazing service! Love the variety of food choices.  Vegan food can be limiting.  The coconut shrimp had us questioning if they were trying to sneak some real shrimp in.  But it's all vegan!  They don't use a lot of soy or "beyond" meat, which is great!  And the service is always amazing, No matter the day or time!  The atmosphere is chill and retro.  A great place to chill and eat delicious vegan food. (For the record, I'm not 100% vegan and the quality of the food is on point!)

My friend is vegan so we're always looking for new good vegan restaurants to try. We've been to Blossom before and really enjoyed it. Since this restaurant is by the same folks, we decided to give it a try. The restaurants are 2 totally different vibes--which is fine--but also the food is notably better at Blossom.

The tostada was good... but not filling. The brussell sprouts were greasy (I've had way better). The mocktail was bitter (how does agave, lavender, orange, pineapple, and hibiscus result in anything other than a fruity sweet drink?). We had the black and blue pie for dessert. We waited for quite some time while they warmed it, yet it still came out cold. At that point, I was just ready to go. We ate it, but neither of us felt it was anything special.

After spending $70 plus tip, both my friend and I were still left hungry. Afterwards, we went to the Shake Shack down the street.  For a tenth of the price we actually felt satisfied!

Also, I personally wasn't a fan of the ambiance although my friend was. We had made a reservation for two and when we got there the only table available was in the basement in the corner against the wall. You have to view the menu and order through the app, but the poor reception in the basement made that experience cumbersome.

I'm not particularly claustrophobic, but it felt crowded. Downstairs was dark. And it didn't help that there was a large party right next to us that was really rambunctious. I'm not knocking them: they came to have a good time so that's great for them. I'm just noting that the whole setup wasn't really conducive to my own enjoyment of the experience.

This place exceeded our expectations by a mile! My partner and I were in town for a weekend and wanted to visit a Black owned vegan restaurant so se swung by for lunch. We made a reservation at lunchtime on a Saturday. We were instantly greeted with a warm welcome from the staff and shown to our table.
I loved the fact that I didn't have a waiter hovering over me, and I could just choose and order from their (expansive) menu via the QR code. Everything we had was fantastic, from the cocktail (Gin Around The World) and Prosecco, to our food. We ordered the Mac & cheese with seitan bacon, cauliflower Buffalo wings, and seasoned fries. It came out quickly and tasted incredible.  As soon as I took my last bite someone was there to clear my plate as if I were in a fancy restaurant.

The prices, service, art, music, food, drinks were all five star quality. We will DEFINITELY be back.

Great service!  The host was a whole snack too (find me boo!) Awesome food, and drinks.  You can tell they take pride in their work and all they pour into their creations.  I will definitely back!

Highly recommend:

Match matcha matcha
Buffalo cauliflower bites
Mac n chz with broccoli

Urban Vegan Kitchen is a hip eatery in the West Village that has the kindest staff and the most delicious vegan comfort food.
You will be sat and greeted by one of the lovely servers but all orders are placed online once you sit at the table-although I am usually not fond of this method (many restaurants that use this often lose that interaction/customer service factor-not the case here), UVK did a great job with this practice: the method kept things rolling and the service was still top tier.
The menu has so many incredible options it can be overwhelming. The drinks are delicious to start, and I really enjoyed their UVK Margarita. For food, you can't skip their Chili Cheese Fries or their famous Chick'n and Waffles. I also really enjoyed their "build a bowl" option, which allows you to try a few of their different favorites-PERFECT for those who want to try everything. The Mac and Cheese, Brussels, and Wings are all things you can add that you'll want to order. UVK was an absolute genius for blessing us with this "sampler" option: NEVER take it off the menu, I beg you!
Everything is delicious and flavorful and the portions are great as well. To make things even better, everyone that I encountered on my visit was friendly and helpful. We were greeted by the sweetest young lady who had an incredible personality-she "passed the torch over" to another waiter who was also awesome, and all those who I passed on the way to the restroom or asked for extra sauces and etc were just wonderful.
I can't wait to come back to UVK!

- tables available on a Saturday afternoon in the summer
- goofy soundtrack
- fantastic decor
- drinks are strong
- drinks are inventive and prettily made
- perfect service
- mushroom quesadilla was bomb
- I did not like the fried 'chicken'
- coconut shrimp was good
- waffle was amaznig
- Mac n cheese was alright
I wanted one of everything. The Korean ribs were amazing. Got the buffalo tofu sando to take on the plane- it was great as well.

Food was good. Everything came out piping hot. Freshly made. My date ordered a burger. I ordered the kale quesadilla and the Vegan macit was good. The Uvk Quarter Pounder and fries. Fries were delish. The burger needed more seasoning. But good. No beyond meat. So we liked that. Service was great. Sat down right away. No wait ambiance was chill Dj was jamming. They even have a bar. I had a shot of tequila while I waited for my meal. Would visit again.
Great vibe ...good food...different style of ordering ...scan QR code and then put your order online ....service great ...tasty food as well ...check it out without a doubt

As a Los Angeles native, I grew up enjoying the melting pots of everyone's Soul Food... so, my tastebuds are well versed... Urban Vegan Kitchen's take on foods makes me long for some of the ethnic comfort foods I enjoyed as my youth... but this isn't about all that... this is about their Onion Rings...

Astro Burger in West Hollywood is famous for their onion rings... similar to Randy's Doughnuts... the Onion Rings were the gold standard... and I've eaten these golden halos of delight for over 40 years!

UVK finally has dethroned Astro, except I'd have to come to NY to enjoy these delicious, crunchy, battered just perfectly (where it doesn't come off on your fingers, or the onion) well balanced flavors (that are just off the chain!!!)

Now, the UVK mushroom burger, a total experience...
The Mississippi Mud Pie... would give NOLA a run for their money! All that was missing was the creole salted coffee...

Seriously, UVK is all that... and you need to try it, especially those perfect onion rings!

So delicious. We enjoyed everything we had.
It was a little unique not having a dedicated waiter for the cost of the food. You order everything on the app and start a tab. The waiter we had was very nice, but we didn't really get to ask any questions about the menu, which would have been kind of nice. We did get to ask questions about the drinks. The drinks were unique and delicious. Matcha Matcha Matcha for the win!

I love that you can order & pay through your phone!!! No splitting checks required. The staff is extremely attentive and personable.

I am picky about French toast and loved mine. I don't normally like Mac n cheese but theirs is easily top 1-2 I've had vegan or not.

The tofu scramble and tempeh bacon was fine. The shiitake mushroom was okay. I didn't like the souther fried chicken at all.

My 11yo sister ate half her waffle, all the fruit, and took the rest home. A rare feat!

My step mom loved the breakfast sandwich, which the staff recommended to her as an omnivore who isn't interested in faux burgers etc.

The drip coffee is superb. They offer soy and oat milk.

Had a great experience. Food was deleicious. Had Buffalo wings- empanada mac &cheede !
Was a treat from eating the same basics everyday. Service great, staff were friendly .
Price is not bad comparing going out to eat anywhere else UKV margarita was good made with lime and lemon instead of mixer. Would recommend that one

Ordered from Urban Vegan kitchen in The Bronx. Portions are very small for the price. 12.00 for 7 small balls of cauliflower?? I was shocked when I opened the box. I thought the Uber driver may have eaten some of my cauliflower. Kids get more than that in a kids meal at other restaurants. Then on top of that if u want condiments u are charged for it nowadays. I paid 1.00 for hot sauce that I didn't use up bcos all I needed was a few sprinkles. Is this  business hurting so bad that they have to skimp on portions and charge increased prices for a entree that won't even fill a hole in your belly?? I love to support black owned restaurants but I do notice the higher priced meals for smaller portions. This has been the case at every vegan black owned restaurant I have visited thus far. So sad to say but true! Its time to start making my own vegan food. Oh and I must add that I will never order from this place again. I should've read the reviews first. BTW...Beyond sushi has better tasting fried cauliflower and the portion is filled to the container and I'm happy with paying the 17.00 they charge bcos they fill up the brown container and if u ask for additional condiments nicely they won't charge you for it. The only reason I didn't order from there is bcos they were too far from where I'm working for delivery.

A vegetarian friend of mine was in town and she wanted to check out Urban Vegan Kitchen - I had no expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised! We stopped by for brunch on a Saturday and there was a decent amount of people, but we didn't have to wait and were seated inside. The interior was really cool with graffiti and photos all over the walls. We got chili, Mac and cheese, and buffalo cauliflower bites - all tasted great! We also ordered the wing flight but it seems like it was forgotten because after we finished everything, we checked in with them on the order and they brought it out much later; for me, it was an interesting texture (of course given that it's seitan) but other than that, it was good and the dipping sauces were tasty!

Best waffle I've had in my life, amazing mocktails, wonderful service from the sweetest server (Adrielle,) I would eat this every day of my life if given the opportunity. I dreamt about this waffle last night. It's that good. Ambiance was so lovely and cozy!
I just wanted to update my food poisoning situation- I was bedridden and had the worst food poisoning of my life for FOUR DAYS after eating here. Beware!!!!
Not 1 complaint. I'm not vegan but was extremely satisfied with all the options and dishes I ordered.  My Mezcal Margarita was great also.

Came here a few months ago with a couple nonvegan friends, trying to convince them to branch out a bit.

Urban Vegan Kitchen is billed as a restaurant serving southern comfort food, but all vegan! Had been on my list for 6 months, so glad we finally got a chance.

Ambience: casual/hipster
When you walk in, the first thing you undoubtedly notice is the decor - tons and tons of graffiti and murals...really cool set up. There are two floors to this place - the upper being a little louder and for smaller groups and the lower seemingly for larger groups (but somehow still a little quieter)

Service: took a mark off here. All of the ordering is done off their website. At a bar, this makes sense to me, but a restaurant? Feels entirely too impersonal and we had trouble asking questions about the menu. Food also came out super staggered as a result...just didn't sit well with me.

Food:
We started with the buffalo cauliflower bites - super savory and had enough crunch to keep it interesting. Wasn't a huge fan of the vegan ranch, but honestly vegan ranch is pretty hard to pull off well. We ended up splitting parts of the chik'un & waffles, which if you've never had chicken & waffles before (me) was a pretty interesting sweet/salty combination and the po' boy which was a classic and a goodie if you're a sucker for fried seitan like me.

Good for casual dining but service leaves a lot to be desired

Was very impressed. Im not a fan of Vegan impersonation food, i think it takes away from the true identity of food (but that's another discussion lol) nonetheless they do it well.
The Seitan is to die for. We had the korean wings to start which was more like a hot bbq but it was splendid. Had the Richboy - it had avocado, seitan, special sauce and pickles. I was full and couldn't stop eating it. The fries were underwhelming.
The vegan coquito with rum was also on point.
I also appreciate the menu and ordering system (you can order everything on your phone) makes it very seamless.

As a lifelong meat fan, I sincerely have to tip my hat to the folks here at UVK. I came here quasi-reluctantly at the behest of a date who was vegan. She knows that I, as an original southerner, have a DEEP affinity for the franchise commonly known as Waffle House, so she promised to introduce me to a vegan spot that could go toe-to-toe with them.

And damn if she wasn't (almost) right! If I hadn't known I would have sworn their "chicken and waffles" was the real thing, or at least a very delicious dark meat subsitute. The portions were also plentiful and satisfying. She had the lasagna, which I sampled, and was also great. If I lived closer I would definitely be a much more frequent customer, and can't recommend it highly enough.

Go here fam.

Super fun and cool place!  Tons of art and paintings on the walls and this place is bigger than it looks from the outside.  This was my first time trying vegan food and I was pleasantly surprised with all the flavors.  UVK also has a huge menu so you will be sure to find something you'll enjoy here.  I also definitely recommend getting a cocktail here with your meal; the drinks ROCK! The staff was really friendly and were very helpful in helping me choose their top few menu items to try for my first vegan meal experience!

A cute establishment! Cozy inside with nice music, outdoor heating pretty good as well (not cold when we sit outside). Pay & order is completely online/digital -- makes splitting the bill easy. Service is super great as well, the staff is very friendly :)

Fries tasted good, impossible burger had a nice horseradish sauce, and their brussel sprouts were pretty good as well. I personally wasn't a big fan of the korean bbq / cauliflower buffalo bites though!

I was looking forward to enjoying great conversation and food with my plant based friends group at a new spot for us in the city. It was a long Friday, and after the torrential rains during rush hour, I was hoping they also had good drinks. We dined downstairs and the vibe was cozy and eclectic. The art on the walls was vibrant and the range of music from 70s up set the tone for a great time.

We shared the Buffalo cauliflower. Great choice! Spicy and not greasy. My Brussel sprouts came out next. I love Brussel sprouts and usually make them with brown sugar. They used maple syrup, and oh my! I could've inhaled an entire trough of those Brussel sprouts. My main entree were the Korean BBQ wings. This was a total risk as I've never tried Seitan. I was so nervous until I took the first bite. They actually tasted like BBQ ribs and had a good firmness to cut. Oh my Lord!!! The BBQ sauce was on point and the additional dipping sauce was the perfect creamy compliment. I should've placed a second order, but I wanted to enjoy my drink and dessert. My beverage of choice was To Kill A Sunrise with a shot of Illegal Mezcal. Smoky deliciousness! For dessert, I savored the warmed Chocolate Tahini cookie. I've tried this delight in other places yet this was my favorite by far. Warm, gooey with the perfect hint of tahini. Bravo!!!!
I guess im vegan full time now the way this place was amazing. The food, atmosphere and people were wonderful. Definitely coming here more often

AMAZINGGGGGG. The chicken and waffles were HEAVENLYYYYYY. The waitstaff was so nice and provided great service with an even better ambiance! I loved all the posters on the walls and the menu curation was 10/10! Would recommend to everyone, including non-vegans!!

I had SUCH a lovely experience here. We sat outside and the fans were great, really kept us cool and enjoying the evening. Then, the waiter was so kind and funny! - usually at restaurants where you order through phone they are not attentive or come back to check on you barely at all, but here it was the complete opposite. They were very on top of checking in, refilling water, offering if we need anything, and being super kind/charming!

The food was also great. I wasn't too hungry so I got the salad and it was veryyy good, and my non-vegan (and never eats vegan) friend got the burger and said it was "really good!" Also had a margarita with mezcal (love that they offer that) which was decent!

Would definitely love to come back and try more!

We'll get yourself ready for some comfort food y'all. Some Mac that will blow your mind. Cocktails that are strong and flavorful. Food that will leave you in a coma from not being able to stop eating!!

First off, Sunday brunch is my favorite meal. Feed me all the brunch every day. My husband really wanted the Mac n cheese with mushroom bacun but I haven't had Mac since I was vegan, aside from a meal delivery made by a vegan chef, that I liked. The table next to us was enjoying some and I asked and they said it was their absolute favorite item. So I caved in. We enjoyed some cocktails, and then the Mac. WOW. I was blown away. Cheesy. Check. Flavorful. Check. Didn't just taste like a pile of Nooch check. Perfectly cooked pasta check. And the bacun. Wowsa. Absolutely everything about the Mac was perfection. So so good.

Now I had a super hankering for a burger so the Super Dope burger it was for me. And yes it was super dope. I can't do "vegan replacement meats" so I chose this since it had the roasted mushroom barley patty, then cashew cheese sauce, sour cream, pickled jalapeno, Dijon mayo, and chili. Wow. Super Dope flavor. Super Dope spice. Really good flavorful and filling burger.

My husband loved his Po' boy. Fried to perfection, spices and seasoned well and exactly what he wanted.

I also have to say, the margarita was one of the best I've ever had. And I'm very picky on my margaritas! Great brunch!
Delicious food and very nice & friendly staff. My not vegan wife & son loved their food also. Would go back next time I'm in the city.

Love this place. They have fantastic vegan comfort food, fun drinks, cute space, and everyone who works here is really nice. I'm addicted to the Chickn ranch salad - but I liked everything I've ever tried here.

Holy macaroni! SO incredibly surprised at how incredibly good this food is. I was a little worried that the food would be underwhelming but boy was I wrong. Okay so first of all, when you go in, you can open a tab on their app and order online. They still have servers but this is a little unique to other places. Second of all, the food comes out very fast.
We got the cauliflower buffalo wings, crispy brussel sprouts, Korean bbq wings, an the mac and cheese. We finished off with getting the mud pie for dessert. Everything was really great! Buffalo wings were tasty, the Korean wings were really yummy and the mac and cheese blew me away. As someone who has tried and failed to make vegan mac and cheese at home, I was quite humbled as how good it was!

I wont lie, it's a little on the pricey side but considering how good and quick everything was, I think the prices are fair. Would definitely recommend UVK to anyone.

Finally got to try this vegan comfort food place. We had the Korean bbq wings, chick-un & waffles, and super Mario quesadilla. Everything was solid and delicious. I really like the texture of the bbq wings and chick-un made from seitan. It's tender and mochi like which was great. They also made the waffles extra crispy to my preference. The waffle was only slightly sweet which is good as that keeps the dish more on the savory side and balanced flavor. Loved the garlic kale on top of the waffles and quesadilla. The super Mario quesadilla was mushroom based which I live and they definitely packed a lot of mushrooms. Definitely wanna come back to try other things (just be ready for the high calories!).

Ordered the BLT and mac and cheese with tempeh bacon (an add-on). The BLT wasn't bad, but to be fair I did get it delivered so it would probably be better at the restaurant. The mac and cheese was really good, maybe one of the better vegan ones I've tried. The bacon wasn't a necessary add on, it would've been good on its own. I only wish they hadn't added the breadcrumbs so it would've been more on the cheesy/gooey side, but still would order this again.

We made reservations a week before.I loved the urban decor walking in. The host greeted us and and we were seated. We ordered the Korean bbq wings, Mac and cheese, fries and chicken and waffles. Every single dish was mouth watering!. I had a couple of UVK subways and they were perfection! It was my comai's bday and they sang and brought out a dessert with a candle. It was awesome! I will definitely come back and I'm not even vegan. The food, customer service, drinks and the music  were that good! Fantastic job UVK!

There are weeks when I will have the Chick-un avocado ranch salad two to three times, it's the perfect blend of healthy and vegan indulgence! The chick-un and waffles and chili are runners up. Friendly staff and the space is great, also nice that it's open late on weekends.

This place, the food, the people, and the vibes are everything! Came here for a casual Tuesday night dinner and got seated immediately. They're extremely helpful with recommendations and we definitely took them since it was our first ever Georgian meal.

Recommendations: the Chanakhi is this amazing lamb and eggplant stew that perfect for splitting. Definitely get their famous soup dumplings and a Georgian salad is the perfect refreshing side.

Also, if you like Orange wine, they have an extensive list which I thought was impressive.

Under-the-radar Georgian spot with lovely minimalist decor that somehow avoided the restaurant price mark-up of both the NYC Georgian cuisine boom and the pandemic. That alone should warrant four stars!

But also, the food is quite good.

The Lobiani is huge, cheesy, carby, and beany--absolutely delicious. The Adjaruli Khachapuri was a tad salty, but otherwise perfectly done. The Chanakhi was a perfect stew, while the beef and lamb Khinkali were both bursting with broth and flavor.

I made the mistake of getting the Honey Cake for the table, and remembered one bite in that I don't actually like Georgian honey cake that much (too dry)--but Ubani says theirs is made in-house, so that's something, right?

Drink-wise, there's plenty of that Georgian amber wine to choose from at affordable prices of $14-16 per glass.

Here we go again... another New York City thievery. Be sure to take a picture of your check once you sign it because the tip amount will be adjusted for you.

That's how things are done in New York these days. Waiters take matters into their own hands. Decide for you about the quality of service they provided. Pure garbage. I of course reported them for fraud with the credit card company because no matter how you want to look at this, it's stealing.

As for the food, blah. There's a dozen other Georgian places in NYC you can eat and wouldn't know the difference.

I was at this Georgian spot with a bunch of others a while back. The service was fine and appeared pretty impatient with another group who came in. The food here was alright and the ambiance was well a coffee shop. I'm not exactly sure why the average here is so high but this is also the neighborhood where Old Tblisi Garden is very high rated so I digress (then again that spot is better than this one which isn't saying much.) To drink I had a glass of one of the Kvevri/Qvevri. Kvevri refers to an ancient Georgian preparation of usually orange/skin contact wine and I tend to like the majority as they tend to have some minerality.

From the Appetizers & Salads section, we got a few dishes.

The Georgian Salad With Walnuts had tomato & cucumber salad, fresh herbs, walnuts, and homemade cheese sulguni and it was $12. The walnut sauce here was lighter than most other spots not having nearly as much garlic and it seemed sparse. The portion size was decent but I found the flavors bland and it was still one of the better dishes.

The Beet Salad With Goat Cheese with marinated beets with raspberry cilantro sauce served on a corn bread topped with goat cheese for $14 was also alright. The presentation was nice and the goat cheese was fresh with there also being a lot of beets. The dressing was a tad sweet and I didn't mind that it was sparse. The flavors were fine but it was just from the mix and not from preparation.

When in a Georgian spot, you order baked goods and that's usually Khachapuri and for most people that is the Adjaruli variant. Our host ordered the traditional version ($14) as well as one with spinach (which is a buck more.) Both refer to a boat shaped pie with blended cheese and a raw egg with some butter you mix it all together while the cheese is hot. The cheese is a mix of sulguni and imeruli and as per usual it is a delicious salty dish. It was a bit small but well flavored but I heavily prefer the one at the pretty close Cafedelia. The spinach one was decent.

We got a couple main dishes. My favorite of the bunch by a mile was the Veal Chakapuli for $17 consisting of organic, grass-fed veal slow cooked with tarragon, sour plum, scallions, parsley, cilantro, and white wine. The meat inside was tender and there was plenty of it with a good soup base as well. I always like the sourness of this dish and this one didn't disappoint.

The Khinkali are the Georgian equivalent of soup dumplings and there's a minimum of three orders (with each order being $3.50 available with either meat or cheese. As per the other dishes, this was alright and a bit bland. I found the filling more sparse and the meat wasn't as well flavored and the dough was a bit too thick even for this dish.

Our final dish was the worst of the bunch. The Quail with Berry Sauce for $18 consisted of a single pan-fried quail with an alright sauce which I think was blackberry based. The sauce was decent and the accompanying salad was nice but the quail was very dry being overcooked and was tiny. I wouldn't recommend it at all being smaller than most of the appetizers and just not prepared well.

I'm not sure if it was an off night or something but I disagree with virtually every review here. I love Georgian food and there are plenty good Georgian spots in the city but almost nothing here was good outside of the Chakapuli. Everything was either overcooked or bland. For the same prices or less, there are several better Georgian spots and I don't mind paying a bit much for much better Georgian food. Low 2.

Had a really nice time at this place! It's a super cute, intimate vibe and all of the staff are really nice.

We had the khinkali, which were awesome! Much larger than imagined. We also had the mushrooms and the cauliflower with walnut sauce - both were great and the presentation was on point. Finally, we had the Cornish hen with berry sauce, which was unexpected to see on the menu and nice.

We also tried the qvivri wine - interesting and fun to try, especially if you like orange wine.

Only suggestion would be more attentive service, but it was a Thursday night and busy.

Best dinner of my life! The dishes were colorful, fresh, and packed with flavor. The staff was very kind and informative on all the details of Georgian dishes. The wine menu was extensive and the restaurant was lovely. I can't wait to return!
Georgian is always good as long as it kept authentic. I also don't write memoirs about food I eat. So go and check it out, good Georgian spot!

Delicious introduction to Georgian food. Service was friendly and attentive and the food arrived promptly. They have outdoor seating with around 2-3 tables with a heated lamp if needed.

Georgian Salad with Walnuts (9/10): Very flavorful, salad coated generously with a curry-like finish. Great summer staple. A little too sweet for my liking.

Veal stew (6/10): nothing stand out

Khachapuri (8/10): carb heaven

Khingali (7/10): Dough was a little too soft/over cooked, also hard to eat due to the soup inside

Small Georgian restaurant that had terrible service when I came here with my GF

We split their cheeseboat and chicken dish, and they were very tasty, but the servers did not ever refill either of our water's or check in on us, and we eventually even had to go into the back of the restaurant and find a server in order to get our check. The cherry on top was the fact that when they finally brought us our checks, the guy who did then left out of the front door (never to be seen again...) but he did not bring a pen with the check, so I therefore had to go back into the back of the restaurant and find a pen for myself.

Cheeseboats are apparently the hot new thing in the city. But this restaurant is a MUST TRY for Georgian food!

You know it's real when all the servers are Georgian and speak proudly about how the menu and wine list represent their country and culture.

The Georgian salad is a must. It has the freshest tomatoes and cucumbers I've ever had. Tossed in the classic Georgian walnut sauce. My dad doesn't like tomatoes but couldn't stop eating.

Also the star of the show is the cheeseboat (kachipuri). It's freshly baked warm bread formed into a boat with four kinds of melted Georgian cheeses. Then the server puts butter and cracks an egg into it. The warm cheese cooks the egg and forms the yummiest cheese bread. So rich.

Warning that the walnut chicken is served cold but in the same walnut sauce as the salad above. Recommend the salad and getting a different chicken to diversify tastes.

Cozy comfy cafe that was perfect on a rainy day!

From pictures alone, I imagined the place would be tiny, but the interior was actually quite roomy. There was even outdoor seating. The service was impeccable. We were initially outdoors at first, and the workers often checked up on us to make sure we were comfortable.

The food came super quick! The Adjaruli Khachapuri ($16) had a poached egg in the middle initially, but it is quickly mixed in by the server, so make sure to be ready! The kachapuri was unlike the one I had previously. This had a way less tougher bread, and had a different cheese. It tasted less like a tomato-less pizza, but more like a super cheesy bread! The cheese is super solid, so it will not spill over, trust.

The Cauliflower with Walnut Sauce ($18) was a table favorite. Simple yet delicious is always a clear winner. At first, the cauliflower may look like it was just dumped onto the plate and handed to you. But once you take a bite of it in the sauce, and ooh grab that piece of raspberry while you're at it, you are in for a savory yet tart and sweet flavor trip. I need that sauce whenever I eat cauliflower now.

The Chashushuli, or Beef Stew ($25), was recommended by the worker. It was a wonderful warm and hearty entree, perfect in heating up your body as it was still piping hot in its clay pot. The slow cooked beef was dry, with most of its taste transferred into the sauce. Not bad, but nothing special.

The Khinkali ($10.50) though, that's what I'm talking about. Another runner-up for the the simple yet so good award, this is a must try! Not only did eating the dumpling from the handles make them fun to eat, but the skin!! The skin was unlike any skin I had before: baby skin smooth and soft. The inside was meat with a black pepper taste and some sauce. You can add in extra pepper if you wish.

With amazing service, and fast, delicious, and abundant food options, Cafe Ubani needs to be in your bookmarks.

I had this place bookmarked for a while and was happy this place lived to expectations (or was beyond expectations in a good way!) Recommend coming here for a try of Georgian food :)

Arriving around 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon with my friends, I wasn't expecting this tiny cafe tucked deep in West Village to be a full house. I think there are about 6 tables indoors and 3 tables outsides. We sat outside initially but after noticing an empty table, we decided to switch indoors before our food was served. It was not so stuffy with the door left open.

We got the Adjaruli Khachapuri, Cauliflower with Walnut Sauce, Chashushuli, and the Khinkali.

The Adjaruli Khachapuri or Cheese boat tasted like popcorn with butter mixed in with the cheese. The cheese was mixed, can't put a finger on what cheeses they used. I was surprised by the different taste despite the similar appearance based on my (one-time) prior cheese boat experience.

The Cauliflower with Walnut sauce was a hidden gem. I didn't expect such a simple name dish to have such delicious flavors. Best dish of the meal! What is walnut sauce exactly?? Whatever it is, it made us magically devour the whole flower plant (minus the leaves).

The Chashushuli or equivalent beef stew came bubbling hot with a side of bread. Very tomato-y

The Khinkali, a serving of 3 huge dumplings, was scrumptious as well! Clean your hands cause the scrunched-up tip is your handle to eat it. There is soup and a decent ball of seasoned meat inside. The best part has to be the skin with a balanced width and how darn smooth and velvety the texture of it is.

The waiters were awesome in accommodating us the whole time and giving us recommendations accordingly. It was a comfortable and relaxing lunch with nice jazz music playing.

Solid and hearty food - can't go wrong with this cozy lil Georgian cafe. Khachapuri is always a must and always HITS like no other. I thought the khinkali was better than other Georgian places I've had bc juicier and bigger but personally still not a fan of this dish in general. We also tried chanakhi (lamb stew) bc server recommended it and it was good. Nothing particularly unique but it was great on a cold day and all the meat and veg were super tender and flavorful. Prices are kinda typical for this area of NYC aka a bit pricey for the portions but I'm used to it now tbh.

Had a matcha latte here during the day on another occasion and wouldn't recommend it - it tasted like straight up soy milk (despite ordering oat milk) and couldn't taste the matcha at all.

This is a delicious cozy spot. I love this place so much I've come back twice in two months already. Everything we tried was so good. I've tried the pomegranate cocktail, orange wine, and the Georgian lemonade which are all sweet and fruity. For food the Georgian salad has a fun curry flavor with some fruit mixed in. Our collective favorite was the cheeseboat with 3 cheeses mixed in. The beef Khinkali were also delicious. It came out last and we were pretty full already so we had trouble finishing it since they are huge. The pork ribs were dry on their own but delicious with the green sauce. Finally their service was so kind, they did not rush us out after finishing our meal and we were able to continue enjoying the place for a while.

I've been wanting to try this place for a while, tried walking in once but was turned away because I didn't have a reservation. So I attempted again but this time with a reservation, which you can only make by phone. Arrived on a Friday at 6 pm to find the restaurant kind of empty, but it slowly filled up as people trickled in for dinner. The restaurant itself is pretty small and had an outdoor dining area. Walls were exposed brick with some prints taped onto it. But the table settings and the dishware used was really nice! I split the dishes with a friend, tried the Georgian lemonade and the honey cake. I really liked the walnut salad, which didn't actually have chunks of walnut but the walnut was hidden in the creamy dressing. Quite refreshing for a hot day. The Khinkali dumplings were satisfying, quite massive and definitely tasted more meaty than I expected. My favorite was probably the honey cake, it was multi layered dough topped with powdered sugar. Not too sweet and had a bit of a nutty flavor. Nice palate cleanser to end the meal. Service was nice, we had large plates and table real estate was quite the hot commodity. The staff made sure that our tables were cleared ASAP. Also, we didn't get rushed out of the restaurant which was pleasantly surprising for NYC.

Worth the hype!!!
Best Georgian food I've ever had (and I've been to Georgia).
Great pesto salad w homemade cheese, best hachipuri, great khincali, delicious Georgian wine.
Deserts too (skip the Pavlova) have the Georgian desert (forgot what it's called).
Excellent service and nice vibes.

We went with my girlfriend to Urbani in Brooklyn on Monday 8/7/23. Ordered Georgian salad with walnuts and salmon kebabs... The salad was amazing ! Salmon kebabs were also delicious... the best part was the waiters,  one of them as we find out was the owner of the restaurant!  They also have enclosed outdoors space at the back of the restaurant, very cosy. Almost forgot about the wine: we drink Kisi wine, very nice
We absolutely loved it!

The cheese pie is amazing! Definitely not calorie free, but wow!  The taste of quality cheese and butter is so good. I would opt for this over pizza . Mushrooms and veggies had a wonderful, mild spice. Just right mixed with red and green peppers.
There were just 2 of us and this was enough food. We even took home some of the cheese bread.
I had a dark red wine, not sure which one, but i hope I can order again. My bf had a coke, made in Georgia!
I loved the interior and ambiance. Painted brick walls with small art. Just a nice, classic, comfortable space.

Cauliflower with Walnut Sauce - was a bit single flavor heavy on the spice. Tasted walnut crunch a bit but not much on flavor.

Veal Stew - tasty but not wow-ed. Small bowl served with dry bread.

Expected more due to the high review...

I'm not sure khachapuri is what immediately comes to mind as light cafe fare to pare with an iced coffee, but somehow it works at Cafe Ubani. I had the adjaruli khachapuri (the typical breadboat variety) with mint mixed in, which added a nice bit of freshness to an otherwise very cheesy, very bready meal.

The cafe itself offers airy environs on a quaint West Village side street. Highly recommend for a casual brunch.

A very interesting new experience! I've never had Georgian food before so I had no idea what to expect but everything was delicious!

I recommend the Adjaruli Khachapuri (you can't go wrong with bread butter and cheese!), the Chanakhi (lamb stew very tender and savory) and the honey cake (a bit dry but very tasty)

Run, do not walk to this place.
I love Georgian food, and this restaurant serves superb dishes.
We had khachapuri and khinkali. Google hot to eat khinkali correctly so you do not miss even the stop of salty lamb broth inside!
Georgian salad with walnuts had dressing that tasted of coriander and sun.

If you like pickles, get the pickle plates. Sauerkraut with pickled beets will rejuvenate your palate. There were also tasty little yellow peppers and pickled flowers.
Adjarulu dessert khachapuri is a delightful interpretation of the savory dish. It feeds three.
The dough was crispy, flaky, and light. The center was filled with smooth pastry cream and berries. It was baked to order.

The place is light and has many cute touches. The service was attentive.

The food is very good here. It's flavorful and light. We ate what seemed like a little but it was a lot and not heavy. We had the pesto salad, which came with cucumbers, tomatoes and onions. It was filling and fresh. We also had the pie boat with beans. Its a bread bowl filled with mashed red beans. The dough was soft and warm and the beans wrote creamy and chunky, a very good dish. The last thing we had were their beef dumplings. They're similar to soup dumplings but the dough is a bit thicker. You bite the side and drink the soup inside and then enjoy eating the whole thing. It was good. I didn't eat the whole dumpling dough but did eat the beef inside. Our appetizers came out fast but the dumplings took some time.  We enjoyed the atmosphere. We ate outside and it was pleasant. The wait staff was friendly and answered our questions. They also asked how the food was and were happy with our pleasure.

Chicken Mtsvadi
Tarragon lemonade

This small but, cozy cafe was a great stop for a late afternoon lunch. Light music plays in the background and you could easily have a conversation. I ordered the tarragon Georgian lemonade which was a bright green soda that tasted similar to anise or licorice. For my entree I got the chicken Mtsvadi with plum sauce. The chicken was piping hot with crisp bits of char, super moist with a few slivers of onion that added a nice bite without overpowering the chicken. The plum sauce has a faint sweetness and tasted strongly of bell peppers. The salad was lightly dressed with vinegar and olive oil and was perfect to sop up some of the juices for the chicken.

A good safe first dish for the less adventurous among us, I definitely want to go back and try the Cornish hen, the beef stew or one of the pies!
It was my favorite spot in bay ridge, but I tried yesterday and didn't like it , khinkali was very bad , and prices are so high

You know how you can go a lifetime without knowing about something and then once you have the experience it becomes a mini-obsession? That's how I now feel about unique and tasty Georgian cuisine. I was first introduced to it during the pandemic and have now sampled a few places, most recently Cafe Ubani, a great find in the West Village.

Warm and friendly service, homemade tasting food, hearty breads, and a nice selection of meat and cheese dishes make this a place to visit. The atmosphere on a rainy weekend day was super chill, with smooth jazz and low lighting perfectly matching the mood.

We started with mint tea and then proceeded to an excellent beet salad, drizzled with a raspberry coulis and served on cornbread with goat cheese on the plate. This is among the best beet salads I've ever had and was a very unique approach. We also had to try the Adjaruli Khachapuri, a must in any Georgian spot, and the portion was well sized, not overwhelming, but hearty with good bread and the yummy cheese and egg blend mixed at our table. We shared the brunch eggs and tomato sauce, which was tasty and reminded me of shakshuka. Last, but not least we tried the beef Khinkali (dumplings), giant soup dumplings that were flavorful if a bit difficult to eat.

All in all, a very nice and relaxing rainy weekend brunch. We will be back!

We had already eaten dinner but when we saw these reviews and photos we had to come here just to try at least one dish before leaving New York.

Food: We had The Famous Cauliflower with Walnut Sauce. I'm so happy we came because it was absolutely worth it! I feel so lucky to be finding an amazing restaurant so early in its life as they just opened this year.

We recently went to a two star Michelin restaurant in San Francisco called Birdsong and I would say this dish is on par with some of their cauliflower dishes. If they keep this quality I think they could end up being a pretty famous restaurant in New York.

Drinks: You HAVE to try the Georgian Lemonade! What an amazing taste! It's something I won't forget and will be back for.

Ambiance: Calm and relaxing. Perfect place to unwind after a busy New York day.

Service: The people who work here are so kind, polite, and friendly! They were understanding when we only ordered one dish whereas some other places might not be.

Recommendation: Try and fix the table legs so the table doesn't rock as much. I only recommend this because I think this could be a top restaurant and these small details start to get noticed as the restaurant gets more attention. Otherwise I can't think of anything else!

I can't wait to come back and work our way through the menu!

Really nice addition to the Georgian-tinged NYC dining scene makeover. Ubani is pleasantly located on a relatively quiet West Village street, and really is more of a cafe than restaurant, tough you can certainly have a sit down meal.

The first thing that became obvious was the lack of booze--and the more surprising lack of a BYOB option (regulations, perhaps). I think they may be in the process of obtaining a license, so do your homework and/or prepare to be dry.
