There are some interesting appetizers to try if you want to explore some deeper cuts from the Goergian cookbook (beet greens with walnuts come to mind), but the draw is unquestionably the dish that has made Georgian food so accessible to New Yorkers, moving it from post-Soviet obscurity through the filter of Italian dough culture. I'm talking about khachapuri, of course, and Ubani boasts a half dozen or so options.

You can have the infamous adjaruli boat-shaped "calzone" with an egg topping, the classic imeruli, or, as I did, the megruli -- more or less a pizza with extra cheese and golden crust. I'm not saying there's a conspiracy to turn baked Georgian dishes into Italian food, but either way they're doing a great job with these.

More basic comforts such as Georgian kebabs are absent, but there is a skewered chicken dish my friend seemed to enjoy.

Looking forward to more experiences here. Looks like another successful Goergian outpost in lower Manhattan.

I was looking for a lunch spot to meet up with a friend and found Cafe Ubani. I arrived early, but they let me sit down and I had a cold brew while waiting. There was only one other table occupied around 1:30pm on a Friday afternoon. It did fill up a little bit during our meal.

We split the Adjaruli khachapuri and an order of 3 khinkali dumplings with meat. I've never had Georgian food, but have watched many YouTubers eat it, so I was semi-familiar. Our waiter explained everything when he brought the dishes, which was super helpful.

The food was great. How can one go wrong with warm bread and gooey cheese?? The khachapuri was super cheesy and savory. I could eat this all day. The dumplings were kind of like, giant, doughier soup dumplings. I love the way they eat these and it's a lot of fun. The meat is a bit peppery, which gave each bite a nice kick.

My first time having Georgian was a huge success thanks to Cafe Ubani!

We also went to the Bay Ridge location but that one is not on Yelp yet.  We started with the Eggplant Roll, served cold with a garlic paste filling that had sort of Indian spices, which was delicious.  We then had the Spinach Khachapuri, where they stir the egg into the hot cheese table side, also fabulous.  For a main, we got the Pork Mtsvadi which is skewer-grilled.  It was very good, and came with yummy potatoes, but next time I think I'd have more small plates.   There's just too much to try.  The service was lovely and they really helped us with the wine and food selection.  We sat in the backyard which is really well done, chic and bright, with chill jazz, a perfect atmosphere.  The place was hopping so make a reservation!  Good for a date or a group.

Intimate cozy restaurant with great food and service. Felt like being in a small family owned restaurant in Europe. The food was all delicious and flavorful with nice herbs/spices (heavy though so be ready for comfort food). Appetizer wise we really enjoyed the mkhali trio which I thought had a balanced taste of each of the veggie and spices and most importantly not salty.
For the carbs, we were ambitious and had the adjaruli khachapuri with mint and megruli khachapuri. Both were excellent. We also had the dumplings, lobio with mint, and pork ribs. All were yummy especially the lobio (beans).
Service was friendly and attentive. Would definitely return to try more things!

The Cornish hen was very good, as explained expected.
Nice outside space. Try the honey cake!

Came here on a Monday night with a reservation for 6:15 (was pretty empty then but differently filled up closer to 8). The service and interior were all amazing, and I would love to come here to study/chill!! But the meat platter my friend and I shared was extremely dry ): looking at other reviews I think we just ordered the wrong thing

We have been here at least 5 times now and always have a great experience. The hatchapuri is super cheesy, the Georgian salad with walnuts has the tastiest walnut sauce, the chicken mtzvadi is juicy and tkemali sauce is tart. The honey cake is EXCELLENT! I think it has a layer of dulce de leche and a creamy layer and a honey layer.. so good. Highly recommend. Don't skip the compote either, get a pitcher to share. Yum!

Came in on Saturday evening without reservations.  Ubani feels informal and has a casual vibe. The menu is a one pager of starters, main courses, desserts and drinks s we opted for kompot (berry) to start . Which was not too sweet, cold and refreshing. Ordered 2 types of khachapuri which were cheesy, buttery goodness and for 2 quite filling . Salad is recommended to break the carbs up. We also got a portion of Khinkali dumplings. These are quite big and meat was well spiced .  Overall we enjoyed our meal and would come back for more main course options to try. The only drawback was noise level that was from proximity to other tables talking loudly . I would avoid busy dinner times if you want to talk normally lol

I have been to every Georgian restaurant in nyc and ubani is the best - everything tastes fresh, homemade, and flavorful - even though it is filling, I feel good after eating here- I appreciate the new wine list and selection- staff also are all Georgian it seems; very friendly; and the restaurant has an intimate vibe- it truly is the best Georgian food I've had - and one of my favorite restaurants in nyc

Delicious food and friendly service!!

Love love their Adjaruli khachapuri. My favorite in NY for sure. The seasonal pork ribs was a nice surprise too, well-seasoned and tender.

Honey cake is highly recommended. Very unique with the right amount of sweetness. I feel that they have honey flavored cheese or something in between the layers. Yummy!

Personally not a fan of the dumplings and the hen. Will be back for their brunch next time.

Amazing service and lovely ambiance. Their pavlova is to die for. And if you're adventurous and like good company and good freshly baked goods please visit Cafe Ubani.

P.S. the owners are so kind and found out it was our anniversary and did this for us! We love Cafe Ubani!!!

This cafe is not just a cafe but a restaurant as well! I had no idea though because the menu at the drink bar was limited to cafe items. It wasn't until we sat down that I noticed the menus and their enticing selection. I'm sad that I already had dinner prior bc I would have loved to have eaten here instead. The owners are also super sweet and nice! One of my friends lost her credit card at a bar we were at and one of them offered to be her muscle if they didn't give her back the card. Plus they were also accommodating of my friend who wanted to return the tiramisu she ordered. She didn't touch it at all, but I'm not sure why she ordered it to just return it. Sorta rude, but the owners were nice about it. So I'm definitely coming back to try their restaurant menu next time. Also, if anyone is looking for alcohol, they serve that here as well!

Onto the food and drinks. I ordered way too much for myself but I had a ginger tea, a dessert and the matcha strawberry drink. Everything was delicious and beautifully presented. Really enjoyed my time here, so I'm definitely coming back!

One nit I have is I would probably dim the lighting a bit more to give off a more intimate vibe for the restaurant side

I grew up hating veggies and still dislike most of them. But if you end up here, you must get the salad with walnut sauce!! It was the highlight of the meal and I'm now wondering how much I might have to pay the owners for the recipe.

Everything served was delicious, and not a single drop of food was left (but we were still quite full).

At the end of the meal, the server (who is probably one of the owners?) gave us a couple of blueberry scones for breakfast the next day. I have no idea why and this is not something I would expect, but let's just say they didn't last until the morning.

The only reason I'm hesitant to write this review is because they are still a new restaurant where it's still relatively easy to get a table; I don't want that to change, since I definitely need to go back!

First time trying Georgian food and was totally blown away by how yummy the food was at @cafeubaninyc! The cauliflower was grilled perfectly and retained the natural juiciness and sweetness of the vegetable, with the walnut sauce being a good addition but not overpowering. Elarji is made with coarse-ground corn flours Sulguni cheese. It maintained a surprising balance of cheesy but not to the point where you can't finish it as a meal. I would describe it as cheesy grits (kind of)! Absolutely loved this place and really wanted to try their desserts but was too full by the end of it.

Verdict: meal was average, service was lacking, honey cake was amazing

Food:
(Adjaruli lobiani)
The beans tasted like refried beans, and the dish was quite bland. Perhaps I should've chosen something with cheese

(Mushroom platter with tkemali/plum sauce)
I liked this dish much better than than the previous one. Tkemali (plum sauce on the side) was really good. The flavors in this dish were also relatively subtle, but the vegetables - mushrooms and bell peppers - were well-cooked

(Honey cake)
This saved the meal! It was amazing! It tasted like graham crackers in the form of a dense cake. It was not too sweet nor too dry.

Service:
The waiters were really inattentive throughout the entire meal. They didn't refill our water glasses even once and were a pain to flag down for the check.
Adjaruli Khachapuri was sooo good! Loved the Ubani Special it was so filling and I loved the fresh salad! The service was beyond attentive and welcoming and the ambiance was adorable.

A really cute brunch/lunch place! This was my first time trying Georgian food and I loved it! The boat shaped bread (part of the adjaruli lobiani) was amusing and seemed freshly baked. It was a perfect texture and definitely stood out to me. The cauliflower was also great and the walnut sauce was well-seasoned. The dishes were also well-presented. The server was patient with helping my friend and me decide what to order. The one thing I would caution is that there weren't a lot of vegan options, but there were a good number of vegetarian options. I also liked the general vibe of the place - low-key but cozy with wooden tables and water color paintings on the walls. Would definitely want to come back here!

Went here for brunch and everything was amazing. Interior was clean and super nicely decorated with plants. Service was very attentive and welcoming, we decided to get the watermelon matcha and the adjaruli khachapuri. Never heard or tried of either but was blown away but how good it was. Being a huge matcha enthusiast, I thought I had every matcha combination possible (never thought of watermelon) but it was truly the best matcha ever! Perfect summer drink would recommend it the most. The adjaruli khachapuri is best for cheese lovers and the dough is pillow soft. Would definitely come back again!

Stumbled upon this cafe on Yelp when searching for a place to work from in the neighborhood. So glad my friend and I found this place as it is now one of my go tos to get some work done.  

Service: 10/10, I've only ever seen one barista here and he's always working hard and attentive. No complaints.

Coffee: Amazing oat milk lattes. I haven't had their food because all gluten items but they do have a variety of pastries available.

Inside: clean, plenty of seating. Small and clean bathroom. One thing I did notice - there weren't any outlets, I may have missed them but didn't see any.

Overall this is a great places to hang around alone (WiFi available) or with friends.

To my mind this is a place where you can enjoy the food you miss being far from your home.  It is a place where all guests are friendly welcomed and a place where you just always want to come back and where you always will be a welcome guest.

Excellent food, desserts, coffee. Great team, service and environment, also cute design.

I always look forward to visiting this amazing place.

In order not to waste time looking for the desired place, visit - "Ubani".

Highly recommend this place.

We came in on a Sunday night and the staff was absolutely wonderful. This was our first time here and we just wanted some dessert and he did a really great job of making us feel welcomed and explaining the desserts to us.

Both the ones that we got were really tasty, but I'd say the honey cake was the unanimous favorite. Ugh was a little more dense than most cakes and chewy, but it wasn't too sweet.

They also have a dinner menu which I will be back to check out!

Watermelon matcha: fantastic
Nutella latte: okay
Napolean: SO DIFFERENT
Honey cake: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING, I ordered another slice to go so my bf can try it

Saw that cheese boat bread many times in the internet but I did not know that it was a Georgian dish until coming here. So it was my first experience eating Georgian food. Tried four dishes: Georgian salad with walnuts, Adjaruli khachapuri with mint, Shkmeruli, and Khinkali. The salad used peanut-sauce-like dressing, tasted okay but super refreshing, love the grape pieces. The star for us was the Adjaruli khachapuri, the cheese boat bread. Basically, we teared the bread and dipped it in its cheese-egg mixture. The texture of the bread was amazing, it had this medium crusty texture on the outside and very soft in the inside. When we combined it with the creamy cheese-egg mixture, it tasted just amazing, cheesey and subtle savory hint. It was good to enjoy while still warm. Next, Shkmeruli was chicken cooked in this creamy broth with lots of minced garlic, I mean really a lot, so it had a very strong garlic flavor. The broth was so creamy and buttery. We tried dipping the bread from Adjaruli to the creamy broth, and it was good!! The last dish, Khinkali is basically a giant Georgian dumpling, came 3 in one portion, they were hugeee. The skin was thick (it supposed to be thick anw) which we don't really like in general. The way to eat the dumpling is by flipping it upside down (so it would look like mushroom tree) and bite a bit part of the skin to suck the liquid/broth inside (it was hot so be careful to not burn the tongue) - reminded me of that xia long bao. There was this minced meat like meatball inside along with the broth. This dish was our least favorite in term of taste and texture. Overall, a quite good experience. Cheese boat bread was the best! Too bad we didn't snap any photos.

It was quite packed when we came for dinner. Really nice and friendly staffs too. They accepted card payment.

Excellent omakase by team Blue Ribbon.
The course starts with few appetizers, including Uni, Lobster, caviar, wagyu, sashimi platter and series of sushi.
Atmosphere is very friendly and at home.

Ueki Sushi is the new omakase restaurant from Blue Ribbon Sushi. While the service and the setting are terrific, they have not yet reached the level you would expect from a top omakase (Ito, Yoshino, Noz, etc). Very good, but lacking that extra element.

Food 5/5 was impeccable, everything was extremely well plated and paired. Including only some snippets here.

Service 5/5 was above and beyond. Two things I appreciated a lot - the chef asked if I was left handed so that he could rotate the piece for ease of picking it up with my dominant hand; the dishes that were meant to be served hot, he would wait to smoke the pieces individually for guests that went to use the restroom.

Ambiance 5/5 very intimate and friendly, as the chefs and waitstaff said, really felt like all the guests were family. Bowie also made an appearance and it was great to meet him in the flesh!

Love coming to this place! The owner is so kind and friendly. The food is yummy and the large windows are great for people watching. If you live in Hamilton Heights you should be coming here for breakfast/lunch.

Came here since it was on my way to take my son for a haircut, and he needed a quick breakfast for our long trip.  We both had omelets.  Mine had onions ham, jalapenos, and cheese.  His was onions, ham, pepper, and cheese.  We both loved it.  They do have their own spicy sauce which, for me was more garlicky than spicy.  I do wish they had sauce with a bit more heat.

The service was great.  The waiter offered to change the channels on 2 of their TVs on both ends so we could both watch a show we wanted while we ate.

I love this place. They have a really extensive selection of things considering the size of the place! The food is always incredible and everyone that works there is SUPER nice. Beyond awesome. I love this place and I'm so glad it's my local spot.

I used to go to this place every week because it's right next to my laundromat. I went in for a sandwich and attempted to take advantage of a promotion I saw for CUNY students. I tried to show the cashier my ID, but he refused to look at it, assuming I was lying about being a student. He then insulted my appearance (accusing me of being too old to be a student). I'll take my old ass someplace else, then. Jerks.

This is for a delivery order I received today.

I will never be ordering from this place again. I ordered a grilled cheese which was literally two pieces of white bread with some hard warmed American cheese. I ordered a bagel and paid to get an extra bagel and instead received an extra shitty grilled cheese. Ordered some cheese fries, the cheese was hard and the fries weren't crispy. I ordered a cheese, egg, bacon, sausage and ham on a hero (because there is no option to get a bacon, egg and cheese), I requested no ham or sausage and of course they ignore my request and made it on a roll instead of a hero. This was the biggest waste of $16.

If I could give this place zero stars I would because it doesn't even deserve a 1 star rating...

I just ordered from them from seamless because for some strange reason seamless has given them a 4 star rating. The food was outright gross. My burger was literally like a school lunch burger if you can remember those dry flavorless patties. The fires were totally stale and soggy. For some reason, they decided to drown my daughter's turkey sandwich in jalapenos. EVerything was cold and gross and it took forever.

Ordered a grilled cheese sandwich and a vegetarian panini with mozzarella cheese. The order was late 10 minutes and i got a VEGETARIAN WRAP and a grilled cheese and not a frigin panini. So disappointed. Are u kididing me? U had one job and u got my order wrong. Awful awful, never ordering again
waited for two hours for food to be delivered and it never came. When I called, people were very very rude. Do not order from this place
GREAT pizza. Love their slices!!! Highly recommend to anyone around city college's campus.

Order from this Italian pizza place as I was looking for different pizza options in the area. It was honestly not too bad and I wouldn't mind ordering from here again but it wasn't amazing pizza. I ordered a standard cheese pie and I enjoyed it. Their sizing is also very big for pies.

The BF and I had tickets to a show at Harlem Stage on this blustery cold night and had made our way up to Harlem from BK much quicker than expected. A quick search on the Happy Cow app revealed Uncle Tony's and its vegan pies! We decided to swing by and grab a couple slices.

The service was reasonably friendly and super quick. The vegan slice was delicious! The crust had just the right amount of crispness on the bottom and was topped with plentiful tomato sauce, vegan cheese, and generous dollops of basil pesto. The pizza was truly outstanding and the dining area was welcoming and bright. Next time I am in the neighborhood, I will definitely be back!
Ordered half cheese/half chicken - skimped out on the chicken and pizza came cold - not the best

I ordered a gramma scicilian for delivery and my fiancé noticed a funny smell. I lifted the cheese and there was this greyish brown stuff all over the dough. I wasn't totally sure it was mold because honestly, as a life long New Yorker I've never experienced something like this.  20 minutes later it turns brown/black. I am the son of small business owners and I promise you that these pictures are from withIn 30 minutes of having the pie delivered. Ive had no previous animosity with the owners and have walked in before to grab a slice and the guys behind the counter seemed really nice. This isn't some type of targeted attack on them. Whoever  is responsible for prepping dough in this pizzeria should be fired. ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE!!!!

When Uncle Tony's first opened, it was AMAZING! super fresh ingredients and creative specialty pizzas. The prices were decent and the service was great too.

As of late, the quality has drastically decreased and the prices increased. The last three times in a row, the pizza was noticeably old and over cooked. We were super disappointed this has happened but we are now forced to look for a new pizza spot. After all, for the price of their pizza ($20+) we expect high quality food.

Spicy Buffalo Chick Pizza from Uncle Tony is sooo good! The pizza  is nicely topped with buffalo chicken. Not too much, not too little. It's topped with blue cheese that just give you a nice ease after getting hit by spice! Yum

You know the pepperoni pizza is good be good when you have bowl shaped goodness pepperonis on it! Their pepperoni pizza is nice and flavorful, hits all the Italian essentials in a pizza

**Extremely disappointed.**

I ordered the "white pizza," and it supposed to come with ricotta but I felt like they didn't put enough. They seem to be cheap on toppings. I asked for mushrooms (for an extra amount) and got very little pieces of mushrooms. The pizza was so thin and hard it was like CARDBOARD. Maybe it was over cooked....

Just extremely disappointed. Over priced and not enjoyable. I had to microwave it to soften it up.

The one good thing is each slice is large. But overall would not eat it again or pay that much. (30 dollars after adding 1 topping).

I tried their vegan pizza and it tastes good...not spectacular or anything. The only thing I didn't like was the texture of the cheese, it just felt a bit off. There has been way better vegan cheese introduced over the past few years, so I think they should try using a new cheese. It would elevate the pizza.

I also wish their vegan pizza was more NYC-style, especially since the restaurant is in Harlem. If you're vegan, I would only recommend this place if you want vegan pizza and can't go anywhere else.

Pizza is good, but be wary of placing online orders through their website.

I placed an order for 4 slices at 5:57 pm, arrived at 6:25 pm (as prompted by their website), but did not receive my pizza until 6:57 pm. An hour wait is too much for four slices, especially since they were not particularly busy. Moreover, they forgot to add pepperoni to one of the slices, which was an extra cost, so I had to go back to have my order corrected.
Not good pizza. There was barely any sauce on our pie and very thin. Crust wasn't cooked very well and it ended up tasting like undercooked pizza dough with some cheese sprinkled on top.

Very mediocre, not really worth 10$ for 2 slices of pizza. If you're around the area and you reallly want to get some pizza, then I would say to go for the buffalo chicken slice. Definitely skip the margarita slice. I would suggest going during their closing time, which is around 9-10pm, all the slices are 1$.

This is a review of the delivery only. So I've been out of the States for years. And as soon as I arrived into New York I ordered from here through Uber Eats (which I absolutely do not recommend using them ever). I had the Grandma Pizza and a bottle of water all to myself.

The pizza was good, obviously if you come to NYC, your first slice should be from John's or something, but I was impatient and was quarantining. It's a thin crust Sicilian. It's a very basic pizza but super tasty since the ingredients they use are of high quality. Garlic plum tomatos, fresh mozzarella, and extra virgin olive oil. All worked together delightfully. Not too greasy, not too rich, a perfectly baked crust. Also surprisingly filling, as I could only eat 2-3 slices before having to call it quits.

Would definitely drop by if I'm ever in the area again!
Always Good!! Always delivered hot!! Great addition to Game Night!!!12x18 Sicilian Pie
Great service, great food and a comfortable environment. Fast & great price especially for whole pies &  pizza by the slice. A wonderful addition to the neighborhood.

Uncle Tony's has grown on me, partly because of their weekend pizza slice special. I am there almost every weekend to get a variety of pizza slices. Bosco is my favorite, bakers is popular, even their vegan slice is pretty good. When it was warmer they started serving gelato which was a great idea, the chocolate was amazing. I think they may have taken note that the pizza needed more sauce because it has definitely improved over the last couple years.

Great pizza! I picked up a slice of the Bakers and a regular cheese. Both were tasty and the bottom was crispy, but not hard. I didn't want to eat the crust, which is usually what sets apart a 5-star pizza from a 4-star.

The employee who helped me was friendly and efficient. I would definitely come back to satisfy any pizza cravings.

I come here for their pizza special which is really good. I usually have their Buffalo chicken pizza and the mushroom slice. Both are very good; and this is my neighborhood pizza place. Their customer service could be better but their pizza is always very good. The Buffalo chicken pizza is always very flavorful and the thickness of the pizza is just right. The mushroom slice is also thin and tasty not too oily.

I love this pizza place. The only "down side" is you can't order delivery unless you use a third party like seamless. I try to support smaller businesses by contacting them directly. But UTP wants to conduct business this way, it won't stop me from ordering their amazing food. Just thought I would let people know.
Now go and order your pizza. In fact order two. This pizza is so good you will eat it for breakfast.
The place was excelent, the Service was good, when we ordered our first pizza we discovered that we liked the pizza and we ordered another one, and the garlic knots were also good

The pizza is definitely delicious. I'm giving this place four stars because their prices are absolutely ridiculous for the neighborhood. It's places like these that are making Harlem so gentrified. There's no reason why a regular slice should ever be more than two dollars.
I do like that they have a variety of pizzas by the slice and a vegan option. It's across the street from campus so that convenient however, unless I'm in a rush to class, I'd rather go down to Olga's on Broadway and save some money.

Popped in for a quick slice after a long ass walk and day in the park. My slice was a mushroom truffle oil and it was good with ricotta cheese. My husband had a garlic slice and my kid had a cheese slice.

They're across the street from city college so we just took it to the campus and chilled there. There's not a lot of space inside the pizza place.

Been coming to Tony's for 5 years now, and while their pizza is great, their customer service leaves much to be desired. I still like their pizza, but I won't be buying extra slices just for the sake of supporting a small business in the neighborhood anymore because I don't think the tall bearded guy and the shorter guy with glasses realize (and appreciate) that us students have been the backbone of their business for years.

They have a $5 special on the weekends from 11-4. However, if you call in to place an order for takeout, this special price does not apply. That is fine if this is made clear ahead of time. However, we called in a few weeks ago and the tall bearded guy rang the pizza up at the $5 special price when we picked up. Thus, we called in again today for pick up. When we got there, the tall bearded guy (ironically the same exact employee that rang us up before) said phoned orders do not count, and made a point to say that it has *always* been this policy. Well, clearly NOT if you have done differently before. Everyone makes mistakes, but he still charged us $28 full price for the slices even though it wasn't 4 o'clock yet (so technically, we could have cancelled the phone order and just re-ordered in person...). Imo, that was poor customer service on their part, especially because it was still during the special hours so they were definitely ringing up at the higher price to get more $$ from us. We couldn't stomach eating the pizza after that (and our classmates were in disbelief that Tony's would insist on charging full price) so they did give us a full refund and threw the pizza in the trash. You'd rather throw the pizza in the trash than just charge us the $5/2 slices price in light of a misunderstanding that was partially your fault?? This was less about the extra $ and more about the principle of customer service. What a shame because their pizza is quite delicious and made for an affordable study snack.
I can only rate delivery - it seems like they don't heat up slices before sending off for delivery. They arrive very and congealed and cold, and today I got burnt cold pizza. I'm only 10 blocks away.

Wowza. This pizza is now my favorite. A true New York style pizza with a schmear of sauce, real mozzarella cheese with a milky melt and slightly spicy pepperoni that crisps up and a crust that bends and folds upon manipulation.

If pepperoni isn't your thing, the plain cheese slice is far from plain. They also have a lovely kalamata olive pie but overall all of the ingredients have been fresh and full of flavor. (I'm hesitant on ordering the mushroom pie but I'm hopeful that when I do, the mushrooms will also be fresh.)

The place is super clean and the staff is friendly. Not too many options on beverages and other fare but they are sticking to what they do best.  No complaints from me.  Definitely a welcome addition and revommended.
They have the best vegan pizza. When we want pizza, this is the place to go! They have a pie with pesto. Will be having one soon!

OMG! That bosco slice! YUM!

I love this place! Saturdays and Sundays have a happy hour special and it's so worth it!

The vegan slice is ok. A little dry for my taste. The cauliflower slice is good too.

This pizza is so good. I can't believe I waited so long to try it. Tried the buffalo chicken (delicious) and I forgot the name of the other but it was also delicious. So crispy and I love just a slice of pizza so I dont end up eating a whole pie. Service was ultra fast and efficient.

I've ordered delivery from Uncle Tony's several times. The last time, my order was wrong and I couldn't eat it. I called and asked for a partial refund, they proceeded to tell me I ordered incorrectly even though I was reading off my receipt. They hung up and wouldn't take any more calls from my number.

The customer service is really unfortunate because the pizza is usually decent.

Love this place. All pizzas are amazing. We come to the heights on weekends and look forward to eating here. The mushroom one is my absolute favorite.
Simple shop, super clean with delicious product. A must try.

Since Tony's is just over a mile from us, we only get over there when we happen to be in our car. But so far, we've found it to be the best place nearby (central Harlem) to get a good slice. The cheese is ample and respectfully greasy, the crust is thin but not floppy, and the sauce is just right: covers the slice but doesn't gush and tastes like it's actually been cooked. We always get pepperoni slices (or a pie) and a couple of grandma slices, also with pepperoni. Always hits the spot. I do wish the pepperoni ratio was a bit more generous, but that would be my only complaint.

As a city college student I've been here countless times and every time I have to order their buffalo chicken slice and the bakers slice. Although this spot is on the pricier side of the pizza spectrum, they definitely use quality ingredients to justify the price point. Uncle Tony's definitely offers the best buffalo chicken slice I've ever had. Usually it seems many pizzerias use the same buffalo sauce for their chicken but there is something about the sauce here that just stands out from the rest. Aside from that they also give you generous pieces of chicken paired with a great blend of cheeses. Bakers is a great Sicilian square slice and when I see the pepperoni that curves up, I just know it's going to be good.
But of course a great slice of pizza is not just about flavorful and fresh ingredients. The crust is equally as important. My definition of a great slice is a crispy thin crust that doesn't sag when you fold it. If it sags it's probably overly greasy or they've let the sauce settle too early. For the Sicilian it has to be just as crisp even though it's a thicker slice with a slight char on the crust. This pizzeria is a bit out of the way but I wouldn't hesitate to try it out.

I think I've only had a couple of slices of pizza from uncle Tony's in the past but I decided to order a whole pizza for my friend and I to share. It was the right choice. Half pepperoni and half mushrooms. The crust was thin and crisp and just enough sauce to make everything fall into place. Pizza was hot upon arrival and therefore the cheese was still melty.  I will be ordering from there again...maybe sooner than later.
Food was amazing mainly the cheese pizza fast service hot food great interactions with employees and it was overall amazing

Me and my friends picked up some slices to take to have a picnic down at riverbank park! the vegan pizza was excellent ( i added mushrooms on top)! My friends got the plain cheese and the grandmas slice and they loved their slices as well! Will definitely be coming back here to order more than slices soon! Pickup was super fast and easy as well

The pizza is actually pretty decent. I'm a sucker for deep dish so I got the sicilian with pepperoni. It's just thicker bread which makes it more filling, not necessarily better. The dough isn't especially tasty. Thin pizza has never intrigued me, but I imagine it would be good here. Plenty of cheese and crispy pepperoni. The pizza is pricey. I'm sure it's more of an artisan type of place, but I just want a good deep dish in the neighborhood

Hands down one of the best pizza spots in Harlem, but Harlem isn't exactly known for pizza so it's one of the best of slim pickings.

I can't help, but compare Uncle Tony's Grandma slice to Prince Street Pizza in SoHo and Grandma doesn't come close. Uncle Tony's Grandma slice is really salty. It's great if you're craving something that tastes like you're licking a Himalayan salt lamp, but sometimes it's so salty it's borderline inedible.

Uncle Tony's is one of the only decent pizza options in Harlem and when their pizza doesn't taste like cardiac arrest, it's delicious.
Don't waste your money on them, buy a pizza from the store it will take better and probably be warmer.

This is probably my favorite pizza in New York now.

I've been pleased with all the slices I've tried (supreme, Sicilian, grandma, baker's, cheese, truffle mushroom) but the standout star for me is the grandma. I have one every time I visit, which has been about twice a week since I've discovered this place.

I'm not generally a fan of the thicker, fluffier slices (not enough cheese and sauce to be bread) but this place does them really well.

One time, I went near closing and my slice wasn't in the oven long enough so the cheese was still hard and cold, but it was still one of the better slices of pizza I've had in the city.

Good pizza place that opened up in the neighborhood recently. I've had their supreme slice, their bacon ranch slice, and their Sicilian slice. All of the slices were pretty good, suffice to say. They also have a happy hour deal on the weekend afternoons where it's $5 for 2 slices of anything. All in all, a pretty good spot.

Firstly the pizza is good. Im giving a poor review because they need to practice better recycling. I had lunch there today and the place was packed with students eating their pizza out of cardboard boxes. Unfortunately the public is not well educated on proper recycling so it's up to you as an establishment to make sure you're not wasting as much as you are. There's no reason a kid should be served a singular slice of pizza in a box. Especially if they're not even taking it to go... in addition to that people are throwing garbage away in the recycling bin because there's not enough labeling and differentiation between the garbage and recycling bins.

I will change my review if they implement a better system.

Delicious NY-Style pizza spot in Harlem! My bf and I are new to East Harlem and wanted to order some pizza! Delivery was a bit delayed but it's because they're so popular and it makes sense why! Crust was nice and flaky, toppings and pizza were delicious! Would highly recommend ordering from them! Worth the wait!

This pizzeria is right by my school. It's honestly pretty decent-I recommend the chicken ranch slice and the cauliflower slice. The prices however....eh. While their slices are good, I've had better pizza at those prices. So I usually just get their slices on the weekend (I have a Saturday class like a loser) since they have a weekend lunch special of any 2 slices for 5 dollars. Now THAT'S what's up.
Excellent pizza, on time delivery, order is always exactly as ordered.. pizza was hot as well , ready to eat .. highly recommended!!

Pizza is great. This is our go to for authentic pizza. We ordered pepperoni and olive and it was delicious. The toppings reminded me of the pizza we had in Italy, authentic black olives, not the sliced ones you get out of a can and the pepperoni was small, and curled a bit, just like it does on an authentic Italian pizza.
We get it delivered and they are quick and spot on.

I was surprised to see the newest addition to Hamilton Heights squished between Clove and Fumo. The unassuming, small pizza parlor left an impression on me just by sight so I told myself I had to come back for a slice or two!

There are 10 different pies on the menu; 5 vegetarian options and one vegan option (yay).

The cauliflower (v) has a heavy sprinkle of  mushrooms. There is a good crunch from the cauliflower and sliced red onions but i'd prefer them roasted in evoo a little longer but that's just imo. The flavors are amazing and got me thinking that cauliflower might have a place on pizza.

Now,  the baker just about nails it in every way.

Seating is small and can pack quickly. Just stand like the new yorker way, I guess. I love the contrasting blue and white tiling and plant decor they got inside.

Not really worth the price. I live around the corner. Had a slice heated. When I got home. All I had was a cold, burnt, nasty slice.
The staff was really great. But, not enough to have me come back.

The pizza here is my favorite in all of upper Manhattan! It took my almost an entire year of trying different pizza shops to find what I would consider the best slice of upper Manhattan! I would highly recommend just trying a plain slice here so much flavor and the sauce is great! I love their Buffalo chicken pizza it has a perfect blend of blue cheese and Buffalo chicken and their crust is like butter! Amazing 5 stars I'm so happy I found a quality pizza shop in the area that isn't too expensive but definitely not cheap ingredients! Go here you won't be disappointed!

OMG, Uncle Tony's Pizza was definitely brilliant. It's the little things that make Uncle Tony's Pizza so awesome. The menu is really amazing, a lot of fantastic choices, I had to go with Sicilian Slice, and it was amazing. Terrific. Excellent service and staff. It's totally worth it.

Pizza is good quality for the area... I just wished they changed their menu up a bit once in a while. I've lived here over 2 years and it's always the SAME pies all the time. Plus I don't like that they don't offer the same pizza options as the sit-down restaurant that's right next door. I mean it's the same owner and they're right next to each other why can't I eat a slice of the prosciutto and arugula pizza on the takeout service? Makes no sense. But decent quality for what they offer.

Full disclosure:  this was a delivery order through Seamless and I ordered about half an hour before the restaurant closed.  This was after midnight.  I was sure they were going to spit in my food.  But the order was perfect and the delivery was fast.

I was surprised by how GOOD these sandwiches were!  I ordered the Asiago gruyere melt, the Cuban melt, and the Italian focaccia with marinara.  All were super cheesy!  Gooey and pull apart good.  I got all three on the homemade focaccia, which was buttery and soft, yet not too soft.  The Cuban had tasty salty ham, mustard, and pickles.  The tater tots were hot and crispy.  The fries were some of the favorite American fries I've had, thick, crispy, well seasoned.

If you want a sexy grilled cheese, I recommend this place.

Sometime I didn't care about others customer who complain about this place . Yes , i gave them a try last night. Food was on time even came faster than estimated time. My bbq chicken cutlet was so good , love the bread not sure what it called. My bf got the burger and tuna melt. He loved them both. I cannot wait to try others on their menu.
Bad. Bad food. Bad customer service. Cheese is like rubber. "Homemade" focaccia is like styrofoam (better than rubber but I like bread more than cheese anyway) and the delivery is atrocious.

Delivery guy wouldn't deliver because there were people outside the building entrance. We couldn't see any people from our window, and we were not alerted to the issue. He asked us to come down even though he had made it through "the crowd" and made it into the lobby. He did not ring the bell. We would picked up if we knew that service wasn't door to door because of people on the sidewalk in public, like people do. This is not delivery. Whoever I spoke to started getting loud and I hung up because I didn't want to get loud. I hate this place and I've never had food from there.

This place was delicious my husband and I are from out of town and we ate here multiple times because the chicken is so crispy and the service is so friendly! When we come back to New York this will be our first stop!

It's your hole in the wall, sketchy chicken spot but damn its so good. The wings are everything, usually get it for parties and everyone loves it. The fries are awesome. The ppl that work there show the highest hospitality.

Based upon the stellar reviews I read, I went to this hole in the wall with an open mind. I was met with a B health department rating at the door and pushed past it mentally. I was on a mission to find a local go-to spot for fried chicken. Can't say this is it for me. The chicken is about average. The fries slightly better than average. Place is cash only with an ATM inside for convenience - not deducting any points for this.

Nice quaint small place. Friendly front desk guy. I had the number 10 - 3 piece chicken tenders with fries. DAMN good moist chicken with crunchy crisps battered tenders and crispy fries. I liked it a lot!

Everyone should have a go to fried chicken place. After living in Williamsburg I felt bereft of chicken that wasn't $20 for some just some chicken and a side. This is the place I've been looking for. Wings and fries are solid. Not overly salty. Pricing is super affordable. Don't be sketched out. Just go, you won't be disappointed.

I give it 10stars if I could! The food is amazing! They have everything you can imagine for amazing prices!!! I love there fried chicken and pizza so much flavor! They even have desserts the strawberry cheesecake is a must! They have every kind of drink from juices to sodas! Love the selection. The chicken is always fresh! The burgers are just to die for! They are made fresh with the Freshest toppings. You guys have to try it you will love it!

Food: 5/5
Taco Ranking -
1. Peking Duck Taco was really good. Wish I had gotten another

2. Skirt Steak Taco was tasty, but wish there was slightly more meat

3. Pork Carnitas taco was solid!

Overall, recommend ordering four tacos if you're hungry!

Drink: NA

Atmosphere: NA

Service: NA
Just note that this pick up / delivery only! No dine-in/outdoor dining options! So make sure to order in advance

As a native Texan in Manhattan, my standards for tacos are pretty high to say the least. I often deprive myself of tacos in the city, because many places are just not worth it. However, Universal Taco would fit in right at home back in Austin. Because of the ghost kitchen style, I never had to leave the couch to enjoy the delicious moo shu and peking deck tacos. Obviously neither are traditional, but the restaurant did a great job of creating a fusion that is actually enjoyable and innovative. Could not recommend this place enough!
Great food a adorable prices.  Good selection of snacks and drinks. Clean and nice staff. Great place recommend

aka, The Dirty Deli

Good hangover baconeggandcheeseonaroll.

Eventually you'll get the "dirty burger".

Also, when you're waiting in line to buy your Manhattan Soda, you can see the back of your head on the security cam.

Place looks sketchy but they make great sandwiches. I'm a house manager for a family with four kids that live in the building above the Dirty Deli so I'm in there literally every single day. The staff are ok, you would think after over three years of coming here they would seem a bit more friendly towards a regular but it's a deli in NYC, quick in and out transactions I suppose.

Ok, I only go here because it's right around the corner from my job and I just don't have enough time to walk 5 blocks to another place. United Grocery is understocked. Massively. They have nerve to call themselves a deli. They charge $2 for a Kashi go lean bar which is preposterous. They do have bialis though which I love. You know, those flat bagels. Lastly, their service is fast and the deli guys are friendly but the woman behind the register isn't so friendly.

I need to find another deli close to my job.

Worked next to this place for over a year.
As a result, they provided me with many breakfasts and lunches.

The food is somewhere just above "meh" but below good, edible but not preferable.

Basically it is the only option in the neighborhood where you can get a cheap meal quick.

This place looks like a dump, but at $4 the tuna sandwich beats the pre-made but well packaged garbage you'd get at Pret A Manger or Hale and Hardy. Double down on the pickles and oranges and you'll have a snack for later.

I love the dirty deli. When I worked in TriBeCa I came here all the time. The staff is fantastic and some of the most pleasant people I've ever dealt with in a deli. Sure, we call it "the dirty deli" but we do so with love. The sandwiches and burgers here were awesome and a lot more food than subway for just a dollar or two more. It's a no frills type of place. Hole in the wall appearance, but good food at good prices and I've found some sodas here (like Pepsi throwback) that I could never find elsewhere. Don't judge this book by its cover.

I have some beef with the Dirty Deli. Today I purchased three bags of Cape Cod chips (each says $1.09 on the bag) and the total came to $5.27!!!!! Yet yesterday my co-worker bought one bag of the same chips and she was only charged $1. And typical Dirty Deli style..they do not provide a receipt.

I will not go into the Dirty Deli until the New Year after this stunt.

I'll start off with the nicknames just to give you a sense of where we're at with United Grocery: Creepy Deli, Dirty Deli. But, the sign out front is rated "A", which is quite interesting.

Also a cool fact, I believe that Jay-z (whose current apartment is next door) refers to this deli in the song "Holy Grail".

"Photo shoots with paparazzi
Can't even take my daughter for a walk
See 'em by the corner store"- The paparazzi occasionally hangout in front of that deli(corner store) waiting for him, Beyonce or Bethenny to come out of their building.

Egg sandwiches and bottled drinks are where this place begins and ends. The guys behind the counter are super friendly especially considering they deal with large groups of construction workers who place orders for their entire fleet at once. However, for a quick egg sandwich this place hits the spot if you can get over the place itself.

This place is a disgrace and it's time to go!  I began working at 200 Hudson 6 mos ago and it's horrifying that this thing that calls itself a "deli" is the ONLY food or convenience store around.  That's undoubtedly the reason they get away with being dirty, dilapidated, and understocked at all times.  Not to mention having almost zero healthy options and 10 types of pork rinds.  Hit the road jack.  Give us something GOOD please!

I attended a charity black tie black and white ball here and I swear I felt like I had walked onto the set of "Gossip Girl".  The crowd was young, beautiful, well-heeled and impeccably dressed.  The latter threw me the most because usually at these charity events, you get the guys trying to sneak in suits in lieu of tuxs or girls trying to sneak in cocktail dresses in lieu of floor-length gowns, but not here.  Everyone was decked out to the nines, with hair done, jewels, custom masks, nice shoes, and just all those details that I don't miss.  Really the best looking gathering of people I had ever seen at an event.  Very much prep school, UES, Waspy party with everyone well behaved despite the numerous open bars.  Genteel is the word I would use to sum up the whole night.

The venue itself is very much like what you would expect of a private club but with a slightly more museum-like feel (what was that, a portrait of George Washington on the wall?) with very American and colonial art it seemed and the interconnecting rooms.  The place is just classy, beautiful, formal and almost, regal.  The place is really ideal to host a charity event.  They have a lot of space to check-in at the entrance, a big room on the first floor for the silent auction, and I think it was 6-7 separate rooms on the second floor and one that can house a band and dance floor.

Like discovering the secret platform at a London train station on your way to Harry Potter's school, being invited into this, the third-oldest private "gentlemens'" club in America is like stepping through the looking glass into a powerfully different, alternate reality.

This one is based on nineteenth century stuffiness and gentility, at least when it comes to the decor. It is precisely what you might expect the third oldest gentlemens' club in the United States to look like, replete with billiards tables, a library, and old-timey bathrooms spread out among multiple floors.  Thankfully, the bathroom attendants have been dispensed with.

The dining room has the same aesthetic. The kitchen, however, pumped out some first rate chow. Your correspondent's steak was expertly seasoned and prepared. The sides, while not terribly creative (which would, it must be said, be out of place here), were competently executed. The fig and parma ham appetizer, on the other hand, was creative, delightful, and attractive to behold.

Service was fairly formal, but not stuffy, which was a pleasure.

A great table for dinner. Of course not open to the public - seek out those who might invite you to this hidden New York City treat.

I came here with my family, one of whom is a member and we had a lot of fun!  We had a delicious dinner in the newly done dining room and wow, the waitstaff are wonderful, the food is delicious too!  We browsed through the extensive library and had drinks in The South Room with cheese and crackers which were lovely.  We plan on returning for Thanksgiving Dinner!
The food is very good. Recommendation for beef short rib and crab fried rice. Mimi's service is very nice. Definitely gonna visit again!!

Good selection of tasty dishes.
Pad Thai is varied and all are enjoyable
Choice of drinks is in keeping with Thai food.
I've not tried desserts.
Service is satisfactory but ambiance is a bit
crowded but ok when seated.

WORTH THE WAIT!
The line outside is always insane but please please just be patient!

The food, ambiance and service is always top. One of my favorite hidden gems. Highly highly highly recommend the curry puffs!!!!

Shoutout Elp for being the friendliest server :)

Such an amazing Thai food spot! This is my boyfriend's favorite Thai food place and he kept telling me that we needed to go to Up Thai; we finally made it happen this past Saturday and I am really glad that we did!

The service was impeccable and the food was out of this world!

The place looks totally underwhelming when you pass by, but once you enter the restaurant it is very vibrant and full of life.

Here are the dishes that we had:

For appetizers:
- shrimp fried Thai rice (I am still dreaming about this dish and all the flavors, the shrimp was cooked perfectly)
- crispy spring rolls (some of the best I have ever had and the sauce was on point)

Main dishes:
- Kea Mao w/ shrimp (the sauce in this soup/curry is everything! Med heat and just so flavorful)
- Talay Thai (if you like seafood this is your dish, the sauce is very refreshing and the squid is to die for)

Up Thai also makes an extremely delicious martini if that is your style.

We will definitely be coming back to Up Thai and I cannot wait to try some more dishes!

This restaurant was so cute and spacious inside, I love the decorations! The tables next to each other all have plastic dividers.

I came on a weekend for lunch and had a short few minutes wait before being seated at the bar. The bartenders and servers were so kind and helped me choose a dish when I was debating between two. I ended up going with the green curry with chicken which had a good amount of spice and was so delicious. It came with a side of rice. It was a pretty large portion so I ended up having leftovers to take home.

The service was a bit slow. It took a while to get my water refilled and to get my bill, but I was enjoying the atmosphere so it wasn't a huge concern. I would definitely come back again if I were in the area.

We had the Suck Tamarind and Salmon Tamarind and they both delicious.
Would highly recommend this Thai restaurant for lunch or dinner.
Eggplant came with the duck and also very good.
We orders in and delivery time was on time.
Tom G

Beautiful restaurant on 2nd avenue. Came here over the weekend with my mother for dinner. Luckily we made a last minute reservation 45 mins before the time. It honestly saved us from having to wait because this place was very packed for a Sunday evening. The hostess was friendly and took us to our seats. Now as I mentioned this place was packed, so our two seater table was near the waiter service area. That made the seating a little awkward with them having to pass by with food and drinks, constantly dodging one another but we made the best of it. Our waiter also took a while come to the table for the food order. That along with the table placement are my only downsides to the experience. But I could see that every seat in this place was taken and the servers were doing their best. We ordered shrimp cakes and roti massamun for appetizers.  The shrimp cakes were hot, crunchy and deliciously paired with some kind of vinegar condiment. The roti massamun was light and savory. Really enjoyed the chunks of potatoes and dipping the roti in the sauce. We followed that by the Hor Mok Pla and Pad See Ew with crispy duck for dinner. [first three dishes were off the winter special menu fyi. Which I assume rotates with the seasons.]. Hor Mok Pla melted in mouth. I don't normally get the banana leaf steamed items but I'm glad I did. I didn't try my moms pad see ew but she seemed to enjoy her dish. I always get a thai ice tea when I have Thai food and it was just right. My mom ordered the yuzu lemonade. Sweet and refreshing. All in all I enjoyed my dinner. I can say that the food didn't take long to come out once the order was placed. The waiters seemed more attentive as the night went on. Anyone would enjoy their time here.

Came here for lunch with family. Love Thai food and it started off well with timeliness of dishes and drinks. The food is fine but my roti for my curry was so hard - it felt like it was either frozen and barely had time to thaw or was put in the microwave too long and hardened. It was basically inedible and was very disappointing. I just ate the curry and soup by itself. The rest was fine but it was very disheartening to have such a bad experience with the roti that it couldn't be made up by the other dishes. The crab fried rice was good but nothing outstanding I would say. For the price and quality of the food, I would not come back. The dish I liked the most was the papaya salad which I think was done well.

Came here on a weekend dinner and was surprised that I was able to walk in without a reservation given how many reviews there were on Yelp. The interior design of the place is absolutely beautiful, illuminated by so many different types of lights. I will say that they have a lot of Moroccan lanterns which are not quite Thai.

I ordered the Massaman Curry and it was quite good. First of all, I was really surprised to see guacamole in there but it was still very good regardless. I ordered the curry with tofu which was a bit bland for my taste but went well with the extremely flavorful curry. I also loved the addition of the peanuts to give it a bit of a crunch factor as well as the soft onion. I think next time if I order this dish I will definitely get it with a meat item.

Overall, not a bad place for Thai food. Is it the best food you will ever have? Probably not, but it will definitely satisfy your cravings.

4.25/5 Thai food spot I'll definitely return to try more dishes!

Service is fast and attentive. It's a big restaurant, but they seem like they have a system going on which I love. Interior is pretty typical for a Thai restaurant, dark but lots of overhead lights.

My favorite dish is definitely the Pad See Ew with beef. It's got a great smoky flavor, a well-seasoned sauce, and there's a lot of beef in it. Thai tea is not from a can (thankfully), so that's as expected. Tom Yum Goong (shrimp) was good, but I was hoping for the clear (non-coconut/not creamy version. It was too sweet for me. Lastly, the Similan curry with Thai roti is also good, as expected. Jasmine rice is mushy, not my favorite.

As said, I'd gladly return if I'm in the Upper East Side An's crave Thai food. And it's rare for a lot of restaurants I've been to in NYC. I think price point is great, and it would be my staple spot if I live in the area for sure!

Wow! One of the best Thai restaurants that I have ever eaten at! The crispy Duck with Wide noodle was delicious

Can not wait to go back and try something else!!!! Also had a nice atmosphere and was not crazy expensive.

~ Up Spring Roll ~
Love this spring roll, so delicious! The shell is thin and crispy, stuffed with generous amount of crab meat, shrimp, mushroom, glass noodle, cabbage and carrot!

~ Kea Mao w/ beef ~
I definitely like this more than pad se ew!! It's much more flavourful and spicy! (Personally I don't find it that spicy because i gwor up eating chilli/spicy food, but I think it probably would be quite spicy for a lot of people?) Great wok fried flavours and noodles are chewy! There are a lot of beef, they're marinated well and not very tough. Lots of bell peppers and onion as well.

Will I be back? Yes!
Quite good value, given the price and portion, and everything are great. These are pretty standard Thai food, so I won't say they are something special or spectacular, but it is well executed. Will be back to try other dishes!

I am visiting from out of town and me and my LS decided to try this place. The ambiance is very cozy and lightly lit.  My food was very delicious and the server, Pearl was very kind and attentive. I would recommend this place and will be returning.

Up Thai is a great place to have a casual dinner.

The basil fried rice was great. The curry puffs are phenomenal. They taste better without dipping them in anything and have a great after taste.

On a rainy Sunday evening, this place was packed. Consider reserving your seats.

I love Up Thai! It's got everything you want - amazing food, decor, service and lunch specials. I used to come by fairly often for said lunch specials when I worked in the UES.
I visited for dinner for the first time on a Wednesday evening around 9pm with a reservation for two. It was super busy, so I highly recommend taking the time to reserve a table if you're coming for dinner.
Along with lychee Thai tea, we ordered their chicken satay skewers, similan curry, and kea mao. Everything was just as delicious as I expected it to be! We especially loved the similan curry - so well flavored. Definitely will be coming back.

Up Thai has quickly become one of my staples. Not only does it have some of the best drunken noodles in the city, it's affordable (insane lunch special with app, salad, and entree) and the service is great. I've been able to walk-in and used the reservations, it's never too bad a wait. The inside is beautiful, wood everywhere and lovely decor. The tables were a touch crowded but I honestly kind of enjoyed it, the bustle made the place feel alive.

Like I said, the drunken noodles are top notch (I recommend with shrimp), and the spice levels are solid though nothing that blew my palette. Notably, I went with someone with dietary restrictions (vegetarian, no egg, no fish sauce) and they were more than accommodating/knowledgeable about the menu to make the correct recs and modifications. This person normally doesn't like Thai food and even she admitted the food was delicious!

Amazing lunch special, totally worth it!

Service: went for lunch, 2 people, no wait to be seated, quick service (done in one hour)

Food/drinks: I ordered the lychee martini, when I told them it was too strong they gave me agave to help so that was nice. The food awesome - I got the ginger salad, crispy spring roll & drunken noodles. All were so flavorful and delicious.

Ambiance: beautiful decor, clean bathrooms (have to go downstairs for)

Slightly above average thai food.

Calamari was good. (4.5/5)
Very crispy. Nice sauce. Very good portion. (It was kinda too large tho we had to take our mains to go).

Pad se ew was above average. (4/5)
It did not quite have the smokey flavor of pad se ew that I like. Other than that the sauce was good. ( maybe slightly too sweet).

Pad thai was average. (3.5/5)
Nothing too special. It was just a pad thai.

Great spot for Thai food! We ordered the up thai fried rice claypot, chicken pad see-ew, beef short rib panang, and moo dang for 4. Food portions are good, with the up thai fried rice and beef short rib panangs being standouts - both more unique food options that aren't typical at most Thai restaurants. Beef short rib was juicy and tender without being too dry, balanced by a slightly spicy curry, and definitely skillfully made where it's hard to replicate this at home. Up thai fried rice definitely resembles sticky rice with the crunchier edge texture courtesy of the clay pot, as well as some sweetness from the caramelized mushrooms and Taiwanese sausage. Moo Dang and Pad See Ew were on point but also more standard dishes, but no issues with them. Very lively restaurant ambiance, would come with groups and the vibes are good. Service was great, Elp was kind and attentive and provided good suggestions for ordering (he suggested the up thai fried rice and beef short rib panang). Looking forward to coming back!

This was my first Thai meal in NYC. My friend treated me a birthday meal at Up Thai as it has good ratings on Yelp and Google Map. They offer lunch special including veggie soup/salad and an appetizer (spring roll/dumpling).

Overall, it was delicious but nothing ground-breaking. Sadly I couldn't compare it with other Thai spots as I hvnt tried the others in town.

＊ Chicken Red Curry
The triangle-shaped rice was so adorable.The veggies were flavorful after soaking up the curry broth. It was on a sweeter side so not as spicy as imagined. You could gorge your jasmine rice quickly with a scoop of curry.

＊ Shrimp Pad Thai
I would recommend pairing your pad thai with tofu veggie or chicken, as the shrimps were a bit underwhelming. It didn't seem very fresh, and I was expecting sth like jumbo shrimps. The pad thai itself was good - chewy noodle tossed with sweet-and-tangy sauce - but not outstanding enough to justify a second visit.

Worth Returning ? Maybe. It's good for a quick lunch.

Up Thai is simply one of the best Thai places in Lenox Hill!

After a long productive day and getting into the city pretty late, my bf and I decided to try Up Thai on a whim and I'm so glad we did!!

Upon immediately walking in, we both thought the place was really cool. I was especially attracted to the dangly colorful lamps, which provided a low-light relaxing ambiance.

Our waiter was very friendly, smiley, and quick to ensure we were taken care of.

I ordered the Cashew Nut w. Tofu and my bf ordered beef and a side of vegetables. I was really pleased with my meal! When I saw other people ordering it, I knew I had to and it tasted even better in person. It was flavorful, delicious, and light. The tofu was cooked at just the right consistency as well.  

The beef wasn't too chewy--just right-- and had a unique flavor that we both warmed up to.

I'm so happy I tried Up Thai and I can't wait to come back in the future!

We discovered this restaurant just recently and so happy we did. We liked it so much and we definitely will come back.
The staff is very friendly and polite. We came shortly after the opening time and the place got filled with customers right away. By the time we were leaving , people were waiting to get in there.
The food was very very good, very fresh and tasty.
And prices are reasonable.
great service! All food was impeccable and place too. Would highly recommend this Thai restaurant for lunch or dinner.

Their dishes are sooo good you will need to pinch yourself to make sure you're not dreaming !!!

Every dish was beautifully plated and jam packed with flavor we literally licked every dish clean  you have to try the beef short rib panang it was sooo tender it just fell off the bone with ease  genuinely can't say anything bad about any dish they just kept getting better and it was very pretty inside great for a date night super fast service we barely waited for dishes to come out

This place is a great place to sit down and have dinner with a friend. I've definitely had better Thai food, but nonetheless I would recommend checking this place out. It has great service which is always a plus.

What I got:

Hai Gai Hor Bai Touy (Appetizer) - Wow, this was phenomenal. I loved the process of unwrapping the pandan leaves and the taste of the chicken + dip sauce was great. Definitely recommend this dish.

Pad Kea Mow - I'm not sure if this was just an off day, but I feel like this dish tasted better when I got it as take out. It's yummy, but I've definitely had better versions of this same dish elsewhere.

Passion fruit mojito - This was a pretty and yummy drink and had a good amount of alcohol content in it. I would recommend the Lychee Tini instead though, it tastes better imo.

Been here a couple times and enjoyed my food every time! My favorite is still their Talay Thai (Mixed Sea Food) curry. Even as take out, the curry is super aromatic and well-seasoned with a nice strong basil flavor. The shrimp, scallop, squid, and clam pieces were all pretty fresh. The Goong Muk Kaikem, one of their seasonal specials, features shrimp and calamari along with bell peppers and onions in a duck egg yolk sauce. Not sure if I'd call it a duck egg yolk sauce but it tasted more like a sweet soy sauce and basil based sauce with salted egg yolk pieces sprinkled on top. While it was very tasty, I wish it had more salted egg yolk flavors in it. The shrimp from this dish was a little overcooked but the veggies were good and soaked up the yummy sauce. Got another chance to try their khao soi which is a northern noodle dish. It wasn't a recommended dish (with the thumbs up sign) but I still wanted to try it cause I love khao soi noodles in general. Their version was alright - sauce could have been a little more flavorful and the noodles were a little overcooked.
Service is very good! Staff are super smilely/friendly and constantly checking in on you. Food comes out super quickly even when they are poppin on a busy weeknight. Definitely see how this is a UES staple and I'll be back for more!
We ordered Tom Yum, Tom Kha, and shrimp pie with plum sauce. It was amazingly delicious! This is my second time here and every time it's just amazing! The drinks are also very tasty!

One of my top 3 favorite Thai places in New York! The food is authentic and extremely flavorful. Our waiter Ploy P, is always attentive and friendly every time we dine in. I highly recommend the Kea Mao, Panang Curry, and Krapraw Moo Krob!

Came on a Tuesday night and man it's busy here! A tight area with a lot of small seatings! Service was amazing from the moment we walked in to the moment we walked out. But let me just say... PANANG CURRY.. best I've ever had! I love spicy and this spice was just a perfect amount. The basil fried rice was also. 5/5, would definitely have again. The padthai was a bit disappointing as It was dry and just not as authentic.

Mango wasn't in season so we had the tarp sticky rice and BAM. Hit the spot! In love with this place!!

A fantastic Thai restaurant! I was not expecting this level of quality and selection from a random Thai restaurant I just looked up. Make sure you make a reservation just in case!

Their menu is pretty expansive and they give you lots of protein choices. Highly recommend this place if you're feeling Thai!

Good food (not great) but not so good service.

I liked the interiors of the hotel but the service was not great. The server forgot that I had ordered tea to start with and then when I asked for an extra cup she made a face and did not get the cup. We had to ask another server to get it for us.

We ordered Crispy Spring Rolls which was not bad but nothing special. They had limited vegetarian options. I ordered Massaman Curry and Kea Mao. Kee Mao was very spicy (I wish they had asked us about the spice level). I enjoyed the Massaman curry.
Overall not a great experience. I might not return.

Up Thai is my go to Thai food in the UES! The food is amazing, and I often get it delivered when i'm looking for take out. I've never dined in the restaurant but have heard good things from friends who have.

I recommend the panang curry and pad thai, both are gluten-free and so delicious! The portions are large enough that I generally have leftovers that I can eat for lunch the next day.

I've been to Up Thai before several times whether it was dine in or take-out and I've always enjoyed it.  It's nothing to go crazy for but definitely one of the better options for affordable Thai food on the UES.  The drinks are good as well and I would venture back.

Good food but sweaty spot

Checked out this place on the recommendation of a friend. Made a reservation and was seated immediately. This placed is literally jam packed like a tetris game. It was a little too much for me as it was extremely loud and hot. We ordered our usual - pad thai and pad see ew. I decided to mix things up and ordered crispy duck with the see ew. It was tasty but nothing mind blowing, pretty much the typical Thai noodle fare. The duck was crispy but a little dry actually. We finished our meal quickly and left given the craziness of the atmosphere was getting to us. Overall, vanilla Thai fare but too crowded for my taste
Great place. great food/drink. good service. Will b included in my regular rotation !

One of my favorite Thai places in the city!

Reservations needed?: yes! And FYI they won't seat you until the entire party is there. This is place is busy!

The food: amazing! Quantity and taste were spectacular . I got the pad see ew and it was delicious and great quantity.

Drinks: my spicy margarita was the highlight of the drinks. My friends got the soju and they enjoyed theirs as well, but definitely want to get the spicy margarita next time.

Ambiance: the ambiance makes this place! Trendy but not too noisy

Vegetarian friendly? Yes! Lots of options.

This is one of the best Thai places in all of New York City. I got the Kai Soy, the food was amazing. I didn't like the soup and server was amazing and actually tried to make changes.
Kwan was an amazing waitress.

Delicious Thai food with great customer service. Pearl, our kind sever recommended the shrimp green curry and it was phenomenal! So juicy and creamy. The entree comes with rice. She also informed us all the dishes could be altered in spice. The crispy duck basil fried rice and chicken pad Thai was just as delicious. The crispy duck is a bit dry but the fried rice was the best I've ever had! Will try it with other proteins next time. The soft shell crab mango salad is refreshing and citrusy. The summer roll is all vegetables and small in size. The crispy spring roll was yummy! So full and the jasmine ice tea was refreshing! Will come back for sure, this is an authentic Thai restaurant with fabulous staff and great ambiance!

The Thai Iced Tea here is just immaculate! The food is obviously very delicious too. Came on a Saturday without reservations and was seated right away, although I still would recommend making reservations if you can. The interior is beautiful and very enchanted garden like. Staff is very friendly and service is extremely fast. Highly recommend!

My friend and I had a great lunch in this beautiful restaurant.  We were here for the weekday lunch after a few hours at The Met. The lunch special included soup or salad, a roll, and an entree.  The tofu soup and vegetarian spring roll was good. My entree of basil tofu was great with a fresh flavor and crunchy vegetables. My friend's vegetarian broad noodle entree was also really good although we both said medium spice but hers was more spicy.

Service was friendly but slower than you would expect for a weekday lunch. The restaurant was beautiful but sitting at the table felt cramped and kinda couldn't wait to finish up. I'm from the burbs so maybe small spaces is no issue for New Yorkers.

I would highly recommend Up Thai .

A great option for tasty Thai food in the Upper East Side! Wait is never too bad and the food comes out super quickly. We got the papaya salad, green curry, and cashew nut stir fry. Everything was delicious and fresh. A good amount of food too. I will definitely try to come back and try more dishes.

When you walk in, your immediate reaction is how pretty the space is. The ambiance is amazing inside because of how well decorated it is! For a Friday night, it was very busy and we had to book a reservation ahead of time.

As an appetizer, we tried the crispy spring rolls (3 for $9), which were delicious! They had lots of vegetarian filling including mushrooms, cabbage, glass noodles, etc. and paired well with the plum sauce. For a drink, I got a passion fruit mojito -- there wasn't that much of a passion fruit flavor, but it still tasted good.

I got the Nam Tok ($22) as an entree, which included grilled sliced top sirloin with dressing over greens and sticky rice. The meat was a bit cold and on the tougher side, but it had a nice spicy flavor. I probably wouldn't get this again, but would come back to try some of the other entrees even if they are on the pricier side.

while visiting NY my family and i ate here for our last meal! it was so yummy and had good portions of food! the pad see ew was our family favorite! customer service was great! they were very nice and served our food quickly! overall would recommend coming here!!

Enjoyed the lively ambience and flavorful dishes at Up Thai! Beautiful decor and drinks. I tried the Thai iced tea and it was delicious. The Taro sticky rice with ice cream was a nice dessert to end the meal with. Mimi was wonderful!

This was one of the best fried rice dishes I have had in awhile. Though I had ordered it as takeout, it was warm and quite delicious.

I had wish the tails were off the shrimp though this is a personal preference. Also, I wish there was a little bit more rice so the rice vs meat ratio was more at ease. However, the flavor was wonderful. Will definitely order this again
We love Ome!!! Ordered the panang curry, mango avocado salad and tom juad soup. All incredible. Such a greaT restaurant

Great Thai food.
Good prices and service.
Up Thai has great lunch specials.
One of the best Thai restaurants on the UES.

The ambience is great for dates. The food is also really good. You should make an appointment beforehand cause it can get super busy at night. I would recommend the claypit rice it was so flavorful and full of toppings. The chicken was a bit dry and overdone though.

Loved this place and can't wait to go back again and try different things on the menu.  We made a reservation for 4 people. (Do note that you only have 10 minute to show up with your whole party before they cancel your reservation.)  The exact time of our reservation we were called and were taken to our table. When you first walk in, it looks like a small restaurant, but when you go inside, it's a beautifully decorated, specious restaurant.  The food and customer service was just fantastic.  I ordered the Lychee Thai tea and the UP Thai Fried Rice Claypot.  It was just delicious to the last bite.  It was very flavorful.  Your tastebud will thank you!  Highly recommend getting the Claypot.  With the amount of food you get, the price is worth it.  

Highly recommend this place.

Stopped by for lunch post Aveda haircut and I'm not sure what's happening but the Thai cravings haven't stopped.. I Yelped Thai places on 2nd Avenue that were still serving lunch specials and Up Thai popped up.
I entered @2pm and this place was paacckked.: bar and tables with patrons. Up Thai's menu states it's upscale street Thai food. Well, all these customers were consuming upscale Thai food and guess who joined them.. moi!
I was seated right away and water and menu followed. The Lunch Special includes choice of soup or salad, one app and choice of curry, rice or noodle all starting at $14.
I chose the salad with ginger dressing, Spring roll  and Pad Se-Ew with Chicken. I also ordered their Thai iced tea.
The salad and Spring roll were served together; the salad was delicious and the ginger dressing was light. The salad was heavy on the radishes and no tomato or cucumber were included. The Spring roll was piping hot and not greasy served with a clear dipping sauce.
The Pad Se-Ew with Chicken was equally delicious: wide egg noodle, plentiful chicken and Chinese broccoli perfectly spiced. And.. a really generous portion for a lunch special.
The vibe here is relaxing, when the early lunch crowd leaves, nice  comfortable seating and  a glass divider between tables.
The Thai iced tea really hit the spot and was perfectly sweet.
The service is courteous, professional and accommodating.
Up Thai is conveniently located near the Q train 72nd Street Subway station.
Up Thai is a great lunch spot and certainly not Up Tight on your wallet.

Ume is actually an acronym:

Uh-MAZIN
