Momentously delicious
Extremely scrumptious

This place has the best sushi north of the Mason Dixon. Also, the service is Uh-MAZIN!

The ambiance is relaxed...

So...don't miss out and come have your Uh-MAZIN, MOMENTOUSLY delicious, EXTREMELY scrumptious sushi at Ume!!!!!!!

With only 17 reviews, I was slightly skeptical of Ume's 4.7 star rating, but decided to give it a shot and really glad we did.

Pretty sure this is a new-ish sushi spot and from the unassuming looks of it, you might assume it's one of the hundreds of mediocre sushi spots sprinkled throughout the city. These days, it's become so hard to find good sushi that isn't high end omakase. But this place nails it.

They have a large menu of sushi as well as lots of hot dishes. This is often a turnoff to me and a sign that the sushi won't be too good, but not the case. They serve really good sushi AND really good cooked food -- who would've thought this possible??

We started with gyoza, Kani salad and spicy tuna crispy rice. All were excellent. Gyoza and kani salad are usually not worth writing about, but both were amongst the best I've had. Crispy rice spicy tuna was maybe the single best I've ever had (yes, better than Tao and Nobu and all the gems). Really that good.

We moved onto sushi and got a mix of cut rolls + hand rolls, everything very fresh and delicious. Good rice, well prepared rolls, very nice fish. Enjoyed it all very much. Didn't get any pieces but suspect they would've been very good too.

Got a chicken teriyaki for the little one which was also very good.

Oh and if all this wasn't enough, did I mention they're BYO? Oh, and that there's a liquor store DIRECTLY next store. Grab yourself a bottle of Halutsuru junmai gingo sake for 20 bucks and and enjoy an excellent sushi + sake dinner.

Service and staff were amazing too! So accommodating especially with our 2 year old daughter.

A+!!!

Stopped in here late at around 9:45pm after a flight. They had a happy hour from 9-10pm, lots of rolls and other grilled appetizers for $6.  I just had a few of these small dishes, everything was good and very fast. Service was also excellent, very friendly. Everyone around me seemed to having a great time and they kept saying the food was so delicious, so I probably didn't try enough. A good fast sushi place to eat in a busy part of NYC.

Walked in for lunch today. The place was clean, the server was attentive, food came quick and delicious. I really loved the crispy tuna appetizer, I would come back just for this, best one I have had so far. The place looks unassuming but food was delicious and the fish was fresh. I will try more of their sushi / nigiri next time. The great reviews are real! This was a really good find today.

The sushi was very good, we had numerous items at happy hour and for that price it is hard to beat. Staff were extremely polite and were even kind to our small children. The inside was very quaint and quiet.

So fresh. Large pieces of fish in every roll. The Christmas roll is my favorite, a hint of lime, a touch of jalapeño, and cilantro. Not too spicy, but oh so good! BYOB with a liquor store next door! Staff are super friendly.  I just found this restaurant and it's immediately my go to for sushi.

Wonderful locals sushi restaurant with great taste, generous portions, and extremely welcoming service. With lots of options around, Ume stands out as the place you want to go back for an any-night sushi dinner or lunch. We love all our local sushi restaurants and Ume is definitely one we will be back to often.
Amazing food! Now it's my favorite sushi place, always fresh, good portions and reasonable price

It is hidden jewels. One of the best restaurant in Lenox hill Upper Eastside. Great price with fresh food. Owner has a pride to provide healthier foods on the table. Very friendly and courteous to every customer. This week don't forget to try Uni.
The sushi is fresh and delicious, the service is excellent and the ambiance very cozy and peaceful. Great Energy

Great sushi, great price! They were fast and had a great atmosphere. Kind staff! Would go again. They had an open concept with the outdoors which was awesome as you could enjoy outside without having to be at a table on the sidewalk like most tables

This is a great little sushi restaurant. Dining in is a cozy experience - a small comfortable space with only a few tables, and a very friendly and welcoming staff.
The sushi is really impressive - the quality is much better than you'd expect from a small restaurant like this one (really great for the price too). It's fresh and flavorful with generous portions and very nicely prepared by the chef.
The menu is pretty big with several interesting appetizers, drinks, and desserts.
The sushi I got when I ordered takeout was just as good quality, fresh, and was ready fast!
This will be my new go-to neighborhood spot from now on, for sure.

Wow!! We had such an amazing experience here. We started with miso soup which was perfect, then we got a few rolls and handrolls which were so fresh and tasty! For entrees we got the pineapple fried rice and poke bowls which were also perfect!! They have such a great menu I can't wait to come back and try more of their entrees (especially the habachi)! The service was excellent. They were very friendly and attentive and the place has a great,  zen vibe. It is also BYOB!! Highly recommend!!

I've been here more then a half a dozen times. The sushi is on par with Zawa and better the sushi seki. The service is great. It's also BYOB.  The ambiance isn't that great but if you are going for high end nigiri I would recommend giving it a try.

Update- I have eaten here two more times and it's delicious! They have crispy rice which is a personal favorite and hard to come by, I also love the Ume Roll and spicy edamame. Next time I will be trying the Hibachi meals. They are also reliable with delivery!

The lunch special was a good deal but the sushi was horrible. I had the jalapeños scallion (looked and tasted like mush), spicy salmon (tasted awful, no flavor), and the salmon skin (only thing that was decent).

On top of the food being bad!  the waitress decided to add her own tip to my receipt. I know for the future to always take my receipt. The food was bad and the waitresses goes rouge. Do not eat from this place! Always take a pic of your receipt, because you never know when they decide to have no morals!

Also, the table smells like they just painted with awful chemical paint!
I came here with my family.Great food and good price.Tuna Sub is one of kind.I will definitely come back again!

A huge improvement over the previous sushi place that used to be here. Granted the pretty much only do sushi now (instead of sushi/Thai/Indian/Chinese). The tuna was fresh and good portions for the price. I got it to go so can't comment on the service. The interior was just ok - not sure I'd sit down for a full dinner.

Wonderful local sushi restaurant. Fresh, interesting rolls. It also has cooked Asian food, which I haven't yet tried. Very friendly staff. I've only ordered take out, but the restaurant is nice and cozy. And it's BYOB (a liquor store on the same block). A big improvement over the previous Asian restaurant.

A new neighborhood favorite! Intimate and relaxed with warm friendly service and some of the freshest sushi in the area. Also has delicious appetizers and noodle dishes. And love the tapas happy hour menu. Highly recommend!
Got the salmon avocado and eel avocado rolls. Both product and price were on point. Will definitely be going back again.
So happy to have a great priced and good quality sushi restaurant in the neighborhood! We did takeout but definitely want to try it in person next!
Great sushi, excellent service, cozy quiet neighborhood gem.  Really enjoyed the sushi and sashimi. Staff was friendly and food came out fairly quickly. Will definitely come here again.
The staff are amazing, the food is good and portions are great. This is my go to breakfast spot!  Love it!

The French toast here is amazing, sweet and very fluffy. I would advise you to only get it once a week though, because they taste like what I imagine a thousand calories tastes like. You should also avoid them if sugary things make you queasy. But if you have a sweet tooth, they are an excellent breakfast. Also, I am pretty sure the orange juice is fresh squeezed, and it's divine.
This place has some standard American breakfast options. The hot chocolate was really good, the sausage that came along with the big boy breakfast was mind blowing. The service was fast and great.

I walk by here all the time and decides to finally stop in! They do not take reservations. I was waiting for my friend to come meet me and told the hostess that. She kept updating me on when a table would be available for us, which I appreciated so much! She said that she had 3 tables leaving soon, so I hoped that I would get one of those tables.

This spot is more low-key than I thought - and in a good way! My friend and I stayed for 3 hours... because we had a lot of catching up to do. But we never felt rushed or anything. And we would have left if people were waiting for a table.

I got the classic eggs Benedict ($16) and a hot vanilla latte ($5). The eggs Benedict came with home fries which were super yummy. I thought the food was flavorful and well portioned. The latte was good too - it was actually flavorful and tasted like a quality latte.

Note: the prices online are slightly different than the ones on the menu.

I would definitely come back and try other dishes on the menu.

Came here for a casual Sunday brunch. The neighborhood is very pleasant in a Sunday afternoon and the outdoor seating is perfect for appreciating it.

The salmon egg benedict is very well made with great home fries. The iced cappuccino was a bit bland in comparison. But overall it was still a great experience and I recommend the place.

Came for breakfast with a large group on a Sunday (about 10 people) and am so grateful they were able to accommodate us all!

We were seated and attended to pretty immediately which was lovely. We were constantly given water and they were super attentive to our orders. Food wise i ordered a basic oatmeal which was good although a little on the watery side. My friends who ordered avocado toast were unimpressed- it came looking like guac on bread whicb isnt traditionally what people expect when ordering avo toast.

i would probably not return as i was unimpressed with the food but 10/10 would recommend for service!!!

Nice decor inside and relaxing vibes. I was there in the evening time after 7pm, it's not crowded ar all.
No waiting time. The seats are very comfortable.
:)  services are wonderful. I'd def com back. It's walking distance from Blooming deal department.

I came here with my mom to catch up and get something to eat. Service is attentive however, this is more like an overpriced diner. Prices don't matter to me as long as the food tastes  good and it's good quality. Drinks are not good either. Everything taste very cheap. Like I don't think I will come back here again/ not my kind of place.

The service was attentive and the inside was cozy. I ordered the ($28) Lobster Roll with my fries well-done. The lobster roll itself was nothing to write home about--light on the mayo and did not have much flavoring to it, bread not buttered, but the fries were cooked to a perfection. The portion of lobster was appropriate for the price point. Enjoyed the experience overall but was not blown away with my particular dish.

Good place, nice interior, polite, friendly staff. Tasty breakfasts and coffee, I really liked eggs benedict with salmon. Beautiful panoramic view from the window.  Very pleasant service experience. The prices are acceptable. We really liked this place

Cute French vibe café!

Good food! Very relaxing.
I recommend the Latte with almond milk, kale salad with salmon, brownie with ice cream for dessert (portion was huge!), and the pear martini is delish!

Service was great, very attentive!

Great vibe, tasty food and delectable drinks, but extremely loud all hours of the day--if not due to crowds then due to excessively loud music.  I dig the place, but not a great place to take a date (unless s/he's the silent type...!).

Food great! Service terrible. Inside is nice but seats are a little dirty for $32 for a salad and fries. Nice place to sit on patio with a drink and food, but don't expect to have your dietary concerns taken into account or attentive waiters.

Truffle Mac n cheese was to die for, and coffee was good all around. Wine/drinks seemed to be priced up exponentially, but the breakfast bowl was more than enough for two meals and the French toast was a hit!

Stopped in one early afternoon cause I was in the area. Not a place I will go out of my way to get to but if I'm around I'll choose to eat here as opposed to other options near by. Breakfast was good and filling. Of course I got their hand cut fries cause they're always amazing. French toast fluffy and flavorful. Worth a try for breakfast at minimum, can't speak for the other menu items.

This is an upscale diner with above average diner food. I love the avocado toast!! They also have Greek foods such as the moussaka. I wish the menu featured more plant based options, but as I said, they do have a good variety of foods and a range of cocktails. If you want to take your friends or family to an above average diner, this is the place. I like how they don't rush you out. Beware that prices are high. I would come back here again when I get a raise.

Food 5/5
Service 4/5
Drinks 4/5
Value 3/5

Great brunch spot. I had the salmon benedict and it was very good and they didn't skimp on the lox. Also, their grilled halloumi appetizer is delicious. Pancakes are fluffy and filling, I stole a bite from their big boy breakfast.

Service was a tad slow but other than that it's a solid spot for a casual brunch or lunch.

This is the place to go after getting your roots done and you're walking your boss's French poodle or to come with your family and friends to practice your english and pretend you don't understand the waiter if he talks to you in Spanish. The fish and chips tasted like nothing. I think it happens when the fish is kept frozen for long time.. The environment inside is tacky. They don't have nice decoration and have huge TVs like in sport bars.
So, you can't come here bc of the food... neither the environment.

Came for Brunch and was seated rather quickly for it being so busy. Met the manager Yanni and he was helping everyone checking in and making it a really friendly environment to be in.
Enjoyed the food so much, will most def come back for brunch again! Thank you for an enjoyable Sunday!
Good food and atmosphere, a bit pricey, but worth it! I hade a fresh tuna salad, low calorie and delicious.

I only went out for drinks I did look at the menu it's definitely café menu with burgers and a little more than just a café. It was hot out and they didn't have any air-conditioning on or it wasn't working.

Sat at the bar for a lychee martini and some fries. Found out after I ordered that there is happy hour pricing on wine but the bartender never mentioned it. The martini was good, but the canned lychee was rotten. I informed the bartender. Her response was "we just opened it today and nobody else has complained". I couldn't believe how little she cared. I didn't ask for a refund or a freebie - I just didn't want her to serve bad lychees to other customers. This is my first and last time here. With so many other excellent restaurants in the area, why have this overpriced cocktail and bad service?

I love coming here! This is my go to spot when I want something casual and quick. Everything I've ordered has been delicious whether it's breakfast lunch or dinner. Service is also really good. Will say prices are a little expensive but it's really good!
Cute place in upper east side not impressed with branzino but they spinach is good and comes with asparagus. The pancake has a taste of cinnamon

Surprisingly delicious fries! Im enjoying this whole outdoor dining, sitting on sidewalks and observing a new quiet manhattan.

Staff were really sweet, it was late at night towards closing and they still took us for a drink and food (we had to order something with drinks - law!)

I wonder what they're like during brunch, i wouldn't put it past them that its great!

Came here around 830 on a Monday for a cup of coffee of coffee and some mozzarella sticks. I was told the coffee was stale so I had a double espresso instead. The mozzarella sticks were great. Nice service, could see this being a great local spot if you live in the neighborhood

I see based on the yelp reviews that this place does not have the best reputation. That said I genuinely enjoyed my food and wanted to include my review!

Some friends and I picked up food from this place while we were around the city area. They nicely packed all the food for us in great containers and gave it to us in an easy to carry bag.

I got the avocado BLT here and it was honestly really really good. The bacon was just the right amount and the mayonnaise on it was a lemon flavor mayonnaise. My BLT also came with fries. The sandwich was large enough that I was not able to eat both halves in one sitting so I actually got two meals out of it.

Overall I would return! It was very tasty and very filling

Delicious club sandwich topped with fries! I love this local spot and have been here multiple times for breakfast and lunch. The corner view is quite nice and the staff is extremely attentive. There is always a nice sized crowd eating here every time I walk by. The club sandwich is very filling and was  satisfying. Will definitely return!

Came here to in search of a traditional breakfast and we got it. They have a good selection of eggs plates, pancakes, French toast, etc.

The cranberry juice was yummy! Can't go wrong with that. I ordered the cheese omelette and it was good.

+ The service was really friendly and at your pace.
+ The food was made quickly and it came out hot.
+ The potatoes were really soft and the egg was cheesy.
+ The location itself is in a nice area of the UES near a lot of shopping.

- Note that this place is pretty expensive. You can expect to pay about $20+ for a plate and drink. The expected tip starts at 25%.

Great customer service every time we go. Attentive and friendly wait staff. The manager replaced my salad when my dressing on the side spilled into my salad. I'm so picky but he was very gracious about it. Food is always really fresh - I really love their Greek salad because it's fresh cut veggies without any lettuce. Tasty feta and soft pita. I get poached eggs on the side. Price is a bit high but it's Manhattan - of course the price is high. They have almond milk for my coffee.

I had pancakes and it was very delicious. I really loved the place and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a nice place to eat breakfast.
The staff was really friendly.
I appreciate the free Wi Fi
I will visit this place in my next trip to NYC.
Since last visit 3 years ago, now it's covid so it was quieter on Tuesday. Mac & cheese wasn't quite my favorite but turkey burger is so awesome!! I had to have it again!!

I have to say I really enjoyed my breakfast. The price was a bit high for my liking but considering the location it is understandable.

We arrived just in time for a Sunday breakfast/brunch around 10:30 AM. About 20 minutes into arriving the restaurant had groups awaiting tables.  The server came over right away and was very friendly.

I ordered the Big Boy Breakfast with coffee. The eggs were scrambled nicely with cheese, fluffy buttermilk pancakes and a side of sausage. The plate was big indeed and quite filling. My friend has the salmon Benedict and seemed pleased with her meal as well.

If in the area I would return.

Had a quite a pleasant experience trying out their menu here on a Sunday afternoon. The storefront is very easily identifiable due to its round corner and large fonts. Upon entering its quite an appealing atmosphere, although the walk way might be a little narrow the whole restaurant is on an open space making it seem quite lively when you get to see everything going on at once.

We had try out their Eggs Benedict and some Avocado BLT sandwiches. The sandwiches are quite nicely made with fresh ingredients and nicely crispy bacon. I just wished it was a little bigger though, but it was quite delicious indeed.

The Eggs Benedict was decent although the hollandaise sauce seem to lack a distinct flavor on its own, but the eggs were cooked as we wanted with a bit of running yolk. I also like how they have a bit of bacon mixed in the potatoes.

Service was quite nice despite the full house. Although we got seats right away and didn't have to wait. The two bathrooms they have are quite huge indeed! Its too bad they couldn't convert of that space to fit more patrons. Definitely a recommended place.

I came here for brunch. The menu is large, as are the portions. The food is good, not stellar, and a bit overpriced. The service is quick. They are fairly loose on COVID restrictions (they asked if I could show my vaccine card, and as I was taking it out, they just led me to my table).

Just ate here. Really appreciate how well they are taking the COVID pandemic seriously. I've seen staff clearly tell others to pay close attention to the max occupancy. So thank you for doing your part. The food here was great. From Club Sandwich and steak everything I had was great quality. I'd totally recommend anyone to eat here.

Atmosphere is great, food is great and the service was great!!!

It's a little on the pricey side, I kind of think of it as a more expensive diner, but the food is better than at your average diner, so I'm OK with the trade off. I needed a dinner spot, and kinda insisted on picking this place over a cheaper place that deals in more greasy spoon food, and I was happy with my meal.

Fried calamari was delicious. Nice batter, a decent portion for one person, a petite portion if you're sharing haha. The avocado toast with shrimp was really good, but they put a little too much dressing on it and that overpowered some of the other flavors and made the bread a little soggy. My friend had a red onion she didn't want and I chopped it up and added in on top for a nice bite and crunch.

We split tiramisu and I thought that was nicely done too. They were playing mainly whimsical, upbeat music: Yellow Submarine, Sixpence None the Richer's Kiss Me, Seal's Kiss from a Rose. Service was extremely talkative and friendly. The bathroom doors are super aggravating and hard to close, but do look very expensive and classy ;)

Great place for Happy Hour in the neighborhood. You have to sit at the bar, but there's also some couch like seating for bigger groups. The menu isn't extensive, but the choices are great.

For $15, you get 6 oysters and a pint of beer. I didn't like the beer that was offered, so the bartender graciously let me get a glass of white wine instead. The oysters come on a huge platter of ice with all the fixins. I was happy that the oysters were clean and fresh. (I went to a near by spot that had a similar offer and the oysters were not clean...yuck!) The white wine she paired went perfect with the shellfish. I also tried the buffalo wings and cheese platter.

The buffalo wings were the style I like. Crispy and crunchy without sauce. Unfortunately, they were way too salty. The cheese platter was much tastier. It also came with a glass of wine.

Overall, I really like the place and will return for the awesome Happy Hour specials.

2 words: Chicken. Sandwich.

The best chicken cutlet sandwich I've ever had. Plus the chairs were very comfortable.
egg not fresh, don't choose the bacon especially for omelette. They'll make your omelette hard as mixed with sands or rocklet
Had the Mediterranean salad which was quite tasty and ordered the quinoa with salmon to go, which my friend loved. My client always gets the burger here with grilled (read burnt) onions and loves it.

Tuesday evening 6:30 PM. Table for 6. Not crowded. Noise level (for NYC) moderate .

Warning: They do not have any round tables so a party of six is awkward. Unless you are in the middle you loose conversations from the other end of the table.

Pro: Not much competition in the neighborhood. Nice informal setting. Seated promptly. Service slow but friendly. We never felt rushed to leave. The french fries were very good. The Shishito peppers (appetizer) at $10 were a standout bargain.

Con: I think the dishwasher was cooking tonight. My moussaka (special of the night) was pretty ghastly. Burger ordered medium-rare came out well done.

Bottom line: Almost all the dishes  were at best mediocre. No excuse when prices are top draw. Draft beer $8, Pastas $22-29, Burgers $18-20. I understand that this is a high rent district. Located in Trump Plaza Building (for which you may wish to deduct a half star).

My advice, keep expectations low. Keep orders simple.
the attention is terrible, they treated us badly and they throw the plates on our table.  The food is not fresh, it is reheated!

I have been here around 4-5 times. Food is generally solid, sort of a diner atmosphere but a bit higher quality food than you would ordinarily find at a diner. I have had the waffle and the american breakfast, both of which are pretty well done. Service is good as well.

Good food for a diner but nothing mindblowing so 4/5 stars.
Great food and service! I would definitely recommend! Casual upscale diner with great food all good things to say!

This place is incredibly busy on a Sunday and after having a delicious brunch here I can see why. The service was great, but the food was even better. I'm not a mimosa person so I had their Bellini and let me tell you it did not disappoint. It was perfect and bubbly. Before leaving we were greeted by the manager Yanni at our table, he was super nice and welcoming and made sure we had a great experience. Will definitely be coming back!
We have been waiting for over an hour and they still haven't delivered. No explanation not even bringing bread.

Came into the restaurant around 12:30pm and placed my name on the waiting list shortly after. Stood in front of the door for nearly 45 mins, getting passed up by other customers while I waited patiently for a table! I eventually went back to the podium to ask the "'manager" about a seat. He notified me that I was next on the list. I continued to be patient and wait as he CONTINUOUSLY skipped over my name & sat other people. I went back to the podium only for him to notify me this time that I could not be sat until the other guest was there (which would have been fine had I been notified when I got there). Why was I told that AFTER being there for 30 mins and two visits to the podium??? The managers clear dismissive attitude and lack of care was VERY evident from the start. I really HATE to play the race card because everything is not black and white... however, I am ABSOLUTELY sure that I was not immediately sat because of the color of my skin!!!! I was the only African American person  who waited for a seat longer than the quoted wait time. I do not recommend supporting this business!!

This place is amazing!!! Love the environment!!! And the music is very energetic makes me feel like home ! Servers are very attentive and the food is one of the best part of the restaurant!!!! I will definitely invite and family and friends !!!!! And by the way they definitely do take care of Covid restrictions so makes it a safe place to come and eat and drink as well !! And the Staff are all welcoming and friendly!!! Simply love this place !!!!!!!  One of my favorite spots to come and eat !!!!!

Amazing food! Some of the best food i've ever had for breakfast. Only rating 4 stars instead of 5 because the staffing is a little odd because there were 4 servers on but only one other table in the restaurant yet it still took a half hour for a server to greet us. Besides this though the staff was friendly and food was amazing. Will definitely come back!
Uncle Vinny's was exactly what we wanted for a NY pizza. Clean interior. Employees were very kind and made recommendations. Pizza was excellent and exactly what we wanted.

Uncle Vinny's Pizza popped up overnight, while I was briefly out of town, taking over Best Pizza #2's spot. I wasn't expecting much, but I was pleasantly surprised by the walnut, mozzarella, tomato, basil, balsamic slice. (I had never had walnut on pizza before, but the server recommended it.) Actually, I was pleasantly surprised by my entire box. This place definitely hits the spot when you're looking for a quick, casual dining experience. And the slices taste better than they look, especially heated up. The server looked pretty tired (at 11:30 pm) but was friendly and even offered a couple of us zeppoles to try. I'll be back sometime.
The quality of this pizza reminds me of the pizza I ate growing up in bk, back in the day. This place is a gem.

Excellent food amazing Service and great ambience.
Highly recommend
definitely five stars

Dining here left us... confused? We were so excited to get a nice Saturday brunch and sit in their garden area, however, what transpired next left us shaken.

1. It took the staff over 20 minutes to even ask for our drink order. My friend had to walk up to the bar and ask if our table could be waiting on. Finally without even an apology, the server reluctantly took our order, this was probably at least 30 minutes after we had originally sat down. We though "okay whatever fine, surely the food will be worth the wait!"

2. The food literally took FOREVER to come out. I would've had time to fly to Europe in between when we ordered and when the food finally came out. On the bright side at least we had plenty of time to chat and take care of some personal admin while we waited for 45+ minutes for our food!

3. When our food did finally arrive it was.... disappointing to say the least. I ordered the egg while omelette and it had zero flavor, it was at least edible, which my friend's dish (the fried eggs) was not. Another note: when they finally brought our food out they practically threw it on the table and placed a hot plate directly on my hand... bizarre.

4. Specifics about the food: the fried eggs were so beyond overdone that they were inedible. The ham on the fried eggs was questionable as well and the whole dish had zero seasoning. They also got the order wrong  and forgot to put mushrooms on it. The French toast was fine.... If you come here just don't get their brunch food.

5. When my friend sent her food back the waiter took it away without even an apology or an offer to bring something else instead....

Overall we just simply weren't served at all! I could've done something better in my own home. Not worth it, waste of time and money. We're just confused because we had heard great things about this place and were so excited to try! We left wishing was had just gotten hotdogs in the park instead. Seriously unacceptable service.

Long story short: wasn't amazing but would go back.

Went on a Friday evening and was able to walk up and get a table for two outside with no wait. The waiter and wait staff were polite and service was quick but not too quick. I liked the casual vibe of the restaurant. The tagliatelle bolognese was pretty standard, would get it again. The prosciutto ravioli was not what we expected (filling is like crispy prosciutto) and probably wouldn't order it again.

I'd been meaning to come here for a while and I'm glad they had a day of reservation available on a Monday night! It was a beautiful, very intimate restaurant with lots of 2 person candlelit tables. We sat at the back that was maybe somewhat outside but very well heated and so cute. I ordered the gnocchi di ricotta which was tasty but I wish it had even more sauce! We also got free bread at the table.

Was recommended by a colleague. Nothing extraordinary but the vibe was very chill and relaxed (went on Halloween night for dinner). Service was okay as we would've liked for our waiter to check in on us a bit more. Food was mediocre. I would try out the spot but would 't visit twice.

I've been to UVA years ago and it's nice to see they're still as popular as they were (primarily for that famous gnocchi).  I also see that there's an "UVA Next Door" quite literally next door.  I'm not sure how the menu differs but I would definitely try it.  My friend and I got the caprese salad and meatballs to start which complemented each other well.  

In addition to the appetizers, the olive oil they use here is fantastic- my friend is Italian and he agrees!  As for the mains of course we got pasta- my friend ordered the special and I forgot the name of the one I got but it was prosciutto filled ravioli with a creamy mushroom sauce.  The portion could've been a bit bigger IMHO but it was adequate enough.  Naturally I wanted the tiramisu after but didn't have any room- until next time!
It was good, not wow-ing. Staff was friendly and my water was always filled! The inside was adorable but very tightly packed. The food was good but not amazing. The bread was delicious sour dough.

WOW! Uva is an absolute dream, and quickly transforming into one of my favorite places on the UES. I'm not normally a huge fan of Italian food, but this is probably one of the best places I've ever been.

If you're going to order anything, get the gnocchi di ricotta. This gnocchi is made with a truffle sauce and was legitimately SO GOOD. Most gnocchi I've had in the past tends to be very dense -- but this was textured perfectly and an absolute explosion of flavor.

My friend and I also split the mezzelune alla boscaiola, which was quite good as well. I didn't *love* it, but that's just personal preference. This ravioli is stuffed with prosciutto and mozzarella, and the sauce that it's cooked in is absolutely divine.

Overall, the service is very attentive, and the ambiance makes you feel like you've been transported to Italy. I can see why people line up for Uva -- I certainly would again.

They have a cute garden in the back-it's been a while since I've been here. The food was decent, the pasta with chicken was lacking in my opinion with flavor but the reason why I wanted to come here again was to comment on the dessert!!! The girella Al cioccolato was amazing and I was basically watering from the mouth. Imagine a ferrer rocher in dessert form. I would go back just for this. The sponge cake with the ice cream and Nutella was so great together...and not that expensive either!

You know a restaurant is really good when a yelper totally forgets to photograph most of the food because they are too busy actually enjoying it!

I can't tell you everything we ordered because it's all a blur now but I can say without a doubt that it was a fantastic meal and our group of 20 left smiling.

The aperol spritz was very refreshing and the burrata was delicious. I had the ragu pappardelle which was perfection.

Service was excellent. Ambiance was great. No doubt highly recommend to anyone visiting the city in need of a great Italian dinner.

Just stopped by here last night.  Before I say anything:  I almost never go to Italian restaurants in NYC, because I'm a giant snob and I get to travel to Italy itself pretty often; so usually the food in this city (besides pizza) is insanely overpriced or just not that good, as far as I'm concerned.

That said, I was happy and pleasantly surprised by my visit here.  They have fairly genuine dishes that do a great job of at least approximating what you could get in a decent joint over in Italy.

They're clearly quite popular and successful - the restaurant was jam-packed (even with multiple outdoor seating areas) by 7-ish on a Monday night.  

While not obscenely expensive, you're definitely paying for quality - I got a bit of antipasti (a good selection of cold cuts and cheese) and a parmigiana di melanzane as an entree, plus a drink, and ended up spending about $60-70 just for myself.

But yes, the quality overall was good, and again their menu has some excellent options for both a primo or secondo piatto.  Just as importantly, their staff were super attentive and friendly - despite how mega-busy they clearly were.

The one thing I was bummed out about is that they only serve their pizza after 10:00 pm - I hear it's great, but no luck trying it since we were done with food by about 9:30.  I'm sure they have their reasons but it'd be great to expand their hours into earlier in the evening.

Anyhow I'd be happy to come back and see if the pizza lives up to the hype.

let me preface the substance of the review by telling you: if you want a quiet dinner, don't go on a weekend. Having said that, I can attest to the fact that the vegetable antipasto is fantastic. The pasta alla Norma was exemplary. The bread is good. The service is enthusiastic and pretty professional.

It's a beautiful restaurant full of charm. But boy it can get really noisy between the music and the crowd indoors on the weekend.

Hot damn! This place rocks and it opens late. The focaccia with cheese abs truffles is phenomenal and worth coming from your home no matter how far you live.

Just a top drawer situation. Great staff.
Amazing food! Phenomenal service and great environment. Sat in the back garden area and it was super cute.

Service just a bit slow, but pleasant, attentive and friendly.

The food is a great blend of typical Italian dishes with a NYC flair.  

Definitely a place to stop and enjoy and filling and tasteful meal with friends.

Add this one to your list.

Rustic and cozy atmosphere with helpful and attentive wait staff.  This place has a great vibe with excellent Italian food and gets high marks for presentation.  Burrata Berese as well as the Burrata Caprese were both creamy, fresh and delicious. We had seven in our group so we decided to try both.  The Berese has the traditional tomato, peppers and basil while the Caprese has an interesting combination of fava beans, yellow tomatoes and a balsamic glaze. Both excellent choices as was the Calamari Grigliati which was grilled and served over a lovely arugula salad.  The mini veal meatballs were extremely dry and although the sauce was good I wouldn't order them again.

The  Costi Di Manzo Brasate short ribs were tender as could be. Pappardelle Al Ragu Di Vitello was excellent, fresh ribbons of pasta topped with a veal Ragu. Truffle Gnocchi while good was very rich in a creamy black truffle sauce.  There was also an extensive wine list and cocktail menu.  Overall excellent dining experience that I would recommend.

Went to Uva for dinner and it was so busy! Loved that they allowed my Mimi to join in on our meal! We had a table in the garden.

I generally enjoy the food here. Particularly our calamari salad, eggplant parm and the veal ragu with homemade pasta ribbons. I was disappointed the veal ragu was mainly sauce and barely any ground veal. And the side Brussels sprouts with pancetta. I was surprised that this dish was substitute with bacon, which were also huge slices. Would've preferred smaller bits. Just felt very overpowering with the bacon. However since the pieces were large it was easy to remove.

I loved that all of my dishes came out very hot! And my server was attentive!

The other note of disappointment was the wine by the glass list. I debated which one to order between the super tuscan vs Chianti. Neither was up to my liking and I normally love these two wines. However the by glass option was horrible. So I opted for the Cabernet, which had a fuller body.

Overall, minus the wine by the glass list, the food is solid and flavorful. Will definitely return.

I've been wanting to check this place out. I came on a Friday night during prime dinner time (7 pmish). My friend and I didn't have a reservation but they were able to seat us in one of the outdoor seating (which had heat lamps).

I got the shrimp fettuccine ($27) and an aperol spritz ($18). The pasta was good and I was pleasantly surprised by how generous the portion was. Service was great! Our meal also came with bread and olive oil.

Chose this spot for a romantic dinner date and it delivered. The interior is beautifully decorated and the dim lighting sets the scene for a memorable night. We sat inside but they have seating outside which looked welcoming as well.

Ordered the wrapped mozz to start, was tasty and interesting twist on a mozz stick. Followed with the the cavatelli pesto and the short rib. Short rib was my favorite- very tender and its a big portion. The cavatelli was just ok, was a bit bland for my taste and slightly over cooked but not terrible. Got the almond tarte to finish, was dryer than I would have liked, regular icecream topping, nothing special. They served house bread.

Strictly on the food, its probably a 3.5 but the vibe and service bumped this rating. Gets busy so would make a resy. I would return but order something different.

Recently moved to the UES so I had to check out this UES Italian spot that all my coworkers talk about! The food was good but unfortunately didn't stand out as expected and the service was only alright.
-INSALATA BIANCA (white salad): Nice mix of artichokes, endive, and fennel with parmigiano and mushrooms. Definitely different from your typical salad but I felt like the seasoning could be a little stronger.
-MEZZELUNE ALLA BOSCAIOLA (mushroom ravioli): Tasty mushroom sauce with meat ravioli. Well seasoned in (meat filling) and outside (sauce).  As a huge mushroom lover, this dish definitely hit all the right spots. I just wish they had more pieces.
-PETTO D'ANATRA (duck entree): The duck was very tender and appreciated the thyme sauce. Love how it came with sautéed spinach and some potatoes. Good flavors overall.
-Brussle sprouts: Also fire!!! I think they deep fry it so the whole thing is super crunchy (not just the outside).
-Frose: Pretty solid and strong!
Loved the ambiance with the hustle and bustle indoors vs the greenhouse vibes outdoor (but still covered) seating. It can be loud inside and quite hot outside nevertheless. Appreciated the candle light lighting. I felt like our server was a little disappointed when my party of 4 didn't order as many apps/entrees as others would typically. Although friendly, she kept asking if we needed to order more so it made me feel a little uncomfortable. Food came out pretty quick even on a busy Saturday night.

I came here on a Wednesday night and it was busy so definitely make a reservation! I had come for brunch before and didn't love but my dinner was delicious. Service was quick and the outdoor dining section is cute. I got the rigatoni alla siciliana and it was perfectly al dente and the portion size perfect for me. Would definitely return and try other dishes!

Nothing to phone home about imo. The bruschetta was extremely light and crispy which I loved. But the shrimp didn't make me go, I need more of this!

My date was salivating over his eggplant parm but maybe it's because I'm not an eggplant person; I found it very mid lol. But I won't tell him that he'll be heartbroken

Extensive wine menu and 3 non alcohol drink options, which I very appreciated. I'm trying to appreciate sobriety and I don't care for wine anyway. Cocktails though, that's another story.

The gnocchi is a must eat.
I'm honestly not a huge fan of gnocchi in general, but this dish at Uva completely changed the game for me.
Savory, umami, and buttery. I could eat this every day.

We went as a party of 2 at around 7 on NYE, and we got seated right away. It was so cute and festive inside with every square inch of the ceiling covered in balloons. Service was attentive, and overall we had a great dining experience!

Uva is a solid spot for a brunch date or a tasty Italian meal! Stopped in on a Saturday afternoon with no wait. BF and I were seated in a sunny greenhouse-like area in the back of the restaurant. I actually liked the ambiance a bit more than in the front room -- the main dining room is very dark, although still very nice.

We went for their brunch but the pastas looked like the real standout to me, so I ended up getting the mezzelune boscaiola (delicious, very creamy prosciutto + mozz ravioli with mushroom). The portion size is on the lighter side, but I was still so happy with my choice! My bf ordered an omelet which he enjoyed, but to me it didn't hold up next to the pasta. My recommendation-- unless you're really into omelets or french toast, skip the brunch menu and focus on their regular entrees.

Uva is a standout neighborhood spot that delivers outstanding Italian food with a comforting vibe. Reservations for larger groups are easy and service is spectacular.

The uniqueness of the dishes at Uva is one of the main standouts and continues to draw me back for additional visits. We ordered the Gnocchi in truffle sauce, Cavatelli in pesto sauce and one of Uva's late-night pizzas which are very unique. The sauces were rich and the portions were great for what you are paying. Will be back numerous times as Uva has become a staple neighborhood Italian spot in the UES.

Went to UVA with a large group - 13 people. They were very accommodating and placed us in a separate section of their outdoor seating. The waiter did such a great job with a large group which included kids! The food was very delicious. I got the ricotta gnocchi which I loved! Others got different pasta dishes which everyone enjoyed very much! For appetizers we got burrata as well as mushroom bruschetta- both were a hit! Will be back here when in the area!
Amazing neighborhood spot! Food is always delicious, ambiance is beautiful & the staff is kind. What more could you ask for? Definitely get the homemade fresh pasta!!!!

We loved this fantastic, hip Italian restaurant. My son made the reservation directly on Yelp, which was very convenient. Even though we didn't dine in the main restaurant (we were in front, across the bicycle lane), we enjoyed the food and service. We need to come back to a table inside. My favorite was the Vitello gratinato con melanzana. It's something very unique, flavorful, and not heavy. And that was a great thing because it allowed me to have a couple of spoonfuls of Tiramisu and Giardella
!

The food was w/out a doubt impeccable & the service was a total bonus! Upon walking up to the hostess stand, Anthony greeted us & seated us. As we were walked to our table in the back patio I couldn't help but feel like I was transported to a cute/cozy/rustic corner in Italy. The candles & rustic vibes make this a perfect location for an anniversary/celebratory dinner.

I'd like to highlight the... Gnocchi Di Ricotta:
Home Made Ricotta Gnocchi In A Creamy Black Truffle & Chive Sauce

The gnocchi at UVA is truly a work of ART! Wholeheartedly the best I've ever experienced. All of the flavors honestly blew my tastebuds away making each bite pure bliss. So much so that we dined there 2 days in a row & I flew back to FL w/an order of gnocchi in hand. It's easily become a must & will be a tradition when in the city.

A friend and I had a very nice experience here recently. It was a bit late, but we hadn't had dinner yet. We walked up and were seated right away by a friendly hostess. Our server was excellent as well, and we were never low on water. The service was good from start to finish.

It is a cozy spot with candles and rustic decor. A bit tight, but they are popular (especially later in the evening) and often have a fair number of people dining, even early in the week. Don't expect this place to be empty on a random Tuesday, but they will do their best to fit you in!

Our pasta was pretty good, not great, but the nice atmosphere and good service kicked the experience up a notch.

My boyf and I have a BIG obsession over tartufo. We will put it on everything we possibly can and we will drool over the massive party flavors happening in our mouths. That's exactly what happened at Uva.

Black truffle on gnocchi, Polenta Tartufata, and Chisolino robiola cheese and black truffles.

No, we didn't get even close to tired of the truffliness. In fact, I'm sure if we could have gotten more we would have. Everything was sooo creamy and rich. Each dish had a different texture to it but still cheesy and truffle-y.

My personal fav? Chisolino robiola cheese and black truffle. That one was the most different dish amongst the three we ordered and gave me that loud truffle flavor.

Stunning patio area and the kindest servers. Thank you Uva for not disappointing!

Wow. Thank you to all of the rest of the places that we wanted to eat for being closed because it was 11pm and the kitchens weren't serving anymore. I'm so happy UVA said open late and it was 5 star. The restaurant itself was so cute and intimate. Service was amazing. And the food I cannot rave enough about how amazing and fresh and homemade and just oh my gosh. Will be back every time

A decent spot on the UES with outdoor seating that isn't too hectic. The pasta was fresh and perfectly cooked, the pesto was nicely herby and portions were generous. My friends ordered the gnocchi which was nicely creamy but a bit heavy and the fettuccini, which was much nicer and well balanced. I would skip out on ricotta bruschetta next time, the truffle honey was the only thing that elevated this from being just bread with pretty unremarkable ricotta. not worth the price point for what it was.

3 of us shared the strawberry/mascarpone cream pancake, the veal/eggplant entree, and the mushroom ravioli. The ravioli was good and better than the other entree but this place might be the rare exception that their brunch options are substantially better than their normal dishes. The pancake once again was amazing and the cream is definitely worth the additional cost.

I would come back here only for their brunch options particularly the pancakes.
Staff were lovely. Drinks are okay. Definitely a great place for after work get togethers.

Came to UVA on a Wednesday evening to celebrate a friends birthday. We have heard GREAT things about this spot and it is walk-in only which i feel like is a sign of a good restaurant

we started with some light appetizers- calamari and cheeses. we wanted 1 soft cheese and 1 hard cheese - the soft cheese had buffalo milk and was a mozzarella literally so good and milky

the calamari was soft, chewy, and came in a little salad which was delicious!

for pasta i ordered the papardelle which was so fresh and rich/full of flavor. the veal was tender and juicy - pasta itself so fresh! my friend ordered the gnocci with truffle and this was def my fav - delicious, fresh, and the added truffle was paired so perfectly!!!

the waiter was so pleasant and helpful to making decisions- 10/10 recommend if you are looking for a classic italian spot

Cosy comfortable restaurant perfect for our last night out with friends in NYC. We had 4 kids and 4 adults and they were able to accommodate us with our dietary needs. Delicious mocktails, the beef ravioli will be my go to when we visit again. We went on meatball Monday and ordered an additional two apps, the shrimp fettuccine,and  gnocchi.The ricotta and truffle honey and calamari. The ricotta and truffle honey is to die for. The calamari was nothing to phone home about. The truffle dessert was a table favorite.

Came here for my birthday and it was GREAT.
A really solid Italian spot in the city and I'm happy they get the attention they do.

VIBES - old rustic Italian. Felt transported into the home of an old Italian family (from Italy!)

Gnocchi Di Ricotta w Truffle***
Soft, delicious, creamy, umami, strong with truffle flavor. Really good. Just get this and do yourself a favor. Cheesy too. The ricotta is not overly powerful. I'm actually not even normally a fan of ricotta cheese because of its texture and somewhat mild flavor and while ricotta was definitely part of the dish it did not add those qualities I mentioned to the dish.

Tiramisu - solid tiramisu! Creamy, fresh, sweet but not saccharine.

Came to Uva after walking around all day. Great ambiance and service. Really nice for an early dinner as it tends to get busy later on in the evening. Not sure if they do reservations as we arrived at 5pm. I had the gnocchi and it was cooked perfectly. My dish had the right amount of cheese and sauce which was great.

Food 8/10
Solid traditional pasta, a very local spot on the UES. The gnocchi was fluffy and chewy at the same time, super filling I couldn't finish it. Calamari turns out wasn't fried, but came in a salad, which was really good too.

Atmosphere 8/10
Definitely a place you come for an authentic Italian experience, loud yet elegant, a lot is going on but it's organized and makes sense.

Service 8/10
Good recommendations.

The service was overall decent from the wait staff. Hostess was not that friendly. Showed her my reservation and somehow got outdoor sitting when that wasn't the request we made. For our reservation. Food was decent but it was more of a check the box for me.

Came into UVA for an early dinner to celebrate my girlfriends graduation.

TLDR: food was 3/5 while the service was 0/5. If I could give the service less than a 0 I would. The service best described was very unwelcoming.

We ordered:
the honey truffle toast (appetizer)
calamari (appetizer)
burrata with balsamic dressing (appetizer)
gnocchi with creamy truffle (entree)

Service:
I honestly felt like the waiters did not care about us at all. We ate half our dinner with our empty trays on the table, and honestly did not care about giving us options, advice or anything when we asked about the dessert menu. Very much felt like we were dining alone.

But right around the time we left, the waiters was an entire 180 and treated the party next to us completely different. They gave recommendations and even told them about the soup or meal of the day. We didn't even know there was such a thing. They were way more attentive and it rubbed us the wrong way when we were leaving.

Food:
The appetizers were the star of the show, the honey toast was amazing, and the calamari was grilled to perfection.

I ordered the gnocchi based off of everyones review here, but to be honest..it was so heavy, too creamy and at the end my girlfriend and I just felt like a gnocchi. But I believe this might just be preference since my girlfriend and I don't really like heavy dishes.

Ambiance:
We dined at the garden which was BEAUTIFUL but holy crap. Be ready for flies!

Originally we wanted to come back to try their other entrees..but with that service..no way

UVA used to be amazing and the truffle gnocchi was the star of the show - pillowy, creamy and perfectly cooked. I'm not sure what's changed in the past 6 mos, but the past couple of times have been incredibly underwhelming due to flavorless food. The gnocchi this time was over and inconsistently cooked, with some pieces tasting like old store bought gnocchi. The tagliatelle and bruschetta with truffle honey were also lacking flavor. Vibes and service were good but I wouldn't come back to eat.
Beautifully decorated for NYE! Cute spot for date night, friendly service, and the calamari is definitely my favorite!

The vibe at UVA is A++. It's extremely cozy and inviting. The dim lights and the decorations really made it feel like a great spot to get together. The covered back yard area was decorated to the nines with Christmas decor. I can see why it's a popular spot. We had a party of 8 on a Thursday night and the restaurant was surprisingly crowded. It's also pretty loud since it's so popular. Many people in our party went with the truffle gnocchi (because how could you not?). The mushroom ravioli was alright. The poached salmon was pretty good. I think I'd recommend this place for wine and apps for a small party since it's extremely cozy. Nothing we ate was amazing but we felt trendy and it's a cute spot.

Good place to come to eat late! On a Sunday night at 10PM it was pleasantly low key. The holiday decor at this time of year is cute too. They have candles lit everywhere, including in the nooks of the brick wall.

We got the mulled wine, salad with the frisée and pear, fettuccine with the shrimp and the gnocchi with truffle.

The salad was great to split as a starter before the pasta. Be careful with the cheese, though. The chunks were larger than expected and I accidentally mistook some pieces for pear in the low light. Since it's Gorgonzola getting a whole chunk is overpowering.

I found the fettuccine to be bland, tbh. Don't let the glistening photos fool you - the sauce is an extremely light white wine based sauce. It felt like most of the sauce sat at the bottom of the plate, but even if I had realized that earlier on and mixed it in with the pasta I would have felt the dish was still lacking in flavor. Personally I leaned on the table salt and pepper to help.

The gnocchi was delicious and creamy. I'm a real sucker for creamy pasta, so I was envious of my friend's choice. I was happy to find they did not skimp on the truffle. It was easy to taste in every bite. The gnocchi was soft and pillowy as well.

Our server was sweet and charming, but after he took our order we realized he wasn't coming back to serve us for the rest of the meal. It was confusing not knowing who we should be talking to if we needed something else and felt like our server had just disappeared. Not a big deal, but still.

Definitely intend to come back!

Food: 7/10
Service: 9/10
Ambience: 8.5/10

We visited Uva with a large birthday party on a Sunday evening. It's a super cute, cozy Italian spot! Service was attentive but food was average. I definitely feel like I could make all of these dishes at home.
I highly recommend ordering family style because the pasta plates don't come with much vegetables or meat. It was a very unbalanced meal for me.
I wouldn't go out of my way to return to Uva but might come back for brunch one day!

We got the following:
ANTIPASTO MISTO (cured meat platter) $31
Ricotta Bruschetta $10
PAPPARDELLE AL RAGU DI VITELLO $28
GNOCCHI DI RICOTTA $27
Espresso Martini: Do not recommend...

Came here for Christmas Eve and it was great. I had the special octopus salad and the gnocchi with truffle. The service was pretty good but not spectacular. We also got bread which was delicious and it's a very quaint, romantic. My friend got the parpadelle with veal ragout which was good too. The gnocchi was delicious and there was a large portion, and it was very rich.

This Italian restaurant is a mixed bag of experiences. The eggplant appetizer was a standout, boasting a delightful medley of flavors that left a lasting impression. The drinks menu was impressive, and the ambiance was exceptional, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. However, the pasta dishes were disappointingly underwhelming, lacking the robustness and authenticity one would expect from Italian cuisine. Despite the pasta hiccup, the fantastic ambiance and delicious appetizer make it worth a visit, especially for those seeking a relaxing spot to unwind with good drinks.

I love the food here. I have gone back a few times and brought family.

The place is well decorated and has relaxed lighting.

The service is good enough but has high turnover rate. It's the food that is most memorable.

After ordering appetizers, main dishes and desert I have never left full...

I'm 5',7" and 169 pounds. Come on ppl put some proper portions so someone my size doesn't leave like they could eat another main dish without struggling.
The average costs at the end of a three course meal from UVA should at least fill you up. At least once.

I'll only go back when I have been asked to meet up with ppl already there and I'll make sure to eat before going.
Martini Monday is Fantastic!!!!! All of the martinis were wonderful. Food is a bit pricey for the portion size, especially the pastas. But a wonderful, cute night out!

Incredible Italian pizza pies!! It's a must try. The crust is so thin. The sauce is good and cheese is just right. The pie is shareable. It's medium sized. The appetizers are so good too - octopus, salmon tartare, shishito peppers. All very good.

It's a bit dim inside. It can be quite noisy since they are so popular. Reservations are recommended, especially for prime eating time. They have Margarita Mondays for $4 for a cup size, which is great to try out the different flavors of margaritas.

Came here for their Martini Monday! It was $4 for a mini martini and $8 for a large one. It can be any martini (espresso, dirty, etc.). The espresso and the regular were the best in my opinion. The dirty was overly salty so I wouldn't recommend.

Ended up getting a burger here and it was pretty good and filling.

The service was on point. They always refilled our martinis and water, and they brought our food out quickly. The place got packed really fast after 7 so I would try to come before that if you don't have a reservation.

Overall, a great deal on Mondays! Would recommend coming back!

Martini Monday is a most do in NYC!!

My friend found this restaurant on TikTok and we came tonight to take part in their martini monday deal. They have a menu of $4 martinis that you can get all night with the purchase of a pasta, pizza, or entree.

We had dirty martinis which really hit the spot. I also tried the Vesper. It was a little too boozy for me, but glad I tried it! To eat, we got a burrata pizza and ricotta gnocchi and split both. I loved both, but the gnocchi was out of this world amazing! The truffle sauce was so flavorful and not too heavy. I really loved this pasta! The pizza was also delish. It was almost like a burrata salad on pizza. Super fresh and light!

For dessert, we got the donuts and a scoop of stracciatella ice cream. Both were great! The donuts had cinnamon sugar on the outside and came with nutella and caramel. I usually am a nutella girl, but I think the caramel sauce was my favorite out of the 2.

The ambiance was cozy and inviting. We came around 9PM and it was still bustling. The service was super quick and since I was very hungry, this made me very happy! I look forward to coming back here!

Came here the other night for dinner and this place was a great find! One of the things I love is that if you come here on a Monday, all the Martinis you can drink are $4 with the purchase of any entree. Isn't that great?

The Martini deals include a classic, wet, dry, dirty, espresso, vesper, and a sour cherry martini. I ended up getting the Espresso martini and it was fantastic.

I also ended up getting their burrata pizza for dinner. It was simply magnificent. A great refreshing option for the summer.

Will definitely come back soon.

IG: QueenOfAdventureNYC

Came for Martini Monday and enjoy the food, drink, and atmosphere. Finally had the chance to walk in and indulge on their great Monday Special - $4 martini (1.5 oz) with any order of entree, pizza, or pasta. My friend and I ordered a margherita pizza and tagliatelle bolognese to share. The pizza was standard - can't go wrong with tomato, mozz, and basil. I definitely enjoyed the tagliatelle bolognese -  not sure if it was the noodles or meat sauce but it was drenched in butter. NOT complaining because it was delicious but the butter flavor was STRONG. Washed everything down with a dirty martini (vodka) and it did the job. I can see why this spot (and next door) is always popping. Happy to have gotten the chance to stop by.

UVA Next Door!!!! This charming Italian eatery has become my go-to place for an unforgettable dining experience. From the moment I stepped through the door, I was captivated by the delicious aroma of freshly baked pizza, the warm and inviting ambiance, and the exceptional service that greeted me.

Let's talk about the star of the show: the pizza. Each bite transports me to culinary paradise, leaving me craving more. The crust is perfectly thin and crispy, with just the right amount of chewiness.

Ps. My favorite appetizers are truffle fries and fried calamari. You can't go wrong with either it's soooo good!!

It was restaurant week so you know what that means. It means going out way too much, spending too much, and eating too much.
In this instance, a friend of mine and I got together at this place. She chose it because it was near where she works. It's also near where I live so it was perfect.
I got there a bit later than her but still relatively on time. It'd been a long time since we saw each other so seeing each other is always nice.
Since it was restaurant week, we get 3 courses pre-fixe menu. I got the salmon tartare and she got the eggplant burrata (she is vegetarian). The salmon tartare was fresh and not overpowering in terms of fish taste. She liked her appetizer as well. She said the eggplant was seasoned well and went well with the burrata. We both got the orechiette with pesto. I don't know what they did to it but it was some of the best pesto I've ever had. It was fresh, vibrant, not too creamy, not too much basil, just perfect. I don't think we planned on eating the whole thing but I'm pretty sure I did. I think she got full about halfway through so she took the rest home.
For dessert, she got the torta caprese, which is flourless chocolate and walnut brownie with ice cream. I got the olive oil cake since I'm always curious about olive oil cake. I think my friend died and went to heaven after eating her dessert. She said it was amazing and she wished she had the stomach room for it. My olive oil cake was a little crumbly from the polenta, but it had that orange flavor to it  and it was just that touch of sweetness that was perfect for the end of a meal.
By the end of it, we were both so stuffed that we had to go walk it off.
It was very busy for a Monday night so make a reservation. Service was fast and the waitress made sure we got everything we needed. I would say for multiple course meals, that it's nice when they wait a while before bringing your next course. We need time to digest.
But I will return for that pesto pasta and that olive oil cake, restaurant week or not.

As the little sister to UVA, UVA next door is a short cute date spot that actually takes reservations!

Service was impeccable and the food was good too.

Take advantage of their restaurant week menu to try out a few dishes for a great price (3 courses for $55).

Great food, great drinks, this is a staple of the UES. I honestly think this place is better than the original UVA and can usually get a table quicker. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a broader menu than just Italian food.

While visiting friends in the UES for New Years, we enjoyed the prefix dinner menu at Uva Next Door. INCREDIBLE meal! $55 a person. Amazing rate, especially on New Years, and great portions!

To start, we shared a bottle of Cabernet Sauvignon. It came chilled which is strange for red wine, but we all agreed it was suprisingly good like this. Everyone got their own appetizer. I enjoyed the Next Door Meatballs. The four, full-size meatballs were super flavorful in a sweet marinara sauce. The side dallop of ricotta was excellent. It also came with a slice of house made foccacia.

My entree was the Gnocchi Di Ricotta. I honestly can say it was one of the top 5 meals I've ever ate. So so flavorful and good. I wish I had bread to dip in my leftover sauce at the end, LOL! My girlfriends got the Chicken Parm Xl and the Garganelli Alla Vodka. The Chicken Parm was your standard tasting Chicken parmesean. Sweet sauce, tasty, and they don't say "XL" for nothing! The garganelli alla vodka was standard as well. The pasta was al dente in a classic vodka sauce.

For dessert we all got the olive oil cake. I had never had olive oil cake before but I've heard its a fan favorite at many restaurants. It was quite good! We had espresso martinis with our cake. Definitely not the best espresso martini I have ever had but still I was able to drink it.

Our server seemed pretty distracted and all over the place, but that didnt take away from our night. We enjoyed a great meal, the restaurant itself was very cozy and closed it, or service time was great, we didn't feel rushed, and had a great night. We will be returning! Thank you Uva!

i really enjoyed their pesto pasta like it was kinda addictive xD we also got the red pasta (i forgot the name) but it was a little too acidic for me. the pizza was reallyyy yummy and juicy & i would skip on the meatballs cus it was too small  i would def return just for the pesto pasta

the service was pretty fast & the ambiance was really nice because we sat outdoors during lunchtime
Had the best time at Martini Monday!! Andre was our waiter and he was so friendly and warned us about the longer wait while it gets packed, which we appreciated. Will definitely be back super soon!!

food was very good here! we were very late for our reservation, but they still let us seat as long as we could eat quicker before the expected reservation after us. we didn't have a problem with that.

I got the penne vodka (had a fancier italian name but I can't remember it). we also ordered the margarita pizza, truffle fries, an eggplant dish, and shishito peppers. the appetizers were all super flavorful.

as a plus, we were celebrating an engagement so they gave us the peppers for free along with a round of shots.

good food, good service!

Cute date night spot or dinner with friends in UES! Nice ambiance, with candle lit tables, darker lighting, and sleek decor.
I went with 3 people and we had a reservation - We split a Pizza Quattro Formaggi which was great- Thin crust, perfect amount of cheese. Delicious and great to share as an appetizer!
I ordered a Tiramasu Next door (tiramasu espresso martini), which was pricey ($19), but delicious and perfectly made!
My main course was the Orechiette al Pesto du Broccoli ($23). The dish was light and refreshing and pasta shape worked perfectly with the pesto sauce on the dish. The portion could have been a bit bigger - If we hadn't had the pizza as an appetizer, the entree alone would not had satiated my hunger.
Service was OK - the wait staff was attentive and quick to act, but definitely felt that we were being rushed, despite being there for under an hour and having a reservation.
Overall tasty and well-prepared food and drinks!!

My reason for 4 stars not 5 is that we didn't get any bread when we got to the table?? That was one of my favorite things at the other uva. And that a Diet Coke was $6 haha.

The food is so good. I love their marinara sauce. Pizza was thin and crisp but not burnt. Cheese is fresh. I guess there could have been more basil.

It's definitely not $$$, I'd say it's $$. Everything is so reasonably priced aside from the Diet Coke. It was $22 for a big pizza, and pasta dishes are in the low $20s. Considering it's all homemade it's priced very well.

It's a little bigger than the original uva and it's a great atmosphere. They also take reservations unlike uva.

Will definitely come back!
Very quaint and romantic. Wonderful service. Terrific pizza!  We went for lunch and they seated us although we were a bit early.

would make a medium size sacrifice to have these espresso martinis on a regular basis.  

Two vegan pastas which were fire. I tried to eat my pasta slow to savor the time I had with it. Did not try the vegan pizza, but nibbled some crust with sauce from a pizza at the table and it too was fire.

Will be thinking of these meal for the next few days

Tiny cute little spot with awesome food. Came here last night for dinner with friends and husband. We hadn't made a reservation so waited about an hour to get a table-you can put your name on the list and walk down the street to get a drink elsewhere while you wait and they texted us when ready.

We did Martini Monday-$4 half/mini martini or $8 regular size any kind of martini when you purchase a pizza, pasta, or Restaurant week meal (one full entree per person to get the deal). They did not disappoint-the mar to his were delicious and strong/normal, not chinchy because of the deal. We got espresso martinis and dirty-both were great. To eat, we got the spring burrata salad and summer salad - both delicious, flavorful, and fresh. For our meals, we did the gnocchi (amazing, soft creamy goodness), and three different pizzas: zoo vittorio (super fresh tomato sauce, nice crisp on the crust, yummy prosciutto and fresh arugula), funghi y salsiccia (yummy mushroom and sausage with same great tomato base and perfect crust), and then the tartufata (amazing rich pesto).

The ambiance is nice with low lighting but it was packed so quite loud. Highly recommend for amazing Italian food, drink, and service!

AHHH-MAZING! Uva next door was next level good. Such a warm cozy environment inside which I loved. I normally drink wine when eating Italian food but the cocktail menu was so unique and fun I switched it up. The cocktails were great and strong but still delicious. For food we had calamari, gnocchi di ricotta, veal agnolotti and a pizza divola. All was incredible. The gnocchi wasn't too truffle forward and the agnolotti's sauce was to die for. Everything was very light too, we didn't leave feeling like we were stuffed.

tasty italian fare with good vibes

Came here for a casual din with friends. On a Wed night, this place was popping. Liked the energy and atmosphere right away. We started off the night with some soshito peppers and a marg pizza to get the taste buds cooking. For the main, I got the orochiette el pesto brocolli with sausage added in which was super yummy. The pasta was fresh and the sauce was so flavorful. Loved the creamy texture with the hit of pesto. Complemented the sausage perfectly. My main gripe is the portions are smaller than I expected, but it was yummy. Service was excellent as well. Overall good casual dinner spot
Such a good neighborhood spot - go for martini Monday for half price tinis! Pizza & pastas are always great

The place is great for a group or date night. It's dim light and average in noise so you can head yourself talk.
For apps we ordered a pizza and grilled octopus. The pizza was delicious and the grilled octopus was also good, meaty. I would have liked it more charred.
For entrees we really ordered 5 different pastas to share. Yes carb overload and don't know what we were thinking but we loved them all. We ordered: ricotta & spinach- yum; gnocchi- my favorite; pesto de broccoli- my least favorite; cavatelli chicken Ragu- also delicious; veal agnatoli- my second fav.
Desserts we had the olive cake (just okay) and the sundae (yum).
The service was also great, they were okay with making half our pizza with no meat. Very friendly all around.

It's the pizza for me. So freaking good. I've been an Uva patron for more than a decade, the spot crushes the pasta game. Usher in Next Door, and that's where it's at for pizza and cocktails. The vibe is romantic, cozy, and intimate. I love love love love the pizza. The crust is where it's at. We got some pasta too, and while at first, it wasn't perfect - way too salty, they were open to feedback, quickly sorted it and got a fresh - and much better tasting dish. So happy with this gesture and ability to make it right without any question. I think this place and its sister spot know how to make things perfect. You can't go wrong here and I'm so happy this is in my neighborhood.

UND might be my new favorite spot on the UES. Martini Mondays, do I need say more. $4 half size martini's and $8 regular martini's. Whether you take yours dry or dirty, with gin or vodka, UND has got you covered.  I came here for dinner with friends and ordered the Garganelli alla Vodka. All of their pasta is freshly made and my dish was absolutely delicious. UND has a great atmosphere and good service.  Open for lunch and dinner, UND is a must try on the UES!

Sorry y'all phone did not eat first, but anyways - overall this place is good. Great ambiance, friendly waitstaff & good food. I liked the pizza better than pasta. Pasta was a bit over cooked and lacked seasoning.

TLDR; Great vibes, great food. Don't skip dessert.

Living in the Upper East Side, I ate at Uva Next Door once a week. It was where I stopped by for dessert for one, brought my date, or introduced to family and friends.

To me, Uva captures the quintessential NYC dining experience: an interior design that makes it feel that you've been transported to another place once you're seated at your table; dimly lit, slightly crowded, and a tad loud with wide open windows that bring the city life in; a menu priced just right that you feel like you're treating yourself but will order an appetizer, entree, dessert, and drinks and not feel guilty; attentive waiters who you sometimes wonder if they're putting on an accent when announcing your wine selection; and great food.

It's a simple menu with great variety. Every dish I've had from pasta, pizza, to fish has been delicious. My favorites include: the calamari, orecchiette con pesto, and Branzino.

Many times I came only for dessert. The milk chocolate polenta budino is a must order again and again and again.

Small wine selection, but great pairings. My favorite is their Montepulciano d'Abruzzo offering. They also have a fun cocktail menu, which includes several Negroni variations.

Drinks are good. Food has fallen off. Have been here probably 10 times. The last three my wife and I have said the words "why are we coming here that wasn't good". Not sure what has happened but servings have decreased, and flavor is just not there. Ordered a Caesar salad which frankly looks like it should be served to a kid for a kids meal. Slowly dropping the ball but they are always packed so my guess is ownership knows they can get away with it.

Food was great! Definitely enjoyed every bite I've been to the original location UVA so I was prepared to enjoy this sister location. It was def worth the visit and the lamb meatballs for an app was very tasty as well.
The only thing that could use work were the drinks. We had the fireside old fashion and the harvest moon both had solid flavors but need better quality alcohol to make it come full circle.
My favorite restaurant in all of New York City. The wait staff also really makes this experience incredible, more specifically, Andre. I come here regularly and each time is better than the last!

Being not an upper east-sider, I decided to give this place a try. The food was good, however when I was having dinner there was a construction guy who started spraying and fixing the ceiling right on top of my dinner table where I was eating! I was able to smell the gas from his spray and also felt some spray on me!

The manager was sitting right there and saw what was going on but did nothing to stop the construction job on top of my dinner plate! My waiter did nothing about this either. This attitude is unprofessional and lacks the basic courtesy to ensure the best dinner experience for the customer. I left totally feeling not respected.

When I brought it to their attention, the Manager (Dean) though agreed with me, gave an uncaring/indifferent apology. My waiter did the same thing.

Needless to say I will not be returning nor recommending Uvaaaaaa.....

I stumbled upon this place after seeing that Uva was out of reservations. We ordered the octopus, meatballs and tagliatelle.  The octopus was amazing! Super tender and served on a nice mix of root like vegetables, which also contained raisins. The meat ball and pasta were standard. For dessert we had the chocolate cake which was nice and nutty.
