Drinks were well made and server was super attentive with filling the water!

I love UVA so I decided to give UVA Next Door a try, I wish I didn't. The food was fine but the portions/serving sizes were a huge miss and not worth the price at all.

Turned out being just another UES spot taking your money, I won't be back.

The service here is the worst in the City. Initially we were greeted by a very rude hostess who refused to seat us outside because she didn't want to set foot outside in the rain. Note it was only lightly misting and all the tables were covered. She complained that her hair would be ruined by the light rain. We offered to seat ourselves and joined some other patrons who also said that the hostess was very rude.
We ordered martinis and some food. All of which was mediocre. The server brought us the wrong drinks and then argued with us when we told her they were not what we ordered.
Upon leaving the manager thanked us for stopping by and asked if everything was satisfactory. When we expressed our dissatisfaction with the service he became agitated and defensive.
After we left we realized that we left a sweater on a chair. We returned and it was gone. The hostess claimed that she had not seen it. Two nights later we were walking by the restaurant only to see the hostess wearing the sweater! We confronted her and the manager who of course denied that it was the same sweater - even though it was my grandmothers one of a kind, hand knit sweater!
Finally the manager said he would send us a gift card for $10 to help cover the loss - which never arrived. Not that we would ever consider eating here again - even if it were free.
Ideal for conversations over a good meal or a date. Service is nothing to write home about but the food is absolutely fantastic

Uva is one of our favorites in NYC so of course we had to try their new sister spot! And it didn't disappoint.

Started with the burratta which had a nice summer as of strawberries and then tried the burger, veal agnolotti and of course, pizza topped with the Uva signature truffle sauce. If I could bottle this sauce up and drink it for the rest of my life I would it's that good. I think I prefer it on the gnocchi, but it was great on the pizza as well!

The only thing I think this new spot is still working out is the atmosphere. We went on one of the hottest nights of the summer but it was HOT inside. Probably because the tables are pretty close to together and it was packed, but once they work out that kink it will be an amazing experience!!

Really enjoyed the prosciutto pizza we shared as an appetizer among 4 of us, and the outdoor dining was bustling (in the best way!) The service was very timely, just wish the pasta portions were larger but thats NYC for you on the Upper East Side. I got the ravioli filled with veal (Veal Agnolotti) and it was cooked very well but again, just wish there were more pieces.

I would return, or maybe try the UVA restaurant next to this one too!

This place was absolutely packed on a weeknight. Great vibes.

Food was good. Got the prosciutto pizza and the short rib ravioli. Both were tasty. The portions were pretty small on the pasta, probably could have eaten twice what they plated. Overall still a good experience.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night at 5:30. Was able to get a table outside for 3 immediately. Got the pizza funghi e salsiccia, the tagliatelle bolognese, veal agnolotti, spring burrata, and calamari. The pizza and both pastas were great. They were very flavorful, and the meats were very tender. The portions were on the small side, so the 3 of us were full but not stuffed after the 5 items plus dessert. Didn't love the salad - the ingredients didn't quite come together. The calamari was OK - the breading was like fish and chips breading, so a bit different than usual.

I have been meaning to come here since it opened and just got here the other night. The food is excellent as expected.

My one complaint is that we had a reservation and had been there for less than 90 minutes when they kicked us out for there next guests. While we had paid out bill we were still finishing our drinks. Beware the 90 minutes rule isn't standard here!

We went on a Sunday evening was not busy at all.  We were one of two tables; despite that the waitress was slow and missed two of our items.  Food was okay; lots of other great options in the neighborhood won't go back.

We went to Uva Next Door with friends.
The place is cute. The doors were wide open on a hot muggy evening.
We asked to move to another table in the back that seemed cooler.
The server seems perplexed and unable to respond coherently to this request.
Instead she spilled the drinks she was serving  on the floor. Accidents happen but  she didn't offer  drinks for having gotten my husband and friend wet.  She was brusque and  truly clueless . They were apparently
" out of bread" at 5:45 on a Saturday night.
The portions were very small and the food itself was totally unimpressive.
The wine pour was stingy. Everything about the food and drinks was less than mediocre, tiny and stingy. Combined with crappy service, I am not sure how this place received any positive reviews. It feels like we were definitely in a different place.
It was a disappointing, underwhelming dining experience all around. We won't be returning. Too many better places to try in the neighborhood.

Visited late on Sunday night 1/29.  Definitely after 10 pm.   VERY cool place - We had delicious Manhattans & Vespers.   Waiter was tolerant of our nonsense!  Will definitely visit again when next in the neighborhood.

Would not recommend. Portions were small and the Chicken Parm was the blandest chicken parm I've ever had in my life. Didn't know it was possible to make a bad chicken parm. Definitely recommend going next door to the real restaurant. Can't be any worse.

This food was SOOO GOOD, I came back TWICE. The perfect date night. The Garganelli Allá Vodka was served with the best pink vodka sauce. I enjoyed the Gnocchi Di Ricotta's creamy black truffle sauce. The drinks are strong and you will get a bang for your buck!! 10/10

The Service Sucks! Like, Sooo Bad! Motor Vehicle could school this restaurant! The Hostess with the MAJOR ATTITUDE and DRESSED LIKE A SLOB! No eye contact! She's as rude as she is a mood! This place is a joke! The WALMART OF PIZZA! I'll never darken the doorway again! Shove ya friggen pizza

So happy we stopped by here! We asked our waiter what the difference was between here and UVA and he said here they focus on pizza and pasta.
We got the Margherita pizza, calamari, and the Cappellacci Di Zucca. The pizza was great. It held up well  in the middle, no sogginess what so ever which annoys us with thin pizza. The calamari was great as well. Fried perfectly. The pasta was good but it was stuffed so much for us that we would've preferred it slightly less pumpkiny so that we could taste the pasta itself too. Too much pumpkin made it a bit overwhelming and mushy. Overall we'd come here again when craving pasta.

Went recently for dinner. Super cute place, perfect for either a casual dinner or date night out. The calamari was nothing special, but the octopus was amazing, def recommend. I must say...it may have had some of the best pizza I've had in NYC, and I live next to a Joe's pizza. Do not go there and skip the pizza. It was also pretty busy, and it was an earlish dinner so def try for reservations.
We were recommended this place by a friend and our experience did not disappoint. The food was tasty and not too heavy, which can be the case at some Italian places. Service was great as well!

(Sep 2022 update) Their serving size for main course decreased in half and at the same time price increased. I ordered penne vodka pasta which is $23 and kid you not had 23 pieces of penne on my plate. They are literally milking inflation.

We've ordered delivery from here a few times and loved the food. It traveled well and the portions were big. We had to try it in person, and were impressed.

The staff go out of their way for you. The food is even better at the restaurant (wasn't surprised), and the atmosphere was very welcoming.

If you're in the area and like Greek food, you should come here. 5/5.

I have come to love this place because the food is consistent and it's always fresh. It's the casual version of Sea Salt (which is 2 blocks down).
I don't think they have AC so keep this in mind, however once you settle in you get comfortable.
The branzino is really good, not fishy! The pita with tzatziki are the best served warm and they come with a lot of pieces of pita. The octopus is one of my favorites but the side it comes with it cold -which was unexpected for me so after a while I was over it. But all in all this place is great and the service is good.

I made a reservation here for marathon Sunday after noticing the excellent location last year.   Under the Bridge did not disappoint. The food was good and the service relaxed but attentive. I had a delicious omelette and my daughter had the salmon kebabs. The espresso was perfect too! We will be back!
Amazing brunch! I also love their salads, lemon chicken soup and tzatziki with fresh, warm pita bread.

Having just gone on our honeymoon to Greece, my husband and I were dying for an authentic meal to bring us back to those perfect days and we found it! This aptly named restaurant is nestled at the bottom of the upper east side, but we preferred to pretend we were dining at a restaurant in santorini! The wine tasted so familiar, which immediately brought us back to Greece. Our waiter shared stories about this favorite wines from back home too, which was awesome. The food was unreal, truly tasted like what we had on our trip which was exactly what we were looking for. If you want a truly authentic Greek meal, this is your spot!

I really love the fried tomatoes and octopus from this restaurant and I order them for delivery frequently whenever I get a craving. On my 2nd time ordering from them, my fried tomatoes were really over fried almost burnt and completely inedible! I was so disappointed!!

Good food and service. Just one off the staff seemed angry or annoyed when I asked for a drink. Probably because the place was packed when I went with family and family and friends. We went here during the TCS New York Marathon.

Good was very tasty. We started with zucchini fritters that were light and Greek yogurt was so fresh. We also ordered lemon potatoes to go with our main dishes. The branzino was lovely. The crab cake was very good and I switched out the beans for the spinach rice side. The waiter Manolis was also charming. Sorry I didn't take pics.

Visited on a weekday night as a party of 3- service was good.

We shared a spanokopita and dips (eggplant dip, hummus and tzatziki) that was served with pita. The spanokopita was a lot doughier/thicker than the light and flakey spanokopita that I've had in the past- not bad, but just not what I was expecting.
The hummus was a little bland (needs more tahini!), but I liked the rich flavor of the eggplant dip.

I must've been an eggplant mood because I ordered the Baked Stuff Eggplant- out came half a eggplant, roasted to perfection, topped off with ground beef and bechamel sauce. It had so many textures and blended the rich flavors together, and was very tasty. Also very filling- I managed to finish the whole thing but I was stuffed! (like the eggplant heh)

Nothing too special but a solid choice if you're ever in the area.

My husband and I came here on a date night at 5:30pm on a Sunday night. It was quiet with just one other table but got filled in as the night progressed. Pretty easy to find parking and we visited the Trader Joe's across the street after dinner. The service was attentive just enough so we also weren't disturbed often. They filled our water frequently. Food was very nice, we ordered the smoke eggplant dip, zucchini fritters, grilled octopus and Tsipoura (mahi mahi fish). They were all very delicious and I would order them again. I liked how balanced the meal was when ordering a whole fish with a side of greens. My common complaint for restaurants is when they don't come with sides by default, so I appreciated that. They took away the fish plate quickly soon after we were splitting it between the both of us, but I would've like the chance to pick at the head hahaha. The table also came with free pita bread with a olive, tomato paste and oil dip. The restaurant also served us two servings of a sweet pound cake which was appreciated on top of the baklava we ordered! I would come again.

Pretty decent place with many things on the menu. We came in Monday night for a dinner.
Service was good, and quick.
We ordered pita with hummus, octopus, orange salad, soutzoukakia, gigantes
It was more then enough food for two of us and we took some home.
Hummus and salad was great. Other food was really average. I remember I came here few years back and I loved it, but today it was just ok. So I would give 3.5 stars.
Not amazing but pretty decent!

I was here a good while ago at this aptly named Greek spot with an odd location. We sat outside and I remember the service being a bit odd but I don't exactly remember why. I don't remember the drink I had outside of it having mastiha and it was tasty with a strong anise flavor. The dishes I ordered/shared were the Horitaki, the Kotopoulo, and the Greek yogurt.

Horiatiki- Greek village salad, vine ripened tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, red onions, olives, oregano, feta and extra virgin olive oil
This was a good version with the most notable thing being the massive block of feta even compared to some other spots. Fresh salad though the dressing was a little bit light my liking though this is perhaps because most of it was on top of the feta. Overall quite good.

Kotopoulo Me Hiloites: Chicken tomato stew with egg noodles and graviera cheese
Also a tasty dish. The chicken was moist and tender. The sauce was a little bit too sweet for my liking with perhaps a bit too much cinnamon also.

Greek yogurt-Walnuts, honey, and sour cherries
Why I prefer just having sour cherries, it was fun to see how it was combined. Good version and reasonably priced.

Overall the food here is quite good. A bit pricey but presumed for the area.

Incredibly friendly service, and the food was wonderful. My only drawback was a lack of wheelchair accessibility on the main entrance, but once you're inside, the tables are low and accessible. We absolutely loved the spicy cheese dip appetizer, zucchini fritters, lamb, and perfect pita bread. We stayed and enjoyed our dinner for a couple of hours and brought home some great leftovers.

I have eaten here quite a few times in the past, and I love the food. I was born and raised in Greece, so I can tell you with confidence that this restaurant serves traditional Greek cuisine!

I highly recommend this restaurant because the owners really care about their customers and the food they serve! If you have always wanted to try Greek food that tastes like homemade food, you should definitely give it a try! In my opinion, this is a hidden gem, and I am sure you won't be disappointed!

Lastly, the prices are very affordable (based on what you will be receiving) and some of my favorite menu items are as follows:
- Tomatokeftedes
- Spanakopita
- Paidakia
- Kofte Kebab
- Horiatiki
- Baklava
- And some wine...

Yiamas!
OK. I was so looking forward to some authentic avgolemono soup, and it was incredibly disappointing. My entree was fine. Service was good.

Needed a quick bite before we headed out for the night in the city. Under the bridge hit it out of the park. So much flavors and everything was cooked to perfection. First time having baby kale and it was light and delicious. The head on shrimp were grilled and so tasty and fresh. Usually chicken kebobs can be dried out especially when delivered but not here. The chicken was juicy and flavorful. The mussels were the highlight of our meal. We couldn't get enough of that sauce it was that good.
Great foods and desserts. Highly recommended for those who love Greek foods, service is also friendly and on the time.

Pros: Location, ambiance/decor and food
Cons: Not very nice owner/manager and outdated menus in website. Prices in the menu at the restaurant were about 50% more than on the website. Oversight?

We ordered delivery from here and everything was just okay. We started with the hummus and the pita that came with it was warm but just okay (a little over cooked). The hummus was also just okay. I wish the texture was a little smoother and it could have used some more lemon/tahini flavor. I then got the branzino and it was good but nothing amazing for $37. My husband got the lamb chops and they were a little over cooked. Also pretty expensive. They lemon potatoes were also just okay. They didn't have enough lemon.
Great breakfast on a rainy day. Waitress was very attentive and friendly. Omelet was fresh. Wasn't too crowded which was perfect because I was in a rush to get back to work. Awesome spot!!!
The food was amazing! Best pancakes we've ever had!  Coffee was also freshly brewed and delicious.

Best. Greek. Food. EVER!  The portions are more than generous.  Everything we ordered when we were temporarily on the east was perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Prices are on point for the incredible quality!

I am giving it 4 stars for the service and the older gentleman who seemed like the owner was very courteous and friendly. There weren't a ton of people here on a Thursday night and I made a reservation via OpenTable.

They sat us immediately and were attentive to our needs. They made sure covid guidelines are followed so we felt comfortable.

We ordered a lot of food and the portions are huge! We ordered cocktails, what looked like a spinach pancake with feta, what was described as meatballs , a chicken and tomato with egg noodle, the grilled octopus with hummus and also the seafood pasta.

I really loved the meatballs and the pancakes, and I loved the chicken and egg noodle pasta. The seafood pasta lacked more sauce and the grilled octopus was a little too plain without any sauce to pair it with.

Seating outside would have been amazing too because you would have the view of the bridge.

All in all, a good experience. If it the prices were lower it would have been even better! Bill was $190 after tip for 3 people.

This is a hidden gem. Its a greek owned restaurant, the food is delicious, the owner is always there and serves you himself. The services is great, and has excellent ambiance, will most definitely be back. You won't go wrong with anything you order on the menu its all good!
Best greek food ive ever had in my entire life. The spanakopita greek fries greek salad were so good

We had company in from PA and wanted to take us to dinner, but not too far from home because they have trouble walking long distances.  So, Under the Bridge was the perfect choice because it's one of the places in our new neighborhood that we'd been wanting to try, and they love Greek food too!

This restaurant is aptly named, it's just across the street from the 59th St Bridge.  We sat outside on the 59th St side, it was a lovely evening.  I'd have preferred indoors but 2 of the 4 of us are still kinda hesitant so outside it was.  Needless to say, it's quite loud out there, what with traffic at dinner time and being just off 1st Ave.  That, however, is really the only part of the meal we could complain about!

Our waitress was very sweet, and apparently genuinely from Greece; I say that because we had a brief conversation about serving wine in stemware here vs in stemless glasses in Greece, which is what my husband and I did experience in Greece a number of years ago!  At any rate, the 4 of us polished off a bottle of assyrtiko that was fragrant and refreshing with our meal.

We started by sharing a horiatiki, my go-to salad, and a halloumi plate, to die for.  We had pita to go with.  Three of us chose the stuffed eggplant entree, and it was unlike anything I've had in any restaurant.  It was a whole eggplant, split wide open, and stuffed with herbs and tomatoes and topped with feta - pretty to look at and really really good!  My brother had the tsipoura, whole grilled fish with a side of sautéed greens, which he shared with my sister-in-law and she shared her eggplant with him.  Everyone loved what they ate.   We were quite full, but our server brought us a complimentary plate of a semolina honey cake that was really sweet enough to hit the spot but not too much to eat after the delicious meal.

We intend to return,  but I'm waiting until my husband is more comfortable eating indoors!

Loved every minute here! We got the spicy whipped feta dip, which was *chef's kiss*. I got the mussels which were in an incredible tomato feta broth - paired with some bread for dipping - perfect.

Our waitress was so nice and generous with extra pita bread, and we got a little complementary cake at the end.

We could see the Queensboro bridge out the window which was beautiful!

Can't wait to come back.

Our waitress was extremely sweet and attentive and the food was delicious! Baked eggplant with ground beef and bechamel sauce was so good. Kind of like moussaka. A little bit too heavy on cinnamon for me, but amazing otherwise. Really cute spot too- nice ambiance for a date.
Not my style of food. I feel this place is way overrated. I got delivery so I am judging only the food.
Great food in a nice location and good decoration . Delicious musaka and friend crew.
Delicious!  My husband and I were walking by and stumbled upon this corner gem of a restaurant- amazing food, warm and attentive service and reasonably priced - highly recommended!
Great authentic feel, fresh food, great service, very hospitable and warm owners. Would go back!

Reasonably priced casual Greek fare with an easy 6 people reservation on open table on an early Saturday night, score.

Appreciate the bread and tomato pure with olives brought to the table and when we left, a little cake  bites; nice touch. Servers were attentive.

Must say it seems like a family place, older crowd as well.

I certainly appreciated that have something for everyone (Vegan, Gluten Free) options.

To start:
we shared a couple dips (taziki, hummus, eggplant) with pita which was very good for party of 6 to share.

For entree:
I got the Meliztzana Imam $22 (stuffed eggplant, caramelized onions, tomatoes) and I omitted the feta to make it vegan.  It was just okay.

I did hear that the Papoutsakia $24 (Baked stuffed eggplant, braised ground beef with yogurt bechamel on top) was outstanding.

Servers were attentive
Such fresh fish and such friendly service. The food is consistently delicious and very popular with the local residents
Attentive and excellent service. Same great authentic Greek food! I love the vegan options! Highly recommended

One of my GO TO neighborhood restaurants for both dine in and delivery.  Some of the best Greek food on the UES and always fresh, flavorful, and fast (delivery).   I've been eating here for years, probably 3-4 times per month, as a fellow Greek (with high expectations) I will say you must give this neighborhood gem a try
Superb service and relaxed atmosphere. Good food and wine. I spilled food on myself and they brought me club soda to clean myself up. I'll be back!

We go every few weeks.  It's a family owned and run Green home food restaurant.  Really good, authentic food.  Kind owner and staff.  Some of our favorites: Ratsina wine (try before you get a bottle), grilled octopus, Greek salad, whole branzino.  It's enough food for four to split.  Setting is pleasant for a summer dinner al fresco with urban New York City all around.  Highly recommend.

I decided to meet an old friend here for dinner; we both love mediterranean food so we thought this would be the perfect fit! The atmosphere was so charming and the staff was very attentive and friendly! We got the Pillkila of 3 spreads: We both agreed the Htipiti was our favorite - the pita bread was so fresh and delicious we couldn't stop eating it. We also got the Spanikopita, Greek meatballs, and Halloumi as well - all were unbelievable. I will be dreaming of the Htipiti and I cannot wait to come back to dine again. Lovely spot, highly recommend.

I ordered for the first time today.  Fried Kalamari which I have had many many times at other restaurants.  I could not even cut it with a knife, it was like a rubber band to chew. Very disappointed.  The Mousaka was delicious and the lemon potatoes.  Very expensive too. I would not recommend.

Really good greek spot. Heard good things about the place and finally had a chance to eat here on a Friday night. Came around 8, and was seated right away without a reservation which was surprising because the place was packed.

Menu was really large and it was actually pretty tough to decide what to order. We opted to start with an assortment of 3 dips and chose the tatziki, spicy feta and eggplant. The tatziki and the spicy feta were awesome, but I would skip the eggplant if I were to go back. Really deep smoky flavor that overpowered everything. Perhaps it just wasn't my thing, but I did not enjoy it. Again the other dips were fantastic, so next time I'll just go with those two.

For the mains I went with the branzino, and it was very good. Massive portion and was cooked perfectly. My only issue was that I asked for it deboned, but it had quite a few bones still in it. Not a huge deal, but takes away from it a little bit. My girlfriend had the chicken kebab which I tried - also very good.

Overall had a great experience and we'll certainly be back.

We visited on a Saturday afternoon with reservations during Restaurant Week.  After seeing the reviews on Yelp and the pictures of the bridge in such close proximity, we were excited for our lunch.  Upon arrival we were seated promptly and offered a Brunch menu.  We were surprised to not find any of the Restaurant Week options we had seen online.  When we asked the waiter about it, he told us that they do not honor that on the weekends.  We found that odd being that their website did not mention that anywhere, and in fact, mentioned honoring their R.W menu through Sunday 2/13 (the day AFTER our reservation).  A woman, who I am assuming is the manager, came over with R.W menus and said she would honor it for us.  Appreciated - but weird...

We started with the Avgolemono and Lentil Soup - both of which were...lacking.  Lacking salt, lacking flavor, lacking a LIIIITTLE someTHING.   For our mains we had the Chicken Gyro with a Mimosa and a Lamb Burger with a Mojito.  For my lamb burger I asked that it be cooked medium with a side of Tzatziki sauce.  When our food came out, I was disappointed to find my burger was well done.  Additionally there was a side of Tzatziki (which I assumed to be mine), until my boyfriend noticed his gyro had no sauce on it.  When I called the waiter over to ask for the additional side of sauce, we were brought out an entire appetizer dish of Tzatziki with pita wedges.  I asked him if this were the SIDE I asked for, as it looked like one of the advertised appetizers and I would not be paying for that.  The manager overheard, walked over and said she would comp the appetizer (we did not ask for) - appreciated, but again weird...  As far as the drinks, a mimosa is a mimosa *shrugs* but the Mojito was quite honestly the worst I've ever had.  Lastly, and this is of no fault of the restaurant, but the view of the bridge?  What a bummer.  Besides the construction, I was so confused as to how people got such amazing shots.  If it's possible to be catfished by a restaurant, that's what happened to us LOL.  All-in-all I was unimpressed with the $100+ lunch we had
Great location overlooking the Queensborough bridge! A corner spot with tons of charm. I order a chicken gyro platter, the tzatziki was super creamy and delicious.

A quaint and quite attractive Greek bistro style restaurant in Manhattan.  With a 8pm reservation for eight people on a Saturday night, and running roughly 5-10 minutes behind, kudos to the owner for holding our table to the point that we were walked right back to it without breaking a stride!  As I was seated with my back to the wall, I had a perfect view of the quaint establishment and cute bar area that both scream Manhattan on a Saturday night!  I also noticed how hard each of the employees worked throughout the night, especially the young guys busing the tables.  Each employee hustled ALL night, and the owner is extremely involved in his restaurant!

We ordered the Pikilia Spread (humus) for the table to start with, and though it was $18, it was extremely good and the size was more than fair!  The pita points were so fresh and constantly replaced until we were done with the humus!  The Horiatiki Salad (Greek) was first up, and while it was certainly good, it's almost too loaded with large chunks of tomatoes.  There should be a bit of a better balance of greens with it, however the excellent cheese in the salad makes up for it!  My hands down best dish was the Solomos!!  A large, and I do mean large, piece of wild salmon that's cooked to your temperature preference with a nice crusty char on the top side!!  It's served with their version of spanakopita (spanakorizo) which is a rice/spinach version that made this dish outstanding!

It's a nice spot that's fairly loud due to the old building, small interior, and a lively crowd.  I will say though that they do NOT rush you at all and our 2+ hours attest to that fact!

I ordered the grilled octopus for pickup. The only complain I have with the food is that it was slightly cold, and that was due to my ride time. The octopus itself was perfect, smooth, and nicely charred. Fava and tomato's and onions were a nice touch and there was a ton of pita included. I would definitely order again.

A nice little place where you can get breakfast or lunch. Scrambled eggs and bacon done to perfection with the best Americano. And they serve it with a biscuit. The wait person was lovely and very attentive. I will definitely visit here again!

Finally decided to try this Greek restaurant and was impressed by the hummus and pita to start. There was great service overall. We were given a complimentary cake when the check came. Will definitely be going back soon.

Great Greek Food...
This is truly original the right place to eat Greek food in NYC.
We had the grilled octopus and it was exceptional, the tzarziki and humus were perfect and the Greek Salad (horitaki) was great too.
Even though we saw a little mouse (not a rat) wondering under the tables, i do recommend this spot

We ordered take out last night and the food was good, not great and portions VERY small for the prices. We ordered lamb burger, dips, fried goat cheese, lemon potatoes and meatballs.  Goat cheese came with 4 small pieces and lemon potatoes were 4 small wedges. They give you a ton of pita bread but nobody wants to eat mostly bread for their meal. Lamb Burger and meatballs were a good size but overall I wouldn't go back or order again because prices dont match portion sizes.
Super friendly waiter and staff. The seafood pasta was delicious with a good amount of seafood in the dish. The calamari is a GREAT portion size. Recommend!

To my delight, discovered this food truck.  I was so struck by what it seemed to be miracle since you barely see any food trucks in this area.  But to my dismay, I discovered this AFTER I bought my lunch of the day, ahah.   So I quickly ran to the owner to ask about his schedule, his twitter updates (he did not have any), and everything else I could possibly fit into one conversation!   I was just THAT excited.  But again, the thought that my lunch bag was already in my hands was disconcerting.  However, I found out he was departing the area at 3pm, so I quickly came back to fulfill this 2:30pm slump - even though a lobster roll can probably worsen the lethargy.   In any case, it was amazing.  At Luke's Lobster, although it is good, my mouth can be slightly open and can fit that hotdog bun style of a lobster roll.  With this place, my mouth could barely fit the collosal pile of lobster meat.  Pieces were falling apart onto my box... not sure if that is a good thing? hahaha!   The roll was crazy packed with meat, it literally touched my nose, sheesh!  

I was also impressed the accepted c/c.. and not only that, they took amex, oooh aaaah - yes, thank you FourSquare!   (Amex is sort of like the black sheep stepchild of the c/c family or whatever child they call it.)

Taste like crap!

$20 = Rip Off!

Never again!

This is the same as:
yelp.com/biz/urban-lobst…

They're starting to show up at this intersection more and more regularly... probably because of all the 1 and 2 star reviews at the old spot?  I dunno... I got nothing against it.  Eaten here a few times now and it's always been good.  There's usually a little line in front of it too so it can't be all bad.

Saw the truck during lunch and decided to give it a try.  For $13 I got this cold lobster sandwich on effectively what was a hot dog roll.  I can't say that the lobster was particularly great.  It reminded me of a cheap seafood salad - not even a serviceable one.  

Perhaps next time I will see if they have any hot meal options.  This wasn't satisfying.
Not impressed at all.  $15 for tasteless claw meat (no tail meat at all) on a cheap hot dog bun.  Mac and cheese was very oily and tasted gross.  Would not go back and would not recommend.

I've had the lobster roll twice and it satisfies my craving for them.  On my last visit (last Thursday in the Union Square area on 17th Street), I tried the New England Clam Chowder.  The flavor was delicious, however, this was the thinnest clam chowder I have ever had.  I could have sipped it through a straw.

Cute upper east side food truck. It is clean and well lemon. The staff operates efficiently and clean. The egg and cheese on a croissant was just what I wanted,  the croissant is buttery and fresh. My fiancé got the chorizo egg and cheese which he really enjoyed. A Mexican twist on a Sunday morning breakfast classic. Will try the coffee next time.

URI's Coffee is on Second Avenue and 83rd Street

Positives
Right outside Q Train Entrance.
Authentic Mexican Food.
You can tell because the delivery men all wait in line.
Assorted muffins and pastries.
Prices are posted so there is no guessing.
Friendly employee.

Down Side
I'm not paying $1.50 for coffee and I don't have a place to sit. But I'm not holding that against URI!
I think it's pricey but then what do I know!
It's definitely a long wait time which is another reason I skipped coffee. He is handling food preparation and needs a assistant to sell quick items like coffee or pastries. Even a bottle of water is a wait.
It's still a four star Food Truck because my friend gave his meal a definite thumbs up!

Salmon Teriyaki Bento Box for lunch is priced at $10.00, which is about average for your midtown lunch. They do have a cheap surf clam sashimi for $2.50 and (cooked) lobster slice for $4.00. I've only ordered from here once but delivery was quick and easy and the bento box was doable. I'm surprised they don't have a yelp page...but it's worth a try.

Located on a 52nd between Lex and 3rd where it receives the foot traffic of the corporate finance elites trying to grab a quick $15 lunch to go back to their cubicles. The restaurant was relatively busy which raised my expectations. However, when I opened my take-out container, I had never been more confused by the look of a sushi roll. A co-worker suggested I cut my losses and toss out my lunch. I decided it wouldn't hurt to try out a few pieces, but everything was just wrong about it. It was soggy, falling apart and I couldn't even identify which roll was which after eating them! Now, I'm sitting at my desk praying to god I do not get food poisoning. Save your time, money, and love for sushi by skipping this place.

Lesson learned.  When you're craving sushi for dinner, do not order from a place with a menu that also features fried noodles and thai curry.  Our expectations were not sky high, but even so, we were disappointed.  The fish was not fresh, the seaweed in the rolls was soggy, and the rice didn't hold together.  Fair warning, sushi lovers!

good food and good price.  these guys have been there for yrs and I haven't even noticed if they've ever raised their prices.

they're good to their customers and that's why there's always a long line, but it moves quickly.  i always get the Hercules combo the works.  

Love Uncle Gussy's.

Decent food and price is alright for what it is in midtown.

Not the best cart you can get around the area but they work quick so even if the lines seem a little long, it'll go down quick.

I personally like the other gyro cart on 53rd more than this one but to each their own. This spot will always be popular during lunchtime.

Nothing too amazing or stands out in regards to their food.

Still as delicious as I remember! When I was still working in the Financial District, I'd have Uncle Gussy's Chicken Breast platter at least once every 2 weeks. Pre-pandemic times, that's right. That's how I've gotten to know Nicko and his team over social media because I was a regular.

Fast forward to the other week. My husband was near their Park Avenue truck and the thought of having their chicken platters and souvlakis were just too good so I ordered online, messaged Nicko and he said, "I got you, guys." Hubby comes home and I see that Nicko threw in some extra fries with feta cheese! What a treat! Thanks again for that!

Anyway, safe to say we tremendously enjoyed that meal. I absolutely love their tzatziki and hot sauces too. Heck even their simple side salad that's in every platter is divine. And the pita. And the rice. And that everything tastes fresh and delicious. I somehow can't understand how they could make a simple chicken breast to be delicious and more importantly, not dried out, which tends to be the case mostly but not here. Absolutely cannot wait for our next Uncle Gussy's meal! Thanks again to Nicko and the team! :)

Great Greek food truck!  The line gets long, but the service is quick and friendly. I always the the Greek salad with gyro meat as my go to lunch. The meat is flavorful and plentiful!  This is definitely a great value for the money.

Ordered the lamb/gyro fries box w the works
But they gave me rice instead

The pros of this store was its speed and presentation

The downside being that the meat and sauce were extremely mid

Its probably as good as it gets in the immediate area for lunch halal trucks but its not impressive (and is $2 more than the other top halal choices like halal guys/ adels)

Pass on this if you got the other two aforementioned options but otherwise this will generally do the trick

Definitely lives up to the hype.

Came here a few weeks ago and waited on about a 20 minute wait. Looked extremely long but they move fast and are like machines.

I had 2nd thoughts about waiting but really wanted to try it.

Boy was i happy i stayed on line. Absolutely incredible- i got the hercules plate it was full of gyro crispy fries and salad.

Their hot sauce is amazing. The fries are amazing - the "greek salad" could definitely use some more love and dressing. But still 5 stars for me.

Just go and wait on line you will not be disappointed.

Tried these guys today for a gyro sandwich and fries and it was excellent.  Good was super hot and and owner genuinely asked how my day was going--I dig that.  Good people and hood food.  Give them a try.

Friendly staff and big portions here - I got "The Hercules" combo (lamb + chicken) with the works (white sauce + hot sauce + grilled onions). I came by for a late lunch, so there was no line and food was quick and hot. Definitely one of my favorite halal carts.

Been a patron of this truck since I started working in the area. The pandemic has changed my work status to fully remote so I haven't been able to get my fix.
Just recently I found myself in the area and walked over to Uncle Gussy's spot. I ordered 2 chicken and rice platters with tzatiki and hot sauce and brought it home to my family.
The rice and chicken were cooked perfectly and survived the trip home. I'm happy to see them still thriving in the heart of midtown east and the food is still fantastic!
Highly recommend.  Big portions and delicious food for a reasonable price.

Great service!  They keep the line moving by having a separate window for delivery service. I had the basic gyro and fries. Boxed up so it wouldn't get soggy. Everything was made perfectly and served in under 3 minutes for $16. What's not to love!

Solid Gyro's. I stopped by and ordered a lamb gyro with the white and hot sauce. It came in a little foil pouch to keep it warm. The lamb was flavorful while the creamy white sauce was extra-garlicky and delicious. Lettuce and tomatoes completed everything. The portion was just enough to be worth the $10. Would go back if in Midtown-east again.

Oh my God. The reviews are true. So I have a combo over fries with the works. It was amazing. So juicy and flavorful and the right amount of everything. Although I have to admit, I added more salad and tomatoes to the dish. But I really like salad Mixed in with the rest of it. The fries are amazing. Perfectly seasoned and crispy perfection. I usually find french fries to be very bland and boring a great find as I was cycling down Park Avenue!!!!
Very good Greek food. I've had the gyro sandwich several times and it always satisfies. Great meat flavor and the tzatziki is delicious. There is always a line at lunch but it moves fast.

Food truck that is known for its tzatziki sauce, and that has all of the greek food staples. It has a lot of hype around it, but I was not blown away. The food was not bad by any means, but I felt that is was very average. I got a chicken pita with fries on the side.

6

One of my Favorite Greek places in the city. Food Truck located at the corner of East 51st Street and Park Ave. The Lunch Line can sometimes get pretty crazy. I love the Pork Sausage Hercules. It comes with Greek Rice, Salad and Fries with your choice of Meat. It is super delicious and worth the price. With a drink and all, comes to about $18 or $19 for the Hercules Meal. There is seating nearby around the Buildings with concrete benches where other people sit and have lunch.

This place is pretty good!

Came here for a work lunch with a colleague and it was convenient. The downside is that it's cash only... so buyers beware. They had a wide range of pitas and sandwiches (check out image below). Service was quick and cast and the person at the window was helpful and courteous.

I ordered the chicken pita with the works. It was cooked well and sauces were nice. Packaging was also great and included utensils and napkins which were helpful for this hand food. Overall, a good meal and may come back here in a gif.

After listening to an interview done by Abdus from Thinknum on this food truck, I decided I must try. As the first ever Greek food truck in NYC, they definitely have the best gyro platter. The "Hercules" comes with fries and actual greek salad with feta. The sauces are served on the side so if you do get it delivered the fries are still crisp and hot. The gyro lamb and beef was flavorful and tender. I pretty much end up mixing it all up, but there is enough to save some for later. It is a pretty hefty plate. Looking forward to trying the chicken next time!
Warm chicken on top of melty feta and onions, over Greek salad. Perfection.  long line but it moves fast.

Uncle Gussy's does not disappoint. If you're craving a solid Greek gyro, this seems to be the truck to go to. Prices are little higher than other food trucks, but it'll certainly satisfy. Only wish the hours of the truck expanded into the evening.

Best gyro and Hercules platter is perfection . The meat is  moist , flavorful and the tzatziki sauce is perfect! With that said,  you sleep on their hot sauce either or fried; their food is of great quality and always fresh ; it's my go to whenever possible and thankfully happy they deliver as well.

Great food for a great price. Friendly staff and also have an order ahead option for pick up.
We shared a Hercules and then sat in the church steps and watch the people go by.
Def worth  a try on a good weather day. It can't be beat. Will def be back.

Saw all the reviews and was so excited to have Uncle Gussy's for lunch. I ordered the Chicken Breast Platter which comes with rice, chicken and salad for $9 (oh my word! It was a ton of food) which was awesome for being in New York City and expecting to spend a lot . Two people can eat comfortably from one platter. I will say however that next time I'll opt for the Chicken Thigh Platter as the chicken breast was a little on the dry side but it was well flavored and tasty.

Ps. Plan ahead before you get super hungry, the line was a little lengthy but moved speedily.

It's all Greek to me!

This very large Greek food truck is a full size restaurant kitchen on wheels and always has a line.

I decided to wait on the long line for my lunch break and it went pretty quick and I ordered half gyro and half chicken over fries with salad. They give good amount of food and not to much to put you in that lunch food coma vibe where you can't get any work done for the rest of the day. The meats are really good and have a solid Mediterranean taste and the fries were perfectly crispy.

In short:
- solid lunch food truck spot
- fair price
- fries are good
I like the sauces here, quite fresh and tasty. I ordered the gyro and grilled pork platter on rice. The meat was a bit dry but was better with the sauce.

I've long fantasied about retiring to Greece; buying a house by the sea, living a relaxing life with all the gyros and souvlaki. Instead, I find myself weaving through the chaos of midtown pedestrian traffic, in an attempt to get the closest thing to that fantasy. Yes, in an ironic twist, the best way to Greek tranquility is through New York City chaos, but at the end of that chaos is Greek food to rival that of Athens in it's prime.

Uncle Gussy's food truck serves up the typical Greek fare, offering gyro meat, chicken slouvaki and the most amazing Greek fries. Though the line can look insurmountable, the friendly staff moves through orders with Herculean efficiency and friendliness. Although the line stretches down half of the avenue on a good day, I'm usually not waiting more than ten minutes before I get that delicious blue box in my hands.

Awesome I could order  online and then go pickup as I walked down Park, the line was crazy ass nuts so glad I didn't order there and wait it out.  
Chicken pita had great spice and flavor to it, and the fries inside gave it the extra little crunch texture that I figured would be perfect. Pita was good consistency even though a little chewy, but still pretty solid. Would have liked a little more sauce as well but overall really nice quick lunch from a food truck that had online ordering which worked out perfectly.

Believe in the hype, it is so good. I wish I worked closer to here but I guess we can't get all of what our heart desires! First, you know a food carts good when you come at an arbitrary time like 3:20 pm on a snowy day and there's a couple of people ahead of you. The prices are reasonable and the portions are more than suffice. The staff is also really sweet and swift (can we coin that phrase)? Like finishes making my meal in 2 minutes max kind of swift. I got the combo wrap with fries inside (because like, why not) and it did not disappoint. The fries were so good (kind of wish there was more) and there was more than enough meat in it (most important part obviously). It was $9 (sandwich typically $8 but extra $1 for the fries). Definitely stopping by again.

On a random side note, in case you would want to sit and eat maybe there's something closer but due to the less than lovely NYC January weather I just went to the open food court/seating area/idk what to call it at Rockefeller Center it's max a 10 minute walk- enjoy!
I am so obsessed with this place. It's gourmet Greek food. Fresh, yummy, portions are huge!! See you guys again very soon
I had the combo plate with chicken, lamb, rice, and salad. Very good and filling meal. Long line but worth the wait.

If you want good Greek food, this is the place to get.  Yes the line could be long sometime, but is well worth it.   My favor one is Pork Souvlaki Hercules or Gyro Hercules.  The portion is huge.  Hercules comes with rice, fries, Greek salad & pita bread.  I love the fries, cuz they are always crispy...  I always asked sauce on the side.  You gotta try it yourself to see how good the food is.

Whenever I go out to lunch around 12-1pm (depending on my workload), I always see an insane line stretch across the block to this food truck. I was curious what all the hype is about. It's a good thing I asked a friend about it so I know how to avoid the line completely.

I was recommended to preorder my food. It costs an extra $0.50 or a dollar, don't remember which, but you get to completely cut the line that way and save yourself time. Preorder is only available up to 10am, so order early.

I ordered the Chicken Hercules with Mild Hot Sauce and Add Grilled Peppers and Onions. The meal comes with yellow rice, greek salad, pita bread, and fries. The order costed around $14 with tax which isn't bad for what you're getting. The food itself is really good and I can see why people are willing to sacrifice half of their lunch hour waiting for this. Will be looking forward to trying other items on the menu in the future.

Uncle Gussy's is now Uncle Skimpy's!  Not sure what happened - really good portions before Covid.  Now the prices have gone up post Covid, which is fine, but the portions are much smaller which is not cool!  Used to go three times a week- now it's not worth it.  Food is still good though!

I was meeting my BF for lunch one weekday near his office, and he recommended Uncle Gussy's for Greek. I could always use some Greek food, and this place was also on my bookmarks list, so it was perfect. We arrived a little after 1 pm and waiting about 15 minutes (according to BF, there's always a line). We decided to go halfsies on the Hercules (yellow rice, Greek salad, pita bread, and fries) with chicken, and added a side of lamb. This was more than enough for two people, especially since they don't skimp on the meat. We were still full at dinnertime. I prefered the lamb over the chicken because the chicken has this charred flavor I don't really care for, which my BF loves, so if you like barbecued stuff, this one's for you. The more you eat the platter, the heavier it feels, and the saltier it tastes, but the Greek salad definitely helps cut that. It's worth feeling like a beached whale afterwards, but just make sure you have plenty of water available - you'll need it.

Tip - cash only!

High quality food truck in Midtown East that consistently puts out good food. I usually go for a chicken or gyro platter, but tried a chicken Greek salad today and really enjoyed that as well. Basic salad base with feta, olives, and a grape leaf and perfectly cooked chicken thigh on top. Make sure to get their tzatziki sauce on whatever you order too because it is some of the best I have eve had. Price is right for the quality. Be prepared for a long line, but it moves fast because these guys are pros. One of the better lunch spots in the area for sure

Was working in the 345 Park Ave location and colleague recommended I try out the famous Uncle Gussy's for all things, Greek.

The food truck is located right on Park Ave and has a very long line so be prepared to wait if you make the visit during rush hours. It reminds me of the Halal Guys which I am a fan of so I had some high expectations coming into this visit.

I've ordered the chicken breast rice platter with both the white and red sauce on it. It is a (4/5) and definitely fills you up for a low price of $9. It is a bit hearty and heavy, which I never feel after eating Halal Guys. It must be the sauce or something. That said, Uncle Gussy's is a decent choice if you're looking for a nice box lunch to take with you back to the office. My box was hot, fresh, and packed a 1,2 punch

Will likely return but try maybe a wrap or something lighter...

This is delicious, likely not healthy (but you know that when you order it), and probably the best food truck Greek I've ever had. Line is always very long but if you go late or early for lunch you don't have to wait long

At last I have tried the infamous Uncle Gussy's and left a little underwhelmed unfortunately. I think it may be because of my constant love for the Halal Guys. I know Uncle Gussy's is Greek so it's a different type of cuisine but I can't help but compare. Uncle Gussy's just didn't meet the same addiction level I have for the Halal Guys. I got the combo platter with hot sauce and their infamous tzatziki  sauce. Although the rice was plentiful with moist and well-seasoned chicken and lamb, it just was only good to me. Not as mind-blowing as I hope and I think it was mainly due to the sauces. I felt the need to add way more sauce than I usually would with anything else. Maybe because the tzatziki sauce tasted lighter and the hot sauce was not as hot as the Halal Guy's red sauce, I thought the whole combination was worth trying but not worth it for a long wait.

Overall, this place is definitely good and I can tell it is well-respected. But for my personal preference and allocation of my fat calories, I don't feel the need to go out of way to go back again.

$9 for a generous portion of meat over rice, $11 over fries, and $13 for rice/fries/and pita.

Got the gyro meat - the lamb with tzatziki and hotsauce was delicious

Would definitely come back

I ordered the Hercules with Chicken (dark meat) which included a Greek lettuce salad (olives, feta cheese, tomatoes and lettuce), french fries, yellow rice topped with chicken drizzled with tzatziki and hot sauce.  It came with slices of pita bread on the side.

I went around 12:15 PM.  The line was long but it went somewhat fast (this was on Good Friday - can't imagine how much the line maybe on a regular Friday).  There is a sign on the truck that mentions you can order online for pick up.  My order took a few minutes to prepare (the line itself took longer than my order - it shows how efficient they truly are!).  

I was a bit worry about the fries being soggy since I had to I trek back to Grand Central Terminal but was surprise at how crispy the fries was.  They'll ask you at the end if you want the tzatziki/hot sauce so you can always opt out of it or maybe ask them to put it on the side (I asked them to go easy on the hot sauce and they did a good job of that!).  The pita bread started to get a bit tough by the time I dig into it but I was getting full with everything else.  I did wish there were some hummus with the pita bread.  Chicken was well flavor.  

After my meal, I was pretty thirsty for the rest of the day/after.  I'm hoping it was a one-off or maybe it was something else that made me thirsty.  Will definitely go back and try the Pork Soulvaki.

I am usually pretty leery of food trucks but Uncle Gussy's appears to be clean.  I used to feel the dirtier the place, the better the food probably taste but I'm not sure my stomach can handle that anymore.   : )

Checked this place out after seeing the good ratings for this food truck. They have raised their prices, but it's still affordable in regards to the area. I order the Hercules and enjoyed the meal very much. The chicken was over-seared, but was still juicy. Overall it's a packed with flavor, but I'd say the portions is concerning in comparison to the price.

I am very disappointed in the experience I just had. The Worker told me I'm mad because I read the menu wrong after I told him what I wanted to order. I'm very disappointed in the service and will not be back.

Came here and had the pork souvlaki pita "Greek style". The sandwich was good but didn't measure up to the daily gyros I ate while in Greece. Perhaps I am judging it too harshly. It was an enjoyable sandwich, but the flavors stuck with me for a couple of hours later too if you know what I mean.   The line moves pretty fast and there are plenty of steps nearby to sit on and eat your takeout.

Cash only
You can order ahead for pickup, in order to skip the line, but a 50 cents convenience fee will be added to your overall total.
$8 for the chicken platter and such a generous portion was given.
It's a midtown staple for everyone who works between 45th and 52nd street near park avenue.
Be prepared to itis after the fact.

The Food Truck is located at northeast corner of 51st Street and Park Avenue.
The line can be big and wait time can run for 30 minutes between 12 and 1 pm.

Food:
Whether you get Chicken, Lamb, Beef or Pork, Proteins are perfectly seasoned.
The menu is simple. you can get any protein on Pita or platter which comes with pickled onions, olives, fresh tomatoes, lettuce, feta cheese and the delicious Tzatziki sauce which appreciately compliments the sandwich or platter.
If you are super hungry go for the Hercules. for 12 bucks you get everything in one box.

I ordered the chicken breast "hercules" platter which is grilled chicken breast over yellow rice, French fries and a greek salad, served with warm
Pita and white and yellow sauces. Everything tasted fresh and the flavors were really good, especially the rice which tasted really good by itself( when does that happen? ) and the fries which stayed crispy even when cold. but the chicken breast itself was very tough and rubbery. The chef did warn be about that though so may be the next time i ll order a different kind of meat. The platter was for $13 and could easily feed 2 moderately hungry adults. You get a good value for your money!

The classic gyro on a pita was delicious and much better than the gyro platter in my opinion. Additionally, it's surprisingly filling and only 8-9 bucks.

You can also skip the massive line and order online, which is very convenient.

OMG. This place is amazing. The only downfall is the fact that I'm trying to be healthy, so that sucks. The chicken is super tender, the white sauce is as good as I heard, the rice is amazing (just the smells alone are worth it) and the people who run this food truck are just so good at what they do. The guy at the cash register is really nice, and they get your food out at an amazing pace (great, because of how long the lines get).
I got the chicken platter, although the combo platter with lamb smelled and looked amazing as well. You can also try to be a bit healthier and get the meal with salad instead of the rice, but personally, I think the rice is a must. The texture of the rice grains with the moist chicken is so incredibly satisfying. The aromas from your plate of food (the portions are huge) will make your entire office jealous, so take that into account when you're ordering!

Their sauce is to die for and everything on the menu is great - I don't even like Mediterranean food that much. Order online beforehand and skip the line. There's a $0.50 fee but during lunchtime, the line is usually at least 10 people long and you have to pay in cash in person but can use a credit card online.

I used to think the lunch game in Midtown was woefully lacking, but places like this are really making me rethink this initial assertion! Uncle Gussy's popularity cannot be denied, as if you've ever been on Park Ave you've likely seen the droves of people lined up to get a taste of the succulent gyro, and I have to say the wait would be worth it! Pro tip too, order online to skip out on the wait and get to pay with card. It's cash only otherwise.

Got the gyro sandwich and seasoned fries. The fries were ok, not extra crispy like I normally like, but very well seasoned and generously proportioned. You certainly get more than you need to compliment the gyro. Now the gyro...this may be among the best I've ever had! What I enjoyed the most was that it wasn't overtly greasy or heavy. It was certainly filling and very flavorful but I didn't have the feeling that I was eating something that was drenched in oil. Every bite was delectable, and since it was so clean I couldn't get enough. The pita was surprisingly good too, and really added to the meal.

Overall, some might argue that other street meat places are cheaper, but to me this is quality over quantity. It may be a little more expensive, but I'll gladly play a premium for the clean eating experience I had, capped off by an addicting flavor and high quality gyro I had.
Good quality. They have great breakfast options. I recommend "The Healthy." Just like how it sounds, it's a very healthy breakfast option.
Had this place almost every night during my stay in nyc. So good. The guy was really nice as well. We tipped him very good.

This halal cart is what keeps us Fordham students running.

I didn't grab any food today, but I've eaten here a handful of times and I can attest to the opinion that the food is pretty good. I usually get the chicken on rice with salad and I don't have any issues eating it. It's decent in flavor and texture, especially for the very affordable price. More times than not, I pass by here to grab a quick drink because they charge the best prices in the area.

Many students at the Lincoln Center campus praise this cart and for good reason.

6.5/10

Chicken over rice: it is pretty greasy, I felt terrible after eating it; rice is relatively bland; overall, not much flavor, lots of grease, but not the worst halal that you can get; chicken is pretty tender, but also not enough flavor

It's amazing, especially on a Sunday night nothing else around is open and when you just want a filling meal to go to bed happy. Lamb over rice is delicious. The guy is also very nice and loves the USA, hence his cart's name. Will keep this cart at the top of my list!

Still reliable after all these years. Service very attentive drive. We had basic breakfast and it came fast. Plenty of coffee refills. Visiting sister was happy. Still getting used to sticker price these days though.

It's a diner so you get what you get!

Big portions of food, easily shareable- great neighborhood diner. The service is attentive and friendly!

We got the buttermilk pancakes, side of bacon and the home fries, and the BLT

So love love love this place. It's a diner people. Does that look like a patty melt? Kinda. Was it good? SO SO GOOD. Perfect? No but the patty was amazing. The service here is always amazing and it's a staple in the hood!!! Blueberry pancake super fresh. Not frozen, fresh!! Will return again and again and again!!

We walked into this place as it looked friendly and we were starving. I ordered a moussaka which was supposed to be the chef's special. It was the worst moussaka I have ever had, stale meat with two pieces of Aubergine inside. I didn't complain to the waiter because he was not friendly to start with and I was afraid he would spit in my food. When he came to clear my plate I let him know that I didn't like the food so he disappeared and wouldn't even bring us the bill. My husband had to ask 4 times to the owner then the waiter showed up and just gave us the bill and no space for us to sign for tips and just swiped the credit card. He never even gave us the merchant copy of the bill and gave himself a tip without even asking how much we wanted to pay!! Rude service & bad food! Stay away!
Huge menu. Fast service. Big portions. My Cobb salad was fresh and delicious. My husband's BLT was just what he wanted. I miss these kind of restaurants. I

Absolute crap. Eggshells in the matzo balls, $8.50 for two tiny testicles in broth. Corned beef hash dry and disgusting. A shell of their former selves
F*ck them.

I went here many many years ago and I was happily surprised to find it still here. The service is very friendly. Everything was very flavorful and cooked as we requested.  The only disappointment was the home fries which were bland and generic.

This is a solid and dependable New York City diner and we're thankful that you can still get a decent meal at a reasonable price in an otherwise very expensive area of the Upper West side.
Was looking for a simple diner style breakfast and we found it here.  Eggs, bacon, corned beef  hash and fried potatoes.  The staples of a diner breakie.  Staff was super friendly and very quick.
Great neighborhood diner. Good service and good food. Explore the menu before, but they have you covered for the NYC Diner experience.

Today I visited Utopia Diner for a salad and stuffed (loaded) baked potato. I've visited this diner one other time and had a really good burger so I thought this would be an easy order. Boy was I wrong! When my order arrived it was no where near what I thought a stuffed baked potato would be! They sliced the potato into four wedges and put SLICED CHEESE on top. No butter, no salt...just a tasteless potato that I had to doctor up to make edible. To make matters worse, it cost close to $15! The honey mustard salad dressing I ordered was two packets of honey dijon SAUCE (like for chicken tenders). I was to shocked and disappointed to complain. With so many other options in the area, I can think of a much better way to spend $30 on a meal. Sadly, I will not be returning to this establishment.

I love it here. I freaked out when I read there was a problem with the lease. I guess they worked it out. I don't feel like talking about the food. If you are a tourist looking for something exciting or whatever--go away and don't bother us. This is an UWS landmark.  If it closes, I will move. I'm not kidding.
A standard breakfast diner.  Eggs over easy with bacon and coffee!  I would need to try a few other dishes to give this diner a complete review.  So far so good though!

We had the worst dinner ever at the Utopia Diner.  I ordered the roast chicken and it arrived both pink inside and dry as a bone.  Sides arrived later and were equally unpleasant.  My husband ordered the spinach pie and it was so dry and sad looking that he couldn't even eat it.  We both made do with our salads and now know never to go back to this place.  The waiter was totally unapologetic and said that most patrons like the spinach pie crispy.  Well, it was burnt on top and soggy all over.  Really bad food.
This diner is a few blocks from Central Park.  I liked the sandwich as a main course, and a piece of chocolate mousse cake for dessert.

If you are looking for an old-school diner, check this place out. I never even realized this was in the UWS till I had brunch with friends here. The staff seems to know their regulars so you get that small-town feel and the menu is definitely very old school but they have gluten-free bread! I got a BLT with fries, and the portion was smaller than I expected but lootttssss of fries. If you want that diner feel, I would check this place out.

Bad even by diner standards. I ordered scrambled eggs and they came back almost like an omelette. Spinach was just plain boiled till it lost its color. Even the tea bag was so lacking tea flavor. I would not go here again.

Came here yesterday for my birthday. They give a lot of food and the food is great. The restaurant is nice but you must pass through the area were they pick up
the food to get to the restrooms. The restrooms are so small. My family said their long island ice teas were strong!

Went for brunch and it was really good. They were quick to bring out the appetizers and also quick with bringing the main dish. We're very attentive to when refills were needed for the mimosas/sangria. Very great taste in the food and options given.

Utopia holds a very special place in my heart. I moved to NYC five years ago and my first agency-provided housing apartment was on the UWS on W. 71st. Utopia diner was one block away and I would go here anytime I wanted a good, satisfying breakfast at any time of the day. Upon walking inside, it just gives me that NYC diner feel. Nothing fancy or pretentious, just cozy city diner vibes. They do have the usual autographed celebrity headshots hanging up behind the cashier. There are coat hooks randomly secured around the interior. The owners are friendly and personable. And of course, the food is consistently good and portions are generous. I usually have a little bit of leftovers. The coffee is nice and strong. The service is very quick and efficient. This place gets pretty crowded, I've noticed, especially during the weekends and there are lots of early birds. I, personally, have never had to wait, but I can see them having more customers than they can seat during a busy morning. They have booths to fit families and also smaller booths to fit just two people. There is also a counter where you can sit. I have no complaints about this establishment and will definitely continue to stop by when I am craving a good simple and satisfying breakfast while I am visiting the UWS.

After a 10 mile run in Central Park, my friends and I needed to fuel up. Half wanted breakfast and the other wanted lunch since it was 11:30am. We walked around and landed here because diner food felt right and we knew there would be variety! It was a packed house but we were seated immediately at the last open booth. Waitress then came quickly to take our order.

Now, the food was ok. I got a Chef Special Moussaka with a Manhattan Clam Chowder on the side. Nothing special but hit the spot. I thought it also came with a small Greek Salad, but I was wrong. The waitress was incredibly nice and still brought one out for me as courtesy and didn't charge me! Customer service goes a long way (and an extra star)!

Yesterday morning, Sunday March 6th, we decided to order in. My wife called Utopia Diner and placed two orders of French toast, one with turkey sausage. I heard her ask, "Please make sure the turkey sausage is fresh." She mentioned this because at least twice before, the sausage that had come with our meal was shriveled or old and could not be eaten.
Our order took about 45 minutes to arrive but that was ok. We knew it was a late Sunday morning and they were probably busy.
As my wife was removing our food from the containers, she called me into our kitchen to take a look at our order.  I observed that the two orders of French toast were burnt. It's not the first time the order has been overcooked but this time, one order was literally black on both sides of the bread. I told her that we couldn't eat the food that was  delivered and she agreed to call and ask for a replacement.
As she described the condition of the food that was delivered,  I heard the person from the restaurant say "You are always complaining about something, I will send another order this last time and don't order from us again."  My wife looked shocked and asked, "What did we complain about last time?" He stated that we had called to complain that our food was once delivered to the wrong building. The doorman from the building across the street had to call for us to come and get it.  He also said that she keeps complaining about the sausage.  We couldn't believe what he had said and when she tried to respond, he hung up on her.
I threw on some clothes and walked to the diner which was less than three blocks from us but since having back surgery two months ago, walking was not the easiest of tasks.
I asked for the manager and was directed to a man who identified himself as "Mike."  
Mike stated that my wife always "complained" that she wanted fresh sausage, and she has previously complained a couple of times that the there was a problem with our order.
I had to ask Mike if his restaurant was not an establishment where people paid to have food prepared the way they wanted.  I also asked if he knew the difference between a request and a complaint. He was dismissive.  He said that he never hung up on my wife, he was just busy. He repeated that he was tired of hearing her complain about the turkey sausage.
At the same time he admitted that the sausage may not have been sent in the best condition at least once or twice, and that he wrote down the wrong address that's why the food was delivered to the wrong building.
He really blew my mind when I asked him if today's complaint was unwarranted and he stated  "You said both orders of French toast were burnt but only one order was burnt."  So in his mind, his justification for sending inedible food was that some of the food, in his opinion, was edible.  Instead of apologizing, he blamed my wife for calling to complain. Some of the customers who were seated nearby, kept shaking their heads in disbelief.
I realized that Mike was never going to admit that he was wrong. So I told him that he seriously needed to work on his customer service skills.  I then walked out of the restaurant. When I got home, my wife joked about getting money to bail me out of jail but thanked me for defending her honor. She knew I would handle the matter respectfully.
My final message to Mike is that in my opinion, there is a difference between a request when placing an order and complaining. Even if he doesn't agree with how an order is placed, he should remember that he works in the service industry.  I am not saying that anyone should disrespect you or your employees, which was certainly not the issue today.
If the order is wrong or the quality is poor,  just apologize and offer a refund or exchange.

My wife and I went to the Utopia Diner this morning at 10:30. There was only one or two tables occupied. We were greeted and seated by a somewhat gregarious man of apparently middle-eastern descent. Our first hint of  what was to come was his comment that "We don't want to be another Carmine's".

We were served coffee, and placed our order for breakfast. That's when the wait started...

We watched while 4 other tables became occupied, all with at least 2 people. We watched over the next 25-30 minutes while all of the other tables were served. We had to flag down a server to ask for a refill on our coffee. Then we waited some more...

A server finally came out and explained that they had an issue with "bubbles in the waffle batter, so they had to re-mix it. Should be coming now.".
We waited another 10 minutes, watched as another table, folks who arrived a full 15 minutes after us, was served. It is worth noting that my wife and I are Black. All of the other diners were White.

Not wanting to be further disrespected by their subtle but apparent racism, we stood up, tossed a $5 bill on the table, and left. I guess they are "another Carmine's".

First time here and I'm judging it as an outsider.
This is place is not the cleanest, not the most luxurious, or the most sophisticated brunch place. But, it does have loving and caring people that work there. I got greeted with a big genuine smile and a welcome, which is already more than a lot of places in NY. I asked about they Challah Toast and was encouraged to get it. I'm all about trying new things so I did. It was super tasty, thick slices of bread soaked in egg wash similar to a French toast but with a much more thicker slice of bread.
The coffee was more acidic than normal, tasty but strong and acidic. This by far, is the biggest side of bacon I have ever seen. Usually it's a slice or two, but at Utopia it's a whole stash of thick crispy bacon!
Love it here! They are always so friendly and their service is super speedy. I love coming here for their delicious burgers and breakfast items.

Usually I don't have a problem with this diner, but today was special.
I asked for an avocado wrap, which comes with fries, a pickle and a small bit of cole slaw. The wrap wasnt that great (everything felt kind of excessive and didnt mix well), but that wasn't  my initial problem. My initial problem came when i got my plate and I saw that I had a handful of fries on it, and not even a 5 guys handful.
Maybe I'm petty, that'll be up to you to judge, but when I go to a diner I'm expecting decent portion sizes. Especially if the meal is $16.
I did notice that another guest had fries with their meal and got way more than I did, so I'm not sure if they were rushing when they made my plate or what.
I'll probably try this place again, for the sake of past experiences, but this meal was a miss.

So good! Steven and I stumbled upon this before dance club earlier this week and our thirst, and obsession, for a good diner was quenched. I got the grilled portobello mushroom salad and Steven got the Santa Fe chicken salad + the mushroom barley soup special. We were so full and so pleased. The service was speedy and the portions are massive; I didn't finish my salad...

Great neighborhood gem!
The final straw was when I got chicken broth and two small matzo balls for $8. Like this is joke right?? I already had a sh it day but this really topped it off
My favourite neighborhood diner - it's so close to the 72nd St subway too! It's classic diner food, big portions, and sometimes it's just what you want

Don't understand the complaints. It's a diner. Pretty standard diner fair. Been here forever so it must be decent at least. I think people on the UWS just like to complain because it's not some trendy restaurant that will be here for a couple years tops until they can't afford the rent. This place you can always count on long after those trendy places come and go.

Came here late on a weekend for a no fuss meal. Straight up diner food at reasonable (for the area) prices and no wait.

Between two people, shared the Greek Omelet ($12) and Buttermilk Pancakes ($10). The omelet is LARGE - stuffed with feta, spinach, tomatoes, onions - just needed a little hot sauce. Dish also comes with potatoes, crisped and warm. The pancake stack was three high, and served with bananas and syrup. Pancakes are your solid fare; dark brown and fluffy.

Service is fast and got to enjoy our booth seating in peace. No frills spot; no frills food.
Perfect NY dinner. The staff could not be nicer. And the food really honors the tradition of good unpretentious dinners. A secure good choice!

I happened to be on the Upper West Side today and decided to visit this particular neighborhood diner. Utopia is your classic Greek diner offering everything from breakfast specials all day long to traditional Greek specialties like gyros and Greek feta salad. They also make drinks and cocktails which as you'll see I took advantage of.

I had just left the gym and needed a pick me up after my workout. I decided a bacon egg & cheese was the quickest and best way to go. I ordered 2 eggs scrambled with bacon and cheese on a roll. My waiter was a stand up guy, very personable. My sandwich came out with fine, crispy slices of bacon along with a nice layering of scrambled eggs. Simple, yet it did the job I wanted.

I'm sick and tired of this long and cold winter. And yes, I know its only just the very beginning of February, but I really wanted a taste of a tropical island paradise without blowing thousands on a plane ticket and a hotel stay. Without a second thought, I went with a Piña Colada. And I will give Utopia my Brunch stamp of approval. Their cocktails are on point!

This is somewhere you should NOT go. We had the clam chowder (floury and flavorless), a turkey BLT wrap (so dry you cannot open your mouth after taking a bite), and a special chicken sandwich where the chicken was so chewy that my boyfriend had to spit it out.
