Our meal was, to say the least, the most disappointing diner experience I have had in 5 years of living in NYC.

Additionally, the staff was incredibly rude. The man clearing tables grumbled at my boyfriend to sit differently and not cross his legs, as so to preserve the pristine vinyl booths in this tacky atmosphere.

Giving two stars because they had all gender (albeit TINY) restrooms.

We visited this place for lunch several times in the past.
Yesterday it was the last one. I could not recollect the restaurant where food is worse than here. My advice to tourists and NYC residents: avoid. Any place will be better than this.

The service was fast but perfunctory. The food was surprisingly weak. I ordered the Caesar Salad. The menu said their dressing was "famous." I do not think that word applies here. It looked and tasted like it was prepared by someone who doesn't know how a Caesar Salad should look or taste. I've had better Caesar salads at a gas station. I cannot recommend this place, unless you are in a hurry and aren't picky about flavor.

This place must be avoided. Unless you like mediocre diner food and underwhelming customer service.
I placed my order and literally called back the waiter to change it and he said "was already on Grill sorry". I had ordered pancakes and omelette, so it seems their grill should be on Ussain Bolt speed tournaments. So disappointed.
I'm usually a diner hunter because I love American food the "old way", but this one is a fake.
It is in a very nice location and seating was almost instant but what a shame they can't make up on the actual reason people visit them : to freaking eat and be served "
Will not be coming back and surely not advising any of my acquaintances to do so. Waste of space.
Chicken wings: 7/10. Very good for a diner. Bacon: 10/10. Marinara sauce and mozzarella sticks: coffeecup/10

If this is Utopia, I'm not feelin' it. My nine year old son and I ended up here because he said he didn't want to eat fancy. And boy did he mean it! We ordered two roast beef and swiss on rye sandwiches and one was worse then the next. We were so hungry so we ate part of it. We shared the silver dollar pancakes and it was flat, pale and half-cooked. Oh and yes, it tasted worse than an actual silver dollar.

We weren't going to take home our leftovers but a gentleman, in a wheelchair with no legs, was begging right outside by the door of the restaurant. The host of the restaurant went out and asked the man what he wanted and we witnessed him give the beggar a cup of coffee. Pretty nice guy and it made me want to like this place. Maybe the regular short-order cook had the day off. Who knows?!?! Notwithstanding, someone enjoyed the rest of our meal and at least has a full belly.

My family has loved Utopia for years and it was nice to get there again. We had breakfast, bagel and lox - comes with a big square of fresh cream cheese and a very generous portion of lox. Bagel was toasted perfectly and I enjoyed every bite.

My friend ordered the Greek omelet and I got to enjoy some of it too. She said it was very tasty but could have had a bit more cheese in it.

Service here is fast and terrific, Jordan was friendly and enthusiastic. We wanted to try the Challah French Toast and he suggested he being it for dessert, what a great idea, it was wonderful!

I must say it was great to see a real diner. Real Greek run nyc diner with the Greek owners actually there managing, hustling, greeting and chatting with guests.  Really made you feel welcome. Friendly and helpful servers, I think mine was named Jorge. Our burgers were hot and yummy. I had the Italian burger. Pretty yummy. Fresh basil leaves and generous amount of mozzarella cheese. Service was prompt and servers were attentive and treated folks respectfully.  I would definitely come back and recommend this place to folks. Menu had a lot of variety!  Adorable decorations for thanksgiving.

This is one of those places where "it is what it is." We came here for a quick dinner one night before heading to the Beacon Theatre for a show and since it seemed like the only place on the UWS that didn't have a wait, we decided to stop in and get a table for 2. As soon as we were seated, we were almost immediately brought water and asked if we were ready to order.

The menu is pretty straightforward and you get what you ask for basically, but that's all that it was.. was just okay. I ordered one of the dinner specials which was all in the $20-30 price range but came with soup and some dishes came with a small side salad. It was nothing to write home about, and even writing this review - there isn't much to rant or rave because everything was "just okay."

Prices were high but I attribute that to its location being right off the 72nd ave subway stop in the upper west side. Overall, the service was quick and efficient and everything came out as fast as I could have asked for, but I'd recommend coming here only if you really do have to be in and out of here quick and just want to get a quick bite.

Had a thoroughly lovely meal here. The wait staff was fantastic. They were always available and attentive without being intrusive.  They made us feel welcomed. The menu is extensive and has something for everyone. The food was very good.  We enjoyed among us, a sirloin steak, a turkey burger and a Greek salad.  Portions were generous. No possible room for desert

Popped in for breakfast and catch up time with a friend. Monday morning buzz, filled with locals. Friendly staff, fast and attentive. Basic diner style menu. Had a lumberjack - eggs bacon and French toast instead of pancakes. So busy talking and eating, forgot to take pics. Nice diner with great views of the city!

Nasty food. Expensive prices. Really nice people.
The food here was really bad! Perhaps I grew up a spoiled New Yorker - always eating great food- but I am shocked that a restaurant with such a great location, not to mention environment (its hard to find such cozy diners in Manhattan) would serve such dishes.

I ordered a wrap and mozzarella sticks. The wrap was gross. The mozzarella sticks burnt. I returned my plate practically untouched but I didn't protest when I got the check - the people here were nice and I had a sad feeling they might be out of a job soon.

If you like pretty good service but terrible food please come here.  The waiters here have always been good, but the food has been going downhill for awhile.  I recently ate here, and ordered the silver dollar pancakes.  Well, I didn't actually think they would taste worse than an actual silver dollar.  They clearly were not made fresh, and were just sitting in the back on a warmer, yet somehow were not warm.  They were hard and frankly, they were far larger than a silver dollar.  I guess the logic here is, let's give them a ton of very horrible pancakes.  This place is overpriced garbage, and you can clearly find better food elsewhere.  To top it off, they charge you a....SWIPING FEE! So if you pay with a credit card, it is an extra 4%.  Be smart and just raise the price slightly of your already overpriced menu items.

STAY AWAY
Best restaurant in NYC! Been coming since I was a child! I love this place! So sweet and staff is family! Definitely come! Everything I'd home cooked and delicious! It deserves 100000000000 stars!

A mediocre, overpriced standard diner. They nickel and dime you - wouldn't even give me one slice of tomato in lieu of toast and potatoes with my $14 omelet. Not only are they overpriced but they charge a 4% fee to use a credit card! They offered to void the card so I could pay cash but I didn't have it on me.

Food's ok and the waiters are nice enough. But the manager is brusque, unfriendly and plainly just wants you to eat & go so he can turn over the table. That kind of treatment makes the whole experience less than pleasant.
solid choice for a nabe diner.  Better and a bit cheaper than Viand.  Big menu quick and friendly service.  Id give a 3.5 if I could

Very nice renovation. Good diner food . Pleasant and efficient service.
Surprise at the register- 3% service charge on credit cards . NO warning or notification.
Disappointed in the attitude odd the "cashier "when I mentioned it he responded-"I will void it for cash " .
PS- I left a nice cash tip for the waiter.

Yesterday, I came to this location with a friend. Despite being seated next to a bunch of very enthusiastic children, it was a pretty chill atmosphere. Especially after said bunch left. If you have been to one Uno's, you've been to all of them. The interior is a mix of booths and high wooden chairs with wooden paneling.

I got their lunch special of the pizza and soup. I got a thin crust blanco rose, which was a white pizza with garlic and a broccoli cheddar soup. I love the broccoli cheddar soup! It was so warm and comforting. It's been a long time since I had it. However, I took it to the next level with some red pepper flakes. It was so filling that I almost couldn't eat the pizza. In hindsight, I probably would have been satiated with the soup alone. However, I am a pizza connoisseur, so I had to eat it. Plus, it's my favorite food group.

It was so good! It was garlicky and just cheesy enough. Also, I elevated it with the red pepper flakes and parmesan cheese. All in all, it was a good meal. The best part was the drinks. I had 2 dirty martinis, and they were so good and respectfully strong. I would have gotten a third, but I waited too long. For dessert, I had a Reeses Peanut Butter shooter, which is the quintessence of balanced decadence.

Also, I would be remiss not to give a shout out to our waiter. He was so nice, accommodating, and patient. He was amazing!

I would not mind coming here again as a solo diner. It's quiet with good food.

When sitting in, we normally have good service. When picking up, it really depends on who is up front for how long you'll wait and the personality you'll get.
I definitely agree with one of the previous reviews that stated the place has gone downhill since covid.  I know many places have suffered from staff shortages or are suffering. They are one of them as I noticed the hiring sign in the window. There's also now a changed health rating  They're now rated with a 'B'.
Yes, I have heard the rumors of the "paid for A rating," and those who say an "A rating means nothing," but it makes my mind, and my stomach feel better. Put it this way, I'm one of those people who preferred to bring home an A over a B to put it in perspective for you.
It doesn't even look the same. It's looks a bit as if it's falling apart. But there was still a good amount of people in there for the lunch rush, so I guess that speaks for the food. There were tables that looked like people recently left, and the plates were empty as well, so I'm just guessing that they enjoyed their meals.
It's unfortunate because it's the only Unos left in the city. The othe is in Queens, and then you have to commute of state. I hope they get it together before they get closed down as well.

Well, if you are looking for good eats and courteous hospitality at the Columbus Avenue location, you are not likely to get it here. I wish I could comment on the cuisine, but I never got the attention of the staff long enough to be serviced. While I try not to play the race card , since being raised in this melting pot, i know when a vibe is off. We just needed lunch to go, and I'm willing to wait for service, I can relate to under staffing by now. But when people choose to ignore my pleading request, I know it's time to go.  I no longer felt I trusted this place to serve me.  So I hope this helps when searching the area for food. Remember, food is a transfer of energy, be wary  of who handles what you  ingest.

Great service welcomes you at this deep-dish Chicago-style pizza. Our waitress was outstanding (I wish I had asked her name). We were dining with a 3-year old toddler, and she was patient, helpful and personable.

We showed up after 6pm on a Friday evening and the place was almost empty. They don't take reservations, but we clearly had no trouble finding an available booth.

We shared their classic Pizzeria Uno deep-dish pizza. The large has 10 slices. It was filling and flavorful, but the dough was dry, and tasted and looked a bit old (not sure why).

It's an ok option in the neighborhood, but the quality of the pizza is just average... not something to write home about.

Went here with my sister from out of town. Service was not good!! I do not blame the server she was stressed and was the ONLY person out on the floor. She was yelling and rushing at customers but I do not blame her I would just say this place is extremely understaffed. Once it slowed down she was extremely nice and talked to us for a bit since my sister was also in food service and could relate. Food was good but a little greasy. Wouldn't recommend the stuffed shells the pasta was a little too thick.

Avoid this place at all costs. Last Saturday I was by the museum and my sister and I decided to eat here. What a mistake. The hostess was so rude. She had an attitude from the beginning. Didn't even greet us, she just had an attitude.  The food was okay but not the best.

One star isn't even accurate here.

This place sucks. Sat down, 15 minutes no server. Asked for a server. One brought plates over and that's it. No water, orders were never taken after 15 minutes. Got up to leave and suddenly the "server" comes over saying sorry. We said no, we didn't feel like waiting a half hour. He said "it was only 15 minutes". 15 minutes is even unacceptable.

The restaurant was empty. One guy behind the bar and 3 women standing at the host stand on their phones.

I'll never try to come back here.

UNO's Upper West Side has been my go to for years. My eye doctor is down the street so I have lunch after my appointment. Sometimes my daughter and I make the trip from the East Side just to have lunch here and shop in the vicinity. We have been huge UNO fans for years.

My daughter always gets Pepperoni Pizza or a hamburger. I love their salads and the sandwiches. I am partial to the Turkey Sandwich. Sometimes I get fries with it. I really love the loaded baked potato. I love the baked Haddock too. A lot of the meals are so good! Naturally the desserts are delicious. The deep dish chocolate chip cookie with ice cream is big enough to share. I love the Oreo float too. I have that on special occasions.

I can't say enough good things about this UNO's. Customer Service is typical. We try to get there during the week and go early. There was a time or two our food took a while to be served. If it wasn't for those times it would be five stars. When I get hungry I hate to wait. I love the food so much that I still return. I'm recommending you give this UNO's a try. I know I'll be back.

I have been here about three times after Covid-19 and May be before but decided to write this review . Two times for lunch whereby I had ordered individual pizza and salad. Salad was real good with nice quality with Italian dressing on side with Tabasco which I add to dressing end then add on my salad. Next item is farmers veggies pizza which is the best I have eaten no where ! Really amazing taste- flaking crust  and ordered well done .. must try with less cost $9.99 for lunch ! Same dish during evening is 14.99 without salad which I had ordered takeout late before closing around 9:44 once !! I have two cell phones and photos are on my other cell and May be I did write  similar review there ?? Anyway service was really good with nice atmosphere with ample parking next to New Wawa next door sharing entrances ...

Unfortunately for me I gave Pizzeria Uno a 3 rd chance  post COVID. Normally I have company but on Wednesday I went solo at 4:00 pm. I ordered the clam chowder and a shrimp salad. Well I was cramped into a corridor and every time someone passed by me a draft of hot air engulfed me. It was 90 degrees outside. The air conditioner tanked. From the time the soup came and the salad came there was a 1 hour gap. Normally, I don't slam a restaurant but I couldn't even complain to a manager.  I left at 5:25 pm. I'm definitely contacting corporate.

A bite after an amazing concert. My sister had a
peach mule and she was thoroughly impressed.
I ordered the shrimp and crab dip, a favorite from years past at a location now shuttered. We did not order pizza. The appetizer filled us so we could not finish our entrees. The server was attentive and pleasant. Kudos to her; only wished they were open past 10 PM. Arrived with a full belly after I reparing breakfast in the house and snacking at the concert. Thank you UNO's at 432 Amsterdam New York, NY.
The service was good but the food was horrible. The chicken was undercooked in the inside and over cook in the outside.

Came here for a late lunch post visit to AMNH. The place is open for indoor dining. As there were 6 of us, we were seated right down the back which provided ample room for the kids to move around.

Kids meal are available - starting at $5 for a make your own pizza and also other dishes such as spaghetti meatballs. The kids were also entertained with crayons and activity sheet provided by the restaurant.

The make your own pizza kit under kids meal involved the kids making their own pizza as they were provided with the pizza crust, tomato sauce and cheese. Great way of getting kids involved.

The adults opted for the express lunch menu - $10 for soup/salad and pizza - a pretty good deal. I chose the broccoli and cheddar soup and a deep dish pizza with meat toppings. Both were pretty yummy and filing.

Service was good, the kids had a lot of fun after their day out at the museum. We will definitely be coming back here again.
Pizza was cold in the middle and gnats everywhere! Service was friendly but the food and ambiance were not worth it imo.
Stood at the counter for 34 min waiting for someone to take my to go order. Every server ignored me, though I asked 3 times. They just pretend like you don't exist.

Happy Hour all day on Sunday! Half-price appetizers! Five dollar glasses of wine. Great service by Sebastian and the entire staff.
Nachos and guacamole tasted freshly made. The buffalo wings were good the following day. The farmers market and spinoccolli pizza were fresh and delicious!  The chocolate cake is big enough for 4 or more people and we still had enough to take home. It was huge, moist and chocolatey.
Would definitely return to this location!

I went on Grubhub and ordered a pizza from pizza Uno's it came. It was all over the box and there was a piece missing. I am so disgusted and no one seems to wanna pick up the phone there. I will never order from there again

So while my server was very nice & I had a nice seat, I was very disappointed by the pizza that Uno's is known for...

I've been to the Uno's in Chicago. Crust is divine, true deep dish and constructed perfectly. Crispy brown, yet buttery goodness. Perfect texture, top-tier.

This crap at this Uno's on the UWS?
Utter trash.
The crust was a mix between saltines and graham crackers smashed together and being also somewhat mushy. How do you make counterfeit deep dish crust?

It was absolutely appalling and disgusting.

I would have rather done thin-crust, which is actually my favorite. Deep dish I love too, but is appreciated in moderation.

So when my moderation opportunity has been ruined, I have to speak on it.

The only saving grace was the white wine sangria. That's it.

Horrendous.

I didn't leave this chain pizza restaurant 5 stars for the food, but for their bartender Emily. I have lived in the area for awhile and never did I think UNO's would be mine and my friends favorite bar.  Emily is incredible! She makes everyone who sits at her bar feel like a friend, and I know that from talking to her other regulars. We go every Saturday night to drink after work and will continue until she gets a job bartending somewhere else...then we go there.

Pizza is fine. If you're starving, get the Numero Uno.
The service was great.  Food met our expectations.   Ambiance was nice...true to the brand

I'm a big fan of Uno's pizza.  This location lived up to my expectations.  I came by for lunch on Wednesday and got great service.  She pointed out the lunch special would save me money on ordering the pizza; she refilled my drink when needed.  The "Chicago Classic " pizza I ordered was delicious.

First time eating here in years, have to say worst service ever. Took forever to take our order and took forever to even greet us. The ambiance is subpar, could be WAY better honestly. The food took long to come out and wasn't the best at all. Some of it was cold and some was hot.

As far as I am aware, there are no "real" deep dish pizza spots uptown other than Uno. You get what you expect for a chain.

I have gotten dishes I was disappointed by, such as the boneless Buffalo wings. For some reason they were just chicken fingers obviously cut in half and doused with Buffalo sauce. The Buffalo Mac and cheese was okay, the cheese tasted more like Alfredo than Mac and cheese.

I have also gotten dishes I was very surprised by. The shrimp and crab dip was pretty good. The best pizza I have had is the cheese deep dish pizza. For some reason it is always better than the pizzas with toppings.

I always order through Uber eats and never had an issue with my orders being incorrect.

We came here for a good time and to enjoy a place we both hadn't been to in ages. We were seated quickly after passing the covid vaccine requirement and I have to say, I'm getting used to it... we met our server Dennis (great guy, very accommodating) and we began to enjoy a very nice evening. We opted for pizza as a starter and damn, it was good! I ordered the rattlesnake pasta and immediately regretted it after tasting her shrimp scampi!!! lol (next time) lol
Our drinks were good, I ordered the pomegranate margarita and she ordered a Moscow mule (really good!) somehow, everything she orders tastes better than mine! lol
Food aside, everything was great! The dessert was a little lacking but we gave it a shot lol
As a side note, I felt the need to remove 2 stars because of the incredibly insensitive and tactless comment our hostess made to me at the end of the meal. She approached and said "all this time you were here, I didn't notice you were missing your legs" yes, I wear double prosthetics as a result of a line of duty injury and it doesn't help when people are so insensitive as your hostess was. We weren't there for free and I don't expect such insensitive treatment. Perhaps management can train this individual on the fine art of tact and diplomacy when dealing with paying customers...

I like that Uno's makes it convenient for vegans. They have vegan cheese and accommodated me by switching up real cheese with vegan cheese. I've had the farmers pizza but i always always get the pizza skins which is potato with cheese and bacon but i ask to leave out the bacon and swap with vegan cheese. Its an appetizer but filling and satisfying.

I'm really shocked how this place is still running. Me and my husband came here after I told him how I use to go to Uno as a kid. But when we arrived it was like a ghost town. No on was at the front. We had to wave them down to get seated. When we finally got seated it's like the server completely forgot about us. We were sitting there for about 15 minutes waiting for her because all the other staff that was buzzing around kept saying we had to wait for specifically the girl who was the hostess as well as the server. First off, after realizing the hostess and the server of the ENTIRE restaurant was one girl I felt so shocked and felt bad for her. Uno should be ashamed. You mean to tell me you have one girl covering the entire restaurant as the hostesses and the server? After they informed us that the pizza would take another 25 minutes to make after waiting all that time, we decided to leave and go to Made in New York right around the corner. May I add in that when they informed us not one customer had a pizza on their table smh. I'm  sure the pizza here is great, but Uno please don't stretch your staff like that. Either hire more people or just shut down this location.

This place truly has some good food. Certain menu items are spot on like their spinach and artichoke dip and their pastas and pizzas. Beware of the Buffalo Mac and cheese though. Or any dish with chicken because they cooked the sh!t out of my chicken. It was dry and tough and the outer breading was crunchy but not the good crunchy if you know what I mean. Other than that the food is a solid 8/10.

However, for some reason this place is plagued with bad service. It's not a one time thing either, I came here 2 years ago and the service was bad, then I came on New Year's Eve in 2020, and then now and all times the service was just not the vibe.

I don't remember what my server's name was but he was slow to collect our dishes and plates or to take our orders and asked us what we wanted the minute we sat down. He also was rude to my friend who is hard of hearing and speech. Pretty much when my friend made a mistake about a menu item thinking it was a pasta dish, the server corrected him in a way that came off condescending and judgmental then rolled his eyes when my friend asked for another couple of minutes.

This is the same person that was at the desk I greeted and waited to be seated but he was busy doing something else and didn't tell us to sit ourselves. I wish I would've gotten the young girl that worked there, she was working a table with three older people across from me and took a couple plates off our table. She was so sweet and friendly. This place needs to hire more people like her. In total me and my friend were there 2 hours.

An absolutely miserable experience from beginning to end. After being sat for around 10 minutes, our server (who was also tending bar) approached us for the first time. We placed our orders: two house cocktails, nachos for an appetizer, and two individual Chicago-style pizzas. We also asked for waters as it was boiling hot inside the restaurant.

We watched our server hang out behind the bar talking to other servers for around 20 minutes (by this point, we were actively keeping track of the time). We watched her make our drinks. We watched the ice in our drinks melt. And then finally, she walked the drinks over to us. The fruits in our drinks did not match the menu description of the cocktails and the syrups used tasted very cheap. We asked for waters again. They did not come.

Two lukewarm Chicago-style pizzas were delivered to our table about 10 minutes later. Then after that, a cold, hard dog bowl of cheap Tostitos covered in congealed cheese and canned banana peppers was dropped off. We asked for waters again at this point. Our server said she would bring them, then returned to the bar to chat with her fellow servers.

I understand that good service is not always possible. I myself was a server for years. When there are a million things going on at once, I understand forgetting drinks or slow service. This restaurant was 3/4ths empty. There were maybe 4 people at the bar and she had 2 other tables next to us. Not once did she come check on our meals. After asking three times, we could not get water...and the food was certainly nothing to write home about. In addition to the stale, cold nachos, our "deep dish" pizzas were basically soggy  triangles of bland bread and nonexistent sauce.

To top it all off, 45 minutes passed between us finishing our meals and cashing out. I had to stand at the bar before our waitress would acknowledge our existence. After giving her my card back with the check, she rang my card, set it next to the register, then (slowly, while cross referencing her recipe book) made two cocktails while I stood at the bar before handing me my card back.

Awful service, low quality and horribly overpriced food. Uno Upper West Side, our first time will certainly be our last.

So this place to start was very hectic, I had walked in with a party of 4 and no one has asked us for proof of vaccination, When we told the manager they acted like it was not a big deal. Most of us had gotten our food but it took about 30 minutes for one of us to finally get what we ordered and they had stated they forgot to give us the other plate. The food overall was amazing but I would not recommend if you want to have a nice stressful free dinner. They had also took almost 15 minutes to give us utensils or even serve us employees had attitudes
Tables were not clean.

First off the food here is fantastic! I've been here a few times now and the food never disappoints. The only reason for 4 stars is that it seems like they may have been short staffed. There was table after table of dirty dishes and that was a little disheartening. Service was average and I felt so bad that I cleaned and stacked my own table. Great food but it would be nice to dine in a clean restaurant with air conditioning. Again I think this may have been an off day. I hope.
Staff didn't show any care or emotion. The burger was very bland for being $16. Mac and Cheese wasn't very good either. Not a huge fan of my experience here.

Service was very slow. Looked like only one waiter was working on Tuesday evening shift. Ordered the número uno deep dish pizza and asked for no mushrooms and after waiting for our food the pizza came with mushrooms.... I was upset. Chicago deep dish pizza was very good (better than numero uno).

Ordered two kids pizza for them to make, waiter took over 20 l+ minutes to collect the pizza to put it in the oven. Had to ask a different waiter to bring it to the kitchen. Our waiter was too busy being elsewhere. There was barely anyone inside the restaurant so I'm not sure why it took so long for service.

Most importantly - Went to the bathroom to wash my hands and I couldn't take the smell of wet wall & mold. I went home with allergies. It was so bad. The whole back of the restaurant smells like mold. Don't know how they allow people to sit towards the back area when it smells so bad.

I've been coming to place for a very long time and today was amazing my waiter (Liam) was so nice and helpful to me and my family when we were eating, the food was absolutely delicious! Props to Liam for making sure everything was good and nothing was wrong and coming back to make sure if we needed anything else. I recommend coming here and having Liam serve your food!
I'll never give up on unos no matter how much I get made fun of for loving the chain. The pizza is just delicious and unique for New York. Love it.

When I want extra cheese, good meat and tomatoey sauce I come here.  Plain and simple every time I come whether I eat in or to-go the food is always exactly how i want it.  And now with the buy one pizza and get your second (equal or lesser value) for 6 bucks i have dinner and lunch for a week!!!lol

The service is chain food service, hit or miss.  Depending on your server you can have a pretty good time....other servers need a neck chop or they are just volunteering because they truly act like they are wealthy and don't need my tip?!?!? lls

Either way as long as my food is right to-go works just fine!!

Gluten-free  deep  dish cheese pizza lunch special along with a Caesar salad $10.88
It's always hard to find a gluten-free pizza that taste like regular pizza... I was surprised at the texture as well as the crunch of the crust... This will be to my to go  place for gluten-free pizza.

My family, her sisters and friends with their children was rejected service in a way that wasn't direct but was obvious. My wife came home to me feeling offended and hurt. I will be coming to this establishment to speak to whoever was in charge. My son was there, hungry...and they were turned away. Why? Because children were crying? Why? Because my family is of color? I don't understand. My family then went to another restaurant close by and had no issues. I am furious and sickened by this.

Lunch Time!

When at the office, UNO's is a contender because their lunch combos are reasonably priced for days when you don't feel like splurging. They also offer options that can be mixed and matched. This is a great option because the menu is pretty standard when it comes to chain bar food.

Three stars... the food is to be expected and there is nothing necessarily wrong with that sometimes but the service here can definitely use some improvements.  On multiple visits there hasn't been a time where at one point the service was subpar. This a neighbor establishment so it's a little unfortunate that customer service isn't better.

Nonetheless. For those who want to brave it. They offer frequent muncher lunch cards. Buy 6 lunches,  get the 7th lunch free!

So I hadn't been to uno in years but came to celebrate a very close friends birthday. First they sat us where there was no air conditioner, so we was literally melting and when we asked if it was on the response was that it's doing the best it can but there's was no air whatsoever. So they finally decided to move us where the AC was actually working. So then they got our order wrong and they forgot one of the guest orders and made her wait another 20 minutes for her food which I believe was absolutely absurd where the waiteress was the one who messed up. Then we ask for a ketchup and it' came after the fact that people were done eating. Another thing we ordered a Stella and the keg was bad because it didn't taste not one bit like Stella.  The service was honestly very bad and the employees were not much of a help where ours seemed fairly new and the vets around her were not assisting one bit. We literally had a table of dirty plates at one point which made no sense because they should've been getting picked up periodically but no they were not. Then at the end we get this check with a mandated 20% for 60plus dollars and honestly no one earned a 20% tip there. I honestly don't recommend no one to go back here because I personally will not be returning and yes the food was good but there service put the nail in the coffin.

Amazing pizza place and the whole experience really worth it!!! Great range of pizza choice, many appetizers, definitely try this crab dip with chips, it's sosooo delicious! Also was happily surprised by the possibility to have cauliflower crust, never saw this anywhere else.
5/5 rating, do not even hesitate. Totally awesome!

The service was amazing and the menu had lots of variety for people of all food diets. Our server, Dennis, was really nice and made sure that everything was good with our orders. The dessert and the appetizers were amazing and would definitely order again along with the tasty drinks. The only issues were:
1.) the build your own pizza dough was a bit too thick
2.) the shrimp scampi needed a little more spice and flavor
3.) the thin crust pizza was too dry, but otherwise okay

I would go back again if I needed a quick spot to eat or if I am in the area again.

Paid $4.99 for tiny pieces of roasted vegetables. Was so disappointing. Never again. It's like someone macabre ate half of my vegetables before I got em. But nope that's just how they do it. My picture doesn't do it justice.

Best gluten free crust anywhere in America. Yum  
We live in San Diego and came out to visit DC and NY. We ate at UNO's in both cities and they both are very good. The New York Manhattan location by Central Park is our favorite!

I hadn't visited any Uno in close to 20 years, but I went in with incredibly low expectations and was pleasantly surprised.

This isn't some fancy-pants establishment, Folks, and yes, it is deep dish. Keep that in mind and don't go in expecting to utter "omakase" and have your mind blown.

Our server was friendly and kind. My dining companion and I each ordered individual pies and they were quite tasty. They were piping hot and yummy.

I like the 21st-century Rise of the Machines way of paying.

I would've given Uno 4 stars, but for the fact that all the pies on the menu (except the veggie pie) had warnings next to them basically saying the sodium content was such that heart attack and/or stroke is imminent after dining at Uno. No bueno. Sure, I don't expect for pizza to be super healthy, but that sodium warning was a huge turnoff. They should revamp their recipes. Nobody needs pizza that salty.

Coming in from Florida to New York we thought we would have pizza. Being on the Upper west side we came across this place called Uno Chicago Grill. The service was awful took us almost 45 minutes to get our food, and all we ordered was a very small pizza Chicago style (which was awful) and a cheese dip,  also awful. So this was not a good experience for us and definitely would not recommend this place I give it zero stars .

Dear Haters, heard y'all back at it again...  I'm talkin to the kats out there who are expecting a life changing meal at Uno's and left a review of 2 stars or below...  you kats are like a plague... can't shake y'all.  It's cool tho, I do what I do here on yelp to make a difference in people's lives.

Lemme just take a moment to break it down for y'all fools.  The KIDS MENU is legit AF, servers are always nice / on point, solid drink selection, and the pizza is good as hell.  What else are you lookin for, bubba?  

I mean yeah, we all know New York style pizza is better than Chicago style, but sometimes even haters like yourselves need to wet your tongues on that deep dish.
Food wasn't the worst, however beware tip isn't an option, 20% is included in check and you can not split the check. Very inconvenient

So we are a family of 3 and got seated real quickly, but that's when everything started. A group of 4 people came in after us and our server looked my wife in the eye and went to the other table. My wife and I looked at each other and I laughed because he looked right at me and kept taking their order. That's only first half of our experience. When the food came, we were never checked on by anyone to see if we needed anything else (water, napkins , etc) and once we were finished I put the plates to the side, but not server collected the plates until I called for someone. This was our first time at UNO and it was horrible.

Not the best place to go for New York pizza. The food is just ehhh.  I got a pasta dish that wasn't delicious. Just mediocre. My son got make your own pizza but the sauce was bitter and just not delicious. We came here after a trip to the museum. And I would definitely try somewhere else next time we are in the area. If we are in NYC I would want to go to a place that has delicious food you can't find locally in NJ. This is not the place. Our server was friendly and kind.

Came here after the Thanks Giving Balloon preview because I needed to use the restroom.  We decided to stay and grab dinner.  The place was jammed packed and we waited 25 minutes which wasn't bad but then again we were a smaller group.  

The restaurant is tight but the service was attentive and we didn't have much complications.  The food was exactly what I expected.  My burger was tasty and was mildly impressed with the shrimp scampi.  

I will be back whenever I'm on the Upper West.

It's Chinese food. Priced well for 2022 and what you get. I've had several different dishes but alway get the Yeung Chow Fried Rice. It has a lot of everything in it (chicken, shrimp, beef, pork). Great take out spot when you're craving Chinese.

I ordered a sesame chicken lunch with wonton soup from here, and it was not bad. The chicken was crispy, but was a little heavy on the sauce. The soup was hot and fresh, and included some green onions. The wontons themselves were okay. I liked that they gave you the option of having brown rice on the side. The chicken fried rice was decent.

Cheap beyond belief. Don't go here. Go somewhere else.
Ordered Won Ton Soup. They did not include crispy crackers.(noodles)
Also ordered Chinese Fried Rice. It had , no kidding three pieces of chicken.
The rest all rice. Save your money. Go somewhere else.

Inside of Whole Foods, the sushi bar offers a wide range from rolls ($10+), poke bowls, edamame, salads and sashimi. The prices are a bit on the higher side but when you're craving for a quick sushi fix, it does the trick.

My go-to udon spot whenever I'm in NY! I've tried a few other popular udon places in the city but always end up coming back for a solid bowl of udon. My favorite is the Niku Udon with Beef. The meat is soft, soup is flavorful, and the udon noodles itself are so good. The portions are big too.

I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the service. Service is mediocre. You have to flag someone down if you need something because they rarely check in on you. But, ambience is great! Interior is modern with dim lighting that sets the mood for a date night or even just a casual hangout with friends.

Good place for udon in K-town.

I've tried both the hot and the cold niku udon. They give a very generous portion of meat, and the bowl is very filling. The cold niku's noodles are chewier than the typical texture of the noodles in the hot udon, so I think I prefer it slightly more.

The interior of the restaurant has many seats and feels elegant, although it gets crowded easily because it's in K-town.

A solid udon spot right in the heart of K-town! A go-to classic I like to order is the Niku Beef Udon, which has a rich broth from the fatty beef. We also got the Beef Curry Udon, which tastes just like you'd expect. The noodles are a bit softer than I'd like, but that's personal preference.

Easily made reservations for a Saturday afternoon and was seated right away. Quick service for a reliable spot. Overall, would come back if I'm in the mood for udon in the area!!

The Mentaiko Cream Udon was as promised, creamy and flavorful. The udon noodles were al dente. The Truffle Salmon hand roll was good too, although I didn't really taste the truffle in it at all, but the salmon was fresh. This was the perfect meal for a chilly autumn night. The service was decent and it wasn't too busy. We sat by the door and we constantly saw people picking up to-go orders.

Nice and trendy spot in Ktown and quite busy. Service was quick. We tried the Niku udon and the Beef Kakitama udon. Both were good. The Kakitama was had a egg drop base so the broth is starchy and filling while the Niku broth us sweeter and lighter. The udon was not as chewy as I wished but otherwise good. The meat servings are generous.

Great spot for authentic udon and other Japanese foods / drinks. I got the Cold Niku Udon with beef ($20), which was delicious. The beef was cooked to be tender and fairly flavorful. They also gave quite a lot of beef which was nice. The noodles were cooked decently, but my one point for improvement would be that they could've been a bit softer rather than being overly chewy (although udon is supposed to have some chewiness). The poached egg, scallions, and nori on top were nice additions to complete this relatively simple yet tasty dish. The broth came in a separate container and was pretty light and tasty. The price is in line with what you would expect for this quality.

They have a pretty wide selection of different drinks, and I got a Level 1 soju pack (lychee flavor). It was delicious with a nice lychee flavor. $15 is an average price for this considering the size.

The place itself is medium sized with a clean wooden decor theme. There were actually several tables still available for walk-in seating on a Saturday night. The staff were very friendly, although they didn't check up on us to ask how we were doing during our meal. The service speed was very fast though.

Overall, I would highly recommend Udon Lab if you are looking for a good Japanese restaurant in Koreatown with a nice environment and without too much of a line.

My daughter school is close to Koreatown in NY, we wanted to try new restaurants for my daughter to have dinner while going to school. We found this udon place while walking around for lunch. The restaurant is quite nice and the udons are excellent. The broths are tasty and the udon is perfectly cooked. My daughter likes this place and will come here when she has cravings for udon.
I personally am not too interested in udon but I found it quite good. The prices are ok in NY.

We came here late at night and it was packed! Still was able to get a table and were seated immediately.

I ordered the Niku Udon with Pork and the udon was delicious!! The broth especially felt very light and nice which I really enjoyed! The meat was perfect too and went so well with the broth and noodles.

Ambiance was great too just seemed like a nice casual New York restaurant at night aha.

We dropped by a weekday night for a quick udon dinner. We appreciated not needing to wait for a table - service was quick.

I ordered the kitsune udon with a soft boiled egg. It was simple and filling. They also have some other interesting menu options, like dipping udon which I'll likely try next time I'm here.

Prices are alright for the area - it's simply textbook udon imo.

I came here for dinner after finding it on Yelp. I thought udon sounded good on a rainy day and the reviews looked decent.

Mentaiko cream udon (3/5): It wasn't the best but it wasn't the worst. I would've liked it more if it was hotter and the noodle was cooked a little more. The portion looked small but it was actually a lot. The flavor was good and it was not too salty. The sauce was a creamy without being too thick.

Karaage (2.5/5): I was surprised this wasn't served with any kind of sauce. There was only a lemon slice accompanying it. Flavor was okay but it just isn't as good as other karaage I've had before. The color of the fry on the chicken was pretty pale so it wasn't that appealing.

The interior was nice and the service was good. Overall it was a one time try for me. I thought it was pretty pricey. I definitely prefer Marugame Monzo in LA.

After the omakase dinner in the dark (there is a review for that), I was still hungry because the food wasn't sufficient enough.
A said we were near Koreatown and he passed by an udon place. I heard Udon and didn't hear the rest. If I had known this place existed, I would've moved down here just to go to this place every day.
I effing LOVE udon. It's an obsession, no, an addiction. It's a real problem.

Anyways, the place was super busy and packed. But we were able to get seated fast. There were so many good looking options but we both got the beef kakitama udon - I think it was the egg drop soup that was the most interesting. I think we also got a sushi roll but everyone knows what that looks like. The udon was the bomb; it was so good and the beef was tender and it wasn't too salty. The service was quick and ambience was busy and bustling. This wasn't early in the evening and it was still so crowded.

We decided to get dessert because we saw taiyaki on the menu and taiyaki is A's favorite Asian dessert. It comes out with the shell being super hot and you eat it with the ice cream to cool it down. i thought it was going to come out like the actual taiyaki and we'd have to eat it hold it upright, but it came out upside down -- which makes it easier to eat.

If you haven't tried this place YOU HAVE TO! I know I'm going back at some point and will continue to go back until I am Udonned out.

I've passed this spot so many times in Koreatown and finally tried it. It looks a little inconspicuous but really nice inside with the dim lighting. Came here with my friend on a weekend night and was seated immediately. The service was quick. There's many seats inside.

I loved the creamy mentaiko udon since I was craving something creamy and not too soupy. It has spicy cod roe sauce with nori. The Niku udon has sweet soy sauce and nori. This is definitely becoming my new favorite spot in the area.

This is such a great spot! Came on my birthday with a few friends and the ambience was chic and peaceful. I thought the udon had a nice texture and the broth was pure/light yet still flavorful. It also came with huge portions which was a plus. My friends and I only tried the udon but would definitely come back again!

Came with friends on a Friday night after work. Ordered the Niku Tsuke Udon (udon dipping in beef soup) ($21) and a lychee flavored Japanese whisky highball ($15). The highball was very bland with no lychee taste at all. For the price, I'm expecting more quality drinks. The udon was also on the hard side as if it was undercooked. The dipping soup was also very salty to me.

Overall not impressed with the food or the service. Not going back.

The food and ambiance are really good. I can see this place being good for a date night. The decor is really pretty and we were there at an odd time for a late lunch/early dinner and witnessed them dimming the lights for dinner. Our server was nice enough to help us ask the chef if we could switch out a sauce on one of the rolls. They couldn't but it was still a nice gesture. The food itself was delicious. The Brussel sprouts were crispy, flavorful and oh so deep fried. The parmesan paired really well with the texture.

The hand rolls were also great. The scallop was sweet and the contrasting texture of the garlic crisps on top was very welcome. The seaweed was also very fresh and only started getting soggy as I was eating the roll and manhandling it a bit. The udon broth was very flavorful and had a strong umami undertone that was incredibly beefy. It was a tad bit too salty for my taste but went well with their noodles which were cooked Al dente. I absolutely hate soggy noodles but it was cooked perfectly here. The takoyaki is one of the riskier items I order at most restaurants. I find that most restaurants serve them quite soggy. It was perfectly executed here, with a soft interior and crunchy exterior.

I found the host to be welcoming and kind.  When we walked in, wow, this place was packed on a Saturday night.  I sat at the bar with my friend who didn't feel like ordering alcohol but felt a bit hungry.  We were on our way to a dance class and just wanted a place to catch up, and the music volume is reasonable so you can hear each other.  They had a ton of amazing cocktails.  One thing to improve: It was confusing to know who was our bartender who may be different from the person taking your order.  
Happily, I did enjoy my drink and the ambience inside.    The drinks are strong and presentable.  I would return with some more friends and try their noodles.  Wow, they looked amazing!

Good udon spot in ktown! The Mentaiko ramen was creamy and flavorful, and the noodles were thick. Definitely the star of the visit.
The salmon onigiri was okay - large and sturdy, but the salmon wasn't the most flavorful.

Great sized space, lots of tables and nice decor and lighting.

The wait staff was attentive and very quick to clear empty plates, replace our empty glass water bottle with full ones, etc.
Our appetizer orders got a bit messed up, but the staff was extremely accommodating in correcting these and removing them from our bill.

Food was delicious, and I'm glad we shared the udon because the portions are huge lol! The staff was friendly and I loved the Halloween decorations they had. Great price too. Typical place for Korean food. So good!

When I came first entered Udon Lab, it looked very nice. I was excited to eat here. I was seated with my guest after waiting for a seat for about five minutes. Then I called a waiter to order my food. My guest got the teishoku which he said was soso and not the best. It wasn't special and the price was too high. The wakame udon took forever to come and by the time it came my guest was almost done with his meal. The udon was nothing special compared to other wakame udons I've had in other restaurants.  The best thing about our meal was the takoyaki but even though it was the best thing it's still better at other places.

Overall the food was mediocre. I wouldn't necessarily come back here to eat. The service was also slow and there wasn't much communication about when our food would come. It was also difficult to find our waiter. The food was expensive and not worth it. Go somewhere else to eat in K-town.

I was with one of my friends the other night and after a few drinks we were looking for some dinner. Since we were close to K Town, we decided to walk over and see what stood out. With the assistance of Yelp, we realized we were a stone's throw away from Udon Lab. Neither of us had been here before, and since noodles sounded great we decided to check it out.

I really liked the look of Udon Lab; walking in, we were immediately greeted by the host stand and seating area. The shape of the restaurant is rectangular, but for a Manhattan restaurant there was a considerable amount of spaced, so we didn't feel cramped. Decor was simple - bright/neutral colors and a contemporary design.

The menu is mostly apps and udon noodle dishes. We decided to start with two apps: pork tonkatsu and pork gyoza. They were both really good - the pork was juicy and served with a tasty sauce, and the gyoza had a lot of flavor. For my main I went with the niku udon with pork which also contained poached egg, scallion, nori, and soy sauce. The dish was good - the udon was cooked well, and all the flavors really complemented each other. They also didn't skimp on the pork which I appreciated.

Service was fast and friendly, and overall I had a great experience at Udon Lab. It's not the best udon I've had, but I don't say that to discount the quality - they serve the goods here and you'll have a quality meal. I'm glad to know a place like this is in K Town, if I'm in the area again I would definitely return.

ended up sitting outside due to a long wait for sitting inside, but that is expected from ktown. the food was pretty standard, nothing memorable. We also got the yuzu high ball which just tasted like whiskey and water.

Me and my partner waited and hour and half for our order to be taken. The waiter with the bread gave us attitude and keep ignoring us after we finsihed and asked for the checked. This has been the worst experience I ever had at UDON LAB. I will no recommend unless you want a long waited. DIGUSTING service.

I absolutely LOVED this place! A friend and I stopped by this location after a long day of trekking across NYC and left with full stomachs and big smiles. I got the mentai udon, which is a rarity at a lot of the Japanese restaurants I've frequented, and I'm so glad I did. I could have easily had a second bowl. The cream sauce was rich and umami-filled, and the noodles themselves were thick without being overwhelming and just the right amount of filling.

While the restaurant was filled up, we didn't have to wait at all for a table and the service never wavered. Loved the bustling atmosphere and how into the food all the diners seemed to be. Will definitely hit up this place again the next time I'm in NYC!

5/5 taste
5/5 portion
5/5 price
5/5 service

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Udon Lab, an udon restaurant located in the heart of Ktown. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by a warm and inviting ambiance that set the stage for a delightful culinary experience.

One of the first things that caught my attention was the affordable pricing at Udon Lab, especially considering its prime location in Ktown. It's always a pleasant surprise to find a restaurant that offers great value for money, and Udon Lab certainly delivered in that aspect.

When it comes to udon, size does matter, and Udon Lab did not disappoint. The portions here were relatively generous compared to other udon restaurants I've visited. It's always a treat to have a satisfying meal that leaves you feeling content, and the ample serving sizes at Udon Lab ensured just that.

Now, let's talk about the star of the show--the katsu curry udon. This dish was an absolute delight for the taste buds. The curry had a rich and flavorful profile that perfectly complemented the crispy katsu. The udon noodles were cooked to perfection, with just the right amount of chewiness. It was evident that the chefs at Udon Lab take great care in crafting each component of the dish to ensure a harmonious blend of flavors.

In addition to the outstanding katsu curry udon, Udon Lab offers a diverse range of udon dishes to cater to various preferences. Whether you're a fan of traditional flavors or looking for something more adventurous, there is a udon option to suit every palate.

If you're an udon enthusiast or simply looking to explore the rich flavors of Japanese cuisine, I highly recommend paying a visit to Udon Lab. With its affordable prices, generous portions, and mouthwatering katsu curry udon, it's a hidden gem in the midst of Ktown.

Had the beef curry udon which tasted exactly the way you think it does. Food is a little bit on the pricier side. Nothing really special about it but I'm glad the portion size is decent at least for a $20 bowl of udon with a few strips of beef in it.

Pretty good bouncy udon, though portions were a bit small. Also, the broth was not piping hot when it came out.

As far as ambiance goes, not the greatest date spot, more for a gathering of friends.

I stopped by on a scorching hot summer day and the cold kitsune udon ($15) was refreshing! The noodles were the perfect texture, but overall the dish could have used more flavor. The niki udon with beef ($20) was much more flavorful; the broth was so delicious. As for drinks, I had the ume oasis ($16). It was a little too sour for my personal preference, but overall not bad.

I loved my creamy udon! Very hearty and filling. It is a tad on the pricey side at $20, but would still recommend. The location is great in the heart of Ktown, but it can get quite busy because of that. Our service was decent, thought we did have to wait for a bit for them to clean the tables, despite there being multiple open tables - why weren't they cleaned ahead of time?

We made reservations for a party of 3 at 12:30 on Saturday and were promptly seated. We each ordered Beef Niku Udon ($20) and shared Takoyaki ($11). They were not skimpy with the beef, but some parts of the beef were chewy. Broth definitely hit the spot on a rainy day and the noodles were cooked perfectly. Takoyaki was just mediocre, so I would pass on this.

The service was very friendly and attentive. It's a standard udon place, so whenever you're craving udon, I'd recommend this place.

Great place for a variety of udon. It is a bit on the pricier end, so be prepared for that. But the restaurant serves delicious karaage ($13). They were nice and crispy, and each piece was quite large. I decided to try the Niku Tsuke Udon ($22) which is where the udon noodles are separate from the broth/sauce and you dip the noodles into the broth/sauce. It was very delicious! Definitely took some more work to eat the dish since there was the extra step of dipping. But overall very delicious with much savory flavors. It was a tad spicy, but I am someone who has a very very low tolerance for spicy.

Overall, I highly recommend trying this place!

Good udon in ktown!
The Korean udon's soup base is very spicy and full of flavorful
The sushi is fresh so yummy

This was my sister and my first stop in New York.
We went on a Saturday around noon and it was not very busy (probably because of the rain). The udon and donburi were both good but nothing I would crave or go out if my way for. However they do have udons I haven't seen around before so that itself kind of makes it worth a visit. The biggest complaint I would have is how long I took for us to get our cocktails. Let's me honest at noon my sister and I were probably the only ones drinking. It should take over 30 minutes to bring over 2 cocktails.

Udon Lab is a great Japanese fusion restaurant in Koreatown. For appetizers, I highly recommend the tonkatsu because it was fried to crispy perfection. For the udon entrees, I love the niku udon and have had it with both the pork and the chicken. I would reorder both- they were the perfect hearty udon dishes for cold nights! I do think it's a bit confusing that the restaurant also has a sushi menu, and I have not tried it but it honestly didn't look like the best sushi. I almost think that they should take it off the menu and swap in something else. That being said, I would definitely return for more udon!

Came here on a hot day and really loved the quality of the food. This place is up to par with spots like Marugame and come with really good portion sizes. The food was really fresh so I was happy. I ordered the Cold Beef Niku Udon.

They have a variety of udon to choose from. The ones we order are pretty normal. I don't really like the pork in the niku udon: it's like braised pork and it's not like pieces of pork but more like pulled pork. The other one tastes a little better, but dipping is too much work so I end up pouring the broth into the noodle bowl. The appetizer has too much bean sprouts. The drink is pretty good.

Pretty good udon spot in the city! Not the best that I've had, but it was good enough for me to come back twice on my previous trip! It was also right next to my hotel so extremely convenient if you're staying near the area.
Service is fast and efficient.

We ordered the Mentaiko Cream Udon, Takoyaki, korean spicy udon, sausage, and the dipping niku udon! I would pass on the mentaiko cream--flavor was lackluster.My favorite was definitely the korean spicy udon--reminded me a little of yukgaejang, it was full of flavor and came out piping hot! I would return back here if I stayed in Ktown again, but not something that I would go out of my way for.

Food here was okay.

We had the garlic cucumbers ($9 for cucumber with some garlic sauce!!)
Spicy tuna roll, which was eh, and I wouldn't recommend. It was doused in the spicy mayo which overpowered the roll.

My friend and I ordered the Tan tan udon to share. It was alright. I was expecting it to be more spicy, but the flavor was muted to me. I also didn't love how the ground meat sunk to the bottom off the broth so I didn't get to taste it with the noodles but rather when we were finishing up the broth.

The Karaage (fried chicken) was very good though, and flavorful! This was a dish that I would recommend.

I was excited to come to a restaurant that focuses on udon cause I love udon!

Takoyaki: omg literally the best takoyaki my boyfriend and I have eaten so far!!! It was so crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. This was the most memorable part of the meal

Shishito pepper tempura: i like how the batter was light and the sauce paired well with jt. I do wish there was a small sprinkle of salt but i would still get this again. Not that spicy

Mentaiko udon: this was okay...i was expecting a creamier sauce that would stick on with the noodles however we had to this more like soup. It was still good but i wish there were more toppings on this dish such as seafood

After having a good solo dining experience last time, I decided to bring my boyfriend here for a quick lunch in the city. I ordered the plain udon again ($14) and he decided on the beef kakitama udon ($20). It took quite a bit for our orders to arrive, and when we received them we were quite shocked. The beef kakitama was a solid block - the bowl was moved around quite a bit and the udon did not budge. On the menu the kakitama is listed as an "egg drop" soup, but what we got was akin to a THICK egg gravy. Flavor wise it was quite subtle and plain. For my plain udon, the dashi broth was definitely more flavorful than the egg gravy in the kakitama, but still not quite as tasty as I remembered. Also, the broth was just barely lukewarm. Regardless, the udon quality was still good - the noodles are thick & chewy.

Towards the end of the meal, we ended up using the remaining broth from my udon to dilute down the beef kakitama. It became more unpalatable as the meal progressed, since the "broth" was congealing with the egg.

Definitely skip the beef kakitama... it was quite shocking. Plain udon is still decent. Would probably still come back to give Udon Lab another chance since their udon noodles are quite tasty.

Food was just okay. I've had better udon in LA. A bit over priced here for what you get but I guess it's also NY and everything is expensive. The udon was quite plain and not very interesting. Flavors were basically powdered seasoning, nothing interesting.

I went here twice during my visit to NYC for the Mentaiko Cream Udon. It's that good!  The sauce is refreshing and the roe flavor really comes through. Initially, I thought with a cream sauce, it would be heavy but actually it's not. My husband had the Beef Curry Udon, and he enjoyed it! We also had the California roll during the first visit, and it was tasty. The highlight of the meal clearly was the udon.

When we went on a weekday, we had no wait. This was around 9:00pm and on the weekend around the same time, we had a 10 minute wait.

Average udon place in NY. The space is large though, so it's a much easier place to get into on a busy day in Ktown.

I tried the Mentaiko cream udon, the Niku udon with beef, and then the Korean spicy udon. It was all very average. Nothing notable about them. The Korean spicy udon definitely had a kick and that was about it. However, it's nothing to rave about. The udon noodles itself just taste normal and as expected.

Given the other options in the city, I would probably pass on this place. It's not that it's bad, it's that just there's better options we'd rather spend our money on.

Very convenient udon place that was close to our hotel. We tried:

Wakame Udon - A simple bowl of seaweed, scallions and two fish cake pieces. They knead and cut the dough by hand, which gives the noodles a thick, chewy texture because each piece tends to be a bit wider compared to the frozen udon packs you buy in a grocery store. Simple, but enjoyable. This dish can be prepared cold if you prefer.

Niku Udon - Noodle soup with thin slices of beef that was simmered in sweet soy sauce, topped with dried seaweed, scallions, and a poached egg. Broth is on the saltier and oilier side. Otherwise, it's very savory. This dish can also be prepared cold.

Korean Spicy Udon - It's like a combination of udon and a spicy Korean beef soup (Yukgaejang). A flavorful mix of vegetables, meat, and noodles. The color of the broth is intimidatingly red, but it's tolerable.  

Mentaiko Cream Udon - Van D. had a lot of great things to say about this one, and I also found it amazing! The creamy cod roe sauce pairs well with the noodles, and each bite just leaves you wanting more. This one also had a little bit of a kick to it, the spice level should be manageable for most.

The wait was about 25 minutes, but it was pretty crowded the evening we went. Our to-go order was packaged neatly, with the broth in a separate container to ensure the noodles don't get soggy. It was a pleasant takeout experience!
Pretty good Udon spot. Really like the atmosphere and the udon is nice and chewy. The service was decent and the portion size was also pretty good. Just a bit expensive for the quality of Udon.

Food portions were amazing! I couldn't finish my udon  but I was definitely stuffed! Thinking about returning tonight!
Service was very friendly.
However, I did have one complaint!
Our waitress wasn't attentive at all, she was a little confused on takeout orders I assume since she was on the iPad.
We ordered 2 appetizers and 2 entrees and 2 drinks and the tables were pretty small so everything was cramped up.
She never came back while our entree was served to regard any plates and utensils that we weren't being used anymore.
So I had to eat with the small plates still on the table which I did not enjoy. Especially, when it was not busy and I'm sure she could've at least stopped by to ask if our food was enjoyable, at least!  
Ambiance is nice, I sat inside near the window and the view was okay since they have outdoor desalting outside, you're able to watch everyone walking around. The bar is super pleasant to the eye, as I went to the bathroom I would definitely recommend sitting in the bar.
Many women were at Udon Lab on a sole date with themselves which I absolutely loved! You can definitely come and eat by yourself and not have to worry since many customers do this.

Would recommend Udon Lab if you're around and looking for a calm and relaxed atmosphere to enjoy comfort food at.

Disappointed with the portions - they overload you with rice/noodles but skimp out on the meat/toppings.

- Chicken katsu curry udon: the katsu was nice and crispy, but the curry udon felt so heavy and greasy!
- Gyudon: so disappointed with the portion of meat on this one. The bowl was about 90% rice.

I may have come in by myself towards the end of a busy Saturday night - that part is my fault when I ended up taking a table of two vs the bar. However, the server was quick to give water and ask about the menu, and despite being at full capacity they were really efficient at getting my niku udon to me.

And on a cold night, that udon was EXACTLY what I needed. The hot savory broth and the classic udon texture with hearty meat - it's a must try.

The servers were attentive but not overbearing so I was able to just enjoy the food and the space.

I tried to finish quickly but the crowd started to thin a little so I ate my fill and set back out into the chilly outside with a warm stomach.

I may have come by myself this time, but next time I'm in the area, I'm dragging my friends here.

This place sucks and how they've managed to stay open is beyond me.

We ordered:
* Beef Kakitama Udon - served very lukewarm dipping udon with cold udon noodles. Cooked very Al dente. Hard to eat. Lacked flavor.
* Mentaiko Cream Udon - very disappointing creamy udon. Super bland and again served warm. We asked for lemon, salt, and soy sauce multiple times before it came and it made the dish slightly better
* Eggplant Mochi - saw so many good reviews for this and yes the eggplant and soy sauce was good, but the fried mochi was odd. Very very chewy hard to eat and doesn't even taste good with the sauce
* Fried Takoyaki - the best thing we had but it's just average  takoyaki .. everything else just sucked

Service is awful. Had to flag down the waitstaff multiple times to ask for anything - to order, get water, ask for salt, get the check. Multiple times.

I got my onigiri app pretty quickly after ordering. Then my mom got her curry Katsu udon right after. It took them 20mins for me to get my COLD KITSUNE UDON the most basic thing I could order which only consisted of noodles and a side of the dashi sauce. The taste was mediocre and similar to whenever I make it myself at home.

The curry katsu udon was pretty good.

But the service was slow and terrible. It was barely crowded and the servers are all piled around the computer for whatever ever reason. Not only that after we had given our card to pay another server came with our bill again. It's like the servers have no cohesive relationship and don't know how to communicate with each other.

Pretty average food , if you want udon obviously come here but i'm usually only coming here if im on my hands and knees begging for udon or if someone handcuffed me and told me to eat here

Got beef curry udon, beef niku udon and takoyaki

All are just average, i didnt leave with my pants soiled so its just some normal udon.

Service was good bc they did not verbally assault me

Ambiance is whatevRr

5 stars. Seriously 5 stars. Everything is excellent. I don't get to go as often as I would like to. If it's not quite right, they will make it right. Good for business meetings ( showy, not too showy) family gatherings ( kid friendly) GO!! YOu will enjoy

Good kosher steakhouse in the UN area. The staff is attentive and food and drinks are good. The ambiance is nice and upscale. My favorites are the chicken lolli pops and the chicken and waffle nuggets which are a game changer!

Great spot! We started with a couple appetizers and then switched over to two 40 oz tomahawk steaks that give of of us split. The food was great, the setting was good (not too crowded), but the prices were very expensive and the service was a bit slow. Would definitely come back

Honestly, the food was really, really good. We went for a friend's birthday during Restaurant Week. The Mushroom Soup was amazing, even though it wasn't served in the bread bowl during Restaurant Week, which is understandable. Everything was delicious, my favorite was actually the Apple Tart. So fresh with apples that were definitely sliced on premises. Amazing. What I didn't like, is that we overlooked the tip being built into our bill, and when we over tipped by $120, they just quietly let it go. We're good tippers, but this left a bad taste in my mouth...

WOW! I cannot stress what a wonderful experience myself and my guests had here the other night!!

The hospitality was beyond amazing! The table side presentation was show-stopping! Kenny the GM was an exceptional host and the rest of the staff was so attentive as well!

The food! My goodness the food! My guest said it was the best meal he's had in a long time! The steak fajitas were sizzling hot and so scrumptious! The steak melts in your mouth and the sauces are a must try! Don't skip out on anything here from drinks to dessert!

The music and ambiance perfectly paired with the entire experience! We were sincerely floored by UN Plaza Grill!

Cannot wait to come back soon! Thank you so much!

I really wanted to like this place but it was so disappointing! The filet was inedible & it was $75! What a disgrace. I ate none of it & no one even cared to ask why. The side French fries were stale, the side veggies were tasteless previously frozen variety, overall do not come here! We all left unsatisfied. Steep prices for horrible food, which is sad because the people are nice.

Great Kosher food! Good place for events, meetings or even date night! I've been here a couple times and very pleased with the food, ambiance, service & staff! Will definitely be back, highly recommended. Kenny is super friendly and hospitable!

*Restaurant Week Review*

Kosher restaurants in nyc are notoriously expensive, so my friend and I chose to try UN Plaza Grill during Restaurant Week for a good deal. Participating restaurants for NYC Restaurant Week offer a 3-course prix fixe special menu for $59.

The ambiance was definitely upscale dining, though the purple/blue pillars of lighting and tiger mural were kind of odd choices of decor imo. The place is large with two levels of dining areas, and the bathroom was really nice and clean. Our servers and the manager (I think) were kind and attentive. I have to say though that they were a bit TOO attentive, where I felt like my conversation was being disrupted every 5 minutes by one of the three employees who kept checking in on us. This is not a major complaint of course as I would rather be checked on too much than too little.

We got started off with complimentary bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar. The bread was not good; it didn't taste fresh and had a huge air pocket that made me wonder why they thought it was a good idea to serve. Oh well, it's just bread.

My friend and I shared appetizers, which to my surprise were really small. The were Lamb Samosas delicious but only 2 pieces, and the Spicy Tuna Crispy Rice were sushi-esque and decent. We both ordered the Boneless Ribeye served with steak fries and a little bit of arugula. To our delight, the dish came with steak sauce and ketchup. They did a good job cooking the steak, though it lacked memorable flavor. The fries are steak frites style and were decent. For dessert, I got the Molten Chocolate Cake, and my friend got Tiramisu. For a Kosher restaurant (assuming dairy-free), the desserts were pretty good, though SMALL. I was actually shocked to see this almost munchkin-sized cake served. It did come with a mint leaf, vanilla ice cream, and beautiful finishing. The cake of the tiramisu was good, though the coffee  elements were weak. Overall, I think it was a good deal for restaurant week, but overpriced on a regular day ESPECIALLY if the appetizer/dessert portions are the same.

Came in for a late night chicken popper and burger. Love the burgers very filling lots of meat in them and the French fries were hearty and delicious. The manager is a gentleman and I will certainly be back. Nice ambiance - great classy decor and lovely staff.

I enjoyed the tomato soup, sushi, Chilean Sea Bass, and Baked Alaska very much. Awesome presentation, and the food was garnished to perfection. Attentive staff. Good sound system. Beautiful space decor.

I held a private party for 300 people at UN Plaza Grill and was thrilled with the location, food and staff. Kenny arranged a great menu, everything was delicious especially the Sushi, Sliders, Chicken lollipops & Potstickers. The staff was very professional and attentive. The bartenders are very friendly and made great drinks that they customized for the party. I usually don't post but I highly recommend them because of how happy and impressed I am. I would love to another party or event here

Just had the most amazing meal here! The food and ambience were unmatched and super unique!

The steak was perfectly cooked and seasoned and filleted at the table making for a nice little show!

Loved every app we had including the mushroom soup and highly recommend the fajitas and sliders!

Went to UN Grill during restaurant week. The soup and the tacos were delicious. The apple pie was great. The steak unfortunately was inedible.
It was so tough that I couldn't cut it with a steak knife , nor could I eat it.
They include a twenty percent service charge and then have a space for a tip. That's a little confusing

I have had a amazing experience, great food, amazing service, definitely coming back.
Oh, and the drinks, they where great.
Love.

Food is amazing
Great service
Drink are tasty
Great ambience
Would come back
..........
Very nice place for bussines meetings or even couples. Food was good and stuff friendly

We had dinner here a couple of months ago. The food was really not that good (salads, soup, salmon and steak entree), so I don't understand the prices.

The service is what I want to write about. When I asked for the menu, the waiter put his finger in my face and asked me to wait a min (just how rude is that!). He then served fries with dips. When my friend asked what they were, he knew what they were 2/3 (not a problem), but wished her good luck in a condescending manner instead of saying let me ask the chef and get back to you.
He served the entrees and put the steak sauce on the opposite side of the table without telling us. We discovered on her last bite.
When paying the check, my friend was gestured to come and meet the waiter, instead of the waiter handling the payment at the table. Who does that? Absurd!
Some people seem to have excellent service here. We were treated with much below average service. Thank you, not coming back.

My family and I love coming here!
Such great food, atmosphere and service.
Highly recommend for a great Kosher experience!

***Restaurant Week***

Overall (3/5): A beautifully adorned dining room that doesn't have much to say with their food.

Food (3/5): We tried a bunch of options, but most of us ordered the Plaza Burger which was good, nothing out of the ordinary.

Atmosphere (4/5): Gorgeous dining room with a sprawling ceiling and an interesting tiger mural. Service was a bit scattered, but there were some staff in training the evening that we went.
