Uniqueness (2/5): Nothing that stood out.

Value (3/5): Pricey for what you get.

​We were at the UN Plaza Grill for dinner for the restaurant week, on January 31, 2022. We ordered off the prix fixe menu. For the $59 per person you get a 3 good course meal. (keep this in mind when viewing) Everything was delicious!

After coming in from the cold we each decided to have a Porcini and White Mushroom soup, with truffle oil and croutons. It was very flavorful, savory, and not at all too salty.

We each ordered the center cut ribeye with hand cut fries. The steaks were done as we asked (medium) and they were juicy.

For desserts, we ordered are tiramisu and a molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.

The drinks were extra but well worth it.
Pictures of all this deliciousness are attached.
The service was excellent, and they even brought out a space heater.

This place is unbelievable, i came in with my colleagues from work, beautiful ambiance right across UN, it was a crowded early dinner but we've been seated right away, for dinner we had tapaniaky wagyu ribs, pot stickers, lollipops made of chicken and mezze platter, and for main entree we all share like appetizers as well, all steaks, Delmonico, tomahawk amazing, so juicy and perfectly medium cooked as we requested. Manager i think his name is Kany or Kenny if i m not wrong and i apologize if i missed spelled, he checked on our table a few times, very charming guy and welcoming, server was great Andrey, he didn't missed anything, always being very attentive and friendly. Thank you guys and see you soon again.
Comfortable upscale definitely has the Manhattan vibe the food and presentation was beyond our expections

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! We had our engagement party here and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Delicious food, incredible staff, beautiful ambiance. Kenny made our dreams into a reality. We can't wait to have our next event here.

We returned to the UN Plaza Grill on New Year's Day and were treated to a wonderful, celebratory dinner.  Every dish is absolutely scrumptious!  Thanks to manager extraordinaire, Kenny, the restaurant is superbly run -- from the sooth lighting, the melodious classic, pop and jazz music in the background to the friendly and cheerful wait staff.  That's why we return again and again to this delightful gem on the East Side.

Overpriced. Food was tasteless
Drinks were poorly mixed
If you're going to get a drink w dinner, go for wine. At least you know what you're getting
Truffle mushroom soup was good. Everything else was bland and lacking imagination
Won't be back
Amazing happy hour deals on both food and drinks. The fries and the dipping sauces were delicious. I also ordered the quinoa salad which was just ok, a little bit dry.

The decor is beautiful, the service is excellent and the food and presentation are really good overall. However, the location is more of a "destination", and although it's one of few premium kosher restaurants in the city, it just doesn't make sense to me from a value perspective.

We always end up spending around $130-150 a person here (i.e. on par with Reserve Cut) but the food is not all that amazing to justify these prices, in my humble opinion. Steaks are $65-75, appetizers are $25-30, and don't forget that most steaks do not come with any side dishes (other than a roasted tomato), so that's yet another upsell.

In terms of appetizers, the chicken lollipops are great, and so are the BBQ rib tacos. Highly recommend them, as they are crunchy and delicious. We got a special of Mongolian beef, which was basically a stir fry but was a bit chewy (maybe sliced incorrectly?) I also got a Tiger sushi roll which was smothered in various sauces. I thought it was good, but my friend said that for a $30 roll it tasted fishy.

The burger feels like the best overall dish here. It was apparently rated one of the top kosher burgers in the city and is made with wagyu beef I think. Steaks are excellent and felt like they were sous vide cooked, unlike Le Marais. Texture and meat were perfect. Sides of Mashed potatoes and eggplant were delicious, but again, probably not worth it from a financial perspective.

Overall, it's good for a nice dinner but we came here on a Monday night and seemed to be only 25% full. Pricing just feels too high and maybe it's possible to throw some more low cost items in here, especially since rent on 1st Ave should be cheaper than 7th and 46th...

Enjoyed our meal last night.  We had great appetizers - mini burger and steak tacos.  Bottle of Jezreel wine and short rib sandwich.  Mine was excellent but my kids said theirs were slightly burned.   Salmon was excellent.  Service was excellent and very helpful

I've been dining at this restaurant for the past 2 years now and have never been let down, always serving high quality food, high quality service and an atmosphere that'll leave you in awe. I've come to write this review because of the special event I had the honor and ability of doing at UN Plaza Grill because of the friendliness and kindness of the maître d', he and his staff made my proposal an absolute jaw dropping occasion. From start to finish the staff were nothing but helpful even with the small little details, if it mattered to me it mattered to them.

Now the food, the food is absolutely amazing, I personally have never been to a restaurant that has served such quality food so consistently and I've been to most of the kosher restaurants in New York. If you're in the mood to have a great meal and don't want to worry about waiting an hour for your food UN Plaza Grill is your place.

The number one thing I find very difficult to come by within the kosher restaurant realm is, nice, sweet hearted and caring staff, I've been very disappointed at many other restaurants because of this issue and I must say the staff at UN Plaza Grill are the most amazing group of people I've ever met, it's always an honor or pleasure for them as they serve you your food, not that it's needed although it makes my experience from fantastic to absolutely originally amazing.  

Overall I'd say, quality food, quality staff and quality atmosphere, if I could rank this place higher I would.

Thank you,
Albert Green

This place was excellent! They made an awesome steak for Michael and they made a vegan dish for me. The drinks were excellent! We had an spectacular time. Cassidy and Gabriella were awesome waitresses! I couldn't have been more happy! I would recommend this place to anyone!
Excellent restaurant and service. Kenny the manager is always very accommodating and helpful.

The best kosher restaurant in all of Manhattan!! My husband and I come here very often and we can't get enough! The food is 5 star, ambiance is 5 star and service is 10 star! I highly recommend!!! I recommend the Lychee martini and white tiger for cocktails! The sliders and tuna pizza for apps! And the steak or branzino for main course! Delicious!!

Great spot for happy hour!! But terrible for dinner.
Ordered a pasta with veggies and it came with Salmon. Salad was dry. Steak tacos were dry as well. Service was quite slow. Would definitely return but only for a glass of wine and fries!

Had a fun time and a wonderful dinner here last night. Came here with family to celebrate two birthdays and four mothers' days. We sat at two different tables since we arrived at different times.
Some of the delicous foods we tried:
Roasted Ox Tongue-In a delicious brown sauce over some wonderful mushrooms and peppery greens
Wagyu Potstickers-Sesame, Scallions, Hoisin Glaze-ok
Buffalo Chicken Tenders Toasted Coconut, Honey Mustard-we held the coconut. Was tasty.The kids loved this one.
Roasted tomato soup-delicious, you could taste the fresh basil
Cote de Boeuf 20oz Prime Ribeye Bone-In;-highlight of the dinner. It was repared perfectly crispy on the outside, melt in your mouth soft on the inside. Served with Bordelaise and Béarnaise sauces. My brother, JJ, was so pleased with his steak, he wanted me to try some before I ordered mine. It was so perfect that I ordered the same. He preferred the Bordelaise sauce, while my preference was for the Bearnaise.
For side dishes (must be ordered separately) We had:
Pomme Puree-tasty
Roasted Wild Mushrooms-really delicious. I finished this dish without much sharing (lol)
Pommes Frites- crispy on the outside, nicely seasoned
Desserts:
Tropical Vacherin Crispy Meringue, Coconut Sorbet, Mango Sorbet-My favorite dessert. Loved the meringue texture against the two sorbets. Perfect flavor and not too sweet.
Classic French Beignet Vanilla, Caramel & Chocolate Sauce-The beignets were fresh, hot, could not stop eating these
Maple Apple Confit Vol-Au-Vent Vanilla Bean Cream-beautiful presentation, and tasty
Chocolate Triple Play Molten Chocolate Cake, Chocolate Cookie Ice
Cream Sandwich, Chocolate Pot de Crème-brought with the birthday
candle. I never got to photograph or taste this becaue it was finished
before it could be passed to my side of the table!
Peanut & Chocolate Peanut Butter Cream, Chocolate Ganache, Chocolate Crumbs-Everyone loved this one too.
This is a perfect choice for a special occasion. Looking forward to returning.

Wonderful outside seating area. Food is delicious even though the menu is significantly reduced from their menu pre-COVID.

This place never disappoints!!

Disappointing. Went for NYC restaurant week. They advertised a prix fixe menu for $59, allowing you to order an appetizer, a main dish, and a dessert. I ordered the samosas and my brother ordered the meatballs. These are each usually $26 (samosas)/$22 (meatballs) on the menu. Surprisingly, these appetizers each included only 2 samosas/meatballs. The samosas were not bad, but not great. The meatballs were regular sized meatballs (would these be $11 each on the regular menu???) and were dry, relatively tasteless. My wife had the soup and it was very good.  
The rib eye steaks were small, a bit chewy/fatty and the taste was mediocre. If these are the same as the regular menu rib eye steaks, they are an embarrassment for the normal price of $68.
The service was ok, the ambiance was excellent.
The bathroom had seemingly not been cleaned all day (toilet paper and tissues all over the floor, no toilet paper on the roll, no paper towels to dry your hands).
Overall, I think I'm being more than fair to give them 3 stars.

This was a last second reservation, and a phenomenal choice. Every single item was on point. For appetizers, I got the tongue, the osso bucco and the empenadas. Mains were the executive cut steak, and the wagyu burger. Dessert was chocolate triple play, and the peanut chocolate cream. My one comment was that the meat was overdone. I ordered medium rare, and it came medium, and the burger was ordered medium, and came well. The flavor was on point though...

Ambiance was perfect, and pricing was great. I'll definitely be back!

I been in that restaurant in the first time after I visited a lot of grill kosher restaurants, and UN Plaza Grill is the best!!
Very cozy and fancy place, beautiful design and amazing tasty food.
Juhan the waiter was very polite nice and professional. It's maybe the first time but for sure not the last one.
Highly recommend!!!

The website advertises an outdoor dining alternative. I reserved a table online, explicitly requesting outdoor dining. When I called to confirm the reservation, I repeated the request. I was told that there would be no outdoor dining if it rained, but otherwise we would be good to go.

When we arrived at the restaurant, there was no outdoor dining. The maitre d' explained that the building had had insecticide sprayed on the terrace earlier in the day. I asked why this was not communicated to us. He had no answer.

For a special occasion - beautiful atmosphere and lively ambience. Dress nicely, I recommend.  Service was ok - seemed rushed and somewhat abrupt.  
Food was good- not great. Steak arrived grilled to order.  Spinach was a disappointment - watery consistency, no flavor- no one wanted to eat because looked so unappetizing.
Fries were ok.  The main courses were all adequate. Desserts were good- especially the donuts/beignets with 3 dipping sauces.
A decent time but not rushing back. Also one of the most expensive kosher restaurants in the city.  Not as good as the other kosher steak houses.

Last night we hosted a wonderful corporate event for 30 clients and contacts at the UN Plaza Grill. We received multiple comments on how great the event was. The manager, Kenny is an absolute professional, incredibly responsive, and a pleasure to work with. The dinner went seamlessly and the service was 100% on point from start to finish thanks to the entire restaurant staff.  The space is beautiful and the food was delicious, high quality, and beautifully presented. We did a three course menu including appetizers, entrees, and desserts.  Some of the standout dishes were porcini & white mushroom soup, salmon carpaccio,14 oz butcher cut boneless prime ribeye steak, chicken marsala, and an incredibly decadent  molten chocolate cake and warm apple tart, among other choices. It is a pleasure to recommend the UN Plaza Grill for dining and private events and I hope to be back soon!

I have to drop my review again and I'm leaving it at this. I've been here several times since my previous review. The food here has always been consistently delicious. But there is always always always SOMETHING wrong whenever I come in, but I've been too lazy to adjust. I come for work lunches and I don't really have a choice in the matter.  The only reason I changed my review to the 4 stars in the first place is b/c they call and asked me to rereview after I had just eaten a meal when I made a reservation. Guess they connected my Yelp review and my reservation name. I didn't mine b/c that particular meal went smoothly. But ever since then, My group always has something go wrong.

This time, there was a piece of ceramic in my dish. I took a bite of shallot and felt some type of rocky pieces in the bite. After digging through the food, I found the culprit-a piece of ceramic that was at the bottom of all my food. So yes, I did eat a piece of ceramic. I checked all my dishes to see if any pieces had broken off....there were none. I left the remaining piece of ceramic on the plate and returned it to the server in the end. The end.

Excellent food. Especially liked the fish tacos and BBQ sandwich.
Attentive service and comfortable location.

Had a special occasion dinner last night and was very happy with the service and the food. The oxtail tongue appetizer was great and my Wagu and short rib Burger was fantastic. Service was great and the restaurant is great for special occasions. It is about$100+ per person but worth every penny. I feel it is one of the top five Kosher restaurants.

NOT Fine dining!

Judging from the price list, we assumed We would be blown away by the food and atmosphere.

When we walked in, the first thing you notice is the makeshift decor- from the brown, pieced together rug, cheaply draped columns, black painted walls and tacky red vinyl chairs and balconettes.  One star for the decor.

The atmosphere in general is loud and obnoxious with annoying background music. The space is overly lit. One star for the atmosphere.

We ordered the tongue and mushroom soup as appetizer. The tongue came overly sauced with way too much going on on the plate. The soup was only so so.

For the mains we ordered the filthy burger, vegan sushi and the truffle Mac and cheese which I was told was made with tofu. The Mac and cheese was inedible - overly sweet and tasted NOTHING truffle and nothing like cheese. The rest of the meal was mediocre. One star for food.

Don't be duped by the price list like were- for Kosher Meat restaurants check out La Marais or Reserve Cut.

Had a wonderful lovely experience at U.N. plaza grill. Service was top notch. Food was incredible. Really enjoyed my dinner. We live in Miami and come to New York often and love to try out new Kosher restaurants. This was one of the best kosher restaurants we have tried in a long time. Would definitely recommend. You don't get this quality steak in Miami

Came here last night for my wife's birthday. Found replace to be very nice. I am not sure why all the other comments are so bitter. Being that it was a new place for us we ordered something from each part of the menu just to try it. The sushi was delicious  [and I'm a very picky sushi eater]. The appetizers were amazing. We ordered the tacos  [must have] and the chicken poppers. The wine list had a lot to choose from from taste as well as price. The steaks were very generous portions. Desert was good as well. Portion for tea and coffee very generous. One negative comment is that the soda I ordered tasted watered down but other than that everything else was top notch.

Their service was not as bad as the other comments make it seem. Our waiter and maitre d was always available for our demands.

Not sure why all the other comments keep mentioning Reserve Cut. Maybe they are bitter about the recent downturn they suffered in the quality of their food.

All in all the food was amazing and for the portion size and location the bill was reasonable...

Definitely a place I would return to.

Lovely room with an eager staff.   Getting up to speed after Covid. Increased volume of business will doubtless allow the team to bulk up the menu. Appreciated the nearby reasonable parking and symmetrical service which brought everyone in our party each course at the same moment

We had lunch choosing from the prix fixe lunch menu. I had the wagyu tataki, the duck breast and the creme brûlée. The food is well presented and well paced. The wagyu was good as well as the duck. The dessert was fair.  We treated ourselves to cocktails: I had an old fashioned which was good.
I'm looking forward to a return visit.

Now, I really would like to say why I have 3 stars for this restaurant. The place is very very pricey especially when it comes to salad. They sell Ceaser salad for $22. I kind of didn't like that they include only a few leaves of lettuce and a few crackers and they charge you this kind of money. Maximum this salad at this location should of go for $12- $15.
Another very bad part I noticed that when we pick what wine we are going to get, the waitress brought us different bottle of wine.The price difference between the bottles was significant. Once he agreed that the bottle was wrong he told us that he has to bring out from the cellar. After all we got what we ordered.
The waiter was distracted by other table for a question while he was getting our orders for wine. He left us hanging for a while and then showed up asking us what wine we decided to go with. In the mean while we have already told him what wine we like.
The stakes came out k. My friends steak went back on the grill.
The 2nd floor seating is very limited for large group of ppl. Waitresses keep bumping in to your chair because of the space is kind of to tight for large group of people. That was kind of not nice. The management should of arrange tables upstairs for couples only or up to 4 ppl only.
They do have full bar.

3.5 stars
Bit pricey for 4 bites but it actually tasted pretty good. For $20 I feel like even a bag of chips would've made it a slightly better deal but I get that everything is expensive now.. It was outside Forest Hills this past weekend so we got one to share for a snack as we were picking up food in the area.
Bun had a lot of butter. Lobster was sweet and had more flavor compared to some restaurants I've been to in the city.

Taste like crap!

$20 = Rip Off!

Never again!

They're so f*cking cheap with the lobster. There was about a tablespoon in my $20 lobster roll. Don't give these thieves your money.

(This was at the 9th Ave Food Fest)

Done waste your money. Got an extremely small portion of lobster.  They don't show you the roll until after you pay, so your stuck with it.  They missed their opportunity to provide a good experience but instead chose to go the cheap route.
They charge you $20 for a lobster roll on a hotdog. i ate it and finished it with 3 bites.

I don't know why this lobster truck gets such crappy reviews.  Yes, service is a bit slow, but its totally worth the wait.  Not enough of an issue to drop the rating down a star.  

Definitely a deal at $13.  The "classic" has just the right amount of mayo (ie. not too much). The warm butter poached version is delicious as well.

See my picture - its worth a thousand words.

$13 LOBSTER ROLL.

Do I have your attention yet? Urban Lobster Shack is a newcomer to the line up of food trucks on Old Slip (FiDi)-- and I welcome them with open arms!

The shack is run by a woman who says that 13 is her lucky number, and therefore prices her "Famous Lobster Roll" at $13 and refuses to raise the price! This is absurd and amazing as we all know lobster rolls in the city average $20 at best.

Most recently, I tried their "Lobzel," made with their lobster salad on a pretzel bun ($16). The lobster salad had large chunks of tail and claw meat which was lightly-dressed.* The pretzel bun was giant and SO good (also lightly-buttered and grilled). All of this made for a lavish lunch, and enjoyed it immensely as I basked in the sunshine at Elevated Acre during my lunch break.

I have yet to try their Old Bay Lobster Roll, Sriracha Lobster Roll, Avocado Lobster Roll(!), Cajun Lobster Roll, and others... but it looks like I'll be eating well this summer. You can follow them on Twitter @urbanlobster, but they don't tweet regularly... it's best to jump on this bright red cart whenever you see them!

_________________________________________

*Add $2 if you don't want mayo in your lobster salad. I'm not a fan of mayo, but the dressing was so light, it didn't even bother me.

OK, so the owner is darling and always greets me with rainbows. And all the different rolls I've tried are tasty, especially the garlic/scampi one which will TOTALLY get you out of that 3pm client meeting you didn't want to go to anyway ("*cough*, sir, I think we're going to have to re-schedule the presentation on account of my breath is nuclear....")

But, see, it's just too dang expensive. Maybe I got spoiled by the abundance of melt-in-your-mouth fresh lobster from such bastions of lobster-ness as Boston, Nova Scotia and Taiwan, but I just can't get accustomed to paying $15 for an average-sized roll. I get it--NYC is expensive, and you pay a tax just to breathe the air. But still....

Very disappointing. I opted for the $17 'warm' roll, it was tepid at best and under seasoned lacking and of the buttery-ness or Lemon advertised. The portion was ungenerous - a small, slightly oily and damp bun with about two small mouthfuls of meat - all of which was in small pieces rather than the chunky claw meat served in better quality establishments.
I should've handed it back and refused to pay - but this was from the food truck at the Murray Hill Residence fair and I thought it might taste better than it looked - it didn't!

Let's be methodical about this:
+1 star because I didn't get the food poisoning promised by everyone
+1 star because the scampi roll had lots of garlic and butter #cantgowrong
+1 star because for $14, the quantity of meat was huge
And finally +1 star because my checkin here got me my Mavrick badge... cuz apparently I don't take y'all reviews seriously.

A lot of hate for this lobster roll, most of which seems at odds with my three experiences at the place. There are a series of trucks around the city, but usually there's one parked near Broad Street in FiDi.

Service is surprisingly slow for a food truck operation. On my most recent visit, the staff was clearly struggling to deal with both online, takeover and walk up orders. That means that even a small line can mean a significant wait - much more so than other food trucks in the area.

When things are slower I've found the staff to be very friendly, and definitely about to example the different filling, side and topping options available here, which are extensive for a mobile operation.

I went up to the pretzel roll and no mayo option for a recent visit, which does push the price away from the bargain towards just fair at $18. But the increased meat count and nice bun means there's no need for any of the sides, which I thought were just fine when I've had them.

I found the flavor of the lobster to be one or two clicks below what's available at Luke's - still the city's gold standard - but still quite edible. Fix the line system and I could see this being a four star place.

Take my review with a grain of salt because I'm not big into lobster, and think I have had a lobster roll only once before.  That said I enjoyed my scampi lobster roll and would get it again.  I did not find it to be too buttery and my stomach feels fine after eating it. Potato salad side was ok.  Service was very friendly, and I love that they take cards.

I ordered the lobster roll without mayo, and the corn, tomato, basil salad. The serving of lobster was generous, with large chunks and minimal filler. The seasoning seemed to be applied with a heavy hand and was overly salty. The roll was an unevenly toasted potato hotdog bun. I would give this roll a 3 star rating.

But the corn salad really ruined the experience! It was tiny and made up of mostly canned corn, three grape tomatoes, and a few pieces of coarsely ripped basil. No seasoning or dressing - which would be fine if the foundational ingredients were higher quality. And the first order I received was very slimy. I brought it back and was given another that was "made this morning." The "fresh" (as fresh as canned corn can be) one wasn't slimy but it was cheep and lame.

This is a decent lobster roll, has some chunk lobster and some filler, and priced either correctly/lower for how much lobster you get.

The service is reasonably quick as well. Flavoring of the sauce with the lobster roll is decent, but does not really stand out.

I didn't have any of the other issues that people had with this truck. They were parked on 3rd ave when I stopped by (near the Bloomberg building) but I have seen them on 47th btw park and lex as well.

I would say that this truck doesn't warrant a special trip, but it is a good "if you are nearby" pick.

Terrible lobster roll I had it deliver and the roll was burnt ! And the roll is a regular hot dog bun!! Very disappointed never! 15 bucks for a burnt hot dog roll ! I will never order from here again. I can burn my own hit dog bun for less. The lobster was also over cooked and tasted like rubber  not happy at all

I got the $17 warm lobster roll when they participated in today's street fair on 40th b/t Park and Madison.  IDK how some people said theirs was skimpy - my roll was nicely filled, although maybe it was because I was getting the last one, I got extra from what was left.  *shrugs*  Either way, I don't get the 1 and 2 star ratings at all.  There wasn't much seasoning, if any, on the lobster, but it was very buttery and lemony, just the way I like it.  The bun was mushy from all the butter, but again, I didn't mind.

2.5 stars but rounded up because of the sheer amount of lobster you get for the price point. I got my lobster roll from the urban lobster shack truck that was parked on park ave btwn 51 and 52. I was pretty surprised how big of a menu they have. they basically have like 10+ different versions of their original lobster roll, such as one with old bay seasoning, another one spicy and yet another on a pretzel bun instead of the usual bun.

Like most lobster roll trucks in the city, the lobster isn't as fresh as it is in a store like Luke's or Lobster place in Chelsea market. I think these exist solely to fulfill midtown lunchtime lobster roll cravings haha so manage your expectations accordingly.

This one is pretty good for midtown east since it is $3 (at $13) cheaper than the other trucks that serve lobster rolls.

I wish there was a bit more of green garnish, but like I said, the sheer amount of lobster you get for $13 makes it worthwhile.

I want to try the pretzel bun lobster roll as that sounds pretty interesting. Old bay spice one sounds good too!

Scampi lobzel was the best lobster roll I've ever had in my life. Really miss this place and hope I find something as good in the future. I'm at gordan Ramseys restaurant in ac and I just finished the lobster roll here and all I can think about is how crap it was compared to this. If you're the owner please reach out to me!
Lobster roll was pretty good, some filler but it was a good price. Service was fine, not very friendly and rushed but it's a food truck so my expectations weren't really very high.
Overpriced and the guy just seemed to perpetuate the grumpy, cold northeastern masshole stereotype. Pass.

I ordered a HOT Lobster roll only to get back and discover they gave me a COLD lobster roll so loaded with Mayo, I couldn't even eat it.  Major fail.  Plus the "homemade" Old Bay chips are not homemade, but Lays Wavy chips sprinkled with Old Bay.  By the way, they were stale.  Will never go back to this truck.
So good, employees were all so nice could not believe how good the lobster roll tasted! Will be back again no question about it!

I'm not sold on this place yet.

On one hand, the lobster itself was fantastic. There were big chunks and when I ate it  solo, it tasted buttery and fresh.

On the other hand, the prices match the quality, so you're getting what you pay for. Also, I felt sick to my stomach for the rest of the day. Not because of food poisoning or bad food, but because of the sheer amount of butter on the roll and mayo in the lobster salad...and this is coming from someone who normally has a stomach of steel.

Conclusion: People in my office have recommended the one without mayo, because they had the same problem as me. Next time I see the truck I'll give the lighter version a shot and report back!

This place deserves a much higher rating than it currently has on Yelp. I had a classic lobster roll and it was divine. Perfect bun and buttery lobster. Also, I don't know why everyone is complaining about the price. It's lobster! We're not in Maine. If you want cheap seafood, go to the Gowanus Canal. If you want great tasting lobster (with kind service I might add) head to Urban Lobster.

Saw this place on Park across from my office and was pretty excited. However, am pretty disappointed! I wanted to get a cross section of what they had to offer, so I went for their "Famous" lobster roll, the pasta salad, and the clam chowder.

The clam chowder was really really thick - way to heavy. The taste was ok, but really muted by the cream.

The pasta salad was horrible. I'm getting nauseous thinking about it. Really poor quality mayonnaise and Old Bay seasoning.

The lobster roll was on a potato hot dog roll, which was buttered and pretty greasy, and the taste of the roll overpowered the taste of the lobster. Yes, it was packed pretty full, all claw meat. A bit under-seasoned, but ok in flavor.

Will I buy from them again? No.

This was an $18 mistake I am now regretting. I just got the avocado toast lobster roll from the lobster shack on a whim as I was leaving my office. I will only go to Luke's Lobster from now on. I started to have serious doubts when I got a glance of the sub-par quality of ingredients the gentleman was putting in my roll, including what looked like artificial margarine, McCormick's GMO spices, and after a couple of bites of the roll itself I started to feel queasy. It's deceving when you see it at first (chunk lobster meat on top) but when you get to the middle and bottom of the roll it's like the artificially-dyed red, minced lobster meat (I definitely tasted some shell), and it has the same consistency and flavor as imitation crab served in California rolls. I feel robbed of my $18 that would have been much better spent at Juice Press, Spreads, or Luke's Lobster.

Kudos for taking credit card though.

I now smell like margarine. Trying to wash down this roll with kombucha.
Delicious lobster sandwich. Is it worth $14 though?! Nope! ... I would definitely fork over $7 or $8 buck to sample some of this seafood goodness.
Lobster roll is just ok. I had the combo with the clam chowder, I did not have one single piece of clam in this so-called clam chowder... Go to Luke's instead if you are in FiDi.

I happened to spot the truck at Columbus Circle on my way home from work and thought this would make a great snack to walk with.I had eaten at the Urban Lobster Shack store some time ago, and although it wasn't the best lobster roll I've ever had, i thought it was pretty decent and was expecting the same from the truck. Boy was I wrong! This was the worst lobster roll that I EVER had!

I ordered the Tabasco Lobster Roll. The bread was untoasted and not even warm so it stuck to the roof of my mouth, definitely some mass produced hot dog buns. The lobster itself was terrible quality, it was not fresh at all and was pretty tasteless, I could not even taste the hot sauce. Worst part was that a huge amount of Mayo was poured right on top of the lobster. I love mayo but this was an obscene amount of it, so much that I could basically only taste bread and mayo. I only had two bites of this lobster roll and had to throw the rest out because I was so disgusted.  I'm ashamed to say that i paid 14 dollars for this.

This is my first ever 1* rating after 30 reviews, and the two reasons I'm giving it one star are:

- The buttered bun is absolutely horrific

- I got food poisoning and spent the evening hating life and had to change my plans

The lobster itself tasted fantastic. The after effects were less than fantastic. 100% buyer remorse.

Looking at the yelp reviews for this place I'm surprised I had a decent experience.  I was in Union Square and craving a lobster roll and I passed by the truck.  Maybe it was a little less shiny and efficient than most of the other trucks I eat at, but it seemed more sanitary than lots of the street vendor guys.

I got a standard lobster roll with butter but no mayo.  The lobster meat was juicy and fresh, and it was overflowing with tail meat in comparison to most of the other lobster roll places where they fill in the rolls with the rubbery end of the claws (Yes Luke's I'm talking about you).  The bun was a little too buttery, but not bad.  Overall, a top quality roll.  

My only complaint is that when the guy handed me the roll he gave me two paper towels as napkins and both were soaked  with what was hopefully butter, but I'd definitely go again.

I was craving Maine and so I stopped by the truck.

It satisfied my lobster craving.  Wasn't the best, but it was good.  I cant believe they use Martins potato rolls though. The bun did need to be toasted, as the butter made it mushy.  Woman in the truck was pleasant which makes me happy in this tough, NY city!

When it's the dead of winter, every single person in this city can find a way to warm their buns, so why can't this truck?

A potato bun was painted with 3 full layers of melted butter, which would have been great had it received 10 seconds on a griddle, it didn't. Bun became a cold, greasy mess.

The lobster meat itself was still springy texturally, demonstrating that it still retained some semblance of freshness but it just didn't taste that way. No sweetness, no salinity, and worst, the mayo tasted stale. It had that flavor you get when mayo begins to demulsify back into egg yolk and vegetable oil. No return trips here.

Had the avocado roll from the truck on 52nd street between 5th and 6th.  It smelled as if the rubber bands were not removed from the lobster claws before it was boiled.  It tasted a little off and after having made this very mistake when cooking lobster myself, I realized what it was.  So after 2 bites I threw it out... $16 lesson learned.

Get there quick, and get a Lobzel.
That's right my friends, it's a lobster roll on  a pretzel bun. Life Changing.
Best lobster roll of my life.  No filler, all killer. I can't even string together a proper sentence right now, i'm that excited about what I just ate.

Honestly the only reason I gave this any stars is because the food is actually very good. Beyond that they have the worst delivery and customer service I have ever seen. The three times I have ordered from them the least late they have been is a half hour. I understand you might be swamped but if that's the case you need to invest in more delivery guys rather than telling me "your his next stop". Honestly you have no way of knowing that or where the guy is it seems like. Also every time I've ordered from here I've been asked to make some form of change to my order. Again unreal if you know you don't have something don't advertise it. I will never recommend this to anyone and will actively advise them to chose something else. There are a ton of great places to get lobster rolls in this city, they should  strive to stand out rather than fall behind.

I have bought lobster rolls from this track parked on Park Ave throughout the summer and I found their rolls to be very good. I never get the "fancy" ones - only the regular roll and either a pasta salad or potato salad as a side. After a while I stopped liking the potato salad - not sure if it was the dressing or too much dill, or the fact that is straight from refrigerator and really cold. :( But they started offering clam chowder, which is also pretty good, so I got that a few times. Now, a regular roll with a side makes for a fairly expensive lunch, so this is something to think about, especially since lobster meat prices went down significantly. But I will surely not hesitate to get a roll from them again if I am craving lobster.

Truck was parked on 45th Street just west of 6th Avenue today, April 3rd. I was excited, but they served positively the worst lobster roll I have ever had. I went for the 'No Mayo'. Thinking i would get a plain, light lobster roll with a bit of lemon and tiny bit of butter.

Instead I receive this greasy glob of chewy lobster salad on a bland soggy roll.

At $14 this is a complete rip off.

This was not worth 13 dollars. Maybe 8 bucks but thats it. Complete waste of money.
If it was on a better piece of bread and little bigger then maybe. Will I go back?  No. Sorry.

the lobster tasted very gummy and not fresh. it has a fishy aftertaste. i hope i do not get food poisoning.  i give them two stars because these buns are overloaded with lobster meat.  Also the bun did taste pretty good.  i bet when these rolls are actually fresh they taste pretty good.
It was parked before my walk to Luke's lobster. And I thought why not try this place instead. Huge mistake. The bread was worse. The lobster was worse and the seasoning was worse.   Not good

I bit the bullet and anted up $14 to try the Scampi Lobster Roll today. I was not impressed by the freshness of the lobster. I was really unimpressed by the $4 side of corn, tomato, and basil salad, which is easy to make and should shine at this time of year. Instead, not enough ripe tomatoes, unfresh corn, and fresh basil was nowhere to be found. I grew up eating lobster rolls and make them from time to time myself so I know great from good from so-so from oh-no. This fell on the wrong end of the scale. I know lobster isn't cheap, but for $14 these need to be way, way better.

Wow, so glad I didn't see these reviews before walking by and deciding to give this truck a try.  I got the classic lobster roll with mayo ($13) and thought is was great!  Lots of meat, nice buttery toasted bun, and not too much mayo.  The best part though was the blueberry lemonade with fresh fruit in a mason jar.  That was delicious! and that alone would keep me coming back.  It was $6, which is pricey, but I think that's because you get to keep the jar, and really guys it was so yummy!  (I'll be sure to update if I end up getting sick, but as of now, I'd go back again in a heartbeat!)

Let me start by saying that my review is for the Tribeca location, specifically near Whole Foods on Greenwich St. Disappointing! My husband and I were excited to try a lobster roll to kick off summer because nothing screams summer more than a lobster roll. There was a wait and a few people in line so initially that felt like a good sign. I ordered the classic so nothing out of the ordinary and no frills or substitutions. I noticed how everyone had to wait for a while for their orders, but then when mine came out literally in 2 minutes, that's when I should have known. Our sandwich was small compared to others meaning no overflowing lobster, like the other diners around us. There were some benches nearby and we all migrated to them so we were able to see what others were having. Also the lobster didn't have that delicious sea taste that lobster has, instead I could have been eating chicken salad for all I know. Terrible! won't be back.
Really chewy lobster roll for nearly the same price as other competitors. What a joke.

Silly me. I paid for the overpriced lobster roll with my credit card, and my CC # WAS STOLEN. Luckily, my bank emailed me to warn me of fraudulent activity on my account. In regards to the roll, I ordered the buttered lobster roll. Without the extra butter. It was cold. I had to nuke it. I don't know why it took the woman so long to put pre-cooked lobster pieces on a pre-toasted roll. The pieces of the lobster were mostly ok, yes I got the rubbery claw ends. Maybe her trying to the ends in my lobster roll took the extra time. I'm not suprised the review below got food poisoning. I got lucky on that end as well. Buyer beware, CREDIT CARD FRAUD, overpriced, marginally acceptable food.

This is my go-to rooftop bar. Mainly because I can see my balcony from it, and it does have wonderful views looking towards downtown.

Food - this one makes me laugh, and the reason why it isn't 5 stars. I've tried ordering charcuterie twice here, and both times it sucked. Period.  But it's also a rooftop bar which is why no one can slam them too hard over it. To mgmt though: I'd look into fixing this as it would plus up the experience sooo much more.

Service - it's a rooftop bar with very few roving waiters/waitresses. Expect a slow response when they are busy. Also another reason they don't have 5 stars. If their people hustled a little more, they surly would of squeezed at least 15-20 more drinks out of me in my 5-7 times coming here.

Ambiance - it's honestly perfect. If you are seated on the window side, you're golden. If you're seated opposite the window side, it's a de-traction, but will still fulfill. Lighting levels are low, but for a guy with younger eyes, it's perfect. If you're old and your eyeballs dislike low-light, do us all a favor and use the candles to read instead of whipping out your iPhone flashlight and temporarily blinding your fellow teetotalers while you scour the drink menu. Semi-kidding old people, but c'mon.

In sum, if you're in midtown-East Manhattan on the late night, don't pass this place up!

I'm not much of a review writer, but I do tend to read them.
We're staying at this hotel and wanted a drink and snack after our show. The website says it closes at 12, but at 10:42 we were told it was last call. We had just gotten our drinks and food, and our server tossed the check on our table.
That was fine because we only needed one drink, but they then scrambled to close down the place and everyone disappeared into the back. Our server didn't come back, so I hunted down a very nice busser so we could at least get boxes and cups to take everything to our room.
As we were leaving at 10:53, a couple came up and started arguing about whether they were open until midnight. I felt bad for them.
The drinks were VERY watered down. The flatbread crust wasn't great, but it was gluten free so that's probably the issue. The mac and cheese almost earned them another star because it was good (as long as you're ok with huge chunks of garlic, which I am). The ambience is also great. But overall the service was just so bad.
I like to chose hotels based on whether they have a cute bar, so this is for anyone who also takes that into consideration. We haven't tried the other hotel restaurants, but they look lovely.

A great midtown rooftop bar that didn't seem to get too crowded or rowdy.

The table we were at was a little small for a party of three but we were able to make it work. Given the scene, I wasn't surprised, but still sad that they did not have a happy hour menu. Be willing to spend over 20 dollars for a cocktail! The drinks were good, but nothing amazing for the steep price.

We shared a bunch of food which was all decent/good. The fried shrimps, the calamari, the lobster dip, the Kobe sliders and the pizzas were all good, but very expensive for what was essentially bar food.

Would I come again? Yes for the scenery. I'll just have to ignore the price.

This is a review for brunch. Come for the view, not for the food. The food is average, not bad/not great - nothing really special. We didn't dislike it, but with all the brunch places around with better menus, there's plenty of other options.
Service and ambiance was epic. Beautiful spot for some great cocktails at the end of a long day in the city!
Reservations are a must. Fantastic views on the city. Food is good. I wouldn't say it's the best I've ever had but it's very solid. I especially liked the sliders. I will definitely be going back.

I booked brunch for my mom's birthday. They only release reservations about a week out. I wanted to sit facing the Chrysler building as it has significance to my mom. I made a note in the reservation and called ahead. We were seated on that side of the restaurant though not where I wanted but my mom was fine with it. Next thing I know the manager moves us to a better table. That made the day. My mom ordered the cloud omelette and they let her alter it. It came out great. The fries were crisp and salty (in a good way). I enjoyed my waffle as well. We split a Bellini which had peach and cranberry juice. It was a great brunch. No complaints.

My husband & I came for a quick drink , I'll be brief ...
All staff here , amazing
Come here to have a beautiful well made drink, with relaxing atmosphere
Beautiful place !!!

Had a wonderful time with friends celebrating with one of my friends 60th birthday. The food was good. Service was great and the ambience was awesome. They pulled back the glass awning and we got a beautiful open view of Manhattan, love the feel of this hotel rooftop.

Thoroughly enjoyed a special night at the rooftop bar. Drinks were as expected; tapas menu was varied- something for everyone. Service was attentive and speedy. We made reservations as recommended and we're seated in a lovely spot in the corner with great view of the city. DJ was spinning good music at a volume that provided privacy but don't overwhelm conversation. Note- It certainly helped that the weather was perfect.

Came in yesterday for a nice new years brunch and it was such a pleasant experience! The rooftop views were  amazing and it was easy to get a table on such a busy day of the year, the big open windows were such a good design and I'm happy to have been able to come. The servers were all also very nice and attentive, coming by often to pick up our plates and refill our waters and just made great conversation with us, particularly the tall male server who was so good to our party. As for the food it was really good, the appetizers for our brunch included baked goods and seasonal fruit which were all great with no criticisms. The entrees we ordered were all so good including the salmon Benedict and the steak and eggs, but what I really liked was the pancakes which were Such a surprise as they were slightly crispy on the outside and paired well with the blueberry compote and whipped cream making a delicious and not too sweet plate. My other issue was the lobster roll that I ordered, the sauce on it was just a. Bit too much without fasting much of the lobster it was all really wet and saucy without placing much focus on the actual lobster. Great place would love to come back again for dinner

Standard rooftop that capitalizes on its' beautiful rooftop location and ambience but pays little attention to service and drinks.
I don't want to be overly critical coz we barely spent an hour here but we visited this place right after our great experience at Ophelia, hence in comparison it fell short.
Though I must say it does have gorgeous view of midtown east and a cool vibe that you can enjoy, specially as a tourist.

I've visited The Upstairs several times now for different occasions. The hallmark of the staff was accommodation each time. When I've come with groups they helped expand our seating to include late-comers (the bane of my existence). During the Covid era they actually read my reservation notes and kept my companion and I far removed from other diners in a well-ventilated area. I never felt a pretentious vibe from them from entry to exit. This is a little rare in Manhattan where space is at a premium and venues try to project an air of exclusivity (which is completely unnecessary).

I haven't been there on the weekend recently but the last time I did, they had a DJ that seemed to adapt to the makeup and vibe of the crowd (a skill that many DJ's don't have). I can't remember his name but I took his card and I'll come back to add his name to this review.

I recall trying several items off of the menu including but not limited to the sliders, truffle mac & cheese, guacamole, charcuterie boards etc. I've had brunch with them as well. The takeaway from brunch was that the sage-infused panacotta had a little too much sage. I can't remember any other remarkable issues with food. They've got a full bar, cocktails and wines. If you can't find something to drink, something might be wrong with you.  

Otherwise, the view, the decor the space overall is beautiful. I'm not sure why their aggregate rating isn't higher. You should go, whether solo, with a date or a with a squad. They'll definitely accommodate you.

Enjoyed my time here even if it was just for the evening. Went to their roof top bar with DJ. Checking out the skyline of NY with the lights and Happy Hour appetizers going around. Got full and appreciated the experience. Plus the excellent service.

I have been here a couple of times. It's always a good vibe and beautiful decor. It's always better to make a reservation if you want a table otherwise you will be standing at the bar as it gets pretty crowded. However the vibe is great, good music ,good food and delicious drinks.Perfect date night, ladies night, brunch etc. A must try!

a very nice indoor rooftop view with dark ambiance lighting!! favorite place so far to admire the vast city landscape with a tasty drink, friendly service, & conversation indoors. i particularly enjoyed the DJs music (not sure if it's always like this) consisting mostly of remixed tunes, vocals only appearing occasionally, seamless transitions, well fitting in the background, & the volume was not too loud to have a good conversation! is quite pricey though - I also got a charcuterie board which was delicious (nothing extraordinary), cute, but very tiny for the price. would come back again on a treat yoself night tho:)

Great place to grab drinks before a show. Cute decor, solid food, and 10/10 drinks. Beautiful views, but wouldn't exactly call it a rooftop bar - the actual view from the rooftop is a bit shrouded, though the views through the windows inside are stunning.
my sweet friend brought me here, Perfect Amazing View of NYC Rooftop Restaurant, good food and drinks, great service too.

Views; Good. Drinks; Strong. Service; Do they know what a Hello or a Smile are?
Served without a smile. Served without a hello or hi how are you, how has your day been, welcome how can I help. Basic service skills lacking. Honestly I've sent my team members HOME lacking any one of the above!
Team huddle, get back to basics, Talk, Appreciate, Communicate and Serve. $56 for 4 drinks Absolutely reasonably priced IMO I'd have paid more , but I would walk out if I visited again and the same server was working without a smile. Iceberg theory is a real thing so everyone gets a first chance.
Hope your server is ok. Thanks for some greats drinks.

Pros: Before you walk into the hotel,
they take your temperature outside and you are greeted by a fancy lobby. You take a few photos in the fancy lobby. Then, you take the elevator to the penthouse and you have a floor to ceiling view of the Chrysler building and the other giants of NYC. Who needs bread when you are served popcorn? You drink Fancy cocktails and eat Average guacamole and pico de Gallo.

Cons: Very limited selection to eat for vegans (e.g., fries and guac). You completely understand that businesses want to turn over tables and were kindly reminded that there is a 90 minute dining window.
Lovely atmosphere. Great food. I had a Bloody Mary and the salmon eggs Benedict. Service was excellent.

Our experience Upstairs at The Kimberly is ALWAYS OUTSTANDING!  The staff are courteous and attentive and the music is !  This is not a place for dinner- there is light bites- but the atmosphere, drinks and staff makes this place.

Beautiful night for cocktails on a rooftop. The door man if the hotel actually chatted with us as we were walking by and said we should check it out. We took the elevator up and were amazed with the space. So pretty. Nice music and staff. We will be going back. Please try it.

Note that you must order something (food) with your drinks. We had already eaten dinner, so we got a chocolate molten cake with vanilla ice cream to share. Delicious!!

tl;dr: Review for brunch only; don't go here for the food. I'm sure this place is excellent during bar hours!

Three stars for the location and rooftop atmosphere only. We were there for Saturday brunch, and here are the things that caught us off guard:

- The food for brunch is emphatically NOT out-of-this-world.  They have a very bare-bones brunch menu (think eggs benedict, pancakes, waffle, chicken wrap, and burger), and due to the size of our group, we tried most of the things on it.  None of it was excellent.  The eggs benedict was over-salted, the chicken wrap had sauce sprinkled OVER it (showing that it was made without care for how someone would eat it) and the burger was dry.
- We do not recommend the mediterranean hash.  We thought it would be something special, but it was actually two sunny side-up eggs on top of a bunch of potatoes.
- We generally felt very safe and most employees were great about COVID measures. But one member of the staff (not for our table) was wearing her mask under the nose.

I'm sure that we would have had a better experience at night, as this place is probably at its prime during bar hours.  But tbd!
We enjoyed the vibe upstairs. Fun music, drinks, some snacks and great views. Lots of people were dancing.

Wanted to try a rooftop brunch in NYC and stopped by Upstairs at the Kimberly! We had a reservation for 12 PM but showed up early at 11:15. Unfortunately, the bar and kitchen are closed from 11AM-12PM so staff can get a break between breakfast and lunch.. At least they let us sit at our table and gave us water until 12 pm rolled around.

I got the prosciutto eggs benedict with salad $16 (you can choose salad or fries as your side). It was good, but not great. Eggs were cooked properly but everything was a bit bland. Drinks were strong and delicious - we ordered an Upstairs Strawberry Rossini ($14) and an Upstairs Peartini ($14). The rooftop has a greenhouse covering that they open at 12 PM but it only opens for the middle area (doesn't open all the way) so if you're looking for open air, probably request that you sit closer to the middle of the seating area. Service was OK, no frills.

Loved it. Nice space, smaller than I thought but with a cool vibe. A girlfriend and I came here to grab a drink and a light dinner before a show. The food was delicious and so were the drinks. Servers were friendly and professional. I'd definitely return.

Pretty standard rooftop. The view of midtown was nice. The drinks were okay, I do have to say the fries were amazing and perfectly crispy. Nice rooftop if you're looking for a chill vibe but nothing special.

Started off our evening Upstairs at the Kimberly... the ambiance is absolutely unbelievable. Sitting on a rooftop in Manhattan with high rises all around makes for an awesome place to relax and have a drink with your friends.

Based on our experience I would highly suggest you call ahead and make a reservation. Their bar seating is very limited. Not a big deal.  We found a place to stand while we enjoyed a drink.  They have a decent cocktail menu with some reasonably unique libations. Unfortunately all three that we enjoyed were very sweet and not well balanced.

Their bottle selection on their bar is great, but the bartender knowledge was lacking. Asking for anything that is not on the menu will require teaching the bartender. Nothing crazy... simple drinks like a Sazerac or an Old Fashioned. A little disappointing for a cocktail bar in New York.

They seemed to have a solid wine selection which I think is likely more their target audience. If you're in the area, give it a shot... maybe it was just a bad night.

Rooftop season is here!  Make your reservation for this midtown hot spot.
Perfectly paired with the opening  of NYC post pandemic !

Excellent views, with retractable roof and small outdoor patio seating area with fireplace.

Large cocktail menu with many libations and plenty of wine and champagne. Perfect place for a drink and small bite. Plenty of parking garages and if your don't mind walk parking on 3rd Ave.

Kobe beef sliders were a perfect size to accompany the cocktails,  ordered a side of French fires, crispy and  well done and served stacked high with chipotle Mayo.

Ice cream sandwich dessert was outstanding. Fresh caramel ice cream in between two oatmeal cookies.

Nice rooftop bar with good food. The drinks are expensive, but they are everywhere in NYC! Not the atmosphere for dancing, it's more of a hangout or lunch spot.

I've been here twice within the last few months. You should make reservations but they may not be necessary depending on the day/time.

The food was pretty good. The fries were by far the best fries I've ever had, no joke. Delish chipotle dipping sauce. I got the crab cakes (they're super small) and the coconut shrimp- DELISH sweet chili sauce as well. My friends who ordered the "medium" size charcuterie board were disappointed in it's small size and lack of variety. Also the cauliflower was sour.

The drinks are okk. I only tried two kinds but even my friends agreed they're only mediocre. Not sure what they're missing... I guess they are small for the price and bland for the expectation.

No one is up dancing at this bar. It's a chill vibe with a nice view. Good to celebrate a birthday or have a romantic lunch.

Interesting night
Me and my friends ,completely unplanned ,had great dinner and great service in a hotel restaurant before going for drink upstairs.
We didn't have a reservation but we found space at the bar.
Drinks were pretty good,prices reasonable but unfortunately our tall bartender was obviously having a bad day.
She would way rather talk to her friends then pay any attention on us or other ppl at the bar.
And when we actually did have her attention for few minutes, it felt like such a hustle and burden that we didn't even dare Ordering another one.
Too bad as place looks beautiful.
If you are in neighborhood,  do yourself a favor and go to ophelia

Beautiful rooftop with gorgeous views of midtown and the Chrysler building! Went here for evening drinks and they still require that you order food when ordering drinks. I had the upstairs Rossini which is a champagne cocktail with strawberries and my friend had the pear tini. I also had the tequila drink with pineapple and cilantro, can't remember the name but the cocktails are great! Will be coming back
Really cool open air rooftop with good food and great drinks. We had a great time with our friends Matt and Kimberly from Athens/Binghampten. Happy anniversary!!

It was okay. Went on a Thursday night , walked right in without a reservation. Wasn't busy at all. There seemed to be some kind of work event. Grabbed a drink at the bar and moved on to look for a more lively spot.

The ambiance is great.  There's a great view of the Empire State Building. The service was nice and quick. The brunch options were very limited.  They had a better menu before but since they reopened it has gotten much more limited.  The prices are on the higher side, but it is expected due to the ambiance.  The food was ok.  We got the cloud omellete which was a acceptable portion size. And the fries were great.  But when the fries are the best part of the meal it can't be a great review. We also got the Truffle Pizza which was $30. It was well topped with mushrooms and a shareable size. But again it was nothing I couldn't put down.

Visited Upstairs on a Friday evening. We wanted to try to see the sunset so we got a reservation at 6pm.

To get to the Upstairs you meet with the doorman at Kimberly to let him know you want to go to upstairs. They have a scanner that scans your temperature, and then elevator takes you straight to the bar.

When you exit the elevator the bathrooms are to your right, and seating area is to your left. I didn't get a chance to see the entire place but overall the vibe was super cute.

The seating area is nicely spread out and comfortable chairs. If it rains there is a cover that mechanically moves over the entire area as well so it's not a big deal if it rains.

We ordered the 3 drinks and some sliders which were delicious. Which was about 80 dollars. It's on the pricier side but overall I really enjoyed it.

My favorite part of this was was that unlike few other places I've been to the music was not too loud. I was able to have intimate conversation with my date and hear everything clearly. We had a great time and laughed a lot. So much I accidentally spat a chunk of the meat from the slider on him... but it was still a good time :)

On the other hand, I don't think you can see the sunset from here. It was cloudy the day we went but it'a kinda surrounded by other buildings...

Overall nice classy place for chill date with nice drinks.

I loved the place, super protected with the covid-19.  A super romantic place and a very good view.  Lovely staff and great customer service.

The food was delicious. Fantastic cheese platter and the pizza  too.

This is a place for family , date , or friends.

I really will like to go back for the brunch because I want for dinner and the brunch menu looks good too.
Great ambiance, friendly staff, amazing food. Definition going back for events, reunions and dates.

We came here for some snacks and a drink. It was very busy so we grabbed something from the bar first. Had their cucumber Collins which was quite good. Light and refreshing!

We then grabbed a table and ordered a couple appies. First came their crab cakes. It was mushy. That's all I can say and wouldn't order it again. We also had their Kobe sliders. It was quite good and tasty. I only wish they were bigger. They are one bite. Lol

I'd say the highlight was that drink and the complimentary snacks they brought. Candied walnuts, peanuts and sour cream& onion chips.

One of the coolest rooftop brunch spots in the city. Super scenic and a great date spot. I got the Belgian waffles and was extremely impressed with the aesthetic array of the meal and the quality of the food. Service was great and the staff was very friendly.

Unique rooftop in UES surrounded by lots of towering buildings! Can't see the city skyline but feels homey and intimate. They have nice outdoor lounge seating outside and they have indoor as well. Drink options are amazing and beautiful! Great spot for brunch or just a few drinks/ apps with a group!

amazing food and amazing vibes
great view
the lobster roll was one of the best i've tried

Upstairs at the Kimberly is located on the rooftop of a stunning hotel with holiday feels. The rooftop itself is decorated very nice and it is enclosed with a glass covering so it's perfect for a winter brunch date. It also has a great brunch view of the Empire State Building. I would recommend getting the lobster roll or the kobe burger-both come with a perfect seasoned basket of fries. We got the upstairs strawberry Rossini to drink which was very refreshing; it didn't start getting busy until about 1 pm but I would definitely make reservations beforehand.

Brunch review!

I came here to celebrate my birthday a few weeks ago. We had a party of 10 which turned into a party of 11 the day of and we had no issues. I noticed on the online reservation that anything over 4 guests showed no availability. We called and were told to submit a request and email with credit card info.

There's a temp check machine in the hotel lobby and a doorman helping the flow of guests to the elevators. Since it was a bit more chilly out, they must've closed off half the rooftop that wasn't covered. It made it a bit smaller than the pics and vids I've seen, but nonetheless it's a gorgeous space. As the sun got brighter, they opened up the roof and it was still a very comfortable temp.

As for food and drinks:
- Drinks 4/5 - Decent variety of cocktails that were pretty strong
- Food 3/5 - Entrees were nothing spectacular, but not bad either. Most of us ordered the eggs benny or the kobe burger, which were both fine. The only thing my two friends didn't like were the lobster roll. They didn't even finish half of it.

Overall, we had a good dining experience. Service was great and constant, but we never felt rushed to leave. It seems like a great place to get drinks, but I probably wouldn't recommend coming for the food.
View at this spot is spectacular! Just make reservations and you'll be seated right away. Rooftop is retractable but they still have ac blasting so you stay cool.

I've been a guest at the Kimberly Hotel several times including today (8/26/2022). Went up to the Penthouse Patio to simply get a cup of coffee and was both questioned by a very rude blond with an ascent and then told I was driving her crazy when I asked for a normal to go cup which typically would be out to grab. Super rude attitude.

The cutest rooftop!! The view is so beautiful and the rooftop is very well designed. I visited on a Sunday afternoon for brunch more so lunch for a birthday. Upon arrival we were temperature checked and allowed to make our way up.

The brunch/lunch menu in my opinion is limited but I ended up ordering the brunch burger and a mimosa. It was filling and tasty. The food is okay in my opinion.

I think it's a great place to come for a nice vibe and cute photos ;) I would visit again and maybe give the dinner menu a try.

Came here for a good meal and some drinks, instead we got rude employees and chickens with there heads cut off running the place. The views here are great but the food is terrible and has no flavor at all. The waitress never smiles and is never around. Had to keep looking for her to give us the check so we could run out of there. Absolutely do not recommend.
Very nice place we really loved it no wait time just reserve on time . And everything is pretty good the orange juice delicious

The Visitors Cafe is similar to the other Coffee Shops and Cafes on the United Nations campus, however, one important distinction is that this one is open to the public.  Well, public means that you still have to arrange or have access to the UN Grounds.

If you don't have a UN event badge or grounds pass, pay a visit to the UN Security Office to arrange a visitors pass.

The Visitors Cafe is located in the Basement (Floor 1, in GA elevator terms) and is adjacent to the UN Gift Shoppe.

The people are friendly, but as you can imagine, they're swamped during heavy traffic times, especially if events are taking place.

Probably the healthiest Chinese food I've ever eaten. We ordered an egg roll, pork dumplings, lemongrass shrimp and chicken teriyaki. And jasmine tea. I would give a 3.5 stars if I could.

Here is the breakdown:

The eggroll was okay. The outside was crunchy but the inside lacked a flavor.

The pork dumplings were good. Standard for Chinese food but prepared well and came with a flavorful dipping sauce.

The shrimp and lemongrass was a confusing dish. The shrimp lacked any lemongrass flavor whatsoever. The dish came with a small dipping dish of the sauce which was cold. The confusing park was that we were expecting a dish that was more in line with the vegetables and the shrimp cooked IN the sauce and it wasn't which is why I said it was the healthiest Chinese food we've ever had. The vegetables were steamed expertly and the shrimp was cooked well but it didn't seem like the dish we had ordered. It seemed more like diet Chinese food without the sauce.

The chicken teriyaki was also good. Cooked with the same vegetables (a mix of asparagus broccoli mushrooms carrots and snow peas) and they were fresh and delicious. This dish had been sautéed in the sauce which was nice too. I was expecting the lemongrass shrimp to be similar.

One note- we got both brown rice and white rice as an accompanying component. They were both terrible and I think it has to do with the quality of rice from the start. Rice is my favorite food so this was a letdown.

I don't know that I would necessarily be back unless I was looking for an excellent steamed vegetables and chicken dish. This restaurant is very new, comfortable, and casual. The service was good too.

For me, this narrowly avoids a 1-star review only because the prices are cheap, the food is served quickly, and they have the ability to sit large groups. If not for this, there would hardly be anything to justify giving this restaurant more than 1 star.

The food served here is about as simple and tasteless as you'll find. It's like home cooking, but not done particularly well. The ingredients look and taste cheap, and the food is quite flavorless (and is only one texture: soft). Tables are packed pretty tightly together and service is almost non-existent outside of bringing dishes to the table. If you want items such as napkins or water, you'll need to chase down a waiter to ask for these items. The upkeep of the restaurant is not the greatest -- as you'll find uncleared tables for a while after diners have finished eating, and the lock on the bathroom door was not present during my visit.

Overall, with so many good options in NYC for Chinese food, this restaurant disappoints on all levels. Even though the price is low, I'd rather pay slightly more for much more exciting and polished food options. I don't disagree with others that the sole purpose of this restaurant is probably to serve large tour groups quickly, cheaply, and efficiently.

Best Chinese food all throughout Turtle Bay. Disregard the bad reviews by the few people that are scared of spice and MSG. Top notch food and staff with usually quick and great service. This place draws a crowd from bus loads of international travelers for a reason. If it was bad Chinese food then why would any internationals come in the first place?
Depressing atmosphere. Staff sold me an item that did not look like the menu picture and laughed about it when asked.
This "restaurant" is actually a bus depot for Chinese tour buses. They bring Chinese tour buses here to feed them. The food is beyond terrible.
This restaurant is very unkind to non Chinese.  Wow.  I wouldn't come in unless you are Chinese

This hidden space is truly a gem. I hesitate to share it with you all so it doesn't get overwhelmingly busy for when we visit the city  We love a good food hall and know that New York is packed with them. This space was recommended by some local connections due to its proximity to Grand Central Station. Even in the rain, it was a couple minute walk just around the corner.

The set up is well planned having a row of stalls as soon as you walk in and then a back seating area with even more options. We were able to order from 4 or 5 spaces with no issue. The turn around was very quick! The food was all very good, but I'm seriously still thinking about that açaí bowl! I was worth the swoon.

There are two bars in the sitting area which was easy to grab a drink once we had a spot all set. This is a great stop off the train and would be worth being it's own destination! Definitely will return.

A food court. Was wondering why folks kept piling into this place at lunchtime. Makes sense now.

Some offshoots of other brick and mortar locales and a good variety for many folks.

I didn't really see anything that really caught my eye at all that I would want to try though.

This was a nice place if you want a decent sized bowl of ramen but it is not the place if you are looking for authentic ramen. I am a sucker for a pork bone broth and there wasn't one on the menu so I was a little disappointed. Nonetheless my ramen (brisket ramen) was solid. The broth was very light and I was happy with the amount of topping it came with, especially since the egg was still runny. Did wish my pieces do meat weren't so small and broken down. Would've loved some thinly sliced beef or chunks of brisket instead. Ramen was expensive at an average of 20 dollars per bowl.

Got the sweet potato fries to share with a friend but wasn't expecting it to be the shoe string kind. Wish it was crispier but the meat on top was nice.

My sister and I came here for dinner. We shared food from Mikey Pomodoro and Redhook Lobster. Looks like lots of people come here after work. We split a hero and had the garlic Parmesan fries. The fries were super garlicky but we finished it all. I was still hungry so my sister got me a lobster grilled cheese. She waited over 10 minutes for it. Sadly, upon biting it I noticed there was no lobster and the bacon didn't taste good. She brought it back for me and were super apologetic then gave her a new one. It was a waste because I couldn't eat that bacon. I'm sure there are a lot of better choices at Urbanspace. I wouldn't recommend Rehook lobster.

While wondering Midtown, I was looking for a nice snack before dinner. I stumbled into Urbanspace and was attracted to its neon lights.

Food + Price: 3/5

I got the two yubu special with Salmon and Beef Bulgogi. Candidly, there were both okay but not my favorite. The salmon was little fishy in smell and taste and the Bulgogi reminded me more of ground beef in Korean BBQ sauce. The tofu skin and rice was fine but they protein could have been better. It was ~$10 so not the worse.

All in all, I will probably not go again but it was a new experience.

A "hip" food court, with lots of options and seating. It's a great spot for a casual dinner and to catch up with friends :)

Just one downside is that they don't have water cups so you have to purchase a beverage/bring your own

I've only had the ramen place and a pitcher of beer from the seafood place.

The ramen place:

The chef/owner was so nice he said he makes everything from scratch and recommended me both the food and the soda.

I got a chicken app which was pretty good if you have a few people and beer.

The ramen was fantastic! The noodles were yummy, the broth was good and falorful, and the toppings were good.

The soda was great it's like milk tea soda not too sweet.

The seafood place:

Great value for the happy hour pitcher!
A lot of options to choose from. I tried the tacos and were really good. I would be willing to try other options next time.

The ambiance seems to be nice, but I'll have to visit again when more vendors are open. I walked from 52nd & Broadway to Lexington because i wanted to try the Red Curry bao buns, and they were already closed when we got there.  We decided on Bull Chicken because the cashier was really kind and provided nice service. My daughter got the chicken nuggets and fries, and I fot the spicy chicken sandwich with kimchi slaw. Let me start out by saying my sandwich was so delicious and flavorful. While the aroma from my daughter's food smelled so good, it was bland and had no flavor.

In a hurry to a show? Great quick bite! This is basically a food park but a notch or two better. Food is prepared to order nice and fresh. Tried Kati Thai fried rice and fried chicken- delicious!! Generous! It was absolutely perfect and economical too and everyone in our party picked different meals so even better
Good selection of food stalls in this space. Mostly Asian inspired but still good. Tried the Bao, Japanese/Mexican infusion, and Korean Fried Chicken.

So many great options that are priced well! Had a spicy chicken sandwich at delaneys and it was the best chicken sandwich I've ever had in my life. Fried to perfect and so juicy and big. The spicy mayo was so good too. Would've preferred white meat but still soooo good! Love food courts
Great lunch spot in midtown. Lots of variety including vegetarian options. I was attending a conference at the Sheraton and stopped here for lunch most days. Don't miss this spot!!

It's like a fancy food court. Kinda hip looking and shxt.
Still, with so many vendors I didn't find something I wanted on this visit.

It looks super clean and staff at all counters were cool.

There is alcohol. I know I know you're at work (loads of offices around) but sometimes...

The End.

Visited this food hall twice during my last trip to the city this month. I've been to the Urbanspace Vanderbuilt before near grand central and I did like the food options there more, but this location had good spots too.

The first meal I had was at Bao By Kaya and I got a popcorn chicken bowl which was tasty. It came with some really good garlic cream sauce and another sauce all over the popcorn chicken, rice, veggies, corn and egg. My mom got the two pork Bao buns with gyoza meal. The food was not that pricey for the amount of food we got.

The second meal I got from here was at Roberta's and was just a margarita pizza and a beer. The pizza was very thin and had a delicious crust. I really liked the pizza from this place. A large is enough for 2 people to share. My beer threes brewing beer was also good. This is a great food hall to stop by in to get a break from the busy city. Also makes for a good food choice for those indecisive pickers. Lot of different options.

I actually liked the choices at the Urbanspace Vanderbilt near Grand Central Station better but this spot has more room to sit in the second floor dining area.

All kinds of cuisine here, from ramen to Italian subs. A few places serve beer.

Bao Buns - I thought the spring rolls would be made with rice paper. Instead they were standard deep fried veggie rolls. Not worth the calories. The
baos however were great and filling! Fatty duck, lots of meat.

My friend liked her Baja Mex food. It's an indoor food court with better food that you'd find at most mall food courts. I like how these are popping up all over the city. Reasonably priced, satisfying, quick meals for folks with busy schedules.

Good spot for food in the area, lots of selections but a bit pricy. I liked the ramen and bao options.

I went to bull chicken today and had high expectations. I would give bull chicken 2 stars but they don't have a Yelp page. I paid $15 for a small portion and everything was stale or cold.
