I hate to leave a bad review on a small business but my only hope is that they improve their dishes and stay in business on the upper west!

I would leave -5 stars if I could. I could only take 3 bites before gagging and this is not an exaggeration. It was my first time ordering from them and Im completely disappointed. Never had I had a poke place drench the entire bowl in this nasty ass white sauce! It wasn't even the normal amount you usually get, but instead it was more sauce than how the halal bros cover their bowls but at least theirs is edible.

It looked and tasted like mayo mixed with cream cheese mixed with expired ranch. I felt bad throwing out the bowl and wasting $20, but I just couldn't do that to myself. I rarely leave reviews and tbh my last one was years ago. But this just did it for me.

Excellent experience ordering at the counter in the times of COVID; I'm so glad they're in our neighborhood!
- Huge quantities of well-prepared food. The large bowl comes with a truly astonishing quantity of rice.
- I had tuna and yellowtail, and both tasted really fresh!
- Our random assortment of topping and sauces all seemed prepared well, and you can have 5 toppings plus 2 crunches, so many of them! Shiitake (the standout, for me), edamame, onions, hijiki, jalapeno (omg too spicy), avocado for $1, nori, garlic crisps... the list goes on.
- On the other hand, the "Hawaiian" pineapple bubble tea was extremely confusing! Sweet, creamy, a tiny bit sour, and probably made all the boba clump together. Probably would stick with the original flavor in the future.

I ordered the Uptown small bowl, which was still a ton of food. I really appreciate the large portion size, as it's a lot of bang for your buck.

The bowl had a lot of yellow tail and spicy salmon. The salmon was genuinely spicy, but I wish it was not cut up into tiny pieces and slathered in sauce. That made it lack the fresh taste that I look forward to when eating poke.

The toppings really complement each other: the creamy avocado, sweet mango, and crunchy cucumber and edamame went well with the salmon. However the wasabi aioli tasted strongly of Mayo and became a bit overwhelming.

I also ordered a matcha tea with boba at 75% sweetness level. I like how you can customize your sweetness and the tea had the perfect amount of sugar. However, I encountered a problem I've never had before: the boba was too thick and kept getting stuck in the straw. My husband had the same issue with his milk tea.

I loved the ambiance of this place and am glad to have supported, but I hope to have a better experience with the menu items in the future. I see pictures of other Yelper's food and it looks a lot better than what I received.

One of the first handful of times of ordering takeout/delivery in the COVID era-

As one who loves seafood/sushi, I was excited to try my first poke bowl since March (!?!?) and I believe the fish was fresh but the frozen/thawed kind.
$14.99 for a small bowl (Salmon sunrise)

Maybe more like 3.5 stars but I know the service industry is going through a lot of struggle right now. Perhaps, procuring fresh fish isn't feasible in today's Coronavirus world.

I also thought the delivery/contactless method was effortless and I'm glad they are open! Would probably order again.

Great delivery from Uptown Poke!
Really appreciated the handwritten note on the bag and the cover for the bubble tea cup is so cute!
Food was delicious and fresh. Be cautious when adding the garlic topping, they're very generous! I know a lot of people obsessed with garlic that would've been ecstatic but it was a bit too much for me. Looking forward to ordering again!

When I think of a poke spot, I think of an open bar with plenty of toppings available for customization. When I walked into Uptown Poke, I was a bit confused by the setup with a closed off kitchen area, only a booth to place your order, and no seating. I was thinking to walk out, but decided to give them a try. Overall, Uptown poke provided a generous portion with plenty of fresh fish, but lacked in several key areas. This spot definitely offers fewer and less creative options for toppings. They also may have forgotten to add sauce to my bowl because it was flavorless and dry. A simple salmon bowl also cost $18 (no additions like Kani, avocado, etc). Felt a bit overpriced and wasn't the best experience I've had. Love my poke, but let down by this one.

The last two times I've ordered from here the avocado has been so unripe that it's inedible.  So unripe in fact that it would have been impossible for the person cutting it up to not have realized.   Really disappointing, especially when you pay so much extra for them.   Last time I ordered delivery, I requested the sauces and the side and received no sauces.  It all seems a bit careless.

Three stars instead of two because my first few times ordering were good so I'm hoping it's a temporary lapse in quality.

If you want 7 small cubes of fish and a bowl of rice, you've found the right place!

Super disappointed and likely won't be retiring anytime soon.

Came for dinner and had the Salmon Sunrise and my husband had the Uptown Bowl. His had a kick with the wasabi sauce but it balanced out with the mango. Mine had the spicy mayo sauce which was a good amount of spice. Really enjoyed it and was more than enough on portion size! (We had the large) def try out this little gem! So worth it

YUM! ordered delivery today and everything was fresh and amazingly good. Don't dare to order anything larger than a regular bowl unless you hadn't eaten more than a day because they give a lot of food. I love the fact that they had my name on the bag with a heart, it was the touch of joy that I believe we all need during this time. Food came quick and the spicy tuna was well made. if you're feeling a little bit stuffy from congestion, this bowl will do your nostrils some justice. Will order again!
Found round worms in my takeout salmon bowl. Very disturbing given the good reviews. Are the materials sushi grade?

Absolutely amazing! I love Poke Bowls ! A close friend of mine  recommended me to Uptown Poke . Here I am , I tell you what ,Sarah ! - you was right.  The food was delicious. Balance lean Protein - Energizing - Ready for my workout!  I'll be back

The poke bowls are decent but they never ever have food ready when you try to pick it up. Can end up waiting 10 mins or more when it should be just a pre-order pick up and go.

I feel bad for the delivery guys who are always waiting forever for the order to be ready.
Solid poke spot with all the ingredients you'd expect. Really friendly staff, fresh ingredients, clean - it's a go to for me whenever I'm in the area.

I have eaten my fair share of poke and I was disappointed by what uptown poke had.

For the bowl size and the charge for the small bowl to only have one protein was already way overpriced.

As for the topping they barely had the correct poke toppings that other poke places usually have so it was hard to create that good flavorful dish.

The protein was fresh I had salmon and even then they gave you the smallest scoop I asked for a bit more but they just stared at me. The place was totally empty mind you.

Maybe if you never had poke before their okay for beginner other I'd totally skip this place otherwise.

BEST POKE BOWL I'VE EVER HAD!
The fish was so fresh and they put a good amount - not skimpy at all! Sauces were on point, very tasty. Service was quick and everything came out exactly as ordered. We will definitely be back :)

Ordered from here via Uber Eats and got the salmon sunrise.Everything tasted really fresh I will say I ordered the large bowl and thought I would be getting some more but appeared to be the same size with another protein added I believe. I would suggest maybe stating that or having an add-on option and actually give more food in the "large bowl".Other than that really good experience just wish I had more, left me wanting more!
Really delicious. Great balance of ingredient, fresh and clean. Def will order again!
This place is incredible.  Not only is the food fast, fresh and fabulous, every person I've ever met on the staff could not be more courteous or friendly.  A real gem.

The food was fresh and staff was friendly.
I highly recommend this shop!

I ordered custom salad and my friend ordered one of their recommendations.
Definitely worth to visit.

From this season, it would be great if you pick up salad here and go to picnic at Central Park!
Rice is old and stiff, hurts my stomach. the miso soup is saltier than salt! Too salty to be a soup, a broth, or even a sauce. Why...

Ordered through DoorDash.  Had been looking forward to this and Very Disappointed. The only bowl that was Fresh and reasonably sized was the one that was design your own. The other two were with  the supposedly Customer Favorites-- filled with  LOTS of rice and the limited amount and the added ingredients did NOT seem fresh. Very little except  for the Rice which was Soaked in one of the sauces.

I was so excited to eat poké at Central Park but this place was such a let down. First off, it's overpriced for mediocre poke. Usually poké is $11-$12 for a bowl with 2 proteins but just a small custom bowl with one protein at this place is $12.99. So my friend and I both opted for their classic mixes bowls off the menu which offers 2 proteins for a small size bowl.  We both ordered Westside bowls which included 2 proteins- spicy salmon and spicy tuna. My other two friends made custom bowls. The westside bowls were drowning in sweet sauce. It threw off the whole flavor and all of my rice was drenched in it. Also their fish did not seem fresh at all! It seemed like the refrigerated fish that's all crumbly after you thaw it out. The fish wasn't even in pieces, it was like it was BLENDED so It was basically like cat food. I couldn't even finish half the bowl and threw it away. The only good part about our food was the taro bubble tea. It's a bummer that there's not many poke places near Central Park but I think it's better to spend your money somewhere else.

I am a recurring customer but the last few times I've ordered via Yelp my orders are not what I am expecting them to be. I've let it slide a few times but this time around was the icing on the cake. I ordered my own bowl with spicy salmon and Kani. LITERALLY two pieces of salmon. I'm not even joking. I'm paying $25 for two cubes of salmon. Come on man. I think the worst thing is when you're excited to eat something and you don't even get what you asked for. Please let me know when you find the salmon in the picture...............

I eat a lot of poke. A LOT. To the point that my blood probably contains more mercury than red blood cells (which might explain my shiny silver Tin Man complexion).  Uptown Poke is not where I would eat it if I had my druthers.

To be clear, the fish is fine -- fresh enough for the purpose, without excelling in any way -- and that does count for a lot. Uptown Poke isn't my favorite for other reasons.

As others (the credible reviewers anyway with more reviews than friends) have mentioned, portion sizes are on the small end and prices are on the high end. I'm sympathetic to the geography and the fact that this restaurant is in a very high rent neighborhood -- but how is it that Poke Rice turns out a far better product for less on W. 4th Street (another notoriously high rent part of town)?

It's not just the amount of protein you receive -- a diminutive scoop that I'd guess was about 1/4 of a cup. It's also that the toppings are pretty basic and lack the kind of mind boggling variety Manhattan poke eaters have been spoiled by elsewhere. And you're paying about $14 (tax, but not gratuity inclusive) for the most basic, salad based option -- essentially a run-of-the-mill salad with a small scoop of sushi-grade fish and more "exotic" dressing choices than you'd find at your standard local deli.

Nice folks work there. But the three eat-in tables in this pretty, modern space are left unwiped, the floor unswept.

Uptown Poke can do so much better. And so can you.

Amazing food and the staff is great, super friendly. My favorite is the salmon sunrise! But you can build your own bowl too. The fish and vegetables were really fresh and they taste amazing . This is my favorite place for a great poke bowl.
Greats bowls. Reasonable price. Wish it was open a bit later. Overall been coming here more and more though.

Best Poké place in NYC! Great owner & staff, generous portions, fresh ingredients including Mango & Pineapple (unlike many other Poké places who use awful canned fruit). Once they made a mistake on my order and went on to immediately send a whole new bowl. This place rocks!

Small portions, but if you get tons of edamame and a rice base, it'll fill you up. Fish portions are small, but you get enough to make two sushi rolls, which will run you $10-15 anyway. That's how I gauge value. Sushi grade fish is expensive. Toppings ate generous and the sauces are good.

Just not a good poke bowl.  The portion sizes are small for the price, and there is very little fish.

The taste itself was also below average.  I got a bowl with yuzu wasabi sauce and spicy salmon.  The sauce was a white creamy sauce that tasted neither of yuzu nor wasabi.  It tasted bland; imagine a cold heavy cream sauce poured over your rice and unseasoned fish.  The spicy salmon also looked unappetizing.  It was an orange, lumpy ball that looked like it had already been half-chewed and then squashed in the bottom of my bowl. I lost my appetite after having a few bites.

The other bowl I tasted had a different sauce, but that was also bland.  The rice was not cooked well: cold and lumpy.  The yellowtail and salmon themselves were okay.

Mushy, cold textures and bland.  I would rather go to Midtown for Red Poke.

Didn't expect it but, Uptown Poke was definitely terrific. Everything is always so fresh, and the price is right! Incredibly flavorful and wholesome. The service was also perfect and everyone was friendly. If you have not tried Uptown Poke you need to at least once.

Ordered bubble tea, I can't tell if I'm drinking $6 syrup or bubble milk tea. Is there even milk and tea in it?
I don't know if it's my mistake or I just ordered a whole bowl of white rice for $18, more than half of the bowl was rice. The spicy salmon and spice tuna, two slops.
The avocado, a extra dollar; was two pieces.
Don't come to this place not worth your time!
Usually we have no problem but today was a DISASTER.  We ordered lunch and are still waiting for the delivery.  The order was placed an hour ago and we are still waiting.  Such a disappointment.

God I love this place! Where else can I get a salmon or yellowtail poke bowl on the uws!?
My favorites are the yellowtail Supreme and the tuna special... Over rice or salad is the perfect healthy lunch

Had an amazing upper west poke bowl last night. The flavor is so fresh and diverse. I loved the sweet sauce as well with the seaweed salad in their. Amazing. They were quick and it was healthy and fresh. My bowl had very sweet flavoring.
Def delicious and fresh.  I would have given fI've stars but I did a double salmon and it felt like they forgot the double.

I got a poke bowl and was charged $17 and change after tax. I don't see any poke bowls on the menu more than $13 so this seems very odd... maybe because I got a salad base instead of rice?

Also, I would say the amount of fish was slim compared to other poke spots. I understand a new restaurant needs to be careful of costs , but it's a dog eat dog world out here in NYC. Competition is tough and I don't like that the woman overcharged

If they can give some sort of response on the overcharge I'm willing to alter my review.

I got a response; apparently I ordered a special bowl which costs more. They don't display prices. The bowl was overpriced for the amount of fish I got. Everything else was fine.

I went to the Brooklyn Deli before a show - it had everything we need and was a super affordable meal. We had a tuna melt and a hot pastrami sandwich - they were great! The pastrami was my fave. The location itself has a cute interior that feels like an old school diner. The staff helped me pick out the best sandwiches and were super friendly.

It was a really convenient spot to go before a show - quick, affordable and delicious.

Okay so I had the pastrami when they first opened and it was very good. Good quality and decent size for a good price. I recently had the breakfast sandwich with a pastrami and while the price was definitely decent, there was very little pastrami on it and it had red peppers with it too. Mostly bread though the egg was cooked perfect. Pastrami scene like it was from yesterday. So I would not recommend the pastrami breakfast sandwiches bc it's probably all leftover and if there, I would only get the pastrami if it was in the steamer and it looks good. Pizza looks pretty good.

I recommend you preview the food before ordering.

Avoid! At least based on our experience you should.

The staff seemed like they could not have cared less, about anything and it showed. We stood at the cash register with the cashier looking directly at us and smiling. Instead of greeting us and/or asking to take our order, she smiled more and went back to stacking to go boxes. After another smile and 2 whole minutes of us standing there, she finally said "Oh would you like order?"

We ordered a Hot Pastrami Sandwich on Rye bread, 2 chicken parm sandwiches and 2 orders of fries. The pastrami was thick cut, VERY tough and had almost as much fat as meat. The chicken parms were very over cooked and chewy rather than tender and yummy. When we asked if we could have ketchup for the fries and the pickle spear they forgot to give us, they got looks on their faces that could best be described as annoyed.

We also asked for the meals "for here" but they boxed and bagged the whole meal.

The only thing positive I can say is that the prices were about half that of pretty much every other nearby deli. I guess you really do get what you pay for.

Bottom line: This place was a real mess when we went there at lunchtime on a Wednesday.  Should've thought twice when a deli a block from Central Park was deserted at lunchtime.  Next time we will pay more attention to that nagging feeling that something's not right.

Classic New York City pastrami.

Saturday October 1,  found ourselves in this diner on the route from our timeshare  to Central Park.  Arrived well after lunch time, and  a good thing, as very limited seating, except around two kitchen tables.  

I ordered the $11.95 hot pastrami reuben, and wife ordered the $16.95 hot corned beef sandwich.  One of those places where you order off an overhead menu, and pay for your order before getting seated.  

Fast food style ordering, but they still expect a full 18%  tip beforehand, for the food delivered to your table.  Long waits for them to prepare the sandwiches, and minimal ambiance, with average New York City prices.

The pastrami reuben came with several slices of heated pastrami slices, covered with swiss cheese melting down a potato bun.  The Russian dressing tasted like the thousand island dressing on Big Macs, and went well with the meaty pastrami, which had minimal fat.  Added the long pickle to the sandwich  savoring the freshness and tenderness of the pastrami.  

I don't normally order pastrami sandwiches, as they come on rye bread which I avoid.  And wife doesn't order pastrami as she doesn't like the sauerkraut.  Not a problem here as the amount of sauerkraut was minimal.   Expected more sauerkraut.  

Wife liked her triple slices of corned beef on rye bread sandwich.

It rained five of the seven days we were in NYC last October.  Today in February NYC had their first snowfall, due to a winter drought.

Great service but the food and coffee is bad  
I ordered the pastrami cheddar for breakfast as I was told it was good. It did not look like the photo and it felt like eating pastrami scraps  . I ordered a large coffee ... it was sooo watery .
Sry but I do not recommend this place at all.

Great egg sandwiches, but miss the Eggface in the Jar dishes where they would sous vide an egg on top of mashed potatoes inside of a jar and top with scallions, salt, and red pepper flakes and serve with bagel chips!  That was by far my favorite breakfast in the city and I'm sad that currently it's off the menu :-(

This place is not worth the amount of time it takes to get food! It HAS to be the slowest place in the city! Smoky ovens, staff doesn't care if you order or get your food at ALL. Jump across the street to Carnegie Diner and save yourself time and hassle!

Hot pastrami sandwich place!! So so tasty, tender and fresh! There are so many options to choose from, it's almost impossible to make a choice, except for the fact there is pastrami available and if you're a hot pastrami fan as I am you'll jump on the chance to have one when available on the menu (as it's not always a given, just like mortadella) as they are hard to come by mostly :) the pizzas are in squared shape and there are pepperoni, veggie and a variety of options available. They even serve mimosas!!!! There are cute little window seating options to eat and watch passersby as it is in the corner where there is a metro entry. Very clean and cute place with tasty food. I definitely recommend :)

Literally the only disappointment on my entire trip. Walked in and stood behind a man at the counter. I assumed he had ordered and was waiting for his food because there were two men working who were running back and forth. After about 5 minutes the man huffed loudly and walked out. Unsure of what had just happened I step up to the counter. Again, a lot of running around but no one acknowledges me. A few minutes go by and I am scrolling my phone for another place to go that is close by when one of the workers step up and gruffly says "whaddya want"

I order salmon and cream cheese on a bagel. It is shown on the menu to be with an everything bagel. The wait is not long for the sandwich but when it comes it is on a plain bagel. I was not asked if plain was OK or even if I had a choice in the matter.

The cream cheese and salmon were fine (albeit messily constructed) but the worst, most unacceptable thing was that the bagel was stale. A stale bagel in NYC! Straight to jail.

I dont know what is going on with this place but they need to pull it together. Its a shame too because the interior is very cute and its a great location.

It's a good sandwich but taking a star away because the sandwich is not that big and I was still hungry after $13.  Also they serve all day breakfast but they wouldn't add an egg to my pastrami sandwich.  *Shrugs*.
The owner and staff were wonderful! Fantastic place I would recommend anyone in the area to come on in for the food and ambiance!

That SUCKED!!
Asked for a pastrami and corned beef combo.  Waiter said he doubted they would do that.
They did, but terrible!!!
Smallest sandwich ever!!! 1/3 lumped fat!!! And chunks of meat not sliced!!

The pastrami here was surprisingly good. I was not expecting much because their were lots of tourists. Surprisingly, the pastrami was amazing. The eggs were cooked perfectly. The service was slow but everything tastes pretty good.

Authentic New York deli. High price. Fast, friendly service. Ordered the pastrami on rye. I was actually disappointed, looking for more, definitely fresh, but lack the advertised flavor, and smoked preparation. I'll try somewhere else before I go back.

Idk how to rate this place. It's so inconsistent.

I get the turkey sandwich all the time because it's reasonably priced and damn good when made correctly/with any care whatsoever. But it rarely is.

What made me finally leave a review today is the fact that they gave me a pudding with mold on it. Pictures attached.

It is typically a three star experience with four star potential, but considering the inconsistency, regularly missing/incorrect items and now a visibly moldy item... gotta go 2 stars. It brings me no joy. There is serious potential, but they seemingly have little interest in reaching it

This place is kind of a bust. If you've come all the way to NY to get the true delicatessen experience, you won't get it here. The sandwiches are paltry by most standards. The corned beef was dry. I heard someone exclaim that the pastrami was good. The rolls were good. The pickles were kind of weird (juniper?). I mean it's probably ok in a pinch, but I wouldn't put it on the top ten of your list by any stretch.

So here is the thing. I'm a New Yorker so I expect the best otherwise why are you here? I passed by this Deli because I wanted to make sure an old Italian (business expense account restaurant in the day) was still there and then I noticed Brooklyn Delicatessen--and I've eaten at the proper restaurant on 57 th street years ago and its still there and they had a traditional Pastrami sandwich on the menu and it made my mouth water. It was 3pm and not busy so I ordered the sandwich and asked that one half be wrapped so I could place it in my back pack before I went shopping. I tipped the girl who then bought it to me unwrapped. Oh boy. To be honest the taste was only ok so I don't know if the Pastrami was aged but then the sandwich just fell apart. I mean the bread, meat and everything. No cheese or other spices but the worst thing is the tiny size. $20.00 for a puny sandwich! Pastrami sandwiches are supposed to be overstuffed not a bunch of scraps that fall apart when you try to eat them! You've got to be kidding me. This is a ripoff. The next time I'll go to Stage or even better Katz's. The horribly uncomfortable tiny wood stools and lackluster service means the only way this place will continue to do any business will be because of the unwitting tourist families like the one's I saw who assume that good quick food surely must exist directly across from Carnegie Hall because...

I wanted to introduce my guest to the taste of NYC deli meat. Looked around as we walked toward Central Park and trusted Yelp reviews. With 4 stars here, USA Brooklyn won. We saw the diner first, they directed us back around to the tiny deli that is difficult to find - the entrance is on 7th Ave. not 57th St., if that helps. Fundamentally different places, this one has a few sandwich options and a few sides. My guest got the crispy chicken sandwich. I got the hot corned beef (full size, not the half one with cole slaw on it) plus a side of cole slaw. Plus Cel-Ray because I can. Opinions:
* Cole slaw is more like cole salt. Too spicy, and 6 oz is a bit much for one person. They don't really have individual portions unfortunately. It's in a pinkish sauce so it's not your typical cole slaw. Recommend giving it a pass.
* Did not taste the crispy sandwich but it was destroyed, so that's a positive sign.
* My sandwich was a bit fatty - I did not ask for lean so fine, that's my fault, but the menu doesn't include a lean option. Most delis have that even if it's an upcharge. Should have asked that, oh well. Once I got the five biggest clumps off, the rest was more or less all meat. I've had way worse fat portions, fat on every piece, etc. - this is not as bad as all that but you will need a fork and knife to piece it apart before consuming. Very tasty. I asked for mustard and slathered it on. Sandwich is pictured coming with cheese. Mine did not and I wondered if they thought I wanted mustard /instead/ of cheese, as opposed to /in addition/. No reason to push it.
* Pickles are nothing outstanding. Standard size, not huge.
Service was a bit broken up - our sandwiches did not come out at the same time at all despite being on the same bill. Someone got a to-go of my sandwich just before my for-here came out. But it made it. That's the service you'll get.
Verdict: I miss the old places. I would look around at what else is out there, but I would not rule out a return here if the better places are gone. So I'll round up to 4 stars for now.
No Star! Absolutely the worst! Corned Beef Sandwich?!  You guys really need to hang it up! Sandwich is tiny 90% fat and tough!

Delicious, truly delicious. We had a brioche bacon egg and cheese sandwich and a bagel with cream cheese. Both were filling and tasty. The staff was very friendly. They are obviously used to dealing lost tourist.

One of the best pastrami sandwiches I've ever had.

It's hard to make a Reuben juicy and moist without being greasy, but UBD somehow managed to do it. The meat was juicy, flavorful, and piled high. The assembly was great which made a big sandwich very easy and enjoyable to eat. Diner atmosphere with Sinatra playing on the background was cute.

Recommended for lunch.

At 4pm when we walked in and sat down for a late lunch we were the only customers, so I was concerned.  But my wife "had a feeling" that it'd be good and darned if it wasn't!  I had their famous chicken soup and was very pleased with the flavorful broth and generous amounts of shredded chicken.  I also had their roasted turkey reuben and my wife the crispy chicken sandwich and we both thought they were very tasty.  We split a side of tater tots which came out piping hot and crispy.  My wife thought they were the best she'd ever had and, while I wouldn't go that far, they were darn good.  The service was excellent the prices quite reasonable.  I've taken the time to write this review because I suspect others may pass it because of the name and the corny signboard outside; there may well be better delis in NYC, but this really hit the spot for us.

I wasn't a fan. The employees were really nice but the food and coffee were not. I ordered an iced latte and they even asked what type of milk I want and I still got dairy when I asked for oat. Would have asked them to remake but I realized once it was too late. They are also serving eggslut copycat items but they just don't taste as good. I got the egg and cheese which is their version of the Fairfax sandwich and it was soooo dry and then bun was not even toasted or warm. There's better food in the area I would avoid.

Very rude owner/manager... whoever the short white guy is... Came out yelling and screaming because I came in to ask to use the bathroom and I didn't realize they weren't open. One worker was kind and opened it for me to use but at that point I was uncomfortable and walked out. It's never that serious to be so rude and nasty. I'm working in the area and that's the closest deli but I rather walk a few blocks then give them my money.

Solid solid 4 stars. Honestly could even be 5 if they had better outdoor seating. But from the food perspective, excellent. We came for breakfast and ordered a couple of bacon egg and cheese.
The brioche was perfect, everything was great!
Amazing pizza!! Service was quick and the staff was very pleasant. And the restraunt was very clean. 10 out of 10 recommend.

Ordered "Bacon egg and cheese" pizza that was incredibly stale, dry and egg was nowhere to be seen, just a slice of thick dry "pizza?" bread, ton of low quality cheese and dry tasteless bacon (you really have to be skilled to make bacon that dry).

went here with my choir before our performance at carnegie hall and we had a group of maybe 20 people- food is delicious and service is fast. the margherita pizza reminds me if the soy plantation focaccia bread, highly recommend

ps: the music they play bomb music ‍‍‍

Place is empty because service is SUPER slow. It's like the employees just met each other. There are no other delis in the neighborhood because of Covid. Still this place is empty. I should've saw the signs
Overpriced, tourist trap neighborhood
Skip it. Ordered two fried eggs bacon and cheese on Ryebread, got one egg because that's what it said on the menu. Nine dollars plus change
Their famous bacon was undercooked. Sandwich was a mess.
Never again

Do not go here. Ordered a bacon egg and cheese on a plain bagel - the bacon, egg, and cheese were not cooked (even though it took over 25 minutes). The cheese was literally a cold square, the bacon was basically raw and the whites of the egg were runny. The bagel had a hair on it. Should have read the reviews before I came.

This place sucks.. the food sucks... the girl at the counter sucks. I ORDERED A HOT sandwich and  a cold dried ass pastrami sandwich served from a girl who hated her life and Job.  

A few good things..
1.. it was slow as hell NO customers no lines, which I should of known better.
2. The ketchup packet and the deli mustard was the best thing.
3. Don't ask for water.. you'll get a missed hand off.

DISSATISFACTION all around. How do you wait 50 minutes for a bacon egg and cheese sandwich. Not to mention they were out of bagels by 8:45 am. Sausage egg and cheese was burnt to a crisp. $12 for a two bite sandwich. Go get yourself a good bagel instead at Bagel Market nearby.  If i could give the restaurant  a 1/2 star I would. Better off at the corner halal cart.

This place is amazing! The service was over the top! The restaurant is clean. The staff is all so incredibly friendly and attentive. The food is absolutely delectable. Everything came out hot and fresh. We loved the open kitchen. We can't wait to come back!

I guess they are going for pastrami and corned beef jerkey. The quality is a shonda . At the very least the meats belong in a hotbox not a food warmer wrapped in plywood. A dear friend was visiting from the west and we were in the neighborhood. How I wish Sandy never cheated so the Carnegie would still  be open. We also checked out the Redeye grill but that felt like a hoarders movie set . What else could they find to haul in there. Katz's is quite a trek but we headed that way. At least you get to tip the carvers on your own and get a  beautiful sandwich. I read that here they tip themselves. The did nail the thing that most fast food joints do though what you get looks nothing like the images they advertise
Peace

Great menu and staff.  Q and Destiny were outstanding. The food was very well prepared tasty and unique
Egg in a jar was a new experience and very enjoyable
Great service by the staff Q and Destiny who were pleasant and helpful with questions about the menu

Highly recommend for breakfast and lunch!!
Staff was great. The pastrami Rueben is delish. Lol that someone who left a one star review asked for a lean-cut pastrami . FOH
Great turkey sandwich! Very moist and tasty marbled rye bread. The staff were very kind and accommodating to us as well :)
Super slow to fulfill an order for a sandwich (25 minutes). Don't order if you're in a hurry.

Be aware of this place. Stay away!!
The sandwiches they serve are NOTHING like the ones shown on their signs. The pictures they show are five times of what they serve. Also, don't bother asking for lean meat, like a 'lean pastrami' sandwich; the meat was greasy and fool of fat.
Stay alert in this place: don't let them charge you for the tip which they automatically add when you are about to pay with credit card; tell them to remove the tip (no one in NY charges tip for counter service).
Best way to eat here is by STAYING AWAY!!
(gave it only one star because there is no lesser choice, and don't deserve).
Very tasty hot pastrami Ruben, super quick, slightly smaller than it looks in the picture but I'm happy for the price and taste.

We were looking for a place that would help us to remember our trip. USA Brooklyn Delicates was definitely a good choice to sample a taste of Brooklyn. I had the Hot Pastrami, and my wife had the Hot Pastrami Rueben.... We'll be back!!
The turkey Ruben was great! The Russian dressing was good on the sandwich. Good quick bite to eat.
Amazing Hot Pastrami Reuben! Moist, tender, and melted in my mouth. Great sauerkraut and loved their house Russian sauce! Don't forget the real French fries and gourmet ketchup!
Walked in expecting your typical bodega pastrami. Boy was I wrong. Absolutely amazing pastrami and probably some of the best sauerkraut to meat to pickle ratio ever. Highly recommend.

This is an amazing pastrami sandwich. Best NYC deli near the south Central Park. Seriously. Don't get the corned beef even if you like corned beef.

Get the pastrami Reuben. I tried all the sandwiches. That is the best. The turkey is also killer for non - red meat people, but I'm a non - red meat person most of the time and the pastrami was the bomb.

Service is great too. I came with my family and they treated us well. Everybody is clean chef style dressed. Great place.
Great fast takeout in midtown.  Large salads reasonably priced for midtown. Decent breakfasts, too.

The Pastrami Reuben was so good!! One of the best I've ever had, granted, I haven't had that many. Ordered a side of fries which were the real and fleshy ones, not the thin flimsy ones. Very pleased with their service and pickup process too!

Phenomenal food!! So so fresh :)
The tuna sandwich, the egg sandwich, the Reuben sandwich. You cannot go wrong with anything here.
Will be coming back again :)

Ordered using the kiosh.  Restaurant being empty expected a relatively quick turn around. Instead the workers here just chose not to make the sandwich and be on their phones.  Had to stand and watch them make a sandwich - not coming back
Service and food absolutely amazing. Would definitely recommend this place. Will be back someday.

I cannot attest to the new menu I am seeing, but I have been a huge umami fan back when they had a dope location in BK. So sad that it closed. My favorite burger was always the manly! It was topped with the fixings, which included the most amazing "bacon jam". Pair that with sweet potato fries or rings and you were set.

Im a little sad to see that much of this menu doesn't really resemble the old umami that I grew to love. Can't wait to visit with an update!

I've only ordered doordash from here so this review is just for the food.
We've ordered both the sweet and savory crepes and have been more than satisfied with every crepe.
I would say portion is a pretty good amount for the price.
Amazing crepe shop in Washington Heights! They have so many unique options. I tried the strawberry cheesecake and it was fantastic. I will definitely be ordering here again for dessert.

I really want to like this place and have ordered on three separate occasions. I like that they have good hours and great costumer service. For those two reasons I have given them more than one chance. Every time I've ordered from here I feel like my crepes taste like pancakes.

I do recommend them if you have a late sweet tooth, for my crepe lovers, I wouldn't expect a traditional crepe.

Tried out this new 24-hour crepe spot via Seamless. I ordered the Nutella, banana, and strawberry crepe. The delivery arrived fairly quickly and the crepe was packed nicely and still warm. Surprisingly, it was not overwhelmingly sweet and had a good portion of fruit stuffed inside. The Nutella was present but not overbearing. These babies are definitely one of the better ones I've had so far.

Uptown Crepes has a ton of flavors so I'll be trying more of their menu in the near future. They also do waffles but let's face it - there's nothing quite like a delicate crepe.

I mean the picture should tell you why one star is being given here. This is what one of the male employees decided to give my sister as a treat. Last time I checked, penis crepes aren't on the menu. The worst part? It was brought to managements attention and they brushed it off by saying that employee only works at night. So because he's on the night shift, that means it's ok to sexually harass someone with food, huh?

CASH ONLY!! They have an ATM

I was in the mood for something sweet and this was the EXACT thing that I needed. With the crepe, you get a little bit of either ice cream or whipped cream! The crepe is a good portion and very very sweet. Honestly, I needed a bottle of water after this because it was so sweet. They have seating inside, but it is not good for large groups. Groups of 2-4 are probably good for sitting here though! I came on a Sunday night and there was no wait to order.

I'm so glad that I found this place! I definitely want to come back again.

FYI - I called and they said that they close at 4am everyday (I may have honestly misheard though).
These crepes are delicious! Deff good enough for 2 people. Go in there and put w.e you want! Choices are endless.
Cutesie place and good food items. Too heavy on the Nutella though, my partner got the crepe and it was way too much Nutella. I got the strawberry covered in chocolate, they were good.
Love them. The fruity pebbles crepe is my fave. I had the Nutella cheesecake one and it wasn't that great. I will continue to order my fave one.

I'm not big on crepes, but I love late night dining, so when I saw they deliver 24 hours, I had to try it out.  Again, I'm not a huge fan of crepes, but the savory steak one I had from Uptown was delicious, and came SOOO fast.  I also got a sweet crepe and it was tooo sweet for me, but I was grateful for just a bit of sugar.  All and all, I'd call them again, especially for those late night hunger spells.
Very yummy crepes in Inwood. Open 24hours and many different types of flavors including savory crepes. Will be back soon!
Love this crepes they're delicious, I ordered the strawberry crepe with Nutella. Is my favorite also try the waffle stick with white chocolate delicious.
Strawberry Crepe- Delicious and quick delivery - open 24/7 is a BONUS - simply scrumptious!
Great crepes 24 hrs for anyones sweet cravings Delicious desserts anytime highly recommended
Excellent portion and just the right amount of everything especially the Nutella I didn't need to ask for extra.

I had no idea this business was now 24 hours! Such a good late night snack spot. I have a pup at home who loves snacking what I snack on so it was only right I got her a pup friendly crepe! crepes are made right in front of you- yum! Hot and fresh for you.

Great selection of options for your crepe, I'd recommend the "tres leche" cake and their fruits on a stick dipped in white chocolate. However, they pack the crepes so much and fold them up in a way that is a bit messy to eat, their prices aren't cheap at all either.
This place is convenient and taste great! They take zelle and cash only though! I'd highly recommend
i ordered a tres leches cake, chocolate mousee cake, and a strawberry crepe and this was perhaps the best decision i made, so good!!! and delivery was fast too
